messages.content: Title: Wrong End of the Knife

Description: There he is! The man that isn't there! He's... he's...

Wait... no, I'm sorry. My thoughts, they're just all over place lately. Ever since my exile, things have been a bit fuzzier than normal.

If you wish to learn from me before I completely lose my mind, then do me a favor, and kill those traitors who sided with the demons and exiled me.

 Quest Hand-in: Green is good. Green is good. Green is good? No way!Oh, it's you <name>. Right, you needed something?Wait, they're dead? And you slew them? Fantastic!
Title: Ambassador to the Ancient

Description: It appears that a genesaur was killed here not long ago and this growth has sprung up.  It is stirring up the local monsters and I fear for our outpost.

There is a strange ancient that wallows in grief here and is not hostile. Perhaps you could "harvest" its story?

 Quest Hand-in: So the normal ebb and flow of battle has been disrupted by the saberon. I do not think it wise to leave things as such.We should see about infiltrating the saberon and setting things right.
Title: Spirits of the Glen

Description: Animals of the forest, mortal souls given form, frolic in the glen. Their anima, a boon to the weald, given freely as rain on the leaves.

But danger lurks in the shadows. A dark storm of malice and enmity tears at the trees. Creatures seeking shelter find only peril.

Rescue them.

 Quest Hand-in: What's this? What's this?The Tall Tree has sent you to help us? Help us!
Title: Lost Armaments

Description: The Wretched grow bolder every day, {name}.  They've achieved enough coordination to launch an attack on Sunsail Anchorage.

As if that weren't embarrassing enough, most of our weapons were left behind when they attacked.  Bring me back our armaments so that we may show those ruffians who's boss.

 Quest Hand-in: Great job, <name>.  Let's show the Wretched what we're made of!
Title: The Struggle Persists

Description: Malygos and his underlings grow stronger in power with each passing day. And now, our latest assault team has been captured and is being held in the Oculus.

We must attempt a rescue! Belgaristrasz and his companions are invaluable to our cause.

 Quest Hand-in: Listen well, <race>.Your work here has just begun!
Title: Planting the Banner

Description: I want you to steal the Bladespire banner from one of their champions and take it south to Bloodmaul Outpost.  Plant it atop their Northmaul Tower.

This will infuriate the Bloodmaul and they will attack you relentlessly.  But it will also keep their hatred focused on Bladespire Hold, and away from Sylvanaar.

You will know you have accomplished the deed when you have defeated Gurn Grubnosh and taken his helm.  Return it to Sylvanaar.

{name}, this isn't going to be easy.  Take a  friend or two with you.

 Quest Hand-in: Gurn Grubnosh's helm and a Bladespire banner?Quite clever of you and the vindicator to come up with that plan.By keeping the attention of the Bloodmaul clan on Bladespire Hold, you've relieved the pressure that they were beginning to assert upon us here.Please, <name>, accept a humble gift from Sylvanaar.
Title: The Lonesome Watcher

Description: I never found the core... but I've often spoken to the keeper Creteus, and his omissions give him away. You'll find Creteus over the mountains to the east, in the Foot Steppes, keeping watch on the Engine of the Makers. The core might well be in there, but you'll need to win Creteus's favor.

The iron dwarves were here looking for something... it might well be the core. They took my ring. Find their leader, get the ring back, and show it to Creteus so that he knows I sent you.

 Quest Hand-in: Drom's ring? I am to assume Drom is not well if he did not introduce you directly. I am sorry to hear of that. Drom is a noble dwarf, if an inquisitive one.On what business have you come then?
Title: Gaze of the Loa: Gonk

Description: The Lord of the Pack has requested to be the next to speak to Talanji. He is just up the steps on the next terrace.

I do not think he will require quite as much of you as I did, but I believe his words will be relevant to your purposes here.

<Krag'wa winks one massive eye.>

Do not think we are not aware of your intentions, {name}.

 Quest Hand-in: <The raptor god eyes you speculatively.>You will serve to remind Talanji of her priorities, if she is to answer the question I have posed to her.
Title: Sudden, Unexpected Crocolisk Aggression

Description: Normally, my day consists of catching fish, and then eating the fish I caught, followed by sleeping. Note that I did not include "fight with a crocolisk" in that list of activities.

You look like a handy {class}. Can you go get rid of some of these crocolisks, so I can get back to my regular routine? The crocolisks normally keep to themselves up at Kea Krak, to the northwest.

 Quest Hand-in: Yesterday, we were fishing happily. Today, the crocs just started... tryin' to eat us.Strange.
Title: Heart of the Watcher

Description: You have found what appears to be the heart of a harvest watcher.

From the sound being emitted by the device you can tell that it's still fully functional. Perhaps you should return it to Farmer Saldean.

 Quest Hand-in: Is that... Is that the heart of one of the watchers? I've heard stories about using one of these to power up a watcher for personal use. Of course I'm really in no shape to try such things myself.
Title: Livin' on the Ledge

Description: Slayer {name}, Matron Mother Malevolence requests an audience with you back at the Fel Hammer. Please see her at your earliest convenience.

 Quest Hand-in: Slayer <name>, I have something I would like to speak with you about when you have a moment.
Title: Alliance of Convenience

Description: The Primalists have a sizeable force of djaradin guarding them while they complete their work.

Even in small numbers, djaradin prove to be formidable opponents when allowed to engage in battle on their own terms. It is far better to bring the fight to them, leaving as little time to react as possible.

Take them out. We cannot have them encroaching on the space we have managed to carve out thus far.

 Quest Hand-in: Good. We will need to keep this area clear for now.
Title: Eyes in the Sky

Description: The most dire, and most organized, threat to us in Feralas are the Gordok ogres in the northern wing of Dire Maul. I requested a druid of the talon to go there and scout it out. If he still lives, speak with him and he will act as your commander to stop the Gordok before they decide to attack.

That's an order, {class}.

 Quest Hand-in: Speak softly, <name>. The Gordok may not be intelligent, but they are still dangerous warriors.
Title: Seeker's Folly

Description: I'm sure your pandaren friend has some ideas about what the mogu are after.

He headed up the mountain a few days ago without a guide, and asked that only you be sent up after him. He was very specific:

"The {class} must endure the trek alone, with only his thoughts. He will honor each shrine before meeting me at the top."

The path is just northwest of the camp, marked by flags. Please be careful! Seeker's Folly is a dangerous trek even on a lucky day.

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, you made it, and you honored the shrines.I knew you could handle it.
Title: Paint it Black

Description: We have reliable intelligence that Razlo Crushcog has taken up a defensive position on the island in the middle of frozen Iceflow Lake. To make matters worse, he's surrounded himself with a network of sentry-bots that will detect any possible attackers.

If we're to take on Crushcog, we'll need to take out those sentries. This device launches a dark, sticky paint that will coat the optical sensors of Crushcog's sentry-bots. Use it to take out his early warning system.

 Quest Hand-in: You've given us just the opening we'll need to get the drop on Crushcog. Excellent work, <name>.
Title: Send the Signal!

Description: My crew is not on board with de word of Zul. We saw too much of who he really is. 

Far out in de harbor, Zul's traitors have joined with de mogu to try to take my ships! If we lose de fleet and de harbor, we lose de city!

We must let Zuldazar know we stand strong. We take back de ships. We drive de villains out. 

You must light de towers with loa-blessed flame. Dey will always see dat de Bay of Kings belongs to Zandalar!

 Quest Hand-in: Ya got here just in time!
Title: The Financial Participation Incentive

Description: I see Buxdoggle running some sort of game over dere. Getting people to guess de fight's winner in exchange for Brawler's Gold.

See if you can figure out how his game works. If you win enough money from him, he might start talking...

 Quest Hand-in: Say, <name>, was it? You're not half bad at this! You'll put me in the poor house if you keep this up!
Title: Gorat's Vengeance

Description: Fortune is with us this day, {race}.

Gorat's blood was fresh enough for me to conduct a special ritual taught to me as a child.

Use this imbued blood on Gorat's corpse to summon forth his lingering spirit.

Do his final bidding, then report back here to Kadrak.

Spirits keep you safe, friend.

 Quest Hand-in: Well done, <race>.The elf captain is dead and the soul of one of our beloved brethren can sleep in peace.I shall pass on word of your deeds to my superiors in Orgrimmar.
Title: The Mind's Eye

Description: The Mind's Eye is held by an ogre mage, in the Mosh'Ogg ogre mound just to the south.  His name is Mai'Zoth.  I know him from when the Darkspears dwelt in Stranglethorn - he is vicious, and his magic is strong.

And if he has the Mind's Eye, then his magic will be stronger still.

You must face Mai'Zoth and wrest from him the Mind's Eye.  It is a perilous task, but it is the only hope we have of saving Yenniku.

 Quest Hand-in: You retrieved the eye!  Your might is the stuff of legends, <name>!And in getting the Eye, you must have defeated Mai'Zoth and sent him to the Nether.  That is why the spirits would not mention him before.It is good that he is gone from the world of flesh and bone, but now that he is in the realm of spirits...I fear he will begin a new reign.But that is a worry for another time.
Title: Something Stolen

Description: Everyone's going to want to dress their best for this, and finery is in short supply in the Highlands.

I understand that those goblin wretches off the coast use the finest silk for repairing their zeppelin air envelopes. A waste!

Find a zeppelin flying back and forth between Dragonmaw Port and the Krazzworks, and liberate some silk from the cargo hold in the lower decks.

 Quest Hand-in: Oh, aye! Kilts for the gents, gowns for the bridesmaids.Just don't tell the ladies they're wearing clothes fit for a blimp.
Title: Vinyl: Triumph of Gnomeregan

Description: <This pressed vinyl is surprisingly still intact. Its label says it contains the recording of a song called "Triumph of Gnomeregan."

You should be able to install this vinyl into the gramophone back in Rustbolt.>

 Quest Hand-in: <The vinyl slides neatly into the gramophone's vinyl carousel. The titleboard updates automatically.>
Title: Doing It Like a Dunwald

Description: They already left to hunt down the ettin that lead the attack on Dunwald. I asked them to at least give ya a chance to catch up, but I'm not sure waitin's in their blood.

They made off towards the town square, in the center of the ruins. You should go join'm before ya miss out on all the fun.

 Quest Hand-in: Thanks for your help. You've got a warrior's spirit in ya - you coulda fooled me for a Wildhammer if it weren't for your... well.. you know.I know Firebeard sent you to unite us. My love for that dwarf runs shallow, but you know now we've got plenty of reasons to make enemies of Twilight. If you see him, tell him that when the battle starts, the Dunwald family will be there.
Title: Elena Flutterfly

Description: I see you're ready for another bout in the skies. Let's take flight!

 Quest Hand-in: My flight has come to an end. Victory is yours this day.
Title: Diplomatic Measures

Description: Kilrath sends news of the Boulderfist leader: He is an orc! An ancient orc that passed through the Dark Portal in the time of our fathers and has since returned to his homeland. I wish for you to track down this orc and try to convince him to pull back the Boulderfist ogres. He resides on an upper platform in the Burning Blade Ruins to the southeast near the border of Terokkar. Good luck, {name}!

Be warned, he is a blademaster...

 Quest Hand-in: So what is your decision? Will it be war or will you lend your assistance?
Title: A Change of Heart

Description: You seek to change the path you walk, {name}?

 Quest Hand-in: May you find what you're looking for, <brother/sister>.
Title: The Extraction

Description: Right now the most important thing is to bring back my people. Preferably in one piece.

And as much as it pains me to say this, I'm in no condition to fight them on my own. 

Will you help us?

 Quest Hand-in: You smell like death... Frostbite likes that.
Title: Spinal Dust

Description: The dark energy that flows through the bodies of reanimated skeletons tends to accumulate primarily in their spine.  I've discovered a method of instilling this energy into a potion that boosts our magical abilities against the undead.

Bring me some spinal dust and I'll be glad to provide you with a sample.  You'll find an ample number of skeletons wandering the Dead Scar, west of here.

 Quest Hand-in: Take this, <name>.  You'll feel the difference immediately!Feel free to bring more spinal dust; I can use as much of it as you can provide.  Side effects?  You might start feeling your joints acting up a bit.  Nothing permanent, I assure you!
Title: Stealing Their Thunder

Description: The vrykul are fearless in a fight. Seems they actually yearn fer a death in battle. With their numbers and that ferocity, we're doomed - plain and simple.

There's one they esteem though, goes by the name of Ingvar. Bring him down and you'll deal a mighty blow to their spirit.

 Quest Hand-in: Outstanding!This could be the turn of luck we've all been hoping for.
Title: We Need Each Other

Description: My father believes he is indulging me. He has ruled for two hundred years, many lifetimes of trolls. In his mind, de threats dat face our kingdom are minor.

I have seen too much to believe dat.

So since my father and his advisors would not help, I turned to someone who would.

Your warchief needs our fleet, and I need her champions. So here is what we need to do.

 Quest Hand-in: Make your choice when you are ready.
Title: The Seat of the Triumvirate

Description: Even with the Sigil of Awakening in hand, the Crown cannot save us until it is whole.

That is why we must enter the Seat of the Triumvirate, even knowing that L'ura awaits us there.

This is a dire task, one that I would not ask if it were not completely necessary.

We will descend together. Come.

 Quest Hand-in: This is grave news indeed. It would be wise to follow Alleria's lead from here.
Title: A Daughter's Love

Description: Here, take this and lay it on his grave. Maybe... somehow, he'll know that I'm okay, and that none of us hold him responsible for what happened.

<There are tears in her eyes now, as she slides a ring from her right hand, and presses it into your hands.>

And... thank you, {name}.

 Quest Hand-in: <A ghostly voice sounds on the wind...>This is...? Sarah? Could it be she's still alive? The weight is removed from my shoulders...<name>. Take my sword, Archeus. As my soul is put to rest, I have no more need for it. It was forged to do good, and though I have proved myself unworthy to hold it, perhaps you will carry on the Light through it.Lys, my love...
Title: The Elusive Ironjaw

Description: Now that I have the fur I'll need for the trim, I've been thinking that the pelt of a particular wolf would make a good hood for my cloak. Imagine seeing your enemy clad in the pelt of the most cunning predator in the forest!

I've tried trapping old Ironjaw without success. I've tried cornering him, outsmarting him, and baiting him. None of it has worked.

He stalks the northeastern reaches of the forest, and I'd gladly reward you if you could succeed where I have failed.

 Quest Hand-in: I bow to your skills, <name>. You have proven yourself the superior hunter.I won't forget your help in making this cloak. It will truly be a one-of-a-kind piece and I'll wear it proudly.
Title: Dude, Where's My Necropolis?

Description: Maintaining the portal between our sanctum and the Zerekriss is a difficult task. With enough resources, we could make it permanent and become the unstoppable force my baroness wishes us to be.

She has asked much of you, as have I. But this work will make your name a legend among the Maldraxxi, as my baroness's has become.

Help to empower us, and you will be empowered in turn.

 Quest Hand-in: You do not cease to impress.
Title: More Torch Catching

Description: Torch catching sure keeps you on your toes.  Think you can keep it up for a long time?

Let's see...

 Quest Hand-in: How's that arm doing, <name>?  You looked great out there.  A real juggling master!
Title: Empty Nest

Description: I've taken an inventory of the eggs you recovered. Some among the bunch may still have a chance to hatch.

They will need to be returned to an empty nest, and with any luck, an eagle will claim the eggs as her own and watch over them once again.

There is a nest just outside the entrance, on a rocky ledge above the cave.

Be careful, {name}. The eggs are very delicate.

 Quest Hand-in: Thanks to you, the great eagles of Highmountain will live on.One of the eggs I thought was too damaged to salvage appears to be hatching...
Title: An Urgent Warning

Description: <The soldier is wan and wounded, obviously in tremendous pain.>

Been held prisoner... since the assault on... the Broken Shore...

<She shudders.>

The demons... th-they are gathering... preparing...

Had to escape... to warn you. They must... be stopped!

 Quest Hand-in: Greetings, Grandmaster. I've just been informed about the wounded soldier who escaped from the Broken Shore.What she must have endured...
Title: Incriminating Documents

Description: The documents contain detailed maps of different strategic buildings in Eversong Woods.  A diagram of an arcane sanctum is also sketched in good detail.  There seem to be numerous notes in a language you don't recognize.

As these were carried by a Darnassian spy, it might be a good idea to bring them to the Captain of the Guard - Aeldon Sunbrand.

 Quest Hand-in: Are you sure you found these on a night elf?  They're clearly written in Dwarven...From what I can understand of this letter, whoever wrote this did not cause the malfunction, but rather was sent here as a spy to observe the results of it.  They call our endeavors reckless and dangerous... but who?Of course!  That envoy from Ironforge!  We were fools to trust anyone belonging to the Alliance!
Title: A Gift For Gina

Description: Have you seen Gina Mudclaw, the market girl? She has it all - looks, brains, and nice big tummy. Could you deliver a gift for me?

I wanted to pick some orchids that grow on top of the big hills to the west, but I can't climb that high. Could you pick a few and bring them to Gina?

Oh, and when you see her... tell her I said "hi".

 Quest Hand-in: These are beautiful! Did you get these for me?Ahh... so they're from Andi, are they? I think I know somebody who's getting a kiss on the forehead later this afternoon...
Title: Follow that Gyro-Copter!

Description: D-d-did you see that?  How the whole cave just crumbled like that?  I guess it's good that you got here when you did, and not a minute earlier.

While this development makes my job of monitoring the cave entrance much easier, I imagine it makes it a lot harder for you to get to Kharanos.

Hey wait, I've got an idea!  The Gnomeregan Airmen have a flight path not far from here.  I'll send up a signal, and they should be here to help.  I imagine they'll land back over at Anvilmar.

 Quest Hand-in: Milo Geartwinge, reporting for duty.  You sent up a distress signal?
Title: Learn To Ride

Description: It's time for you to learn how to ride! Seek out Kar Stormsinger in Mulgore's Bloodhoof Village. Don't forget to buy your mount while you are there!

 Quest Hand-in: Don't forget to buy your mount while you are here! You can buy one from Harb Clawhoof over there.
Title: Lost and Forgotten

Description: We have seen firsthand the depravity that has taken hold of my former brethren. The time has come to put an end to it.

The path ahead is no doubt packed with Lord Stormsong's cultists and their soulwrought elementals. I will absorb their souls as they fall with the Dead Ringer, as you once did.

However, there will be no release for these fiends... not this time. We will need them to pry open the final door to the Shrine.

 Quest Hand-in: Mourn not for the fallen. We do what we must to save our people.
Title: Stop Gul'dan!

Description: After his defeat at the Black Temple, we brought Illidan's lifeless body here, to be interred forever within the Vault of the Wardens.

Gul'dan has found his way through our defenses and is trying to steal the Betrayer's corpse.

Even in death, Illidan's body can be used by the Burning Legion. Gul'dan CANNOT succeed.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent. You have absorbed the powers of these brutes. Look how strong you have grown!
Title: Kliklak's Craw

Description: You are pleasantly surprised to find that after being mangled and masticated by a sea crab, this map is still quite legible.

It clearly indicates that a footlocker was buried in the Kelp'thar Forest behind a gigantic mollusk.

A well-drawn sketch on the back of the map shows that the owner, along with his key, was eaten by an overgrown crustacean named Kliklak.

 Quest Hand-in: The satisfying sound of a chest unlocking is followed by the sight of once-hidden treasure.
Title: I've Got This Guy

Description: Good timing, {name}.

Seems I'm not the only one interested in these obelisks, and these fellas aren't inclined to compare notes...

I think I can handle this guy.

Maybe you could take care of a few of his friends before they make their way over here?

 Quest Hand-in: That's a relief. Thanks, <name>.Turns out I've got my hands full here.
Title: Tiragarde Sound

Description: We must convince Katherine Proudmoore to pledge Kul Tiras to the Alliance. Flynn believes the Ashvane Trading Company's new gunpowder is our best lead.

 Quest Hand-in: Maybe with your help we can restore the people's faith in Proudmoore leadership.
Title: An Audacious Advance

Description: Directly west of here you will find the Halaani Basin. Within the basin are the twin clefts of Nagrand: Northwind and Southwind. Boulderfist shock troops use the clefts to hide their ogre mounds.

I need you to track down those troops and kill all that you encounter in the name of Mag'har.

 Quest Hand-in: If this does not freeze the blood in their veins, nothing will. You have done the Mag'har justice, <name>. And for justice, Mag'har rewards greatly.
Title: Spirits of Auchindoun

Description: Auchindoun's spirits have no stake in the conflict between the Alliance and the Horde, but incurring their favor will give our side an edge in the region.

Ancient custom directs the living to pay their respects at spirit towers in the Bone Wastes - though only at specific times of the day.  If you can help secure a tower during these times, you will have helped bring the spirits to our side.

Should we succeed in gaining the spirits' favor, they will grant us a boon that will aid us in our endeavors.

 Quest Hand-in: The spirits are one step closer to resting in peace.  It is good to incur their favor, especially when waging war so close to their place of rest.
Title: Blind Lake Sturgeon

Description: We need to stock the garrison pond with local fish.  I need you to search the waters in Shadowmoon Valley for fish that we can stock up with.  Once you have the fish, you will need to slice them up and look for eggs inside.

 Quest Hand-in: These will do nicely, <name>!  Thank you!
Title: A Savage Path Through Time

Description: You know what's tough? Time travel! You know what's even tougher? Fighting monsters while time traveling!

Show me how tough you are by doing both.

 Quest Hand-in: You're looking tougher already. Remember, being tough is about staying consistent. Let's see what you can do next time!
Title: Prey Upon Them

Description: My mission cannot progress without a supply of anima. 

Fortunately, the necromancers nearby have been kind enough to gather some into their maldracite crystals.

You will relieve them of those crystals. They may be reluctant to part with them, but I trust you can be... persuasive.

 Quest Hand-in: Yes, these will do nicely.
Title: The Bundle of Bloodthistle

Description: I wasn't lying. That egg was incredible. Where did you get it from?

Well, if you ever need more bloodthistle, you know where I am and what I need.

Here's a bundle of the stuff. Take it back to your benefactor.

 Quest Hand-in: Now to set the trap!
Title: No Time for Curiosity

Description: {name}, I have a favor to ask of you. Normally, I would do this myself, but my hands are already beyond full.

I have an associate named Kialon at Sylvanaar in the Blade's Edge Mountains to the north. He's expecting to hear from me in the near future, although I suspect he won't like what I have to say.

If you would deliver my response to him, you would have my gratitude. I must insist, and this is very important, that you not attempt to read the letter. It is for Kialon's eyes alone.

 Quest Hand-in: So you've brought Timothy's response?<Kialon pauses a moment to read the letter, then laughs.>He's got everything under control, he says. Doesn't need help, he says. I could've predicted that!Some people never change. Look, he even took the time to correct my spelling.<Kialon lets out a half-hearted sigh.>I shouldn't have sent the letter. I forgot. The specialist always has the situation under control. Always.
Title: The Land Is in Their Blood

Description: If we're to stabilize the forces of nature, we'll need every little bit of help we can get.  The furbolg of the Blackwood tribe have long inhabited the area and have strong ties to the land.

Their elder Shaman, Elder Brownpaw, wields great power over the elements -- his assistance would be invaluable.  See if you can obtain their aid.

 Quest Hand-in: I have much respect for the great Malfurion Stormrage.  I cannot, however, leave my people in their time of need.  Maybe there is a way we can both help each other.
Title: Essence of the Iron Conqueror

Description: Redeem your Essence of the Iron Conqueror with Lady Liadrin to select an armament of your choice.

 Quest Hand-in: <name>, your courage and dedication has made Draenor a safer place. Take these armaments and go in the Light.
Title: Find Bingles

Description: We've lost contact with Bingles! He was sent on a reconnaissance mission over Gnomeregan and hasn't reported back in over a week. I just know he's gone and blown himself up.

He was last seen flying over the Loch. Perhaps you can investigate, {name}.

 Quest Hand-in: So Gnoarn doesn't trust my reconnaissance abilities? I wonder why...Nevermind that, I need your assistance! Nay! The movement needs your assistance!
Title: Hold The Barricade!

Description: {name} they're rallying for a heavy assault!

We'll need to defend these barricades from attack! Are you with me?

 Quest Hand-in: That witch! She must be the one guiding these attacks!
Title: The Halls Of Reflection

Description: You have reforged and tempered the sword, yet it sits quietly in its sheath, showing no signs of the power it should possess. You say the sword pulls you, as though it possesses a will?

Dare you bring it where it wishes to go? It's not right that the sword should be this silent and this insistent, yet I fear that if you do not take the sword to its destination, we will never learn why. Take it into Icecrown Citadel's Halls of Reflection, but be on your guard! I'll be waiting for you in The Frozen Halls.

 Quest Hand-in: I had not thought it possible for evil to take hold in such a sword, but I suppose it was naive of me. If the greatest of dragonkind's creations could be corrupted and turned against them, why not a mere sword?Uther's advice is wise, <name>, and I would urge you to heed it quickly.
Title: The Temple of Purity

Description: Greetings.

I am Kosmas, Disciple to the Temple of Purity.

The temple is a place of cleansing. Its sole purpose is to free aspirants of the burdens they carry with them from life. It is a place of quiet reflection even for those who have shed their burdens.

Of late, those who look to us for purification have grown numerous. My fellow disciples are stretched terribly thin. I have come to ask the aid of all able-minded aspirants.

Your help is needed. Please report to the Hand of Purity at once.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you for volunteering.
Title: The Smell of Orcs

Description: <You've noticed that your snowfeather hatchling shakes whenever orcs are nearby. It appears to be utterly terrified of them. Perhaps you could take it somewhere with a lot of orcs, so that it can get used to the smell.>

 Quest Hand-in: <The hatchling seems to be more comfortable around the sights and sounds of an orc city. It will need some time to recover from this adventure.>
Title: Undersea Sanctuary

Description: I believe I've located the author of your note, friend.

It would seem that he is in desperate need of attention if he is to survive.

I shall attune one of my scrying orbs, that you might see him for yourself.

 Quest Hand-in: We must make haste!As you can surely see, his time is not long.
Title: Nature's Touch

Description: Apparently we're not the only druids that have run into these demons. The Legion took a ton of captives and brought them back to their camp. Our brothers and sisters lay wounded and hurting...

You can heal! Let's go save them!

 Quest Hand-in: I feel a lot better knowing we were able to save some of the other druids. We did what we could.
Title: Stone Cold

Description: Our assault on the Court of Bones continues. Our progress remains slow, but measurable.

Unfortunately, we've received several reports of stone quilen statues coming to life without warning. I can't have these quilen threatening my research expedition.

Venture into the Court of Bones and destroy any quilen statues that you can find.

 Quest Hand-in: I am glad to hear that you left the quilen in a thousand tiny pieces. You have contributed much to our war effort.
Title: The Kunzen Legend-Chief

Description: I've heard people talk about the hozen like they're just some tribe of barely-functional idiots... but that's not true! They have brains, too - they just don't all like to use them that much.

I've heard that the Kunzen tribe has two chiefs - one in charge of fighting, and one in charge of stories, lore, and history.

What I wouldn't give to see what kind of stories they tell...

 Quest Hand-in: Wow! Look at this! It's...<Fish flips through the pages, and her face sours.>Oh, I think that's a dirty picture. But the rest of this is very interesting! I just love learning how other creatures think. Thanks, <name>!
Title: Gaohun the Soul-Severer

Description: Big mogu leader is here! Up behind village. If we kill big mogu leader, Leven be happy with us for sure!

You been good at helping Rook. Want to help more maybe? Please?

 Quest Hand-in: Leader gone. People safe. Rook save village. And friend save village too. Thank you, friend!
Title: Pikwik in Peril

Description: What the heck is going on here? Foreman Pikwik should've shut the valves off by now.

We can cap these leaks all day and if the central valve is off, we're just delaying an enormous explosion.

Listen, if you value money, your life, or either combination of the two, you'd better head south to Irontree Cavern and see if you can find Foreman Pikwik.

 Quest Hand-in: It's a disaster down here! The pump's thrown, all my men in there are gone...You gotta help!
Title: Ransacking Nethergarde

Description: After the Iron Horde took Nethergarde we attacked. While we killed the Iron Horde at Nethergarde they brought more forces through the portal and took Okril'lon Hold. So many souls stripped of their bodies by those savages.

We must not forget those that gave their lives at Nethergarde. If you find any mementos of the fallen, bring them back to me.

 Quest Hand-in: Throm-Ka, <name>. These mementos will forever remind us of our champions.
Title: Embodiment

Description: What a nasty little plague you've brought me, apprentice. Must've been concocted by a true sadist.

To study the sample, I gave it form. But the ungrateful thing turned on me and attacked, completely unprovoked! 

It's shuffled a bit further on into the House. I hate to say it, but I believe this one must be put down before it is allowed to grow any stronger... or larger.

Look on the bright side. If your plague eater manages to survive, it'll be attuned to your particularly terrible form of blight.

 Quest Hand-in: Despite all the trouble that sample gave us, I think I actually have a little bit of hope now.
Title: Corruption Runs Deep

Description: Everything the Legion touches is marred by fingerprints of their corruption. If I can study the traces of magic they leave behind, perhaps I can discern their plans for Karazhan.

This vial is specially reinforced to contain fel magic. If you bring me the essences of corrupted soil and water from near their portals, I believe we'll be closer to unraveling their scheme.

 Quest Hand-in: Every bit contains an essence of sorts - one we can study to learn things about the magic wielder and ways to manipulate their magic for... other purposes.
Title: Going Underground

Description: We're so close to replacing all my equipment, {name}. In order to make flasks again, we need to be able to precisely measure each ingredient.

For that, we need to replace my burette assembly. Unfortunately, burettes aren't easy to come by. We may be able to procure some though through other means by...

<Deucus looks around and beckons you closer.>

Going underground, so to say. As in, the Black Market.

Go see Ms. Xiulan. Mum's the word.

 Quest Hand-in: Well, now that we understand one another let's see what sort of arrangement we can come to.
Title: A Grim Connection

Description: I've spoken with Inspector Tarem regarding the evidence you gathered from the ruins of the Shady Rest Inn. He seems certain that the hoofprints and the shield you found there point to the Grimtotem clan of tauren.

With reports of Grimtotem activity on the rise in the marsh, this has to be more than a mere coincidence. I'm sending you to speak with Captain Darill, who is something of an expert on the Grimtotems. Follow the road north out of town to North Point tower. It's the second outpost on the road.

 Quest Hand-in: Captain Vimes thinks the Grimtotems are behind the destruction of the Shady Rest Inn? They wouldn't have been first on my list of suspects, but if Captain Vimes sent you here to follow up on a lead, he must have his reasons. Regardless, the Grimtotems have been a thorn in our side for some time and we're always glad to have the extra help.
Title: Gulper Soul

Description: <The Gulper Soul is patient and calm. The shape of the Gulper will be yours to call upon.>

 Quest Hand-in: The shape of the Gulper is now yours to call upon and use.
Title: Return to Razor Hill

Description: My wind riders are trained to fly to many different places, as long as you have already been to that place and spoken with the wind rider master there.

You have been to Razor Hill and spoken to their wind rider master Burok, so now you can fly directly to him from here.  Once you're at Razor Hill, you can deliver Gryshka's letter to Grimtak.

Speak with me when you are ready to go.

 Quest Hand-in: Hah!  I guess she liked it!  Nothing brings red to a lady's cheeks like a big, juicy steak!Thank you, <name>.  You've done me a great service.  Here is some money for your trouble, and don't be surprised if I invite you to my wedding!
Title: Fresh Frostsabers

Description: Doesn't that smell great? My smoked meats get top dollar, and nobody else provides the exotic flavors I've got out here in the hills. And it's efficient; you just do the hunting for a small fee, and my other fine friends drag the beasts back here for skinnin' and smokin'!

I've got the market cornered on Frostsaber meat right now. Absolutely delicious stuff, makes great sausages. Head out and hunt those cats just west of here, and we'll call that a start!

 Quest Hand-in: Alright! Don't stop now, we're after the big ones next!
Title: Broken Circle

Description: The jiro of Circle Olea work here. We make...

<The jiro pauses for a moment.>

They... make new lands and creatures for the Forge.

Devourers attacked, but some jiro still survive. You must find them. Tell them to gather outside the cave to the north. I will clear the way.

Do not tell them I sent you. They will not want to see me.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you for finding the survivors!
Title: What Lurks Below

Description: Legend tells of a great beast in the forest to the north.  My son is missing and I fear he may have wandered too near its lair....

Head northwest to Krasari Falls and look for a mysterious whirlpool - this is the key to revealing what is hidden there.  Kill the wretched beast and recover any clues to my son's whereabouts.

 Quest Hand-in: My son's ring?  What does this mean?<Rassan appears thoughtful.>The situation is grim, but not without hope.  My son is careless with his belongings, so perhaps he simply threw it into the pool?  Thank you for your help <name>, I will not soon forget this great favor you have done for me.
Title: Mogu?! Oh No-gu!

Description: I know your friends are worried about the animating statues over at Mogujia, but I'll tell you what you should really be worried about.

Where there are animated statues, there are Mogu. I don't know if you've seen one before, but if you haven't...

Well, let's just say Mogu are bad, bad, news.

While you're dealing with whatever else you're doing, you need to get the Mogu behind the trouble!

 Quest Hand-in: Oh, thank goodness! You've saved all of our skins, believe me.You have no idea how much trouble those guys can stir up.Err, or, I guess you do, now. Kind of. Almost.Imagine that, but a lot worse, and for a couple thousand years.
Title: I Could Be A Contender

Description: Hold up there, brother. 

If you are serious about fighting in the Arena you're going to need a manager. 
Lucky for you, brother, I know a guy. He's just had some openings in his roster of fighters and you look like just the type of {class} he needs to fill his ranks.

Name is Louison, you can find him at the gate just east of here.

Tell him I sent ya, brother.

 Quest Hand-in: Oh, Anzio sent you? Hah, and here I was thinking you were just another nosy fan.Yeah, you look like just the <class> I need!
Title: Hungry Work

Description: We must get Chief Telemancer Oculeth back on his feet as soon as possible.

Find ancient mana, any way you can, and feed it to him.

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, I am feeling much better. Thank you!Now let us get to work.
Title: Judgment Day Comes!

Description: We cannot defeat the Lich King on our own. Divided we shall all fall!

I implore you to answer the call, brother. The Argent Crusade accepts all who would volunteer to aid in the war effort. Highlord Tirion Fordring himself awaits you at the Argent Vanguard! Get upon your mount and fly to the southeastern reaches of Icecrown. It is there that you will find Lord Fordring and the soldiers of the Argent Crusade.

Go now, {class}, for judgment day comes!

 Quest Hand-in: My faithful knights have served me well. It seems that their recruitment efforts have yielded a hero!
Title: Rebellious Souls

Description: Please hear us out, Maw Walker.

When Margrave Gharmal launched his attack on Bastion, there were many, such as Emeni and myself, that opposed his actions. 

Fearing dissent, Gharmal removed many souls from their constructed bodies and imprisoned them. Emeni escaped the prison, but most did not.

Help us free the other souls, and we can build you an army of constructs far greater than any that serve Gharmal.

 Quest Hand-in: Do not let Emeni's sour disposition deter you. Your aid is greatly appreciated, Maw Walker!
Title: Corrupted Night Dragon

Description: You have found a sickly, corrupted version of what appears to be a night dragon plant.  The fruits that hang from the plant appear rotten and poisonous.  It desperately needs some sort of attention if it is to be turned back to normal.

 Quest Hand-in: You apply four Cenarion plant salves to the night dragon.  It immediately begins to shed its corrupted form, blossoming into a vibrant and healthy plant.
Title: Out With the Old Boss

Description: Right so I talked to some people. You talked to some people. No one likes the Irontide. They're cutting in to profits and scaring off good, honest scoundrel- er customers! 

We take out the guy in charge and we'll be able to run the rest outta town! So a little change of management is in order.

I'm not usually one for stabbin' people, I'm a lover not a fighter, but I can pay. You do this for me and I'll make sure you're welcome here whenever ya want? Sound good?

 Quest Hand-in: Great! I'm the Boss of the Cove now and what I say goes.Since you've been a pal, I'll let you stop in whenever you like. Remember to bring gold.
Title: A Dusty Vase

Description: <You have found a vase. It appears to represent a black dragon fighting what could be a djaradin. It could be something Voraxian is interested in.>

 Quest Hand-in: <Voraxian holds the vase up to eye level and squints at the carvings.>Hmm, yes, I think you are right <name>. It does look like a djaradin. It is a vase though. Unlikely to be too exciting. Do not get your hopes up.
Title: Let's Go Surfing Now

Description: Navigating the steep bluffs of Howling Fjord can be nerve-racking! I've come up with a solution to ease that burden by utilizing vrykul technology and dwarven ingenuity. With just a few adjustments and some fine tuning I've created Icehammer's harpoon controller! Of course it hasn't been tested, but that's what you're here for!

Take the controller to the big gun in Nifflevar and use it to launch yourself into Valgarde. Report your victory to Zorek. Oh yea, you can keep the controller.

 Quest Hand-in: You are insane, <name>! What kind of degenerate would actually launch themselves from a harpoon gun as a method of travel?But I guess you need to be a little crazy to pull off what you did up there on the bluffs! Fantastic work! We've gotten word that the Dragonflayer leader, Ingvar, is furious! Maybe one day you'll be ready to stomp his face into the dirt - in the name of our beloved Alliance.
Title: Stop the Plague

Description: I'm convinced that the plague is being caused by something in the caves up there.

{class}, I want you to take these seeds. I normally use them as a ward against the Scourge, though perhaps they can be used to disrupt whatever foulness is happening in the dens.

Find the source of the plague and throw them into it.

 Quest Hand-in: <The sage hangs her head and sighs in relief.>This is a good start. If only that were our only problem.
Title: Shredder vs. Saberon

Description: After the saberon stole from these plants, they were forced further up Steamscar Rise and barricaded themselves in. I could not find a way to get in but you have the solution.

One path is blocked by a tangle of hard vines. I have heard you have a machine that could cut through that with ease.

I would get on a shredder and take those vines down.

 Quest Hand-in: Good work, but we need to move quickly before the plants realize the way is open...
Title: A Taste For Eggs

Description: I can sense your anxiety, but you are not ready yet. Your training must continue before you perform the final test. As for your task... I need you to fetch me some eggs.

Yes, eggs. The marshland atop the hills to the east is home to a number of birds, all of which are generally peaceful in nature. You should have no trouble gathering enough eggs to last me several weeks.

 Quest Hand-in: Now you know why I don't gather the eggs myself.Shall we continue your training?
Title: Tavernkeeper's Fate

Description: I have finished unraveling Ly'leth's message.

I want you to come with me to her estate. It is long past time I returned to the city.

 Quest Hand-in: We need to take action immediately!
Title: Restoring Jade's Purity

Description: {class}, will you aid us?

The temple's purity has been jeopardized. Even now the three masters struggle against their doubts.

Please, I beg you, head in and help Wise Mari, Liu Flameheart, and Lorewalker Stonestep in their fight against the sha.

 Quest Hand-in: While I am sad to hear the fates of Wise Mari and Priestess Flameheart, you have my heartfelt thanks.
Title: Crabby Patrons

Description: These crabs are not friendly. Not. Friendly.

Sam's endless drilling is riling them up. I know from experience that there's no stopping Sam, so let's look into the other side of things, shall we?

 Quest Hand-in: Does everything down here only come in jumbo size? Oooh! That's a thought. Maybe there are some hunky sea goblins around here somewhere.Thanks, by the way.
Title: We Will Rock You

Description: The orcs can NOT be allowed a foothold in this land. They will defile it just as they did Kalimdor.

{name}, I need boots on the ground and horde in their graves. Get down to the coastline and bring the full force of Alliance wrath down on their heads!

Slay any orcs you find. Take the wind out of their sails.

For the King!

 Quest Hand-in: Well done, soldier. That should help keep the horde in check.
Title: The Great Escape

Description: With our mission objective secured, the time has come for us to make our escape. Though Gilneas is lost, with the aid of Godfrey and his lieutenants we will have it back in no time at all.

Go now, {name}. Fly back with Arthura to the Forsaken Front in southern Silverpine Forest. The Banshee Queen awaits your arrival.

 Quest Hand-in: I had no doubt that you would succeed, <name>. I hope you can understand why I kept the true purpose of your mission a secret. Should Crowley and Bloodfang have found out about our plan, they would have surely gotten to Godfrey first and disposed of the body.Stand by, <name>. The time of their rebirth is at hand.
Title: The Lost Advisor

Description: You may as well assist me while you are here. I require a potion to be made, one that will set things right.

I must conserve my energy until my task is finished, lest I become like these miserable wretches scrabbling at the cobblestones. There is coin in it for you, since I will not be needing it soon.

The harpies around here cannot resist cliffthorn. It is what drew them to Tel'anor in the first place. 

You should find plenty just outside this building.

 Quest Hand-in: <Thaedris stirs from his thoughts as you approach.>These will be sufficient, <race>. Cliffthorn is a deadly poison, and will be perfect for my needs.
Title: A Score to Settle

Description: This elf prince thinks he can come to my town, insult my queen, kill my men and get away with it? He thinks we're going to stand by while the hordes of Utgarde build up to launch an attack?

Not in a million years.

You're going to walk right into Utgarde and kill him. I want Arthas to know that we've arrived and we're playing for keeps.

Report to Dark Ranger Marrah inside Utgarde Keep when the deed is done and she'll tie up any... loose ends.

 Quest Hand-in: Revenge feels good.  To think that this is but a taste of what's to come.Arthas will get what he deserves soon enough.  Then and only then will I die a happy man.
Title: Vineroot on the Menu

Description: <Again the small gorger shows up and you can clearly see is looking for more Endmire Vineroot.>

 Quest Hand-in: <You barely get your hand back as the gorger snags the bundle. You can't help but notice he looks to be getting bigger. In between bites he spits out something.>
Title: A Job Unfinished...

Description: In the name of our great master... For the glory of Illidan!

By order of Overlord Mor'ghor, the great plateau of Netherwing Ledge is to be secured. With all Netherwing drakes captured or forced off of the land, rock flayers are running rampant and threatening crystal harvesting operations.

Destroy them all, their den mother and her consort, Arvoar.

Mor'ghor commands it!

<It would appear that this orc failed to take the plateau. It is time to prove your worth to Mor'ghor!>

 Quest Hand-in: So from the remains of one of my own overseers you recovered the command and took matters into your own hands? You have managed to impress Mor'ghor. Well done...
Title: Afterlife Goes On

Description: A new dawn shines on Bastion. I had my reservations, but you have proven that honor yet remains in Maldraxxus.

Take my hand once more. I will return you to the temple's entrance.

Let all Maldraxxi know of our victory. And for the sake of peace, ensure that this never happens again.

 Quest Hand-in: May our paths cross again.
Title: Your Second Leatherworking Work Order

Description: Place another work order with my assistant. Once it is complete, we will leave it out here for you to collect.

 Quest Hand-in: We look forward to serving you again.
Title: Nesingwary's Trek

Description: De greatest hunter from your lands, de dwarf Nesingwary, has come to participate in de Great Hunt.

If you are enough of a hunter to join him, den travel to de Nesingwary Trek along de northeastern region of Zuldazar.

 Quest Hand-in: Welcome to tha hunt.
Title: Signaling Trouble

Description: Long ago, we gave select leaders special flares that were only to be used in times of great need.

Upon seeing the flare, the leader of the Unseen Path is supposed to head to the southern watchtower to meet with whomever lit it.

I don't know who we'll face once we reach the tower, but we must move quickly.

 Quest Hand-in: I fear that the Burning Legion is planning to invade Dalaran.I've dispatched members of the Kirin Tor to spy on various demon strongholds, with hopes that they can uncover any plots involving the city.In the meantime, Dalaran could benefit from the protection of the Unseen Path. I know its citizens will be safe with the Unseen Path watching over them.
Title: A Load of Croc

Description: Now while you're runnin' around doin' whatever the heck it is that you do, would you mind helpin' me out a bit?

See, I usually go out huntin' crocolisks down in the loch, but given certain circumstances, I'd rather sit here right now. Mighty polite of you not to give me grief over it, thanks!

So seein' as how you're such a gentleman, why don't you bring me back some crocolisk jaws and I'll give you some mostly-clean money in return.

 Quest Hand-in: Mighty kind of you to help out an ol' fool like me. Here's your reward as promised an' all.
Title: Welcome to Highbank!

Description: Welcome to the highlands, soldier. You're here just in time.

Horde troops just launched an assault from the air. Step up and do something about it. Clear them out!

 Quest Hand-in: That's more like it. We should be able to mop this up from here.
Title: Explorers' League Document (1 of 6)

Description: The document bears the Explorers' League crest and contains extensive information on the indigenous creatures of Loch Modan. Sooty smudges lead you to believe it was likely stolen by the Dark Iron spies in the area.

You recall mention of missing documents at the Explorers' League building in Thelsamar.

 Quest Hand-in: Hello, sonny! You seem to have found one of our stolen documents, eh?Thank you kindly for bringing it back to us. We'll gladly lend some coin as thanks for its return.
Title: The Dragonskin Map

Description: Upon closer inspection, the scroll appears to be a heavily-illustrated map of the fjord.  The location of various villages are depicted in what seem to be tribal symbols.

The location of Vengeance Landing is marked with a disproportionately large skull.

This map will almost certainly be of military value to High Executor Anselm.

 Quest Hand-in: <The high executor looks at the map intently, occasionally looking up at landmarks around the Fjord.>Here's the eastern coastline over here.  The Dragonflayer and Winterskorn villages are here and here... and this must be us over here, marked for death.
Title: More Than Expected

Description: Ya definitely more den expected, mon. I'm sure dere's more important stuff we can be usin' ya talents on now. Ya don't need ta hang out with da newbloods no more.

Head down to da village to da southeast and make yaself known. Lend a hand here and there and I'm sure ya make yer way up to sometin' more prestigious quick enough.

 Quest Hand-in: Ya tha new recruit everyone's talkin' about, eh? Welcome ta tha Darkspear.
Title: Looking Forward

Description: The Admiral used the information you gathered for him to make a forward post under the terrace to our west. He's been preparing there for some kind of attack against the naga.

You should go to him immediately and inform him of the scope of what you've witnessed. Our force is small, and I fear for our soldiers if we charge in too recklessly.

Take my sea horse. It knows the way.

 Quest Hand-in: Good to see you again, <class>. I almost thought we'd lost you to the Wavespeaker's fool errand.Did anything come of it?
Title: Missive: Assault on Stonefury Cliffs

Description: Bloodmaul ogres from Frostfire Ridge have been ambushing trade routes throughout the continent, and are putting captured soldiers to work in their slag mines.

Bodrick Grey has requested the rescue of friendly troops that have been taken prisoner in the main Bloodmaul compound at Stonefury Cliffs.

 Quest Hand-in: Word of the assault has already made it back, as have some spoils from the fight.Well done sir, if you don't mind me saying.
Title: Entry Fee

Description: You looking for da Ring of Blood? HAH! That good one. Not just anybody able to compete in da ring. You gotta pay the entry fee: fifty blood marks.

How do you get them? Oh, tiny one, you killing me!

<Kroggol hands you a small stone caked in blood.>

Dat one is yours. You kill others in da proving grounds to get da rest. Take dem to Wodin da troll servant by Mogor when you done.

Don't talk to Mogor, though. Mogor da boss.

 Quest Hand-in: You? Fightin' ta be da Blood Champion? Hmm.
Title: The Bears and the Bees

Description: Hey, while you're out, would you grab some honey for me and the boys?

Plenty of hives out in the woods, but I'd be careful if you don't want to dirty your delicate house cat hands. Bears out here tend to get pretty vicious when they smell honey.

 Quest Hand-in: You got more on your shirt than you got in the bottles! I'd ask you to shower, but frankly none of us have done that in weeks.
Title: I'm Being Blackmailed By My Cleaner

Description: I have something embarrassing to admit: I'm being blackmailed!

Mrmrglmr agreed to clean some of my things, and got hold of my spare murloc costume. He's threatening to reveal my true nature to the other murlocs.

I need not explain to you what a disaster that would be! Besides, I have a plan that's going to require that we get that costume back.

Please, {name}, go to Mrmrglmr at the other end of the Retreat to the north and do whatever he asks of you.

 Quest Hand-in: Aw, so you must be the so-called King Mrgl-Mrgl's lackey. I suppose that night elf has sent you to appease me?Good, I have just the thing that needs doing for someone as powerful as you!
Title: Born to Be Wilder

Description: There's a lot of information you need to know. Let's have a talk and then we can decide what's best for Lubbins.

 Quest Hand-in: Good! Now to get to work, <name>.Before you go, take these polished pet charms. Pet trainers like to trade these for useful supplies, so keep an eye out.
Title: Gizmos and Gadgets

Description: I've been coming up short on parts recently for my engineering projects, and the other day I finally saw why: the Mosshide gnolls have been making off with them!

I don't have any idea what they could possibly want them for, but I need those gizmos back. They're probably strewn all over the marsh by now, but if you see any, could you gather them and bring them back?

 Quest Hand-in: Oh, wonderful! I'll be able to start reassembling these right away. Thank you so much!
Title: Aiding Maldraxxus

Description: Maldraxxus defends us from forces that threaten the Shadowlands, or at least, they once did.

Now they are plagued by infighting and an imbalance in power.

We have few allies there, but those that remain, we must maintain.

Go there, give them aid, and help them reunite the houses such that the armies of the undying may defend us once more.

Without them, we are but one invasion from complete annihilation.

 Quest Hand-in: We are now one step closer to reforging the army that will defend our worlds. This is a good thing you have done today.
Title: Mass Production

Description: Wahoo!! Did you SEE that?!

We need to get this into production right away!

Here. Take the rest of the stuff to Jinx. You'll find him setting up our new facility just west of here.


 Quest Hand-in: <Jinx examines the powder carefully for a moment.>Hmmm.It'll take a little time. But yes, we can put this into a bomb....
Title: To Fel and Back

Description: Mardum has its fair share of secrets, one of which we found not too long after we took control of the Fel Hammer. It's a breeding ground of sorts, festering with fel bats.

We've been capturing the pups and trying to train them up for our efforts against the Legion.

But the other day, we caught an even greater prize, something worthy of your position, Slayer.

Speak with Kyra and she'll provide you a ride to the ledge.

 Quest Hand-in: Never would I have thought an adult fel bat could be tamed, but your efforts seemed to have prove otherwise. This is a promising revelation for us.But for now, let all see what you have accomplished.
Title: Croc-Out

Description: The Stagalbog east of town is swarming with crocolisks. Swarming, you hear me? I've sold every bit of crocolisk you could imagine.

Crocolisk hides, teeth, tails, tongues, eyes, you name it. My point is, they ain't sellin' anymore. There's too many crocs! We're over-supplied and under-demanded.

So since they're of no use to me, and they occasionally eat my guests, I need you to just kill the suckers. Do me the favor, eh? I'll be here negotiatin' things with your people.

 Quest Hand-in: All taken care of? Good to hear. Takes a load off my mind.Now I can focus on proper business for the fine folk of Marshtide and Stonard, weary from the war... and all that junk.
Title: The Twilight Forge

Description: <Pip's helm hums with energy.>

Damn it! Raz won't stop! It's as if he were possessed with a burning vengeance for all things Twilight! It looks like if we're going to get past this room and catch up with Raz we'll need to take out the Twilight armorer, Karsh Steelbender. Kill him quick, {name}.

 Quest Hand-in: <Finkle's helm crackles with static.>That should put a stop to their armory - at least for now.Raz ran off across the ramp on the other side of the forge. GO GO GO!
Title: The Archiereus Of Flame

Description: Your efforts have driven back the Ordon and brought peace to the Celestial Court, but it will not last. It is time to silence the great emissary of Ordos - the Archiereus of Flame.

Speak with Mistweaver Ku and purchase a scroll of challenge, then travel to Three-Breeze Terrace to the north. Issue a challenge at the challenge stone, it will undoubtedly catch the attention of the Ordon, drawing the archiereus out of the Ordon Sanctuary. It is your only chance.

 Quest Hand-in: The emissaries of Ordos have been silenced, for a time.Know that anger, violence, and hatred will never cease. Wherever there is the darkness within one's spirit, you will find these Sha awaiting you. They may become manifest in many forms: a warlord hungering for power, a dagger in your back in the night, a young prince following a dark path, and even your own battle against forces not aligned with your own.Learn from the lessons of these emotions, lest you lose yourself to the darkness.
Title: Dredgers Left Behind

Description: When Prince Renathal fled Darkwall Tower, he was forced to leave many people and belongings behind.

The powerful relics and weapons were long ago carted off to the Master's lair. But the Prince's dredgers were forced to stay and serve the Master's traitorous lackeys here instead.

You will be a welcome sight to them--a sign that the Prince has not forgotten them.

If they are willing to fight, help them escape and I will ensure they are brought safely to Sinfall.

 Quest Hand-in: I must admit, I did not expect the dredgers to be quite so eager to fight for their own freedom.The Prince inspires all of us, I suppose.
Title: Feed the Eater

Description: The House of Plagues has suffered calamity, much like Lordaeron. I hope that our work and effort here will reverse some of that destruction.

But first, we must reach farther into the House of Plagues so we can strengthen the capabilities of Faranell's plague eater.

Any slime or creature you slay will surely help it gain fortitude.

 Quest Hand-in: The Plague Eater is looking so much stronger already. I think Master Apothecary Faranell would be pleased.
Title: A Hearty Thanks!

Description: You saved my life, {name}! Thank you so much! That beast would have torn me to shreds if it weren't for you.

If you see the exarch at Azure Watch, tell him of what you did. I'm sure he'll be pleased to hear such news!

 Quest Hand-in: Well done, <name>. Well done indeed! You are turning out to be a special <race> - a cut above the others of your age. Take this as a reward!
Title: Killing on the Side

Description: Those annoying Alliance nearby are definitely takin' orders from Mekkatorque.

That means they gotta die! And any of their Kul Tiran friends, too. They gotta know the Horde is number one.

And that you don't kidnap someone's roadside assistance!

 Quest Hand-in: Good work mopping up those guys, that'll show 'em to mess with the Horde! What? They weren't messin' with us? Of course they were, they kidnapped my insurance policy!
Title: Parting Gifts

Description: Look what we have here... eyes of dominion. The Cult normally goes to great lengths to keep these things safe, but I suppose their options for retreat are few when we're slaughtering them in their own home.

The eyes allow a being of any relative power to control an undead minion's actions precisely. As you can imagine, this can be extremely useful when it comes to your typical clumsy ghoul or skeleton.

Care to try your hand at it? Use one of the eyes to control a captured shade.

 Quest Hand-in: Nothing to it, eh? Any intelligent being should have little trouble controlling lesser undead. I suspect only the likes of a true necromancer could use these to sieze control of any of the more powerful undead. That won't be a problem though - I can already think of quite a variety of destruction we can wreak with even the most paltry minions.Shall we have at it then?
Title: Runecloth

Description: In Timbermaw, we are content.  We do not like strangers.  This is good for us, but it is bad for trade.

Not long ago, a rare night elf friend came to Timbermaw and she wore a runecloth cloak.  Runecloth is rare among us, but the cloak was so fine my people want me to make more runecloth clothing.

Will you bring me runecloth?  If you bring me enough, then I will give you something in trade.

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, you brought the cloth.  Such fine material it is!Thank you, <name>.  You are a true friend.  Please accept this in exchange.
Title: Obliterating Ogres

Description: We got more of those magic tossing ogres here which is never a good thing.

These new ogres are especially bossy and have increased work being done here.

Do you know what stops ogres from working hard? Dying.

Kill some ogres here and get this camp back to its normal boring self.

 Quest Hand-in: Great! They are pretty scared now. Its hard to do research when you are afraid of being stabbed in the back at any time!
Title: Greatest of Threats

Description: Powerful djaradin and other creatures threaten both the Obsidian Citadel and the safety of my flight. 

This cannot stand.

Help secure the area. Seek out and eliminate two of our most powerful enemies.

 Quest Hand-in: Well done. Your willingness to assist has been noted... and is appreciated.
Title: Give it a Name

Description: My, my, how long has it been? How long have we been working on this damned plague? Finally, after an eternity of failure, we are blessed with perfection. This... It doesn't even have a proper name yet! This blight... That's it, BLIGHT! This blight will tear down the very fabric of life!

<Harris hands you a vial.>

Now, find the bat handler, Tobias, and show him the specimen. He'll get you on your way to Venomspite.


 Quest Hand-in: Uh, yea, you can go ahead and hold on to that vial, friend. I trust you.
Title: This Is Our Army

Description: I told Commander Valorfist that we could hold our own, and we intend to.  I had a little conversation with the death knight general, Thassarian, on my way over here.  We farmers plan to help in our own way.

We will take control of this farm, begin to cultivate the land... and then when the battle for Andorhal commences, we will attack the Forsaken from the rear.  They'll never expect it.

First, we need to get rid of these Forsaken outriders.  Kill some, then return to me.

 Quest Hand-in: You fight well, <race>.  My men could stand to learn a few moves from an experienced <class> like you.
Title: No Mercy for the Captured

Description: We have more fools for you to kill.

My agents tell me that several of our good citizens have seen fit to fall into the hands of the Scarlet Onslaught.

This will not do.

Go back to New Hearthglen and eliminate Deathguard Schneider, Senior Scrivener Kinnedius, Engineer Burke and Chancellor Amai.

From what I hear, they're spread out throughout the area. No doubt they are being kept in cages awaiting torture.

Speak with them and then kill them!

 Quest Hand-in: What? You were expecting us to have you rescue them?Now why would we do that when they have a proven track record of getting themselves captured in the first place?Northrend is a cold place, young <name>. I suggest that you adjust to it.
Title: Skulk Rock Clean-Up

Description: Years ago, there used to be a Horde base deep within Skulk Rock. It's been abandoned since then, but it's still prime territory, worth takin' for our allies!

Problem is, it's full of dwarf-eating slimes and oozes. Those things are slightly less disgustin' than trolls, but they'll still give us a hassle.

With our boys tied up fightin' the Revantusk, I need you to go to Skulk Rock and clear the place out for me.

 Quest Hand-in: It's good to see you back... and not missing any limbs, either.
Title: Devoured Anima

Description: Sika has idea!

Devourers... devour. They eat anything! So they eat anima, too.

If we take anima from devourers, then that anima is ours!

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you! Wow... you can't tell this was inside devourer!Sika will get anima to those most in need.
Title: Anima is Power

Description: You did well, boss. Keep it up like that, right, and we just might 'ave a chance of survivin' this mess.

Keep your eyes open, though. Word of success like this gets 'round and it's only a matter of time till uvvers come callin' for your 'elp.

Now, right, all that anima you've recovered can be put to use 'round 'ere. Bring it down to Foreman Flatfinger. He'll ensure it stored away nice and secure.

 Quest Hand-in: Boss returns the victor! You got any anima on 'and?
Title: Frost Infusion

Description: Shadow's Edge is prepared to receive its final infusion of power.

Sindragosa, the enemy's own mount, must fall. But before she is brought down, you must sustain four of her frozen breath attacks without tasting death.

Without his dragon, nothing shall stand between you and the Lich King.

 Quest Hand-in: The axe has drunk its fill, <race>, and the forge is nearly ready for the creation of Shadowmourne...
Title: A Jade Cat for Ella

Description: Do you have any pets? I like cats, but dogs are nice, too.

 Quest Hand-in: Oh, a jade cat!My father and I used to hunt for these in the fields. He always said they were lucky.
Title: Report from the Northern Front

Description: The battle against the Horde isn't being waged from Raynewood Tower alone, {name}. There's a more substantial Silverwing Sentinel presence at Silverwing Grove to the southeast, near the border with the Barrens. From the grove, Sentinel Farsong directs our efforts against those who would destroy our lands.

I'm a bit late in sending my latest report to her, but also hesitant to leave the tower unattended.

I am in dire need of your help in getting this report to her as soon as possible!

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you for delivering this report, <class>. From what Sentinel Melyria writes, it seems our worst fears have come to pass. With each advance we make, the Horde appears more determined to do as much damage as possible.We can't afford to back down; the fate of our ancestral lands hangs in the balance. With more people like you on the frontlines, I'm certain we could triumph.Will you join our fight? A new front has just opened in Warsong Gulch to the south.
Title: Island Expedition

Description: We better be quick if we're gonna get to de island before de Alliance.

You ready?

 Quest Hand-in: Nice work, <name>. We make a good team. Let's do this again sometime.
Title: Steal Them Back

Description: <This empty crate of supplies is clearly marked with Kul Tiran signage. These must be the spoils of their raids on the farms of the valley.

The citizens would probably like their supplies back if there are any left.>

 Quest Hand-in: It's not stealing if we're stealing them back. Hey! Are those my lucky anchors?
Title: Back on Track

Description: Now that the batteries are out of the bog I can radio in some more copters to take them to camp.

I'll stay here until they arrive, but you should go ahead to my brother Dilbert and let him know what happened. He must be worried sick!

 Quest Hand-in: Oh, thank goodness. I don't even have any weapons!
Title: Wayward Archivists

Description: You, dracthyr. 

Two of your kin have been searching the archives just south of here. I have yet to introduce myself, and would appreciate the company.

If you have the time, I can meet you in the upper archive.

 Quest Hand-in: You are a very jumpy bunch.
Title: Cranberry Chutney

Description: If you haven't tried the cranberry chutney yet, you're in for a treat. It's made with the freshest tangy Wetlands cranberries. Just pick some up from the Pilgrim's Bounty vendor if you want to try your hand at making chutney.

The recipe should be in your bountiful cookbook.

If you've got some extra time on your hands, would you mind making some of the chutney and bringing it down to Jasper Moore outside Stormwind? I promised him I'd trade some for the pie you brought.

 Quest Hand-in: Finally, the cranberry chutney I was promised. You wouldn't believe how fast the celebrants go through the stuff here.
Title: I Am the Trashmaster

Description: Whatcha got there, richmon? 

Ha! You think you be de Trashmasta? You be talkin' to de God of Garbage! De Ruler of Rubbish! Master of all things Discarded an' Unwanted!

So you not be wantin' that ol' trashy cloak, eh? Jani got somethin' better. 

You just give dat ol' thing to me, an Jani will be takin' care o' you...

 Quest Hand-in: Hek hek hek. Thanks for de trade, richmon.I not be wantin' this thing. It be too stuffy, too high-an-mighty. Not worthy of Jani! But you can have it.Now be gone. I got offerins' to sort.
Title: Rise, Champions

Description: As leader of our order, other hunters will look to you for guidance. Many will be willing to pledge themselves to you, doing whatever is necessary in the name of the Unseen Path.

I know of two within our ranks who are impressed with what they've seen from you so far, and want to help any way they can.

Seek them out, and let them ease the burden of leadership.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent. Emmarel Shadewarden and Loren Stormhoof are worthy champions. We can trust them to carry out any task we ask of them.
Title: Waterlogged Tome

Description: In spite of its magical nature, the book has been damaged by water.

The head of the curators in Dalaran is renowned for his abilities.  Perhaps he can restore it.

 Quest Hand-in: I would recognize that handwriting anywhere.  This is our own Khadgar's journal!
Title: Stealing From Our Own

Description: As you know, {name}, Garrosh has relegated the goblins of Orgrimmar to the western outskirts of the city.  Fortunately, that means that we have easy access to their supplies.  I am working on a large batch of jambalaya for the infantry and I need as much rice as possible.  Lucky for us, the goblins keep it stored in barrels near their structures.  Retrieve these barrels of Kezan rice for me and I should be able to finish up. 

 Quest Hand-in: I see you are a skilled thief as well, <name>.  Don't worry, we will return the rice once we are done... or not.
Title: Deaths in the Family

Description: The Agamand family was the most prosperous family in Tirisfal Glades.  I used to work their mills...before the plague.

When the Scourge first came, the Agamands fortified their home and convinced those in their employ to remain and help them defend.  We were fools, but at least we were loyal fools.

The Agamands, in their pride, doomed us to undeath.  And now they are minions of the Scourge!

Serve the Forsaken by defeating the Agamands who fell to the plague.  Serve me by bringing me their remains.

 Quest Hand-in: Revenge has a sweet taste, don't you think?  When you destroyed the Agamands, did you catch any hint of free will within them?  I hope so.  I hope they knew fear before they were smashed into oblivion.It is a foolish hope, I know.  But it is a hope I foster nonetheless.
Title: Our Most Precious Resource

Description: You have fulfilled your calling, Maw Walker, and brought peace to our realm.

Stay vigilant, for others will similarly call upon you in time.

The anima you have so dutifully recovered will be of great use in the hold. Bring it to Haephus at once. He will ensure it is kept safe until it is needed.

Go in service.

 Quest Hand-in: The Maw Walker returns triumphant! Have you any anima on hand?
Title: Rush Delivery

Description: Peak Grindstone's team broke down somewhere out there to the west.

Think you can make yourself useful for a change and rush some parts out to them, {race}?

 Quest Hand-in: I can't thank you enough, <class>. Now, let's see if we can get this catapult moving again.
Title: The Trogg Threat

Description: {class}, you may or may not be aware of the trogg threat looming over dwarven lands.  With the Ironforge Reserve called up to the Alliance Front, we're left with a fraction of the defense forces needed to keep these lands safe.  My regiment is assigned to watch over the town here and we cannot leave our post for fear of invasion.

But we need some pressure put on those damned troggs lurking in the hills.  If you're up to the task, wage an assault on the troggs.  Bring me back eight trogg stone teeth as proof.

 Quest Hand-in: I am quite impressed, <name>.  You have done the Dwarven race a great favor by defending our lands.  King Magni Bronzebeard himself would be proud!
Title: No Dragon Left Behind

Description: I... cannot move so long as this spear remains in my side. But we need to follow Fyrakk's trail.

<Ebyssian grunts sharply, his breathing labored, claws digging into the dirt.>

Remove it. I can... bear the pain it will cause.

 Quest Hand-in: We should both be able to walk.Fyrakk has left a trail of destruction across the cavern. We must help any harmed by him, even if we can do nothing to stop him.
Title: All's Fair in Love, War, and Archaeology

Description: First things first, though.  I'm not just going to sit here and tell you everything we've discovered down in those ruins.  We've got problems to take care of!

Most pressing is those upstart Reliquary hooligans, just on the other side of the tomb.  They're makin' off with all of our loot!  Don't they know that diggin's dwarf work?

Hunt down a few of their "excavators" - more like bandits, if you ask me - and bring some of these precious artifacts back to me.

THEN we'll talk titans.

 Quest Hand-in: Chalice... worthless.Vase... counterfeit.Hieroglyph... interesting, but rather common.What's this?  I've never seen trogg craftsmanship of this caliber!  You've stumbled upon something rare indeed, <name>.Alright, fine.  Let's talk titans, shall we?
Title: Fighting Words

Description: Throughout the Shadowlands, there is so much magic to learn!

A threat in Bastion has put many of their ancient teachings in danger. I wish to study their scrolls before they are lost forever. We must travel there and safeguard what we can!

Help me fight back the Forsworn at the Temple of Humility and save the scrolls within.

 Quest Hand-in: You have helped strengthen our forces, Maw Walker.
Title: Moose Soul

Description: <The Moose Soul endures and protects. The shape of the moose will be yours to call upon.>

 Quest Hand-in: The moose! A fine choice. It will be yours to call upon.
Title: Challenges in Bastion

Description: Sometimes we need look no further than our own golden hills to find a suitable challenge.

Doubt has crept into the minds of some of the most stoic shieldbearers of the Kyrian people. It has poisoned them against us, and in doing so, harmed the ability of the Shadowlands to heal from this blight.

We must stand against them, now. 

It will not be easy, but things that are worth fighting for rarely are.

 Quest Hand-in: You have uprooted the seeds of doubt and crushed them with certainty. May their doubts now be about only their own dark paths.
Title: At the Stonemother's Call

Description: It is time. The Stonemother will speak with you. You can find her throne in northern Deepholm, above the Scoured Reach.

 Quest Hand-in: So you've come.Fleshlings just like you killed my daughter... my only daughter. With no provocation.Not sated at stripping me of my family, more of you flocked to Deathwing to serve him in ravaging my home.You're quite arrogant to come before me asking for MY help. I'm tempted to crush you where you stand.
Title: What Kind of Name is Candy, Anyway?

Description: Can you believe that Candy Cane! You know up until you "dealt" with Chip, she was dating him. Now she's going out with the Trade Prince!

I just can't get over the fact that she betrayed you like that with your ex. Maybe you should head down into the Slave Pits and take care of her once and for all?

 Quest Hand-in: Serves her right for stealing your man in the first place.
Title: Saving the Sutras

Description: My adepts had to abandon their studies when the sha invasion began.
