 Quest Hand-in: Speak not. I know what you seek.Do you believe yourself ready to face the trials ahead?
Title: Troubles at Home

Description: They say that all of the Shadowlands is a stage, and right now, I think we're in a tragedy! 

All throughout Ardenweald, we are under attack. They seek our anima and the souls that we protect.

If the cycle stops here, so many great souls will be lost... forever.

There's no time to waste, we need your help! Defend Ardenweald!

 Quest Hand-in: I've heard many tales of your greatness, the Winter Queen is quite pleased! Please take this, and keep up the fight!
Title: Reflections in Amber

Description: <A viscous dark ooze drips from this large chunk of amber. Attempting to wipe it off is futile, as the ooze is seemingly created by the amber itself.

As you hold it, unintelligible whispers fill the back of your mind.

The Shado-Pan will surely want to examine it.>

 Quest Hand-in: What is it you have there, <name>?
Title: Robbing Robbers of Robbers

Description: Ah, a {class}. I could make good use of your skills.

A convoy was struck just up the road by a band of marauding saurok. These marauders made off with some... merchandise... her ladyship, the Madam Goya, had a mind to sell.

One does not steal from her ladyship.

If you recover these items I will gladly provide you a finders fee.

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, our merchandise. Madam Goya will be pleased. You have the gratitude of her ladyship.
Title: Obsidian Obfuscation

Description: Hi, {name}.

<Ruszi looks around nervously.>

Do you want to play hide and seek with me? I think it would be very good training. 

I need to watch out for danger, so it is good to know where to hide. Will you help me practice?

 Quest Hand-in: You found all of us! I think I am getting better at hiding. I cannot wait to play again!<Ruszi does a spin.>This was super super fun!
Title: The Fate of Tuurem

Description: Prophet Velen's search for allies has emboldened those draenei remaining in Outland to begin a search of their own. The Legion's war on my people drove us from our cities and temples, but they have not destroyed the traces of our civilization.

Tuurem, my former home in the Terokkar Forest, was one of the first cities overrun by the orcs. It's been too long since I've received news of its status. Take this letter to Andarl in the Allerian Stronghold within Terokkar and see what you can find out.

 Quest Hand-in: Hmm... I remember hearing our scouts speak of the ruins of a draenei settlement in the forest's northern reaches. I don't know much about the ruins, personally, but you're welcome to talk to some of the scouts.
Title: Pirates? I Hate Those Guys!

Description: <An old pirate hat. Seems out of place on this island, perhaps Reno Jackson will know what to make of it>

 Quest Hand-in: I suspected pirate activity here! All these strange items we're finding are their plundered loot.
Title: Too Close for Comfort

Description: I'm happy for Nathaniel: he's spent so long trying to return to Northridge, and now with the Scarlet Crusade out of the way, he can finally move back home.  It's just... even for such a seemingly-idyllic setting, it's not really the best place to raise a family.

For example: along this valley's edge, you will find rabid foxes searching for innocent prey.  Every once in a while I catch a glimpse of one looking right at me.

Please, {class}, remove some of these foxes.  I don't feel safe with them near.

 Quest Hand-in: I feel a bit more relieved, <name>.  Thank you.
Title: Finest Fungi at the Feast

Description: Fine dining is all about using the finest techniques on the finest ingredients, naturally. The food composed for fine dining is oft locked behind wealth and means, but we would never allow that at The Ruby Feast!

Morsel has informed me of a perfect ingredient for today's theme. One so rare, so exquisite, that it... does not exist yet! Tantalizing, no?

The bronze have uncovered a portal to a dangerous future. One where a black truffle with untold flavor exists!

You must go!

 Quest Hand-in: Oh, <name>? My plate is full, but I will always make room at the table for you.
Title: Showdown

Description: Now it comes to this. We will bring Goc forth from his lair, and we will destroy him. With Goc dead, the Bladespire ogres will threaten the Mok'Nathal no longer. Go to Goc's altar outside Gruul's Lair, then blow my horn. I will come, and we will face the son of Gruul together.

 Quest Hand-in: The battle was hard and you fought well, <name>. I am honored to have stood by your side in the battle against Goc. I am thankful beyond words.The Mok'Nathal should know of these great defeats, but I am not ready to face them yet. I know my father's mind, and I know my heart. There is still much I can learn and do to become stronger, to show to him that I am his true son.
Title: Safety in Numbers

Description: I've taught you all that is practical for now.

It is time we joined with the other survivors.  The others mentioned that King Greymane and his royal guard are just south of here.

We should go there and seek safety in numbers.

 Quest Hand-in: You've done well in coming here.  If we Gilneans stick together we might yet defeat this terrible enemy.
Title: Echoes of the Fallen

Description: There are tuskarr here! My friends, my people--my family. They left for a hunt not a week ago.

Already they're too decayed to recover. 

Their spirits are here still. They linger in rage and regret. Kaqiata, Lutokk, Tuyuki...

Please, {name}, take this totem and place it near their remains. It'll contact their spirits... and help them find peace.

 Quest Hand-in: So they all chose to lend their power to my totem? <Brena squeezes her eyes shut in sorrow.> Thank you, my friends. We will use the strength of your spirits well. The gnolls will not reach Iskaara.
Title: Dragon Isles Supplies

Description: Greetings {name}! 

Thank you for helping us! Meet me in Loamm so we get you a reward. 

Keep up the good work, 

Mimuup

 Quest Hand-in: Honestly, we're forever grateful. Thank you!
Title: Maxnar Must Die!

Description: They've left us no choice, {name}.  It's time to put an end to the threat from the Blackwing Coven by taking out their leader, Maxnar the Ashmaw.

I don't know if you caught a glimpse of him while you were in there, but he's one of the dragonkin, half-man, half-dragon.  And he's tough, so don't underestimate him!

Finish it quickly and with any luck you'll secure the safety of Evergrove and the Ruuan Weald.

 Quest Hand-in: Now we can breathe more easily knowing that the leader of our enemy has been dealt with.  Not only that, but you've saved the entire mountain range from their depredations.Whatever their ultimate goals, you've foiled them!You have our gratitude, <name>.  Please accept this token of our esteem, as well as our unending hospitality.
Title: Strange New Ores

Description: You smell that, smith? Ahhhh... that there's the smell of opportunity.

Dalaran's taken us to some strange new shores, filled with mysterious metals. I'm tethered to my shop here, but you... you've got the freedom to explore and mine at will.

Bring me something interesting, and we'll see what we can make with it.

 Quest Hand-in: Fascinating...
Title: Blooming Blossoms

Description: Would you do a humble merchant a favor? I've been needin' to refresh my stock of eternal blossoms. They grow in the woods nearby.

Could you help me out, perhaps?

 Quest Hand-in: Aha! You are quite the kind patron.Thank you... thank you.
Title: A Great Storm Approaches

Description: You are not like the others, little one. You do not reek of the ancient death. Perhaps you can be trusted.

I am Gymer, king of the storm giants. I was lured here by my brother, Thiassi, now an undead servant of the Lich King. By the time I realized that his cry for help was a trap, it was too late. I am now a prisoner of the Scourge and I fear that soon I will suffer the same fate as many of the other storm giants.

Find a way to release me from this cage and I will aid you to the best of my ability.

 Quest Hand-in: A... A storm giant? I don't know about this, <name>. That sounds risky. On the other hand, I don't think we have too many other options.If I do this you have to promise me that you will get your giant friend to help us deal with Navarius and his cronies.
Title: The Ebon Watch

Description: West of here, across the ruined roads and structures, is the death knight encampment of Ebon Watch.

<Crusader Lord Lantinga rolls up Drakuru's orders.>

Take these orders and deliver them to Stefan Vadu. He is the death knight in command at Ebon Watch. Let him know that the Argent Crusade will deal with Prince Navarius. They'll have to handle Drakuru.

Be careful, {name}. The way to Ebon Watch is teeming with Scourge.

 Quest Hand-in: <Stefan reads the missive, then crumples it up and tosses it into the fire.>Old news. The Argent Crusade is - once again - late to the party. We've been tracking Drakuru since Grizzly Hills. He is slated for eradication.
Title: Emergency Aid

Description: Many of our warriors didn't survive the Twilight attack on our air fleet. Those that did are swimming to the remains of the fleet, bleeding and badly burned. I need support from the shore to keep my men alive!

There should be some sort of doctor or medicine man inside of Dragonmaw Port who would be willing to help his fellow orcs out. Go ashore and see if you can bring some medical supplies back to the fleet!

 Quest Hand-in: <Gregor bows respectfully to Zaela.>If it is Zaela's wish, then you shall have your supplies. Just don't tell the Dragonmaw Warchief...
Title: Tapping the Leylines

Description: The arcways were built to tap into the magical leylines beneath Suramar. As we learned to subsist on the Nightwell, the old facilities fell out of use.

This chamber is clearly receiving power from elsewhere.

There is only a trickle now, but if you can direct more leyline energy here it will help to sustain us.

The closest source is to the north, near Anora Hollow.

 Quest Hand-in: And just who might you be?
Title: Salve via Mining

Description: If you possess a Cenarion beacon while mining in Felwood, you will be able to see tainted vitriol that corrupts a vein of raw metal.  I know how to purify that vitriol and turn it into a reagent that goes into making Cenarion plant salve.  You will then use that salve on plants you find in the wild that need saving.

If you have collected any tainted vitriol, I'll give you some Cenarion plant salve I have already prepared.

 Quest Hand-in: Very well then, here's some Cenarion plant salve. If you find more vitriol when you mine in Felwood, remember to hold on to it for me! The more of it you find, the more salve I will be able to make.
Title: Insurrection: Waxing Crescent

Description: First Arcanist Thalyssra has sent word: there has been communication from Ly'leth. Your help is needed.

Journey to Shal'Aran in Suramar and lend what aid you can.

 Quest Hand-in: You are going to want to hear this.
Title: Wounds Beyond Flesh

Description: Even as Baine's flesh mends, his spirit draws closer to death. I have seen dark magic like this before... among the Shadowmoon clan.

The Jailer's minions must have inflicted a similar malady upon Baine. 

The only cure for the Shadowmoon's curse was to find the object they used to poison the spirit and shatter it.

The sorcerers of this realm wield ornamental daggers. That might be what we're looking for.

We must find the one that they used on Baine--quickly!

 Quest Hand-in: We were fortunate to find the sorcerer who poisoned Baine's spirit.I will need your help breaking its link to the High Chieftain.
Title: Fueling the Demolishers

Description: {name}! About time you showed up. While the battle may be over, we still need to prepare for the next battle. Travel to the Cauldron of Flames in south eastern Wintergrasp and retrieve several eternal embers.

The embers are mixed in with coal to fuel the Demolisher and Siege Engines. 

Oh, and if you happen to see some of the Horde in the Cauldron, don't hesitate to slay them and take their embers. We can't let them have the advantage in the next battle.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent! This will help fuel the flames of war for days to come.
Title: Our Forward Scouts

Description: The Jailer's forces control much of Zereth Mortis, but there are other dangers out there as well.

I have dispatched scouts to survey the surrounding area and pinpoint any potential threats.

Speak with each scout. They should have a report of their surveys. Gather this information and then return to me.

 Quest Hand-in: This information will help us plan our next move. Thank you, Maw Walker.
Title: Hook 'em High

Description: The Wildhammer can train war gryphons faster than we can subvert and control drakes. We can't let them continue to outnumber us!

Hunt gryphon riders flying over the river north of Bloodgulch. Take this hook and fling it at them as they fly by. Their momentum will hurl them from their mount, right to your feet. Kill the dismounted gryphon riders!

 Quest Hand-in: You made that look easy, <name>.Get the Wildhammer off of their mounts and they're nothing!
Title: Ga'nar of the Frostwolf

Description: We must move on, there isn't time to waste!

One of the elders of my clan, Ga'nar, is out there somewhere. I can sense him, but I cannot find him.

Keep an eye out for Ga'nar. He is a strong-willed orc, and will languish in captivity.

 Quest Hand-in: <The orc's lips and wrists quiver with restrained fury.>Who are you?Wait, what's that you say? Drek'Thar is here?
Title: Information is King

Description: Information ain't cheap. Outta everyone, Zeros should know that best.

People have sighted dangerous crocolisks around Janeiro's Point. You know what I see? Money, money, money! Get me their precious skins and maybe I'll remember something important about those crystals Zeros is after.

If that's too dangerous for your cup of tea, I might be open to other forms of payment too. You know, the most common form.

<Blixrez folds his arms and waits expectantly.>

 Quest Hand-in: Mmhm, this will do!
Title: Only the Beginning

Description: I miss the days when legions of powerful ogres marched by the Horde's side into battle, the pathetic Alliance cowering at their ferocity. Perhaps those days will return before I am gone to the ancestors.

However, that is not the case now. An ogre magi, Glubtok, has joined forces with the despicable Defias Brotherhood and acts as Foreman over their mining operations. The pathetic fool! End his life for me, and for the spirit and glory of the Horde!

 Quest Hand-in: Do not be alarmed, <name>. I am close to you, waiting in the shadows. You've done well.You must continue the mission here - I am too valuable to risk my life against petty criminals like these.
Title: Troll Patrol: Couldn't Care Less

Description: Of all the posts, they throw me in this one.

The place is flooded with putrid, stagnant water and now it's host to sewage elementals!

I don't really know what they are or why they're here, and frankly I couldn't care less. What I do know is they're making a mess of my sector! How am I supposed to conduct any dignified military operations with those foul things roaming around?

Get out there, {class}, and don't come back 'til you've cleared your share of 'em off of my battlefield!

 Quest Hand-in: You sure about that, <race>?Seems to me like there are more of them things out there now than when you started!
Title: Dungeon: Darkmaul Citadel

Description: Gor'groth seeks to raise a powerful dragon, Ravnyr, from the dead. 

He's collected enough life essence to attempt to finish the ritual... even if it means Ravnyr will not be at her full strength.

Gor'groth will not stop until he is slain!

You must storm the citadel and slay Gor'groth before he can complete his ritual!

I would charge in beside you, were I not still recovering from his dark magic.

 Quest Hand-in: Victory for the Horde! It is time we returned to Orgrimmar as heroes and conquerors.
Title: Prisoners No More

Description: Hatuun's people have endured arduous times. Their numbers dwindle as those ripped from beyond the walls of their sanctuary become servants to the annihilan lords in the pits just beyond, sentenced to a life of labor, torture and ultimately, death.

Seek out these captives, release them from their bonds and show our allies we stand as one against the Burning Legion.

 Quest Hand-in: Hatuun's people will greatly appreciate what you've done for them.
Title: Last Resort Analysis

Description: <Watu mumbles to himself, eyes closed and arms crossed.>

Of course I get gored by a stag, of all creatures. Now I'm just another one who needs help. My brother will get all the credit, and no one back home will be surprised.

<Watu looks up.> What? What's that you've got there? Glowing rocks? I'll look at one, but take the rest to somebody else. I'm a hunter, not an archaeologist. <Watu snorts, glaring at his leg.> Maybe this is a sign for me to switch jobs. Go on, you've proven more useful than I.

 Quest Hand-in: <Watu stares at shock at his leg, newly bloody and pierced with the shard.>
Title: Brace for Impact

Description: That's it for warming up. You and the other new recruits are a promising bunch, I'll tell you that much.

Hold on... what's that sound? I think something big is headed our way!

 Quest Hand-in: This ship may not make it to the island.Hold on to something sturdy and stick with your fellow recruits. We'll get through this.
Title: Dead Elves Walking

Description: D-did you hear that? Ghosts! I hate ghosts!

Their eerie howls are coming from the barrows to the south. Ahhh! Make them stop!!

Please, mister I'll pay good money to get those voices out of my head!

 Quest Hand-in: Woohooo!!You've silenced the voices! Thank you, thank you!
Title: Step Into the Ring

Description: One of the remarkable things we have found about these lands is that they seem to be adaptive and changing, even as ancient as they are. Things are not stationary.

In the depths of the Nexus of Actualization there is a forge that appears made to test these various designs, and to learn. These creatures may one day be used to defend Zereth Mortis from threats, so you should test their effectiveness where possible.

Go there, challenge what the forge creates and report back to me.

 Quest Hand-in: What a remarkable device. Of course there is clearly some improvement to be made in what it creates. But perhaps it will learn from the lessons you have provided.
Title: Proof of Loyalty

Description: <Tytallo listens as you recount what happened with Lyndras.>

I see. You sound almost... sympathetic to the wretch.

The nightfallen are liars and thieves. ALL of them. Lyndras included.

I will not tolerate a student that has any respect or sympathy for those... things. And have you witnessed what they turn into at the depths of their depravity?

If you want to get on my good side, do not return until you are covered in the blood of the withered.

 Quest Hand-in: Hmm.Very well. We may continue.
Title: West to the Strand

Description: {name}, I have a friend who could make good use of particular talents. His name is Talen and he's an archaeologist of sorts. Recently he's been fascinated with the upheaval of the old city of Zoram and its treasures.

If you're willing to lend him a hand, you can find him at the Blackfathom Camp down the path to the west.

 Quest Hand-in: Hello, <class>.What's that? You say that Shyela sent you?Very well, let's get started.
Title: Bleeding the Bleeding Hollow

Description: The Bleeding Hollow provide significant reinforcement to the Iron Horde in Tanaan. From their home in Zeth'Gol they relentlessly pursue our scouts, disrupt our operations, and gather more power for Gul'dan's magic.

We should consider a direct raid on Zeth'Gol to make them pull back their forces across the valley. This should give us some breathing room... for a time.

 Quest Hand-in: Well done, commander! The Bleeding Hollow are sending their best warriors back to Zeth'Gol to defend it.This should give us an advantage, albeit temporarily.
Title: Serpent's Scale

Description: I see you have gained your own hatchling, {race}.

Have you been feeding it, cleaning after it, and playing with it properly? Only by doing so will it become strong and healthy.

Now let me tell you a trainer's secret. To the north, in The Widow's Wail, you can find a mushroom known as Serpent's Scale.

It is difficult to acquire, but this mushroom has powerful properties and important nutrients. Your serpent won't like eating it, but who likes eating their vegetables?

 Quest Hand-in: <Your serpent sniffs the mushrooms and makes a horrible face. It tries to escape, but you hold it gently and coax it to eat the spongy morsels.>
Title: We Must Prepare!

Description: More of our citizens go missing every day. We think the gnolls are responsible, but we have no idea where they are taking them! If you are to help us defeat the gnolls and find our people, you must be properly equipped. Unfortunately, we are all out of gnomecorders. Without a gnomecorder, there is no way for us to communicate with you when you are in the field.

Our last good gnomecorder was stolen by marauding murlocs last week. You will have to go to Lake Everstill, east of here, and recover it!

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent! Let me make a few adjustments here and we should be good to go.
Title: Defcon: Bobcat

Description: Stop everything! It's come to my attention that there's been bobcat sightings near the lodge. Bobcats!

Now mind you, I've never seen a bobcat, but they're surely dangerous. They're like mountain lions or something. I don't want anyone leaving until the area is secure!

Anyone but you, that is. I'll pay you to help secure the area, {class}. But don't get your face ripped off.

 Quest Hand-in: Okay, yes, I have already been informed that bobcats are much smaller than I was assuming. But that's still pretty dangerous for gnomes!You've done a good thing for the safety of this lodge, <name>!
Title: A Visit With Maybell

Description: You seem like the helpful type, {name}. How about doing an old man a favor?

The last time I was over at the Maclure Vineyards I overheard Maybell crying in her cottage. Would you be so kind as to go check up on her? I'm a little worried.

 Quest Hand-in: William sent you? Bless his soul. I... I'm ok... It's just... Well...
Title: Aiding Azure Span

Description: The oathstone's energy cannot be reclaimed until the ley lines within the Azure Span are repaired.

Some ley lines may only be reachable by those of Kalecgos's skills... but you may still be of aid.

If they still yet survive, seek out the tuskarr. They lived here in my times and have a deep knowledge of the land.

Speak with one of our arcane aids to return to your allies.

 Quest Hand-in: The tuskarr? There are a number of tuskarr merchants and travellers who pass through here.
Title: Bad Supplies

Description: Some of da survivors mentioned food, {name}.  We better check da food supplies.  I gotta a bad feelin' about dis.

 Quest Hand-in: Zanzil... Dis is all startin' to come together now.  If I can find my contact den we can formulate a plan of attack.  A way to end dis madness.
Title: The Tomb of Lights

Description: To the east, buried under the charred sand, is the Tomb of Lights, a lost resting place of the dead.  Before our caravan was ambushed I was going to journey to the tomb and cleanse it of evil spirits.  

Little did I know it was already infested with another kind of evil.  Even now the ethereals plunder the bodies of the fallen for trinkets and keepsakes that were given to the dead centuries ago.  

There is little I can do while our caravan struggles to survive.  

 Quest Hand-in: Out here in the wilds of Outland we are weak with few heroes to defend our rights, but you have given them something to fear <class>.  I do not think the ethereals will soon forget the strong right arm of <name>.
Title: Time-Locked Timewalkers

Description: I'm so glad you're here! I need you to stabilize the situation here on the platforms while Dante and Zera help me hold our infinite dragon friend in place.

The temple's security measures locked Eternus in a stasis bubble when she tried to take control of our Oathstone. Unfortunately, the other Timewalkers were also caught in those security measures.

Your Timewalker staff should free them, no problem. Just make sure to deal with any angry timelings that pop up!

 Quest Hand-in: It worked? I'm not surprised... not entirely, at least!
Title: The Giant Cauldron

Description: A high value artifact at Cragplume Canyon, hmmm?

Let's see if we can't beat the Iron Horde to it.

Let's move fast. Speak to Choluna, and we'll be on our way.

 Quest Hand-in: So this is it, huh? Let's see what's hiding in these depths.
Title: Find Agent Kearnen

Description: SI: 7 has been tracking Helix Gearbreaker since he entered Alliance territory two weeks ago. The letter I received from Mathias Shaw explained that he sent an agent by the name of Kearnen to Westfall to shadow Helix. Find Agent Kearnen and you'll find Helix Gearbreaker.

Kearnen came into town for supplies two days ago. She mentioned that she would be near Mortwake's Tower, southeast of here, on the Dust Plains.

Get going, {name}.

 Quest Hand-in: Helix is the one responsible for the gnoll attacks?<Kearnen nods at the tower.>He's inside. He's been there for days. I've just been waiting for an excuse to bust him.
Title: Time in a Bottle

Description: Great! The Timewalker staff intact! But, it is definitely drained.

I know! You can recharge it using the temporal energy coalescing around the wildlife here. Unfortunately, that means defeating affected creatures in the forest. The energies were making them dangerous and unstable, and we would have had to cull the population after anyhow... 

Sometimes you have to sacrifice for the greater good. Could you help? I still need a minute.

 Quest Hand-in: This staff has been through a lot, but it should be fully functional again.Thank you, <class>.
Title: Hot Stock

Description: The fish could be biting better, don't you think?

You know, that gives me an idea. Legend says these lava lakes are not always abundant with hot-loving fish. They say, pools were stocked with fish when the dragons soaring overhead dropped them! Can you believe it?

Maybe you and your drake could give it a try?

 Quest Hand-in: Ha! The legends are true, how fantastic!
Title: Carry On, Basilton

Description: There is one more thing this old drakonid would like to ask you, before you leave.

Back when Lord Basilton and I first met, we would go on all sorts of adventures together. I think that's why he wanders off. He misses exploring.

I can't do that for him anymore. But you can! You can take him to see places I never would have dreamed of, I can tell.

However, we should ask Basilton what he thinks first.

 Quest Hand-in: I'm jealous of him, if I'm being honest. To be young again, and exploring the world. You'll have to visit, sometime, so you can tell me what he's been up to.
Title: Return to Boralus

Description: You know, a lot has happened since you arrived in Zuldazar! I'm sure Mr. Wyrmbane would appreciate a report.

Oh, not from me. Maybe somebody a bit more serious... like you!

I bet Daria over here could get you back pretty quick!

 Quest Hand-in: We'll base our operations out of Xibala, then. And I'll have some reinforcements sent out to assist Brigadier Thom.Thank you for your report, <name>. Well done.
Title: Ysondre's Farewell

Description: With that, I am the only one left.

Even if I choose to remain in this world, I cannot rejoin the green flight. But this victory gives me hope. Perhaps, in time, I can find peace in a simple life among mortals.

You must return to your people. Tell them that the dragons of nightmare are gone, and will no longer threaten these lands.

 Quest Hand-in: To be drawn into a fight between dragons...I don't know if you're blessed or cursed.Lady Shandris has heard of all you've done, and has personally sent this reward for your bravery. I'm glad you came back in one piece to receive it.
Title: Nuke 'Em Norbit

Description: These motospiders continue to multiply unchecked. If we don't slow them down they'll overrun Rustbolt soon.

I've modified Norbit here with adequate firepower to take the spiders head on!

Would you pilot Norbit and destroy the Reinforced Sparkweave Eggs?

 Quest Hand-in: Mission accomplished!
Title: Fruitful Ventures

Description: Oh no! They must be vegetarians.

What these elekk need is fruit and lots of it. There are cherries all over the place around here under the trees.

You wouldn't mind grabbing me some, would ya?

 Quest Hand-in: You got them all? I just know this is going to work.
Title: A Friendly Accord

Description: I'd like to offer ya an accord.

The Dread Admiral Eliza wields a pair of cursed blades that have made her the scourge of the south seas. She also stole one of me best ships - the Horizon's Edge - and has it anchored off the shore of Azsuna as we speak. 

If you help me take back me ship, then her cursed blades are yours.

Now, assuming that sounds agreeable, meet me aboard the Crimson Veil. We have her docked right in Booty Bay - not a cheap arrangement.

 Quest Hand-in: Aha! I knew you'd come!
Title: 50 Tickets - Darkmoon Storage Box

Description: Step right up, step right up!  If you have tickets from the Darkmoon Faire you'd like redeemed, then just say so!  You can redeem tickets in various denominations for wondrous and fantastic prizes.  Don't be shy, give it a try!

 Quest Hand-in: Here you go, here you go!  A prize fit for a king!  Congratulations to you, my friend!If you have more tickets you'd like to turn in, then please let me know!  For as long as the Darkmoon Faire is here, I'll redeem your tickets.
Title: The Home Stretch

Description: If they weren't angry before, they sure are now. We won't survive a minute up on top o' this tank!

Let's join up with the rest and get out of here!!

 Quest Hand-in: Against all odds, here we stand. Still alive, an entire army on our heels.Our ship is waiting. Shall we depart?
Title: Noggle's Last Hope

Description: Blasted!  The antidote didn't work.  Noggle must've been stung by one of the stronger creatures in the far south.

I'm going to need you to go there and get me some more samples, {name}.  The good news is that since their poison is stronger I won't require as many.  The bad news is that there are more kinds of poisonous creatures crawling around the southern area so you'll have to draw from more sources.

 Quest Hand-in: Yes!  It seems to be working, Noggle is coming to.  We owe ya big time!
Title: Get Zherin!

Description: If we're going to get those oil drilling rights, we need to know what the Horde is offering. How can we win if we can't do them one better?!

Their negotiator, Trackmaster Zherin, is up there talking with one of their khans right now. Why don't you head up and persuade him to hand over the Horde's proposal?

You don't have to kill him... we're not savages! Just rough him up a bit.

 Quest Hand-in: What?! How'd they get that much gold to offer?We don't have that kind of money!
Title: Rewritten Wisdoms

Description: {name}, we must help Elder Shaopai. There are few more deserving of our kindness.

On the way here, you surely noticed the scrolls of wisdom hanging in the grotto to the south. The hozen have defiled many of them, and sadly, they are not recoverable. We will deal with the problem directly - burn the defiled scrolls. Wipe the hozen writings away entirely.

Do not worry for Elder Shaopai. The people shall come together and help him rewrite the wisdoms in time. I shall see to that.

 Quest Hand-in: You're a good man, <name>. You have proven that again and again, and I am glad to stand beside you.
Title: Learning the Ropes

Description: Now that you are a pet trainer, it's time to test your skills!

Head out into the valley and pick a fight with a battle pet.  Come back to me after you have won and I will continue your training.  Good luck!

 Quest Hand-in: Nice work, <name>!  You're better with those pets than I thought!
Title: A Gift For Fung

Description: Farmer Fung is pretty mean, and just a little scary. Mah always said that he was one of the best farmers in the valley, though.

I think I know the perfect gift for a mean, kind of scary guy like him.

There's some big plainshawks that circle the hills to the west of here. You should get one, find a big piece of meat, and then ask Kol Ironpaw to grill it up!

 Quest Hand-in: Hey! Where'd you get that? I thought they were out of plainshawk!Andi asked you to get this for me? Huh. Maybe I underestimated that kid.
Title: The Purification of Quel'Delar

Description: The Sunwell and the end of Quel'Delar's exile await, {name}.

You will find Lor'themar Theron, the regent of Quel'Thalas, and Grand Magister Rommath standing within. Be wary of them and do not allow them to entrap you in their political scheming.

Instead, remain focused on your task here. Speak to a Warden of the Sunwell to enter the Sunwell Plateau. Immerse the reformed Quel'Delar in the Sunwell to complete the restoration. Show the blade to Myralion Sunblaze at Quel'Delar's Rest once it is restored.

 Quest Hand-in: Am I truly laying my eyes upon the weapon of Thalorien Dawnseeker? This is a wondrous day for the Sunreavers and for all sin'dorei!
Title: The Return of Baron Geddon

Description: Ragnaros is not the only powerful elemental that has re-emerged into our world.

The dreaded Baron Geddon is leading the onslaught and we must put an end to this rampage.

The Flameseer's Staff has proven powerful.  Perhaps it is powerful enough to weaken him to the point where our arch druids can bind him where he stands.

Go, {name} and be careful.  Baron Geddon is a vengeful and treacherous being.

 Quest Hand-in: Well done, <name>.  We cannot afford to lose any further ground in Hyjal.By stopping Baron Geddon we will have dealt a huge blow to the enemy.
Title: Warchief's Command: Blasted Lands!

Description: All able bodied members of the Horde are hereby ordered to report to Okrilla at Dreadmaul Hold.

Okrilla, commander of the Horde forces at Dreadmaul Hold, requires your help to secure the outpost against rebellious ogres and the forces of the Alliance.

Travel to Dreadmaul Hold by taking the road south from the Swamp of Sorrows.

Destiny calls!

 Quest Hand-in: Our enemies are numerous, <class>. It will take skill and bravery to overcome them all.
Title: Cultivating an Image

Description: Now that we've got the uniform, we've got to get enough information to complete your camouflage.

Raegar brought along this camera to document the team's finds, but I have a different use in mind. I want you to take it with you to Dun Argol and use it to capture the images of iron dwarves.

Of course, your models aren't going to be a cooperative lot, so you may have to, err... subdue them first. Bring back the camera and the images when you're done.

 Quest Hand-in: Good, these should do. Now, to create a kit to pass you off as a convincing iron dwarf.
Title: Ursoc, the Bear God

Description: The time has come, {name}.  Now we will learn whether our efforts will accomplish what we need or nothing at all.

Take these ashes and seek the furbolg that Kodian told you about, Tur Ragepaw, near Ursoc's Den.  You will find the den to the north of Grizzlemaw.

Convince Tur to aid you, for you will need all the help you can get.

Once you've defeated the bear god, use these ashes over his body.

Even if his worldly form is destroyed, his spirit must be saved.

 Quest Hand-in: <The druid looks pale and her eyes stare blankly past you.  She has left a package in anticipation of your return.>
Title: The Shadow Vault

Description: It sounds like you did extremely well. And you secured three very important allies for the Knights of the Ebon Blade in the process.

<Koltira gazes down at the map on the floor.>

You should head back. By now, Baron Sliver and the other death knights will be fighting tooth and nail to hold The Shadow Vault against the might of the Scourge.

I'm sure they'll need your help.

 Quest Hand-in: Good of you to return. As you can see, we have our hands full here.
Title: Call to Arms: Nazjatar

Description: Our objectives in Nazjatar are being interrupted by the influx of Alliance scum.

Clear as many of them out of the area that you find, then report back.

 Quest Hand-in: Good work, <class>.
Title: Fire From the Sky

Description: The remnants of Schnottz's organization persist here on the Maker's Ascent, making the region deadly to any who draw near.

There's plenty of ammunition, but without a good spotter, I'm just firing blind.

Hop in and give me a hand here. Those soldiers won't know what hit them!

 Quest Hand-in: The enemy on Maker's Ascent remain a threat, but with your help we've dealt a serious blow to their numbers and their morale.
Title: Greasing the Wheel

Description: Sorry about that.  I was pretty sure you were one of those spider-beasts, doing a bad {race} impression.

How do you do?  Gidwin Goldbraids, at your service.  I'm in a bit of a hurry back to my caravan, but I was wondering if you might do me one last favor?  My pal Fiona runs a small shop, and she could probably use some of these herbs that grow along the river shore.

I'm thinking if we give her some nice herbs, she'll be MUCH less likely to murder me.  That's the plan, anyway.

 Quest Hand-in: I'll tear that pint-size paladin to shreds before he... wait a minute are those Banshee's Bells?  You brought these for me?Oh, Gidwin asked you to get them for me!  That sweet little guy.  Alright.  He's off the hook for now.
Title: The Problem with Shrinkage

Description: <Having skinned countless creatures, you can't help but notice how much usable leather is lost when the skin is dried and tanned. The Unshackled seem to have a solid understanding of using the material, perhaps Rolm could share some of his insights.>

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, yeah, sorry about that. We are so used to working with these materials, I forgot to explain how to prevent that. See, these beasts are usually underwater all the time, and the air dries them unevenly. When you skin the beast, roll the skin as you harvest it. That'll rehydrate it enough to prevent waste.
Title: Single Firewing Signet

Description: Even the smallest contribution to our cause is noted, {name}.  Our enemies are many, but we shall prevail!

 Quest Hand-in: Yes... Kael's numbers continue to dwindle as our numbers continue to grow.<This quest can be repeated up to Honored reputation.>
Title: A Worthy Weapon

Description: Of all the times to have such rotten luck!

My tournament blade has gone missing.I've heard the bards telling tales of travelers offering winter hyacinths to a lonely maiden in return for gifts. Those hyacinths grow only on the ice flowing from the Ironwall Dam, on Crystalsong Forest's northwestern border with Icecrown. Gather the flowers and take them to the circle of lamps in Drak'Mar Lake in northeastern Dragonblight, near Zul'Drak and Grizzly Hills. Ask the lonely maiden for a worthy blade.

 Quest Hand-in: <The grand champion accepts the Blade of Drak'Mar from you.>A fine weapon, and perfectly balanced. It will serve me well in the next match.
Title: Survey the Lakeshore

Description: All these cruddy ancient ruins have to be bulldozed if we're ever to see Azshara's full potential. Look on my map here - you see Lake Mennar, to the East? I'll tell you what I see: a future rocket fuel depot!

But we need an accurate lay of the land before we can clearcut, bulldoze, landfill, and pave over that lake. All of my surveyors have been spooked off by the oogly-boogleys haunting that area. Escort one of my Jr. grade surveyors to the area and take readings from the equipment that's been set up.

 Quest Hand-in: Beautiful work! Now that we know the area better, we can tear this lake a new one.
Title: Time to Hide

Description: You shouldn't have touched it.  But now that you did, he's going to come looking for you.

And he'll find you.  Unless you hide yourself from him.

Bring me blood from the faceless ones if you want to live!

 Quest Hand-in: What are you waiting for?  You have to rub it on you!Quick!  Or he'll see you!
Title: Beyond the Graves

Description: Darnell tells me that the two of you have already met.  That's good, because I'm sending you both into Deathknell.  Your work is done here.

Speak with Deathguard Saltain in Deathknell, to the north.  He will tell you more of what you must know.

 Quest Hand-in: Those val'kyr have been really busy resurrecting you newbies lately.  I've already seen a couple dozen new bodies run down that hill since this morning.You, however, are the most promising <class> I've seen today.
Title: The Burrowed Bufonid

Description: Have you stopped to watch the bufonids?

A lovely one lurks underwater. Still, patient, unmoving. Wise Bud takes after him. They are much alike. I sense Bud desires to see this large bufonid up close. 

Perhaps the creature can be lured out with some honey from the vespoids here in Zereth Mortis. Would you please gather some?

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you, <name>. Now, let us see if this will entice that bufonid to emerge.
Title: The Honored Ancestors

Description: <A distant voice echoes in your head as you regard the stone statue.>

Do not be startled, stranger. I am Elder Atkanok, an ancient ancestor of the tuskarr people, a skilled craftsman in my own time and the guardian of this quarry for centuries.

The quarry has been overrun, leaving many statues unfinished while the ancestors' spirits wander the world. Will you aid me in righting this wrong?

First, I must know the names of these wandering ancestors. Look for the markers near their statues.

 Quest Hand-in: <Elder Atkanok's voice greets you as you approach his statue.>Well done, <name>. With the names of the wandering elders, we can continue the ceremonies disrupted during the attack. However, before the elders' spirits can be led to their stones, we must calm the spirits of the murdered craftsmen and shaman. Otherwise, the ancestor spirits may never hear the ceremony's call.
Title: Additional Armaments

Description: These druids be lackin' the tools ta properly handle the job out 'ere. I got meself a buddy back at day ol' stag shrine through the portal though. If we were ta be gettin' reunited, we'd sure have some real toys ta use against ol' Ragboy and 'is cronies.

Take some of dem mark things an' go find Matoclaw. Ask her fer Ricket. We need'r here so we can be causin' some real trouble. 

 Quest Hand-in: I was wondering if those two would come in handy. They've seemed quite out of place ever since they arrived.I saw Ricket around here just a moment ago. I'll gladly send her back through the portal with you. She's less likely to be blowing up any local plant life on that side of things anyway.Let's see... where is she...
Title: Welcome to Brewfest!

Description: [PH] Speak to the Brewfest Organizer at the Brewfest Grounds outside of Ironforge and receive a free beer.

 Quest Hand-in: What?! A free beer? Yeah, yeah. I guess we said we'd do that this year.
Title: Wotcher, Watcher?

Description: Thank the Titans! {class}, we need your help!

Primalists attacked only moments ago. My sisters and I were able to defend, but at a severe loss...

There will be time to mourn after my watcher is safe! A group of Primalists broke away while we were fighting and I swear if they hurt our Watcher--

You must help her before it's too late!

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you, <race>. Were it not for your aid, I would have surely perished.
Title: Ruuna's Request

Description: I will not charge you gold for my services, for I can foresee that your actions are necessary and much hinges on what you learn today.

I will, however, ask you to collect a reagent for me.  Obtain gossamer dust from the fern feeder moths northeast of here.  Do this and I will prepare a potion that will take you to the time and place where the events took place that you need to witness.

 Quest Hand-in: Good.  These will do just fine.I will have the potion ready for you in no time at all.
Title: The Corruption of the Jadefire

Description: The cleansing of this forest has been a grueling process. For every success we have achieved, a new challenge has arisen.

The Jadefire satyr have been a constant nuisance. They seek to corrupt the forest just as we seek to cleanse it. Now, we have taken steps to begin eradicating them from Felwood entirely.

Travel to Jadefire Glen to the west and rid the forest of their presence. You'll find the entrance just north of the walls of Deadwood Village; look for their vile banners.

 Quest Hand-in: The Emerald Circle thanks you, <name>. If we all work together here, we can purge these demons from our midst.
Title: Site Salvage

Description: I've worked with many elementals as a shaman, but I've never seen any this aggressive!

The Expedition discovered a titan vault here, but a barrier protects the inner chamber. When we tried to dispel the barrier, I think we triggered some kind of security system... There were suddenly angry elementals everywhere!

Many explorers were working in the dig site when the elementals attacked. Many of them are trapped, and NONE of them are fighters. 

Please go down into the dig site and help them retreat!

 Quest Hand-in: Everyone's safely within our new perimeter. Thank you, <name>.
Title: Built to Fall

Description: The Baruk use the forbidden arts of necromancy to trap souls of fallen mogu into the statues that fight for them. 

These tactics are a disgrace to our people, and cannot be allowed to continue.

Break their precious statues, and give them no vessels with which to contaminate with their stolen spirits.

 Quest Hand-in: As their statues crumble, so too shall their clan.You have performed adequately.
Title: Wrapped Gold Band

Description: <This might be something Emila Bellocq is looking for.>

 Quest Hand-in: Beautiful. I will put this away so it's safe.
Title: Chilled Meat

Description: De beasts of Northrend are big, heavy, and full of meat. Go find sometin' we can feed to the colossi.

 Quest Hand-in: This will work just fine. De Horde thanks you, bruddah.
Title: Proof of Strength: Ancient Branch

Description: This branch is proof of your strength at slaying ancients and your gladiator friend has born witness!

Take the branch back to Jonaa and claim your accolades!

 Quest Hand-in: Ancients here tend to be guardians and tenders, but that does not make them any less dangerous. An enraged ancient is something to be behold. Taking a branch from one is a worthy deed!
Title: Taking a Trip to the Top of the Tank

Description: We cannot risk the reactivation of the Dark Portal. Now is the time for the deathblow.

Thaelin should have figured out how to get that tank working by now. Take him with you, and turn that tank against the Dark Portal itself. We will follow behind you.

 Quest Hand-in: This... I can work with this.
Title: Enlistment Day

Description: You've come to enlist, right?  Normally you'd have to stand in line like the other recruits.  Normally you'd be out of luck because the recruitment ledger's gone missing and I can't process anyone until the new books get here.

Fortunately for you, {name}, I've heard about you and what you did in Outland.  To be honest, you're a cut above these poor saps.  Lines aren't for you.

Go to the barracks and speak to General Arlos.  He'll be more than happy to meet with someone of your caliber.

 Quest Hand-in: We've been expecting your arrival, <name>.  Welcome to Northrend.
Title: A Green Ogron?

Description: Them botani got themselves a green ogron. A green ogron!

I mean I may not know much about plant people but that canno' be a good thing.

Think ya can take it in a fight?

 Quest Hand-in: Is it still twitchin'? I think I saw it still twitchin'.
Title: Orientation: Dragonscale Basecamp

Description: Welcome to basecamp, {name}.

It took Toddy and me awhile to settle on the perfect site to establish camp, but I couldn't be happier with our selection.

Easy access to ruins, proto-dragon breeding grounds, and of course the dragonflights.

Why not take a few minutes to explore the camp and meet some of the suppliers helping to fuel the expedition?

 Quest Hand-in: Met me Granpap, did ye?Well, don't believe all his stories... He loves to brag about the family!
Title: Brutal Boost

Description: The Aggression Formula is ready and I need you to inject Ben'jin with it. 

Let's show the world, and the witch doctor, that well researched, dramatically overpowered, double-blind, peer-reviewed, super goblin science is the right way to do, uh, pretty much anything!

 Quest Hand-in: I spent several moments working out that formula! It should have worked! The reason these brutosaurs are endangered is clearly their unreasonable resistance to science!
Title: Rekindling an Old Flame

Description: I am dying, {race}. My flame, it smolders... soon my light will flicker and fade into nothing.

You mustn't allow this. Retrieve for me the Essence of Flame. Allow me to live another day and I will burn every breaker to ash, I swear it.

I will take vengeance for my brothers and sisters.

 Quest Hand-in: The flames, they burn within me!
Title: Land's End

Description: Psst! Hey! Come closer, you fool, you expect me to read your mind or--oh. Come closer anyway!

You've done a wonderful job advancing the agenda of Gnomeregan here, friend! And an amazing job of pretending you were only in it for the coin, simply splendid. But now Kelsey Steelspark could use more of your direct help.

She's moved on yet again...she asked me to tell you to meet her far south, at Land's End Beach. I wouldn't keep her waiting, either!

 Quest Hand-in: I'm amazed that Soothfancy was capable of following a simple set of instructions. And ones that required him to keep his foolish mouth silenced as well.In addition, it is honestly good to see you again, <name>. Now that I've dropped the charade, you'll get to see how gnomes get things done around here.
Title: Forfeit Souls

Description: The tidesages here have given in to dark magics. They have submitted themselves to powers they do not understand, and my people have suffered for it.

I knew them once, my brothers and sisters in the tides. But now they are lost.

I guess I am too.

Redeem the name of the tidesages! Kill these betrayers!

 Quest Hand-in: It didn't feel good to ask that of you, <name>. But it was right.
Title: WANTED: Foreman Wellson

Description: Foreman Wellson has been a pain in our side since we got here.  His shipyard holds a large amount of supplies that would be extremely useful to us... if we could get to them.

He keeps a close watch over his minions and makes it very difficult for us to get a foothold on the shipyard.  I need you to take out Wellson for good this time.  Be careful {name}, we have been receiving reports of dirty Alliance all around the area.

 Quest Hand-in: Great work <name>.  I will report your efforts to our highest in command immediately.
Title: A Timely Invitation

Description: The time has arrived to remember the past and celebrate our adventures across Azeroth and Beyond. 

To commemorate the occasion the Bronze Dragonflight is throwing a celebration and you are invited! 

Come to the Caverns of Time and present this ticket to gain entry to the party!

 Quest Hand-in: Welcome! It's that special time of year when the bronze dragonflight celebrates all that has happened over the years and you, <name>, are the guest of honor!Come celebrate at the grand feast, get down at the "Disco of Time", or accept a quest to fend off some of Azeroth's greatest threats.
Title: Waking the Shieldmaiden

Description: With the rituals disrupted and her bones returned, we may be able to wrest Ashildir from the grasp of these Bonespeakers.

Deeper within Haustvald, the mystics possess a special altar that can reunite the body and spirit of a fallen warrior. With this, we may be able to return Ashildir's spirit into her bones, and out of the grasp of these foul mystics.

Go outsider, I will rally her guard.

 Quest Hand-in: Where... where am I now? I... know you...
Title: Proving Teamwork

Description: I am intrigued by how much mortals like you thrive on conflict. I am told there are others like yourself that combat each other in predetermined teams. Seek out some other mortals to join with to attempt this challenge.

Let us see what you can prove, then return to me.

 Quest Hand-in: I am surprised you were successful in this task. I suppose you have earned these.
Title: The Battle for Andorhal

Description: I just got word, lad.  It doesn't sound good.

The city of Andorhal is in the middle of a three-way war between the Forsaken, the Alliance, and the Scourge.  King Wrynn has rolled the dice and sent a death knight to lead the charge for his cause, but I'm sure he can use all the help he can get.

I hate to see you go, but they've asked for you by name, {name}.  Speak with Guthrum Thunderfist outside.  He'll put you on the first gryphon out to Andorhal.

 Quest Hand-in: It's about time you arrived, <class>.
Title: A Short Fuse

Description: As you light the fuse, you notice that it is consumed by fire far quicker than you would expect.

The bombs are about to go off and your best chance at surviving is to lean towards the pit and hope the fall doesn't kill you.

 Quest Hand-in: This pulsing object is covered in a thick layer of ice.  It shimmers strangely beneath the water.
Title: Platform Adjustments

Description: It seems the last of the arcane disruption is up here. 

I'll continue adjusting the ley energies. Use some of the arcana you recovered to dispel the disruptions here.

 Quest Hand-in: Fine work! I can feel the ley lines beneath this place beginning to heal. We're almost done.
Title: The Hermit

Description: I've been told there's signs of activity at Beggar's Haunt. People have reported seeing lights in the tower to the east of town.

Few would be bold enough to stay that close to Deadwind Pass. You're the first to report since I've learned about this; go check it out and make sure whatever's in there is human.

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, welcome, stranger. I'd offer you something, but there's not much here...Could I beg you to run some errands for a poor old hermit?
Title: Wrecking the Wreck

Description: To dislodge the alliance ship, we need to find our engineer. He parted ways with us when we were escaping the wreckage.

You should be able to find him somewhere in the western forest. Tell him Korga sent you and he'll get in line to help.

 Quest Hand-in: Korga sent you, eh? Well, I wouldn't mind doing a number on that ship for my own reasons anyway, but it's going to take some work.Give me a moment to think...
Title: WANTED: Ayame

Description: Well equipped exterminator wanted.

Huge snake seen lurking north of Fort Victory. 

Reward offered for anyone who brings in the head of the pest.

-Garrick Blacksteel

 Quest Hand-in: Ah! Good! I've nae been able ta sleep a wink since I first saw this thing!Here's ye reward, ye earned it!
Title: Calling All Competitors!

Description: The Artisan's Consortium has struck a deal with the quartermasters of the Gladiator's Refuge!

In addition to the usual selection of powerful combat equipment they offer, worthy combatants can now purchase tokens that can be used in Crafting Orders or one's own crafts to certify the equipment for use in battlegrounds and arenas!

Present this flier to Calderax to receive two complimentary Trophies of Conquest, on us!

- Rabul

 Quest Hand-in: Hm, they sure know how to reach their audience.Here are your trophies as promised. Use these when crafting your own equipment or submitting Crafting Orders and the gear will be comparable in power to what I offer. It is perfect if you are looking for something highly specific or imbued with a certain embellishment... and are willing to put in some extra work.Questions? Take them to the Artisan's Market.
Title: Walls Have Ears

Description: Yazma, mistress of spies.

Bah! A traitor who is into creepy crawlies. She chose to side with Zul, and she uses de children of her loa, Shadra, to watch and track everything we do.

We have to kill all de spiders we see, or dat traitor Yazma will know every move we make.

 Quest Hand-in: Well done. Dat should blind Yazma.
Title: Ellia Ravenmane

Description: We regularly organize one-on-one duels with trainees that we think are well-suited for one another. We have found one such trainee for you, {name}.

Her name is Ellia Ravenmane. This will be her first duel, too. She will be waiting for you at the pavilion just to the south of here.

 Quest Hand-in: Very good!The next time you return, you will face a new challenger. Continue winning, and your favor in the eyes of Chi-Ji will increase.
Title: A Flash of Bronze...

Description: As you survey the devastation of the vale, a flash of bronze catches your eye. Unless you're mistaken, a tiny gnome is trying to catch your attention from the balcony above Mogu'shan Palace, just outside of the Seat of Knowledge.

You should see what she wants.

 Quest Hand-in: <The tiny gnome's eyes reflect the light with a copper sheen. She is not what she seems.><name>! I have been waiting for you. The bronze dragonflight has need of your services.
Title: The White Turnip Treatment

Description: Grandpa often told me to "Keep my drawers clean and my dirt cleaner." It sounds like a joke, but he makes a good point.

Vegetables tend to leave behind bits of root that can contaminate your soil... but a nice, big, white turnip will clean that gunk right up. Think you could plant a white turnip for me?

 Quest Hand-in: Look at that dirt. Practically sparkling.Grandpa would be proud.
Title: The Land, Corrupted

Description: The cliff giants of Feralas are extensions of the earth itself, {name}. When nature thrives, they are benevolent protectors and peaceful guardians.

But as the forest is tainted, so too are they.

If the corruption has spread to them, they will lash out at the wildlife and their own kind, causing great destruction. You must destroy any corrupted giants you come across.

 Quest Hand-in: The spirits of these guardians will return in time, <name>. You've freed them to move on in nature's cycle.Now it falls to us to make sure that cycle is free of corruption and needless suffering.
Title: The Tainted Marsh

Description: I wasn't able to scout inside the village yet, however, there are more dangerous experiments going on to the south. They were befouling the unquiet spirits in the marshlands with more fel magic!

I will rework this fel totem to draw out the fel energies they infused in those spirits.

Please, cure what spirits you can, perhaps it will even give them some peace.

If you want, I can even send you there!

 Quest Hand-in: You've done those souls a great favor. I hope they find peace.Let's cut off these experiments at the source now.
Title: To Catch a Banshee

Description: The strange-talking vrykul said I might be able to meet you here. I have orders from Greymane.  It seems he may have a lead on Sylvanas' location.

He's set up a camp near the base of the mountain. We've run into some troubles, though. It looks like the Horde may have homed in on our position.

We could use your help. You can take my gryphon. Just speak to me when you're ready to leave.

 Quest Hand-in: It is good you arrived when you did, <name>.
Title: I Take No Pleasure In This

Description: I knew that Gallywix was selfish and wasteful, but this... this is too much.

His bloated pride has blacked out the sun of good leadership. He hoards the wealth of his people to satiate his gluttony, greed, and lust while his people toil under his calloused heel.

And, maybe worse, opportunistic socialites from all across the Horde revel in the depravity.

All people of Azeroth deserve better than this. We must teach these spoiled cowards a lesson.

 Quest Hand-in: I won't pretend that this will solve all of the goblins' problems, but it does feel good to bring a little justice to these pompous parasites.
Title: Secrets Lost, Forever?

Description: <With the ancient Lin family noodle soup recipe in hand, you decide to set out for the Halfhill Market.>

<If anyone in Pandaria knows how to decipher this scroll, it's Sungshin Ironpaw.>

 Quest Hand-in: Hello, <name>. What is it you have there?
Title: Toshe's Vengeance

Description: You met Toshe back in Damplight Cavern, didn't you? He followed some of the fleeing naga to a set of ruins to the east and then sent for help.

Find Toshe at the ruins as soon as you can. If you find out anything about what the naga want, please let us know.

 Quest Hand-in: I remember you. You were there when they attacked us back in the cave.Good to have you with me, <class>. Ready for a little vengeance?
Title: Hero's Call: Outland!

Description: By order of his royal highness, King Anduin Wrynn, all able-bodied citizens of the Alliance are to report to Commander Duron in Hellfire Peninsula.

The expeditionary forces require your help to overcome the demonic armies of the Burning Legion! Talk to the Honor Hold Mage in the tall tower in the Mage District to travel to Blasted Lands, then walk through the Dark Portal to arrive at the Stair of Destiny.

For the glory and honor of the Alliance!

 Quest Hand-in: The expedition needs your help, <class>.
Title: WANTED: The Warlord's Treatise

Description: While it is known that Warlord Kalithresh of the naga is a great warrior in his own right, there are fewer who know that he has codified all of his knowledge.

One of my customers is aware of it though, and is keenly interested in obtaining his treatise.

I ask that you travel to the Steamvault in Coilfang Reservoir and obtain this book for me.

 Quest Hand-in: Indeed, I fear my customer will not have time to peruse the entirety of this book. Nevertheless, that is not our concern.  Here is your reward.Come back tomorrow and I will have another request for you to fulfill.
Title: Legacy of Nar'anan

Description: Hey there, {race}. Mind helping me out?

You see, I found these pylons here and it seems they contain memories from a notable Highborne who lived here long ago.

I can't get any closer to the rest of em' because of the snapdragons. Especially the terrormaws...

Can you go and activate the pylons for me? We Tortollans love old things, and this is a potential goldmine!

Oh, and be sure to write down what you see!

 Quest Hand-in: Let me see what you got. <Collector Kojo reads your notes... slowly>I think we may have just found the origin of Snapdragons! Let's see what else we can learn.
Title: By the Light of the Stars

Description: Look at this, {name}.

<Harrison holds up the dead scout's goggles.>

I tightened the clamp in the middle and crimped the wires on the edges. They may not be the most comfortable, but they should hold together.

If I've translated your tablets correctly, there's something hidden here - a final piece to our puzzle.

I hope your spectacles hold the key.

Let me know what you find!

 Quest Hand-in: Well, kid, it looks like you've done it again.<Harrison points to an image on the tablets.>This starlight is exactly what we were missing.Now we can get to work!
Title: The Tortured Earth

Description: Bring up the usurper. You will find him. Follow earthen path. First you put to rest tortured earth spirits. Must sleep once more.

<Gordawg smashes his fist into the ground and brings up very foul smelling soil.>

Must sleep!

<Gordawg points southeast.>

Find spirits near mountains. Near hills. Near rocks. Near earth.

Put to sleep.

Telaari Basin... Southeast.


 Quest Hand-in: <Gordawg nods in approval.>Good. Spirits sleep now.
Title: Tear of the Earthmother

Description: The sword's enchantments must be contained within a powerful focus, such as a gem. I know of a gem that we can use for this purpose, for there are few that can play host to such powerful magics without shattering.

The gem we need is called the tear of the earthmother. It's a powerful artifact in the hands of the ogres who created it, and Warbringer O'mrogg, who currently holds the gem, has many powerful allies in Hellfire Citadel's Shattered Halls. Take care in retrieving the tear, {name}.

 Quest Hand-in: <David Wayne holds the gem up, to the light, admiring it.>It's absolutely flawless, and that's exactly what we'll need. A flawed gem would endanger the weapon's wielder, twisting the magic against them.
Title: Audrey Burnhep

Description: Greetings, {name}! My name is Audrey Burnhep. I've been hearing quite a lot about you recently. You're becoming quite the tamer!

You should come speak with me in Stormwind. I have connections with some of the finest tamers in all of Azeroth, and I can help you grow even more!

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, you're <name>. Splendid! Let's get to work then, shall we?
Title: Shape Your Fate

Description: The whims of the spirits can be guided, I have seen it.

There were whispers of an item, a way to change the path of destiny.  I heard dem, and I went looking.  For many years I listened to those whispers on the wind until one day they showed me the way.  This is what I offer you.  It will take some time, and some valuable resources, but I can perform the ritual to allow you to control this power.

Well?  Are you ready?

 Quest Hand-in: The ritual has begun. This will take some time. Return later.
Title: Vile Idolatry

Description: With our leadership in ruin, we are left open to attacks from all sides. The foul Murkblood tribe could not have picked a better time to attack us!

In recent days, we have been subject to no less than 5 assaults from the Broken. They have even taken over our only other territorial holding in the area: Sunspring Post.

We must strike and show them that we are not powerless! Strike down the vile idolaters and bring me their twisted idols of worship so that they may ride the lightning.

 Quest Hand-in: You have given the Lightning Sons hope, <name>. If our leader will not protect us, perhaps there are others that are capable - like you.
Title: Tapping the Breach

Description: We had thought the Twilight's Hammer's presence in Darkshore was snuffed out with the defeat of Deathwing. Apparently, we were mistaken.

Remnants of their cult have used the conflict in Darkshore as an opportunity to re-establish their presence here. Darkshore is home to several breaches of elemental power, and it looks like they aim to use these to unleash powerful elementals to devastate the land.

This must not stand.

 Quest Hand-in: You have saved countless lives today. For this I am greatful.Still, I'm afraid this won't be the last we will see of the Twilight's Hammer. We must be ever vigilant.
Title: No Problem Too Small

Description: These problems might seem small, but they will eat away at the Horde over time if they remain unaddressed. 

We must offer our help. 

The vulpera are skilled at solving problems, no matter their size.

I will investigate the outpost. Nisha and Meerah will see to the others.

Meet me in the Twilight Highlands when you're ready.

 Quest Hand-in: Abandoned, just like Commander Dresh said.
Title: Filling Our Pockets

Description: We've looted everything that isn't bolted down around here, but I'm not done yet. If we're bothering to do the Steamwheedle Cartel's dirty work for them, we're going to make as much cash as we can while we're here.

I haven't seen many earrings on these pirates, so the gold must be in the next best place...their teeth. The Southsea musketeers and strongarms to the south are the higher-ups here; they'll be the ones with the adornment. Bring me back a good fistful of gold fillings.

 Quest Hand-in: Nice!  Remember, gold is gold, no matter who's mouth, nose, or otherwise it's been in.It's all perfectly sanitary after being melted down anyway. Or at least wiped off.
Title: Uncovering the Past

Description: Interested in being a Lorewalker? There is lots of digging and reading and digging and more reading.

I have entire days where I stare at a broken vase trying to figure out how it goes back together.

Should give it a try. Go solve one artifact of Pandaria and we will appreciate you sharing the knowledge of how you did it.

 Quest Hand-in: Wow! You got the pieces to meld together so well. The quality of this restoration is amazing.How did you do it?
Title: All That Skitters

Description: There's somethin' I've noticed up there... Jintha'Alor's full of spiders. Small ones about as big as yer hand. Not an unusual sight for the Hinterlands, but somethin's amiss.

To be honest, I don't trust the trolls to keep pets. They're up to somethin'. I need you to bring me some of those spiders. Keep 'em alive if you can, and we'll see what the spirits tell me...

 Quest Hand-in: By Kurdan's beard... these don't look like any spiders I've seen before. Dark magic's at work here.
Title: Sandscar Breach

Description: I heard some mutterings about sand and snakes.

The plea comes from a tiny village on the very fringes of Zuldazar- hardly more than a few farms. Dol-something I think it was called. Don't know what they be calling it now. Go see what the fuss is about.

Bladeguard Sonji was sent ahead some time ago. She should be able to get you up to speed on that... situation.

 Quest Hand-in: Rastakhan finally sent someone!I hope you not be afraid of snakes, mon.
Title: A Champion Rises

Description: You have earned my respect and the respect of your peers. You defeated all who challenged you and mastered the ways of tournament combat. I have no doubt that you are ready to face down the champions of other cities for the glory of Orgrimmar!

Justicar Mariel Trueheart has asked to speak with you, {name}, and to formally enter you in the champions' grand melee.

 Quest Hand-in: I welcome you as a champion of the tournament, <name>. As a champion, you will be able to compete for the grand championship of the tournament. You may also choose to become a valiant with another Horde city's delegation and in time, a champion for that city as well.All champions must have the assistance of a squire, <name>, and you are no exception. Allow me to appoint one of ours to accompany you in battle. He will proudly carry the banner of any city that has named you a champion.
Title: Cracked Numeric Cylinder

Description: <R33-DR is looking for this item.>

 Quest Hand-in: Data successfully purged.
Title: Gloomshade Game Hunter

Description: <You find a list on a piece of parchment.

Arsenio needs some ingredients for a new recipe he's preparing at your garrison.>

 Quest Hand-in: Nice! Thanks so much! I can use these to make a delicious wolf meat, frog leg, mushroom stew.
Title: Delivery to the North Sanctum

Description: I'm pleased to discover that you're at least somewhat competent, {name}.  I'll give you another task since you seem so eager to prove yourself.

This is a letter to Ley-Keeper Caidanis, the arcanist in charge of the upkeep of the North Sanctum.  Go southwest of Falconwing Square  and you will find him.  He is a very important person, so I hope you don't bother him too much with trivial chatter.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you, <name>.  I've been expecting this letter.
Title: WANTED: Giselda the Crone

Description: Wanted: Dead or Alive

Giselda the Crone of Kil'sorrow and her lackeys for murder, ritual sacrifice, communing with the Legion, kidnapping, and burglary.

Known to congregate at Kil'sorrow Fortress in southeastern Nagrand, near the border of Terokkar.

Large gold reward to be dispensed by Warden Moi'bff Jill at Telaar to anyone able to bring Giselda to justice.

 Quest Hand-in: The crone has been slain! This is wonderful news, <name>. Here is your reward.
Title: Cleaning House

Description: Not long ago, a new recruit showed up by the name o' Jacob Anders. He's been trouble since he got here, always drinkin' and pickin' fights, but he crossed the line this time.

One o' our patrols spotted him tradin' intel with the Horde - he's a traitor, commander! I thought ye would want tae deal with him personally.

He was out drinkin' by the water last time I saw him, and I'd bet me pappy's beard he's still there.

 Quest Hand-in: I think ye did the right thing, commander.
Title: Lapidary Lessons

Description: It's good to see you again, {name}.

It seems we've both been busy since last we spoke. I have something that you may be interested in.

A recent shipment of rare jewels called maelstrom sapphires have finally arrived here at the shop.

I came up with a beautiful design for them and would like to show you how to cut them into something useful.

 Quest Hand-in: <Tiffany looks over the gem and nods her head.>Very good work, <name>. It seems your skills have improved since the last time you cut something for me.Enjoy that design, it's one of my finest.
Title: The Last Eggtender

Description: I understand your concern, {class}, but all will be rectified shortly as it seems that we are about to have company. 

Feel free to stay and witness what transpires. It should be quite cathartic.

Do speak with our egg tender when you have a moment, though. She will no doubt need the support.

 Quest Hand-in: Can you believe it?
Title: Watch Yer Back

Description: Aegrim, you say? Bulwark of the Mountain King? Well, if we are going to start anywhere, it has to be Aegrim's study. The entrance lies below us in the depths of Old Ironforge.

The only trouble is the troggs in our way. How about you take the lead?

 Quest Hand-in: The guards will tend to sealing the tunnels. We have important work to do.
Title: Wing Clip

Description: The young fliers of this era are fascinating. Their exceptional agility and endurance were, in my time, the feats of incredibly skilled or mature fliers.

This would seem to indicate some kind of evolution in wing structure... Or perhaps a result of advancements in training? Induced genetic mutation? Selective breeding?

Gah! There's no way to know for certain without tissue samples.

Bring me their wings! And try not to ruin them in the process, will you? I need them intact!

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent, these are in fine shape.
Title: Hero's Call: Spires of Arak!

Description: All able-bodied citizens of the Alliance are to report to Azik in Spires of Arak.

There have been wingless arakkoa seen fleeing from Spires of Arak. Rumors suggest that they are running from an Iron Horde superweapon.

We need to find out what is causing them to leave their homeland, and why their wings have withered.

Glory to the Alliance!

 Quest Hand-in: <Azik looks you up and down.>Azik is betting you are someone of importance to your people.Come closer, friend. Azik could use your help.
Title: Delicate Enchantments

Description: As I'm sure you've noticed, demons have taken over the vale. Their arrival has forced many of my fellow druids to flee their homes, but I refuse to go down without a fight.

Despite all this, I'm happy to provide enchantments for your weapons, but you should know that it is a delicate process that takes time and concentration, something I have little of lately.

If you're willing to shelter me from attackers, I will certainly do my best to enchant your weapons.

 Quest Hand-in: I'd get a lot more work done if I could convince you to stay, but I know you have pressing matters elsewhere.
Title: Waste of Thyme

Description: Living Ire Thyme. I must have more! Be quick about it, will you?

 Quest Hand-in: Perfect. It's quite interesting how useful the most random things end up being to incantations of this sort.So much more to learn!
Title: To the Garrison

Description: My father is avenged. The sons of the Iron Wolf are all slain.

Go to the garrison your people are constructing in the south. There, herald my return to my laggard brother.

The time has come for the "chieftain" to be reminded of what it means to be a Frostwolf.

 Quest Hand-in: Ga'nar is coming. Good. We need his forces if we are to press the advantage.I can only hope his bloodlust has quelled enough for him to listen to reason.
Title: The Return of Twilight

Description: The Twilight's Hammer has reemerged and they are building an army to overthrow my kingdom. A ludicrous fantasy on their part, but one that I cannot take lightly.

I cannot offer the mortal races my aid until the threat to Deepholm has been dealt with. If you truly wish to unite the Elemental Lords to your cause, I would see you prove it.

Go. Uncover the plot that the Twilight's Hammer is hatching and put an end to their scheme!

 Quest Hand-in: It is good that you have arrived, Farseer <name>. The Twilight's Hammer has built a formidable stronghold here in Deepholm.
Title: Return to the High Commander

Description: Return to High Commander Halford Wyrmbane at once, {name}. Let him know that your mission was a success and that the few remaining villagers that were rescued are back to work.

 Quest Hand-in: <Halford salutes.>The townsfolk are all back to work? Already? Outstanding, soldier! We'll get this town built back up and fortified in no time. Before long, reinforcements will be ready to join the fight with Lord Fordragon at the Wrathgate.I'm getting ahead of myself, of course, as there is much left to do here before we can even think about sending you to the aid of Bolvar.
Title: A Place of Refuge

Description: Our next priority is to catch up with the others who fled during Bovan's stand. Hopefully, Bovan and the other braves have regrouped with them.

This Tomul says the most likely place the tauren would seek refuge is an abandoned village to the southeast. 

While her reasoning is sound, this is also the perfect location for a trap.

{name}, I know you vouch for her, so I will give her the benefit of the doubt.

Let us hope your trust in her is not misplaced.

 Quest Hand-in: The good news is that we have found the other tauren.The bad news is that this Bovan he seeks isn't here.The irritating news is that everyone wants me dead.
Title: The Smallest Creatures

Description: The ogres, simple as they are, would notice you dispersing this poison throughout their camp. Thus, I will teach you how to enlist the help of one of nature's smallest creatures to do this task.

By playing a simple rhythm on this drum, you can coax a marmot to follow your commands.

There is a den of marmots near the Bloodmaul camp, to the north, down in the Daggermaw Canyon past the Circle of Blood.

Once you have a marmot's aid, use it to disperse the poison to the Bloodmaul's kegs.

 Quest Hand-in: For many long years I have concentrated my efforts on perfecting the ways of communicating with nature. This is but a small part of the untapped potential that beasts can bring to you.
Title: Echolocation

Description: Glad you're here! These bats have got to get up and start giving us some more air support.

I've got a draft of a flight plan here in Darkshore. It's helped by the fact that our bats can see in the dark, when most of us can't.

Talk to Avery and she'll make sure you get safely back to Bashal'Aran.

 Quest Hand-in: Well done. These bats will help us win the battle of the skies.
Title: Phaestus, Genesis of Aeons

Description: Sika reports the Forsworn are widespread. They not only took over production, but the rise as well!
