In the meantime, their chief gave me this to pass on to you - a map and a message in some fancy script.

Do what you must, but be quick about it.

War is brewing...

 Quest Hand-in: Greetings, <name>!Welcome to Dawn's Blossom, a home of my people.Sadly I must depart. Alas, a Lorewalker's work is never done.Make yourself at home. Our people could surely make use of one with your talents.
Title: Need More Science

Description: <Clubnik wipes away a tear, then juts his chin out with determination.>

Never again, {name}! No bulldozer deserves the fate of my Margene. We're going to need some industrial ghostproofing. This is a job for our top scientists, and I know just the woman for the job! Look for Assistant Greely at the Southern Rocketway Terminus. She's the administrator for Azshara's world-famous Secret Lab, and she owes me a favor.

 Quest Hand-in: What is Clubnik talking about? Haunted construction equipment? Does it look like I have time for ghost stories?I've got a laboratory in the middle of a meltdown, fires burning, animals mutated, and worst of all - projects falling behind schedule. Help!
Title: The Folly of Envy

Description: <Alwin points at a venthyr on the ledge above.

He lets out a slight, low rumble.>

 Quest Hand-in: Could it really be? The object of our long search...
Title: Clefthoof Training: Moth of Wrath

Description: Deep in the forests of Nagrand are some beasts capable of evading almost any predator. The greatest of them all, the Moth of Wrath, is coated with a foul-smelling dust.

If the moth dust is enough to keep wolves at bay, it will probably be a pretty good test for your clefthoof. See if you can keep it focused and defeat the moth.

 Quest Hand-in: Glad to see you back. I will need some time to brush that dust off of your mount.
Title: Return to the Stead

Description: You carefully close the spigot in the control panel, watching the cauldron's putrid ichors drip into the empty bottle.

With the poison in hand, it is time to return to Field Agent Kaartish at the Menders' Stead.

 Quest Hand-in: Good work.  One moment please...<The draenei takes a moment to compare your sample with a sample he presumably had distilled earlier.>Yes, this appears to be the same corruption that is affecting the wildlife.  With this knowledge, and with your combat expertise, we may have the power to stop this.
Title: Action This Day

Description: Two of the Horde's strongest warriors have led a charge to try and capture our fleet. We cannot allow this, {name}.

If they take our ships, they will use them to sail to Darnassus!

Slay the two warriors leading the attack, and the rest of them will give up the fight.

 Quest Hand-in: Have you heard from Malfurion recently?
Title: The Kul Tiras Campaign

Description: Our enemy spreads its influence throughout Kul Tiras, recruiting new allies to fight against the Horde.

We must establish footholds in these enemy lands if we are to win this war.

The Warchief requires your assistance in securing outposts in Stormsong Valley, Drustvar, and Tiragarde Sound.

Which location shall we secure first?

 Quest Hand-in: You have the Queen's trust. For now.
Title: Frozen Solid

Description: The breath of a frost wyrm can freeze even its largest foes in an instant. Our forces, unfortunately, have experienced this firsthand.

Their advance toward the citadel has come to a halt. I fear we may lose our foothold unless we act quickly.

Take this potion and use it to free our forces from their frigid bonds. Light be with you.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent work, <name>. We will see to it they recover in safety.
Title: Homegrown Help

Description: Every good party herald needs an assistant. Which is why I have you!

But every good party herald's assistant... also needs an assistant.

Which is why I procured permission from the prince for you to create your own dredger butler. We can start him on security while we cozy up to the guests and procure the necessary reading materials to train him on the social protocols of the different realms. He'll be entertaining the whole court in no time. 

No, don't thank me. You've earned this!

 Quest Hand-in: You ready to get your hands dirty?Makin' dredgers ain't pretty work.
Title: The Wilds of Feralas

Description: You are truly brave to help us protect these lands, hero. If you wish to do more for the wilds, there are others in need of your aid.

The verdant forests of Feralas lie to the south. There, in the shade of the mighty Twin Colossals, you must seek out Telaron Windflight. At Dreamer's Rest, he and his fellow druids of the talon have found signs of a disturbing illness.

They will need your help, {class}. Go in peace.

 Quest Hand-in: Welcome to Feralas, <class>. I thank you for coming to assist us.
Title: Do It the Azerite Way

Description: Incredible! Ye stopped the wound from spreadin' before it could get out o' control!

Nordrassil should be safe again, fer now. This is a good sign that we may just be able tae reverse all the damage done tae Azeroth.

Let's get back tae the Chamber o' Heart, an' see if we can put any o' that azerite ye absorbed tae good use.

 Quest Hand-in: Additional azerite available for Heart of Azeroth. Activating now.
Title: Training Our Forces

Description: I have yet more troops for you to train, and there are plenty of things to do right here in our domain. 

Take them out and give them a good, solid, and probably bloody taste of what we're up against.

Now, if you get them killed? That's none of my business.

<Sakaa sips a thick and sweet-smelling beverage.>

 Quest Hand-in: Well, it looks like you drilled some good experience into this one today. Only a few broken bones!
Title: Revenge is Tasty

Description: I'm providing the catering for some unusual party guests tonight.  One of these fellows was flying around in Skettis and got knocked to the ground by a monstrous kaliri--his leg was broken badly.

They've requested something special for his get well party: Kaliri Stew.

I can loan you my cooking pot so you can whip up a batch of stew for me.  The recipe itself is simple, but you'll need to get a giant kaliri wing and some cooked warp burgers.

 Quest Hand-in: Oh, I do smell something tasty!  I hope you gave that bird quite a good beating.Please, help yourself to some of my extra stock.  I'm sure someone of your talent could put it to good use.
Title: Preparing for the Worst

Description: Dark times are upon us.  Karkut's spirit walks the earth and gathers the spirits of dead tuskarr.

The sons of the mist have taken many of our brethren.  Soon dear Kaskala will be reduced to ashes.

There is hope yet.  Not for us perhaps, but we've sent our families to Unu'pe.  We fight here so there may be a future for them.

They will need supplies or they will starve.  There's not enough food in Unu'pe.  Salvage any supplies before it's too late for our families.

 Quest Hand-in: I thank you, <name>.  These supplies will feed our cousins and children.  Even if Kaskala falls, our tribes must carry on.
Title: Alpha Worg

Description: When you've eaten Talonshrike's eyes, you should be able see Garwal and rip out his throat!

{race}-thing, seek out and slay Garwal in the western Rivenwood. After you have killed him, go and tell Mistwalker that I am once more the alpha worg!

 Quest Hand-in: Garwal was not a worg at all! I know of these creatures... they are called worgen.But, Ulfang indicated that it came south from the Grizzly Hills? Odd. There aren't any worgen there.I thank you for helping to restore Ulfang to his proper place amongst his pack. Now we both will be able to sleep peacefully.Please, you must accept this as a sign of gratitude.
Title: Prying Eyes

Description: The Constructs would repurpose the carcass of our necropolis. But we will need its parts for our own ends.

Let us deliver a warning to these scavengers.

Slay the Constructs amid our wreckage. Pluck the eyes from their skulls. Such is our signature.

They will know to fear the darkness once more.

 Quest Hand-in: I see cowardice in these eyes. You have done well.
Title: Blueprint: Scrap Trap

Description: <This blueprint details how to build what appears to be some sort of land mine using little more than scrap metal.

You should be able to upload the blueprint to Pascal-K1N6's database in Rustbolt.>

 Quest Hand-in: Have you recovered a new blueprint, my fleshy friend?I will add it to my database posthaste.
Title: Shields Down!

Description: Did you hear that? They got the shield up. There'll be no getting into Telaar now.

You must get that shield down. The only way to do it is to destroy the Arkonite crystal.

Don't worry about me. You're going to kill two birds with one stone; Packleader Kargora is the one who stole your blueprints.

 Quest Hand-in: Perfect! You retrieved the blueprints.There's only one thing left to do.
Title: The Mantle Returned

Description: The Mantle of the Primus...

I can hardly believe it. That Gharmal possessed it. That they did not use it against us. That we reclaimed it.

This could prove vital toward our efforts to restore Maldraxxus. We must return it to Baroness Draka at the Seat of the Primus immediately.

 Quest Hand-in: I'll send scouts to continue the search, but this... this is a huge boon for us.
Title: The Rod of Lianthe

Description: The totem alone is not strong enough to counteract the sinister magics of the dark conclave.

We can combine it with other objects of power, forming a staff to focus the energies. We cannot rescue my brethren from the depths of their depravity, but we can stop them.

One of the items I need for the staff is the Rod of Lianthe, held by the blood elves at Eclipse Point to the southeast. It is kept in a pavilion on the top tier of the ruins and will be heavily guarded. Use caution, {name}.

 Quest Hand-in: Well done. Such a treasure deserves better than to be shut away in a dark chest. We shall see it used for a worthy purpose.
Title: Finding a Witness

Description: You have rescued two of our allies from Torghast, but Anduin and Thrall have yet to be found.

That tower's corridors are vast... seemingly endless. You could spend an eternity wandering those unholy halls.

In your expeditions, you have encountered many unfortunate prisoners. Perhaps one of them has seen or heard something that could guide our search.

Seek out any captives that might have the information we need, {name}.

 Quest Hand-in: I am heartened to know that Thrall yet lives. By the Light, we will find him.I fear for Anduin. Darkness hungers for his soul.We must make ready. You will hear from me when it is time to proceed.
Title: Vul'gath's End

Description: Vul'gath's time has come to an end, {name}. My daughter's blood is upon his hands, now his blood will be on ours!

Show no mercy and strike him down!

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you,<name>.I wish we could bring him back just to kill him again but I guess this will suffice.I hope the spirit of my little one will now know peace.
Title: Breaking the Seal

Description: <As you behold the relic, Thalyssra's voice echoes in your mind.>

You found it! But it is sealed away tight.

Search the room for a way to break those seals.

 Quest Hand-in: <As the magical barrier begins to fade, you hear the rustling of leaves and the clattering of mandibles just outside.>
Title: The Absolution of Souls

Description: Do you not yet understand the purpose of Revendreth, Maw Walker?

The souls under our care teeter on the brink of permanent damnation. Even with perfect attention and careful processing, not every soul can escape the Maw and be elevated to a higher destiny.

That is true under the best of circumstances.

Currently, due to your installation of the Chamberlain at the Halls of Atonement, we're instead witnessing the worst of circumstances.

We must return to the Halls of Atonement and enforce order.

 Quest Hand-in: It is worse than I feared.
Title: Rhino Mastery: The Kill

Description: Now that we know where to find Farunn, all that remains is the battle against the great beast. Are you ready to take on this rhino, {name}? For all the spirit's blustering, I'm certain it was telling the truth about the beast's strength.

When you're ready to face him, head north past the Suntouched Pillar and look for Farunn on the northeast shore of the Bittertide Lake. It may even venture near the Glimmering Pillar. Bring back its horn to commemorate your kill.

 Quest Hand-in: <Hemet examines the horn.>An astounding trophy from an amazing animal! <name>, I've been hearing rumors of even bigger, more ferocious game in the northern reaches of the basin and I'd like you to help us track it down.
Title: Call of Air - Ichman's Fleet

Description: Their spirits are low, soldier. After our last failed air strike against the Horde, they refuse to fly! It is up to you to bolster their morale.

Return to the battlefield and strike at the heart of the Frostwolf's command. Take down their commanders and guardians. Return to me with as many of their medals as you can stuff in your pack! I promise you, when my gryphons see the bounty and smell the blood of our enemies, they will fly again! Go now!

 Quest Hand-in: Can you see it? Look at them, soldier! They're coming around... Soon, Ichman's flight will once again strike at the heart of the valley! Stormpike will rule the skies!
Title: Not My Warchief

Description: There is little time. Sylvanas likely knows of my intentions and sent you to deal with me accordingly. I doubt she will be pleased with your decision.

We must make our way to the wyverns and take to the skies.

 Quest Hand-in: Eitrigg told me of your escape from Orgrimmar. There may still be other dissenters within the city who are unable to leave such as you did.All we can do for them now is end this battle before Sylvanas makes them suffer.
Title: Haunted

Description: You think I'm going to just let you go after you killed me like that, mon? No way! I didn't create a piratical mercantile empire out of nothing just to see you bring me down.

You're going to help me get back to life. Find my ex-wife, Ajamon, on the north side of the Holdfast. Just follow your nose. She'll be wherever the stinky brewing cauldron is.

 Quest Hand-in: What ya be wantin'? Oh no you don't. I can see ya got Tony's spirit with ya, and I want nothin' to do with it!
Title: Loken's Orders

Description: I've created everything else you'll need for your overseer disguise kit. Try not to retch when you put it on. I took pains to make it as true to reality as possible.

Take the kit with you southeast to Dun Argol, use it to disguise yourself, then go to the easternmost building on the broad middle tier of the city.

There, you should see a pedestal where the thane and overseers receive their orders from this Loken. Activate it while disguised and learn all you can from the communication.

 Quest Hand-in: So he means to foment civil war between the factions of the titans' creation? Why does this titan city of Ulduar mean so much to him? I suppose this is what Kurun and his giants are hoping to prevent.Well, I doubt we're in a position to keep the giants from fighting each other, but we can find a way to use this to our advantage. I must inform our leaders at once.
Title: In Defense of Vakthros

Description: It's time, {name}. The Primalist forces in the air are dwindling now that you've handled things on the ground.

Raszageth is calling in one of her lieutenants to reinforce the Primalist forces, thanks to your efforts.

I need you to handle this monster while I push forward to fight Raszageth and help Khadgar.

Look for my magic during your fight. I will do what I can to aid you.

It is time for Raszageth to face the fury of the Aspect of magic!

 Quest Hand-in: Good to see you adventurer. Time is of the essence!
Title: Pieces to the Puzzle

Description: Thank the Light that someone got my message. Now that I'm safe from the iron dwarves, I need to ask your help with something. I've got a lead on Norgannon's keystone, which guards access to Ulduar's archives, but the Titans divided it into two pieces and secreted them away.

One of the pieces, the keystone's shell, is held within the Inventor's Library on the northern coast, south of Ulduar itself. The first thing you'll need to do is retrieve the fragments of an access disk from the library's guardians.

 Quest Hand-in: Wonderful! Now that we have the disk, you must use it to open the Inventor's vault!
Title: Engineering Her Demise

Description: -- THE MOTHER HAS BEEN DETECTED. WARNING! WARNING! --

 Quest Hand-in: The screams of our enemies washed over me. The people of Tuurem are avenged.
Title: Root of the Problem

Description: I suspect we can harness the growth energy present in these plants for our own purposes, but I will need fresh samples.

You can harvest energized plant matter from any of the lashers or vine-choked automa nearby, or those inside the Catalyst Wards.

 Quest Hand-in: These roots are overflowing with growth energy.
Title: A Loose Thread

Description: <A book appears to have been recently knocked off the table from the nearby Venthyr encampment.

The Venthyr would likely appreciate you returning it to them before one of the gromits uses it for nesting material.>

 Quest Hand-in: <It appears you and Mal'ganis are not done with one another. When you finally confront the Jailer, you are certain the dreadlord will be there as well.>
Title: Necessary Precautions

Description: That was freakin' awesome! We decimated Mekkatorque's puny little army.

We got a location on where that little punk and his airship is. That's where he's controllin' all his FORMER mechs.

Here's the plan, we're gonna fly over there, blow up that freak, then destroy his airship!

Now, I ain't no idiot, {name}, I'm the smartest goblin alive. First, we gotta take what they call necessary precautions.

Take this manual, I want you to make sure the G.M.O.D is ready to go!

 Quest Hand-in: I don't care what the meter says, I say we're good to go!
Title: Littlefur

Description: Stranger, I beseech you! My once peaceful brethren are now cursed with insatiable wrath.

My nephew and I tried to leave against the Chieftain's wishes. The clan wrested him from me, and would have torn me apart if I did not flee.

He is trapped in the village, and I fear the worst.

Great {class}, please save him. I am too old and too weak to do it myself.

 Quest Hand-in: Uncle?
Title: Greenstalker

Description: The mighty wolf Greenstalker was once a protector of these forests. He has fallen under the sway of dark forces. My brother and I attempted to calm his spirit, but he is too far gone.

Use the charm I have constructed to weaken him. I ask you {class}, please, end his suffering.

My brother is still weak and I must stay to protect him. Go now before the wolf consumes us all!

 Quest Hand-in: A grim but necessary task. I hope Greenstalker's spirit will find peace now.Be careful, <name>. These woods are being twisted by ancient power.
Title: Extra Shiny

Description: In the pools below are some small, lovely pearls. 

They were tossed in during some Azsh'ari ritual. 

Do they mean something? I have no idea. But I would like to have some of them. 

Be a lovely heavyfoot and go grab some for me, please!

 Quest Hand-in: I can feel them glowing! They tingle through my hand and into the ocean floor.Very lovely.
Title: Army of the Damned

Description: You probably think you're quite strong -- fighting these undead and crushing their bones beneath your war machines.

That is nothing compared to the strength it took to create them.

I saw the prince do it himself.  I can show you how it happened... if you'd like.

 Quest Hand-in: The prince's true power wasn't his ability to make armies out of corpses... that was easy.But killing his own men, with whom he'd shared many battles... the prince's true power was his ability to do what had to be done.
Title: Warchief's Command: Ashenvale!

Description: All able bodied members of the Horde are hereby ordered to report to Kadrak at the Mor'shan Rampart on the border between the Northern Barrens and Ashenvale. Aid in driving the night elves from the forest, so that we may claim its resources for our people!

To reach the Mor'shan Rampart, you must take the Gold Road north from Crossroads in the Northern Barrens.

Destiny calls!

 Quest Hand-in: So you're the reinforcements? I suppose you'll do fine as long you can kill night elves.
Title: Synthesis of Power

Description: Arcane tomes are not ordinary books that happen to deal with arcane matters.  There is intrinsic power in them - a power I've learned to synthesize into a single arcane rune.

Should you find an arcane tome in your travels I will give you one such rune.  Only the most powerful wielders of magic carry the books I need.  In Outland this usually means Kael's blood elves - but you'd be surprised by where such tomes often turn up.

 Quest Hand-in: As promised, <name>.  The entirety of the book's raw power, condensed into a single rune.
Title: Prayerblossom

Description: I have worked for years to try to cure the affliction of the Broken. The foul energies that corrupted them did  more than twist their bodies; it took the comfort of the Light from them. They cannot feel its warmth.

I cannot let Magtoor pass on in darkness, {name}. Before he worsened, I was studying prayerblossom, a flower that grows in the shifting mire. It grows hardy in even the darkest shade. I beg of you, gather these flowers for me, for Magtoor's sake.

 Quest Hand-in: Prayerblossom has been used by the Broken as a remedy since they settled in this swamp. If it soothes the physical form, it might be used for more powerful healing...
Title: Void is Prohibited

Description: Scans indicate errors in reality surrounding nearby structure. Portals directly to the Void.

Current theory, corruption has Old God as source. Void attracted to Old God corruption.

Portals must be sealed to contain entities lured here by Old God corruption.

Take this device. Titan Keeper Hezrel has forged it thanks to help in powering up systems.

Use device to seal Void portals, prevent more void entities from entering area.

 Quest Hand-in: Void portals no longer detected. Must continue.
Title: Tallstrider Soul

Description: <The Tallstrider Soul is agile and curious. The shape of the tallstrider will be yours to call upon.>

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, the tallstrider. This shape is now yours to call upon.
Title: Burn Victims

Description: We have warriors out in the field who are falling wounded, and many of our druids are too busy fighting to give them proper aid. I need you to go to the north, towards the Ashen Fields, and tend their wounds at least enough that they can make it back to safety.

If you haven't any bandages or healing spells, I had Rayne put together this salve, which should prove sufficient to get them on their feet.

 Quest Hand-in: I saw several of our warriors make it back to safety shortly after you departed. It seems your efforts were quite effective. Thank you.
Title: The Weight of My Ambition

Description: As with the other settlements, I too relied on the services of sailors and watercraft to deliver supplies. They proved very useful in their diligence, and their silence.

Predictably, they drew the attention of enemies, including those below the waves. Their anchor was hexed, dragging them beneath the ocean before they could so much as cry out.

I have seen them, hoisting ethereal sails and singing shanties of the damned. If these waters are to be safe again, they must be silenced again. For good.

 Quest Hand-in: Finally, a sailor's death.
Title: Land of Opportunity

Description: <The grandmaster's voice rings out over the roaring crowd.>

This is it! The final event of the tournament!

These two Maldraxxi gladiators have cut down challenger after challenger. Now the only thing left...

Is for one to slay the other!

 Quest Hand-in: In ages past, the Primus founded that tournament to showcase the might of Maldraxxus. Today, it has sparked an all-out war.
Title: Spread Your Lunarwings and Fly

Description: These poor faerie dragons are being tortured!

What's worse, when the thistleleaf become bored they ensnare their victims to continue their torment later.

This behavior is simply unacceptable.

Please free any trapped Lunarwings you can find.

 Quest Hand-in: On behalf of the Lunarwings, thank you.
Title: Liberate the Kaja'mite

Description: Sir, we need tons of moolah to pay the Trade Prince and get off Kezan! Well, tons of it is just waiting for the taking down there in the Kaja'mine!

These are the last known deposits of kaja'mite anywhere. This is the raw stuff that made us the genius tinkerers and alchemists we are today. If that's not worth a bazillion macaroons, I don't know what is!

Take some of my kablooey bombs and blowup the deposits. Then, pick up the chunks.

Just watch out for the rebellious trolls!

 Quest Hand-in: Nicely done, sir, nicely done! That's a fortune you have there in your bags.With all of that, I bet the Trade Prince will let all of us come along on his yacht!
Title: The Bloodsail Buccaneers

Description: You sure seem eager to work, matey.  Not sure why some land-loving {race} {class} is offering help to the Blackwater Raiders, but I'm not going to turn you away.

We've made Booty Bay our happy home away from the high seas, but word has it that the Bloodsail have some new plan cooked up.  All me boys are too busy hitting the grog and looking for ladies!  What I need is a scout.

Check the cove just north of Booty Bay along the Savage Coast and see what you find.

 Quest Hand-in: On top of the barrel, you discover a map with some hastily written text on it, along with some coins.
Title: Coalpart's Revenge

Description: I'm so full I can't swing an axe even if I had one.

Tell ya what, we got a mutual interest here. I need yer help to get a little vengeance on the big botani at the back of this bloom. In return, I'll point ya in the right direction fer gettin' a secret weapon the botani keep.

 Quest Hand-in: Me mother always told me to eat me vegetables. I dunna think this is what she had in mind.
Title: Retribution for the Light

Description: There are agents of darkness everywhere, fighting tooth and nail to envelop the world. The Light relies on us to balance the scale.

You have the power needed to destroy Teron'gor's demonic minions once and for all. Send them to the Twisting Nether in pieces!

 Quest Hand-in: Already I can feel the Light triumphing over darkness. We've done it!
Title: The Nighthold: Talisman of the Shal'dorei

Description: When the Nighthold was built, my people forged a talisman that allowed access to these halls. With the talisman's power, one could traverse the palace unhindered, taking the fight directly to the magistrix. Using fragments of the Nightwell's power, we could locate the talisman and end this foolish war...

 Quest Hand-in: The power these fragments hold will allow me to call the talisman to us. Well done!
Title: In the Ruin of Rebellion

Description: Well, here we are -- Sinfall.

Last I saw, the Master was dragging Prince Renathal and his most loyal followers here in a prison convoy. However, this is a forbidden place, wrapped in rumors and mystery. I heard it was once the workshop of Denathrius, where he performed dark experiments.

Intriguing to be sure, but we are here to find Renathal. Search below, but proceed with caution. I will send word for the Accuser to make her way here with what allies she can muster.

 Quest Hand-in: I will sever your head from your body should you...Wait...You are still alive? That means you are... the Maw Walker?
Title: Beastmaster's Hunt: The Crab

Description: Along with the crate, you get some advice on crab hunting:

Crabs are strange, primordial creatures, with wildly different motivations than you or I.

Small crabs are easy to find and hunt, but the large ones hide beneath the sands, out of danger and out of our reach. To draw them out, we play on their sense of smell.

The Unga villagers to the southeast allow their fish to ferment before they eat them. Bring enough rotten fish together, and you will catch yourself a colossal crab.

 Quest Hand-in: You spread out the decaying fish, prepare the crate, then turn your eyes toward the beach...
Title: Futility

Description: Do you see now?  Sending your men against the prince's armies just swells their numbers.

I don't expect you to understand... you'll probably just end up like the others.  You'd best return to whoever sent you.  They might be worried.

 Quest Hand-in: Nice shooting, <name>.  The Scourge never had a chance.Are you feeling okay?  You look like you've seen a ghost.  Not that it would be an unusual thing around these parts, now that I think about it.
Title: A Little Leg Work

Description: The legs and shocks on this mount are shot! We'll need some new ones if we're going to get this mount crawling.
 
A few weeks ago, Bondo and his gang rode into the Scrapbone Den hoping to scare the Troggs off. The Troggs tore their crawlers apart! The parts for those crawlers are still laying all around Scrapbone Den.

See if you can get us some of those parts from the Troggs.

 Quest Hand-in: These parts will get us closer to being able to ride this thing!
Title: Stacked!

Description: We just filled an order this morning. How could they possibly need more already?!

My team has been workin' double-time to get these trees chopped and processed.

Problem is we have an infestation of Lion's Landing troops down here. I already risked my neck once today, I'm not goin' back out there!

Goob will go with you and help you fill this order. He's not the brightest, but he can do the heavy liftin'.

 Quest Hand-in: It's about time you showed up with this lumber order! I was just about to come down there and get it myself.
Title: The Prime's Directive

Description: All centurion are made to serve the kyrian.

That they now work against ME, the Forgelite PRIME, is an insult to all centurions in Bastion. Look at them! Praetors! Goliaths! All... PURPLE!

I hereby give you permission and expressly order you to extract their cores. I will repurpose them in a fitting manner. I will reclaim their anima to power the Locus.

I can build more. Do not pity.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent. Their anima will be put to better use.
Title: Lay Waste, Lay Mines

Description: They ransacked my library, {name}.

If they want our knowledge, we will give it to them. 

This piece of rune work will allow you to cast an ensnaring spell on the ground. When the Nightborne cross the threshold they will see the true might of the Moon Guard.

Teach them well!

 Quest Hand-in: A lesson we all must one day learn. Never assume your enemy dead until you see their corpse. <Lothrius grins.>
Title: Secrets of the Flame

Description: If we are to banish Ragnaros back into the Firelands, we will need to gain access to Sulfuron Spire.

Only the most trusted members of the Twilight's Hammer will have been entrusted with such valuable information.

Go search the Ascendant's Rise for any written tomes you might find.  Foul as they are, we cannot waste the opportunity to learn about our enemy's weaknesses.

 Quest Hand-in: These foul books should not be allowed to exist.  Yet the information inside them is of vital importance.
Title: Pets Versus Pests

Description: I been tryin' ta get dis place ready for your pets, but we uncovered some rude pests while buildin' da garrison.  I tried takin' care o' dem myself, but they be too tough for my little friends.

Beat da angry carrot in da garden, da rat eatin' our food, and da ornery water creature harassing da fishermen.  If you can do it, I be free to finish up da work on your menagerie.

 Quest Hand-in: Nice job, brudda.  I hope your pets be likin' dere new home.
Title: See to the Survivors

Description: If we don't do something quick, neither Nevin nor the survivors will make it out of here alive. I'm going to give you my squad's emergency teleport beacon. We still have enough strength and ammunition to fight our way out of here, but those survivors are in no condition to make a run for it.

Use the beacon on survivors to arrange for them to be teleported out of here to the safe area my men have set up. Once you've done that, report back to me and we'll make arrangements to get you out of here.

 Quest Hand-in: I know Nevin will be pleased with all the survivors you managed to help. I still can't believe you managed to stay so strong down here in the radiation. You've seen the shape the other survivors are in.Let's get you to the loading room for decontamination.
Title: Schematic Reassimilation: Prototype Leaper

Description: <This schematic contains the pattern of a new protoform construct. Present it to an appropriate protoform forge and it may instantiate one of these creatures for you.>

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent. With this schematic and the right components, a new song can begin here to accompany you.
Title: A Suitable Disguise

Description: Getting you inside the Sunreaver's Sanctuary will be tougher than it appears. Only those who possess Sunreaver tabards are permitted entry to sanctuary. If we can get our hands on one, a simple enchantment will do the rest of the work.

On the balcony above Threads of Fate, you'll find Shandy Glossgleam. I've helped him a few times in the past, so he owes me a favor. He handles laundry for a wide variety of people in the city. Maybe he can find a way to 'lend' you a tabard for a while.

 Quest Hand-in: I knew Shandy would find a way to come through for us. Let me get this enchanted and ready for you to use. The sooner you get done with the tabard, the sooner we can get it back to Shandy and the better the chances that its owner will never have missed it.
Title: Ursol's Wisdom

Description: We have strayed from wise Ursol's path, trading focus for obsession and contemplation for fear.

Gather cones from the mighty Rustpines. As their roots stretch deep into the earth, take strength from the waters, reach into the winds, and are ripened by fire, they will be a symbol of our renewed commitment to true balance.

Take to the skies on that drake of yours and you should be able to gather enough. The upper branches are the best place to find them.

Offer them to Ursol at his nearby shrine.

 Quest Hand-in: Our path forward is clear now. Thank you for your part in this.
Title: The Mosswalker Savior

Description: There's some small chance that the Mosswalkers are not all dead yet... and at the very least, they deserve to not be butchered like this.

Let's find some revenge for this slaughter and see if there are any to be saved in the process.

 Quest Hand-in: I'm very glad there were some to be saved... with luck, they'll make it back to Rainspeaker Canopy safely.
Title: No Sister Left Behind

Description: We were searching the ruins south of here when the mogu fell upon us out of nowhere.

Some of us were able to retreat to this encampment but many others were captured. The mogu have also caught a number of the Horde who happened to be in the area as well.

Please, {name}, rescue any sentinels that you can.

Leave the Dawnchasers to their fate.

 Quest Hand-in: There are so few of us, it is a great relief to see such help.
Title: Defender's Oath

Description: You've carried out the promise you made to us, {name}.  And for that you've gained the recognition you deserve.

As you continue to become attuned with past events surrounding mount Hyjal, I can continue to tap into the power contained in your ring.  It won't be long until it has reached its full potential.

 Quest Hand-in: You are a worthy ally indeed.  As you grow in power so does the band of eternity!
Title: Essence of the Iron Conqueror

Description: Redeem your Essence of the Iron Conqueror with Exarch Maladaar to select an armament of your choice.

 Quest Hand-in: <name>, your courage and dedication has made Draenor a safer place. Take these armaments, and may the Light protect you on your journey.
Title: Overpowered

Description: The Sunreaver forces have grown more powerful recently. I suspect magic to be at play here, but I can't be certain.

I think it would be wise to investigate their camp to see if you can find the source of this extra power.

Once you find it, use this crystal to overload and destroy it.

 Quest Hand-in: So they've constructed objects that infuse their forces with additional power? This will have to be watched closely.Thank you for your efforts today.
Title: Adventuring Anxieties

Description: {name}! I was recently talking with Mei, the mount trader, and she asked me if it was possible to make a barding that could prevent adventurers from being dismounted.

I'd like you to go and discuss this idea with her further.

Return to me when you're finished. Perhaps we can solve this issue together.

 Quest Hand-in: I see.That shouldn't be too difficult to make.
Title: Destructive Prey

Description: <Your sharptalon falcosaur watches carefully when you are in combat. It appears to be interested in your abilities. It might learn a thing or two from watching you do battle with a powerful opponent.>

 Quest Hand-in: <The hatchling looks more confident in your abilities. It will need some time to recover from this adventure.>
Title: An Expedient Ally

Description: The old iron dwarf capital of Thor Modan, far to the northeast, is under siege by a mysterious band of stone giants and earthen.

Why the creations of the titans would war against each other is beyond my understanding and the Horde's interest, but there is an opportunity here to weaken a mutual enemy.

Travel to Thor Modan and seek out this 'Kurun' who commands the giants and earthen. Make common cause with him and use his forces to crush the iron dwarves.

 Quest Hand-in: <You introduce yourself to Kurun.>So the sons of iron are your enemies as well?My forces have the iron dwarves pinned inside their city, but we could use help in pressing the attack. Will you aid us?
Title: Disciples of Naralex

Description: {class}, the Barrens used to be one of the most beautiful places in all of Kalimdor. It teemed with life and promise.

Now, as you can see, that is no longer true. It is a land of great torment and strife.

The Disciples of Naralex seek to cleanse the Wailing Caverns and bring them back to their former beauty. Speak with Nalpak just inside the Wailing Caverns to help.

 Quest Hand-in: Yes, <class>? What brings you to this place?
Title: The Push Westward

Description: Our work is done here, {name}.  Against all odds, we stopped the Neferset advance on Nahom.

Let us join the forces pushing west, lest they take all the glory for themselves.

They must've reached the outskirts of Neferset City by now.

 Quest Hand-in: You've arrived just in time, <name>.
Title: They Can't Stay Here

Description: Can't believe the Horde already have a foothold in the Necropolis. We have to stop them.

This one's simple. Kill as many Horde as you find in that cursed place, but keep your eye out for a fella named Bwonsamdi.

Seems like he's some sort of death god. He's way beyond anything we can handle, but why not send a few of his followers his way?

Better they rot in his necropolis than bother the living.

 Quest Hand-in: Good, less Horde for us to deal with in this cursed place.
Title: Glimmering Locket

Description: <A glint of metal catches your eye among the gently bobbing flotsam. Digging into the tangled seaweed, you discover a locket of simple, yet sturdy design.

Opening the locket reveals a hand-drawn picture of a woman with fiery red bangs. 

Her arm is around a woman with short-cropped auburn hair, and the two are proudly displaying warm smiles for the artist.>

 Quest Hand-in: Is that?<Jane takes the locket and opens it tenderly. Tears begin to well up in her eyes as she closes it and tucks it away in her jacket.>Thank you.
Title: The Black Knight's Curse

Description: I wanted to remove the Black Knight's remains from the tournament grounds after your victory, but Confessor Paletress insisted that he receive a decent burial. Ever since, a dark presence has lingered in the cemetery and people are afraid to go there to visit the fallen.

Would you visit the cemetery just past the eastern end of the tournament grounds and see if you can discover what's happening? 

 Quest Hand-in: <Crusader Rhydalla frowns.>Do you think they've been planning this? I suppose it doesn't matter, but I don't like the implication that we've been playing into their hands. Whatever is going on, we have to stop it.
Title: Ormgul the Pestilent

Description: We've lived at peace with the drogbar for years--our tribe even more than the others. But we were betrayed in our last trade with them at Riverbend.

They usually supply us with potent alchemy to prevent insects from infesting our fields. This time, led by Ormgul, they have attacked the crops that sustain us all.

Ormgul the Pestilent is the one who brought the infection to our farmland. Destroy him, and bring me whatever he uses to attract the bugs to our land.

 Quest Hand-in: Now we have what they used to spray our fields. I wonder what use we could put this to...
Title: Shadow Over Thunder Bluff

Description: A dark force has descended upon us. I refuse to believe that the Highmountain are behind it.

The cacophony out there is disturbingly familiar. Could it be... 

No! The minions of the Old Gods are attacking! We must fight for Thunder Bluff, {name}!

 Quest Hand-in: The Old Gods are known for subversion and duplicity. To attack so brazenly...Whatever they seek, they want it badly.
Title: Shot-Caller

Description: <Solar energy courses through the slumbering constructs, their ancient servos whirring to life all around you. It is too late to shut them down now.

Outside, an arakkoa overseer bellows commands, each answered by the buzz of an Apexis beam carving away at the mountain.

That turret would make short work of the constructs - if you can command it.>

 Quest Hand-in: <The Apexis interface slides into place with a satisfying click. Seems this is the seat for taking full command of the turret.Rifling through the cushions, you find a few spare coins, which you pocket.>
Title: Weathering the Storm

Description: Ah, you have arrived just in time! We've heard tales that the Nokhud centaur have powerful, dangerous weaponry infused with storm enchantments. We would like to bring some samples to our enchanters for study.

At the very least, we can decommission the weapons and put them to better use.

 Quest Hand-in: With these weapons no longer in destructive hands, we can feel more at peace and begin to understand these enchantments.
Title: Echo of Gul'dan

Description: To attune this shard to the place you wish to go, we must follow some of its history.

The first location we will visit is the Dark Portal in the Blasted Lands.

It was there that Gul'dan used a piece of the Vision of Time to travel between realities.

Join me there when you are ready.

 Quest Hand-in: Gul'dan was a pox upon all lands that he set foot upon. His death was well deserved.
Title: Lost in Transition

Description: Sir, the storehouse is fully operational and I've seen to it that your supplies are safely stored away and accounted for.

Unfortunately, during the rest of my audit I found that we are missing a few crates of surplus material - probably misplaced by one of the porters.

If you happen to come across any of the surplus crates while making your rounds, please bring them to me and I'll update our ledger.

 Quest Hand-in: According to the ledger this appears to be everything we're missing. Those porters will be cleaning the latrines tonight for this!
Title: The Healing of Shen-zin Su

Description: This is more horrific than I imagined, but we can handle this. We need to gather the healers and close the wound. We need to save Shen-zin Su.

Find any healers you can! Rescue them, relieve them - whatever you need to do to get them over here healing the wound.

Keep the healers safe at all costs!

 Quest Hand-in: You are a sight to see when under pressure, <name>! We wouldn't have stood a chance without you.I think it's working. The flow of blood is slowing. I knew it would work!
Title: "Accidental" Arson

Description: It's no use trying to get Andrei to tell us who he's working with. He won't talk, and we can't risk alerting his accomplice. 

We need to get rid of him, and it needs to look like an accident. 

Once Andrei's been dealt with, set fire to his rug and let the whole estate burn down.  

Andrei isn't someone you want coming into power. He's as ruthless as he is cruel.

 Quest Hand-in: You're quite thorough, aren't you? I can see the flames from here. While you were out I took the liberty of having some proper leg wear altered to fit you. I am sure I have you sized up properly.
Title: Amber Secrets

Description: The Morrowchamber houses a small section of the Zara'thik, mantid under immediate directive of the new empress. Some of them may have been given pieces of amber like the one you found.

The Shado-Pan would be interested in any extra pieces we can acquire.

 Quest Hand-in: More of this corrupted amber. I need to bring this back to the garrison.
Title: Flash! Aaaaaahhhh!

Description: The gnomes have brought their flying contraptions. I want my skies CLEAR!

Get up there on whatever mount you have with you and destroy those paltry devices.

You may use this grog I "acquired" from our goblin allies. It would be better served blasting down gyrocopters than in the gullet of those little green fiends.

 Quest Hand-in: Ha! Simple mechanical toys are no match for a well aimed bottle of grog.
Title: I Intend to Live Forever

Description: Please, {name}. I am not finished.

There is one more memory that I must see. One more that must be faced.

It... it will not be easy. I will need support from all of you.

But it must be done.

 Quest Hand-in: <Adrestes breaks from his thoughts, a renewed resolve in his eyes.>I believe this experience was the missing piece for Uther. And for me as well.
Title: Ruins-Level Marketing

Description: Now dat de Goldtusk Inn be open for business, we gotta make sure everyone in Vol'dun knows about it!

I think we should focus on those wagon-riding vulpera first. Dey don't even have real homes!

In fact, I saw a pack of vulpera up at de ruins to de north de other day, and dey barely had anything.

Take dem dis coupon and tell dem to stop by for a free first stay.

 Quest Hand-in: <Kenzou looks skeptically at the leaf you handed him.>No, I will not be going there. But are you looking for some real work?
Title: If You're Sure

Description: You sure be collectin' a lot of treasures. Dey will be worth more next week, but I can take 'em off your hands.

 Quest Hand-in: Here ya go! Instant gratification's da best gratification!
Title: Along the Southern Front

Description: I'm heading westward with Taoshi to gather the strongest I can find to confront the Sha of Hatred.

I would like you to come with me.

 Quest Hand-in: Let's get this taken care of so we can get down to the bridge.
Title: Defeat Jakra'zet

Description: Jakra'zet is summoning Mythrax the Unraveler!

We cannot allow the ritual to continue. Jakra'zet must be stopped before it's too late!

Lead the way, {name}. We'll be right behind you.

Let's go!

 Quest Hand-in: It's a miracle we survived...
Title: To Tame A Thunderspine

Description: I'm so happy that Lizi is safe and sound with us.

However, her wounds are healing slower than expected. I hope that the magic inflicted upon her didn't cause permanent damage.

Could you help me gather insect ichor? I know, it sounds gross! It's actually the base of many healing ointments.

 Quest Hand-in: I'll go apply it to her wounds right away. It should offer immediate relief.
Title: Isolated Victory

Description: Alliance forces are pushing deeper into Vol'dun. We can not allow this aggression to go unchecked!

 Quest Hand-in: On behalf of all the denizens of Vol'dun, thank you for your help in pushing back the Alliance invaders.The people here have suffered enough threats without the Alliance adding to the list.We will not forget the Horde's sacrifice here, nor yours.
Title: Deny Them Resources

Description: This entire invasion has been carried out with the sole objective of infusing raw materials with elemental power on an unprecedented scale.

While we may not know Fyrakk's ultimate goal, frustrating his efforts seems straightforward enough.

If he wants these materials, we will deny them to him.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent. Anything we can take from him buys us time.
Title: Kitchen Assistance

Description: That recipe sure will come in handy.  I'd better get to work so I can have some smoked desert dumplings ready for today.  I could use a hand in making some, I'll make it worth your while.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent!  You're a life saver.  These dumplings turned out to be quite good.  Didn't really expect such good taste from the Twilight's Hammer.
Title: A Bit of a Bind

Description: The naga sorceress leading this excursion seems to be in the process of binding a larger elemental. If she succeeds, we will no doubt lose our foothold here.

Strike out at her, perhaps you can catch her off guard and interrupt the ritual. Remove the head from these snakes.

 Quest Hand-in: I have no idea what this might be, but I don't like the looks of it.
Title: The Battle for Hillsbrad

Description: The journal documents the last 62 days of Clerk Horrace Whitesteed's life. In it is written damning allegations against Warden Stillwater and his activities at the Sludge Fields.

You should show this to the warden. He will undoubtedly have an explanation for what is written in this journal.

 Quest Hand-in: <Warden Stillwater flips through the journal, reading under his breath.>Ramblings of a mad man! Clearly he had been ingesting the mushrooms. It is good that you brought this to me, <name>. I will burn it myself!
Title: Mystery Meat

Description: Mojambo's gang may be coming to kill us, but we've still got to eat. And when you live in a harsh wasteland, you make do with what you've got.

Sometimes fresh meat is hard to find.

Dat's how I came up with de idea for my famous mystery meat pie.

De secret ingredient is dung beetle, but with enough seasoning you can't even tell!

Our food supplies are dangerously low right now. I need someone to go beetle hunting as soon as possible!

 Quest Hand-in: Just look at all dese juicy intestines! We'll have enough pies to feed de entire camp!
Title: Wolf Training: Ironbore

Description: Alright, we've taken on foes in the sky and on land, and even in the rain. What happens when the beasts are below your feet, though? We're about to find out!

The rockworm is a cunning predator, striking at prey from below the sands. Many beasts of Nagrand have grown wary of the rumbling of the earth. Take your wolf on out to the sandy shores and see if you can't take down one of the elder rockworms: Ironbore.

 Quest Hand-in: The sand worm's bit the dust? Well done, I'll get this beast bedded down for the night.
Title: A Mech for a Goblin

Description: Gallywix has a plan to deal with the Alliance and has requested your help. It involves the Azerite you reclaimed.

Speak with him down at Bilgewater Bonanza, and do whatever you can to help him... when it comes to the interest of the Horde.

Oh, and make sure Gallywix stays alive. The Alliance already tried to kill him.

 Quest Hand-in: You're here! Good, 'cause we got ourselves problems.
Title: Out of Place

Description: The gorge is an unforgiving place.  We don't get a whole lot of fuzzy wildlife wandering around here.

We tried bringing in some wild game, but they haven't fared well at all.  There's just no food for them to eat.  Now the nearby spiders - which were already dangerous - are getting big and fat on chicken meat.

We'll never get rid of all the spiders, but we can salvage what few chickens remain.  Not only will you be feeding the Brotherhood, you'll be saving them a painful death by spider bite.

 Quest Hand-in: You've got quick hands if you were able to gather this many in such a short time.Excellent work, <name>.  I'll make sure these ones don't go to waste.
Title: A Ritual of Flame

Description: We appear to have everything under control. Our invasion portal to the Firelands will be opened momentarily, and the elementals have not put up much fight.

Assist our druids by dispatching the last few of these elementals. Then, once the gate has been opened, we can make our move.

 Quest Hand-in: Leyara... she lives. I sense Fandral's hand at play here...
Title: Attack on Nethergarde

Description: The Iron Horde controls Nethergarde Keep, but they are fools if they think we will let them retain such a strategic position.

My best troops are more than eager to spill the blood of those savages, but we need a champion like yourself to lead the charge.

 Quest Hand-in: The Iron Horde will learn to fear us, as they should.
Title: Fear Takes Root

Description: The fallout from Shek'zeer's madness will continue long after her reign has ended. We will struggle to heal our lands for many years to come, and even then our efforts may prove fruitless.

A new species of sha-twisted flora has begun taking root near Zan'vess. Destroy any that you find, but beware - there is no telling what kind of sinister defenses it may have.

 Quest Hand-in: This species is interesting, but the risks associated with keeping it around for study are too high.
Title: The Lightbringer's Redemption

Description: How may I be of service, {race}?

 Quest Hand-in: <Uther stares at the medal, speechless for a moment.>Arthas' medal.I remember well the day I presented it to him...You have done me a great service, hero. My soul may now rest in peace. I offer you a memory lost in time. Do with it as you please, but do not forget those that assisted you in this monumental feat.
Title: Spreading Decay

Description: <Brena turns Kargpaw's totem over and over in her thick hands.>

Kargpaw is a pawn. He isn't the source of this rot. We must find it, before the decay spreads further.

The closest tuskarr presence from here is a trading outpost, just across the bridge on the way to Iskaara.

We should check in with them... and quickly.

 Quest Hand-in: As I feared, they were attacked as well.
Title: The Heart of the Deck

Description: The day the Dragon Isles began their slumber was the day of my very last match. Fate was cruel, and I lost my strongest card before I could compete.

Guo-Hee's card, you see, was mine. I do not know how her ancestors came upon it.

Alas, I cannot claim it as my own as it has been in her family for centuries. That was a foolish mistake on my part.

Perhaps you and I could craft a card together? A truly unique card... Yes! Will you help me?

Speak to me once you are ready.

 Quest Hand-in: This is it! I have never seen such a card before! Such power! So many possibilities!Magnificent!Thank you, <name>. Now I am ready...
Title: Stories of Battle

Description: The writings carried by the priestess appear to be the first part of an epic poem describing the history of Ashildir, the ancient queen of the Valkyra. 

If Ashildir has a connection to the shieldmaidens here, you may be able to use that to your advantage. 

The answer to her involvement likely lies within the remaining text.

 Quest Hand-in: The verses of the poem unfold the tale of Ashildir founding the shieldmaidens and bringing them to Skold-Ashil.If these shieldmaidens revere the Valkyra queen as this would suggest, your dealings with her in Helheim may prove advantageous.
Title: Sundered Flames

Description: Did Neltharion keep this place as his hoard? No wonder that Sarkareth was looking for it. 

Neltharion's "treasures" litter every corner of it.

There's no telling what Sarkareth has gotten his claws on here.

Stay close!

 Quest Hand-in: I did not wish to fight Dezran. Sarkareth's strong personality and manipulative tongue are making his people follow his wildest whims.
Title: Resource Management

Description: Now that you possess Helya's Horn, the kvaldir are yours to command. We may as well put them to good use for a change. 

I've dispatched my Val'kyr, Danica, to the Broken Shore. She has identified a few Legion targets that should be eliminated.

Aerylia will send you there when you are ready to leave.

 Quest Hand-in: Good to see you made it, Battlelord <name>!
Title: How Fares Ebonhorn?

Description: Three of the ancient wards are restored. The mountain is not yet secure, but we may have done enough to break Ebonhorn free of the shadows gripping him.

Let us return to Thunder Totem and see how he fares. Hopefully Ebonhorn can tell us more about what is happening with the Necrodark and the insidious master they serve.

 Quest Hand-in: I am myself again, <name>.You and Graysky have freed me from the grasp of the Old Gods. Had I remained in that state for much longer, I would have been lost.
Title: Westward Bound

Description: Warlord Grimaxe wants us to search west of here for the site of the next ritual.

We could use your help. I've already died once. It's not an experience I'd care to repeat.

 Quest Hand-in: A giant pit filled with necrotic energy and spiders.I used to hate spiders. Now that I'm Forsaken, I don't think they're all that bad.They will still definitely kill you, though.
Title: But... I Am the Hero of Ducks

Description: Hold on... there is something...

<Gracus looks around.> 

Firequackers! The boy must have gone down the river again! No matter how often I tell him, he always tries to play with the hornswogs!

I need you to go check on him. I hope he didn't get swallowed again.

 Quest Hand-in: He was swallowed by the--Firequackers still has much to learn. Pilot on the other hand has already taken a liking to you. The smartest of the brood and the one most ready to leave. For all that you have done, I thank you! Take care of my sweet duckling!
Title: Ahead of the Game

Description: The watcher Yotnar keeps the vault, and he is a fickle one. Challengers come from far and wide seeking the trials, but the watcher chooses not to see.

If you wish to catch his eye, show him you are worth being seen.

Some of these challengers await in camps throughout the Valley of the Sword. Bring their heads to Yotnar, so that he may see them, and you.

 Quest Hand-in: It is a shame to see the first worthy challenger for the Aegis treating the trials with such disrespect. Such hubris cannot win the Aegis, for the gods will surely strike him down for his arrogance.You, however, seem different. You have shown that you are a worthy challenger. I will allow you to begin the trials.
Title: Leader of the Illidari

Description: Illidan has officially placed you in charge, {name}. The Illidari are now yours.

Meet me upstairs. We will let everyone know together.

 Quest Hand-in: Ready, <name>?
Title: Bonbon Blitz

Description: I can see you've got an eye for opportunity, {class}. What do you say we make a little coin together?

Crown needs to push samples of our latest holiday-themed products to every potential customer in the city. Help us share the love, and we'll share some of that amazing Crown merchandise with you!

Your time, our money, friend. We got a deal?

 Quest Hand-in: Lovely work, <name>! People will be tripping over one another to get Crown chocolates now that they've had a chance to taste those sweet, romantic treats.Here's a little something for helping us out.
Title: Answering Their Attacks

Description: The sethrak's attacks on our burrows cannot go unanswered. 

They need to learn that not all within the desert will give up so easily. 

The only thing the sethrak understand is blood, so that's the language we'll use to teach them.

<Nisha pauses and looks at you, skeptical that you understood her.>

I'm saying we need to kill the sethrak here. All of them.

 Quest Hand-in: Their blood flows down the dunes back to their fortress. The sethrak will think twice before attacking our burrows again.
Title: Service with a Smile

Description: Oh, simple {race}. Simple, simple {race}.

I did not 'forget' to sweep up those reins from that foolish cakewalk of a knight they call the Lich King. I simply did not bother, as I already received the mighty steed during my raid last week.

<Johnny motions to the horse on his left.>

Since you're here and clearly intrigued by my sweltering greatness, won't you take that superfluous stallion to the assistant resort director in town? My coffers could use a bit of extra lining.

 Quest Hand-in: <Johnny raises his arm exaggeratedly, glancing at his naked wrist.>My, my, quite the LETHARGIC adventurer, aren't you? That just might cover my repair bills from the many dungeons I've plundered.
Title: How to Serve Goblins

Description: Why would fel orcs steal my shredder parts?  I hate them so much.  They just sneak into my camp here and take things all the time.  A couple of days ago they stole three of my peons!  Now the rest of my peons have run off because they are afraid they are going to be eaten by fel orcs.  

I can't run a mine without peons.  If you could save the peons that I lost maybe the others would come back.  The fel orcs have their camps along the wall to the southwest.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you for saving my peons.  Now maybe I can get them to fix my shredder with those parts you found, earn some money and get out of Outland.  I can't wait to be back in Booty Bay.
Title: Shark Week

Description: Crabbing is our big money-maker, but we send all kinds of goods back around the wall. Oils, plants, even rare minerals - the sea's bounty is rich out here!

Right now the big craze in the markets back home is thresher teeth. Apparently they make great necklaces?

Threshers are all over the Shelf of Mazu to the west. Bring me lots of teeth!

 Quest Hand-in: Those are perfect, just put them down over there. I'd rather not touch them myself. Creeps me out.
Title: You Are Rakh'likh, Demon

Description: Hero, listen well.

First, we must travel to the Deathly Usher, who waits at the northern foot of the Rise of the Defiler, to our northwest.  The usher will take us to the top of the rise.  Once there, you will help me defeat Razelikh, for I fear I am not strong enough to defeat him alone.

Most importantly, I need you to hold the stone knife, and do not use it until I tell you to.  The knife will trap Razelikh's soul within its new, eternal prison.

If we succeed, speak with Grimeo, the draenei.

 Quest Hand-in: Loramus, resurrected!?  And then he trapped the demon inside his own body... by the Light...I see.  So this was Kasim's plan all along.  I suspected correctly, but I suppose I refused to believe it.Ah, one last thing!  Kasim left one more instruction for me within his rune.  I did not understand it at first, but given the events that have taken place today, it now makes much more sense:He asked me to let you choose from one of these.
Title: Steady as a Rock?

Description: Orlond's notes indicate that he brought a piece of equipment called a portable seismograph with him, but the device is nowhere to be seen.

The survey log shows that Orlond completed all his readings in the Thor Modan tunnel, save one labeled the 'east end of the exposed tunnel.'

The last entry in the log indicates Orlond tried to take refuge in the water and was attacked by subterranean threshers. They might've taken his equipment.You'll need to recover it before you can take the last reading.

 Quest Hand-in: <Brugar looks over the report.>This isn't good at all. Even if we could excavate the tunnels behind the blockage, there's no guarantee they wouldn't collapse again. It looks like some of these areas haven't been used in generations. We'll have to give Captain Gryan the bad news.
Title: Feathers for Grazle

Description: While you have proven yourself to me, you may need to continue to work toward proving yourself to the suspicious brethren of my tribe.  To that end, I may be able to continue assisting you.

Some of the Deadwood furbolgs wear a distinctive headdress that may be used as a means of proof in thinning their numbers.  Bring me a feather from any headdresses you acquire; for every set of five you bring me, you will earn recognition amongst the Timbermaw.

 Quest Hand-in: Well done, <name>!  I will make sure that your deeds are known amongst my kind.Remember to bring any of the feathers you find to me.  I will continue to accept them as long as necessary.
Title: Animated Infusion

Description: I have a simple request for you today.

The alchemists are short on an ingredient used in a particularly tricky brew. The herb is easy enough to retrieve. You'll just need to find some aggressive plants to extract samples from. Think you can handle that?

 Quest Hand-in: Well, not all hunts will be the most exhilarating. Nonetheless, the samples you retrieved will be put to good use.
Title: Helya's Conquest

Description: If Helya is making an advance on the Broken Isles, we will need to answer in turn.

Go to Tideskorn Harbor and scout her forces. We will see if Helya is foolish enough to begin her campaign against me.

 Quest Hand-in: She has forced my hand...
Title: The Very Best

Description: Have you seen those adventurers who train up those little creatures to fight each other?

Now that's tough! You have to make those little creatures a little stronger each day.

Show me how tough you are by defeating those other adventurers and their group of creatures!

 Quest Hand-in: You and your team look way tougher than before! Can you keep it up? Let's find out next time!
Title: Trophy of Glory: Charl Doomwing

Description: Defeating Charl has yielded you a trophy worthy of acclaim.

Take this to Durotan at Beastwatch.

 Quest Hand-in: Our purpose here was hard enough without a giant beast like Charl harassing our scouts and aggravating the Gronn.Glory to you <name>!
Title: Into the Wilds

Description: Deep in the wilds, on the southern coast where the Krasarang River meets the sea, rests the Temple of the Red Crane, home of the great Chi-Ji and his most devout followers.

They should be told of what happened here.

If you're headed that way, I have a favor to ask; We often send supplies to the temple, but our last courier has not returned. Please look for signs of him as you travel - where the road forks at the Dojani River, he'd have gone north. When you reach the temple, find Koro Mistwalker.

 Quest Hand-in: I see... And the sha have seeped out as far as the province already, have they?Well, I hate to break it to you, but the temple is also overrun with sha. Those of us who haven't been killed or... possessed, or whatever, are fleeing for our very lives.If you defeated the sha at Zhu's Watch, I have to implore you to help us deal with them here.
Title: Duskwing, Oh How I Hate Thee...

Description: I have seen many things in my day, {race}.  The peaks of Mt. Hyjal... the oddities of Outland... a wall of Scourge soldiers, proceeding into war.  But I have never seen a bat as big, or as shockingly white, as Duskwing.

How he taunts me from his roost!

This albino demon bat circles to the southwest of here, due north of Blackwood Lake.  Track him down and destroy him.  If he flies too high for you to reach, use my flare to get his attention.


 Quest Hand-in: Excellent work.  I can now continue my work without the distractions of that great white beast.I shall fashion this fur into something you can use.
Title: Myzrael's Tale

Description: As the stone goes quiet, you're left with a vague sense of unease. Something isn't right.

Perhaps you should tell Zaruk of what you've done so far.

 Quest Hand-in: I know, <name>. I should not have sent you.Forgive me... the whispers of the past are sometimes too strong.
Title: Sharper Blades, Bigger Timber

Description: Incredible news, Commander {name}. Your ever-loyal servant (that's me) has managed to secure us timber lords. Now maybe you don't know what a timber lord is, so let explain: think of a blood-crazed, mass murderer who enjoys nothing more than killing. Now take that same enthusiasm for killing and apply it to killing trees! That's a timber lord.

What this means is that we can now cut medium sized timber - but first we need to give these timber lords a test run.

There's a suitable tree nearby. Good luck!

 Quest Hand-in: You didn't believe me about those timber lords, did you? Well now you know.It looks like this group will serve you well, sir. Medium sized trees across Draenor are now at your mercy. That means more timber per tree!
Title: Mission: The Murketh and Shaadraz Gateways

Description: Just west of the Dark Portal are two huge transporters: Gateway Murketh and Gateway Shaadraz.

If you look east up the Path of Glory, you'll see them on either side of the road.  I want you to bomb them both into rubble!

Here are the bombs you'll use, specially designed by a goblin in Area 52.  Now, speak with Wing Commander Dabir'ee -- he'll put you on a gryphon and send you on your way.

 Quest Hand-in: That will slow them down, there's no denying it! I think you just put me in an uncharacteristically good mood, <name>!
Title: Burning Vengeance

Description: The Blackrock orcs are ceaseless.  They swarm atop the battle-plains to the east, poised to strike at any moment.

They already attacked my homeland once.  I'm here to make sure it doesn't happen again.

If you hold any love for mankind, you'll do the same.  So prove yourself.  Travel south, to the Whelping Downs, and slay their whelpers and the hatchling black dragons.  Prove to me that you're ready for this war.

 Quest Hand-in: So you're in, then?Good.
Title: Shoveltusk Soul

Description: <The Shoveltusk Soul is protective and determined. The shape of the shoveltusk will be yours to call upon.>

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, the shoveltusk. This shape is now yours to call upon.
Title: The Purification of Quel'Delar

Description: The Sunwell and the end of Quel'Delar's exile await, {name}.

You will find Lor'themar Theron, the regent of Quel'Thalas, and Grand Magister Rommath standing within. Be wary of them and do not allow them to entrap you in their political scheming.

Instead, remain focused on your task here. Immerse the reformed Quel'Delar in the Sunwell to complete the its restoration, then speak with Myralion Sunblaze at Quel'Delar's Rest. Speak to a Warden of the Sunwell when you are ready to enter the Sunwell Plateau.

 Quest Hand-in: Am I truly laying my eyes upon the weapon of Thalorien Dawnseeker? This is a wondrous day for the Sunreavers and for all sin'dorei!
Title: Snapjaws, Mon!

Description: Don't let their big eyes fool you, mon! Those saltwater snapjaws be a menace. I can't fish for five minutes without getting a broken line from one of those oversized fish vacuums stealing my bait.

Do me and the people of Revantusk Village a service and kill em, mon.

Kill the whole lot of em!

 Quest Hand-in: Oh, mon! I can't thank you enough! Hopefully this here fishing pole will be reward enough for the job.
Title: Old Friends, Dear Friends

Description: I don't want to give up on my best friend, but what if she doesn't want to be friends anymore?

We've been dig buddies since we were tiny pups. Maybe it matters to me more than it does to her.

What do I even say?

 Quest Hand-in: I think I'm okay now, <name>.We can still be best friends even if we don't do digs anymore. And I have new friends like you to dig with.I'm glad I got this off my chest.
Title: More Booty!

Description: I need more armor scraps, {name}!  Do you have any?

 Quest Hand-in: Thanks again, <name>.  You do the Horde proud...
Title: Not Felling Well

Description: Let's see... Yseralline Seed for healing, Bruiseweed for curing poison, and Elemental Earth for disease resistance. Oh and just a touch of ground Felwort for attunement. 

Yes, I think this will counteract the Legion's poison. It will probably taste terrible, but what medicine doesn't?

Hurry, Grandmaster {name}. Our most stricken friends don't have much time left.

 Quest Hand-in: It makes my heart glad to see our order returning to health.
Title: The Machination

Description: <Bzzzzzzzzzzzzt.>

<Bzzzzzzzzzzzzt.>

He-hello? {name}, are you there? Are you still alive? Hello?

Oh good, you're still there! What in the name of Lordareon are they building? It's some sort of mechanized monstrosity! You have to stop them from completing that...that...thing! 

Throw out the rules, do whatever you have to do to thwart them!

 Quest Hand-in: <Bzzzzzzzzzzzzt.>You're nearing the heart of their domain. There will likely be an extremely fortified door protecting the inner sanctum of the entire Defias operation. See if you can find anything that might pry it open!I suggest a stealthy method!
Title: The Plumbers, Mason

Description: Jewelcrafter, how would you feel about a chance to practice your prospecting techniques?

The architects and plumbers of the Dragonscale Expedition have requested that we acquire some stones for the construction of a new bath house. I think you will find this a suitable task to occupy you and practice your masonry.

 Quest Hand-in: Nice work, <name>.Here, I made these cuts. You can study them to learn how to be a better jewelcrafter like me.
Title: Sight Beyond Sight

Description: I had not expected to find djaradin here, though it does not surprise me. Legends tell of their elders slumbering beneath the earth. It makes sense that some would delve underground in search of them.

Their forces are heavily guarding this outer area. I recognize the magic their scouts are using--it is farsight, powered by those totems near them.

I spotted a larger totem at the top of the nearby tower. If you can figure out how to power it, we can use it to search the caldera from afar.

 Quest Hand-in: <Ebyssian narrows his eyes in contemplation. At last, he sighs a deep breath and sets his jaw.>We cannot act yet. We need more information, and a better opening.
Title: The Mosh'Ogg Bounty

Description: Say... have you heard about the ogres?  I got a hot tip from some fella' named Mok'thardin that some {race} schmuck in a ridiculous {class} getup found this ogre hand, and...

<Skeezy trails off as he looks you over.>

What was I just saying?  Oh yes... some SWASHBUCKLING HERO found this ogre hand, and Mok'thardin thinks it means that the ogres have some special artifact.  I've seen them guarding a chest up in some ruins behind their mound.  Care to fetch it for me?

 Quest Hand-in: <Skeezy struggles fruitlessly to open the box.>Those ogres really know how to close a treasure chest, I'll tell you what.  A box is useless to me, hero.  We're going to need to find a way into this crate.
Title: Close Enough to Touch

Description: He is near, {name}, I can feel it.

We must scour this place in search of my husband. I fear if we do not find him soon it will be too late.

You have been courageous throughout our search. I know you will not fail me now, {name}.

Thank you, and please hurry.

 Quest Hand-in: This cannot be!
Title: Aiding Maldraxxus

Description: The allies we have here in Maldraxxus may be few, but we cannot turn our backs on them. Every hand we pull out of darkness and into our fold, is a hand that can hold a weapon or wand.

Walk our lands, find those seeking aid, and provide it. Crush our enemies, and show them that we are at once everywhere. Make them fear you.

Fear is the seed that breeds doubt, and doubt is the root that crumbles empires.

 Quest Hand-in: Our rival houses will think twice before stepping foot outside of their strongholds again. Blood and glory to you, Maw Walker.
Title: Where Did Those Darn Gnomes Go?

Description: Despite the good that we've done here, I feel bad about one thing: driving Toshley and his gnome friends away.

We had no choice; they were making a mess of our efforts in the grove with all of their technology and experimentation.

I would appreciate it if you would find out what became of them.  Last we heard, they headed east across the bridge.  I'm certain that they must have turned south, away from Thunderlord Stronghold.

Look for a clue as to their whereabouts in the southern Jagged Ridge.

 Quest Hand-in: SYLVANAAR?  COMMANDER SKYSHADOW?THIS DOES NOT COMPUTE!BACK AWAY BEFORE I AM FORCED TO PLAY LOUD SOUNDS AT YOU!
Title: Into The Pit!

Description: The felstalker pits?!

There's no time to waste, {name}!

 I canna' tell ye what the Burnin' Legion has planned for ol' Brambley, but it canna' be good!

Hurry! We've got to find him before the Burnin' Legion has their way with him!

 Quest Hand-in: It canna' be true!Brambley... my dear ol' friend! Why did ye have to go an' die?
Title: Poke and Prod

Description: While your commander has his focus diluted by his loathing of your Alliance rivals, you can depend on me to direct my attention squarely on the real enemy here - the Lich King and his minions.

In order to hold any hope of conquering him at the citadel, your people must take and hold each gate.

For now, let us focus on the first. Return to the front and prod their defenses. Look for any sign of weakness that we might exploit.

I'll await your report, {class}.

 Quest Hand-in: Really, <class>?Nothing notable to report?I beg to differ...
Title: Catapult Destruction

Description: Did you see the catapults lined up on the way over here?

Seems like the ogres are planning to hurl who knows what at our camp. Good thing I came prepared!

Cork gave me some of his explosives as a contingency plan.

I was going to save them for some enemies back in Orgrimmar... but I suppose you should use them here instead.

Blow up the catapults before they fire on our camp!

 Quest Hand-in: Good work! You didn't happen to save any of those explosives, did you?...I didn't think so. Oh well! I have plenty of other ways to blow up my enemies.
Title: The Scent of Magic

Description: This is the last known location of the missing Kirin Tor. There isn't much evidence, other than a torn piece of cloth, which looks to be from one of our tabards.

The scrap may be small, but it should be heavy with the essence of magic. We can only hope that Baron can catch the scent and track down the mages.

 Quest Hand-in: The Houndmaster is an ancient and powerful demon who has attacked our world once before.His return could have dire consequences for mages throughout Azeroth.
Title: Whispers in the Wind

Description: You hear dem, {class}? De voices from de cave. Dey want to talk, but dey ain't got no breath.

Let's find a way to listen. De Twilight's Hammer, dey talk to de wind. Go to de Twilight Breach south of here, and grab de Windspeaker Charm from de camp. It'll be atop a stone pillar.

We'll need us de breath of the elementals, too! Slay de Storm Vortexes and take what joo need.

 Quest Hand-in: Dat's de stuff, mon!Now can you hear dem? De spirits, dey be talkin', but dey say nothing nice.Let us bring dem to de light.
Title: Magical Mystery Tour!

Description: <Lady Moonberry's voice rises from the scroll.>

{name}! It seems Huln got into some trouble. And--well--it's complicated. We could really use your help in Revendreth! Please meet me at Dominance Keep.

See you soon!

 Quest Hand-in: I'm glad you could get here so quickly! We've run into a little bit of a hiccup.
Title: Flying Colors

Description: The Rumpus was your final test. You have mastered the disciplines taught at this monastery.
