Just as your training began with a banquet, so shall it end. High Elder Cloudfall should be waiting at the banquet grounds. I'll be right behind you.

 Quest Hand-in: Congratulations, <name>. While your traineeship was strictly honorary, your results were undeniably impressive. The young ones look up to you.Groundskeeper Wu had this prepared for you. Please, use it as you see fit.
Title: Temple of Sethraliss: Avatar of the Loa

Description: We cannot let Mythrax bring his destruction upon this world once more. 

We need our loa now more than ever, but she has yet to return to us.

The time of her rebirth has passed. Someone, or something, must be preventing her awakening.

Enter her resting place and see what you can uncover.

 Quest Hand-in: Behold, <name>. Sethraliss has returned.
Title: A Walk With the Spirits

Description: The spiritwalker you saved from Riverbend has been insufferable since his arrival. He is insisting on showing you the ways of our people so that you better understand what is to come.

He is a strange one, even by spiritwalker standards.

Even so, only a fool would discard his insight. Please, go to speak with him when you get a moment.

 Quest Hand-in: You made Mayla smile. That is the first time I have seen her smile in... ever?
Title: Ogre Bashin'

Description: Glopgut ogres! I'd say they was dumb as a sack of hammers, but I have more respect for me hammers than that.

We've fought off their raids for years, but if they're bold enough to steal one of our own, we're gonna have to learn them a lesson.

Help us smack around some Glopgut ogres! Kill their pounders, hurlers, or bashers either out here or - better - inside the cave. That'll show 'em. 

 Quest Hand-in: Har! My men could learn a lot by watching you work. Well done.
Title: Got Silk?

Description: Strange noises comin' from over at the Silken Fields.

Strange smells, too.

Almost makes you think that they could use a cash-strapped {class} to complete a few odd jobs for 'em. Make a few pieces of gold.

Or not.

 Quest Hand-in: Greetings, <class>. Welcome to the Silken Fields.
Title: He Called Himself Altruis...

Description: A being riding atop a nether drake arrived in town late last week. He introduced himself as Altruis and then proceeded to ask us several questions about Nagrand.

He claimed that he was hunting Legion. That such insanity was actually his job. Can you imagine? A person that would willingly hunt demons?

Before he left, he asked that we let the would-be heroes in town know that he will be staying in western Nagrand for awhile and that should they seek a purpose, to find him.

 Quest Hand-in: Does my appearance startle you? Do you know what I am?
Title: All this Hammering

Description: The anvils have not been quiet since the Dragon Isles awoke. The anvils are doing fine, but our hammers are starting to crack. To keep up with the demand, we need to restock.

 Quest Hand-in: You can't have enough hammers can you? Your skill is progressing well. Here, have this to study so you can continue to improve your blacksmithing.
Title: Pearl in the Deeps

Description: <The oracle draws a circle in the sand, then points down into the deeps. There is something round down there that she is after, perhaps a pearl or stone?

The oracle motions for you to wait a moment before you leave. She waves her hands around frantically, then places them under her mouth, mimicking two large fangs.

You take this as a warning that there may be something waiting for you in the icy darkness.>

 Quest Hand-in: <The oracle takes the pearl from you and rubs it gently before peering deeply into its shimmering depths.>
Title: Warriors' Redemption

Description: Those that surrendered when Honor's Stand fell are no longer worthy of our Horde, {class}. But I'm not giving up on them yet. The prison tower below us is lightly guarded. Let's give those prisoners one final chance to die with honor.

I've set up ropes that will allow you to quickly clamber up and down the mountain. Slip down, acquire the confiscated weapons, and re-arm the prisoners inside the tower.

And {name}, stay by the tower! We're not yet equipped for an assault on the base proper.

 Quest Hand-in: From up here I got the perfect view of the havoc you just caused, <name>. Our lost brothers reclaimed some of their dignity, and the Alliance dogs were sent scrambling. Sharp work, my friend!If the Alliance sleeps comfortably at night, we are not doing our job.We will never let up.We will never give in.
Title: Iteration is Key

Description: You've been holding out on me!

Here I was, thinking that we're friends now and yet you neglected to tell me about your magnificient wrench!

<Christy inspects it closely.>

Well, not too magnificient... I recognize the Ub3r-Spanner from its blueprints, but whoever built this lacks a certain level of craftsmanship.

I will upgrade it for you. Bring me the Overcharged Mecha-core from a mechanocrawler.

No excuses. I will fix your mistakes.

 Quest Hand-in: This will only take a minute. Keep a close eye on what I do, and you will learn a thing or ten.
Title: The Only Choice We Can Make

Description: Take this torch, {name}. 

We cannot reverse the Nightmare corruption once it has taken hold. All we can hope to do is destroy its manifestations.

Incinerate the root. Only then can we rest easy in Suramar.

 Quest Hand-in: What a disturbing tale!
Title: Flight Test

Description: I fix these to my arms... then they become wings, yes?

Then I jump off cliff. And fly!

You watch?

 Quest Hand-in: Hmm... did not work. What else, what else...
Title: Trinket Bandits

Description: The gnolls have quite a collection of trinkets. Tuskarr trinkets. They have either stolen them from our villages, or worse, from the brave tuskarr that fell in battle against them. These trinkets are our heritage and should reside with us.

If you bring some back to me, I will teach you the techniques that are used to make them.

 Quest Hand-in: I recognize these trinkets. I remember those they originally belonged to. Thank you for returning them to us.
Title: Salvaging the Remains

Description: Forgotten Hill has been overrun with zombies and ghouls ever since we reclaimed this wretched isle.  We have tried to clear them out many times but they always seem to come back.

One of our lieutenants recommended taking the ghouls' bones when we kill them in hopes that they can't reincarnate overnight.  Think you can help us out with this one?

 Quest Hand-in: I didn't think you would be able to do it, <name>.  You are just full of surprises aren't you?
Title: Follow the Path

Description: Maldraxxus must answer for their crimes against Bastion. There shall be justice!

Let us go to Oribos and speak with the Tal-Inara, the Honored Voice. We will tell her what has transpired this day. Tell her that the kyrian will not stand idle against this aggression.

Artemede will inform the Archon. My brothers and sisters will surely prepare for war.

That must not come to pass.

 Quest Hand-in: I know why you have come. This kyrian has explained much.
Title: Anima Salvage

Description: Revendreth is not a place that many souls choose to go, but it is a place that they must go. Here, their sins are laid bare before them, and they are broken and re-formed to function in our society.

This is a necessary part of the cycle.

Yet now, the cycle is broken, and are unable to serve our great purpose.

In order for us to do our work we require Anima. Travel to Torghast, Maw Walker, gather that which we can not. Without it, we wither and fade.

 Quest Hand-in: These Anima Embers will serve us well, Maw Walker.
Title: Unconventional Inventions

Description: The workshop is bustling with the whir of minds and motors. We're coming up with new inventions all the time.

Try out today's glorious invention on the workbench behind me.

 Quest Hand-in: Nice invention!
Title: Ashes in Ashenvale

Description: Darkshore may be battered and broken, but thanks to you, we've achieved some amount of safety here. Some amount of peace. We've much rebuilding to do.

You should continue on, friend. Garrosh has pressed the full might of his Horde against us in Ashenvale. They will kill all of us and chop the forest clear if we don't step forward to stop them.

If we are to have any hope of not losing those forests entirely, we'll need your help. Follow the road to the south and find Sentinel Shyela.

 Quest Hand-in: Good to see a new face around here!The forest crawls with Horde, but my assignment requires that I keep this outpost safe. I could really use someone who might be up for a good fight.
Title: Pristine Iron Amulet

Description: This artifact has been restored to a remarkably excellent condition.  Perhaps you will put it on display at the Seat of Knowledge, so that lorewalkers and archaeologists can study it.

 Quest Hand-in: This will aid lorewalkers and archaeologists in understanding the history of Pandaria.
Title: Nexus-Prince Shaffar's Personal Chamber

Description: Only the most steadfast and battle-hardened of adventurers will take me up on this offer, {name}. Should you wish to face the horrors of the second stasis chamber in the Mana-Tombs, I am able to synthesize a key. Bring me a mark of the Nexus-King and I will make it so.

 Quest Hand-in: As promised, here is the key to Shaffar's personal stasis chamber.
Title: Delas in Dalaran

Description: Delas Moonfang needs our help. In-turn, she will aid us to decrypt the Codex of Command.

I implore you to seek her out as soon as possible. She is known to enjoy the memorial dedicated to the fallen, great leader of the Kirin Tor, Antonidas.

 Quest Hand-in: Goddess be praised that you are here, <name>. I'm hoping that you can aid me.
Title: Give Sassy the News

Description: I'd celebrate with you, {name}, but it feels like that dragon did a number on ol' Mount Kajaro. I... uh... I think I'm gonna grab my stuff and get on the first ship leaving the island!

Anyways, you should probably head back to headquarters and let Sassy know that you won the footbomb title for us. I'm sure she'll also want to know about the dragon and Mount Kajaro.

Good luck!

 Quest Hand-in: You're kidding, right?! DEATHWING?!!!<Sassy looks panicked for a moment.>Okay, this'll work out just fine. We'll throw your party and by the time it's over, I'm sure that the dragon will be long gone and the ground will stop shaking.If not, we can always charter a ship off of the island.
Title: Learn to Ride at the Exodar

Description: This pamphlet advertising riding training and mount purchases was sent from Aalun.

Aalun can be found at the entrance to the Exodar on Azuremyst Isle.

 Quest Hand-in: So, shall we begin your Apprentice Riding training?
Title: Poisoning the Brood

Description: Now we have room for our plan to kill Hir'eek. You see, {name}, my specialty is in making potions and poisons.

I am working on a poison to use on Hir'eek, when de time comes. I have no idea if it will work or not.

I want you to take what I already made and use it on de bats around here. It should kill dem instantly. 

If it works, den I can make it stronger with my voodoo and give us a chance at killing Hir'eek.

 Quest Hand-in: I knew my poison would work! I just need to put a bit more of my voodoo in dere for it to be ready for Hir'eek.
Title: Shark Tank

Description: I hate sharks.  All of my troops hate sharks too.  This is where you come in, {name}.

I need you to head up to the Cape of Lost Hope and take out a huge shark named Tank.  Tank is not to be trifled with so I would bring a few friends if I were you.

 Quest Hand-in: No way, you actually killed him?  We are having shark tacos tonight for sure!
Title: The Twilight Plot

Description: We came here to investigate rumors of a Titan artifact up at the Masters' Gate to the southwest.

One of those Twilight's Hammer cultists must have the plans for what they're doing up there. You're going to have to get them for us, {name}.

Keep searching the cultists until you find them.

 Quest Hand-in: <Mowi takes a look at the plans that you hand to her.>But... but, this is just gibberish!What does this even say? What language is that?
Title: Stand Tall, Captain!

Description: Well, well, well... still alive I see. That's good, because Mor'ghor has requested your presence in his tower at once. Get a move on!

 Quest Hand-in: <Mor'ghor nods.>That's right, I said captain. You've earned another promotion, <name>.You certainly don't work like any fel orc I've ever seen. Keep this up and you might make overlord some day.Now get out there and take command. I would suggest you try and earn your Skybreaker wings.
Title: Killing the Quilen

Description: We've taken care of the scout problem for now, but there are still advance mogu forces inside the Guo-Lai Halls down the hill.

Unfortunately, their vicious guard dogs are protecting their operations deeper in the ruins.

Go and dispatch of their beasts. Be on your guard - they can be quite good at blending into their surroundings.

 Quest Hand-in: Good. Those dogs know no mercy, so it's good that you showed them none.
Title: Einar the Runecaster

Description: Being a leader is not just about sending your troops to combat. You will also make decisions about how we train and improve our armies.

Speak to Einar the Runecaster and let him know how you would like development to progress.

 Quest Hand-in: A wise choice, <name>.
Title: The Power Possessed

Description: Our goals have been met, warlock, and it is time we part ways.  I think I will be glad to see the last of you.

Go on, return to your dark masters. We are done here.

 Quest Hand-in: Friend has the weapon? Yes, Calydus can feel its power!
Title: Special Treatment

Description: <The mud mask looks curious about your intentions, but it is cornered on this branch!>

 Quest Hand-in: Oh, wow. Look at all that snot on them.<Zeldis pauses.>You know, I think they were going out of style anyway.Keep that sludge away from me. Or keep it as a pet, whatever floats your boat.
Title: Nursery Direction

Description: I'm so grateful that Lasztak has accepted the Calling of a Whelptender! Especially given how many of the precious little things are teething right now.

Beyond that, the nursery gardens are admittedly facing challenges. The whelps are stressed and the tenders are--well, more stressed than usual.

Please, whenever you have a spare moment, find me in the gardens below. We could use your help as well!

 Quest Hand-in: Thank goodness you're here! You may have noticed the bees on your way in. We must do something about them!
Title: Back to Boralus

Description: That should just about do it for now, then. We'll be in touch if the fighting heats back up again. No doubt it'll be any day now.

 Quest Hand-in: You're all caught up? Excellent.Holding a firm line in Arathi is critical to the Alliance's continued occupation of Lordaeron. We appreciate your support, both now and in the inevitable upcoming battle.
Title: Productive Pests

Description: This jungle is a whole new habitat for creatures and critters. A shame we're here to deal with Alliance driftwood.

I've got an idea and I think it's genius. Two words: Poison bugs.

First, I need some bugs. Crawling and flying ones, just to be thorough for our test.

 Quest Hand-in: These are going to be great!
Title: The Firelord

Description: With his gatekeeper gone, you've given the Guardians of Hyjal access to Sulfuron Spire.

Ragnaros will have no choice but to defend the main entryway to the Firelands himself.

Go through the Twilight's Hammer portal at the Sanctum of the Prophets and meet me inside.  Malfurion and Hamuul will also aid us while the others continue to fight the enemy outside.

 Quest Hand-in: Hyjal has been saved, <name>.  And it's all thanks to you.
Title: One Size Does Not Fit All

Description: Lad, who's the genius that made our cannons a non-standard size? Now we have ta make special cannonballs ta shoot out o' the infernal contraptions!

I would look kindly on ye if ye would go out and find the balls we've already shot. No doubt with the way these louts shoot they be all o'er the place ta the south and east.

<The cannoneer spaces his hands apart to give you an idea of how big the cannonballs are.>

That would be faster than us making 'em from scratch fer a certainty.

 Quest Hand-in: Oh, bless ya, <name>, bless ya!Just set 'em down right where yer standin'. I'll have one o' the boys come load 'em up soon enough and we can stop worryin' 'bout runnin' out o' balls ta shoot at Skorn.
Title: A Call to Service

Description: We may hold the Seat of the Primus, but it will do us no good without the anima to power it.

As you fight beside our troops on the battlefield, seek out opportunities to recover anima to support the war effort.

Speak with Sergeant Romark. He can offer you additional guidance.

 Quest Hand-in: There is much to be done, Maw Walker.
Title: The Scamps

Description: You there! You have legs and a need for money? I wish to hire you.

Confounded, despicable, parentless children have been stealing my scrolls again. Those scrolls are dangerous in the wrong hands.

What is worse, I believe these junior vagabonds to be organized.

Find these street scamps and relieve them of their bounty, and I shall pay you for it.

 Quest Hand-in: It pains me to pay you for something I could have done myself when I was younger, but these legs do not move as swiftly as they once did.
Title: Return to Rest

Description: The spirits of our ancestors are reliving one of the most revered battles in our history at the Tu Shen Burial Grounds to the east.

Do as I ask, {race}, and honor their gravestones. Remind them that they are respected even these many years later, and that they are deserving of peaceful rest.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you, my friend. You respect for our ancestors means a great deal.
Title: A Necessary Distraction

Description: The weapons are authentic, as we feared.  Illidan is training demon hunters at the Ruins of Karabor and we must put an end to it.

Do not be fooled by their name, {name}, their power will be used against us as often as against any demon.

Their warlocks summon and subdue demons to be used as part of the initiates' training.  A pit lord named Azaloth has proven too strong to be used in training and is kept banished.  Find a way to let him loose on his captors.  That should buy us the time we need.

 Quest Hand-in: Let us hope that distraction bought us the time we need to fully learn what we need of the training grounds at Karabor.
Title: The Call of the World-Shaman

Description: The Earthen Ring calls to you once more, {name}.

As a member of the Alliance, I know that you may have reservations working with the one you call Thrall, the former Warchief of the Horde. But he has specifically requested an Alliance hero to accompany him in his next endeavor, a ritual of healing that will profoundly impact our world.

Cast aside your doubts, {class}, and heed the world-shaman's call.

You will find him under the boughs of Nordrassil in Mount Hyjal, on the southern side of the tree.

 Quest Hand-in: It would appear my message has been heard in Stormwind.Thank you, <name>. Let us get to work...
Title: Assault on Shattrath Harbor

Description: Shattrath City is in the hands of Sargerei forces under the leadership of the traitor Exarch, Socrethar.

Members of the Sha'tari Defense have been requesting aid against the Shadow Council forces in the eastern portions of the city.

 Quest Hand-in: Word of the assault has already made it back, as have some spoils from the fight.Well done sir, if you don't mind me saying.
Title: Dressed to Impress

Description: Every man's got to learn his own lessons I suppose.

Here, take my wizard hat. I have no doubt that he'll take you on as an apprentice if you look the role... you just might have to jump through some hoops first. Tiny flaming hoops, suspended over spikes, with spinning blades on the other side.

You should be able to find an image of Xylem on top of that hill to the northeast.

 Quest Hand-in: Well look at you, aren't you just a marvel of modern Magery! Quite a fancy hat, I must say.Apprentices. Apprentici? I do think that I might have quite a few already, but I suppose one can never have too many appren..tici.
Title: An Unstoppable Force

Description: Now is the time to strike, {name}. 

Passing through the wall will not be easy, but I think it's something you can handle. Do what you must to prevail, and meet me on the other side. I will lead a squad of sturdy soldiers and as many demolishers as can survive the passing.

We may not make it to Darnassus today, but the outcome of this war does not rest on one victory alone -- it will come as the result of a thousand small victories.

So let's get started, shall we?

 Quest Hand-in: Malfurion will return with his forces, but until then let's press on.
Title: Claim Korthun's End

Description: You are seeink spies up above?  This is not good... not good at all, comrade.

Return to Korthun's End and destroy them, my friend.

 Quest Hand-in: You did well, <name>.  We need to be especially wary of Horde attacks right now.  The Pincer X2 has plenty of firepower at sea, but in the back of this cave, she is exceptionally vulnerable.
Title: All Brawn, No Brains

Description: Varsek is one of the toughest drakonids you'll ever meet. One of the dumbest ones too, but he'll never admit that.

He got spooked after Frostbite and started re-evaluating his life or... something. Said he never got to study the ruins left behind by his ancestors. Ran off to be a "scholar".

Get Varsek back here. He doesn't belong there anyhow!

 Quest Hand-in: It's very nice to meet you, but as you can see, I'm a bit busy trying to solve this puzzle.
Title: Meet Me in the Cavern

Description: It's time, {class}. Time to face the masters.

 Quest Hand-in: You made it. Good.Getting in here was nothing compared to what's to come.
Title: Tomb Raidering

Description: I said to myself over and over, "Don't go near the citadel. Don't go near the citadel." But what did I do? I went to the citadel. Almost had my hands on that sweet treasure chest before I got chased off by a bunch of crazy demons. I made it out of there with just my helmet and my life!

 Quest Hand-in: Did you bother to read the label on this potion? I'm going to assume, no. You may find some sucker who will pay you for it.Better luck next time kid.
Title: Dark Omens

Description: We won't be able to defeat Kruul alone.

Once the portal has stabilized I will send word so we can bring the Highlord to justice.

In the meantime, you should inform the Kirin Tor of Vazuun's death - and Kruul's return.

 Quest Hand-in: Any luck out there?
Title: Fear No Evil

Description: Have you embraced the Holy Light yet, brother? It is through the Holy Light that we are saved! It is through the Holy Light that I am able to heal these overly demanding soldiers! And it is through the Holy Light that you will be able to venture out into the field to the north and rescue our fallen brothers!

Take this prayer book with you into the field and cast the Light's healing touch on the injured.

 Quest Hand-in: I think you now understand the power of the Light. The Light giveth hope, brother and the Light taketh from the darkness! BLESSED BE THE LIGHT!
Title: Crushing the Wildhammer

Description: Since my people first claimed the Highlands, the Wildhammer dwarves have been our persistent foe. We fought them in Grim Batol, we fought them in the Wetlands, and even now open warfare rages to our north, across the river, amidst the Thundermar Ruins.

Prove your valor to me. Seek out and crush Wildhammer Warbrands. The best among them carry insignias - my warriors collect them by the dozen.

Can you?

 Quest Hand-in: <Narkrall clenches the insignias in his weathered hand.>So, <class>. There's more to you than meets the eye.Maybe your Horde can stand with the best of my warriors. Let's try you out...
Title: Armor Scraps

Description: Battles rage constantly in Alterac Valley, and the supplies we get from Ironforge are not enough to outfit our experienced troops.

If you find armor scraps from the battlefield, aid the war effort and bring those scraps to me!

 Quest Hand-in: These are some good pieces, <name>.  I can use them to fashion new equipment for our troops.If my supply level gets high enough, then maybe our seasoned fighting units will enter the field!
Title: Taken by the Swarm

Description: There's something different about this mantid swarm. Instead of just killing everything in sight like the mantid usually do, they've taken to capturing our defenders and holding them alive.

I really don't want to know what they have in store for the captives. 

Why don't you go rescue them so we don't have to find out?

 Quest Hand-in: You've freed them? Oh, thank goodness!I cannot fathom what a mantid would want to do with live prisoners, but it cannot be good!
Title: Follow the Recipe

Description: This seems to be part of a recipe for whatever concoction the Crown Chemical Company is cooking up. The other parts must be nearby.

 Quest Hand-in: Aha! With this we can start on an antidote for this awful mixture. Thank you for bringing this to me.
Title: Talbuk Training: Rakkiri

Description: Now that your talbuk has got a taste for combat, let's take it out into an environment it may not be familiar with.

The icy bluffs of Frostfire Ridge should be a good test. Find yourself a big, mean beast out there and take it down with your talbuk.

 Quest Hand-in: Oi! That talbuk's performin' admirably. Let's let 'er rest.
Title: Legend of the Animaswell

Description: <This appears to be an incomplete set of notes detailing one archivist's search for a mythical font of anima hidden somewhere deep in Korthia.

Watcher Vesperbloom in the Heart of the Forest would be able to help you put together a team to search for it.>

 Quest Hand-in: <Watcher Vesperbloom carefully studies the documents you brought her.>The documentation is incomplete. It is unclear if the archivist even survived...But the tales of the anima are incredible, and there are enough details here to launch an expedition.It will not be easy. The archivist warns of many dangers protecting the anima source...
Title: The Good Ol' Switcheroo

Description: Look, I'd love to give the order and have my men blast these rebels to bits right now, but I can't because the entire Stockade is under Warden Thelwater's jurisdiction, and he only wants to contain them right now.

Rather than disobey orders, we're going to take care of this in a slightly different manner! We've managed to befriend Mortimer Moloch, who just so happens to be the ruthless rebel leader Randolph Moloch's twin. Kill Randolph, and we'll switch 'em so Mortimer can stop the rebellion peacefully!

 Quest Hand-in: Yes, Mortimer just faked his own death. He'll probably take on his brother's name and continue on his 'epic schemes'. We'll just have to deal with that when the time comes.
Title: The Vindicaar

Description: Everything is prepared for our assault. We need only establish the beacon to transport us to the vessel.

Once the beacon arrives, place your hand upon its surface to board the Vindicaar, the instrument of our retribution.

 Quest Hand-in: I have waited many years for this day.Behold the triumph of the draenei, the Vindicaar!
Title: Something to Wear

Description: I've got an idea for how you can get close to their leaders without getting killed. But first, you're going to need to find something to wear.

My suggestion is that you head up there and get their armor from them.

 Quest Hand-in: <Lakota looks worried about the condition of the armor, especially the bloodstains.>You sure don't fool around, do you, <name>? Well, it'll have to do.
Title: The Earth Rises

Description: The effects of the Twilight's Hammer attack can be felt even here, this close to the world tree.

As our forests burn, the very earth turns against us in a crazed frenzy.

We can't allow the elementals to go unchecked.  Go and help our men take care of them.

 Quest Hand-in: I thank you, <name>.  Your fighting prowess is admirable.  You will be crucial to putting a halt to the elemental onslaught.
Title: Stalking the Stalkers

Description: Many brave trolls have been lost to the harsh wilds of the Hinterlands, {race}. The Silvermane wolves are one of the biggest threats to our hunters. They lay in wait, hiding amongst the bushes and landscape, then strike out when the opportunity presents itself.

This type of ferocity will not go unchecked!

You must think like the Silvermane. Stalk the stalkers! Slay them all!

 Quest Hand-in: A job well done, <race>. The Revantusk thank you for your contribution.
Title: Infernal Encroachment

Description: Listen up, now. An' lookie here.

<Thargad points off to the east.>

Yeh see them big green glowin' balls that be fallin' from the sky?

Those be a nasty buncha demons roamin' the lands unchecked. Well, almost unchecked... I've been keepin' 'em on their toes, givin' 'em sumthin' ta think about.

How 'bout you get over there an' pick up where I left off?

 Quest Hand-in: Well, lad!Don't hesitate to knock a few more down for good measure!
Title: A Long Walk

Description: The Arbiter awaits us. Though few are allowed within the Crucible, several who hail from Azeroth have been granted permission to bear witness as he passes judgment on Sylvanas.

Yet we are far from the only ones affected by all the carnage Sylvanas has wrought. Her actions have brought pain and suffering to a great many.

Screaming back at the Banshee as she passes might be their only chance to speak their mind. Let them be heard.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you for joining us, my friend. I felt it important that you be here to witness this moment.
Title: The Speaker of Elune

Description: Fortune smiles upon us, {name}. We have found a soul in Ardenweald who was once a Night Warrior in life, as Tyrande is now. 

His name is Thiernax. I am told he assists in tending to the spirits resting in the Garden of Night.

Seek him out and petition him for aid. I pray he will have wisdom to share.

 Quest Hand-in: <Qadarin watches Thiernax race off. He sighs before turning to you.>My apologies. Thiernax may have seemed curt, but there is a reason for his reluctance to speak of the Night Warrior.If you have a moment to help me out in the garden, I can elaborate. Then I will see what can be done to convince Thiernax to help your mother.
Title: Mystery at Citrine Bay

Description: The Burning Legion invades Azeroth, and SI:7 is wasting valuable resources hunting down and assassinating one of their top agents?

Something isn't adding up...

We need to find out how deep this goes. Why was Amber Kearnen being hunted by her own organization?

The encrypted letter she was carrying may hold the clues... but we need more information.

The SI:7 assassins you tailed in Dalaran mentioned Citrine Bay... search Citrine Bay for clues and we'll see about getting this letter decrypted.

 Quest Hand-in: Ye had best keep ye voice below whispers, matey... thar be a band 'o pirates ahead! Fer sure, these be not th' type ye want to mess around wit'...
Title: Stunning View

Description: Gargoyles make effective scouts and can be deadly if left to rain attacks from the air, but they have a very obvious weakness. Most of them have to go through long periods resting as stone to maintain the energy they need to carry their heavy bodies through the air.

As I peered through the eye you were using, I noticed dozens of iceskin sentries resting on the eastern and southern walls inside. Use the stalker to leap up to their ledges and devastate them while they sleep.

 Quest Hand-in: Not so much of a threat when they're sleeping.
Title: Blueprint: Charm of Focus

Description: <You have discovered plans for a charm that seems to energize your soulbinds in the Path of Ascension.

Dactylis should be able to help you with crafting this charm.>

 Quest Hand-in: I see you have retrieved a new blueprint. I look forward to assisting you in your crafting.
Title: Remaining Threats

Description: We have managed to route the Horde presence in Darkshore, but several threats remain throughout the countryside.

If we wish to hold this land, they must be eliminated.

 Quest Hand-in: You have strengthened our position and brought some measure of safety to the people of DarkshoreYou have my thanks.
Title: Seekers of Corruption

Description: If anyone would know more about the "corruption" the tablet spoke of, it would be the Suntouched that were put in charge of rooting it out.

Of course, I doubt they'll be willing to turn over any information voluntarily.

Luckily for me, you're a bit of a specialist at brute force investigation, aren't you?

 Quest Hand-in: So the Amathet aren't working with N'Zoth after all! That's a relief!Of course, that doesn't make them any less hostile to us, but it's a start!
Title: The Missing Crew

Description: I can't believe it. Almost the entire fleet... lost! 

We need to have ships out there on missions supporting our efforts, but how am I supposed to do that now?

If we are going to recover from this, I'm going to need my top people. I know the chances are low, but I need you to get out there and try to find them. Alive if possible.

 Quest Hand-in: Well, I suppose that's better than nothing. Let's get to work.
Title: A Worthy Weapon

Description: Of all the times to have such rotten luck!

My tournament blade has gone missing. I've heard the bards telling tales of travelers offering winter hyacinths to a lonely maiden in return for gifts. Those hyacinths grow only on the ice flowing from the Ironwall Dam, on Crystalsong Forest's northwestern border with Icecrown. Gather the flowers and take them to the circle of lamps in Drak'Mar Lake in northeastern Dragonblight, near Zul'Drak and Grizzly Hills. Ask the lonely maiden for a worthy blade.

 Quest Hand-in: <Ambrose accepts the Blade of Drak'Mar from you.>A fine weapon, and perfectly balanced. It will serve me well in the next match.
Title: Clearing the Depths

Description: You are a sight for sore eyes, {name}.  Now that we have claimed Tol Barad, the battle has just begun.

We discovered a cell block just east of here that we need you to clear out.  Turns out that its chock full of ghosts that have been locked up down there for who knows how long.

Clear out as much as you can and report back to me when you are done.

 Quest Hand-in: You made it back out alive?  You are a stronger man than I, <name>.
Title: Azerite Denial

Description: This substance, Azerite, is hurting Onu... and the Horde seem eager to collect it for themselves.

We must not let that happen. Collect as much Azerite as you can find. Ensure the Horde do not retrieve it.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent work... this Azerite is a powerful substance indeed. We must not allow the Horde to get their hands on it.
Title: Into the Soulgrinder

Description: The grimoire is the key to Skulloc's downfall.

Read aloud from the book at Soulgrinder's Barrow to initiate the ritual.  An object known as the Soulgrinder will appear, as well as Skulloc's ghostly victims, who will try to destroy it.  You must keep them from doing so long enough to force Skulloc fully into the world.

Find the barrow by heading north through the Daggermaw Canyon on the other side of the Circle of Blood.  It is on the right side before Gruul's Lair.

Bring back Skulloc's soul.

 Quest Hand-in: It is over then.  You have freed us from the shackles of our enslavement to the Sons of Gruul.  You have given the Bloodmaul Clan a reprieve from certain extinction.Words cannot describe the extent of the debt that ALL of the ogres of the Blade's Edge Mountains, Bloodmaul and Bladespire alike, owe you, <name>.Look down, even now the ogres gather to pay you tribute.  Let Gruul and his puppet, the old king, Maulgar, cower within their lair.  Go to the ogres below as our new king!
Title: Sealing Fate: Piles of Gold

Description: Twice the cost of the last, but maybe that's worth the price. Or, perhaps a different currency would be easier for you?  I leave the choice up to you.

Remember, you can only obtain three seals per week.  This counts as one of those three.  Next week, I will have others.

 Quest Hand-in: A simple exchange with complex results.  That's the art of doing business.
Title: A Gift From the Six

Description: {name}, without you some of the Legion's strongest agents would still be roaming Azeroth, threatening to undermine all that we've accomplished in this war.

Such a deed merits more than mere recognition.

If you would accept it, we would like to formally reward your heroism in the face of such darkness with a portion of our power.

 Quest Hand-in: We hope the increased power to your weapon will prove useful on the Broken Shore and beyond.
Title: For Queen and Grove!

Description: A stunning performance... in more ways than one.

So much has transpired on Azeroth in my absence. But there was one dream I did not see portrayed onstage.

I dreamt of Tyrande, engulfed in darkness, twisted by anger and a thirst for vengeance. I witnessed a forbidden ritual, the rise of a new Night Warrior, and a hunt that can end only in tragedy. That too must be real.

<Ysera shakes her head.>

The Winter Queen awaits you in the Heart of the Forest. We had best be on our way.

 Quest Hand-in: Your actions here will echo beyond the veil. Aid the forest, and all mortal worlds may yet be saved.
Title: Slaying the Scavengers

Description: The rotting corpses are attracting hyena scavengers.

In addition to spreading diseases from feeding on the dead, the feral creatures will attack us on sight.

Go and eradicate the beasts. It is unfortunate, but ultimately for the best.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you, <name>. It was an unpleasant task, but it had to be done.
Title: The Tortaka Tribe

Description: Have you ever met a tortollan before? Dey have all kinds of useful scrolls and artifacts for sale.

We used to trade often with de Tortaka tribe, but we haven't seen or heard from dem in weeks.

De tribe has a village in Darkwood Shoal. We need someone to make contact with dem and reestablish our trading partnership.

 Quest Hand-in: You're from the troll tribe at the arena? I'm afraid we don't have much to trade right now...
Title: Pay It Forward

Description: You are now able to move about this realm more freely and without fear of drowning.

This is where our work begins.

First, you have many allies nearby who are drowning as we speak. As I saved you, you must save them.

I have enchanted the shell you brought me. Use it to rescue your friends.

Hurry now!

 Quest Hand-in: While you were away, I was able to revive some of the fallen soldiers.We'll need every hand if we are to survive here.
Title: Plug the Geysers

Description: The geysers are dangerously unstable and will be erupting any moment now.

I fear that Azshara's misuse of the Tidestone is causing irreparable damage to the elements within Nazjatar.

We have to do what we can to prevent any further destruction.

Take this sealant and use it to stave off the next round of eruptions. In the meantime, I will do what I can to stabilize the elements.

 Quest Hand-in: Good work, <name>. Thanks to your help sealing the geysers, I've been able to stabilize the elements and redirect the pressure to a safer location.
Title: Grand Master Obalis

Description: You think yourself ready to challenge Pandaria? You truly believe that you can defeat the most powerful tamers in all of Azeroth?

I shall be the judge of that notion, {race}. Face me atop the Vir'naal Dam in Uldum, and we shall see if you are truly ready.

 Quest Hand-in: I have been proven wrong. You are prepared to face my greaters.
Title: That New Mount Smell

Description: Once every week, Mechagon expels a lot of excess oils through the outflow. That's why the place is a toxic mess!

Today they expelled a batch of Golden Cogpaste. The stuff is amazing! I make air fresheners out of it. Makes any mount smell like it's brand new!

Check all the pipes in the outflow, and see if you can collect some of this paste.

 Quest Hand-in: I was running low on Air Fresheners, this will let me whip up a new batch right away!
Title: I Will Remember

Description: I... I need a few moments, please. 

Go back to Camp Nowhere, {name}. I will meet you there.

 Quest Hand-in: It was only at the very end that I began to appreciate Lathos. I took his patience and experience for granted.We owe him our lives.<Rannan looks towards the Ruins of Karnthar.>I will never forget him.
Title: Working with Purpose

Description: It seems the Shirakess are never satisfied with the number of pearls we source for them. They're always demanding more. 

Before you came along, it was my job to crawl around the cavern, cracking open clams. 

So you see, you have some purpose, other than being a mindless sack of flesh.

 Quest Hand-in: Eager to please, aren't you?
Title: A Smokywood Pastures' Thank You!

Description: We at Smokywood Pastures appreciate the recovery of the stolen treats, {name}.  For that, we'd like to offer you a special gift... presented by none other than Greatfather Winter himself!

Please, speak with Greatfather Winter, and he will give you your Feast of Winter Veil gift from us here at Smokywood Pastures.  From our farm to your plate, it's always Smokywood Pastures wholesome goodness... thanks to you, of course!

 Quest Hand-in: Ho ho hello, adventurer!The goblins told me that you have earned a special gift this holiday season, and I am pleased to give it to you.  Here you go - have a wondrous Feast of Winter Veil this and every season in the future.
Title: Stay of Execution

Description: Come. It is time to save a friend.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank the Sunwell you were able to save Baine's life, <name>. Thank you.And Jaina Proudmoore came to his aid as well. Interesting...
Title: Blackfathom Deeps

Description: I care deeply about these forests, {class}. Things look grim here, but I would rather face the Horde alone than watch them hack and slash their way through the trees.

Travel west to Blackfathom Deeps. Once you're inside, find Sentinel Aluwyn. She's a trusted friend in need of help.

The orcs in Zoram'gar Outpost threaten her position as we speak. If they take Blackfathom, they will surely cut every tree down to fuel their insanity.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank Elune you're here! We could use all the help we can get.
Title: A Bad Deal

Description: <Carentan escaped!

Roko, the tortollan merchant who set up this deal in the first place, will want to know what happened.

When you last spoke, Roko said he would be heading to Boralus.>

 Quest Hand-in: Hmm. A scam, was it? You have my apologies for putting you in harm's way.This man should be delivered to justice. He may be in hiding now, but I am very, very patient.
Title: Claim the Sky

Description: I mourn the loss of my sisters and desire nothing more than to avenge them. Yet I know that I am no match for the witch's magics or her army of Mawsworn.

We must let wisdom guide us and fly from here. 

Though I am weak from my captivity, I have the strength to bear you from this place.

Let us go, friend.

 Quest Hand-in: Welcome to Skyhold, <name>.
Title: Crown of Dark Blossoms

Description: Such somber flowers... but they hold a beauty of their own, don't you think? If only they could last.

Allow me to lend my aid.

Every Lunar Festival, similar flowers to yours bloom around the world. They hold a special connection to Elune... one that I can empower. If you bring them to me, I can preserve them so you may enjoy them long after an ordinary flower would die.

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, what calming flowers. I sense a solemn peace emanating from them.This crown shall support you with a silent grace.
Title: Darkcloud Grimtotem

Description: There is no alternative: if you intend to win a battle, you must spill the enemy's blood. In this case, unfortunately, a lot of it.

You know what we have to do.

 Quest Hand-in: While the Earth Mother does not condone such violence, we had no choice. The Grimtotem have ignored Her teachings for too long and are reaping what they have sown.
Title: Teamwork Lesson: Fenryr

Description: <Your direbeak hatchling timidly avoided the other flying pets during their last battles together. Showing it a good example of teamwork might help.>

 Quest Hand-in: <The hatchling has taken a large puff of wolf fur for its nest, and you're not entirely sure where it was concealing it. It will need some time to recover from this adventure.>
Title: Something Old, Something Used

Description: Want new luckydos? Chordy is best at finding luckydos!

Want to go look around with Chordy?

<Chordy looks at you pleadingly with his large eye.>

 Quest Hand-in: These are valuable resources. Thank you, Maw Walker.
Title: The Dark Shaman

Description: These dark shaman have been down here for months, raising beasts and performing dark rituals.

I don't know what they aim to achieve with all of this, but it's clear that they are no friend of the Horde. That's where you come in, {name}.

Fight your way through the chasm and kill Dark Shaman Koranthal and Lava Guard Gordoth.

 Quest Hand-in: It would seem that the dark shaman experiments drove Gordoth insane.Hopefully we've seen the last of this, <name>.
Title: Wolf Training: Thundercall

Description: The elements can sometimes pose a problem for some beasts. Ever seen a ram in a thunderstorm? They'll hide behind anything larger than themselves. I'm not sure if they think the world is ending or what, but it's not great if you're atop one at the time.

In Nagrand, off on a windswept cliff high above the shore, is a creature made of pure thunderstorms. Hop atop your wolf and face off against Thundercall, and we'll see if it gets spooked.

 Quest Hand-in: Well, it's a bit wet, but seems to be in good spirits. I'll get 'er dried off and into bed.
Title: Steam Cleaning

Description: Xijan seems to think the elemental invasion on our beautiful spa is only a minor problem, but this surge of flame and steam needs to be brought under control immediately.

We had booked musical acts to play in the lower area, but the elementals destroyed their gear. As we have never had such levels of elemental destruction in this area before, I suspect Primalist influences.

If you want to help, clear the elementals on the east side of the lower spa. That is where the first events are scheduled.

 Quest Hand-in: A good start, but there are still far too many for my liking...
Title: Feast or Famine

Description: Life in Westfall's hard, sonny! Every day is a struggle. We can sometimes go weeks without a decent meal. That's why it's important that we all help each other out. Maybe you can lend a hand, eh? I'm making dirt pies and need some ingredients.

Get me some fresh dirt from the pumpkin patch out front and a bundle of coyote tails. You'll find coyotes wandering around in the wilds of Westfall.

Get moving! We got mouths to feed.

 Quest Hand-in: Just smellin' you comin' got my stomach rumblin'! We're gonna eat like kings tonight!
Title: Scouting the Breach

Description: If Ly'leth's information is accurate, there is a breach in the Sanctum of Order that could be our only way into the Nighthold.

No doubt they have magically sealed it - take Valtrois and protect her while she examines the seal. She is an exceptional talent, and I have total faith in her ability to break whatever enchantment they have cooked up.

Valtrois has her own methods of getting into the city and will meet you inside the Sanctum of Order.

 Quest Hand-in: It appears Ly'leth was correct. This is an entrance to the Nightwell - and it is well protected. Nothing is impenetrable though.Let us have a look at the ley lines powering this shield, shall we?
Title: Exodus

Description: We have no choice, {name}.  We must move further inland.

I don't like it one bit, but we're vulnerable here.

Return to the stables below the manor.  Let's get everybody on carriages and send them eastbound.  I pray it's not too late.

 Quest Hand-in: Thanks for stopping, <name>.  Our carriage got hit pretty bad.The one in front of us got it worse.
Title: The Lost Spirit

Description: It high time you an' I had a talk about ol' Vol'jin's missin' spirit. 

Dis goes beyond simple bargains and rights of passage. Spirits don' just go missin'.

You gotta few friends dat are gonna help ya track Vol'jin's spirit down. Dem who was friends to him in life should have da strength to find him in death. And if not, Talanji gonna help ya.  

Go to Talanji's ship in da Port of Zandalar. It be dat banged up ship ya came in on. You gonna do a little seance.

 Quest Hand-in: I am here because Master Gadrin and Rokhan asked for my aid and it is my gratitude for their deeds and yours that makes me willing to do this.NOT because Bwonsamdi insisted.If he can't keep track of his own spirits that is a "him" problem, not a "me" problem.
Title: Laying Claim

Description: We are not the only ones who have discovered the value of the Southmoon Ruins. The dwarves of the Explorers' League have swarmed there, taking artifacts and inscriptions for the Alliance.

I don't think I have to explain much further. We will not allow the discoveries here to fall into the hands of the Alliance. Slay as many dwarves as you can, and drive them from the ruins!

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent. The less interference from the Alliance, the better.
Title: The Blade in the Night

Description: Though my hunt has been arduous, I have two promising leads on additional Night Warriors. The first is here in Maldraxxus.

This tower contains records of those who arrived in Maldraxxus, including someone referred to as "The Blade in the Night." I believe this to be our next Night Warrior.

I encountered many traps on the way here. Doubtless we will find more within the tower. Someone is trying to stop us.

We will not let them succeed.

 Quest Hand-in: I am not opposed to helping you, but... There are matters I must attend to first.
Title: The Coast is Clear

Description: I was on the last leg of a supply run when we were shot down! They took the pets, but the supplies are scattered over this stretch of beach.

I don't know what they're planning, but I know we gotta get our supplies. You an' me, we ain't subtle.... But Speedy IV... He won't cause all them pirates to go into hiding. He can get the supplies while Stringfellowe surveils the area from the air.

Speedy's fond of you, so chat him up and let's try to recover the smoldering supplies before they all burn up.

 Quest Hand-in: We got our pet supplies back. Now we gotta get our pets.
Title: The Alchemist

Description: I know a little about alchemy from my cousin Kadar. She is the alchemist at Stonefang Outpost. If you wish to learn more, she is the one with whom to speak.

I only hope she has survived the attack.

 Quest Hand-in: My apprentice... Inside... (She dies in your arms.)
Title: Beyond Durotar

Description: Hmmph... it looks like your services are being requested elsewhere.  Ag'tor Bloodfist is looking for recruits to assist the Horde's ventures in Azshara, north of Orgrimmar.

I'm sure you still have work to do here in Durotar, and I understand that they'll shortly be asking for your help in the Barrens.  I wouldn't be going anywhere yet if I were you, but if you're itching for some manifest destiny... Azshara awaits.

 Quest Hand-in: Good, you're here.  Welcome to Azshara, the stage for the next act of the Horde's glorious future.  Now get to work.
Title: Growing Power

Description: The Tirisgarde has need of your help now that you have grown in strength, {name}. Meet me in the Hall of the Guardian when you are done with your adventures.

 Quest Hand-in: Good to see you here, <name>. There is much to be done!
Title: A Closer Look

Description: We've seen countless ships sail past the shore to the southeast, but most pass by inconspicuously.  Several days ago, however, a powerful storm carried several of the ships to shore and left them wrecked.

I'd bet a pint of Nethergarde Bitter that they were Horde ships if I didn't love Nethergarde Bitter so much.  I can pay you gold, though, if you'll go check out those ships and report back.

 Quest Hand-in: You saw worgen?  That's bad.Worgen ghosts?  That's even worse.Those weren't Horde ships... they were Gilnean.  And they must have been headed down to Surwich, at the bottom of the Tainted Forest.  That makes a lot more sense.We've got to try to help them, <name>!  The worgen are our allies!
Title: We Can Rebuild It

Description: Tools? Check. Materials? Negative.

If we're going to build this thing, you're going to have to get me the materials.

First things first, {name}. For the skeletal structure I'm going to need a large barrel from Nifflevar, some dark iron ingots from Valgarde, and industrial strength rope from Baleheim.

Nifflevar and Baleheim are vrykul towns northwest of here. Valgarde is located in Daggercap Bay, also to the northwest. Speak with McGoyver to get the ingots. He'll fly you back here once you're all done.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent. These combined with the skin will make for a flawless clone of the constructs the iron dwarves use.
Title: Temple of Tyranny

Description: Tyrant Velhari was once a promising vindicator, but has turned to Shadow for reasons known only to her.

Purge this Eredar of darkness.

 Quest Hand-in: Anotha follower of da darkness falls before ya.
Title: A Steady Hand

Description: The black walnut extract you purchased from Miss Whiteblossom is but one of many extracts we keep in stock for various applications.

Blushleaf extract can be gathered from the flowers in the Waxwood Forest to the west. Several units can be extracted from one flower, but only those with calm nerves and steady hands can remove all of the extract from one flower.

 Quest Hand-in: Do not forget to wash your hands. Blushleaf stains forever.
Title: Rastakhan

Description: You stand before General Jakra'zet, lord of de armies of Zandalar, enforcer of her seas and bringer of war.

And I do not like you. 

It took years to earn my place here after your Horde laid waste to my people. You will not undo what I have built.

I will see you kneel before King Rastakhan. I will watch you beg as he lets me take your head for a trophy. I will fling your corpse into de wastes of Vol'dun.

Her "Highness" may object... but she is not queen yet.

Come. Let us fly to your fate.

 Quest Hand-in: Your deeds had reached my ears before your feet ever set foot in my land. It is time we spoke.
Title: Keep Combing

Description: Guzbert will be busy planting explosives for a while. We should continue south, looking for more signs of the Horde.

 Quest Hand-in: Up there, by the ruins. You see them?
Title: Fiery Tongue, Fragile Feet

Description: I was kicking the water for fun again when one of those vicious crocolisks lunged out to try to bite my foot off! Rude! I have proceeded to rest my weary soles a few feet farther from the water, but I already look back on my water-kicking days longingly.

Would you be so kind as to kill a crocolisk or eight for me? I assure you they deserve it for frightening me though.

 Quest Hand-in: Do you hear that, my beautiful feet? You can rest easy now, your water-kicking days have returned!You've been oh so lovely, friend. Do share the fruits of your labors and spend a second or two by the water with me someday. We can exchange tales of that one time when you so generously slaughtered a ravaging band of vicious limb-snatching reptiles for the sake of my frightened and innocent feet. What a grand day that was.
Title: Mushroom Mixer

Description: Now what we need is something to spike the mojo with. Something that'll make it so that when the prophet drinks it, he'll become less powerful.

Drak'Agal lies to the east. There's a mushroom there that the natives call muddlecap fungus. I think it's exactly what we need.

Bring back lots of them. When we mix them into the mojo, the mind of anyone who drinks it will become muddled.

 Quest Hand-in: <The hexxer nods his approval.>Hand that fungus over and I'll mix it up with the mojo and elemental lord fluids.
Title: Continued Efforts: Seeker's Quorum

Description: The onslaught from Zovaal's forces continues to devastate these lands.

We must send them a message. Show them we will not back down, {name}.

The might of Ardenweald stands with you.

 Quest Hand-in: Quite the show you put on, <name>.That should buy us just enough time to sharpen our blades before our next battle.
Title: An Odd Trinket

Description: Wait, {name}, before you leave... did you not notice this?

<Raethan peels a small piece of paper from the bottom of the jewel.>

This wasn't reported stolen. It appears to be a card of some kind. Must be a scribe thing.

Perhaps it may be of some use to you.

 Quest Hand-in: I... I know this work. My old apprentice, what's-his-name, was trying to prove he could create something as great as I could.Impressively, he seemed to have succeeded in this one case.We should learn from what he created and make our own, less putrid version.
Title: Mazu's Bounty

Description: That was some amazing work you and the captain did out there, {name}! It's an honor to have you on the crew.

Oh! And Ju Lien survived! He swam ashore just after you started letting the harpoons fly. He was raving about some kind of gigantic egg or something that washed in with Jiao.

Go check up on him, will you? He's probably hauled it out of the water by now.

 Quest Hand-in: Hey there!Oh, I'm fine. I've had worse spills than that after a night at the Chum Bucket.But would you look at this thing? I spotted it peeking out of the sea floor when I went under - Jiao must have dredged it up while he was thrashing around.Not really sure what to do with it, but it looks valuable. Seeing as how you pretty much saved all our hides, I think we owe you this catch.
Title: Caught Off-Guard

Description: Our escape from the shell can't have gone unnoticed, but either the naga at these ruins weren't informed or they don't consider us a threat. I don't intend to take the opportunity for granted - we strike now.

I need you to slip into the lower level of the ruins to our west and take out as many of their patrols as you can. We cannot risk any of those patrols finding out about our occupation of this cave - make sure none escape.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent work, <class>.I will get some patrols out of our own to make sure that no more naga get within sight of this cave. We should have the area secured within the hour.
Title: Maintaining the Barricade

Description: It's all I can do to keep this shield up under the barrage these shadowflame drakes are putting out.

Thin their ranks before we're pinned down for good.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent work. I might even be able to catch my breath before the next catastrophe.
Title: Step Into My Barrow

Description: I've still got no clue where all these bugs came from. My best guess is the cataclysm stirred up some underground nests we never knew about.

No use getting distracted with that when they need killing, though!

 Quest Hand-in: Hey, nice work!If you ever want to come back and kill some more bugs for absolutely no additional reward, please, feel free!
Title: Clefthoof Training: Moth of Wrath

Description: Deep in the forests of Nagrand are some beasts capable of evading almost any predator. The greatest of them all, the Moth of Wrath, is coated with a foul-smelling dust.

If the moth dust is enough to keep wolves at bay, it'll probably be a pretty good test for your clefthoof. See if you can't keep it focused and take down that moth.

 Quest Hand-in: Glad to see you two make it back. It'll need a bit of time to brush that dust off.
Title: Aggressive Self-Defense

Description: With the Winterpelt all in a tizzy, I don't imagine they'll appreciate ya poking around up there. 

Don't be afraid to defend yourself if they start somethin'. A firm reminder that ya mean business might knock some sense back into 'em.

Try not to kill anyone though, will ya? I know how ya adventurin' types can get.

 Quest Hand-in: Hopefully ye didn't go too hard on 'em.
Title: Medallion of Wrath

Description: Maw Walker. I will march with my stoneborn into the depths of the Maw and rend the head off every nathrezim I find there.

However, Revendreth is still too strategic in this war to lose out of misplaced vanity. 

Therefore, as Harvester of Wrath, the second of that title, I offer you my medallion for safe keeping and utilization while I wage this war.

Use it to empower the Harvesters so they can prevent Denathrius from simply returning and regaining control with a snap of his fingers.

 Quest Hand-in: <Inserting the medallion in the socket tugs violently at your soul as the energies link, flooding a sense of will and intent into everything around you unlike any other energy you have experienced before. Together, the Harvesters rule Revendreth uncontested.>
Title: Kinelory Strikes

Description: All right, {name}. I'm ready if you are.

Shall we?

 Quest Hand-in: You've done a great service for us, <name>. Thank you.I hope Kin wasn't too much of a handful down there. She's very friendly, but can be just as deadly when you're her enemy.
Title: Make an Entrance

Description: I need you to infiltrate the Twilight Vineyards and bring back something to deal with these insects.

To do that, you will need a way to bypass the guards that keep the orchards secure.

Ly'leth will be able to help us there. I will arrange to have her meet you near the entrance.

Go quickly!

 Quest Hand-in: Let me show you around, then.
Title: Freshly Squeezed

Description: Is this troll a friend of yours? I'm so glad Kiro let me keep her. 

He's a bit wary of outsiders, but he's a great healer. 

She'll wake up, I promise. And when she does, she'll be thirsty.

The sands are short on water, but you're in luck. The grove that surrounds this camp is filled with pricklevines. 

You wouldn't want to eat the flesh, but the liquid inside can quench any thirst.

Just give them a good squeeze to collect their juice.

 Quest Hand-in: That's a lot of juice!
Title: Searching For Clues

Description: It be no coincidence that we be in Citrine Bay investigatin' a murder, and we find th' band 'o pirates known as th' Red Blade here as well!

Aye, this be no coincidence at all, {name}... but we be needin' proof!

Ye go on ahead and look fer clues and I'll find some scallywags to interrogate.

Aye {name}, we'll get t' 'th bottom o' this t' be sure! Thar be no doubt!

 Quest Hand-in: Aye, what do ye have thar? 'tis be a letter from Master Mathias Shaw himself! Writ' to th' Red Blade no less.Aye, it be just as I thought... these orders be fishier than a bucket 'o chum!
Title: Archivist on the Edge

Description: If the curse isn't removed, Qadarin will waste away until nothing is left! 

We used to bind and seal curses just like this all the time, but we haven't had to deal with one in ages. 

Go to Archivist Dreyden at the Grove of Memory. He will know which curse this is and can give you its scroll. 

Bring it back so we can figure out what we need in order to cast a counter-curse.

Hurry, {name}!

 Quest Hand-in: Please tell me you are here to help with the spriggan problem!
Title: The Endmire

Description: Oi! You.

Not sure what landed you in the Endmire but I need your help.

See these torches? It's my gig to keep 'em lit. But it ain't like they runnin' on flint n' tinder.

My stash of infused rubies got hauled off by some devourers when my back was turned. Can ya find 'em before we both get ate by one of these horrors?

 Quest Hand-in: Much obliged. These torches keep the effects of the Endmire at bay. Even scares away the devourers for the moment. Only lasts so long though. I miss the good ol' days of only having to worry about manifestations down here.
Title: The Value of Knowledge

Description: This crate is filled with relics from the nearby ruins. The pirates have discarded them, likely thinking they're of little value.

The Explorer's League would probably appreciate if you retrieved these relics for them to study.

 Quest Hand-in: Well that was most noble of you to save these ancient relics from a water-logged fate.I will be sure that the Explorer's League puts these to good use!
Title: Purity From Corruption

Description: The flowers you brought me were the essential ingredient.

Protective barriers surround Shadow Hold, projected from demonic braziers. If we are to drive the Shadow Council from Felwood, then those braziers must be extinguished.

This vial has been infused with crying violet and the magic of the wilds. Fill it at the corrupted moonwell in the center of Jaedenar and return to me.

 Quest Hand-in: This will do nicely, <name>.
Title: Bombs Away: Windshear Mine!

Description: Ve have discovered ze vhereabouts of ze gigantic goblin bomb zat you discovered at Silvervind Refuge.

You remember Boog? Ze gnome you rescued from ze orcish vagon of agony? Vell, he and Minx have tracked ze bomb down to Windshear Mine. Go zhere immediately, {name}! Zey'll be expecting you.

 Quest Hand-in: Good to see you again, <name>. Thanks for the rescue in Ashenvale. Damn shame about all the gnomes we lost.You ready to get down to business?
Title: The Second Course...

Description: I remember seeing larger diemetradons east of the Hand of Gul'dan, near the lava flows around the Ruins of Baa'ri. What I want you to get for me now is one overdeveloped felfire gizzard from the beasts around that area. You might have to kill several to find a gizzard like the one I described. Keep at it! One of them is bound to have my next meal.

 Quest Hand-in: This is fantastic but I just received some incredible news!
Title: Scales of the Arcane

Description: In my experience, dragon scale has been the strongest material I've ever had the privilege of working with. It's hard, durable and very little can go a long way.

I wish to work with it again, {name}. Being in this form, I'm bound to this area, unable to experience the world any longer.

I've heard rumor of the blue dragonflight occupying parts of Azsuna. Perhaps you can speak with them and see if they can shed a scale or two.

 Quest Hand-in: Yes, these are perfect, <name>. As is fair, I will return this grand favor and impart more of my leatherworking knowledge to you.
Title: Steven Lisbane

Description: If you thought I was tough, prepare yourself. The road only gets harder from here.

Find Steven Lisbane wandering the roads in the southern parts of Northern Stranglethorn. Seek him out and see who the superior tamer is!

 Quest Hand-in: What a show! A most excellent skirmish indeed.
Title: Much to Learn

Description: Fresh to your training, your first task is simple: Speak to Master Shang Xi.

 Quest Hand-in: Today is the day when your fate will be decided. Do you have the compassion and the keen eye of a <class>? Or are you destined to a life tending to the livestock?Each has its place, but I can sense that you aspire to greatness.Let us begin our training, my newest pupil.
Title: The Time to Strike

Description: This configuration of the stars causes an unusual vibration in the crystals strewn across Draenor, relics of the ancient Apexis. Some swear that the crystals will multiply when left unattended beneath the night sky, but none have seen the phenomenon firsthand. Regardless of the true cause, these crystals should be far more plentiful should you seek them out.

 Quest Hand-in: Well done, <name>. Fortunately, a skilled diviner can use Apexis crystals to reveal oil deposits beneath the earth. I cannot teach you this art, but you may nevertheless reap its benefit.
Title: Iskaaran Fishing Net

Description: I see you're getting along with the villagers.

You seek to learn more about our ways of fishing you say? Well, first of all no one fishes with their bare hands. I can craft you a good, strong net worthy of an Iskaaran.

 Quest Hand-in: Here's your Iskaaran fishing net. Use it wisely, and never take from the cycle of life more than you need to sustain yourself.
Title: Assault on Violet Hold: Into the Violet Hold

Description: The Violet Hold contains some of the Lich King's most powerful servants, and is at risk of being overrun by Legion agents. We must go there and thwart the demons before any of the prisoners can be set free.

 Quest Hand-in: Were you able to overcome the Assault on the Violet Hold?
Title: Unsafe Workplace

Description: You've returned just in time! Fae are in danger!

It seems our actions have enraged the gorm. They are even more aggressive than they were before!

While some fae were able to evacuate, there are still many who are trapped down there.

Take this jar and slather anyone you find with a generous helping. That should heal their wounds and give them a chance to escape.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you for rescuing them.
Title: WANTED: Prime Thumpknuckle

Description: To any and all brave enough to seek the challenge: 

Find and defeat a Prime Thumpknuckle, the largest and most dangerous of all the wild gorillas.

They can be found up and down the road from the Village in the Vines. 

A reward for any that succeed!

 Quest Hand-in: You faced down those Thumpknuckles? That's worth a lot to us. Thank ya.
Title: Shards of Ahune

Description: These shards pulse with foreboding.  Do they hold the last essence of the Frost Lord?

 Quest Hand-in: Yes, these shards hold the final essence of the Frost Lord in this land.  We will dispose of them and banish Ahune to the nether regions of cold.Thank you, <name>.  Your name will echo in the chants of the Earthen Ring for days without end.  Please honor us by accepting this vestige, a symbol of your kinship with warmth and light.
Title: In Search of Inner Calm

Description: We have already experienced so much together.

I am grateful to have a companion on this voyage of discovery.

You walk where I can only project.

You touch that which I can only see.

I have had another dream.

Another coast. A statue. 

A large statue of a little one. 

Go, seek out the view from my dream.

 Quest Hand-in: That was such a pleasant dream. I am glad to you got to experience the reality.
Title: One Step Ahead

Description: Commander, Vindicator Maraad set off with Yrel and Thaelin Darkanvil to track the Iron Horde's movements in the nearby forest.

They await your arrival on a small rise to the southwest.

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, Commander <name>. Good to see you. Now our party is complete.
Title: Crossroads Caravan Pickup

Description: <Halga grins disarmingly, holding up an enormous firearm.>

Have you ever used one of these, {name}? It's a beast. Hell with a handgrip. Too heavy to use on foot, but perfect when riding at the head of a caravan. I call it my 'street sweeper.'

We need to get those supplies you've collected to the Crossroads, and I expect trouble. I'd like for you to ride shotgun. Literally! Say the word when you're ready and I'll put you at the head of our next caravan.

 Quest Hand-in: You're a sight, <race>. That's the first caravan to make it through this week!
Title: Sanctum Improvements

Description: Your will to succeed is strong, Maw Walker. With the anima and the souls you have recovered, we can now begin to unlock our sanctum's true potential.

As we acquire more souls and more anima, we can gain even greater power from the Seat of the Primus. Remain relentless in your pursuit, and victory will be ours.

 Quest Hand-in: When it comes to matters like these, patience is as important as strength. In time, our power will grow vast and unmatched.
Title: Unfair Fight

Description: A cowardly pest that cheats his way out of the glory of death? Bah!

I have something that'll cut him down where he stands. But such an enhancement requires one who is strong enough to wield it properly.

Show me your mettle and fight! If you can prove yourself, I'll empower that ranseur of yours.

 Quest Hand-in: Here, take the power we've honed and use it to defeat your hardest-to-kill enemies.If that san'layn ever shows up here, well... he'll have an appropriately warm welcome.
Title: Time to Collect

Description: Hey there, pal. My sources around here say you had a run-in with the Sixtrigger brothers. I'd imagine you're not very happy with them?

Let's just say we're not exactly friends either.

So I'll tell you what. How about I let you in on some intel about their current location? Maybe they might have an unfortunate accident, you follow?

Oh, and bring some friends. They're not exactly the easiest of targets.

 Quest Hand-in: With the Sixtrigger brothers ended, you're finally able to collect your payment for services rendered.You rummage through their most prized possessions and take your pick.
Title: Unearthed Artifacts

Description: Ever since the Amathet came out of their tombs, they've been busy unearthing titan relics from the surrounding areas. 

I'm not sure what they intend to do with them or if they're just hoarding it so we can't have them. Sufficed to say the Explorer's League would love to study some of what they found!

Of course, we can't get anywhere close to them without the Amathet trying to stick an axe in us, but that's not a problem for you, is it? 

Care to help?

 Quest Hand-in: You really do come through, don't you?You know, we could use some reliable folks like you in the League...
Title: Seams to be a Problem

Description: <Picking away at the ore, you notice that much of it seems to turn to dust and fall to the floor at your feet. Enough even, that had it held its shape, would be enough to craft something with.

It may be worth talking to Rolm to see if there's a way to prevent this loss from happening.>

 Quest Hand-in: The seams that osmenite flows through are structurally different than that of their mere deposits.If you want to harvest the full amount of osmenite from a seam, you'll have to ignore the ore all together and go for the rock surrounding it.It's a bit counter to how you normally mine, but trust me, you'll be pleasantly surprised with the results.
Title: Selfless Preservation

Description: The automa were once abundant here, singing, constructing various things, carrying out the purpose of the First Ones. Then, invaders from the Maw slaughtered them all.

The last automa to fall were protecting something important in a nearby structure. 

I witnessed one of the cursed Mawsworn steal a device by the door. The Elders say we should not meddle with artifacts, but would it be a transgression to recover what was stolen?

 Quest Hand-in: This automa still lives! But it is so weak.
Title: The Crucible of Carnage: The Deadly Dragonmaw!

Description: You're going to love this one! The Dragonmaw heard you were entering the arena and they're determined to make sure you don't leave it.

Time for some good ol' {race} on orc action! Let me know when you're ready to do this!

 Quest Hand-in: No love in your heart for orcs I see. You really made a mess of that guy.
Title: The Bad Earth

Description: By curing the hides with the blighted earth outside the Temple City, Sage Aeire believes she can create a cloak which will cause most of the Scourge minions to ignore your presence. You should blend right in, she says.

She'd best be correct. It's our only chance to gather information and plan our counterattack.

You should be able to find the earth she needs poking in the areas to the south and west of the fortress. Bring it to me when you've finished gathering it.

 Quest Hand-in: <Chieftain Wintergale gingerly accepts the clods of soil you gathered.>We should get these into Sage Aeire's hands as soon as possible.<The chieftain grunts, pretending not to be disturbed by the tainted dirt.>We can never know when the Scourge commander will launch the final assault on the village.
Title: Gems of the Apexis

Description: Listen, boss. I know you're a jewelcrafter. It's OK, I totally understand - I like money, too!

I heard some of them bird fellas talking about some new gem-cuttin' device they got up in Tanaan. I'd be interested in checkin' it out myself, but I've got this whole shipyard mess to deal with right now.

 Quest Hand-in: Yes?
Title: Lok'lira's Parting Gift

Description: You've been a great ally, {name}.  Now comes your true test.  You will need skill, courage and a little luck.

<Lok'lira attaches a thin strand of hair to yours.>

You cannot fail now sister.  Speak to Gretta the Arbiter.  She'll see you on your way.

 Quest Hand-in: Are you ready to ride, sister?  There is no coming back.
Title: A Change of Command

Description: There's an orc general I've been keeping a close eye on. Warlord Bloodhilt curried a lot of favor with Garrosh Hellscream by beating back an Alliance advance in Southern Barrens. He's now entrenched within the fortress at Domination Point.

I doubt the Alliance can take him out. But... you've proven me wrong before.

If you wish to finish him off, bring friends. Lots of friends.  

 Quest Hand-in: <Wrathion grins.>You were being tested, <class>. I knew you were capable of great things by yourself.But you have proven to me that you have the makings of a leader, cobbling together support among a group of strangers in the midst of a battlefield.The Alliance is fortunate to have you.
Title: Ancient Techniques

Description: I've heard tales that the djaradin forge their blades with magic so hot that they can actually quench the metal with lava. Lava! It's like ice water compared to the heat their magic creates! 

But I've never been able to verify it for myself. They aren't exactly peddling their wares at the market.

You smell like battle, though. Go and fetch some of their weapons for the blacksmiths back in Loamm and we'll see if the legends are true, eh?

 Quest Hand-in: <Crubus tries to accept the blades from you, but quickly yanks his hands back and shakes them out.>YEOW! How are you holding those so easily?!Just--just set them down. I'll get some gloves.
Title: Treasure Reclamation

Description: We've got our reinforcements, but we still need to find a way to pay them. That kind of action doesn't come cheap.

Up on Deepfin Ridge to the northwest, the slimy gilblin have stolen all sorts of treasure. I think that it's time to reclaim some of it for the cause.

 Quest Hand-in: That should be enough for now. We know where there's more should the need arise.
Title: Me Brother, Nipsy

Description: Me brother, Nipsy, runs a rat kabob operation on the other side of Deeprun. Ye needs to take this here crate o' rats to him before they go bad. Get a move on!

Ye have ridden a tram before, aye? It's easy. Just step aboard when she arrives and enjoy the ride. An' keep yer arms and legs inside durin' the ride, lest ye be peglegged fer life.

 Quest Hand-in: Poor Monty. Ever since the Gnomeregan incident, he hasn't been the same. That boy has never seen an ocean in his life, let alone being some kind of pirate.<Nipsy sighs.>At least he keeps the flow of twitching critters coming.
Title: The Mother Lode

Description: Hey we got ourselves a crisis here! Our zeppelin "The Mother Lode" crashed onto the south mountain range.

It was supposed to only be on an observation mission, what could have happened?

We got to get down there quick and I'm going to need your help on this.

Are you with me?
