 Quest Hand-in: Oh my gosh, this is way worse than I thought it was gonna be. I'm really going to need a hand with getting these survivors out of here.Good thing I have you on the payroll.
Title: Damage Control

Description: Kor'ik has been sending signals to the empress for weeks. Everything the Klaxxi have done, the empress knows about.

That stops now!

Kypari Ik will be the first to receive news of Kor'ik's demise. It would benefit us to make sure that message does not make it to the empress.

Destroying the whisperers and beacon there will buy us enough time to come up with a plan before the empress can act.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent work! This should allow us the time to repair the damage Kor'ik caused.You may have just shifted the tide of war in our favor.
Title: The Glory of Argus

Description: <Amazed that anything so pure could continue to grow on this planet, you pick the flower from the ground. You feel a small power radiate from it and then vanish.>

<As it falls apart in your hands, you wonder if anyone on this Light-forsaken place knows how to handle this precious herb.>

 Quest Hand-in: So you were trying to gather astral glory I see. Yes, there is a method to doing it correctly.The flower has a power to it, allowing it to protect itself from anything it thinks may seek to destroy it. If it feels truly threatened, it extinguishes itself.You mustn't try to pick it with intent to harm, but to protect. It's an unfortunate irony as we eventually destroy it in the process of making items with it.However, this deception is necessary for it to yield itself to you.
Title: Ghost Walker Post

Description: Greetings, {class}.

It is good to see that you still draw breath. The time has come for me to call upon your services.

Just southwest of this glade stands Ghost Walker Post. There you will find a forsaken by the name of Maurin Bonesplitter.

He may have a solution for one of the problems we face here.

Speak with him and do what you can to assist him.

 Quest Hand-in: Greetings, <class>.It is good that you have finally arrived....
Title: Glow and Behold

Description: Look, {name}. The remnants are faintly glowing!

They must be reacting to something in Pilgrim's Grace.

Find out what is causing this reaction!

 Quest Hand-in: So the remnants have something to do with the translocator. But what?Whatever their prior function, they have no power now.
Title: Perfectly Pure

Description: This humour won't serve on its own.  Too thick.  WAY too thick.

The nagas to our west maintain a shrine that dispenses the only clean water this side of Duskwood.  For most potions, I'll use river water, but Bronwyn demands accuracy!

Obtain it from the Nek'mani Wellspring at the peak of the naga camp.  Good luck!

 Quest Hand-in: Do you know how hard it is to get fresh water in Stranglethorn?  It's no wonder that the nagas guard their shrine so ferociously!Alright, let's get this mix started!
Title: A Life's Work

Description: <A voice whispers to you from beyond the veil of death.>

I spent more than one-thousand years researching the mysteries of the arcane before the Great Sundering tore our world apart.

I perished amidst the destruction and my work was lost.

Search the area for my ancient writings and put my spirit to rest...

 Quest Hand-in: With the arcane tomes and ancient scrolls restored to the bookcase, it feels as though a long held weight has been lifted from your shoulders.
Title: A Stalwart Ally

Description: We have our work cut out for us, Maw Walker. The Harvesters will not relinquish their power without a fight. 

You will need stalwart allies at your side. Ones that know how battles are fought within the Shadowlands. 

Let me be your guide. Together, we will see Revendreth return to its true purpose.

 Quest Hand-in: Together we are stronger.
Title: Power of the Great Ones

Description: We need to do something to stop puppy-men attacking Sparktouched Haven. Jaloot brought me very special crystal that he found in River's Heart... we seen only one like it before.

The crystal not have power now, but the opened up lifeblood pillar should have energy to recharge it if you just bring it close. Once the crystal is charged, go to Sparktouched Haven in far southwest and let the crystal's energy make you big and strong.

Then it time to kick some puppy-men butt.

 Quest Hand-in: So much energy in you... you full of the power of the Great Ones! I not lie, I little bit jealous.
Title: Under Siege

Description: Those Iron Horde cannons are laying waste to our troops. I'm not sure how much more of this we can handle. Our forces are already spread too thin.

There has to be a way to stop those war machines.

 Quest Hand-in: It will take the Iron Horde quite a while to get those demolishers operational again. Throm-Ka, <name>.
Title: Ambushed!

Description: This should have been a walk in the park.  Their forces are hungry, injured and ill equipped.  Yet somehow, we walked right into their trap.

We approached these reefs from the south to gain cover and were immediately boarded by the Alliance dogs.

I'm sorry to say, if you want our cannons to fire at anything, you're going to have to help us take our ships back.

 Quest Hand-in: Nice work paring those mongrels down to size.  My men will be able to clean up the rest.
Title: Rightful Resting Place

Description: You have truly proven yourself a hero in the eyes of those who are its absolute judge.

I thank you for giving me the honor of holding it, even for this briefest moment. However, it is only proper that you be the one to enshrine the spear at it's rightful resting place.

Let us meet at Hero's Rest where you can do the honors.

 Quest Hand-in: <Place the Spear of Kalliope in its rightful place knowing that only a true hero can do so.>
Title: Ride to Orgrimmar

Description: For just a few coins I will have a wind rider bring you to Orgrimmar.  When you get there, you can take Grimtak's meats to Gryshka.  Her inn is in the Valley of Strength.

Speak with me again when you are ready for the journey.

 Quest Hand-in: Oh, wonderful!  Those are fine cuts!  These are from Grimtak, are they?  That orc sure knows his way into a lady's heart...Oh, I can't wait to cook it.  But not too much!  Meat is best served rare, don't you think?
Title: Cleaving Time

Description: I, Gamon, have come through the dark portal to cleave many orc skulls. Yet my weapon has not kept pace with my rage, and is nicked and dull.

Find me a new weapon - one that is good for removing Hellscream limbs.

 Quest Hand-in: I like this blade. It will see me through much removing of limbs. Here, for you, something to remember me by.
Title: Spark of Imagination

Description: I've diverted all non-essential power to prepare for Hati's reformation, so I cannot teleport you to Ulduar from here.

Be extremely careful with the Thunderspark on your way. It is charged with highly volatile energy. One wrong bump could lead to serious complications!

 Quest Hand-in: Quickly, now! We may not have much time!
Title: Tech It Up A Notch

Description: Thanks to you, the Hall of the Guardian is gradually re-assembling.

However, there is much more work to do. As our leader, you can determine the trajectory of our order's future.

Speak to Chronicler Elrianne. She will show you the ropes.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent work, <name>! I can see that the Hall of the Guardian is in good hands.
Title: No Rest For the Dead

Description: Excellent work, my apprentice! You have completed your training and are now a true Necrolord.

That also means you've taken on additional responsibilities. Such is the burden of genius!

I believe Baroness Draka wanted to have a word with you.

 Quest Hand-in: I hope you're settled--there's no rest for the weary in Maldraxxus.
Title: Blacksting's Bane

Description: By Khaz'goroth's flaming navel, it's hot here! I can't blame the first party for leaving, but everyone knows 'twasn't the heat that drove them away. No, it was Blacksting, although they won't admit it.

They were camped just to the south of the glowing draenei towers to the west, just north of the Feralfen Village, when the giant wasp appears out of nowhere and attacks! I can't wait to see the looks on their faces when I bring the creature's stinger back to Ironforge and show it to them!

 Quest Hand-in: I can't thank you enough, lad. I'm going to enjoy this...
Title: Gutretch

Description: Me like fighting you. You not so easy like the others. We fight again?

 Quest Hand-in: Me like fighting you, even if me lose.
Title: Ulthalesh, the Deadwind Harvester

Description: The book says the Dark Riders were last seen in a place called Manor Mistmantle. If friend can find these riders, then he can get Ulthalesh!

Calydus will wait here and await your return. Find Ulthalesh, friend!

 Quest Hand-in: I am left with little choice. I cannot face another Dark Rider ambush alone, and you are obviously formidable.I will help you find the weapon you seek, but only if you will allow me to return the others in their possession to their rightful place.Do we have a deal, <class>?
Title: Reconnaissance... for my, uh, Recovery

Description: It appears I am at your mercy once more, {name}.

Far be it from me to tell you the best way to absolve my sins as the Accuser insists we do.

However...

In that note, the Tithelord arranged a meeting with his contact in Darkhaven. Do you know where that is?

If you do, we could investigate, gather more information, and present that information to the Accuser and Prince Renathal.

I imagine that would be quite useful to them.

And a very selfless act of assistance on my part, do you not agree?

 Quest Hand-in: A lich? So close?Can you feel its presence? I once could...
Title: Westward Noble

Description: While I am loath to involve you in this further, I don't have the men to afford an escort for Lord Kennings. If he gets hurt, we'll all be out of a job. Can you make sure he at least made it to the west camp?

 Quest Hand-in: Oh, you finally made it! I think we have more pressing matters on our hands than hunting deer.
Title: Battle at Valhalas: Final Challenge

Description: I'm afraid that your success is going to be your undoing, {name}.

<If the val'kyr could turn more white, she would.>

Word of your success in Valhalas has reached deep into Icecrown Citadel, stirring one whom you have no desire to meet.

Prince Sandoval himself is on his way at this very moment. Gjonner warned you that you should run and I cannot disagree.

What will you do? He's on his way. Will you face the blood prince in final battle?

 Quest Hand-in: Your defeat of Prince Sandoval sickens me. An unwashed peasant such as yourself should have willingly given over his life simply for the chance to meet him and kneel at his feet.You've earned your damned reward. Be quick about your choosing.
Title: Heroic Warfront: The Battle for Stromgarde

Description: Our enemies are relentless in their quest to seize Arathi for themselves. We will never allow it to fall into their hands! We must stop them before the keep is rebuilt!

Take up arms. The Alliance is upon us.

 Quest Hand-in: A battle well fought, <name>. You have once again proven yourself a great warrior of the Horde.
Title: Clearing Out Before Cleaning Up

Description: Here's the situation.

We need to get this salvage operation moving ASAP, but the ship went down right in the middle of the wasp nests.

The ugly bugs are all over the place, and I can't call my team in here to start work until they're taken care of.

Go kill as many of 'em as you can and I'll cut you in on some of the haul.

 Quest Hand-in: That's how ye do it! As soon as my crew gets here we can start work.Here's your pay. Thanks for doing the job.
Title: Birds of a Feather

Description: I have seen many ebon wings in the Maw, but never brilliant golden ones.

Now that the aural sequencers are relaying information reliably, we should discover the source of these feathers.

Follow the trail, Maw Walker. There is a mystery here... and very likely profit.

Gold has value where you come from, does it not?

 Quest Hand-in: My heart rejoices to see a noble face in this realm of nightmare.
Title: Gava'xi

Description: The presence of rogue ethereals in this area might amuse Gezhe, who sees nothing but opportunity wherever we go, but it's a true threat to the security of our operations.

Their leader, Gava'xi, is a dangerous criminal and I've made it my top priority to see to it that he is neutralized.

If you're looking to make yourself useful, go and take care of Gava'xi.  I will see to it that you're rewarded properly.

 Quest Hand-in: We won't have to worry about Gava'xi anymore, thanks to you.  Let us arrange for your reward now.
Title: Down by the Riverside

Description: We have de aid of Krag'wa and de Gob Squad. We must get back to Zul'jan and begin our plan to stop de blood trolls.

We have one problem. De Gob Squad are unable to move their mech fast enough in de jungle. We must take it by boat.

De two of us will ride with dem and ensure de blood trolls do not destroy de mech.

I will run ahead and get de boat ready near de riverbank. Meet us dere.

 Quest Hand-in: We made it, <name>. Now comes de hard part. Are you ready?
Title: Stonehide Leather Sample

Description: The quality of this leather scrap appears representative of the beast hides found in the Broken Isles.

Your skinning trainer in Dalaran would be interested in seeing this.

 Quest Hand-in: Greetings, <name>. What have you brought for me today?
Title: Nothing for Breakfast

Description: My brother Valdo was supposed to order more supplies. But it's been a week and nothing has come. 

I'm not surprised. The lazy oaf probably took a nap instead! Now we're short on food, and I'm too busy to hunt on top of my chores--and Valdo's! 

Would you hunt for us? The meat of the vorquin striders and striped bruffalon south of here would keep the kitchen open until I can order supplies.

 Quest Hand-in: Thanks to you--and no thanks to Valdo--I can feed all these hungry travelers!Hmm... are you looking for a job? I've got a recent "opening"...Can't pay you much, but you can have Valdo's spot! No? Ah well, can't blame me for trying.
Title: To the... Rescue?

Description: The Parchment of Dust reads: "Put the featherless against one another so that our claws remain unsullied!" How wise the high Ravenspeaker is to foresee this day.

There is a great beast on the hillside to the west by the name of Stonescale. It has abducted one of the flock and despite our many attempts we have been unable to defeat it. 

Go, prove yourself by slaying the beast and rescuing Tillik! Fulfill your destiny in the name of the Raven Mother!

 Quest Hand-in: Tillik! Dear friend I'm so glad you have returned! All of the acolytes missed your witty banter after the evening chants.<Iktis looks back towards you.>Yes, now your great test is done. You have fulfilled the requirements of The Parchment of Dust!
Title: Corrupted Songflower

Description: You have found a sickly, corrupted version of what appears to be a songflower plant.  A pungent, unhealthy odor emanates from the plant.  It desperately needs some sort of attention if it is to be turned back to normal.

 Quest Hand-in: You apply some Cenarion plant salve to the songflower.  It immediately begins to shed its corrupted form, blossoming into a vibrant and healthy plant.
Title: Bombs Away!

Description: The Wellson Shipyard is constantly receiving supplies from offshore and we need to put a stop to it.  They have setup cannons along the docks for defense but if you can make it to them, we can use them to destroy their supply ships.

Head over there and see what you can do.  Report back to me on your progress.

 Quest Hand-in: Great work on those supply ships, <name>!  We knew you would be good for somethin' around here.
Title: A Marsh Lily for Jogu

Description: The watersh shay that I will have great fortune today.

 Quest Hand-in: The watersh were right! Thish flower will bring me luck.
Title: Death to Nullifier Darkoor!

Description: Da goblin Gurgthock be requestin' your presence at the Ring of Blood in Nagrand, boss-mon.

It seems that Mogor, da lord of da ring, be holdin' an exhibition match der and he want you to fight his newest acquisition.

I think it be safe, commander. I heard of dis goblin's work before. If you be ready, whisper to him "I seek da seeker."

 Quest Hand-in: Word already be spreadin' about your exploits. If da ogres did not fear your strength yet, dey should now.
Title: Zanchuli Traitors

Description: Dey are trying to cast down our loa, claiming dem to be false gods.

Dey have turned to de old ways of blood, sacrifice, and subjugation.

I cannot even begin to say how offensive dis is. Kill any of dese traitors you find.

 Quest Hand-in: You killed how many? Well, dat is a start.
Title: Hideaway No More

Description: This was supposed to be a peaceful retirement, not a warzone!

Grab one of those totems the shamans left lying around and put out these fires before my dreams of a nice fishing retreat go up in smoke! Literally!

 Quest Hand-in: Good job, <race>. Maybe I'll get an afternoon to myself, yet.
Title: A Hero Remains

Description: I know why you've come... they've sent you to bring me back, but that cannot happen. I carry the plague of undeath, {class}, and I'll not share my fate with those near me. No, I shall stay here.

My only regret lies in what I may become when death grips me. I do not fear death itself, but I loathe to consider serving the traitor, Arthas.

Leave me... and see to it that no one else comes looking. You would do me a great disservice if you were to expose anyone to the plague that I carry.

 Quest Hand-in: Bridenbrad has contracted the plague? I cannot imagine a worse fate for one who has devoted his life to the ways of light, nor can I fathom leaving him to die without lifting a finger to help.No, undeath shall not be his fate. We shall find a way to aid this hero.
Title: The Hand of Fate

Description: Ever since the Legion invaded the Exodar, the draenei have been hard at work preparing to return to Argus. At long last they have a vessel that can take us there.

With the way to that dreadful world open, we simply could not ask for a better opportunity to strike. Prophet Velen called for you quite specifically to join the assault force.

You should make your way to Bladefist Bay right away. Arrangements have been made for a ship there to take you to Azuremyst.

 Quest Hand-in: I knew you would be among those called to fight. It will be an honor to fight by your side.
Title: Blessing of Zim'Torga

Description: <Zim'Torga looks on impassively. She wonders if you seek her continued blessing by presenting more Drakkari offerings to honor her.>

 Quest Hand-in: <The Mother of Prosperity beams her approval down upon you.>
Title: Patience and Understanding

Description: Take the blueprints and travel to Shattrath City in the Terokkar Forest. Once at Shattrath, go to the Lower City and look for a mo'arg by the name Sal'salabim. He'll probably be at the bar, drinking away his sorrows.

By the way, you may need to convince him to lend his assistance. Try to approach him with patience and understanding. If that does not work, use your fists.

 Quest Hand-in: Calm down, bright eyes! Sal'salabim will help.
Title: Remnants of Anger

Description: As you look upon the severed claw of the defeated Sha of Anger, you realize that Ban Bearheart, commander of the Shado-Pan in Townlong Steppes, would want to know of your victory.

 Quest Hand-in: <As you present the Claw to Ban, his eyes grow wide with the realization of what you have done.>I see now what about you has changed.You have done the impossible. The Shado-Pan shall record your name, and honor it as long as we stand watch over this land.
Title: Bring the Base

Description: We'll need to collect some baseline statistics before we use the Embiggifier.

Grong will be asked to perform basic tasks pertaining to speed, intelligence, and strength. 

This will help us measure the increase once he's been embiggified.

 Quest Hand-in: Quite impressive, really! Grong's in superb condition.
Title: No Stone Unturned

Description: The mogu have forced spirits into their old statues to bring them to life, control them, and turn them against us.

The only way to free the bound spirits is to destroy their vessels.

 Quest Hand-in: Your efforts here make all the difference. Thank you so much for your help, friend.
Title: Garrison Campaign: The Sargerei

Description: Greetings, {name}.

Archmage Khadgar wishes you to hear an important message.

The draenei suffered a great betrayal when one of their leaders, Exarch Othaar, revealed himself to be working with the Legion.

In the hills above Shadowmoon Valley, Othaar, who now goes by the name Socrethar, gathers new recruits to his cause.

Archmage Modera is in charge of this covert operation, which we need your help carrying out.

Meet her in the field, and she will give you the details.

 Quest Hand-in: Greetings, <class>. Khadgar told me to expect you.
Title: Push Them Out

Description: The people are free, but the town is still occupied by the Forsaken.  They're cut off from their main force, so if we're to drive them out, now's our chance.

Their leader, Executor Cornell, is known  for his unbound ruthlessness.  Also among them is Valnov the Mad, a so-called scientist who carries out inhuman experiments on villagers too old to work the mines.

Take care of them all.

 Quest Hand-in: We have the people of Emberstone on our side now thanks to you.
Title: Beastmaster's Quarry: The Crane

Description: The ancient crane is alive, but stunned.

You should bring it back to Huntsman Blake before it wakes up.

 Quest Hand-in: It might have taken just one <race> to capture this beast, but it will take many more to put it down.Gather up some friends, then come and speak with me again. We'll pit the grace of the crane against the glory of the Alliance!
Title: Zhu's Despair

Description: Hmm... Is that Yi-Mo kid over there?

<Ken-Ken squints against the increasing torrents of rain.>

It is! He's at the well, and he's not lookin' so good.

Ken-Ken got a bad feeling about this...

 Quest Hand-in: We did some good work here today, <name>.Monastery always tell us to leave a place better than we find it.
Title: The Dreghood Elders

Description: The Dreghood spirit is broken because our elders are imprisoned.  Take this key and go downstairs to free them.

They are Morod the Windstirrer, Akoru the Firecaller and Aylaan the Waterwaker.  Once they are free, the spirits will return to the Dreghood tribe.

 Quest Hand-in: I can feel it, <name>!   The spirits are returning to us.
Title: The Warden's Time

Description: <Erunak's image penetrates your mind.>

You have done well, {name}, but more remains to be done.

Before moving on from this place, let us be sure that we leave it in disarray.

Find the one who leads these naga and repay him for his misdeeds.

 Quest Hand-in: It is good that this operation has been undone.Soon, I must move on...
Title: Rings To Bind Them

Description: The djaradin here have become bold, binding flame elementals and letting them rampage through the area. The wildlife has fled, and the elementals are dangerously close to our camps.

Luckily, I have been able to construct a small bastion of stone to stand against this fiery tide the djaradin have unleashed... and we will not fall!

Gather the magical rings that bind these flame elementals. We shall use them to bolster our defenses against the flame elementals.

 Quest Hand-in: Perfect! The residual energies of these rings can be turned against their creators to summon a construct under our control!
Title: Requisition: More Spiral Leaf

Description: We are dangerously low on our medicine stores. If you find any Spiral Leaf, please leave your stores with the quartermaster.

I should warn you, Spiral Leaf is immensely poisonous. Make sure to handle it with care. Some symptoms of spiral leaf poisoning include bouts of rage, immense bursts of strength, and murderous impulses. If you are exposed, find some naga and use your murderous energy for good.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you for your contribution.
Title: Clear the Riffraff

Description: The naga sent their tiny, foul, muck-smelling minions into our camp. They are quite bothersome. 

If we do nothing, and their numbers continue to grow, they could pose a threat.

You look quick and handy. Could you perhaps expunge a few for us?

 Quest Hand-in: Maybe, some day, they will learn to think for themselves. Or at least choose a master more wisely.
Title: Moving On

Description: With the Bronze Oathstone restored, Alexstrasza can proceed with her plan.

Travel to Valdrakken, {name}. She will want to hear of your success.

 Quest Hand-in: <name>, please accept our most sincere gratitude for all you have done for us. I will let you know when the time comes to accompany me on this next step.
Title: Culling the Corrupted

Description: The sickening corruption of demons pervades this entire forest. The soil, the trees, the animals... all grow thick with fel magics.

We of the Emerald Circle have sworn to cleanse this forest, and doing so requires a constant battle. While some life here can still be healed, the bears and wolves that wander nearby have been twisted too far.

We must end their suffering, and ensure their bodies do not spread the taint further. Hunt the bears and wolves, and return to me with their hides.

 Quest Hand-in: I will see these are burned swiftly and safely, <name>. You have my thanks.
Title: Blessing of the Tides

Description: Dorian certainly lives up to her reputation, {name}.

This magnificent vessel is complete and now it has a crew. Two pieces remain.

First, we must give the ship a name.

Then it falls to Brother Pike to bless this vessel. As is tradition, a tidesage's blessing fortifies the ship against storms and encourages fair weather and smooth seas. It is as much ceremonial as it is practical.

Once that is done, we will set sail for Stormwind.

 Quest Hand-in: It has been so long since I have seen such a rite performed. I was only a child.It means a great deal to me to have had your help in this. Thank you.
Title: Time-Lost Vikings

Description: Oi, barely made it out of that place!

We came through the portal to help, and the next thing you know, we're prisoners in the Bloodmaul Slag Mine. It was brutal! We were shackled for days, and covered in filth.

And they took my SHIELD!

 Quest Hand-in: Oi, it's a fair sight dirtier, but that's her! Here, this is for you. You have my thanks.
Title: An Ore for an Eye

Description: I have one last request before I can go.

I wish to see de sunset one last time. I have an enchantment in mind, and I have all the materials I need except de metal.

I need you to bring me twenty platinum nuggets.

I have asked de spirits to bring me de ore, but dey do not listen to me anymore. Dat is why I hid de map where only someone who could be of help would find it.

If you help me out, I will teach you what I can about mining platinum.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent!<Ta'mil mutters an incantation under his breath as he cradles the platinum nuggets in his hands. A bright light bursts out from between his fingers, fading away as he finishes. Turning to you, he smiles as he holds out what looks like a pair of platinum eyeballs.>I see you. I thank you for dis. I suppose dis means de next sunset will be my last.As for your training...<Ta'mil picks up a large chunk of rock with platinum veins, and shows you his secrets to harvesting the metal.>
Title: The Siege Swells

Description: Today's mantid swarm is among the worst I've seen. We are lucky to have Niuzao join us in battle.

Help him, {class}. Return to the courtyard, and join in the defense of our temple.

 Quest Hand-in: Look at him, <class>.Nothing can stop Niuzao. Only Niuzao can stop Niuzao.
Title: A Seer's Staff

Description: I hear that word of your deeds in service to the Horde has even reached the ears of the warchief. He has agreed to allow Orgrimmar's master enchanter to create a staff for you.

The cursed Shadowfang Keep in Silverpine Forest is the only place to get the materials you'll need. Travel there and find the lost holy symbol of Commander Springvale, a supply of moontouched wood, and the essence of the ghosts that haunt the keep.

 Quest Hand-in: You must be the <class> that Brother Silverhallow mentioned. Welcome, <name>. Let me see those materials you gathered from halfway around the world. They seem well worth the travel and you will not be disappointed with your staff.
Title: Sneaking In

Description: This is Lizi... she's my secret friend. I've been taking care of her since she was rejected by her mother.

This isn't looking good. Whatever they did to her is beyond my knowledge. I have to bring her home. My Ohn may ground me for the rest of time, but Lizi must get help. I am ever grateful to you, {name}. I'm sorry this was more trouble than you signed up for.

If you wouldn't mind one more adventure... please face my Ohn's wrath with me? Meet me back at the springs.

 Quest Hand-in: You've returned! Look--Lizi is going to be all right.
Title: Insight into Our Enemies

Description: There's no telling what awaits us within this land. We cannot press forward without first knowing exactly what we're up against. 

Our new allies have long been embattled with the naga. They would know best how to navigate these waters. 

Speak with Blademaster Okani and see if they can provide some insight into how our enemies operate.

 Quest Hand-in: You wish to know more about the naga of Nazjatar? I am afraid these waters are as new to me as they are to you, but we may still be able to help each other.
Title: Relics of the Sundering

Description: It's not every day that you encounter the remnants of a lost civilization beneath the ocean!

I never would have imagined that I'd have the opportunity to explore the lost city of Nazjatar... and on solid ground at that!

There are many secrets here to uncover. If you come across any ancient highborne artifacts, please bring them to me. These relics could provide us with valuable clues regarding the mysteries of the Great Sundering.

I feel as though we are barely scratching the surface so far...

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent work! Look at all of these highborne relics you've found! I will begin examining them at once.
Title: Arcane Essence

Description: Kaelynara will not stop until she has drained every last drop of arcane energy from the crystal...and destroyed this entire mine in the process. The arcane shield she guards herself with cannot be penetrated by normal means, but I have a plan.

If I had a focusing crystal powerful enough to momentarily pierce her shield, Kaelynara could then be dealt with.

Fortunately, we are in the perfect place to build one. Start by bringing me arcane essence from the creatures rampaging throughout the mine.

 Quest Hand-in: This will do nicely, <name>. All we need now is a suitable crystal...
Title: Drowning the Alliance

Description: The Alliance continue to pursue us, they will not disrupt our plans any further. Drive their champions into a watery grave.

 Quest Hand-in: There is no way the Alliance will defeat us, even here.
Title: Now, When I Grow Up...

Description: Maybe I already asked you this, but when you were my age did you know that you wanted to be a {class} when you grew up?

I'm not sure what I want to be.  Maybe a mage or a warlock or a Blood Knight, like I said before?  Or maybe... A rock star!!  Like Sig Nicious, the blood elf, in the Elite Tauren Chieftain!

I heard that when they aren't touring, they hang out in Silvermoon City!  They just sit on a balcony in the Walk of Elders waiting for people to stop by.

Please take me there.  Please!

 Quest Hand-in: Did you see that?  They were cheering for me!!Now I know how they feel when they are up on stage singing!  I felt the power and the energy!Just like they say in their song!My mind is made up, I am going to be a rock star when I grow up!
Title: A Spirit's Duty

Description: I seek to understand more about the Dutiful beings in this realm.

If you could place one in a wildseed, as you did for me, I could observe the restoration process.

 Quest Hand-in: This is nothing like my home world, but it is still quite fascinating.
Title: Al'Akir's Vengeance

Description: Listen, {name}.  What struck Orsis was no natural sandstorm.  It was the minions of Al'Akir.

The elemental lord of air is firmly allied with Deathwing and it was only a matter of time before he set his subjects upon my people.

Orsis has been attacked as a warning to us.  We must move quickly to offer our brethren what aid we can.

Meet with Nadun at the Arsad Trade Post outside of Mar'at.  I will begin preparations to take care of the displaced and wounded.

 Quest Hand-in: Do you see what Deathwing's minions have done?  Great Orsis is now all but buried in the sand!
Title: Tranquillien Besieged

Description: Rommath has opened the way for us to quickly travel to Tranquillien. I warn you, it's already a bloody battlefield.

Take the portal, and I will be along right after you.

And {name}... keep an eye on Salandria. She may have excelled in her training thus far, but she has yet to be tested like this.

 Quest Hand-in: Not a moment too soon.Let's get to work.
Title: The Mark

Description: Your blade is powerful, but it has not yet met its full potential. The all-powerful Odyn in the Halls of Valor can bestow upon you his strength.

In order to seek this blessing, you must bring him a worthy tribute. I know where you may obtain such a gift, but in order to retrieve it you must first receive the mark of the Valkyra.

Prove yourself worthy of our mark, champion, then you may enter the Vault of Eyir- the goddess will guide you from there.

 Quest Hand-in: <Ashildir nods knowingly.>You are ready for the next step.
Title: Materiel Plunder

Description: Ah good, new meat. Do you wish to prove yourself, new meat?

The Scarlet Onslaught, the most zealous and racist of the Scarlet Crusade, are in our backyard to the south. If we're going to fight them, we'll need more armor and weapons than I can make in such a short time.

Why don't we take theirs?

More to the point, why don't YOU take theirs?

 Quest Hand-in: You do not smell so fresh now, new meat.Very well, all of this will do. By what name might I call you, <class>?
Title: Just To Be Sure

Description: Just... kill anyone who looks like they might be magically inclined. Or has organizational skills. Or looks overly ambitious.

Really, just use your best judgement on this one.

Your "best judgement" is to stop speaking to me? Come on, {class}! They're... up to something nefarious, obviously!

 Quest Hand-in: That had to work, right?
Title: Schemin' That Sabotage

Description: Goblins... What would this world be without goblins? I'll tell you what: CLEAN!

Those filthy little scum suckers have planted their oil pumps all over the lake with the hope of extracting every last drop of oil that exists in Stonetalon. At each oil pump they've stationed an oil pump controller whose sole job it is to watch the pump and make sure nothing goes wrong.

Something is about to go wrong.

Take out the goblin pump controllers and take their pump controls. Use 'em to overload the pumps!

 Quest Hand-in: I could see the explosions from here, <name>! The Horde won't be refueling from Mirkfallon anymore, thanks to you!
Title: A Dense Delivery

Description: Our scales are tough, but we can always use more protection. Only the densest of hides will do for our armor--a challenge to gather, but perhaps one you are up to?

I've seen your skills. Go and gather some hides for our stores.

 Quest Hand-in: Ah! These are excellent quality. I was right about you.
Title: Deep Despair

Description: There is more to this naga problem than meets the eye, {class}.  It appears that the issue will not be resolved by merely thinning their numbers. To humble them, a more severe impression must be made.

Travel to the northern end of Zoram Strand and enter Blackfathom Deep. Once there, demonstrate to the naga that their presence in this region will no longer be tolerated!

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent!Let the naga retreat back into the seas where they belong!
Title: Into the Night

Description: What we do this day, we do for Azeroth. For the countless souls lost to the Legion's foul crusade.

Once you are ready we will take the Vindicaar into the very heart of the Legion.

Argus awaits.

 Quest Hand-in: We must act quickly!
Title: General Nazgrim has Awakened

Description: It would seem that your General Nazgrim has awakened from his injuries. He and his people are upstairs in the apothecary's house back in Binan Village.

He has requested your presence.

 Quest Hand-in: Where have you been, <name>? Nevermind. As you can see, we survived the battle at the Jade Serpent.Unfortunately, so did... they.
Title: You, Robot

Description: Doctor Vomisa, Ph.T. at your service.  Here, take this controller.  I want you to activate it and give my newly-invented Scrap Reaver X6000 a spin.

Just stay nearby!  The controller is tied to my console here, and if you get too far away, the robot will cease to function.

Try out everything... I'll be watching and calibrating its servos based upon your test run.

 Quest Hand-in: Well, my boy that certainly was exciting!  And for my money, I'd say that the Scrap Reaver X6000 performed admirably, despite its rookie pilot.Hehe, no, don't take offense, I was just kidding.  After all, you just saved Area 52 and the X-52 Nether-Rocket from certain doom!
Title: Missive: Assault on the Pit

Description: The Blackrock forces based out of the Pit in Gorgrond make up the bulk of the Iron Horde army. If we crush them on their home soil, the rest of the Iron Horde will have little hope of standing against us.

If you choose the battle, bring friends. The Blackrock won't be defeated easily.

 Quest Hand-in: Word of the assault has already made it back, as have some spoils from the fight.Well done sir, if you don't mind me saying.
Title: Sealing Fate: Honor

Description: To kill another for honor is peculiar...a relic of an older time, perhaps?  No matter, this seal is of no use to me.  It is far too burdened with power for me to control.

Remember, you can only collect three seals per week.  This counts as one of those three.  Next week, I may have others.

 Quest Hand-in: A bloody price to pay just to play with luck.  Let's hope it was worth it.
Title: Controlling their Stones

Description: Captain Kelra won't last much longer. We need to acquire the ward stones to break the ritual before it kills her.

We'll hold the line here. Take out the ogre's lieutenants and get those ward stones!

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you for saving me, but we have no time to lose. The ogres will not stop until they have raised the dragon!
Title: One of Our Own

Description: These wretched creatures captured me while I was scouting the area. Now that you're here, commander, we could really use your help back at base.

Oh, and any way you could convince your... friends... to let me go?

They, uh... won't let me leave.

 Quest Hand-in: Now, uh... could we maybe forget this little incident happened, commander?Bodrick and the other agents would never let me live this down.
Title: Out of Jovite

Description: Ared and I came this way because we needed a good supply of metal to build his designs and some of the best metal is the jovite that comes from the mine in Kuuro's Claim. In order to supply the artillery tower I'm going to need this metal.

Unfortunately that place was recently overwhelmed by a pack of goren, so you're going to have to fight your way in to get the ore before they manage to devour it.

Nothing that should be too much of a problem for you.

 Quest Hand-in: These look pretty good. Ared would have loved to get his hands on these.<Miall wipes away a tear.> I'm sorry, this is making me too emotional, these will do just fine.
Title: Caught Unawares

Description: Our invasion plan looks to have backfired. Several of our birds have already reported in, speaking of fires breaking out across the vales of central Hyjal.

Now, many of our druids are stranded out in the field, unprepared for such a large-scale attack. Thisalee was near Ashen Lake, and several others were out in the Regrowth, to the northeast.

Go, {name}! Find them, and make sure that they do not succumb to this backdraft!

 Quest Hand-in: <name>! You're back!They've pushed us back to the Sanctuary. We are vastly outnumbered. At this rate, the Guardians of Hyjal stand little chance of survival.I'm glad you're here with us.
Title: Breaking the Hand

Description: We must break the fingers of the Stormpike if we are to stop their incursion.

<Cromush hands you a small package.>

Within this package are four high-yield goblin explosives. You are to infiltrate each of the four fingers - Sofera's Naze, Corrahn's Dagger, the Headland and Gavin's Naze - and plant a goblin pocket-nuke at each.

Once you have done that - as well as all that Melisara asks of you - return to me.

 Quest Hand-in: Once Melisara is through with you we will detonate the explosives!
Title: Fight, Kill, Salute!

Description: The greatest gladiators on Draenor have fought for glory and honor inside the Coliseum. Will you become a legend like Kargath Bladefist or will you be nothing more than bone dust beneath the boots of a more savage gladiator? There is only one way to find out.

You must enter the competition and fight! The price of victory is 100 lives!

I will admit you without cost once per day, but if you fail and wish to fight again you must pay the price of admission in blood and bone!

 Quest Hand-in: Remarkable! You have proven yourself a true gladiator. And to a true gladiator goes more than honor and glory!
Title: Malfurion's Return

Description: It was only recently that we heard the news of Malfurion's awakening, mere moments before the Cataclysm occurred.

As soon as he regained consciousness, he gave a cryptic warning about the land splitting in two if something wasn't done and how all the shockwaves were converging here on Darkshore.

He then reportedly set off for somewhere in this vicinity.  I was sent here to find him, but I've found my hands full helping the refugees.

Perhaps you could look for him to the southeast for us.

 Quest Hand-in: There is no time to waste, <class>.  It is taking every ounce of my power to keep Darkshore's entire landmass from being shattered and swept into the ocean... you must listen to me very carefully.
Title: The Call of Fate

Description: I am the Arbiter's fatescribe. It is my duty to observe the strands of destiny that the Purpose lays before us.

Fate flows through you, mortal, as you journey through the Shadowlands. And now it offers you... a choice.

Return to Oribos, {name}, that I might help guide your path.

The Purpose is our way.

 Quest Hand-in: Welcome, mortal.Allow me to explain the choice that the Purpose has set before you.
Title: Upgrading The Fleet

Description: You have been doing a great job out there commander.  However, we are going to need more experience and resources to upgrade this shipyard.  Once we reach our goals, we can upgrade the capacity of the shipyard to hold more ships!

 Quest Hand-in: Great work!  We will get to work right away on the upgrade.
Title: Battle of Snowblind Mesa

Description: Your timing is fortunate. Our forces at Snowblind Mesa report seeing the Underking above ground.

What is more, he is lightly guarded, and has the hammer with him. Thanks to your efforts, we can meet them in battle.

Meet us at Snowblind Mesa and let us take the fight to Dargrul together.

 Quest Hand-in: That... is a lot of drogbar.
Title: Work Order: Fuel

Description: Our fuel supplies are running low. Without fuel we won't be able to operate the machinery that's building this place. They might even expect me to start helping them build!

I was not built for manual labor! See these nails?! I just had them done!

Get down to the refinery and get this fuel order filled! Hurry! They were fitting me for a tool-belt this morning. It didn't even match my outfit!

 Quest Hand-in: More fuel huh? Is her "loveliness" afraid she might have to do a little more than sit around lookin' pretty?
Title: The Temple of Telhamat

Description: Fortunately, the Path of Glory is not the only trace of my people in these lands. To the west, a few of our holy sites survive, although some have been overrun.

While Velen prepared for the journey that would lead him to Azeroth, those of us who would remain behind sought to reestablish a presence at our holy places.

In the western part of the Hellfire Peninsula, you will find a small group of draenei at the Temple of Telhamat, led by Amaan the Wise. I am certain he'd be interested in meeting you.

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, so you've met Seer Kryv. He is a wise and gifted man and any <race> he would name a friend is also a friend of mine.Make yourself comfortable and introduce yourself to the others who call the temple home.
Title: Blessings From Above

Description: You feel a deep connection to the distant past having partaken of the ancient blessing granted by this relic.

You determine to make as much as you can of this divine gift.

 Quest Hand-in: The divine brazier graciously endows you with a blessing.
Title: The Offensive Begins

Description: No one seems to know very much about the vrykul.  Our records show no signs of activity in their lands for centuries.  Yet here they are, just as we move against Arthas.

The map you retrieved makes it clear that we'll have to defeat them if our forces are to get any further into Northrend.

One of my best sergeants, an abomination known as Gorth, oversees the blockade beyond the lift.  Assist him in launching a pre-emptive strike on Baleheim.  If a vrykul attack occurs, it will be launched from there.

 Quest Hand-in: You come to help?  Good... good...Gorth was getting tired of killing vrykuls all day.  Help is welcome!
Title: Wanted: Stoneheart's Stone Heart

Description: <The posted sign is written in beautiful calligraphy.>

The archivists humbly request that all expedition members seek out Stoneheart's Stone Heart for our artifact archives.

If acquired, please deliver to Cataloger Jakes for processing and compensation.

Expedition members have reported seeing Stoneheart in a cave of central Azure Span.

 Quest Hand-in: This used to be a beating furbolg heart? The Primalists really are something else...I'll ensure this is properly documented, researched, and archived for the expedition.
Title: Signs of Change

Description: A severe illness has fallen over the creatures of this forest. While at first I hoped it was part of nature's course, it has refused to pass.

The forest stags, normally strong and serene, have suffered the worst. Some waste away in weakness; others froth and rage dangerously. If I am to consult the spirits to learn more of this sickness, I will need the stags' antlers.

 Quest Hand-in: At the very least, these creatures' suffering has ended. Let us hope their sacrifice will bring a stop to further pain.
Title: Rylak Rescue

Description: I managed to squeeze even more information out of our little friend here.

The Darktide Matriarch is at the top of the hill.

One of their lead engineers is attempting to tame the matriarch with his technology. We must stop him, {name}.

 Quest Hand-in: We have accomplished great things on this island today, <name>. I look forward to the day we hunt again.
Title: The Crawg Ma'da

Description: No matter what we do, as long as dem blood trolls have their village here, dey gonna be a threat.

We gonna put an end to dat threat!

Amaka be da strongest blood troll I ever seen, and she be right across da way there. She be feedin' da bodies of da Zandalari ta her pet crawgs, makin' dem big, fat, and deadly. It be time for revenge, and we be doin' it wit' da help of her own pets.

Go kill a crawg and cut its poison gland out of its belly. With it, ya can weaken Amaka and put an end to her.

 Quest Hand-in: Well done, <name>! Da blood trolls gonna be hurtin' wit' da death of their general. Now, let's keep da pressure on dem!
Title: Warchief's Command: Swamp of Sorrows!

Description: All able bodied members of the Horde are hereby ordered to report to Trade Baron Silversnap at Bogpaddle.

Persuade the trade baron to continue supplying our warriors with the weapons and munitions they require, no matter what it takes!

Travel to the Swamp of Sorrows by following the road from the southeastern Burning Steppes through the Redridge Mountains and meet the trade baron at his seaside resort.

Destiny calls!

 Quest Hand-in: Welcome to beautiful Bogpaddle!
Title: Eternal Escapades

Description: Ah--ACHOO!

Sorry. Do you want to play hide and seek? I found new places to hide and I want to play!

I hope my allergies don't stir up any trouble!

 Quest Hand-in: Wow, the other Zhusas had really amazing hiding spots! I have a lot left to learn.Thank you for spending time with me!
Title: Parasol Components

Description: Sheets of fine cloth, wooden parasol ribs, wooden dowels and metal braces, everything you would need to put together new parasols. These are worth a lot of gold in the Ember Ward. Mats would certainly reward you handsomely if you brought him this cache.

 Quest Hand-in: Oh, wow, this is a real find you have. Here, a heap of Infused Rubies for the bundle, the best you will see here in the ward. And if you see one of my goods you might like, let me know.
Title: Southsea Freebooters

Description: Gazlowe promised me a promotion if I can help him with Ratchet's pirate issues. The problem is these new buccaneers that sailed in and took over Fray Island, south of here. They're not just after our goods - they've got grudges to settle! The other night they even went after one of our war galleons.

I've got plans in the works to deal with the situation, but Gazlowe wants to see quick results. Head over to Fray Island and start lopping off some heads, will you?

 Quest Hand-in: Superb! Gazlowe will reward me handsomely for this. And I'll reward you. Less handsomely, of course. A goblin's got to make a living, you know?
Title: Paddle to Safety

Description: Perhaps... perhaps I can still help my people.

I overheard conversations between the foreman and his men. It sounds as if the source of this corruption comes from the deeper waters, where the Stormriggers do their monster hunting.

Please, assist me in investigating this. I can still redeem myself and this operation.

 Quest Hand-in: From here, we can launch our investigation.
Title: Riverbeast Training: Moth of Wrath

Description: Deep in the forests of Nagrand are some beasts capable of evading almost any predator. The greatest of them all, the Moth of Wrath, is coated with a foul-smelling dust.

If the moth dust is enough to keep wolves at bay, it will probably be a pretty good test for your riverbeast. See if you can keep it focused and defeat the moth.

 Quest Hand-in: Glad to see you back. I will need some time to brush that dust off of your mount.
Title: Ore Repossession

Description: We're moving in!

There were some snobolds here when we arrived... their mining operation seems to have met some unfortunate happenings though. Doesn't much matter - we were taking over soon anyway.

I sent some of our miners in there to get me some ore samples that I can use to calibrate our machines for processing, but they haven't come back.

Mind going in there and nabbing some samples for me in their stead? The snobolds probably have some on them, though I'd expect most of them are dead by now.

 Quest Hand-in: Woo! That's a ripe stench right there! You had to get hands-on with some of those snobolds, didn't ya?I do appreciate it though!
Title: The Frozen Flame

Description: It is time we make our move, {name}. I can conjure a portal that will take you directly inside but it will take some time before I can make another and join you.

The Lich King will no doubt sense the magic of your arrival so you will need to move fast to locate Felo'melorn and secure it.

If Lyandra has the blade with her then I fear she may not relinquish it easily. Be prepared for anything, {name}.

 Quest Hand-in: Felo'melorn... I can barely believe that such great power is locked within a blade as beautiful as this!With this weapon in your hands, the Legion will surely fall!
Title: The Perfect Color

Description: As you have seen, this grove is abundant with beautiful pink petals.  As each petal ages, the tone deepens and fades.

If you would be so kind, I am in need of a few petals that have freshly fallen.  Only the ones that have just fallen will have precisely the right color I am after.

From it I can forge an ink that will be breathtaking.  Can you help me?

 Quest Hand-in: Ah! You have a wonderful eye for color my friend.  These will make a superb pigment.
Title: Watch Out For Splinters!

Description: Have you been over to the Wellson Shipyard yet, {name}?  Best to stay away from there unless you have a good reason to venture in.  Unfortunately, that is exactly what I need you to do.

You see, we have been short on supplies ever since we recaptured the island.  That ghost ridden shipyard is overflowing with lumber but every time we send an escort to recover the lumber, they never make it back.

Can you help us out?

 Quest Hand-in: I didn't think you would be able to do it, <name>.  You are just full of surprises aren't you?
Title: Gozda'kun the Slaver

Description: Dat's it. De Sandfury are officially banned from de Goldtusk Inn!

You can't just ransack a place, kidnap its staff, and mock its owner with an assortment of fruits and vegetables and expect to get away with it!

We gotta teach those thugs what happens when you mess with de Goldtusk Gang!

Gozda'kun de Slaver was bossing around de rest of de Sandfury during de attack.

Take him out, and leave some Sandfury behind to spread de word.

 Quest Hand-in: Dat'll teach de Sandfury to fear de Goldtusk Gang!
Title: The Battle of Ardenweald

Description: With the betrayal of Sire Denathrius, and the absence of the Primus of Maldraxxus, we must assume that the Winter Queen is the Jailer's next target.

And we won't let anyone take her sigil!

Ardenweald has endured much, but it is a realm of great and mysterious power. Things aren't always what they seem.

We'll use this to our advantage, no matter who comes for the Queen!

 Quest Hand-in: We just barely survived that! I definitely didn't expect THAT to happen.But it's not over. We can't let our guard down!
Title: Taking Part

Description: What a glorious time we live in!

The former wastelands of Desolace are blooming, bursting with life. Imagine, {class}, if all of Azeroth's wastelands awoke in such a fashion! Perhaps someday...

It's true that there are weighty issues at hand here, but why not take a moment to appreciate the wondrous miracle we are witnessing?

In fact, why not take part in it? Here are some Cenarion Seeds. Use them at the more fertile spots of the wildlands.

Perfect medicine for lifting a weary soul!

 Quest Hand-in: The rejuvenation is so invigorating! Don't you think?
Title: Beastmaster's Quarry: The Tiger

Description: The elder cat is alive, but stunned.

You should bring it back to Huntsman Blake before it wakes up.

 Quest Hand-in: It might have taken just one <race> to capture this beast, but it will take many more to put it down.Gather up some friends, then come and speak with me again. We'll pit the power of the tiger against the glory of the Alliance!
Title: Earthen Blessing

Description: Ignis will help with smelting the metal, but the heat from the forge will cook you in yer boots!

Our ancestors, the dwarves who forged Aegrim's armor, could sustain their stoneform for far longer than we can today. That's how they could forge the bulwark in the first place.

Luckily, my friend Bouldercrag can help us with that. He'll need some materials for the ritual.

 Quest Hand-in: This will suffice.
Title: Where Are the Children?

Description: The children have gone missing!

That horrible Grumpus has been making his way throughout Draenor, snatching up children. Please save them!

Our scouts have spotted him over in Frostfire Ridge.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you for all the help! Their families will be so happy to see them.
Title: Rockin' Powder

Description: I'll give these pygmies one thing... they sure know how to party! But they're not so clever. I think I've discovered the source of their rockin' powers: Rockin' Powder!

It turns out that this stuff, which turns them into world-class rockers, is also highly explosive. We must have it!

So, while you're in there at Oostan to the east, make sure that you pickup a whole bunch of the stuff. Trust me, you're going to need it for what's coming up!

 Quest Hand-in: This will do. In fact, it's more than we need. I devised an ingenious idea for a weapon that the boots will be turned into once you get them to Hobart.Hand the powder over and I'll load it into the the Super Booster Rocket Boots.
Title: Dark Arts

Description: It is said that Shan'ze Dao was once home to a great mogu temple.

There, the Shan'ze studied and practiced the art of subjugating the dead or inanimate.

Much of their knowledge still remains on the island to the northwest, buried among the ruins.

We need to get our hands on their knowledge - both to keep it out of their hands, and to understand the nature of their experiments.

 Quest Hand-in: Well done, <name>.We'll begin deciphering the writing on these tablets at once.
Title: Murloc Motes

Description: An alternate timeline born from murlocs??!

Forgive my selfishness, but would you obtain a few stray motes of temporal energy while you locate Ambassador Chronomu? 

Just walk into them and your staff should do the rest. I will examine the data later. When we are not in the middle of venturing through rips in Azeroth's varied realities.

 Quest Hand-in: Astounding work! Now, what do you imagine the murlocs of this Murloc World are? I shudder to think...
Title: Wyrm Food

Description: It's hungry work, defending and fighting for the Obsidian Citadel, and dragons can eat a great deal. We need to replenish our stores.

Lurking beneath the hardened lava, squirming through the magma, are some very tasty worms. This may not appeal to you, but to a hungry dragon, they are delicious.

Take our servant Gulchak and use his pointer to direct him towards disturbances in the lava. He will attract the worms for you to harvest.

 Quest Hand-in: <Voraxian taps his teeth together approvingly.>Thank you. This will go a long way toward keeping our kin fed and healthy. We do not fight for our future on an empty stomach.
Title: Song of Zephyrs

Description: A swirling essence coalesces at the feet of the Duke.

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, I see, it is a hard-earned reward from one of your many battles. Well done, <class>!
Title: Blueprint: Rustbolt Pocket Turret

Description: <This blueprint details how to build what appears to be a tiny flame turret.

You should be able to upload the blueprint to Pascal-K1N6's database in Rustbolt.>

 Quest Hand-in: Have you recovered a new blueprint, my fleshy friend?I will add it to my database posthaste.
Title: A Knight's Belongings

Description: Amidst the squalls and the crashing waves, my mighty ship swayed and tumbled. Lesser knights would have trembled in terror, frozen stiff. Not me! Nay! Heroically, I stripped my armor off my back and stored it safely in my sack. 

Why did I strip down to these simple undergarments, you ask? Only an ignorant squire would. I was wary of sinking to the bottom should my ship fall foul of course! Ha ha! 

Unfortunately, the sacks of armor were thrown overboard by the waves.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent, you found my armor.
Title: Mulverick's Plight

Description: You were sent here to free me? It seems that makes us allies.

Slavemaster Turgall within the Soostained Mines will certainly have the key to this cage.

While you're in there, do you think you could see which of those spineless taskmasters took my axes?

 Quest Hand-in: You have my sincere gratitude, <name>.
Title: Quill You Help?

Description: My scribe apprentice, I am delighted to see you.

Earlier today I had a few novices come in to try their hand at inscription. They all wrote with too much force and snapped their quill nibs right off!

I hate to ask, but could you craft a few more quills to keep in stock?

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you, my scribe apprentice. I do not know what I would do without you.Please take these glyphs as a token of my thanks. Perhaps you can study them to further your practices.
Title: The Crucible of Carnage: The Bloodeye Bruiser!

Description: I'll tell you what, buddy, this place is a far cry from the rolling plains of Nagrand or the bloodbowl in Zul'Drak, but hey, I go where the gold's at! So welcome to Twi-Hi, pal.

You're new to this pit, so let me set you straight. I'm the fight promoter and this feisty troll next to me is Wodin, my bodyguard. You're the entertainment. When you wanna fight, let me know and I'll set up the match.

If you're ready and got a group of friends with you, we can start! What do you say?

 Quest Hand-in: Not bad, friend. You might make some gold out here - if you manage to stay alive.
Title: Garrison Campaign: The Ring of Blood

Description: Hey Champ,

You were out when I stopped by. You're the talk of the arena, friend! I mean, the Ring of Trials? Stonemaul? You're killing it out there!

I've got a sweet gig set up at the Ring of Blood in Nagrand. Lots of ogres looking for the next big fight. Big money. You in?

I'll meet you at my stash so we can talk a bit in private before your big debut.

<A map is included with a dollar sign scrawled on an abandoned ogre tower.>

 Quest Hand-in: I won't waste your time, champ. I've got a once in a lifetime opportunity for you.
Title: Freeing the Light

Description: Ah... you are not in league with the ogres. Please, you must aid me.

I have been bound against my will by dark magic. I ask only that you free me.

Take a piece of my light. Use it to dispel the necrotic energies that are keeping me captive.

 Quest Hand-in: You have my thanks, <name>. I must leave this world, but I wish you luck. Take my blessing. May it aid you against these monsters.
Title: A Ruby Shard for Farmer Fung

Description: Hey, it's the citypaw!

 Quest Hand-in: Oh, that's a very nice stone.
Title: Culling the Crew

Description: If we're going to protect Draenor from the Bonefleet menace, we'll need to thin out the crew.

See to a swift reduction in their numbers, and we might just push them back into the sea for another year.

 Quest Hand-in: We're lucky you were around to take care of those bony brutes!
Title: Equipment Blueprint: True Iron Rudder

Description: This appears to be a blueprint for some sort of naval equipment.  We should take it back to our Shipyard and see if someone can decipher it.

 Quest Hand-in: This is a blueprint for some high tech naval equipment.  I should be able to reverse engineer the plans and have this equipment available for you shortly!
Title: Soul Surrender

Description: We assault the mogu at the Court of Bones, but I fear we merely send them fodder for their abominable rituals.

The mogu do not merely kill their prisoners - they steal their souls and imbue them in machinations of stone, or reforge the fallen into ghostly tools of war.

Horde or Alliance, it matters not. We cannot allow the mogu to bolster their numbers.

Go into the crypts. Free any prisoners that are still living.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you, <name>. You have lightened my heart of a heavy burden through your heroic actions.I will remember your efforts on this day.
Title: Much to Learn

Description: Fresh to your training, your first task is simple: Speak to Master Shang Xi.

 Quest Hand-in: Today is the day when your fate will be decided. Do you have the intellect and force of will necessary to be a <class>? Or are you destined to a life scribing in the dusty libraries?Each has its place, but I can sense that you aspire to greatness.Let us begin our training, my newest pupil.
Title: Three Is a Lucky Number

Description: Ari is much more than she appears, you know. She was once one of the most powerful archmagi on Azeroth and a member of the Council of Tirisfal. Unfortunately her mind was badly damaged and she has not left the Hall of the Guardian since.

She must like you very much to have given you a gift. If you bring her something special in return, I suspect she will surprise you. She prefers things in threes.

 Quest Hand-in: These are wonderful! I couldn't keep them for myself, of course. But... Can you hear the bees humming in the honey brew? They sing so sweetly... Oh! What a lovely idea! Thank you, little friends.
Title: Just Hatched

Description: While looking through this soldier's possessions, you look down to see a newborn raptor hatchling looking back up at you.  Was it following this Kurzen militiaman the whole time?

You can see it studying you, learning your features and following your movements.

The lashtail hatchling has formed a bond with you.

Perhaps someone back at the Rebel Camp will know what to do with a raptor hatchling.

 Quest Hand-in: Yes, the little one seems to have taken a liking to you.  You're lucky... at this age, the raptors are calm, peaceful, and easily trained.  Keep her, <name>... she may come in handy.In fact...
Title: Outpost Upgrade: Castaway Point

Description: The mission at Castaway Point was a success. Well done, {name}.

We now have access to a very large cannon which promises to be a fast way to travel to Tiragarde Sound. Glad that's not how I plan to get around.

Travel to Castaway Point and enquire about this upgrade.

 Quest Hand-in: Ain't she a beauty? I know its unusual, but this baby here can get you quick smart to Tiragarde Sound. Want to give her a shot?
Title: Tol'vir Hieroglyphics

Description: This gravestone marks a strange burial site - possibly from one of the original builders.  If you could use a Tol'vir Hieroglyphic keystone to understand the words, it could be an important archaeological find!

 Quest Hand-in: Using the keystone, you confirm the grave is from one of the original builders, and you learn important details of the mummification process.
Title: A Prayer and a Wing

Description: A winged visage? Could it be...?

{name}, there's no time to waste. You may have been speaking to Aviana herself, trying to return to us.

I'll need something from Aviana's past to reach out to her. High atop the ridge overlooking this shrine, you'll find a series of huge nests belonging to Blaithe, an ancient bird of prey that was once her consort. For ten thousand years he's been mad with grief.

Go to one of his roosts, and use this call to summon him. Kill Blaithe and bring me one of his feathers.

 Quest Hand-in: That was nasty work, <name>, but it had to be done.And if Aviana is truly to be resurrected, then perhaps your actions have enabled Blaithe to someday come back as well?Now let's see if we can contact our long lost guardian...
Title: A Strong Heart

Description: We saw a flare near Junkwatt Depot. 

The retrieval team has made it out with the power source. We are now forever safe from King Mechagon's Annihilo-tron, its heart will serve a new purpose.

This is great news!

However, the flare means they have company. Your help will be needed to extricate the team and retrieve the Spark Reactor.

Please move with haste, we are so close to completion.

 Quest Hand-in: I am quite pleased.With a 40% chance of success, I was not sure the variables would reconcile in our favor.It was a serendipitous sequence of events.
Title: How To Stop An Exploding Toy Boat

Description: I am loathe to part a child from their toy, but it would be a great value to the Kirin Tor to study how it absorbed so much arcana.

Then again... I do not want to slight our new tuskarr allies. I do have a wand that could dispel the magic...

Let's speak with Toolk's mother, then decide what to do.

 Quest Hand-in: We did the right thing today. There will be more magical oddities to research, but this girl will not get more gifts from her lost father.
Title: Deathdealer's Spaulders

Description: It is said among us that the ornate shoulder armor worn by the mortal races started as an attempt to emulate the wings of a dragon.

Bring me the bindings worn by the highest Qiraji leaders and I shall shape them into a set of pauldrons more dreadful than even the wings of Nefarian himself!

 Quest Hand-in: From the materials you bring and from the scales of our fallen Qiraji foes I make you these pauldrons, mortal.  May they grant you the protection you need and may the sight of them strike fear into our enemies.
Title: And The Mole You Rode In On

Description: I think we've kept Hansel waiting long enough. Can you take me to him? Then we can all hitch a ride out of here on the mole machine.

 Quest Hand-in: So I guess it's safe to say my old workshop is compromised. We'll have to find a new place to set up shop...
Title: The Art of War

Description: Lok'tar ogar, {race}. I am Nazgrim.

You are hereby ordered to present yourself at Grommash Hold immediately.

All in service to the Horde are to swear an oath of allegiance to their new Warchief.

Do not keep him waiting, {race}.

 Quest Hand-in: Ahh, good. You're here. And not a moment too soon...
Title: Prince Farondis

Description: I'm glad to see that my doubts in you were unfounded.

You seek Prince Farondis? Follow me. I will show you to the prince's hall.

 Quest Hand-in: That's him, behind me.
Title: Brokyo Beatdown

Description: I'm almost done here, but I can't leave in good conscience.

I spotted an ogron named Brokyo that is wearing a priceless ring. Priceless as in crazy expensive.

I'm sure Nixxie will give me a promotion if I bring that ring back to her.

 Quest Hand-in: You got the ring? Nice! The Steamwheedle Preservation Society is going to make some serious moolah on this stuff.Nixxie will be pleased.
Title: Volatile Reactions

Description: The living slime within Maldraxxus naturally produces a powerful catalyst used in many of the House of Eyes's poisons. There is always a need for the substance.

It would be of great help if you could retrieve some for us.

 Quest Hand-in: A respectable amount. We will make good use of this.
Title: Huck Wheelbarrow

Description: Usually our trainees are adventurers like yourself, or monks from Tian Monastery, or occasionally retired Shado-Pan. Very rarely, though, we will greet trainees that have no fighting experience whatsoever.

Huck Wheelbarrow is one such trainee. He has requested a duel with you. Look for him on the island's western shore.

 Quest Hand-in: There remains only one trainee ranked higher than you.I have a feeling that you will be facing him when you return.
Title: The Hermit of Swamplight Manor

Description: There's a fellow the locals know as "Swamp Eye" Jarl, who lives alone out in the swamp. Sometime ago he "took over" Swamplight Manor after the previous owners disappeared under mysterious circumstances.

I like to send someone to check up on him every once in a while. He kind of reminds me of my grandfather, you know? Some say he's not quite right in the head.

If you're headed northwest on the road out of Theramore, you'll find Swamplight Manor in the Witch Hill area, before the road turns west.

 Quest Hand-in: Get off my lawn... unless, that is, you want to help old "Swamp Eye" with a little bit of cooking. Whad'ya say?
Title: Enemies, Old and New

Description: Our ancient enemy, the draenei, have returned with powerful allies.  They wage war in Halaa, southwest of here.

We cannot allow them a victory there as Garadar would be next without a doubt.

Go and slay those who would aid our ancient enemy.

 Quest Hand-in: You bring great honor to our people.  You have our thanks.
Title: Garrison Campaign: The Ring of Blood

Description: Hey Champ,

You were out when I stopped by. I've got a sweet gig set up at the Ring of Blood in Nagrand. Lots of ogres looking for the next big fight. Big money. You in?

If you think the Stonemaul arena was a thrill, this is way, way bigger than that. It's going to be HUGE, I'm calling it now.

I'll meet you at my stash so we can talk a bit in private before your big debut.

<A map is included with a dollar sign scrawled on an abandoned ogre tower.>

 Quest Hand-in: I won't waste your time, champ. I've got a once in a lifetime opportunity for you.
Title: Keymaster Orlis

Description: The Felborne insurgents appear to be guarding a teleporter pad within the glade ahead. I wonder where it leads?

It is probably safe to assume that we'll need to kill Keymaster Orlis in order to gain access.

 Quest Hand-in: This appears to be some sort of attunement crystal. Perfect.
Title: Tauren Hoof

Description: Ever see a Tauren Rogue, {name}?

 Quest Hand-in: Of course you haven't! I mean, look at these things...you can't sneak into anything with these things clacking around.
Title: Elune's Fire

Description: We need special flame for ritual.  We need Elune's fire.

Horoo's spirit wanders east of here.  Horoo carries torch of Elune.  Bring here so spirits rest.

Aroom thanks you.

 Quest Hand-in: <Aroom lets out a long low-pitched hoot.>Finally kin may rest.
Title: Bandit Blades

Description: We only have enough weapons to arm half of de tribe against Mojambo's gang.

We're going to need more weapons if we are going to survive de approaching battle.

Tongo's crew is sure to have a ready supply of weapons at their hideout.

Search de hideout for any weapons you can find and bring dem back to de arena.

 Quest Hand-in: Dese ancient blades may not be in de best condition, but dey are finely forged. I am sure dey will hold up in battle just fine.
Title: The Firelord's Offense

Description: Smolderon calls from across the battlefield, shaman. Now it is his realm being violated.

It seems urgent. I will clean up here.

 Quest Hand-in: I will not allow such insolence!
Title: Headbutting 101

Description: Your beast is looking well fed. Good. Try and keep it dat way.

Now, next you need to teach your little one to defend itself. Direhorns in de wild are prey for much larger creatures and de young are easy pickings for saurid and their like.

Go out into de Savagelands and show your little one how to fend dem off.

It's all in de horn, {name}.

 Quest Hand-in: I see a gleam of confidence in your hatchling's eyes. Good. It will need it.
Title: Barst Recruited

Description: Well a deal's a deal. If Grimtusk needs a hand killing Frostbite once and for all, then I'm in.

What hate I have left in me I reserve for Frostbite. Did Grimtusk tell you what happened? 

All of us who hunted with Grimtusk thought we were unstoppable. Until we met Frostbite. 

Frostbite didn't just defeat us. He humiliated us in front of everyone in the hideaway. 

We were all defeated and left bloodied and battered at the hideaway. Frostbite used us as an example.

Now it's time for payback.

 Quest Hand-in: Here's Barst. Just as... annoying as ever.
Title: Proving Your Strength

Description: Though we seek a peaceful life, our enemies are many.  Of these, none match the ogres in sheer brute power.

If you seek to prove your prowess to us, bring me the warbeads they wear around their necks.  I will tell others of your accomplishments.

 Quest Hand-in: You are a strong ally indeed, <name>.  Going head to head against the ogres of Outland is not something that just anyone can do.
Title: Crown of Courage

Description: I see you are a fan of pink flowers. It is a shame those that make up your crown will one day come to perish.

Perhaps I can help with that.

Though those are ordinary blossoms, I know similar flowers that bloom only during Lunar Festival. If you retrieve them for me, I can imbue them with Elune's power so that you may enjoy them throughout the year.

 Quest Hand-in: Such beautiful flowers! I can feel Elune's might within them.This crown shall bring you great courage.
Title: Four Finger Discount

Description: I gotta admit, establishing a supply chain to a primal world on the wrong side of time is tough, even for me. Gotta make due with, uh... "locally sourced" goods.

Say what you want about the Iron Horde, but when it comes to raw materials, they got connections!

Keep an eye out for some of the more valuable goods in the Iron Siegeworks. I packed a few rocket chickens we can use to send the good stuff back to your garrison.

 Quest Hand-in: Not a bad haul. Here's yer cut!
Title: A Friendly Chat...

Description: <Roka listens with disgust as you tell her why you're trying to track down Snivel.>

You mean I've been under the spell of an alchemist all this time? I can't believe I fell for that fraud! If I ever get my hands on that conniving little goblin, I'll tear him apart!

If he's finished his errands, he's on his way down to the zeppelin tower in the middle of Orgrimmar! Whatever you do, {name}, you can't let him board that zeppelin and get away with all this!

Hurry to the zeppelin tower before you miss him!

 Quest Hand-in: You got his ledger? Really? That's great, <name>. There's probably loads of good information in here.
Title: Fear No Evil

Description: Have you embraced the Holy Light yet, brother? It is through the Holy Light that we are saved! It is through the Holy Light that I am able to heal these overly demanding soldiers! And it is through the Holy Light that you will be able to venture out into the field to the north and rescue our fallen brothers!

Take this prayer book with you into the field and cast the Light's healing touch on the injured.

 Quest Hand-in: I think you now understand the power of the Light. The Light giveth hope, brother and the Light taketh from the darkness! BLESSED BE THE LIGHT!
Title: Something That Doesn't Melt

Description: No no no! Those ice shards didn't work at all! They'll melt before they even do any damage. That's the last time I'll trust Narf's word on materials. This means we need something else entirely for the shrapnel.

I know! I'm brilliant. Bone splinters.

There are some bones all around here that the jormungar have been gnawing on pretty thoroughly. Go check them out and see if you can find me some splintered bone that I can use.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent!  That should be the last thing I need to test out the new bombs.  Just a moment and I'll try this out!
Title: The Challenger's Ring: Chao the Voice

Description: It looks like you're quite the fighter, {name}.

Chao heard about it, and she's been talking about how she'd kick your...

Well, let's just say I think you should challenge her and try to get her respect.

 Quest Hand-in: I'm sure there's no hard feelings. She just loves a good fight.You should talk to her next time I have some missions for you. She's quite an able fighter, as I'm sure you saw.
Title: No Safe Haven

Description: I brought Rastakhan to Zeb'ahari to hide him, {name}. I did not dream Zul's followers would find us so soon.

De people of Zeb'ahari are being hunted by those who answer to de prophet. I have brought dis upon dem by keeping de king in their village.

Help me save dem, {name}. Gather those who can still walk and send dem to me.
