I can do nothing for those who died, but we can still rescue de living.

 Quest Hand-in: I will try to help dem secure their village.Stay sharp, <name>. Zul will not stop while ol' Rastakhan's fate hangs in de balance.
Title: Trouble at Southshore

Description: Before my capture and imprisonment, I was stationed at Southshore. My primary job at the ruins was to take slime samples and make sure that the blight that we released was safely dissipating. Simple and easy if not for the worgen that would continuously harass us.

I need you to head to Southshore and find my apprentice, Serge Hinott. Make sure that he's ok and inform him that I will return once my work here has concluded.

You'll find the Ruins of Southshore to the southeast, near the coast.

 Quest Hand-in: The worgen situation hasn't gotten any better and Helcular is really creeping me out.
Title: Ignis the Furnace Master Must Die!

Description: The great fire giant, Ignis the Furnace Master toils away inside of Ulduar's Colossal Forge. Under orders from Loken, Ignis creates weapons that are terrifying in their power.

The Council of Six has decreed that Ignis must die!

 Quest Hand-in: I trust that you did not have to face too many of his iron construct assistants?
Title: Gardener Fran and the Watering Can

Description: You want me to just GIVE you some hops? Pfshh! This is the third time today some little {race} like you has come up to me asking for food!

You want food? Then you'd better work!

<She shoves a watering can into your hand.>

Now go water my plants!

 Quest Hand-in: Hmmph!Nice farming.
Title: Visions of the Dreamer: The Betrayal

Description: I sense that in the spirit's vision, she struggles with the memory of a betrayal that is truly profound. 

Someone as close to her as a brother, turned to an enemy.

Go to the second Dreamshrine in the Basin, and help vanquish the pain of this nightmare.

 Quest Hand-in: To have an old friend turn against you, in the most terrible way. How very painful. But we are so close now, to soothing the spirit within the wildseed.
Title: The Thread of Starlight

Description: Melandrus of the Nightborne is First Blade of Elisande. Perhaps you've heard of him? He is a great hero to the Nightborne but, to be absolutely honest, he is a mess with regards to style. 

His accoutrements are somewhat better and a particular pair or bracers are rather nice. In fact, the thead that binds them will be absolutely perfect for your pending outfits. Why don't you get that for me and we will talk further.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent work, my friend! I will find an appropriate use for this as soon as I can.
Title: The Lady's Necklace

Description: The necklace shimmers, a remarkable piece of jewelry that doesn't seem to succumb to the gloom that permeates the Ghostlands. Given the inscription, and where you found it, it must be the lost property of Lady Sylvanas Windrunner herself!

Perhaps it would be best to first take it to High Executor Mavren at Tranquillien? He seems to be the highest ranking Forsaken in the area and is sure to know what to do with it.

 Quest Hand-in: You say that you found it on one of the Scourge at Windrunner Spire and that there's an inscription on it? Let me see!Here, take this coin for a job well done.
Title: Hero's Call: Un'Goro Crater!

Description: By order of his royal highness, King Anduin Wrynn, all able-bodied citizens of the Alliance are to report to Williden Marshal at Marshal's Stand.

The Alliance needs you to provide support to the Marshal Expeditions as they uncover the secrets of Un'Goro Crater's ancient beasts, unique flora, and powerful crystals. You can reach the crater by departing western Tanaris and following the road all the way to Marshal's Stand.

For the glory and honor of the Alliance!

 Quest Hand-in: My team of explorers, researchers, and scientists is the finest in Azeroth, but we need all the help we can get to discover the truth about the crater's history and its denizens.
Title: Captain Gulnaku's Treasure

Description: <This map is poorly drawn and covered in stains, but appears to identify three possible locations where a pirate captain may have buried treasure around the Port of Zem'lan. The treasure could be at any of the three locations.

At the bottom of the map, someone scrawled an order: Set traps!>

 Quest Hand-in: <The chest is filled with shiny treasure.>
Title: Kyrestia, the Firstborne

Description: I will escort you to hold audience with the Archon.

I beseech you to present your information succinctly and directly.

Our wise Archon will hear you and make a decision on the best course of action.

 Quest Hand-in: The Archon's grace is upon you, mortal.
Title: King or Prey

Description: My loa has seen fit to question my resolve.

For my people, my pride, and my faith, we will correct dis. Return to your Horde. Ready your forces, and I will ready mine.

When de time comes, we will strike back against de traitorous snake, Zul.

 Quest Hand-in: You have gone beyond our wildest expectations!Thank you, <name>, for upholding the honor of the Horde. We must remember who we were, to realize what we may become.
Title: Down, But Not Out

Description: <Kua'fon wiggles happily in his new armor. He starts to pace restlessly back and forth. A taste for adventure has surely awakened in this flightless creature.>

Skree! Skree!!

 Quest Hand-in: <Kua'fon lowers its head and gently nuzzles you. He is ready to follow you wherever you may go.>
Title: They Sent Assassins

Description: Have you ever seen a goblin, {name}? They're wretched little monsters that love only two things: gold and themselves.

The Blackrock orcs have enlisted the aid of goblin assassins to kill our soldiers. If you look to the field in the north you can barely make out their silhouettes, sneaking about in the grass.

I need you to head out there and kill every goblin that you see. They need to learn that nobody messes with the Alliance!

 Quest Hand-in: That will teach those monsters! They'll think twice before taking another mercenary job for orcs.
Title: Get Out of Here

Description: I can't believe you're here. Please, we need help!

They've been forcing us to mine nonstop. The weakest among us have been steadily dropping. At this rate, we'll all be dead soon.

The chains are weak. You may be able to pry the lock apart.

I'll keep a lookout until the others are free. Don't worry about me!

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you for rescuing us, we'd have been trapped in here until we all slowly perished.
Title: Things Are Not Goren Our Way

Description: The abandoned mine shaft has been overrun with goren!  They seem to be responding to commands from a big one further down in the mine.  If you can take him out, the rest will probably retreat.

Once you have those goren cleared out, we can get that mine up and working!

 Quest Hand-in: Nice job, <name>! Let's get this mining operation started!
Title: The Call of Oshu'gun

Description: The elements have spoken and a vision has been revealed, {name}.

Together we shall travel to the great mountain Oshu'gun and put an end to the dark disturbance there.

If what you saw in the vision is to be believed, then great danger awaits us.

I will meet you in the Spirit Woods at the foot of Oshu'gun. When you are ready to depart, speak with Gixmo Moneycash and he will fly you to there.

 Quest Hand-in: These woods are sacred to the orcs and to my people as well.Beneath the great mountain of Oshu'gun lies the heart of Nagrand, the Genedar. This great dimensional vessel rescued my people from annihilation and brought us to this world.
Title: The Call of Kalimdor

Description: Say, you haven't seen a fish about this long?  Short fins?  Responds to the name Steve?  He's blue?

Never mind, I'll keep looking.

Actually... there was another reason I came here to Booty Bay.  Boss Krog, over in Dustwallow, is looking for new blood.  Someone to help us Stonemaul from getting overrun.  You look strong enough.

Wait on the edge of the pier for the next ship, then ride to Ratchet.  Gazlowe should be able to help you from there.

Steve?  Steve!

 Quest Hand-in: Yeah?  What can I do for ya?
Title: Target: Hive'Zora Tunnelers

Description: Reinforcements have been called on to join the assault on Hive'Zora.  You have been selected to target Hive'Zora tunnelers.  Report back to Commander Mar'alith after completing your task.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent work, <name>.  Without their tunnelers, the silithid will have a hard time repairing any damage inflicted to their hive's structure.  I assume you'll want a new task.
Title: Enter the Illidari: Shivarra

Description: Our Shivarra demonesses are waiting at the Black Temple. It's a gamble bringing them here... they used to be part of the Burning Legion after all. But, they are some of the most powerful in Lord Illidan's arsenal.

<Jace looks at you for a long moment.>

I have a feeling that the ultimate sacrifice is going to have to be made in order to summon them in.

 Quest Hand-in: Grim. But demon hunters are no strangers to sacrifice. We have given everything to become what we are.The Legion will fall. We await your orders, <name>.
Title: Village of the Corruptors

Description: The Feltotem continue to create these totems for further "experiments". Let us deal with these infusers in the traditional manner.

Their deaths will right a great wrong and provide clues as to their ultimate goal.

 Quest Hand-in: Tugar... I thought he was dead. He was a nasty Bloodtotem even before the Legion arrived.We have to get to him.
Title: Hold Still

Description: If you want to be a Roughneck, you're going to have to pass a few... trials. Every one of us has done 'em, so I don't want to hear any whining.

Take these clippers and get me some goat fur. You have to clip 'em while they're alive, because thems the rules. Oh, and cover your bits when you do it, they like to kick.

 Quest Hand-in: You actually did it! Tell me, how did they like it? Any of 'em give you the horns? Hahaha!
Title: The Unfriendly Faction

Description: <When passing the other faction recently, your snowfeather walked right up to them without fear. It does not appear to understand that they are the enemy. Probably best to teach them before something bad happens.>

 Quest Hand-in: <The hatchling emits a low hiss when you pass a member of the opposite faction. Mission accomplished! It will need to rest after this adventure.>
Title: Nespirah

Description: It is clear to me at this point what must be done, {name}.

The naga can only be obtaining these pearls from one place: Nespirah, the ancient, shelled creature that rests outside of this cave.  Why Nespirah would submit to the naga, however, is beyond my understanding.

We can enter Nespirah's body cavity through a small tube near the exit to this cave.  I must first fetch my master, then we can meet you on the inside.  We will convene in Nespirah's northwestern entrance.

 Quest Hand-in: Erunak trusts this task to me?  Very well, let's see what we can learn from the ancient one.
Title: The Word of Zul

Description: I have a mundane task for you. Our esteemed Prophet Zul has words to distribute to very specific individuals in de port. 

And he requested you be de one to deliver dem.

Don't ask me why he didn't just have you deliver these when you were here de first time. De prophet is notorious for not sharing all of his visions.

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, you are a competent errand-<race> after all. Perhaps you could be trusted with more important tasks. Like trash removal.
Title: A Dark (Iron) Tide

Description: Their red eyes... flaming beards... dark, dusky skin. These can only be Dark Iron dwarves. I have never seen one before this day.

It is my understanding that they have been sent here on an errand for the Alliance. Given my people's allegiance, I believe we are now placed in a position to better demonstrate our loyalty to the Horde.

The Dark Iron must die. See that they do not claim so much as an inch more of this beach.

 Quest Hand-in: Let there be no confusion on where we stand, <name>.
Title: Given to Corruption

Description: A final favor for an old friend, perhaps? My age-old companion, Varethos, has fallen to the nightmare's torment. We once worked in unison to protect this land. His close ties to the land brought him low in this dark hour.

As with all who suffer this fate, there is no restoring him.

Please, {name}, bring him peace.

 Quest Hand-in: My sight fades, but I am glad that he rests.
Title: Darkheart Thicket: Into Darkheart Thicket

Description: Beneath the boughs of Shaladrassil, Xavius extends his power to twist and torment the once-pure druid grove. 

Not only this, but Xavius has taken a prize from among the druids, and his revenge will be slow and painful. We should go to Darkheart Thicket and stop his wicked plans.

 Quest Hand-in: Were you able to overcome Darkheart Thicket?
Title: Meet the High Tinker

Description: I don't know if you'll remember Mekkatorque or not. Nevin tells me that memory loss is pretty common for a Gnomeregan survivor.

Mekkatorque, or more properly, the High Tinker Mekkatorque is the leader of all the gnomes. He has made a habit of meeting with every rescued survivor personally. You should introduce yourself to him. He'll be with his war council beneath the tent in the center of town.

 Quest Hand-in: It's good to meet you, <name>. You've probably heard others speaking of Operation: Gnomeregan. Let me tell you a bit about what happened and why we left the dwarven city of Ironforge.
Title: Bat Soul

Description: <The Bat Soul is cunning and swift. The shape of the bat will be yours to call upon.>

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, the bat. This shape is now yours to call upon.
Title: Mastering the Runes

Description: I think I've figured out what the Iron Dwarves are doing. The tools they use are imbued with magic during their forging.

When they're used to carve runes, the symbols form much more than mere words. These runes have the power to bind, compel, and twist.

If I had a set of those tools, I could mimic the runes in the book. I captured one of these boxes from one of the pavilions at Giants' Run, but it was empty. Look for similar boxes and recover a set of tools from them.

 Quest Hand-in: <Pembe examines the tools.>These are more delicate than I'd thought. Allow me a moment to try them out.
Title: The Great Cranium Caper

Description: Sandfury thugs attacked de inn after you left and kidnapped de whole Goldtusk Gang!

We gotta get dem back.

Man'zul was usually de brains behind our thefts back in Zuldazar, but I'll try to come up with a plan to get dem outta dis mess.

<Rhan'ka thinks for awhile.>

I got it! You rescue 'em all!

 Quest Hand-in: Ya one of us now, <name>.
Title: Deadly Prey

Description: <After working together on recent pet battles, your snowfeather falcosaur seems much more interested in your combat abilities. It might learn a thing or two from watching you do battle with a powerful opponent.>

 Quest Hand-in: <The hatchling looks at you with admiration. It will need some time to recover from this adventure.>
Title: Forged of Shadow and Flame

Description: The weapons the Twilight's Hammer uses against us are crafted by Forgemaster Pyrenduis within these very halls. The metal slices through armor like cheese in the hands of its wielder. Yet, when captured, the steel turns brittle and shatters.

So be it, {name}. I'd rather see those cursed arms smashed than delivered to our enemy.

Seek out the crates of Twilight arms in these caverns and smash them to pieces.

 Quest Hand-in: Good, good. I like nothing more than to see the works of our enemy destroyed.
Title: A Boon for the Powerful

Description: The king is finally beginning to take note of our power and our value to the Alliance, thanks to your deeds. Perhaps they are beginning to accept our kind.

King Wrynn has commissioned the royal enchanter to create a powerful weapon in recognition of your achievements.

The materials you will need come from Silverpine Forest's Shadowfang Keep. Travel there and obtain the tenebrous orb held by Lord Godfrey, the Book of Lost Souls, and the essence of the ghosts haunting the castle.

 Quest Hand-in: I won't ask what you had to do to come by such rare and powerful materials, but I'm glad to have the chance to work with them. Your weapon will be magnificent!
Title: Return of the Archmage

Description: With Dalaran protected once again, we can all breathe a little easier. 

It is time for us to return to the Hall of the Guardian. I'm sure Meryl is anxiously awaiting word of our success.

 Quest Hand-in: We must not forget that this is a temporary measure. I cannot overstate the devastation that will ensue if Kathra'natir escapes... Still, thanks to you, Dalaran's teeth are sharpened once more. Well done, Archmage <name>!
Title: A Gift for a Lord of Ironforge

Description: Did you want to make a Lovely Charm Bracelet for Muradin Bronzebeard? I'm sure he'd be thrilled.

Do you already have a Lovely Charm Collector's Kit?

 Quest Hand-in: My thanks for this Lovely Charm Bracelet.
Title: Excuse the Mess

Description: I wish I knew more about how to welcome you to the Dragon Isles, but I'm only the sentry.

<Sendrax motions to the tower behind her.>

You could try talking with Ambassador Fastrasz in the visitor center. He might be able to answer more of your questions before the dragons arrive.

Mind your step in there. He was clearing out rubble last I saw.

 Quest Hand-in: The embassy is looking better already!Is every <race> as helpful as you are? I can't wait to meet more.
Title: Darkened Dreams

Description: The ancients at the Emerald Dragonshrine suffer in their dreams. With Ysera gone, I am shorthanded and unable to investigate the matter myself. Would you help me cleanse the nightmare from the Emerald Dragonshrine?

 Quest Hand-in: With your assistance, the ancients have fallen back into their restful slumber. Thank you, <race>.
Title: The Altar of Storms

Description: Up on the bluffs to the west lies a powerful altar.  A powerful DEMONIC altar, guarded by cultists, but powerful nonetheless.  If you can reach it, you can use it to bring Loramus back to us.

The altar will likely resist your efforts, so you'll have to protect Loramus' body while the ritual completes.  Bring the demon hunter back to me afterwards.

 Quest Hand-in: You... you fool!  What have you done?
Title: What's Shaking in Ironforge

Description: Things have grown worse in Ironforge, {name}.  Please, speak with Stormcaller Mylra in Ironforge and see if you can lend a hand in some way.

 Quest Hand-in: It is good that you've come, <name>.  We need all the help we can get with the situation here.
Title: Bladespire Kegger

Description: As T'chali was saying, he helped out his Bloodmaul friends to make their brew.  But what T'chali did not say was why.

The Bloodmaul are in dire straits.  The Bladespire clan be crushing them, and they needed a new weapon to help out with their fight.

That's when T'chali came up with a great idea.  Why not make the perfect brew, one that strengthens you and weakens your enemy?  Only thing is, T'chali does not know if it works.

So, you gonna take this brew up to Bladespire Hold and see if it works!

 Quest Hand-in: That's good news!  That brew is gonna come in handy with what T'chali is gonna ask you to do next.
Title: The Ruins of Gol Var

Description: What lies beyond are more ruins, much like those the coven sought.  

However, these ruins served a different purpose, one that established the legacy of House Waycrest thousands of years ago.

Let us head inside, and I will explain.

 Quest Hand-in: Who would've thought that from this stuffy little chamber would rise some of the greatest warriors of House Waycrest's history?Are you prepared to follow in their footsteps?
Title: Mother's Prized Knife

Description: The other day, Mother and I were up at the top of the nearby mountain, and she threw her skinning knife at me because the view wasn't good enough.

Her knife is still up there, somewhere. I'd feel horrible just leaving it.

 Quest Hand-in: This is it - look, you can still see some of me on it.
Title: Imprisoned Inquisitor

Description: This report states that the Legion seeks to free an imprisoned Legion inquisitor called Raalgar, a demon from here on Argus who cannot be killed because of a secret magic he alone possesses. 

Because of his immortality, he is held in the Arcatraz in Tempest Keep.

The Light Mother told us of that naaru stronghold, but I've never set eyes upon it myself, {name}. Turalyon mentioned the Vindicaar has some connection to Tempest Keep. Perhaps your ship's engineer knows more.

 Quest Hand-in: High Inquisitor Raalgar? A fearsome creature but he has been held securely in the Arcatraz at Tempest Keep for a very long time. If the Legion plans to free him then they must know that he is particularly dangerous to us.
Title: Awakening the Archdruid

Description: Now, we must focus our efforts on waking Archdruid Steelclaw.

She and our druid brethren slumber in the barrow dens to the south.

With the furbolgs quelled, we can pass safely to the entrance.

Go and awaken the Archdruid. I pray to Elune that we are not too late.

 Quest Hand-in: <The Archdruid's deep, shallow breaths rumble across the chamber.>
Title: Ready for Greatness

Description: You seem to know your way around the kitchen. Demonstrate to me your skills and make me 5 bowls of rice pudding.

 Quest Hand-in: You are ready. You are now a zen master cook.
Title: Rescue the Survivors!

Description: The healing crystals are replenished, but that is not the only way we can help the injured. All draenei can tap the gift of the Naaru to heal. You must use this ability to heal one of the crash survivors.

You'll find most of the survivors in the areas to the west and northwest, but the crash scattered us all over the vale.

The survivors have suffered from exposure to the irradiated power crystals, so you should be able to find them by the red glow that surround them.

You must save them, {name}.

 Quest Hand-in: The Light be praised! You've done what only a true hero could have done, <name>! The <race> you saved owes their continued life to your selflessness!Please, take this supply pouch. You look like you can use it more than I.
Title: Fight Plague with Fire

Description: One final request of you, stranger. I've seen what's happening outside, and I've heard about this "plague". I don't want to go down without a fight.

I have enough rum in the back of this bar to set this whole tavern on fire, but I don't have the tools to do it safely. Fetch me a flint and some rope, and I'll give you my key to the backstreets of Stratholme.

 Quest Hand-in: This'll do, <class>.Take this key. You've earned it.
Title: Defense of the Fel Hammer

Description: We need to get back to the Fel Hammer ASAP!

 Quest Hand-in: That was quite a hit you took...Frankly, I'm amazed that the Fel Hammer didn't self destruct when we fired her weapons. We are lucky to be alive.
Title: Guests at Grommash Hold

Description: {name}, I've received word that a vulpera caravan has arrived at Grommash Hold. They wish to address the Horde and have requested your presence.

I'm afraid it is not the best time for guests, so please see them as soon as you are able.

 Quest Hand-in: I'm glad you've come, <name>. You should be the first to hear what we have to say.
Title: Teamwork Lesson: Xavius

Description: <Your sharptalon hatchling has taken to hiding in your pack when you approach very powerful creatures in the world. It must learn to remain calm under pressure, even when facing the darkest of nightmares. Showing it an epic example of teamwork against a fearsome foe might help.>

 Quest Hand-in: <The hatchling looks at you timidly. It appears to be a little afraid of your power. It will need some time to recover from this adventure.>
Title: Teron Gorefiend - Lore and Legend

Description: Stories abound about the life of Teron Gorefiend, but most are just that - stories. We do not know what happened to Gorefiend after he returned to Draenor.

The only thing we are certain of is that he has already died once.

I have heard the scouts here speaking of an ancient orc spirit that resides at the Altar of Shadows, far to the southeast, across the Netherwing Fields and through Netherwing Pass. Take the Spectrecles and track this orc down. He will surely have more information on Gorefiend.

 Quest Hand-in: Gorefiend? Why, I have not heard that name in ages!After the Second War, Gorefiend returned here, along with his death knights. Unable to cope with the terrible nature of his new form and without the support of his beloved leader, Gul'dan, Gorefiend killed himself.If he walks these lands now as a spirit, it is news to me. Yet, perhaps I can divine such knowledge with your assistance.
Title: The Properties of Leystone

Description: I've never seen anything like this "leystone" ore. It's light, like mithril, but it carries much more of a magical energy... more even than saronite or elementium.

Let's try making something with it. How about a nice pair of gauntlets?

 Quest Hand-in: Are you alright? Most of my stock seems to be unharmed by the flames. It's a good thing this wasn't the tailoring shop.The explosion seemed to happen when I applied the flux.No flux means no welding. That's a shame. Without the ability to weld, we're limited to crafting belts and bracers.
Title: The Power Within

Description: My apologies for the unannounced intrusion, {name}. Do you have a moment?

The power within your weapon has grown exponentially as you have fought the Legion, but I cannot help but wonder if there is something... more... hidden away within. Perhaps even a new form entirely!

The very thought demands we find out for sure.

The ancient blue dragon in Azsuna known as Senegos lays dying and is key to our journey. You must aid him - I will meet you in his domain as soon as I am able.

 Quest Hand-in: Senegos has generously offered us his assistance in the journey ahead.A truly kind soul.
Title: Visions of the Dreamer: Origins

Description: The spirit within the wildseed dreams of her birth and youth, in the primordial days of her world.

Go to the first Dreamshrine outside of Hibernal Hollow. Meditate at the shrine, and soothe this vision of how her life began.

 Quest Hand-in: We all start somewhere. Sometimes in unexpected places. Me, I just popped out of the ground like a flower.
Title: Priestess Hu'rala

Description: Thank you, {name}.  I know you didn't have to save my life, and... well, I am thankful.

The return of Bloodlord Mandokir is ill news.  He was killed inside Zul'Gurub several years ago, and we thought we had seen the last of him and his kind.  The trolls of Zul'Gurub were attempting to perform a hideous, horrible ritual.  If Mandokir is alive, then it stands to reason that he is not the only one.

The trolls at Bambala in the east may know more.  Speak with their priestess.

 Quest Hand-in: Mandokir is alive, yes.You are responsible, yes.You may be able to stop him still, yes.
Title: Working With the Wardens

Description: As much as we might not like it, we need the aid of the Wardens if we're to locate the Sargerite Keystone. They took it from you when we were all imprisoned in the vault.

With Maiev missing, their current leader is Sira Moonwarden. On your behalf, I have agreed that we will assist them in tracking down some of the more powerful creatures that escaped from the Vault of the Wardens. In return, she will direct us to where we need to go to get the Keystone.

 Quest Hand-in: Well, we did everything that she asked, but that wasn't enough for Sira Moonwarden.She's asking for one more thing and she wants you to deal with it personally.
Title: Big Gulls Won't Die

Description: Still one more... takes my bait... my fish...

My finger...

Kill him... you will be... rewarded...

 Quest Hand-in: Is he dead?Yes... now I can catch... and gut... and catch...More entrails... only the best for the sisters...
Title: The Zealot Rises

Description: Sometimes the line between hero and villain is nothing more than perception. As High Inquisitor, Sally Whitemane saw herself as a champion of humanity in the war against the scourge. Yet under her leadership the Scarlet Crusade slew the living along with the undead.

Death can bring a silent peace to the soul, but not for Sally Whitemane. Her death is one of regret and unrest.

We will offer her the chance to atone for her crimes. The price will be high, but I have little doubt she will pay it.

 Quest Hand-in: I have heard that the battle at Scarlet Monastery was a success, thanks to you.Initiate Whitemane has already begun her training as a <class>. She shows much promise, and I have no doubt she will make a formidable horseman.
Title: Blood in the Tides

Description: We do not have sirens in Zandalar, but our sailors know of dem. In Zandalari, we call dem bwon'tulak - de death singers.

My ship was run aground and my fellow sailors all murdered by de death singers.

Jane saved my life, so now I help to protect dese people.

Sirens are a plague on da seas, no matter who ya serve. Run the tides red wit dere blood!

 Quest Hand-in: You have made de seas safer for all. You have my thanks.
Title: Projections and Plans

Description: This is a teleportation device. If I had to guess, I'd say that it leads to the surge needle platform floating above the Moonrest Gardens to the southwest.

{name}, I need you to use it to investigate what's up there. It appears that the device works both ways so you shouldn't have to jump off.

I expect that once you teleport up to the top of the surge needle, there will be some sort of apparatus on it to observe.

You should be able to use the teleporter from anywhere within the gardens.

 Quest Hand-in: What you're describing... that's a projection of the Arcanomicon!<The archmage's show of concern is quickly masked behind an impassive countenance.>The Arcanomicon is a map of all of the magical ley line intersections in the world. The blue dragonflight has been using it to find and destroy ley line 'anchors' to send the magical power back to the Nexus.The question is, why is the path of destruction leading east when it should be heading west instead?
Title: A Brew for the Ages

Description: Legends speak of an ale brewed by Neltharion himself. Yet this ale has been lost to the ages! If those stories are true, and doubtless they are, we may find the recipe within this vault. 

Ipfelkofer and I found three keys to this vault, so we decided to look around. Hopefully, our thirst for discovery will be quenched.

If we found that recipe, imagine the excitement in the brewing community! We could even feature that ale at the next Brewfest! First round will be on me.

 Quest Hand-in: Our operation is a success! Now that we've got the recipe, we won't be needing these. So help yourself.So what should we call this ale? Deathwing Dark? Black Flagon? Beyond the Dark Porter?Anyway, that was amazing. I need a drink.
Title: Picking Bones

Description: When I was sailing in, I noticed the remains of an unbelievably large beast on the nearby peninsula.

Whatever it was, it must have been strong, making it the perfect source for the bone elements of the drums.

Go to the peninsula, 'Xibala' I've heard it called, and fill a bag with the bones you find.

If you come across any of those damned Alliance, show them no mercy. They did this to themselves.

 Quest Hand-in: These look good.It makes me even happier knowing this was something the Alliance was after, and that you mucked that up for them! Heh!
Title: Further Advancement

Description: As the war against our enemies progresses, so must we.

We are now able to perform new research. Seek out Leafbeard the Storied to continue advancing the Order Hall.

 Quest Hand-in: Our power grows.
Title: Ember Court: Lost Chalice Band

Description: Hips was smart to send you my way. The Lost Chalice Band plays the best music this side of the Maw!

The band is not quite ready to tour yet, however.

The musicians are all safe in the crypt behind me, but their instruments have been confiscated by our obnoxious neighborhood authorities!

Noise complaints and all that.

Help me get those back, and perhaps recruit a few groupies and roadies along the way to help out, and we shall throw the best concert your court has ever seen!

 Quest Hand-in: I do not know what promotional tricks you used, but it worked.A whole stream of dredgers and venthyr stopped by to join the band crew!The Lost Chalice Band is ready to tour!
Title: Riverbeast Training: Moth of Wrath

Description: Deep in the forests of Nagrand are some beasts capable of evading almost any predator. The greatest of them all, the Moth of Wrath, is coated with a foul-smelling dust.

If the moth dust is enough to keep wolves at bay, it'll probably be a pretty good test for your riverbeast. See if you can't keep it focused and take down that moth.

 Quest Hand-in: Glad to see you two make it back. It'll need a bit of time to brush that dust off.
Title: Elekk Training: Orc Hunters

Description: The Warsong Clan of Nagrand are some of the finest hunters the world of Draenor has ever known. Their beast-killers will aid us in putting this mount to the test.

Out in Nagrand, you will find an orc by the name of Karak, the Great Hunter. He has slain more fierce beasts than any other in the clan. Face him astride your mount, and avenge the slain.

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, you have hunted the hunter. Many beasts will be pleased tonight.
Title: A Fitting Weapon

Description: From your earliest days, your trainers always knew you would make your mark on the Horde. You have fought bravely and given our enemies reason to fear.

As a reward for your dedication, the warchief has commissioned his personal smith to forge a special weapon.

The cursed Shadowfang Keep in Silverpine Forest is the only place to get the materials you'll need. Travel there and find the lost Silverlaine family sword, a supply of moonsteel ingots, and sinew from the ghouls and geists infesting the keep.

 Quest Hand-in: Grezz Ragefist told me to expect you. Those materials will make a fine sword. Always use it for the glory of the Horde.
Title: The Troll Menace

Description: The trolls're acting up.  More than usual, I'd say.  We've seen them put together war parties before, but this time it's... different.

What matters most, however, is the continued protection of Anvilmar.  I've no intention to let these trolls flank Anvilmar while its attention is turned towards troggs.  Go thin their ranks a bit.  They need to know that we're still not without defenses.

 Quest Hand-in: Hopefully that did the trick.  Anvilmar will be safe from trolls for the time being.  Now, to find out what it is that has the trolls so agitated.
Title: An Unexpected Message

Description: Ah, Felo'melorn. I am familiar with this weapon. 

For ages the Council of Tirisfal attempted to recover the blade. Its control over the primal forces of fire would be devastating in the wrong hands. 

As luck would have it, an associate of mine, Archmage Modera has recently uncovered some information on this artifact. This crystal contains a message from her.

I suggest you start your search there. The portal over there will bring you back to the city.

 Quest Hand-in: <name>, I'm glad you came.I've found information on just the thing we need to turn this war in our favor.
Title: Hot and Cold

Description: As you stare at the anvil you relive your recent accomplishments, particularly those which brought this artifact to rest here.

It suddenly occurs to you that more remains to be done. To the east, smoldering scraps clutter the landscape--shrapnel from the battle fought there.

If they could be cooled and gathered somehow, the frost giants would have an abundant supply of metal and the region would be cleared of these remnants of war.

 Quest Hand-in: You feel a sense of accomplishment as you realize that your efforts continue to strengthen the renewed bonds between Thorim and the Sons of Hodir.
Title: Marshals of Madness

Description: The n'raqi have long served as the commanders and taskmasters of the Old Gods' forces. Their presence on the field of battle shows that this invasion is a coordinated effort rather than a random outbreak of corruption.

Led by these faceless masters, the chaotic forces of the Old Gods transform into capable military.

We must make it a priority to fell these creatures. Only then might we take the upper hand against N'Zoth.

 Quest Hand-in: The loss of their leaders should prove to scatter N'Zoth's forces in the Vale.This should provide us with the advantage we need to crush them once and for all.
Title: Deliver the Thread

Description: Here is your thread, {name}.  It has a thousand uses, from binding evil spirits to sewing life into inanimate objects.

 Quest Hand-in: Delightful!  This will do splendidly...Here, good <name>, take this as payment for your honorable deed.
Title: At Your Service

Description: I suppose I should commend you. You certainly exceeded my expectations.

Rathan can be sentimental, but he is right. This place can be our new home, and here we can construct new bodies for the souls you freed.

Inform Baroness Draka that she has earned the allegiance of Princess Emeni and the constructs of Butchers Block! We stand ready for whenever she has need of our strength.

 Quest Hand-in: Well done. Emeni and her constructs will make for powerful allies.They will, however, need your assistance to reach their full potential.
Title: Mysteries of the Maw

Description: The Maw is changing, mortal. And with change comes opportunity.

The Jailer has pulled a realm that was hidden deep within the Shadowlands into the Maw. It is a location of some interest to me, but I do not wish to approach it alone.

The Mawsworn are swarming the area, you see. There must be something of value that they seek.

I have a safe enclave nearby. Accompany me there and I may be able to help you find that waystone you're looking for.

Do we have a deal?

 Quest Hand-in: The Jailer desperately wants something here, yet his precious Eye cannot breach its defenses.Oh well. Shall we?
Title: Face Your Enemy

Description: We have decided that our best course of action would be to enter the prison disguised as Proudmoore military. Rexxar will be our prisoner.

We want to keep a low profile until we break Ashvane out.

I find that I work better with reference when undertaking this type of endeavor.

I have chosen some humans that interest me. I would like to examine their faces.

Use the Shard of Vesara on them, and they will be... encouraged to find their way to me.

 Quest Hand-in: Humans can be so malleable.
Title: Into the Maw!

Description: Atop the Lightning Ledge, the Twilight's Hammer has erected an enormous flamegate. I do not know where it leads; I know it is not of this realm, and I cannot enter. None of my other followers have returned.

I need you to enter this realm and be my fangs within. Step through the flamegate. If he is still alive, meet with Jordan Olafson inside. He will give you a token that will allow you to use my powers in that realm.

Be bold, {name}. Find out where that flamegate leads, and destroy whatever lies within.

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, you are the champion Goldrinn promised! Your eyes don't deceive you: you have entered the Firelands, an elemental plane of molten stone and fire. We've got our work cut out for us here.Put aside your differences with the Horde, there's plenty of danger to go around.And take this: the Fang of Goldrinn will allow you to channel the ancient's power here within the Firelands. Use it well!
Title: Setting the Mood

Description: De voodoo love incense and romantic meal are ready, {name}. Take dem and place dem at de feet of Maka'fon. 

Quickly, if you could. Dat smell is... overwhelmingly, horribly, disgusting. 

Could you move any faster? 

Away. 

From us.

For de sake of de brutosaurs, of course.

 Quest Hand-in: I am an expert on love and all of my previous mates can attest to dat. I have misread de reason for Maka'fon's mood. De razorwings ate her last clutch of eggs and she will make no more until she feels safe and avenged.
Title: Eatercology

Description: Drek'Thar thinks the portions of Exurotus consumed by the goren might be worthless. I am not about to step before the fury without at least trying to recover as many of these "motes" as possible.

Slay any goren you find at Magnarok and see if you can extract the motes of Frostfire from them.

 Quest Hand-in: Goren are abominations. They were created to eat the world. Your have done well.
Title: Condition Critical!

Description: We have the enemy on their heels. Victory is within sight!

It is not yet time to celebrate though, {class}. There remains much to be done before the Horde can lay claim to Ashenvale.

At Raynewood Retreat to the east a battle has been joined. Reports indicate many Horde wounded.

Take these medical supplies there and give them to Thagg. Tell him of our assault on Astranaar. It may help to bolster morale.

 Quest Hand-in: <Thagg listens intently as you recount your assault on Astranaar.>This is good news indeed, <race>. But right now, we need more than just good news here.These triage kits will be put to good use!
Title: Azsharite Experiment Number Two

Description: Okay, new plan. We'll SCARE it out of 'em! In my experience most large creatures are terrified of tiny ones - like rats. Hmm. This place is crawling with rats, but how do we coax them over to the giant?

Hey! You don't mind having your cellular matrix broken down and reassembled do you? It's only painful while it's happening. I can shrink you down to rat-sized and you can ride one of these brutes over there like a horse. It's so crazy it's got to work! Speak with me when you're ready for shrinkage...

 Quest Hand-in: So scaring him didn't work, either? Double-nertz! I'll have to break the news to Grapplehammer: Azsharite's going to remain the rarest substance on the planet. We'll have to use it sparingly.
Title: Consult the Locals

Description: Whoever wove this fabric CAN'T have intended it only for belts and shoulderpads. There must be some way to sew thread into this material.

Head on down to Azsuna and try to find a tailor. We need to sew if we're going to do any real tailoring.

 Quest Hand-in: My my, look at you! Such an attractive young <class>, and all bedecked in magical finery and weaponry. To what do I owe the pleasure?Aha! Tailoring! It's your lucky day, er...I'm sorry, what was your name? <name>?It's your lucky day, <name>! I happen to be one of the best tailors in Suramar...
Title: A Gift For Chee Chee

Description: That crazy Chee Chee is actually pretty neat. Mah always said that hozen were nothing but trouble, but... I guess he's just a better hozen then the rest of them.

We should do something nice for him! Those mountain hozen in the west make some really fancy stir fry, and keep bowls of it inside their little hozen houses.

I bet Chee Chee would love some!

 Quest Hand-in: For me? Me, Chee Chee?This brings Chee Chee back to when Chee Chee was little wikkin' baby. Chee Chee's mama used to make it just like this.
Title: Darnassian Intrusions

Description: Besides the constant threat that the Wretched represent, I also have to deal with all kind of fictitious reports of night elf sightings.

Though most reports are unfounded, one recent incident demands further investigation.  The West Sanctum, one of our primary energy sources, has suffered a terrible malfunction and rumors of Darnassian sabotage are rampant.

Travel there and deal with anyone that looks suspicious.  Report back to Ley-Keeper Velania, who watches over the sanctum.

 Quest Hand-in: Night elves?  Here?  Those rats!Do you suppose they had anything to do with the malfunction in my sanctum?  If you have any information, you'd better take it to Captain Sunbrand at once!
Title: Spirits Are With Us

Description: Dere was somethin' not right about dem serpents, {name}.  Dere was a trace of some bad mojo in da poison an' dat don't happen naturally.

Da bonfire in da middle of da camp, we can use dat to perform a ritual.

Whatever be makin' dese serpents attack, dey probably still watchin' over dem.

Da only problem, {name}, is dat I only be here in spirit form.  I need you to be my hands.  I need you to go to da fire an' prepare it for me.  Den I'll handle da rest.

 Quest Hand-in: Venoxis... Dis can't be good, <name>.
Title: Memories of Ebonchill

Description: Is that Ebonchill you've got there? Alodi's old staff? My my my... <Cough>

In the days of the first guardian, all the members of the Council of Tirisfal granted their powers to the young mage in the hopes that he could overcome the Legion. <Wheeze> None of them are alive today... but that staff of yours remembers.

Search the streets of Dalaran below for reflections of the former council members. Their memories may empower you as they once did Alodi. Seek them out and speak with one!

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, your eyes gleam with newfound knowledge, <name>.That staff of yours has seen the passing of many mortal lifetimes.  It can teach you a great many things, if you're willing to listen.As for its memories... they may be unreliable. You may find a different reflection haunts the streets of Dalaran each day. I leave it to you to find them all.
Title: Capture a Mine

Description: The mines in Alterac Valley hold more than just minerals.  Both the Frostwolf and Stormpike have cached excess supplies in the Irondeep and Coldtooth mines... that's not a bad idea, if we could only maintain control of them!

Capture a mine, then return to me.  To capture a mine, enter one that we do not control and kill its leader.  When you do that, the mine will be ours, and we'll send troops to protect it!

 Quest Hand-in: You did it!  Well done, <name>!When we control a mine and have troops stationed there, it's much easier to gather minerals and supplies from it.
Title: WANTED:  "Hogger"

Description: Wanted: Hogger

A huge gnoll, Hogger, is prowling the woods in southwestern Elwynn.  He has overpowered all attempts at his capture.

The Stormwind Army has placed a generous bounty on the Gnoll.  To earn the reward, bounty hunters should venture into the woods and deal with the beast.

 Quest Hand-in: He did WHAT? Great, now we have a bloodthirsty beast right beneath the streets of Stormwind, with a whole army of gnolls at his command.  Definitely an improvement, I feel safer already.  Here's your reward, <name>.  But promise me you'll check in with the Stockades guards in Stormwind at some point, just to ensure that things are going smoothly.
Title: Keep the Secret Safe

Description: Our existence here depends entirely upon staying hidden. Should the shield fail, even for a moment, Malygos' minions would have us.

One of my responsibilities is to rejuvenate the warmages' mana levels so their focus doesn't falter. With our supply lines lost, I've been forced to improvise.

I could use your help, {name}.

Very near the Nexus, Arcane Serpents feast on the abundant magical energies. Once defeated, they will yield a mana essence that I can make use of.

 Quest Hand-in: Your service to Dalaran will not go unnoticed, <race>.I hope you find this payment sufficient.
Title: Waterlogged Recipe

Description: This appears to be the remains of a mixture for potent wine.  Perhaps the proprietor of One More Glass in Dalaran would be interested in it....

 Quest Hand-in: This is quite a find, <name>.  I can't have you selling this to anyone else, so I'm willing to offer generously.
Title: Dizzy Sparkshift

Description: I'm in a pretty good spot as far as artifacts go.

We have a couple other society members out in the field. I'd go look for them, but it seems like a bad idea from a health perspective.

You don't seem to have a problem with pain, think you could find Dizzy?

 Quest Hand-in: Shh... keep it down. The last thing I want is to get punched in the face by an ogre.
Title: Pristine Firestorm Egg

Description: What is that heavenly smell?

 Quest Hand-in: I have never seen one of those before, where in the world did you get it? It is so beautiful, I am not sure I can bear to break it open. Just kidding, this is going to make the best omelet! Here is a bunch of coins!
Title: The Fog of Battle

Description: The Primalist attack came suddenly and with no warning. My unit attempted to find our leader, Commander Eranog, but before we could get to the other side of the garrison we were cut off.

In the battle my unit leader, Sergeant Tagrik, held off three Primalists by himself as Kaora, Mikor, and myself battled at his side.

Their screams are the last thing I remember before I fell. 

Please, {race}, if you see any signs of my unit let me know what happened to them.

 Quest Hand-in: This... pains me to hear... but I understand. Thank you, <class>.
Title: A Grizzly End

Description: This lodge serves as the largest supplier of furs and leather to Boralus.

<Kennings puffs out his chest a bit.>

And as its proprietor, it is my duty to ensure every request is met on time. With recent delays, I've decided to take a trip out here to see if the Holtons need my assistance.

We could use any available hands! Take this knife and bring back some pelts from the bears in the nearby pass.

 Quest Hand-in: These furs appear to be in fine shape. Your skills should easily make up for any setbacks caused by 'accidents'.
Title: Fit for an Elven Queen

Description: The nightborne have dropped their shield allowing us to penetrate their city and learn their secrets.

One such secret I've discovered is a crown of immeasurable power.

I'd like you to find this crown and report back to me on what it does.

 Quest Hand-in: You found it?<Tae'thelan listens as you explain about the missing jewels.>I see. So the crown was just a vessel and the jewels are the true source of power.
Title: It's What's Inside That Counts

Description: The Makers built two Ancient Stone Keepers to help protect Uldaman from would-be invaders and to oversee daily operations while Ironaya and Archaedas slumber. One is still fully operational in Temple Hall, but the one in Echomok Cavern has been corrupted by something.

I fear that one of the Old Gods is responsible for this, and you're going to help me see if that's the case! Topple both of the guardians and bring me their power cores. They'll tell us all we need to know. 

 Quest Hand-in: This is incredible, <name>. The power coursing through each core...the contrasting powers so close together!I'll take this to the proper dwarves right away. These cores are extremely important!
Title: Schematic Reassimilation: Ambystan Darter

Description: <This schematic contains the pattern of a new protoform construct. Present it to an appropriate protoform forge and it may instantiate one of these creatures for you.>

 Quest Hand-in: <The protoform forge chimes a melancholy song as it draws in the schematic.>
Title: Fear No Evil

Description: Have you embraced the Holy Light yet, brother? It is through the Holy Light that we are saved! It is through the Holy Light that I am able to heal these overly demanding soldiers! And it is through the Holy Light that you will be able to venture out into the field to the north and rescue our fallen brothers!

Take this prayer book with you into the field and cast the Light's healing touch on the injured.

 Quest Hand-in: I think you now understand the power of the Light. The Light giveth hope, brother and the Light taketh from the darkness! BLESSED BE THE LIGHT!
Title: Echoes of My Ancestors

Description: This land holds many secrets and many artifacts of ancient times.

From what I've been able to discern there's an artifact of great power close to here. I just need to narrow down its location.

I'd like you to dig up more artifacts and learn what you can. When you feel you've done enough research, come back to me and share your knowledge.

 Quest Hand-in: <Tae'thelan listens to your recount of what you learned.>Very interesting. If what you've said is true, then I believe I know where the location of the artifact is.
Title: How to Sink a Zandalari Battleship

Description: Let's go over our plan of attack, but remember above all things, the Zandalari cannot know our full forces are here.

If they were to discover an Alliance base within the shadow of their empire... we would be wiped out in an instant.

 Quest Hand-in: You know the plan, <name>. Stay hidden and weaken the Zandalari fleet. If we accomplish those two goals, we'll walk out of here alive.
Title: Ohn'ahran Plains

Description: The green dragonflight needs the aid of adventurers. To do so, you must ally with the centaur of the plains.

Ambassador Taurasza can be of aid.

 Quest Hand-in: We have much to discuss, you and I.
Title: The False Talon King

Description: Ikiss was once a respected sage among the Adherents, but his search for the truth of Terokk's fall led to his own banishment.

Ikiss became obsessed with Terokk, even claiming to be the old hero reborn. He commands the Sethekk, promising untold power in a new age of darkness.

Know this: Ikiss is no Talon King. Slay the delusional fool, and search him for anything useful. He is known to collect powerful trinkets.

 Quest Hand-in: A bracelet? Interesting... rather plain looking...
Title: Mischief in the Making

Description: You good hunter, but Frenzyheart can make you stronger. Harkek think maybe you ready for something more important.

Before Rakjak send you on important mission, you need gather things for Rakjak. All along river to south are blue crystals. Rakjak need lots of blue crystals.

You go get crystals now.

 Quest Hand-in: Good <race>! Okay, all ready.
Title: On the Brink

Description: This many withered threaten to wipe our brood out completely!

Quickly, {name}! Crack off a ley crystal and heal any wounded drakes you can find out on the battlefield.

I will do what I can to keep these whelplings safe and healthy.

 Quest Hand-in: Well done. I saw the other drakes take to the skies.And look! You found Emmigosa!It seems she's taken a shine to you, <name>. I trust you'll keep her safe for now.
Title: Return to Atuik

Description: Return to Elder Atuik at Kamagua. He and the rest of my people must be warned of this impending doom that approaches from the sea.

<Orfus shivers.>

Use the Ancient Lift to reach him. Please hurry!

 Quest Hand-in: The Kalu'ak thank you for all that you have done, <name>. We must now prepare for battle and warn our brothers and sisters across the sea of what is to come.I hope it is not too late...
Title: A Song for Silkstriders

Description: There, the harp is fixed. I am too injured to take it to the silkstriders, but you are strong. You can help them.

Our precious silkstriders are all across the cliffs. When you find one, play the harp for them, and they will give you fresh silk. Make sure that there is nothing nearby to stress them out first though!

If you find yourself in need of a way to move about swiftly, just take a Silk Shooter there, next to me. Aim it where you want to go, and it will shoot silk to pull you there!

 Quest Hand-in: Wonderful job! I'm sure the silkstriders appreciated the song you played. You look like someone who appreciates the fine arts.
Title: Crystal Containment

Description: Kanrethad will be safe in my care, but something must be done about these crystals that hold his fel magic.

If any should break, the energy inside would find its way back to our friend. I shouldn't need to tell you how devastating it would be if that were to happen.

I will gather the crystals and meet you back at Dreadscar Rift.

 Quest Hand-in: The crystals will be safe here, with each of the council members watching over them.Kanrethad is still recovering, but is well enough to speak.
Title: Lost, Not Forgotten

Description: I know not what madness has overtaken my people, but we must stop it together.

Take this bell. It calls the souls of the recently deceased to it for later release. We Stormsong do not bury our dead in the earth. The tides claim all.

If they will not answer to reason, then we must give them eternal peace. Fallen or not, they are Stormsong.

 Quest Hand-in: It is done. We will release them somewhere a bit more peaceful.
Title: A Quick Flyover

Description: Malfurion knows that his wisp wall is a temporary measure. He is buying time for reinforcements to arrive in Teldrassil.

It is imperative that we find a way through that wall, and quickly.

I want you to take our explosive reserves and apply pressure. You will not be able to bring it down, but you may be able to find us an opening. I will have a squadron ready to strike once you break ground.

Zarvik Blastwix should have a few bombardiers for the job.

 Quest Hand-in: How did it go?
Title: An Urgent Message

Description: We received an urgent message from one of Belath's scouts down on Mardum! I think you had better listen to it.

 Quest Hand-in: Lady S'theno went down to lend a hand, but this sounds like it's getting serious!
Title: A Window to the Past

Description: In this, I trust Vanessa's word. I do not believe she knows what the Drakefire Amulet is. Some of the story about Onyxia was made public, but not all.

Perhaps even you do not know. 

I will explain everything, for both of you.

 Quest Hand-in: We all have our own versions of the past, don't we? I don't care if some dragon lady had a magic amulet. It wasn't complete mind control. The nobles already hated the common people. The Stonemason's Guild would never have needed to turn to banditry and become the Defias Brotherhood, if not for them.
Title: Maw of Souls: Into the Maw of Souls

Description: Our scouts report that the vrykul damned are forced to sail aboard the Naglfar, a ship built of death.

Travel to the Maw of Souls and confront Helya, before she collects any more poor, unfortunate souls.

 Quest Hand-in: Were you able to overcome Maw of Souls
Title: The Fabulous Miss Fanny

Description: Most of these vegetables will be sold, but I'd like to keep some for my family. Specifically, my nephew Liang needs some to feed to his pigs.

Unfortunately, the pathway to Liang's farm is currently swarming with Snagtooth virmen. We're going to have to ask Miss Fanny to help us out.

Bring some of the food we've gathered to Miss Fanny, who stands next to my house. Then ask her - NICELY! - to send them down to Liang's ranch.

 Quest Hand-in: I understand you're the one who sent the food down from uncle's farm. Thank you.My pigs are picky eaters, but those turnips and watermelons are some of their favorites.
Title: Attack on Mistfall Village

Description: Mogu have been sighted at Mistfall Village to the southwest. I dispatched Rook and Sun immediately, but I need another capable hand there as soon as possible.

Don't delay. The villagers need you.

 Quest Hand-in: Oh, thank the celestials you're here! This is worse than we thought!
Title: Thog's Nightlight

Description: To see de spirits, we need a special light. A light that lights up one's insides. De light of souls.

Twilight's Hammer uses dem to root out traitors after what we did to dem in Hyjal. Dey just gave one to de Glopgut ogres as a gift.

Inside de Glopgut Hollow to de north, you'll find de great big brute Thog. He's got him a Light of Souls. At least, he will until you take it from him.

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, dis be it, mon.<The lens glows brightly in Buunu's hands, casting unearthly rays of light across the shadowy cave mouth.>We be ready to bring dem spirits out de shadows now.
Title: Fury of Frostfire

Description: The moment I begin the ritual to free Exurotus you can expect Kron to be drawn to us. 

It would normally take an army of seasoned warriors to defeat a magnaron. We have only the three of us.

Look for my fire totem upon the battlefield. I will try to gain what boons I can from Exurotus. Step near the totems and become one with the Fury.

With these boons, slay Kron! Lok'tar ogar!

 Quest Hand-in: With Kron defeated I can finish breaching the magic that holds Exurotus, but I may be too late. So much of the fury has already been expended and drained by the magnaron and goren.I fear we may have only bought this spirit a peaceful death.
Title: Find the Ancient Hero

Description: Quickly, {name}, head southwest to the Halls of the Ancestors!

Within you will find slumbering mjordin. Wake them until you find Iskalder. When you do, use this amulet upon him and bring him back to me.

Now go. There is no time to waste!

 Quest Hand-in: He's a fine specimen and will serve us well.Now, we have to make sure to use him properly to trap Vardmadra!
Title: Hezrul Bloodmark

Description: Hezrul Bloodmark is the leader of the Kolkar centaurs in the Barrens. He is fierce, brutal and cunning. Defeating him would disrupt and fracture the Kolkars, greatly reducing their threat to us.

So kill him. Bring me Hezrul's Head, and I will mount it from this outpost, so that they may know fear.

Hezrul leads his people from the Lushwater Oasis, to the south.

 Quest Hand-in: I commend you, <name>. These centaur are undisciplined and cannot focus their rage as the orcs can, but they are fierce nonetheless.  In defeating them, your valor is proven.
Title: Mobu's Pneumatic Tank Transjigamarig

Description: These wrenches are useless, buddy. I need my pneumatic tank transjigamarig to get these things up and running! Unfortunately, I left it at my old digs, on the other side of this landing. It's the beat down hut next to the stables. You're gonna have to go and get it for me, because I sure as hellfire am not going to go anywhere near the mist.

Oh yea, buddy, watch out for the mist. The mist is what tore up these shores.


 Quest Hand-in: Great work, buddy! Now where'd I put those spare parts...
Title: A Change of Heart

Description: You seek to change the path you walk, {name}?

 Quest Hand-in: May you find what you're looking for, <brother/sister>.
Title: The Dark Lady's Bidding

Description: Uh, are these guys friendlies? I guess it's a good sign they haven't tried to eat Duchess... yet.

Anyway, I have orders. Nathanos caught up with the dark rangers, who were sent forward aboard the Oblivion on a secret mission from Lady Sylvanas herself! Unfortunately the Alliance caught wind of our plan, and now Greymane is attacking the outpost!

We could really use you over there, {name}. Duchess can take you there, just give me the word.

 Quest Hand-in: Finally someone competent arrives at this sorry excuse for an outpost. Our efforts to complete Sylvanas's mission are at a standstill, but now we have even more pressing matters on our hands.
Title: Mech versus Airship

Description: We're all set to go, thanks to them battle plans ya found. Looks like Mekko ain't gonna be at his airship right now.

Here's the plan. We're gonna go seriously mess up his ship, then Mekko is gonna swing by to try to save his friends.

But instead, he's gonna find you and me standin' on the deck of his burnin' ship, waitin' to take him out!

Get in to the mech, {name}, we're blowin' up an airship and a gnome!

 Quest Hand-in: What a ride, huh?
Title: Emergency Response

Description: Your companions have made themselves at home in our land, and brought with them a dangerous conflict.

The full extent of their destruction here we cannot yet know. Already it is... unspeakable.

Nevertheless, to forsake your friends out of spite would be against our way. Any that yet live are doubtlessly wounded and in desperate need of care.

These fireworks were to celebrate the statue's completion. Use them near your companions to signal Mishi, and she will bear them off to safety.

 Quest Hand-in: My thoughts will be with your fallen companions, traveler.May their wounds mend well.
Title: Hands Off Our Booty!

Description: The Irontide Pirates have been stealing from dracthyr and tuskarr. They're taking anything and everything. It's all just booty to them!

You should recover our stolen goods. Make them regret coming here.

 Quest Hand-in: That'll teach them!
Title: Kobold and Kobolder

Description: Now that those little blighters are dealt with, we've got more to take care of.

The tunnel rats are swarming all over the Silver Stream Mine, setting up camps and sniffing around further and further every day. Greedy little things are looking for loot, I gather.

Surveying and foraging is all fine and dandy when it's not on dwarven land! Take care of those tunnel rats and report back to me.

 Quest Hand-in: Good, good. Now we can see what's going on down in that mine.
Title: Establish Your Garrison

Description: It's time for the main event! We've got the materials, we've got the manpower, we've got another thing that starts with "m."

Let's build this thing!

I got a gaggle of assistants up on that ridge to the west.

They should have your personal surveying stand set up by now.

Head on over there and you should be able to watch our progress from it.

 Quest Hand-in: Right! I think we've got this well in hand now. And hardly an explosion to be found!
Title: Love it or Limpet

Description: <Gazlowe spreads the plans on the table and jabs a tiny finger aft of the ship below the waterline.>

There! The hull is thinnest here, where the crankshaft meets the paddlewheel. And it's right next to the magazine!

{name}, I can't be held responsible if some enterprising Horde {class} were to attach a limpet mine to that part of the hull. Not even if I supplied the mine. And paid him. Handsomely. The ship is anchored just southeast of here... go to it!

Then radio me with this stolen gnomecorder.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent! I wish I could've seen the look on that Rear Admiral's face when his flagship went up like a candle. Let me use my telescope here to take a look at the damage.What - Whhhaaatt!? That thing is still floating? Hartley must've moved the munitions ashore in case his ship was mined.I underestimated you, Hartley... but for the last time!
Title: Following the Curse

Description: Very well. I suppose an introduction is in order. I am Revil Kost, priest of the Light and a seeker of lost artifacts. I've dealt with the Dark Riders before, and have returned to rid this place of them.

The Riders are elusive, but I may have a clue to their whereabouts. In our previous confrontation, I was able to see a glimpse into their past. Granted blessed vision by the Cloak of Purity, I saw the Dark Riders for who they were before.

Come with me to Ariden's camp. I will explain on the way.

 Quest Hand-in: It's strange that the Dark Riders haven't followed us here, but I will take whatever boon I can get.I believe the key to finding the Dark Riders is here somewhere. Let us begin our search.
Title: The Path Provides

Description: All who follow the path are granted precious gifts by virtue of their connection with our covenant.

The strength of that bond, known as Renown, is reflected in the shining spires of Elysian Hold itself. Though you have yet to gain Renown, you will as you aid us across the Shadowlands.

When you are ready, I will show you all that the path can provide.

 Quest Hand-in: Follow the path always, and all will be well.
Title: Hunting Amid Houses

Description: I have dreamed that Tyrande Whisperwind is crucial to the survival of Ardenweald.

The night fae have been searching for others like her who were once Night Warriors. We have recruited an ancient ally of Azeroth, Huln Highmountain, in order to look for them.

Elune's power is too much for any mortal to contain--even Tyrande. I do not know how much longer she can hold on.

Allow me to explain further, then you must hurry to meet Huln in Maldraxxus.

 Quest Hand-in: Word of your deeds has spread across the Shadowlands.I know together we will be able to find this Night Warrior swiftly.
Title: Secure Seabrush

Description: You saw spies up above?  This is not good... I won't have it.

Return to Seabrush and get rid of them before they start trickling into our hideout.

 Quest Hand-in: You did well, <name>.  We need to be especially wary of Alliance attacks right now.  The Verne's got plenty of firepower out at sea, but in the back of this cave, she's far too vulnerable.
Title: The Defiler's Legacy

Description: It seems you are not so easily deterred. Very well.

Your deeds qualify you to seek the Sigil. To be clear, I am only permitting you to move on. This does not guarantee your success.

The greatest of your challenges lies before you.

You must go to the Praetorium and face Archimonde himself. Only by defeating the master of the Conservatory will you be worthy of the Sigil.

Few have overcome this obstacle. I hope he does not make too much of a mess of you.

 Quest Hand-in: I have never felt power like this before...<Y'mera handles the shard cautiously.>We should get this to Velen as soon as we can.
Title: Orders Are For the Living

Description: Unsurprisingly, we aren't going to listen to Cromush about the plague. However, his brute strength will come in handy for muscling my men through the many foes ahead on the path to Godfrey, the most powerful being his right hand man, Lord Walden.

I'll meet you in Walden's chamber after you finish him off. Then, at long last, we can completely take Shadowfang Keep for the Forsaken!

 Quest Hand-in: The time has come! Godfrey will fall!
Title: Unyielding Fists: Trial of Bamboo

Description: We will start with a test: The Trial of Bamboo.

Your friend Lin failed this test.

Follow me, and listen carefully to my instructions.

 Quest Hand-in: You show promise, <name>. We will continue.It is now time for your first round of training.
Title: The Shuddering Moor

Description: There is an immense beast in the swamp. It has not yet marched upon us, but I place no stock that we will continue to be so fortunate.

Strike it down before it grows hungry enough to brave our defenses.

 Quest Hand-in: You are not one to be trifled with. I am sure to have further use of your services.Come back to me in a day's time, <class>.
Title: Eradicate the Burning Legion

Description: Though this land is full of strange new enemies, the Burning Legion is still the greatest threat to our Expedition. One of my most trusted warriors, Sergeant Shatterskull, has been studying the Legion's tactics - trying to discern the demons' true purpose in this land. Seek him out at the supply caravan just outside the southern wall.

And {name} - be wary of the Legion. Their evil cannot be underestimated.

 Quest Hand-in: No doubt you saw the Legion's warriors dotting the landscape on your flight from the Dark Portal. Though we defeated them at the Battle of Mount Hyjal some five years past, the cursed demons just keep coming back for more. If it's a challenge they crave, then the Horde will answer in kind!We orcs have more than just a score to settle with the Legion. What about you, <name>? Shall I tell you of our enemy?
Title: Not "Only Zul"

Description: Our enemies here either follow de name of Zul, or dey want to use him to take Zandalar.

He has the ego to allow either. 

Dey claim only Zul can lead us.

Dissuade dem.

 Quest Hand-in: Well done, <name>. I wish that put a bigger dent in the threat they pose.
Title: Taking the Fight to Nagrand

Description: **Eyes Only -- Commander {name}**

With the fall of the rangari base at Telaar, Vindicator Yrel, recommended we establish a new foothold in Nagrand.

I've taken the liberty of dispatching some of our men and supplies. Rangari D'kaan's already reporting that a new outpost is nearly complete. He has indicated that they are ready to receive you.

A gryphon is waiting to catch you up with the latest caravan shipment whenever you're ready, sir.

-- Bodrick Grey, SI:7

 Quest Hand-in: They came at us... from... nowhere.<The lieutenant nearly passes out.>
Title: Wave One

Description: Here they come, {name}! The Twilight Knight Riders, astride black buzzards birthed in the scorching sulfurous breeding pools of the Firelands. The only way to defeat them is from the sky!

Take wing once more, {class}, and slay them.

Run into enemy riders with your lance to destroy them.

Go forth. Fly, fool. Fly!

 Quest Hand-in: Spectacular flying, <name>! Their screeches of anguish echoed about this light-forsaken cavern.But our work is not yet finished...
Title: Twice-Exiled

Description: Elementals of all sorts are bursting free of their bonds across the Highlands.

Return them to the primordial chaos from whence they came.

 Quest Hand-in: The elementals have been banished? Well done.
Title: Claw of the Land

Description: Personal experience has taught me to use stronger materials when crafting armor pieces. They last longer, and you don't need quite as many of them.

For example, I utilize the claws of the pinerock stalkers. If you acquire some for me, perhaps I can show you how better materials can increase your efficiency.

 Quest Hand-in: You've gathered enough here to last me for many moons.<Hrul begins to work with the claws. It's clear that he's using very little of each, but still able to make an excellent armor piece.>I hope you were able to learn something from this, <name>.
Title: Reclaiming the Oathstone

Description: Fine work, friend. It seems we've managed to repair the leylines within the Azure Archives.

Back when the blue dragonflight was united, I would tell my brothers and sisters to never doubt the strength of mortals.

Meet me at the oathstone to the south of here. I will reclaim it, and then be on my way to Thaldraszus.

 Quest Hand-in: It is good to be back... or reactivated, as it were. There is much to do, and I am glad to give whatever aid I can.
Title: Memories of Stormhoof

Description: When the bronze dragonflight gifted me with immortality and set me on the path of the witness, Nozdormu entrusted me with the Lorehammer.

The hammer's reaction to your findings means that time has gone awry here and it is our duty to restore the true timeline.

We must find it. To the northwest is Frostfloe Deep, ancient burial cave of the warriors of Tunka'lo. Seek out the spirit of Chieftain Swiftspear, Stormhoof's brother. Ask him what he remembers of his brother's battle against the North Wind.

 Quest Hand-in: Even the chieftain is beginning to lose his memories? The past is being rewritten before our eyes and if we do not find out who is behind this, the entire legacy of Stormhoof could be lost forever.
Title: The Admiral Won't Back Down

Description: What? You want to stay here to fight? Typical {class}, wanting to stay and fight off the Horde while there's still a chance to run for it.

Look, if you really want to save Northwatch, you should report to Admiral Aubrey in the tower behind me. He's keeping his ships here to fight, instead of ferrying us all away like I begged him to.

Now if you'll excuse me, I've got to finish packing!

 Quest Hand-in: You've ventured all the way here from Honor's Stand? Excellent, we could use your experience here.They may have breached the walls, but Northwatch isn't going down without a fight.
Title: What's My Motivation?

Description: Now for our finale! A thrilling performance of the most recent trials on Azathoth!

<Featherlight checks his notes.>

Azeroth. Whatever. It features an artificial god, a powerful magic ice princess, an infamous queen, and an eldritch abomination of unspeakable terror! Who doesn't love a good drama with a dash of existential horror?

You're back to playing yourself, so just... do whatever heroes are supposed to do!

 Quest Hand-in: A fair enough performance! I think everyone's more acquainted with your world and the role you've played within it.Next time, the set design will be a bit more... prepared. But for now...<Moonberry nods at Ysera.>I think your friend wishes to have a word. Don't take too long. We still have to hold the final induction ceremony at the Heart of the Forest.
Title: Bring Down Those Shields

Description: Look at the button on the side of the controller here. I bet if you got close enough to one of those scourging crystals, you could use the controller to bring its shield down. Then it would simply be a matter of destroying the thing before its shield goes back up.

Brave enough to hazard another trip down there, {name}? I can guarantee a nice reward for you if you can bring down those shields and destroy the crystals.

How can you refuse if it means less Scourge, especially ones made from murlocs?

 Quest Hand-in: <Anastasia turns and smiles at her succubus.>Very well, <name>, I concede that you have certainly earned a choice of one of these.
Title: Defending Your Title

Description: Everyone's impressed by your performance, sister.  But do not let your guard down -- every new challenger with delusions of grandeur is going to come out swinging for your title of Hyldskvinnar.

Show these upstarts what you're made of.

 Quest Hand-in: You continue to prove yourself worthy.  We are honored by your presence.
Title: Into the Reservoir

Description: With anima in short supply these days, I've been entrusted to manage the reserves 'till they be needed.

Go 'ead and deposit any anima you collect into the reservoir 'ere. 
Be assured, It'll be safe an' secure in me care.

 Quest Hand-in: There we go, the anima is safe and secure now.
Title: No Wisp Left Behind

Description: More of the Kaldorei souls still languish in the Maw.

I ask you once again, Maw Walker, to find them.

Help correct this wrong.

 Quest Hand-in: It brings me joy to see more souls freed from that dark place.Thank you Maw Walker, for continuing to help us.
Title: Strength of One

Description: When the ship crashed, our menagerie was scattered on the northeast beaches of this isle.  I have been handed a key that unlocks the cage holding one of the deadlier specimens, a death ravager.  The creature is little armored but resistant to most magic.  It must be killed by a simple blade.

Take this key and release the creature from both its prison and its pain.  We cannot afford to have it escape and cause even more damage to the ecology than we already have.

 Quest Hand-in: <Ruada nods solemnly.>Then it is done.You are ready for your next lesson, <name>, but I will not be the one to teach it to you.
Title: The Land, Corrupted

Description: The cliff giants of Feralas are extensions of the earth itself, {name}. When nature thrives, they are benevolent protectors and peaceful guardians.

But as the forest is tainted, so too are they.

Should they be corrupted by this malady, they will lash out in violence against trees, wildlife, and the very boulders they were shaped from.

Be wary in your tasks. Should you find any corrupted giants, destroy them, for the sake of those still spared.

 Quest Hand-in: The spirits of these guardians will return in time, <name>. You've freed them to move on in nature's cycle.Now it falls to us to make sure that cycle is free of corruption and needless suffering.
Title: Defending the Vault

Description: To reach the vault, we'll need to carve a path through the attacking Mawsworn.

The covenants are doing their best to drive off these monstrosities, but our allies can't hold out forever. The Mawsworn are intent on reaching the prize before you.

We could use your help fighting against the Jailer's forces, Maw Walker.

Purpose guide us all.

 Quest Hand-in: Good work fighting those Mawsworn.We'll take it from here, <name>.
Title: Building Your Own Coffin
