Description: I'm looking for precious artifacts. The kind of artifacts that can help solve some of the greatest mysteries of Draenor, and make the Steamwheedle Preservation Society a ton of moolah. And ladies love the moolah, know what I'm sayin?

So, get me the artifacts, I'll get the ladies, and you get... wait, what are you looking for again?

 Quest Hand-in: Nice! What did you get?A necklace, not bad.. another necklace, good. A giant rock in the shape of an ogre head?<Greblin seems puzzled, he glances up at you.>Seriously? This is a rock in the shape of an idiot. Whatever, the necklaces look good.Not a bad find overall.
Title: Schematic Reassimilation: Vespoid Flutterer

Description: <This schematic contains the pattern of a new protoform construct. Present it to an appropriate protoform forge and it may instantiate one of these creatures for you.>

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent. With this schematic and the right components, a new song can begin here to accompany you.
Title: The Road to Kun-Lai

Description: Ah! Greetings friend of Lorewalker Cho. I have a message for you.

<The strange little creature hands you a battered scroll case.>

The Lorewalker waits for you in Kun-Lai. Very dangerous to travel there, yes, very dangerous.

Look for guides along the road to help you find your way.


 Quest Hand-in: Oh, you are a friend of Cho's? Welcome! Welcome!I would serve you a banquet, but as you can see, we are in dire straights at the moment.Say, would you be willing to lend us a hand?
Title: The Thaldraszus Reverse Tour

Description: Once more you'll be heading back to where it all finished. Or started. I can't remember anymore.

Seek out my bronze colleagues to fly the reverse courses to complete your rewinding.

 Quest Hand-in: Who are you? I don't think we've met before.I'm joking. Well done on completing the newest tour.Feel free to re-fly any of the courses to beat your own best times. The sky's the limit!
Title: Second in Command

Description: Wait... I remember something else.

Sir Edward... he was shouting... looking for someone.

I... I can't remember who. There were so many screams...

 Quest Hand-in: If today was any other day I'd have you court-martialed for being out of uniform.
Title: Boulder Delivery

Description: Here you go, as promised! One Boulder-in-a-Box.

Lilith was asking for this, wasn't she? She's my only customer!

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, you actually brought the boulder! I'm a bit surprised.Stand back and witness the pinnacle of craftsmanship.
Title: A Not So Friendly Request

Description: Scouts have reported a non-mantid presence near Kor'vess. Their intrusion and their theft of amber would normally be dealt with swiftly, but our forces are needed elsewhere.

This task seems suited to you, Wakener. You will convince them to leave this land, or you will destroy them in the name of the Klaxxi'va.

 Quest Hand-in: So they want us to leave do they? What a selfish request! We're only taking amber from one tree.Well, I'm not going anywhere! I have brew to make.If you help us maybe we can all come to a mutually beneficial agreement. I give them some brew, they stop trying to kill us.
Title: Where is Wrathion?

Description: Hm, wonder where Wrathion is?

He said he'd be here waitin' for us with an ambassador for Alexstrasza the Life-Binder, Queen of the Dragons.

It does nae seem like a dragon to break a promise.

Well! At least this eager wee drakonid is here to welcome us. Can you talk to 'em and find out when the others are gonna arrive?

 Quest Hand-in: I do not know! As I said, this is my first assignment... Let me think on what to do.
Title: It's a Dirty Job

Description: We gotta fix up this muck pool before we go makin' that dredger butler of yours.

Looks like the anima shortage caused all sorts of problems for this pool.

Them muck pools gotta have plenty of filth and fiber in 'em to grow good dredgers.

But between them devourers and nasty elementals formin' from all that wild muck, I can't get close enough to feed it!

Help me out and throw some of that filthy rubble into the pool, yeah?

 Quest Hand-in: I can smell it from here.<Rendle inhales deeply and sighs.>Home sweet home.
Title: Local Reagents

Description: Korthia is an odd place. The wildlife here is different, likely due to years of exposure to the Vault and everything it contains.

Are you ready to try some experiments? We'll need a good stock of reagents first.

Near the Seeker's Quorum, you should be able to find shardhides, gromits, and razorwings. Watch out for their needles!

 Quest Hand-in: This needle is so long and perfect! Well done apprentice. I can't wait to get started on our new tests!
Title: Study Hall: Combat Research

Description: What's this? A new, confused student, desperately trying to win the favor of the headmistress, wandering the halls without anything to do?

Perfect! I need help with my research.

I'm writing a paper on combat. Grab me some books from the shelf over there.

 Quest Hand-in: My hand is beginning to tire from taking so many notes. I think it's time we took a break.
Title: The Shadow Vault

Description: It sounds like you did extremely well. And you secured three very important allies for the Knights of the Ebon Blade in the process.

<Thassarian gazes out over the horizon.>

You should head back. By now, Baron Sliver and the other death knights will be fighting tooth and nail to hold The Shadow Vault against the might of the Scourge.

I'm sure they'll need your help.

 Quest Hand-in: Good of you to return. As you can see, we have our hands full here.
Title: A Brewing Situation

Description: Greetings, Grandmaster. I'm an expert at producing tricky brews, and Almai and I have been working with Stormstout Brewery to craft Storm Brew for the order. 

In fact, we have already begun production!

That calls for a party, don't you think? We brought enough of my prized Celebration Brew for everyone!

 Quest Hand-in: Whew. Celebration brew is..*hic* shtronger than I remembered it to be. *urp*
Title: Whispers on the Winds

Description: Hello, {name}. It's been a while, and I wish we had more time to catch up.

But you see, I've just had a rather enlightening... no, make that foreboding... yes, a foreboding conversation with an old friend.

Sometimes a revelation can be both, after all.

I really must tell you of what I've learned.

 Quest Hand-in: Unsettling news indeed, but you had to know of the peril we face.
Title: And You Thought Murlocs Smelled Bad!

Description: Originally I came down here to investigate some rumors about artifacts to be dug up. I knew that there were murlocs along the coast here, but I never in a million years thought I'd see this.

<The explorer pokes his head out to look around the tree.>

The Scourge are out there, and they're changing murlocs, and anything else they can get their hands on, into the walking dead!

{class}, I think it's our duty to do something about this. Think you could take out a good chunk of those Scourge?

 Quest Hand-in: <Jaren seems very excited about your success, but motions you to keep your conversation to a whisper.>Great job, <name>! That's a lot of Scourge goo all over your stuff though. You might want to think about a quick dip in the strait. It's cold, but it'll get you cleaned up right quick.
Title: Clearing the Delta

Description: The greatest of the Zeth'jir offensive sits within the delta as we speak, waiting for the summoning ritual to be finished. If we can clear out a number of them, we'll finally have the upper hand.

Get down there and cause as much chaos as you can!

 Quest Hand-in: Good work! That should deter the naga for now.
Title: Trolling Them

Description: My army is disciplined, and they will follow my order not to engage the kaldorei in combat unless I give the command.

However, it is with some level of shame that I must admit both armies have been attempting to harass the other with pranks, littering our respective camps with insults.

Please, {name}, we need someone both armies respect to collect these items before fighting breaks out.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you, <name>. Hopefully, since our forces saw you performing this task they will come to their senses and stop this harassment.
Title: Return to Roscha

Description: Baba is rested, and Roscha's supplies are recovered. We can return without upsetting her further. 

Take some boxes when you go. I will send warriors for the rest.

 Quest Hand-in: You have the supplies? Good.Leave them by the forge.<Roscha looks around and frowns.>
Title: Someone's Keeping Track of You

Description: Most of us made it here alive... but there are worgen on this side of the city as well.

We're going to continue heading south once everyone's accounted for.

That reminds me, someone was asking about you.  A man named Blake.  Said something about a plan to escape into the woods.

 Quest Hand-in: <name>!  I knew you had to be around here.
Title: Prison Break

Description: Greetings, {class}. I am Donathan, a loyal representative of Dalaran.

Forgive my abruptness, but we find ourselves in the midst of a crisis. Mages all across Azeroth are being abducted and I have been authorized to conscript anyone able to assist in the unraveling of this mystery.

The camp just south of ours is where our investigation begins. I call upon you to rescue one of the imprisoned mages held there. You must obtain a key from one of the mage hunters and use it to open an arcane prison.

 Quest Hand-in: You have done well, <name>.The Kirin Tor graciously accept the assistance you have rendered. Know that any service you provide us will not go unrewarded.Please, accept this humble offering as a token of Dalaran's appreciation.
Title: In Tyr's Footsteps: The Waking Shores

Description: You have proven yourself well so far, and though I have great faith you are worthy of the Engine I still must challenge you as is my designation. 

Go to the Waking Shores and find my statue and you shall receive further instructions.

 Quest Hand-in: <This once majestic and imposing statue now lies in ruin.>
Title: Trust Fall

Description: Let us ponder the meaning of the Archivist's last words: "Victory only belongs to those brave enough to fall."

Hmm. It could be reference to the Volume of Victory. That is the most well-known of all the writings said to be kept in this tower.

That book is priceless, {name}. I mean that almost literally. We must do whatever is necessary to find it!

But, uh... What do you suppose "brave enough to fall" refers to?

 Quest Hand-in: This is it... the Volume of Victory! The single most important compendium of Maldraxxus military history ever assembled.It must be mine! Uh, ours. I mean ours!
Title: Arcane Sanctum: Ko'ragh

Description: Ye know the name "Ko'ragh?" One of them Highmaul ogres. They dug up a relic some time ago that killed everyone it touched but for Ko'ragh... givin' him a near-complete immunity to all magic.

Ogres ain't meant to have that kind of power! Travel to Highmaul and defeat Ko'ragh, before they learn to use him against us.

 Quest Hand-in: Great work! Ko'ragh is defeated. You truly are as powerful as they say.
Title: Clearing Out the Cache

Description: <While inspecting the crate, a commotion can be heard within the cavern. A familiar voice, shouting orders.>

 Quest Hand-in: It seems Azshara's influence reaches even further than we thought. Ashvane may have escaped, but at least we have secured the weapons.
Title: The Wayward Baron

Description: It has come to my attention that you seek to uncover a plot by the baron Kel'Thuzad. 

That upstart has been a thorn in my side since he arrived at the House of Rituals. Not only did he pilfer my rightfully earned title, he has since shut me out of the house's dealings.

I have yet to find evidence that would mar Sin'dane's adoration for her new baron, and thus I offer an arrangement. I grant you access to the House of Rituals, and in return you help me bring down Kel'Thuzad.

Do we have an accord?

 Quest Hand-in: <Balmedar's voice resonates from the floating eye.>You didn't really think I would risk meeting you here in person, did you?Come, we have much work to do.
Title: Gormsmith Cavina

Description: <Hunt-Captain Korayn left you a terse letter of introduction to Gormsmith Cavina in Ardenweald.

What aid might he be able to offer the Ember Court?>

 Quest Hand-in: Do you need some armor repaired?
Title: Call the Flock

Description: Today, we have an opportunity to make another assault against one of Ragnaros' greater minions: Millagazor. However, we first need to get some assistance.

<Matoclaw holds up a large, silky feather.>

Use this artifact to invoke the power of Aviana. Once you have done so, travel northwest and gather some of her flock by calling out to them.

Once you have done so, we may proceed against Millagazor.

 Quest Hand-in: <Amidst the chirps, hoots, and frenzied caws of your fellow birds, you hear the voice of Matoclaw speaking to you from afar.>Well done, <race>. Now that the flock is assembled, we strike.
Title: Shades of Disruption

Description: Vol'jin's spirit is a slippery one. I have asked Master Gadrin and Spiritwalker Ebonhorn to aid us in calling him forth.

Dis ritual will not be easy, and I ask you to be on your guard should anything other than Vol'jin appear.

 Quest Hand-in: Ya know you be askin' a good question when someone be tryin' to have you killed for askin' it.
Title: Northern Stranglethorn: The Fallen Empire

Description: Commander Aggro'gosh is looking for devoted members of the Horde to assist him and his mission in Grom'gol.  If you're interested, just hop on up to the top of that zeppelin tower and board the Grom'gol zeppelin.  It's that easy!

Seriously, Stranglethorn is the place to be right now... there's plenty of action to be found, and not nearly as much cataclysmic damage as, say... Stonetalon Mountains.  I wish I could go with you.

 Quest Hand-in: Glad you could make it!  Let's get to work, shall we?
Title: Data Mining

Description: That disk you assembled... it's blank! Keeper Mimir, the tinker who built this library, must've hidden the information elsewhere. Look around the Inventor's Library; do you see any databanks there?

That might be the disk's purpose. Try using it near some of those databanks. Perhaps it's set to retrieve and store information from them. After you've tried your hand at that, contact me again and let me know what you've found. Meanwhile, I'll be trying to track down the other half of the archive key.

 Quest Hand-in: <Brann looks at the disk as you hold it up.>I can't tell if there's anything stored there or not, lad. You'll have to tell me what happened.<You describe the data retrieval process.>So it worked? At least we can count on Keeper Mimir to be systematic.
Title: Inspiring Ashran

Description: I hope you will find our facilities to be up to your high standards.

This inn is run by Jaesia Rosecheer, in my opinion this is the best place to hearth in Draenor.

We have new recruits coming through the portal daily. In fact our latest recruit, Knewbie McGreen just came through the portal today.

If you are looking to trade for weapons or armor, Vindicator Nuurem will be happy to help.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you again for taking the time to visit, commander. You have no idea how much it means to us.
Title: Hunting Brendol

Description: I'm too busy collectin' artifacts to busy myself with much else, but there is a bit of an issue here I wouldn't mind sortin' out.

There's a forsaken apothecary who's been pokin' around these parts for a while now. Normally, I'd ignore him, but three times now he's snuck into my camp and pilfered my supplies.... enough's enough!

Find the thief and bring me whatever's left o' my things!

 Quest Hand-in: Justice is done!Now let's have a peek at what's left of my goods....
Title: Undercover Agent: Stone Guard Mollivox

Description: I believe you've met one of my other agents: Stone Guard Mollivox. She's investigating our second suspect: Shadowmaster Skrizzik.

You'll find Mollivox near the arena's entrance.

 Quest Hand-in: <name>? Mollivox. Nice to meet you. Again.Skrizzik's over there. You go take point, I'll hang back and jump in if things get ugly.
Title: Felling an Ancient Tree

Description: WANTED!

Stronglimb Deeproot, ancient of war and chief defender of the Living Grove south of Sylvanaar.

Find him by heading west across the bridge that traverses the Bloodmaul Ravine.

Return his hewn trunk to Tor'chunk Twoclaws.

 Quest Hand-in: Stronglimb Deeproot's Trunk!  Did you chop him down by yourself?I bet you did.  You know, Rexxar and I are looking for a young, strong <class>, such as yourself, to help out around here, especially with the problems we continually have with the ogres.  Make sure that you follow-up with me on that possibility.Well that trunk's definitely proof, which means you're here to collect the bounty and not to listen to me talk.  Go ahead, take your pick.
Title: Cornered and Crushed!

Description: <The Banshee Queen speaks through your mind.>

We must act quickly, {name}. They mustn't be given the chance to flee. I am dispatching a squadron of my most powerful troopers to the Deep Elem Mine. I'm also sending the Horseman with them to ensure that nothing goes wrong. Meet him at the Deep Elem Mine, east of Olsen's Farthing, and CRUSH those rats.

 Quest Hand-in: I 'spose we're to corner them first then crush, eh?
Title: Road Rations

Description: We do not have time to wait around for the Admiral to recover.

Sully and I are planning to search for Anduin to the north, but we'll need supplies for our journey.

The lake here is teeming with wildlife, which we have received permission to hunt.

Go and gather some supplies while Sully and I finalize our preparations.

 Quest Hand-in: This should be plenty, <name>. Thanks.
Title: Trouble at the Overwatch

Description: Yesterday, I sent two of my best scouts to spy on the ogres at Mar'gok's Overwatch.

I haven't heard back from them.

{name}, would you do me the honor of checking on them? I'm sure it's nothing; the Overwatch is a large fortification.

I'd feel better knowing they're okay.

 Quest Hand-in: I'm honored you're here to help, wolf-brother. Things here are worse than we thought.
Title: Meet with Feenix Arcshine

Description: I just received a scroll for you from Orgrimmar, {name}. It's from Feenix Arcshine, one of the mage trainers there. He wants you to meet with him at The Barracks in the Valley of Honor.

 Quest Hand-in: The Horde needs your help in the battle against our enemies.
Title: Unfortunate Measures

Description: Your effort has made something clear that, honestly, I wish were not true.  The unchecked power of the Burning Crystals has maligned a much larger swath of the isle's natural balance than I thought.  We must now take on more unfortunate measures to reclaim control.

The nearby lynxes have succumbed to the influence of the crystals, and they must be put down.  Bring their collars, {name}, as I may yet be able to fashion a magical restraint to turn some back from being uncontrolled.

 Quest Hand-in: The tower and surrounding areas should now be relatively secure, though only for the time being.  You have done well in providing us with a buffer of security, but we will need to reassert control over the entire isle if we are to survive here in the long run.  This will involve tackling much greater threats than errant mana wyrms and lynxes.Take this, <name> - you will no doubt make good use of it for the tasks to come.
Title: Closing a Dark Chapter

Description: This terrible place was Alexstrasza's nightmare. During what mortals call the second war, she was chained in the depths below, her tormented offspring forced to serve the demon-corrupted Horde.

Alexstrasza may be free, but the beast known as Erudax still corrupts her offspring below.

<Baleflame's body tenses in anger.>

Destroy him, {class}. Crush him that we may end these horrors once and for all!

 Quest Hand-in: So it is done.Would that I could bring this entire mountain down upon itself, I would.
Title: Extrinsic Motivation

Description: The Shattered Hand are nae strangers tae pain. They each cut off their own hand as a sign o' their allegiance to Kargath.

If you're going tae get the information we need, it might take more than my poison.

Slaughter them all. We'll see how far they're willing tae go fer their beloved warlord.

 Quest Hand-in: They got what's comin' to 'em.
Title: Stones of Binding

Description: I have it on good authority that SI:7 is concerned about collaboration between Twilight's Hammer and the Dark Iron dwarves in Blackrock Depths. We can act on this information, prove our value to the Alliance, and gain something for ourselves at the same time.

The report mentions that the Twilight's Hammer followers have placed a number of elemental binding stones throughout Shadowforge City, the Domicile, the Shrine of Thaurissan, the West Garrison and the East Garrison. Find and capture those stones!

 Quest Hand-in: The binding stones you brought back are exceedingly powerful. It will likely take me years to learn all their secrets, but I'm certain they'll prove most useful. Thank you, <name>.
Title: Back to Westwind Rest

Description: Well, far as I figure, we've got quite a lot of rebuildin' to do.

I'm not one for joining any big causes, but my farmhands aren't gonna have much to do 'round here, to be honest. And, since you helped them out, they want to join your "Alliance." So, who am I to stop 'em?

Bring 'em with you, back to Farmhand Bo. I'll miss 'em, but they're better off with you.

 Quest Hand-in: You did good, bringing these guys back. We'll have 'em farming you up some food in no time!
Title: A Hero's Quest is Never Complete

Description: What ho, squire {name}! Since last we spoke, I have heroically approached the gates of Blackrock Spire and nobly intended to end the toothy reign of its dragons.

Yet, as I neared the place, my mind drifted to thoughts of my Doloria's fair face, and to my own painfully unsatisfied desires.

My sword arm fell limp at my side.

I charge THEE then, squire, to go in my stead and search Upper Blackrock Spire. I must know if the dragons still squirm within its corridors.

 Quest Hand-in: By the light, they breed like great fiery rabbits! I shall head there presently, to slay no less than THIRTY of the great beasts.For Doloria!
Title: Manifesting Power

Description: As you know, shedding our memories of life can result in dangerous creatures known as manifestations. They have increased in number and strength as of late, but I believe we can find use for them yet.

Manifestations carry great power within them--power we may purify and use in our own creations at the forge here. In making something positive out of such negativity, we do a noble act of service.

Simply eliminate any you come across, and collect their essence. That is all.

 Quest Hand-in: These will do quite nicely! Go in service, Maw Walker.
Title: The Source of the Madness

Description: After reducing the basilisk blood out of the elixir, I've uncovered an unusual precipitate.  It appears to be a blue crystal of some sort...

<Brother Nimetz consults his notes.>

It's not a singing blue crystal... not a pulsing blue shard...

<He flips forward a few pages.>

... not a piece of the Mind's Eye.  Nope, this isn't something we've seen before in Stranglethorn.  If anyone has any more of this substance, I want it.  Check the high-ranking Kurzen troops, in the back of their cave.

 Quest Hand-in: <Brother Nimetz opens up a pouch and lets you place the crystal inside.>I knew they'd have some more of this substance.  I'm going to send this to my contacts at Fort Livingston, to the south.  Hopefully they'll have some more luck with it.Thank you for everything, <name>.
Title: This Should Be Simple... Right?

Description: I have plenty of silk patterns that we can put this cloth to work on.

Help me to prepare the materials, {name}. We're going to put this cloth to good use and make you a new robe.

 Quest Hand-in: That's a shame. Without the ability to do any stitching, we can hardly do anything with this fabric.<Tanithria pouts.>Still, there ARE patterns we know that don't require stitching. Shoulderpads are easy, and belts should be a cinch.
Title: Seedbearers of Bad News

Description: When these seedbearers are slain their seeds survive. From them spring new seedbearers, not over years, but hours.

Leaving their remains here would soon cause your camp to be overrun.

Burn them, outsider, if you wish your camp to endure.

 Quest Hand-in: Watch them burn!
Title: Unbridled Power

Description: Although our forces have dutifully held this citadel since your departure, we have been unable to access most of its resources - the Fel Hammer can only be fully activated by those bearing the mark of a Legion lord.

Thankfully, your blades carry that very mark. Use them to activate the Fel Hammer - show your forces your limitless power!

 Quest Hand-in: The Fel Hammer is fully operational.
Title: We Can't Have Dull Weapons

Description: For a squid head, you sure are making my life easier. 

I guess you get to live long enough to complete another task. 

Our new weapons are forged from some foreign material that I don't quite trust. 

You won't catch me sharpening any blades, but the work still needs to get done. 

Get to it!

 Quest Hand-in: <The weapons on the rack radiate with a familiar energy.>
Title: Might As Well Wipe Out the Scourge

Description: If the cultists up in those caves survived the crash, then that fallen necropolis to the west can only be assumed to still be filled with Scourge. There're probably lots of them out in front of it in the pools, too!

While you're at Talramas, {class}, do you think you could dispatch all of the Lich King's flunkies that you find there?

 Quest Hand-in: Thanks, <name>.The Lich King and his Scourge are really scary, but we can't stop until they are all lying still in new graves!
Title: Slitherscale Suppression

Description: The Slitherscale take orders from their leader, the Slitherscale Lizard-Lord. He can be found celebrating his victories on the southeastern corner of Windward Isle.

If we can destroy this leader, we can deal their tribe a great blow.

Without their lord, the Slitherscale will think twice before attacking the gentle cloud serpents of the east.

 Quest Hand-in: Wonderful! I knew you could triumph against the Slitherscale lord.
Title: Survey the Destruction

Description: I had heard of enormous seismic anomalies here in Kalimdor, but I had no inkling that the geological chaos would be so profound!

I need an up-to-date survey of the destruction while I stay here to study the seismographic readings. Could you gather some data via my automated survey craft? I'll take care of all the flying.

When the survey is complete, present the data to my colleague Horton Gimbleheart in Northwatch.

 Quest Hand-in: What, what!? Can't you see we're under attack here!<Gimbleheart snatches the readouts from the survey craft, then stuffs them haphazardly into a duffel bag.>Yes sure of course I'll give Nibb's findings careful study. Later. From the safety of the Eastern Kingdoms, if I have any say about it!
Title: Ending the Bloodcurse

Description: To the south you will find Bloodcurse Isle. Atop the island you will find a shrine dedicated to the beloved queen of the naga, Azshara. Destroy the statue - burn it in effigy! This will surely draw the ire of Atoph, the Bloodcursed leader.

Slay Atoph and return to me!

 Quest Hand-in: You did it! Hundreds of souls are grateful for all that you have done.Allow me to make an offering...
Title: Hope For a Cure

Description: Hopefully you found enough fel poison samples with which to brew a cure.

Let's meet back to the Temple of Five Dawns!

 Quest Hand-in: Hmm let me take a look... Yes, I think I can counter these!
Title: Let's Get It Started

Description: I theorize this to be a communication relay. It is non-operational, but gnomish ingenuity and your strong back shall soon solve that problem!

I need you to help get this device functional.

 Quest Hand-in: This is a monumental success. The device appears to be fully operational!
Title: The Rise of the Darkspear

Description: Tha Darkspear tribe have long been victims. Outcasts. We found ourselves fleein' our homes time 'n time again... but dis time, it's not fleein' dat drives us here.

Vol'jin has offered us leadership through wisdom, and it has kept us alive dis long. Now dat same wisdom offers portents of a chaotic future for tha Horde unda Garrosh Hellscream.

No, dis time we not fleein'. Dis time, we are fightin' for a home dat will last.

It's time to begin ya trainin', {name}. Speak with Zabrax to the east.

 Quest Hand-in: Anotha newblood, eh?Ya actually look ta be in shape though. Steady hands. Fierce eyes. I may be able ta turn ya into a real <class>.Lets not waste anymore time 'den.
Title: Arborcide

Description: How's that shredder holding up? I think I can bring your emergency power supplies online - that'll recharge you when you're wounded.

Listen, these night elves are being strengthened by an ancient of war who's taken root just west of the gates. He's a big, giant tree. You know what to do! Take him out!

You were made for this!!

 Quest Hand-in: You did it, <name>! The invaders have pulled back. And they told me I was crazy for installing a grenade launcher on a woodchipper...Great work with the Shredder. With an impressive showing like that right here on the Warchief's doorstep, the Horde can't doubt what goblin technology can do for them. I owe you a big thanks!
Title: Lessons in Brigandry

Description: The Wastewanders have spent many generations as brigands, whether on land or sea. Though we have decided to hang up that life for a chance at a more peaceful existence, we have not forgotten the lessons we've learned in those days.

One such lesson I feel is particularly relevant now -- when faced with a superior opponent, it often helps to use their weapons against them.

Find their hidden caches and take whatever you can carry. You may just find something that can turn the tide of this battle.

 Quest Hand-in: I hope you found what you were looking for.We can use all the help we can get in this fight.
Title: Darkheart Thicket: Nal'ryssa's Sisters

Description: I was not the only miner in my family. I was the youngest of four sisters.

I say "was" because the other three are gone.

Two of them went too far. They overloaded their bodies with felslate and succumbed to the will of Sargeras. They are more demon than elf, now.

The third, I have not heard from in quite some time. The last I heard, she was investigating the Darkheart Thicket.

I fear she may have fallen, too - one way or the other.

 Quest Hand-in: Yes, this is my sister's ring.The fact that you found it on a demon's corpse suggests that she has either fallen in battle or, like my other sisters, thrown in her hat with the demons themselves.Thank you for bringing this to me. We don't have many spare materials here on the front lines... but I can do without these.
Title: A Quack in Time

Description: <This duckling is despondent, quietly quacking to itself as its eyes dart around in fear.>

<Maybe the ecologists would know how to help it?>

 Quest Hand-in: Thanks for bringing Daisy to us. If there's two so far, there must be more, so keep an eye out next time you venture out there.
Title: The League Will Lose

Description: Even with the fall of Stromgarde, the League of Arathor continues to operate in the Highlands.

The northern farmland will belong to the Horde. Go, and defeat the humans.

 Quest Hand-in: You've driven them off? Well done.
Title: Challenge of the Masters

Description: The time has come to challenge the Burning Blade masters.

Go to the back of the cavern. There you will find the challenge ring and the masters watching over it from above.

Pull the blade from the middle of the ring to issue your challenge. My clan values honor above all else and will respect your claim to trial by combat.

As reward, you will be allowed to walk away with your life. Or, you will be dead.

 Quest Hand-in: A great victory over the Burning Blade!This new Warlord Azuka Bladefury sounds formidable. We'll have to keep an eye on her and her blademasters.
Title: Oshu'gun Crystal Powder

Description: This base was the primary draenei research facility for the study of naaru crystals.

What we have discovered is a veritable goldmine of research notes about the crystals from the "diamond" mountain, Oshu'gun. It would seem that everything in this region carries with it some residual powder of the Oshu'gun crystals. If you find any powder while adventuring in this region, return it to me and I shall reward you with a token of my appreciation which you may use to make purchases from the quartermaster.

 Quest Hand-in: This base was the primary draenei research facility for the study of naaru crystals.What we have discovered is a veritable goldmine of research notes about the crystals from the "diamond" mountain, Oshu'gun. It would seem that everything in this region carries with it some residual powder of the Oshu'gun crystals. If you find any powder while adventuring in this region, return it to me and I shall reward you with a token of my appreciation which you may use to make purchases from the quartermaster.
Title: What? What? In My Gut...?

Description: Wha...what IS this!?

There's great pain growing... from deep in my bowels.

I think... ugh... they must have poisoned me!

They fed us strangely glowing seaweed that they grow around their stronghold...

I think these cramps will worsen if I don't get more soon...

Please, {race}. Try to find me some!

 Quest Hand-in: Yes, yes. This is the stuff.Maybe I can gradually eat less of it and avoid that side-effect.Thank you, <name>.
Title: An Echo in the Darkness

Description: {name}, I... I am beset by dark visions. A power emanating from within Torghast.

A familiar sensation. One I have not felt since...

Come to Oribos. Do not delay.

 Quest Hand-in: <Bolvar grimaces in pain.>
Title: You Have to Burn the Ropes

Description: I, umm... well...

Oh, never mind. It was a stupid idea.

It's just that, I was thinking that maybe we can stop the Kunzen hozen from attacking us without having to, you know... KILL anything. I noticed a few ropes on the side of the mountain. I think they're using them to climb down to our farms and...

No, forget it. It was a silly idea anyways.

 Quest Hand-in: <Ella's face lights up.>You did it? For me? Oh, thank you, thank you, thank you, thank you!
Title: A Rogue's End

Description: A rogue from the lost expedition, Coulston Nereus, tried scouting the island for any threats after they made landfall.

The last time Henry saw him, he was headed for a cave not far from here.

Can you make contact with Coulston? He may be able to help with our rescue mission.

Oh, and be careful when heading north. Alaria spotted a vicious bear roaming the area.

 Quest Hand-in: Here's the secret to making these poisons. It took me ages to learn it.Now that I've taught it to you, it should be easy enough for you to make more whenever you need it.
Title: My Favorite Subject

Description: I don't know if you've noticed {name}, but this whole lab complex has gone south of cheese! I don't mind writing off all those hippogryphs, but my most prized experiment has gone missing: Subject Nine!

Subject Nine is a raptor we imported from the Barrens. I wonder - is she still alive? Try checking above the main complex west of here, near the giant top secret rocket. You can't miss it.

 Quest Hand-in: Have you come to assist me with my work? My claws are quite dexterous, but I must reluctantly confess that my arms are debilitatingly short.
Title: Julia Bates

Description: We welcome all kinds here within the Cradle, as long as they recognize and subscribe to the ideologies of the Red Crane. One of our new, more exotic trainees comes from the human kingdoms to the northeast. She goes by the rather foreign-sounding name of Julia Bates.

She is your next challenger. You will find her on the island's western shore.

 Quest Hand-in: Another fight handily won. I anxiously await your next match, <name>.
Title: A Bunch of Artifact Fragments

Description: The more, the better!

 Quest Hand-in: That must of taken great effort to get back to us. You deserve this reward, friend.
Title: Warfront: The Battle for Stromgarde

Description: If the Horde thinks it can assault Stromgarde, it is sorely mistaken! We will not let Arathi fall!

Prepare yourself for battle.

 Quest Hand-in: Well fought, <name>, though I'm afraid it may be premature to let our guard down just yet. I am sure our enemy will not sit idly while we rebuild Stromgarde.
Title: Hey There Dalliah

Description: Two powerful agents of the Burning Legion, Wrath-Scryer Soccothrates and Dalliah the Doomsayer, have begun rallying the demons on board together into a small army.

You cannot let their forces grow any larger, or the Arcatraz may soon become yet another Legion stronghold.

 Quest Hand-in: The Legion seeks only to consume. They hold no regard for the balance.
Title: Asset Extraction

Description: Hey, it's my good pal {name}! Listen, I'm in a bit of a bind here. I've been trying to negotiate a deal with the broker Au'larrynar and he needs a little something, a job done before he'll accept.

The deal is he had an associate who went missing with a rare item. He's asked that I... we... locate and return the missing property.

The associate was last seen in Ardenweald. I know, strange place, way too bright for me. But, I... we... really need this deal to go through! 

So, you ready to go?

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, now this is exquisite. Your reconstructed companion said you would be able to come through and you've done so magnificently!Let him know I'll count this toward the repayment of his debts.
Title: Shades of Blue

Description: You there, {name}!
It's good to see a friendly face in these parts. Telash and I were just discussing reports we've heard of... newcomers, in the area.

<Emberthal lowers her voice.>

Blue dragons. 

Given our... history, with the blues, Telash and I thought it necessary to assess the situation ourselves. 

Please, join us.

 Quest Hand-in: No sign of blue dragons yet, but plenty of their underlings.
Title: Renewable Resource

Description: We're going to need some more animate basalt. There's only one reliable source for that in the area, a mountain giant named Balboa. We can't be killing the mountain giant if we want to keep stocked in the stuff long term, so we've just been chipping off pieces at a time.

You'll be able to see his path northeast and east of here. Find him, place the charge ahead on the path, and then hide until it goes off. Once he's cleared the area, you should be able to retrieve the basalt and bring it back to me.

 Quest Hand-in: Good work. This should keep us for another few hours before we have to go back for more.He doesn't seem to be the brightest of giants. I expect we'll be able to keep doing this for a while before he catches on.
Title: The Angry Gorloc

Description: I not think you be back in time to go out again, but I wrong. I sending Moodle to nearby Mosswalker friends to bop silly Mosswalkers for not coming see shrine. Their village is east, up ridge, northeast of broken pillar.

You go with Moodle! He extra smart Rainspeaker... you listen to him good-like.

 Quest Hand-in: Before you say anything, do not assume me as foolish as most of the Oracles you've met. I've been into the world a bit, I've learned your language, and I'm not easily duped.I knew the Mosswalkers were dead before we ever came, though I didn't know that the undead were behind it.They are not supposed to be able to enter this land... the destruction of the Lifeblood Pillar must have allowed them in somehow. We must see to it that they leave.
Title: Moozy's Reunion

Description: You will never know how thankful we are to you, {race}. Because of you, Moozy and my husband are safe. I won't let either of them out of my sight!

I am sorry to ask one last favor of you, but do you think you could find my mother and bring her here so she can see that her grandchild is safe?

Her name is Ethel, and her home is on the northern bluff of Thunder Totem.

 Quest Hand-in: Your kindness will not be forgotten. You are a friend to my family, <name>.
Title: Favor: Soul Hunter Blade

Description: This item will be of great interest to the brokers. 

Per your previous deal with The Night Market, you should bring it to Ta'xera.

You will be fairly compensated.

 Quest Hand-in: What have you brought me today?Oh, I see. The blade from a soul hunter's rapier. This holds great value to those looking to learn more about their dueling techniques. Thank you, <name>. My contacts will be most pleased.
Title: Rough Roads

Description: The Argent Crusade built these towers to be points of light in the darkness of the Plaguelands.  I walk the paths between these towers, protecting and maintaining them.

The roads have been dangerous lately.  Plagued wildlife runs rampant, and bats swoop down upon unsuspecting travelers.  It would make the next leg of my journey much easier if you could clear some of this wildlife out of the way for me.

 Quest Hand-in: Of course a young <race> like you would have no trouble taking care of a few wild animals.  With the roads clear, my journey to the next tower will be much easier.
Title: The Embiggining

Description: I'll give you the quick rundown before we get started.

The Embiggifier is remotely controlled. 

See this big red button?

<Megs gestures to the device in her hand.> 

This jolts the wearer with a surge of power, making them bigger.

For safety reasons, you should remain here at camp. 

I think that's it! Are you ready to science?

 Quest Hand-in: Grong exceeded all our expectations. I'd say this is a resounding success.
Title: Arming the Rebels

Description: The Nightfallen rebellion is growing in number, but they have not fought a real war in ages.

Victoire and Silgryn are doing their best to train the new arrivals and could use an experienced hand.

Go to them and show them some of the skills in battle you have picked up in your travels. We need those Nightfallen ready for battle when the time comes.

 Quest Hand-in: Every member of the Duskwatch has had centuries to perfect their fighting techniques. We do not have that much time to get these rebels in to fighting shape.
Title: Into the Hollow

Description: I've learned that the Shadow Council is using the nearby deathweb spiders' venom to spread fel corruption and augment their forces after their defeat at the Burning Front.

One of my soulbinders saw a dreadlord headed into the eastern mines with Sha'tari, one of the remaining pieces of the Heart of Auchindoun.

I need you to wrest Sha'tari from the dreadlord's quivering corpse and bring it to me, champion.

 Quest Hand-in: Just as I suspected. Thank you, <name>. With Sha'tari back in our possession there is only one piece of the Heart left to retrieve.
Title: Howling in the Big Tree Hills

Description: The gnolls that attacked our caravan were led by three lieutenants.

Durgun was flanked by a dozen hyenas.

Kerwal cackled maniacally each time we tried to pursue him and fell for one of his steel-jawed traps.

Bakra taunted us, mercilessly.

To have a hope in recovering what was stolen, they must be slain.

 Quest Hand-in: Good, you did what I could not. But there is another gnoll leading the Shadepaw... more terrifying than the three you encountered.
Title: Lao-Chin's Gambit

Description: Alright. Thanks to you, we have the wall under control. Good job. 

I'll stay up here for a little while and make sure no more yaungol get up onto the wall.

You, though, should go back down and see what Lao-Chin has cooked up. I hate to say it, but maybe he had a good idea after all...

 Quest Hand-in: Good to see you made it back in one piece. Thanks to your help with the barrels, I've managed to brew up a good surprise for our yaungol friends at the front.
Title: Demanding Answers

Description: So just how did all those Dark Iron warriors end up here, on the doorstep of Ironforge, on the verge of invading our city?

Does not 'Empress' Moira, a member of our esteemed Council of Three Hammers, rule the Dark Iron? This cannot have happened without her knowledge and consent. This was no ragtag band of rebel dwarves, but a well-organized and fully equipped invasion force.

I have prepared a report on the battle for the airfield. Take it to Ironforge, to the High Seat and confront her!

 Quest Hand-in: And just what is this?<Moira takes the report and the color drains from her face as she reads.>This is impossible!
Title: Into the Plains

Description: The green dragonflight has returned to their gardens in the nearby plains. Queen Alexstrasza wishes for you to make contact with Merithra of the Dream.

The centaur of those plains are fierce hunters. To reach the Emerald Gardens, you will need to establish diplomacy with them first.

Be respectful, but show no weakness.

 Quest Hand-in: You serve as an envoy of the dragons, then. Times are changing.
Title: Contribute Supplies: Draconium Nugget

Description: I'm always glad to collect rare materials for better fishing gear.

If your nets are good enough already, bring me any spare draconium nuggets you find.

 Quest Hand-in: That is a heavy one! Thank you, my friend.
Title: Adversarial Blood

Description: The descendants held prisoner by the Skettis talonpriests are listed in this book: Gezzarak the Huntress, Karrog the crystal giant, the heretic known as Darkscreecher Akkarai and Vakkiz the Windrager.  They will all need to be slain before Terokk returns to this world.

You will need the scrolls carried by the time-lost arakkoa to call them forth at the summoning circles in Skettis.  These are powerful beings you will be facing; you would do well to bring friends.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent!  Take this.  I've prepared this bundle with items symbolizing the foes you've defeated.  They will allow you to summon Terokk.Beware, <name>.  He is the most powerful arakkoa to ever exist.  Do not underestimate him!
Title: Terrorizing their Eggs

Description: Sur'jan, I should be doing dis! What do you mean, I need to recover? Bah, fine.

I need more power, and de skyterrors have eggs nearby. I need you to bash some of their eggs to fuel my energy.

Those eggs got lots of life force in dem. You destroy dem, and I will feel de energy coming back to me.

Come on, Sur'jan, dis will be easy! I can do dis! Hmph... well, you make a good point. You always were de smarter one out of us.

 Quest Hand-in: I feel better already! Maybe I should destroy more of those eggs in de future.
Title: The Mantid

Description: The mantid! They came out of nowhere and smashed our convoy to ruin, scattering our people this way and that.

Now they are preparing to hit Stoneplow.

Please, {class}, destroy some of these beasts before they get sufficient numbers to flank our home.

If my cousin, Ambassador Len, is still alive and at our convoy he should be able to reward you for your help.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you for your help, <class>! I've never seen anybody stand up to the mantid like that before.Well, other than the Shado-Pan, of course...
Title: Gatekeeper's Challenge: Mastery

Description: Archimonde was an individual consumed by the pursuit of power. Only those who could match his lust would fare well under his tutelage.

You will fight what remains of Archimonde's greatest pupils. These three once held such power in their own disciplines that the Conservatory remembers them now.

Their echoes will try to kill you.

Best all three with all your limbs intact and I will recognize your strength.

 Quest Hand-in: I must admit, I am impressed.
Title: Judgment at the Eye of Eternity

Description: Now that you have access to the focusing iris it's time to put that key to use.

As much as I would like to see Malygos brought back into the fold, that's just not going to happen at this point. With everything that's at stake, it is the judgment of the other Dragon Aspects that the Spell-Weaver needs to be put down.

<Krasus says this last with a great deal of trepidation.>

{name}, travel to the Eye of Eternity, confront Malygos and return with the Heart of Magic.

 Quest Hand-in: This is a very sad day, not only for dragonkind, but for all of the living creatures of Azeroth. We have lost one of our most thoughtful, intelligent and ancient friends. Magic is now without its guardian.Let us hope that this was a wise decision in the coming years, <name>. A storm is still brewing on the horizon and now we are without one of our most powerful defenders.
Title: A Change of Heart

Description: You seek to change the path you walk, {name}?

 Quest Hand-in: May you find what you're looking for, <brother/sister>.
Title: Iyu

Description: There is a genesaur here!

It wants its artifact back.

Kaz and Draka are fighting it now on the surface but they need you. Draka said I could fire the big gun. So I will stay here and do that.

 Quest Hand-in: It was an honor to fight by your side today, commander.
Title: Parts-is-Parts

Description: I've always wanted to try making an abomination. It looks simple enough, but you know how it is when you learn things from a book. There's no substitute for doing!

First, I'm going to need parts. Lots of parts. And you're going to get them for me.

No need to be picky: human, orc... it doesn't matter. Parts is parts.

Just be sure the corpses you harvest come from the Battlescar, so I know they're fresh.

<Calder presses a rusted, gore-covered bonesaw into your hands and smiles disarmingly.> 

 Quest Hand-in: <Calder peers into the sack of extremities and licks his lips with a dry, black tongue.>Oh my. This is exciting. Aren't you excited, <name>?
Title: Opening the Way

Description: Hmm. This ritual is a bit... tricky. No matter, together we will be able to complete it.

I shall begin to channel. You will need to activate the runes in the proper order. I shall leave the scroll here so you may consult it.

 Quest Hand-in: From here we shall be able to reach Fate's End. Hopefully in time.
Title: Rumors of Exile

Description: Talanji sent you, didn't she? 

De princess needs to know dat it is no longer safe to ask such questions so openly. 

Warguard Rakera spoke out, and no one has heard from her since. 

Rumor has it she was exiled to Vol'dun.

 Quest Hand-in: We will not let Rakera and whatever she knows be lost to de sands.
Title: Prepping For Battle

Description: To earn my mark, {class}, you must first prove yourself in battle to me. There is a naga I wish to kill, but I am not strong enough to slay him.

Before we go into battle together, I need your help as an enchanter to become stronger. I'm sure by now you have a bevy of enchantments in your repertoire.

Make some for me so that I may become strong enough again to make a difference in this world.

 Quest Hand-in: <Alynblaze takes the vellums from you and applies them to his gear.>Yes! I feel like I can take on the entire Legion now!Well, that may be a bit of an exaggeration, but I certainly feel up for some battle.
Title: On Eagle's Wings

Description: Since ancient times, my order has stood vigil on these Broken Isles, watching for the Legion's return. Only a handful of us remain... but that changes today.

The artifact you hold is more than a weapon. It is a symbol that will unite hunters of all kingdoms and creeds.

I'm sure you have questions. Meet me at the Trueshot Lodge in Highmountain and see with your own eyes what awaits us. Snowfeather and I will make our own way there.

 Quest Hand-in: I've observed your skills for some time, <name>. Watched you from a distance.Wait, that sounds a little creepy. Sorry, my social skills are a tad rusty. Let me start again.Our order has been on the lookout for hunters who could lead the Unseen Path into a new era. No one is more qualified for that role than you.
Title: Blacktalon Intel

Description: While Selistra and I attracted their eyes above, shadows crept in through their defenses.

My agents, the Blacktalon, are keeping an eye and an ear throughout the keep. Meet them and let them know you're on our side. They'll give you some valuable information on our enemies.

 Quest Hand-in: That is troubling, to say the least. Yet another reason to fight them.
Title: Second Sight

Description: Though young King Anduin is a noble soul, he may lack the conviction of his father. The Alliance needs a leader who will do what needs to be done. The Legion will strike at the first hint of weakness.

Even now, I sense something amiss, {name}. I fear that not all is as it seems.

Quickly, use your Spectral Sight. We must know if there are foes among us!

 Quest Hand-in: Of course the Legion would try to infiltrate this funeral. Having all the leaders of the Alliance gathered in one place at one time... it is too tasty a target for the demons to resist!
Title: Shipment: Shifting Sun Curio

Description: A wealthy shipping concern has requested a collection of Shifting Sun Curios to sell at Undermine.   If you can bring me one, I can reward you with a Dalaran Jewelcrafter's Token.


 Quest Hand-in: Here is your Dalaran Jewelcrafter's Token as promised.  Come back tomorrow and I am sure I will have another item I need from you!
Title: To Ankhaten Harbor

Description: I fear that I don't yet have the strength to ride out into the sands and face those monsters again.

Ride to the south and find Tracker Samara in the excavation camp formerly known as Schnottz's Landing.

Tell her to halt any caravans that plan to pass this way, lest others are ambushed and met with the same grisly fate.

We must get the word out across Uldum before our forces are further divided!

 Quest Hand-in: Orsis is lost you say!? This is truly worse than I feared.
Title: The Vials of Eternity

Description: Seven vials were drawn from the Well of Eternity by Illidan.  He poured three into the lake on top of Mount Hyjal and a second Well of Eternity was created.  For years the rest were believed lost.

With the opening of the Dark Portal, we've come to know that he gave one each to his lieutenants Kael'thas and Vashj.  Retrieve what remains of them; we will need them as foci to open a gateway to any events tied to Mount Hyjal, recent or ancient.  The outcome of the Battle of Mount Hyjal must be preserved.

 Quest Hand-in: The power contained even in this small amount of water from the Well of Eternity is incredible.I can see clearly into every moment in time linked to Hyjal... the creation of the second Well of Eternity, Illidan's imprisonment, the enchantment of the World Tree and... yes!  The Battle of Mount Hyjal.We must make haste, the timeline is not safe.
Title: Assault on Lost Veil Anzu

Description: Some of our best scouts have gone missing in the vicinity of the lost ruins of Veil Anzu.

Bodrick Grey has requested any available resources be dispatched to identify the threat and see if any of our men yet remain alive within the ruins.

 Quest Hand-in: Word of the assault has already made it back, as have some spoils from the fight.Well done sir, if you don't mind me saying.
Title: Cracking the Curse

Description: <In her haste, it looks like Helena left her spellbook behind. The pages of this book detail the ritual that she used to entrap the villagers of Fallhaven. 

It seems the effigy holding the spell in the village is protected by smaller ones surrounding the town. If these are destroyed, you may be able to affect the one holding the spell on the townsfolk.>

 Quest Hand-in: <The magical energies surrounding the effigy have dissipated.>
Title: Orako's Report

Description: <You remind Orako that he was supposed to send a report back to Captain Verne.>

Right, a report.  All that I've seen here is fish.  Lots and lots of fish.

<Orako looks over at the sack of fish that you brought for him.>

Bring this back to the captain.  This is my report.

 Quest Hand-in: This is his report?!  That idiot...I suppose we can use the food.  Thanks, <name>.  You've done as well as can be expected.
Title: Caring for the Caretakers

Description: The Drust attacked so quickly, they captured some of the spirit tenders of this grove!

It's not an easy job to do, between the drought and monsters and everything. I should know.

Please, see if you can get them out of whatever terrible magic those invaders have cast on them.

 Quest Hand-in: Those Drust really are cruel to us fae! Those spirit tenders were just trying to do their job...Thank you for helping them.
Title: Call to Arms: Nazmir

Description: It's time to press the attack within Horde territory, {class}! Travel to Nazmir and slay as many Horde as you find.

 Quest Hand-in: Great work, <class>.
Title: Forces of Nature: Hippogryphs

Description: Hippogryphs are majestic creatures. Some say they were created by Cenarius himself as a gift for the night elves. They're wary of other races, but they're intelligent enough to recognize a friend of a friend.

I need more hippogryphs here so we can begin training some of our newer archers to ride them. Take the whistle again and rally the Frayfeather hippogyphs in the grove just south of the Tower of Estulan.

 Quest Hand-in: A properly trained squadron of hippogryph riders can take on nearly any opposing force. Feathermoon Stronghold will be much safer with these noble beasts on our side.
Title: Sacred Remains

Description: Dis area was once a lush jungle, home to many great and powerful thunder lizards.

De bones of those ancient and powerful creatures are still buried around de temple.

Great power lingers within those ancient remains... you will need such power to call upon Akunda.

Search de area and return to me with de ancient bones of de thunder lizards.

 Quest Hand-in: Dese bones still resonate with power.
Title: Yrel

Description: Forgive me if I'm a bit flustered - I've never killed anyone before.

My name is Yrel, and I am a student of Karabor.

You say you have an ARMY with you? The Light must truly be watching over me today.

I will follow you, then. Lead the way, {name}.

 Quest Hand-in: Up there - that is Keli'dan the Breaker. No doubt he's been alerted to our presence, and he's attempting to tell his warlord about our little jailbreak.We have to take him out, <name>.
Title: Teamwork Lesson: Serpentrix

Description: <While victorious, your bloodgazer hatchling distracted your other pets during crucial moments in combat. Showing it a good example of teamwork might help.>

 Quest Hand-in: <The hatchling glows slightly with magical energy, what did it get into? It will need some time to recover from this adventure.>
Title: A Vision in Time

Description: Look at how the Vision reacts! Astounding! Even now it shows shadows of timeways that flit around us constantly. Though not true sands of the Hourglass of Time, the finely-ground epoch stones certainly have a power all their own. Our first task is to use them to calibrate the Vision of Time.

Take the Vision of Time to a location where history is in the making: the Siege of Orgrimmar. Once there, turn the hourglass and see what happens.

 Quest Hand-in: How very intriguing. I will have to make some additional modifications, and perhaps locate a more proper catalyst. Thank you for performing this experiment, I trust that you did not experience any adverse effects? Should you feel up to the task, I may have use of your services again shortly.
Title: Following the Bloody Path

Description: The ones I kill... they speak of a cave. Sacred to the Bleeding Hollow. Kilrogg could be there - I am going.

 Quest Hand-in: Old earth... old blood. I smell Kilrogg. He has been here.
Title: Messenger to the Feralfen

Description: The time has come for us to embrace the Feralfen and teach them that the Light has not forsaken them. Take the potion I've prepared and carry it with you to the Boha'mu Ruins.

Once you arrive at the ruins, drink the potion to assume the form of one of their bird spirits. Speak with Elder Kuruti and let him know the draenei are ready to welcome his people as our long lost brothers.

 Quest Hand-in: They refused? They are welcome to choose their own path, of course, but their choice surprises me. I would think that all the draenei, including the Broken and Lost Ones, would still remember that we're all a part of the same people.I suppose he is right about the folly of deceiving them, but still, could he not see that our intentions were friendly?
Title: Stonebound Killers

Description: Mogu stone dog creatures chasing villagers and hurting them. Rook try to smash some, but they too fast.

You help smash some too?

 Quest Hand-in: Yes! You faster than rook. Do good!Thank you, friend.
Title: Kick Them While They're Down

Description: The news you've discovered is fortunate, {name}.  Not only do you get to waltz into Manaforge Duro unfettered, this also presents a great opportunity to deal a blow to Kael's army.

Use the mana creature assault to your advantage and pick off any Sunfury stragglers you run into.

I do not take particular glee in the senseless slaughter of my own kin the way that Thalodien does, but the tactical advantage here is too high to pass up.

 Quest Hand-in: You've done well, <name>.  Kael's army will not easily recover from the blow you've dealt today.
Title: Target: Hive'Zora Hive Sisters

Description: Reinforcements have been called on to join the assault on Hive'Zora.  You have been selected to target Hive'Zora hive sisters.  Report back to Commander Mar'alith after completing your task.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent work, <name>.  You're a worthy ally.
Title: Do Your Worst

Description: You're going to use this machine against the Scourge?  You're not going to win against them like that.

You can destroy hundreds... even thousands of them.  But you won't win.  Not out here.

When you're done playing with your machine, meet me to the north.  There is an old army encampment.  What I will show you will teach you a little bit about who you're up against.

 Quest Hand-in: You see?  You killed your fair share, but for every one you destroyed, another rose from the dirt to take its place.You don't know what you're up against, <name>.  Let me show you.
Title: Neltharion's Lair: Rod of Azure

Description: Before we can begin though, there is a small favor I need to ask of you. I'm rather ashamed about this matter, to be honest, but it must be done in order for us to work together.

When I was summoned to this land, I hadn't been given a chance to collect my things. Most importantly, I left behind my enchanting rod.

Instead of retrieving it I believe it would be much simpler to reconstruct it.

Here's what we'll need...

 Quest Hand-in: Oh yes, that seems to be everything.<Kharmeera takes the components from you and assembles the rod.>Now, let's see what I can share with you.
Title: Securing the Perimeter

Description: The saronite bombs are in place, {name}.  We're only going to get one shot at this, however.  Let's make it count.

We need temporary control of the area for a safe detonation.  Let's try to put a dent in the Scourge's numbers.

 Quest Hand-in: You're as good as Thassarian said.  Good job!
Title: Forbidden Quilboar Necromancy

Description: Quilboar are primitive and savage. They rarely practice any magic other than geomancy.

But these particular quilboar seem to be dabbling in necromancy. They must be stopped.

Slay the quilboar in the den. We cannot allow them to raise an army of the undead!

 Quest Hand-in: Good work. I hope those quilboar learn that necromancy is not a path to power.
Title: Going to the Gordunni

Description: We have a good supply of jovite now but there just isn't enough of the material in the mine to keep the artillery tower in stock for long. Down south of here there's a mountain that's just full of the stuff but there's one problem; Ogres!

The Gordunni live on top of that mountain and they have begun trading the jovite to the Iron Horde.

We need to go down there and secure the minerals for ourselves.

I'll pack some supplies and meet you near their fortress down south.

 Quest Hand-in: I crafted a few things before we left that we may need: some smoke grenades, a grappling hook, even was able to get Thaelin to throw together a rocket pack.I'm sure we'll find a use for everything.
Title: Investigate the Broken Shore

Description: All of us know the price we paid the last time we set foot upon the Broken Shore.

<Tinderfell turns her eyes to the ground.>

I recommend dispatching a scouting team to investigate the Legion's strength. We need to know what we're facing in that accursed place.

 Quest Hand-in: Grim tidings indeed.I suggest we continue sending our champions to scout out the dangers that await.
Title: Aerial Aspirations

Description: <Kua'fon studies you intensely. One single golden eye is trained on you, unwavering.>

Skree.

<He then turns his maw toward the horizon and spreads his wings wide.>

Skree!

<Is it finally time?>

 Quest Hand-in: <Kua'fon wheezes.>
Title: Masks of Deception

Description: My hunting party was ambushed not far from here. I narrowly escaped capture, but the others were taken deeper into Blackthorn Grove.

We must find and rescue them, but we are vastly outnumbered. We'll need to disguise ourselves while we search the grove.

See if you can find something we can use to do so. I need just a little longer to recover from my wounds.

 Quest Hand-in: Yes! We can use these masks to disguise ourselves.
Title: Back to the Elementium Depths

Description: The Earthcaller has a goblin initiate? Goldmine is his name? He has need of you.

I think that they're ready for you to do their dirty work with whatever's down in that mine.

 Quest Hand-in: <name>, glad you're back! Have I got something fun for us to do!
Title: Journey into Thunder Bluff

Description: The wells are cleansed, and Mulgore's waters run sweet and clear once more. You've saved us...but you've also uncovered grim happenings. The actions of the Grimtotem must be made known.

It is time for you to enter Thunder Bluff, our great city atop the mesa.  Go to our leader, Baine Bloodhoof, son of Cairne. He must hear of this.

 Quest Hand-in: Welcome to Thunder Bluff, <name>. You've done great things for our people.Tell me of your journey.
Title: Grimrail Depot

Description: We must move quickly, commander. As we speak the Grimrail is preparing to depart Grimrail Depot to deliver a massive battalion of troops to Shattrath. Rumor has it that they have outfitted the train with a weapon strong enough to shatter the shield protecting the inner city.

Skylord Tovra has taken to guarding the train on its journey to Talador. You must stop Tovra and the Grimrail before it reaches Shattrath!

 Quest Hand-in: Derailing da Grimrail be a mighty blow to da Iron Horde. It will take dem a great deal of time to amass more troops thanks to you.
Title: Missing Mag'hari Procession

Description: Greatmother says that we must press on and serve our people. She says that we must serve as an example for Garrosh - to show that life goes on.

I have so many matters to attend to here, especially with Greatmother having taken ill. Would you honor the Mag'har by helping one of their matrons?

Several days ago we sent a funeral procession to the Ancestral Grounds and they have yet to return. Will you go search for them? They took the western road out of Garadar. Follow it around and avoid Halaa.

 Quest Hand-in: Thirty orcs, <race>! Of those original thirty, only Ungriz and I remain. We found the young orc, Saurfang, nearly dead near Sunspring. Apparently he was here for another reason...
Title: Troll Patrol: Done to Death

Description: Trust me, {race}. I know....

The smell of burnt flesh has become sickening to even me, a Forsaken. Nevertheless, it is our solemn duty to ensure that our brethren never walk with the Scourge.

Pour this oil on the corpses of our fallen to ensure that we never face them on the battlefield as enemies.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you, <name>.It's not the most glorious job on the battlefield, but it must be done. I'll make note of your service in my report.Captain Grondel is likely waiting for you to the northeast, just outside the amphitheater.
Title: Noggle's Lost Satchel

Description: Where am I?  Where's my bag? *gasp* I must've lost it while fleeing from Deathclasp, the giant scorpid.  In my rush to escape I walked right into a nest of stonelash flayers.

The satchel I was carrying had all sorts of rare reagents in it.  Without them, me and Beetix won't be able to make the potions that Cenarion Hold needs.  I'm too weak to get up yet, but I can make it worth your while if you bring back my reagents.

I ran into Deathclasp in the southern mountain range, behind Bronzebeard's camp.

 Quest Hand-in: Yes!  You brought my satchel back.  And my rare reagents are all here!  I'll be in your debt for a long time.
Title: A New Master... But Who?

Description: You've arrived just in time.

Here's the skinny: the Dark Iron dwarves in the gorge have been acting strangely, and the Thorium Brotherhood intends to find out why.  Overseer Oilfist doesn't like surprises.

We suspect that they're following orders from some new leader.  I have reason to believe that Gravius Grimesilt, just south of here, knows who it is.

Even here in Searing Gorge, we've begun to hear tales of your exploits, {name}.  You should have no problem with Grimesilt.

 Quest Hand-in: Let's see... Overseer Maltorius... we're quite familiar with him and his work.What's this?  The "archduke"?  That sounds promising.
Title: Pruning the Garden

Description: In a very real sense, the Uncrowned are gardeners. We snip and trim here and there. One clipping of a single branch may seem nonsensical until you step back and look at the garden as a whole.

On the greater theater of the Broken Isles, we must act decisively. The forces that arrayed against Azeroth are moving quickly. We need to prune some very ugly flowers to make our garden beautiful again, wouldn't you agree, {name}?

 Quest Hand-in: There, now that is much better. I would say that our garden is much more beautiful.
Title: Good News... and Bad News

Description: <Blackhorn used the power of Thol'embaar's remains to slip his bonds. But at least the inferno seems to be subsiding.>

<Matoclaw will want to know what happened here. She's waiting for you back at the Grove of Aessina.>

 Quest Hand-in: What? Blackhorn helped you combat the inferno but escaped in the process? That crafty weasel!It's not your fault, <name>. He'd probably been plotting this the moment he saw the flames begin creeping up the mountain. We'll have to deal with him later.
Title: Talbuk Training: Thundercall

Description: The elements can sometimes pose a problem for some beasts. Ever seen a ram in a thunderstorm? They'll hide behind anything larger than themselves. I'm not sure if they think the world is ending or what, but it's not great if you're atop one at the time.

In Nagrand, off on a windswept cliff high above the shore, is a creature made of pure thunderstorms. Hop atop your talbuk and face off against Thundercall, and we'll see if it gets spooked.

 Quest Hand-in: Well, it's a bit wet, but seems to be in good spirits. I'll get 'er dried off and into bed.
Title: Oh Great... Plagued Magnataur!

Description: Tinky and I came out here stalking some old magnataur. Apparently those caves up there are where they go to die.

Of course, we had no idea that they were going to get plagued when they went in there. We can't have plagued things just roaming about; it's not healthy.

Say, why don't you put down a number of those things while I figure out what our next step should be?

 Quest Hand-in: Nice work, but I'd grab a shower the next chance you get.Now, let's really deal with the problem out here.
Title: To the Hilt!

Description: You immediately recognize this statue from a sketch in Furien's Journal.

Though the words associated with the entry elude you, the sketch seems self-explanatory. After battle, the enemies' weapons were to be cast upon the basin in exchange for a divine gift of some sort.

As you ponder this ritual, the glint of steel catches your eye from a nearby weapon rack....

 Quest Hand-in: With the ritual completed, you are awarded a divine gift.You can't help but wonder what Elune would think of someone such as you receiving one of her boons.
Title: Brotherly Love

Description: Tragic... My brother faces me on the field of battle: A commander for the Stormpike.

Of the four Stormpike Commanders, he is undoubtedly the most dangerous. Perhaps if he is slain, the Banshee Queen could turn him as she did me - show him the error of his ways...

Deep within enemy territory you will find my brother. Slay him and return to me. I trust that you are capable of completing this mission, soldier.

And soldier, do not go alone.

 Quest Hand-in: Your heroics will not go unnoticed, <name>.I must waste no time if he is to be saved. Sylvanas must be contacted!
Title: Neltharion's Legacy

Description: <As you stare into the cracked titan gem, a voice echoes through your mind.>

{name}! This is Nozdormu. 

The time to redeem the legacy of your creator, Neltharion, is at hand. 

You hold a vital piece to the artifact Neltharion once used to control you and all of the dracthyr.

Meet me in Valdrakken. There is much to discuss.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you for coming. I have been preparing for this moment for quite some time.
Title: Beastmaster's Quarry: The Crab

Description: The colossal crab is alive, but stunned.

You should bring it back to Jorn Skyseer before it wakes up.

 Quest Hand-in: It only took one to capture the beast, but it will take many more to truly defeat it.Speak to me again when you have gathered enough allies. We shall test the resilience of the crab against the might of the Horde.
Title: A Rare and Unusual Spirit

Description: I'm glad to see you again, friend!

We have found another inert spirit gripped by dark dreams. Nasty stuff! 

In this dream, a noble figure that once embodied loyalty has been consumed by their own doubts, leading them down a dark path.

If you were to defeat the fallen paragon, I bet we'll be able to revive this poor spirit.

Will you help us once more, {name}?

 Quest Hand-in: Another dream vision fulfilled. This is remarkable!
Title: The Speaker Listens

Description: Magni has sent for you in Krokul Hovel once more. He seems to have made a new breakthrough in trying to reach Argus.

I suggest you find him immediately. His last vision foretold Aggramar's coming, and there is still so much we do not know of Sargeras' plans.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank ye fer joinin' me, lad. There's somethin' ye have to see.
Title: Nowhere to Hide

Description: Welcome to Valdrakken, {race}. 
The climate in the city has been a bit warm of late, and I do not mean the weather.

The Primalists are skulking about, fomenting dissent among the citizens of our city.

Our foes are crafty. They have been disguising themselves as citizens of our city to hide from the Scalesworn. They know how to avoid my guards but will not suspect an outsider.

Take this Dragon's Eye gem, it should help you see through their disguises.

Go reveal and kill these infiltrators!

 Quest Hand-in: Good. Let this serve as a notice that the Primalists will never be welcome in Valdrakken!
Title: Rin'thissa

Description: My sister Nal'ryssa has her claws in you, doesn't she?

That weakling doesn't know the first thing about mining. She was always too afraid to take the leap. True knowledge comes only from the Great One, the God of Fel and Flame.

You want to truly learn how to mine? Come to Suramar's northwestern corner, and speak my name:

Rin'thissa.

 Quest Hand-in: My sister's soul rests now. I have you to thank for that.Rin'thissa was always a charmer. You did well to avoid her invitations, and even better to slay her and end her demonic possession. You've learned much since we first met, <name>.
Title: Students of Chi-Ji

Description: Our order prides itself on excellence in combat. We hone these combat skills by dueling one another, here on the Cradle of Chi-Ji.

Prove yourself in the eyes of the Red Crane. Venture south, into the center of the island, and duel with your fellow students.

 Quest Hand-in: With every battle - a win or a loss - you improve. You become faster, hardier, cleverer... better.
Title: Grab and Go

Description: Nothin' left to do but grab that Marshal and bring him back up to the surface, then.

Though I guess you might as well search the shipwreck for anything else of value. You spent all that time gettin' down there, and time is money.

 Quest Hand-in: <Nathanos looks at the two sailors' bodies, pauses for a moment, and then laughs.>Not only did you succeed, but you've also brought me the corpse of Lady Proudmoore's firstborn son?! You make my job easy, <name>.
Title: Re-rebuilding the A.F.M.O.D.

Description: Alright, so, we're goin' after the Alliance through this crazy fog. We gotta retake Zo'bal ruins up ahead.

We can do that real easy if we fix up our mech, A.F.M.O.D. - a flying mech of death! 

The Alliance wrecked it in their initial attack and took a bunch of its parts. Get those parts back and we'll have this thing fixed in no time!

 Quest Hand-in: Great! We'll get this thing fixed in no time.
Title: Hero's Call: Swamp of Sorrows!

Description: By order of his royal highness, King Anduin Wrynn, all able-bodied citizens of the Alliance are to report to Trade Baron Silversnap at Bogpaddle.

The Alliance forces urgently needs the munitions provided by the baron! You must do whatever is necessary to convince the baron to keep selling our forces supplies at reasonable prices.

To get to the swamp, follow the road from the southeastern Burning Steppes through the Redridge Mountains.

For the glory and honor of the Alliance!

 Quest Hand-in: Welcome to Bogpaddle, <class>. I fully expect you will enjoy all our facility has to offer.
Title: I Moustache You to Lend a Hand

Description: A message from the Primus of Maldraxxus, you say? We haven't heard from him in... Well, it's been a long time.

This isn't a prank, is it? The Queen doesn't have time for pranks. But I do!

<Moonberry leans in close and whispers to you.>

And for this one, I think we need one more lily.

<Moonberry winks.>

Let me take a look at this message. You bring that last night lily to Featherlight, and then we'll talk.

 Quest Hand-in: I hope that your arrival in Ardenweald is a sign that better times are on the horizon.
Title: A Ruby Shard for Sho

Description: Yes, {class}. What can I do for you?

 Quest Hand-in: For me? Why thank you.
Title: A Ruby Lifecalling

Description: {name}! How fortunate you are here! We are about to begin a Lifecalling Ceremony and would be honored if you assisted us. 

A dragonspawn's Calling is very special. Some become masterful gardeners; others care for particular wildlife.

These young dragonspawn have finished their training and are ready to take on their first Callings. I know they would be thrilled to have you participate. When you're ready, please present each of the items on this table to them.
