Description: We cannot afford to let up on any front, continue to press the war.

 Quest Hand-in: If we keep up the pressure there is no way the Alliance will succeed.
Title: My Old Enemy

Description: My old enemy, High General Abbendis, has come to Northrend.

Somehow she survived the attacks upon Tyr's Hand and brought a small force north. They've established New Hearthglen to the south.

While they could prove useful in fighting the Scourge, Abbendis herself is far too shrewd an opponent to let live. Trust me, if we let them stand, she will be at our throats before the dust settles.

So, we'll deprive them of their leadership and go about our business. Bring me her head as proof.

 Quest Hand-in: An unfortunate, but necessary action that we had to take in dealing with Abbendis. In another lifetime, I think I could have imagined fighting side-by-side with her.<The commander's voice trails off as he reflects a moment before proceeding.>I'm a little concerned about this grand admiral you describe. Barean Westwind you say? I can't believe that he's still alive. He must be ancient. We'll have to deal with him later, however.In the meantime, I think you've earned a reward and a little R & R.
Title: Murkblood Invaders

Description: The parchment holds a crudely painted map of Nagrand. There is a big red 'X' where Telaar would be on the map. It would seem that these savages are planning an attack on the city. Take the Murkblood invasion plans to Arechron in Telaar.


 Quest Hand-in: <Arechron slams his fist into his hand.>Ortor... Treacherous fiend!
Title: Out of Body Experience

Description: Ah, you seek a vision of the past.  You're a wise {race}.

Every time someone drops by for a reading, they seem to always ask about the future.  When you get to be my age, you learn that scrying the past, more often than not, is more useful.

Drink this potion and peer into my crystal ball.  Let us see what knowledge we can obtain.

 Quest Hand-in: Did you learn anything from your vision?  You mentioned Solstice Village during your trance -- which marks the second time someone has spoken the place's name today.
Title: Explosive Interruption

Description: I managed to infiltrate a rebel camp, down in Scalewatch Cavern. It seemed like any other camp, except for frequent wagons coming into camp with their contents covered.

Eventually, I was able to discreetly make my way to where the wagons would be unloaded. The rebels are stockpiling bombs, but it's even worse!

They're piling the bombs against a pillar directly underneath the aqueduct from Tyrhold.

Meet me down there, and we'll find a way to stop this!

 Quest Hand-in: We seem to be in time, <name> - let's put a stop to this before the aqueduct is destroyed!
Title: Ring of Trials: Crushmaul

Description: So you want to fight in the Ring of Trials do you? It's your funeral, bub!

Your first fight is against an exceptionally large and angry ogre named Crushmaul. That's not all though, you'll have to take out his armored boar companion too; Crushmaul never goes into the ring without him!

I hope your affairs are in order, because the last gladiator that fought Crushmaul went home in a body bag...

I'm counting on you! Get your ass inside the arena and speak with my associate Guzrug to start the fight!

 Quest Hand-in: Whoa! I couldn't tell if that was Porkchop squealing in there or if you had Crushmaul crying like a little baby!You've got talent, kid!Here's your cut of the profit, but why stop there? Together we can make a mountain of gold!
Title: Ready for Battle

Description: Greetings, {name}.

Our recruits are eager to join you on the battlefield.

 Quest Hand-in: With our allies fighting by your side the battlefield is ours for the taking.
Title: A Roc-ing Appetite

Description: Segallia seems like a good egg, good with gadgets, but she panics easily.

For example: When I sent her into the caves directly south of here, she was promptly run out of them by an unusually large harpy. Seems it was giving orders to the others as well.

Could it be the matriarch of this brood? Perhaps a commander of some kind? Get in there and find out, {name}.

And don't be afraid to ruffle a few feathers, if you know what I mean.

 Quest Hand-in: My fine-tuned bird senses are telling me these Screechflight aren't just here for snacks...But you did well, <name>! Let me decipher this scroll and we'll find out just what these harpies are after.
Title: The Legend of the Threads

Description: Tailoring is the noblest of professions because clothing is universal. Most dress with nary a thought. If you analyze the legends, some races stand out from all others. 

The Nightborne are masters of style! Much of the brilliance is in their materials--in particular their thread and their looms. We will take advantage of both. Before you gather materials, I need to confirm my list. Find the fashion treatise I brought with me. Perhaps I dropped it by the flight master?

 Quest Hand-in: Ah thank you for locating that. Let me see--we'll want to target the most stylish of the Nightborne... this seems like the perfect list... oh, she's dangerous... so's that one... very well. There is a lot to do so you should get started!
Title: A Change of Heart

Description: You seek to change the path you walk, {name}?

 Quest Hand-in: May you find what you're looking for, <brother/sister>.
Title: Safety in Numbers

Description: I've taught you all that is practical for now.

It is time we joined with the other survivors.  The others mentioned that King Greymane and his royal guard are just south of here.

We should go there and seek safety in numbers.

 Quest Hand-in: You've done well in coming here.  If we Gilneans stick together we might yet defeat this terrible enemy.
Title: The Good Stuff

Description: I've got a little proposition for you, if you're interested.

Those Dark Irons were here before Durdin and his crew arrived.  That means that, once these titan ruins opened up, the dark irons were the first ones in there, lootin' all the good stuff.  I'll bet they've still got those treasures locked up inside Angor Fortress, northwest of here.

You've more than proven your ability to wallop a dwarf.  Head on into that fortress and wallop your way to titan treasure.

I'd go with, but I'm drunk.

 Quest Hand-in: Now here's some treasure!  I was beginning to worry that these weren't titan ruins at all!I'll show these to Durdin.  Thanks again, <name>.
Title: The Coast Isn't Clear

Description: You probably noticed all of the shipwrecks along the coast.  The Great Sea is treacherous indeed.  The coast of Westfall needs to be kept clear, so that if sailors find their way to our beaches, they are safe.  The Murlocs are trouble though.

Kill murloc tidehunters and oracles and I will see to it that you are rewarded.

 Quest Hand-in: Well done, <name>.  You have quite a knack for combat.  Thanks to you the Coast of Westfall is a safer place.
Title: Traitors Among Us

Description: It's good to meet you, {class}. I've come to Theramore to help eliminate the problem of the deserters. Not only have some of the men abandoned their posts, but some have filtered back into the town.

These deserter agents are spreading lies and propaganda, hoping to convince others to join their ranks.

They're at virtually every guard post throughout the town and the docks. Find them, expose them, and discredit them. At this point, anything more risks inspiring more sympathy for them.

 Quest Hand-in: Well done, <name>. I think we managed to catch them off guard. Their agents probably thought themselves safe within the city walls.Given time, the agitators will return and spread their lies again. We'll use the time you've bought to shut out the deserters further.
Title: A Strange Port of Call

Description: I know Rastakhan is furious dat dey claimed his ship, of all de vessels in our navy.

But dere is a better question to ask. Why did dey bring it here?

Zeb'ahari is a small fishing village. Dere are no warriors here, no powerful supporters of de king. Dere must be another reason.

Board de ship and have a good look around. See if you can find out why dey brought dat beast of a boat way out here.

 Quest Hand-in: I think I know what dis means, <name>, and it does not bode well for my loa.
Title: On Even Ground

Description: We're fortunate dat those giants be havin' such bad aim. Luck is sure to be favorin' dem eventually though.

We need to get dem off da battlefield, but I don't tink takin' dem head on would be very smart.

Take dis grapplin' line, get a good hold on one of their ankles and pull their legs out from under dem. Once dey are on da ground, dey should be easy ta be finishin' off.

 Quest Hand-in: Dat will slow their assault a bit while Norsala be findin' a way to calm'm. We've no desire ta be remainin' enemies of Therazane the Stonemother.
Title: Alliance Attack Plans

Description: <You pry the note loose from Fuzzwhistle's hand.>

They're onto us! They know all about the bomb. Planning an attack on Krom'gar Fortress! I think they sent a search party after me. Won't go out like a chump. They'll get a fight.

I think I hear them coming now! Their leader is a high elf huntress named Davinia. She spoke of attack plans. Avenge me by killing her and getting those plans! Her tent is nearby, to the east.

Hellscream's eyes are upon you...

 Quest Hand-in: Damn shame... He was a good goblin.<Saurboz shakes his fist.>As for you, <name>, you've done well. These attack plans will help us prepare. I want you to deliver the plans to Overlord Krom'gar personally! There's sure to be a promotion in it for you.
Title: Pest Prevention

Description: These woods have never been so densely littered with spider eggs.

If these are recent... they must also be corrupted! We cannot allow them to hatch into more of these aggressive spiders.

While you are in the woods, destroy those eggs. Any more spiders could lead to an uncontainable infestation!

 Quest Hand-in: Thanks for that.I uh... I think you got some spider egg goop on your cloak.
Title: Ounces of Osmenite

Description: <Picking away at the ore, you pick up some shards that have fallen to the ground. There ought to be a way to mine these deposits without wasting any of it. Perhaps Instructor Ulooaka knows of still a better way to mine this ore.>

 Quest Hand-in: Ah yes, that's due to the fragile nature of the ore. You need to adjust your style a bit.Instead of heavy, powerful swings, try picking away at the edge of where the ore meets the rock.Like peeling the skin off a fruit. Here, let me show you what I mean...
Title: Forest Refugees

Description: Some of those displaced by the fallen groves have made a home for themselves at the base of the Heart of the Forest.

Hibernal Hollow is fortunate. We have supplies, when they may not.

If you would, bring these to Flwngyrr. They care for the refugees there.

 Quest Hand-in: Many cries call in the night. Many creatures seek shelter.This is a refreshing breeze.
Title: Death's Door

Description: Now there is an even greater threat from the Burning Legion.  To the south is a portal known as Death's Door, which opens upon the horrific world where the Legion breeds its deadly hounds.

To get there, exit Evergrove by heading east up the ramp.  Follow the path south, through the Bladed Gulch, Razaan's Landing, Razor Ridge and the Scalewing Shelf.  Then, take the ramp down into the Vekhaar Stand and enter Death's Door through the tunnel, south of Mok'Nathal.

Once there, use this druid signal.

 Quest Hand-in: It is a relief that Wildlord Antelarion has sent you to us.  The problem is much worse than first we feared!
Title: Oh, It's Real

Description: Yes, Tethyr is certainly real, and he lives in the waters off Theramore.

Has a thing for bright lights. He's the reason they shut down the lighthouse in the first place, you know...

And if you light it up again, he'll come right back. But no one in their right mind would do that.

So that must be your plan! It's been good sharing a drink with you, but don't blame ol' Nat if Tethyr REALLY turns you into fish bait. If you're going to do this, make sure you consult Major Mills at the Theramore docks.

 Quest Hand-in: <You recount your experiences with Nat Pagle, carefully omitting the portion about the 'bait test.'>Well, it sounds like we've got our work cut out for us. I'll make the preparations.
Title: A Hunger for Flesh

Description: <The bile-soaked leather bears a deathly odor. Upon closer inspection, it appears familiar. The insignia of the Argent Crusade is unmistakable.

Commander Throgg will want to know of this at once.>

 Quest Hand-in: This... This is from one of our own... from within the city walls.I will send word to our patrols. Remain alert, <name>.Should the Scourge rise from within our own ranks, find me at once!
Title: Hero's Call: Westfall!

Description: By order of his royal highness, King Anduin Wrynn, all able-bodied citizens of the Alliance are to report to Lieutenant Horatio Laine at the Jansen Stead.

Westfall has been overrun by beggars and transients, leading to a massive increase in criminal activity. Your help is needed to restore order to the populace. You can reach the Jansen Stead in Westfall by traveling west from Elwynn Forest.

For the glory and honor of the Alliance!

 Quest Hand-in: Murder, rookie. That's what you're looking at on the ground in front of us.
Title: One More Thing...

Description: Firstly, allow me to congratulate you. I know of no one more deserving of the title of Shadowblade. But there's one more thing.

Meet me over near the forge.

 Quest Hand-in: I think you will appreciate this. I must admit to a certain level of envy.
Title: What's Your Specialty?

Description: Hey, {name}! Have you decided on a combat specialization yet?

Since you're a {class}, you already know about the different classes available to adventurers. But did you know that there are also areas of specialization within each class?

Choosing a specialization is an important decision. Your specialty determines your combat role in a party, as well as the kinds of weapons and abilities that you will use.

Let's go speak with Juisheng Halfclaw to learn more about specializations!

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent choice of specialization, <name>.Feel free to test out your new abilities on the training dummies outside.
Title: A Dark, Glaring Reality

Description: Their eyes are upon us, {name}, watching every move from the shadows. It is no wonder our efforts thus far have felt... lacking.

The fault is by no means your own. We should have suspected this was the case long ago.

If we are to continue our efforts with meaningful expectations we must go undetected.

Our old friend has offered an elixir to aide in exposing our enemy. While there may be a few... unknown side effects, the result provides the imbiber true sight in the darkness.

 Quest Hand-in: Keep your eyes open, <name>.
Title: The Sealed Gate

Description: At one end of the Dark Iron Highway stands a massive gate much like the one that protects Shadowforge City on the opposite side. However, we have no idea what's behind it!

All we know is that it's heavily guarded by Anvilrage patrols and the molten giant Bael'gar. You simply must dispose of them and see if you can pry that gate open!

Just imagine what could lie behind it...there could be an entire other half of the city we never knew about! Or nothing! Who knows!

Though, it's probably something...

 Quest Hand-in: Darn it! I simply HAVE to know what's behind that gate! This could be the discovery that makes my career, you know!Hmm....maybe a couple good explosions would do the trick...
Title: Riverbeast Training: Gezz'ran

Description: This bulbous beast has spent a number of years in the wilds of Talador. We will begin the training there. It is already docile, as well, so I do not think it will take as long to train as the others.

As you know, stalkers can blend into their environments, allowing them to sneak in and steal the eggs of nearby prey. See if you and your riverbeast can't overcome this natural defense mechanism.

 Quest Hand-in: A savage beast, but you have triumphed. Fine work, I will get your mount some water.
Title: Grimtotem Chiefs: Elder Stormhoof

Description: Elder Stormhoof is a shaman chief of immense power. He was taught by Magatha Grimtotem, the Elder Crone, leader of the Grimtotem clan.

We know that he is here and that he has been training their geomancers. We have to kill him, {class}.

 Quest Hand-in: That was not pleasant. I wonder what he meant by calling you, "the Chosen"?
Title: Blossoming of the Grove

Description: The conservatory grows hearty and hale. Now, it must blossom anew.

Though it requires much in the way of anima, every additional spirit that the conservatory rebirths returns your generosity tenfold.

Confer with Zayhad, so that this conservatory may grow ever larger.

 Quest Hand-in: You have this grove's gratitude. Yet more spirits may now rejoin the cycle.
Title: Tipping the Scales

Description: Our scale bracers are finely crafted and highly in demand. I am finding it difficult to keep up with all of the orders! Would you lend your skill in replenishing my supply?

 Quest Hand-in: Well done, <name>. Here, take these designs in return for your aid. You can study them to improve your leatherworking.
Title: The Warden's Pawn

Description: Once those Reliquary honks got here, we panicked, and we all just started looting indiscriminately.

A lot of bad archaeology happened that day.

Luckily, Olga happened upon this small jade statue.  We thought it to be a key of some sort, but can't figure out what it opens.  Maybe you'll have some better luck with it.

 Quest Hand-in: <The statue clicks into place on the large stone slab.>
Title: A Fate Worse Than Death

Description: After the blood elves leveled Kirin'Var Village, they started the construction of a large building to the northwest. Without the expertise of the archmage, we can't say for certain what's going on there.

One thing is clear, though. The blood elf activities have unleashed a tide of ravenous mana elementals on the village. They seem drawn to the ruins of Wizard Row, wreaking further destruction. We cannot permit this to continue.

 Quest Hand-in: <The custodian looks dismayed.>I can already see the next wave coming over the horizon. Culling them will work for the time being, but more permanent measures are needed.
Title: Recovering Raimond

Description: The map we found earlier had some red markings, near the flower field. 

Do you think you could go up there and look for dad?

I'm going to stay here and check out the rest of this stuff. 

I'd go with you... but, I'm sort of allergic to bees.

Oh, and take his boot. Just in case!

 Quest Hand-in: Ahh, hah! Ancel sent you to find me, huh?Hey, you found my boots too!? Marvelous!
Title: Clipping Their Wings

Description: Ever since Finklestein's arrival, I've been relegated to collecting various ingredients for his experiments and recipes.

I'll follow my orders as I've vowed to do, but I'm a seasoned veteran. I've taken part in dozens of conflicts. I'd much rather be on the front lines, having a more direct impact on the Crusade's outcome here.

Help me, {race}. Collect some bat wings for me so that I might get back to the real action sooner.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent work, <name>.I thank you for your assistance.
Title: WANTED: Ten'gor and Nol'ixwan

Description: To any hunters worthy of the challenge: 

Find and defeat the dueling giant direhorn and devilsaur, named Nol'ixwan and Ten'gor. 

Their never-ending battle has disrupted travel throughout Zuldazar. 

Glory for any that succeed!

 Quest Hand-in: Those two have been fighting for supremacy as long as can be remembered. They will not be bothering de jungles of Zandalar anymore.
Title: Darkheart Thicket: Demons Be Different

Description: Oh yes, I've seen me fair share of demons while in dese lands. And skinnin' dem ain't no easy task.

Their hides are tougher than normal animals, fibrous, see? But if you be wantin' to make da most of their skins, den ya need to be practicin' more.

There be a creature I've heard of in da Darkheart Thicket whose hide's as tough as a demon's. When ya go ta skin him, try cutting with da grain in one even stroke.

Bring me his skin to show me you be picking up on what I'm sayin'.

 Quest Hand-in: <Ske'rit takes the hide from you and looks it over.>You definitely got da hang of it, bruddah.
Title: The Silver Covenant's Scheme

Description: One of my contacts in the Underbelly caught sight of a Silver Covenant agent gathering information at the Cantrips and Crows Tavern. Silver Covenant members aren't normally found in the sewers, so they must be plotting something.

Go into the Underbelly, find this Silver Covenant agent, and eliminate him. Search the body for any information that might give us a lead on the location of that tome from Wyrmrest. We can't let those simpering Silver Covenant weaklings get it back to Icecrown before we do.

 Quest Hand-in: <Magister Hathorel reads the captured orders.>The agent you intercepted was supposed to deliver the Wyrmrest tome to Icecrown, after meeting with one Arcanist Tybalin inside the Silver Enclave. We have to reclaim that book, <name>, and we only have one chance before it leaves the city. We have to work quickly.
Title: The Old Bear

Description: I cannot change your mind, can I? Very well, I may know where you can find your answers. 

High in the mountains, there is a hidden alcove of impossibly verdant growth. It is there that the druids of Kul Tiras train in the old ways of the Drust - from before the time of Gorak Tul.

Their leader is a great bear named Ulfar. I know little about him, but few are more qualified to parse the magic of the Drust.

You will find a path to his den along Highroad Pass. Good luck, Inquisitor.

 Quest Hand-in: Forgive my hesitation, mainlander. It would appear the minions of Thros are no longer confined to their own realm.I will help you cross the threshold into the Blighted Lands.
Title: The Activation Rune

Description: This colossal being appears to be inactive.  You notice an empty rune-shaped slot on its chest.

Perhaps you might be able to find the missing rune inside the nearby overlook.

 Quest Hand-in: <You hear the rumbling sound of stone grinding as The Etymidian's limbs come to life.>I am needed somewhere?
Title: The Absent-Minded Prospector

Description: Who are you again? {name}? Have we met? If you're here from the League, you can tell them I'm not leaving! Not without my find. I had it, right in my hands! Then the screaming. Then the wetness.

Listen here whos-yer-name, I documented the whole thing in my journal the day the tidal wave hit. And I know just where I left it! The journal. Not the find. Help me get the one so we can get the other! Or vice-versa! Do you follow? Follow me!

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, you've helped the Prospector find his missing journal! To think it was here all along.Someday you'll have to show me this other set of ruins he's always going on about.
Title: Sustain, In Vain

Description: These turncoats have kept busy. They've opened more portals around the area, allowing themselves to replenish their numbers with little trouble.

Even with her might, the Paragon cannot eliminate an endless army. Let us destroy these portals. Without reinforcements to sustain this contingent, it will surely fall.

 Quest Hand-in: No longer can they sustain themselves. Good work.
Title: Playmates!

Description: Orphanage gets real lonely, you know? Sometimes we want to go places, meet new friends.

Maybe you can take us somewheres with other hatchlings? We heard about a place called Winterfin Retreat, in the big Borean Tundra. We think it's way in the northwest, near the edge of the Coldarra-island.

The orphan lady say someone brave save a bunch of hatchlings there. We think they lonely, too. We think they need friends. You take us there?

 Quest Hand-in: That was fun! We go again sometime? We can't wait to see our new friend again!
Title: How Best to Proceed

Description: Your demon-slaying down there bought our scouts enough time to get a good look at that druid.  My intelligence tells me that his name is Marl Wormthorn... a rogue Gilnean druid of substantial power.  He resides in Maldraz, the large, twisted tree at the center of the forest, and is protected from harm by some strange force.  Whether that force is of demonic or natural sources, we have yet to determine.

Speak with Elijah.  He may have some more information for you.

 Quest Hand-in: Rohan's sending YOU to slay his druid?  Very well.You should know: Marl Wormthorn is as much demon as he is druid.  Even a druid of his power doesn't have a chance against the demonic energies that run so deeply through this land.  That does not, however, make him any less of an obstacle.
Title: A Valiant's Field Training

Description: The tournament is a time for testing your skills against your peers, but we must not forget that the real enemy, the Scourge, will not wait. As you hone your skills against others, so should you maintain your edge in combat against the enemy.

Travel to the area southwest of the Valley of Fallen Heroes and north of Corp'rethar. There, the Scourge raises dead heroes and turns them against us. Defeat these minions of the Scourge, do honor to our allies, and keep yourself prepared for combat.

 Quest Hand-in: Welcome back from your exercises, <name>. Even while we practice for the competition, it's good to remind ourselves that the Scourge is still out there.
Title: Path of Ascension: Artemede's Challenge

Description: Are you prepared for a challenge, {name}?

Though most kyrian have their preferences, every kyrian must learn to fight with a multitude of weapons and equipment. This allows them to keep both their minds sharp and their muscles and movements honed.

Let us see how your soulbinds fare against the memory of Craven Corinth while utilizing the Ring of Warding.

 Quest Hand-in: I knew you would rise to the challenge. Well done.
Title: Feathers of Flight

Description: Now, let us see this next to my arm...

Look! There many long feathers along the edges of the Larion's wing!

And none on mine. This is why I can not fly!

Hmm. It will take lots of flight feathers to give me wings. 

You help?

 Quest Hand-in: Yes, these are enough feathers to make my arms into wings!
Title: Diametrically Opposed

Description: I shall speak plainly to you, little {race}. My people have not been the same since our ties with Thorim were severed.

Volkhan will not rest until either he, or we, are no more. We only want peace, but it seems we have no choice but war.

 Quest Hand-in: Volkhan shall haunt the dreams of my people no more.Continue your efforts, little <race>. In time, I am certain my people will grow to forgive Thorim.
Title: Missive: Assault on Stonefury Cliffs

Description: Bloodmaul ogres from Frostfire Ridge have been ambushing trade routes throughout the continent, and are putting captured soldiers to work in their slag mines.

Shadow Hunter Rokhan has requested the rescue of friendly troops that have been taken prisoner in the main Bloodmaul compound at Stonefury Cliffs.

 Quest Hand-in: News about da assault beat ya back, boss-mon. And some spoils of the fightin'.Ya be a force to be reckonin' with.
Title: The Forgotten Tale

Description: The toxins in the murkweed elixir will render you unconscious. So powerful is the effect of the murkweed that even your spirit will be fooled, allowing you to temporarily enter the world of the dead.

Once a spirit, you must speak to the ghostly denizens of the Forgotten Shore. Seek out the cause of their anguish and return to me.

Remember, {name}, these spirits were once Alliance soldiers. Treat them with respect, honor and dignity.

Now, with elixir in hand, venture south to the Forgotten Shore.

 Quest Hand-in: <Orik's eyes fill with tears.>They don't know. None of them know! They think Arthas to be some great hero, when in truth it was Arthas who ordered the ships to be burned. It was Arthas who left us all for dead in this frozen wasteland!<Orik weeps.>Not all of the soldiers from the Prince's fleet perished in the freezing winter. I was only a lad when I was given the chance to battle the Scourge... to save our home from certain destruction. I took that chance, <name>.
Title: Kazak's Behest

Description: {name}, I have received word that you are needed back in Orgrimmar. Kazak Darkscream, one of the senior warlock trainers, has something important that he wishes to discuss with you. It seems like the kind of thing that cannot wait.

Make your way back to Orgrimmar and speak with him as soon as you can. You will find him at the Training Hall in the Valley of Honor.

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, you're here at last.
Title: Some Reassembly Required

Description: <The word "Feathers" has been etched onto the broken mechanical creature -- the sort of thing the person you are looking for might have created. Collecting the pieces and recreating the mechanical construct will surely give you a clue as to their fate. 

The area is crawling with Venture Co. scavengers and goons. Their pockets are probably filled with mechanical bits you could use to fix Feathers.>

 Quest Hand-in: <The pieces go together with some judicious use of applied force and acerbic verbal encouragement. Hopefully the extra pieces you have on hand weren't critical.The mechanical parrot now hovers unevenly over the sand.>
Title: A Worthy Crew

Description: If Dorian really can build this ship before the day is out, we need to find a crew for the new vessel.

This crew should represent the best of Kul Tiran society, the highest naval prowess, and the faith of our people as we present this gift to Anduin.

I have a captain in mind, but you'll want to speak to him yourself. I will let him decide who else he wants aboard.

Seek out my brother, Tandred Proudmoore, in Boralus. He will help you fill out the ranks from there.

 Quest Hand-in: This is a fine group you've assembled. Very well done.
Title: The Gnome Behind the Trogg

Description: If I just attach the core of this to the input module here... Amplify the matched frequency here...

<Tinkerbow mumbles a few more things while she attaches the communication device to the console.>

Flip the switch, Commander! Just make sure it's the right one. The left one is the self-destruct switch. Or was that reversed...

 Quest Hand-in: Give me just a second to trace the origin of the signal...
Title: Rank and File

Description: First things first; let's kill us some crusaders.

And when I say kill the Scarlet Crusade, I mean wipe them out, root and branch, rank and file.

 Quest Hand-in: Great start, <name>!It won't be long now before the Scarlet Crusade is nothing more than an ugly footnote in the annals of history.
Title: A Rough Start

Description: Lets put dose skills ta use. I'll start ya off easy, mon.

There be cats killing our boars. Dat food ain't for sharin'. Dose boars are gonna need ta be alive if ya be wanting food tonight.

Dey're all over the island. Bring me some cat pelts.

 Quest Hand-in: Dese are some fine pelts, boy. We could make some hefty cloaks outta dese.
Title: A Time to Lose

Description: Well met, {class}. As we attempt to embrace the Wickerman ceremony, it is no surprise that the Horde would attempt to ruin our celebration.

Now the prudent course of action may be to rise above the conflict and simply ignore the attacks.

I admire those that take that high road, but I cannot help them.  But for those that seek to strike back... I can help them.  If you are interested, {class}, take this Dousing Agent and use it on the Horde's Wickerman in the Ruins of Lordaeron.

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, so it is done.  A momentary setback, but if it is as annoying as their attacks have been, then it is worth it.I spoke to the children about your adventure and they were very excited.  They were impressed with your bravery to venture into enemy territory.  They also seemed to get a kick out of the mischief that you helped bring about... Oh those little rascals...They did want you to have some of these treats as a reward.  Enjoy, <name>.
Title: Right Beneath Their Eyes

Description: We need to get inside Darkmaul Citadel, rescue the captain of the expedition, and stop the ogre necromancer behind all of this.

Meredy is going to cast an illusion to make you look like an ogre, and you're going to take us all in as "prisoners."

This plan is... inventive. But it's the best way to get us behind enemy lines.

Speak with Meredy when you're ready for her to cast the spell.

She assures me the effects will be temporary.

 Quest Hand-in: We're close to stopping all of this. We just need to push a little further.
Title: Fuel for the Forge

Description: To make the best blades, you need the heat that only a Magma Core can provide. We try to keep a few on hand as a fuel source for our forges. Lately, we've been running low on cores and could use a resupply.

Magma Cores are obtainable from most lava creatures in the Dragon Isles.

 Quest Hand-in: The blacksmiths will be glad to have this resupply for their forges.
Title: The Lord of the Gordunni

Description: Witch Lord Morkurk is the leader of the Gordunni. We need to kill him to secure the jovite for use in our artillery tower.

Morkurk is an accomplished mage so you better be prepared. Here, take the rocket pack and use it if you need to avoid any of his deadly magic.

Archenon poros!

 Quest Hand-in: Fine work commander! Your combat skills are clearly second to none. I am honored to be your armorer!Let's get back to the outpost so we can take stock of our new inventory. I saved a few flares to call us in a ride back.
Title: Audience with the Warchief

Description: Welcome to Orgrimmar, the Horde's seat of power.

Tensions are running high, demon hunter. Warchief Vol'jin was gravely wounded in a disastrous assault on the Broken Shore.

I suggest you offer your skills in service of the Horde before your presence is... misinterpreted.

High Overlord Saurfang commands the city's defenses. Though wary of the Illidari, I believe he will give you a chance to prove your worth.

Speak to him and request passage into Grommash Hold.

 Quest Hand-in: Vol'jin's death was part of a larger plan. The Legion thrives on weakening its enemies from within. The demons will strike when their enemy is at its most vulnerable.Whatever grief the Horde's people are feelilng, they can no longer afford to ignore us.Our time is now, Illidari!
Title: Target: Hive'Zora Reavers

Description: Reinforcements have been called on to join the assault on Hive'Zora.  You have been selected to target Hive'Zora reavers.  Report back to Commander Mar'alith after completing your task.

 Quest Hand-in: I've heard good things about your part in the Hive'Zora attack.  Keep up the good work and victory will soon be ours.
Title: Disarming Bears

Description: I would prefer to do as much as we can to protect my people from the Deadwood tribe without slaughtering every last one of them. We've taken steps towards this before, and if you wish to prove yourself to the Timbermaw tribe, I would ask you do this as well.

Look for the piles of weapons kept in Felpaw Village to the southwest. Take as many as you find. If we disarm the Deadwood tribe, we may be able to stop some bloodshed later.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you, <race>. An action like this will go a long way towards proving yourself as an ally of the Timbermaw.
Title: Growing the Farm I: A Little Problem

Description: So you need to whack some wily weeds?

No problem, neighbor! Only thing is, I'm running low on weed killer.

I make my own concoction - very potent, totally organic and good for the earth. Plants love it! Well... except for those pesky weeds. They hate the stuff!

If you bring me some Spideroot from the terraces just west of us, I'll make a fresh batch and go down to Yoon's farm myself.

I would gather some myself but... well... I hate spiders. You'll see what I mean.

 Quest Hand-in: Well what do we have here? You harvested enough to last me a while.Many thanks!
Title: Breaching the Barrier

Description: The ritual site is already prepared, and it is protected by a barrier... one that I created. I can destroy the barrier, but I will need three items currently in use at Forge Camp Vengeance.

If you can get those ritual items, I will meet you at the Corrupted Refuge and remove the barrier. Even if it kills me.

 Quest Hand-in: Not a moment too soon. He has summoned something, I fear the ritual is close to complete.
Title: The Wicked Revantusk

Description: These Revantusk trolls think they're special for bein' in the Horde. Makes me laugh!

See, the funny part is, it doesn't matter if they're part of the Horde, or some kinda troll empire, or the bloody Burning Legion for that matter. We've fought trolls in these lands for a few centuries now.

In fact, I'll be kind enough to let you lend a hand, lad! Grab a weapon and head out to the battlefield and help our boys to the east.

 Quest Hand-in: Not bad for a city-dwellin' <race>. Good show, aye!
Title: Blurred Vision

Description: Look up.

See them, scattered among the trees? Those brightly glowing owls are not living, breathing denizens of the forest... they are Kaldorei magic. Sentries. A ruse -- reporting everything they see back to Malfurion.

We can't have that, now can we?

Deal with them, {name}. But take care -- they aren't the only enemies in the forest.

We cannot allow anything or anyone to stand in our way.

 Quest Hand-in: Nicely done.
Title: Slaves to No One

Description: I was one of the few that escaped, {name}.  When the Forsaken took over our town and our mine, they treated us with utmost cruelty.

Those of us who were weak and could not endure hard labor were worked to death by the abomination known as Brothogg.

My wife was among his victims, {class}, and I swore that one day her death would be avenged.  I am too frail now, but you can deliver justice... for my wife... for Gilneas!

 Quest Hand-in: I thank you, <name>.  Our people will no longer suffer under that monstrosity's yolk.
Title: Bloodlord Mandokir

Description: {race}.  You just resurrected your worst nightmare.  You didn't think I was a friend, did you, {race}?  Ah, ha ha haaaa!

You've served your purpose.  I've returned to the realm of the living, and it's all thanks to you.  So, instead of killing you, I'm going to make you a deal instead.

Give me that raptor.

You must already know that she's no normal raptor, and I need a replacement for Ohgan.  Do it, or both you and the gnome will taste my rage.

 Quest Hand-in: I'm glad to see you've come to your senses.Come and visit us in Zul'Gurub sometime, <race>.  I'll be watching...
Title: Hammer to Fall

Description: It looks like the Horde thinks they can hide behind their heavy hitting mooks.

The mooks are tough, powerful, and dumber than an ogre with a hangover.

Go down there and bring the hammer of the Alliance fury down on them!

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you soldier. That should teach the Horde that it will take more than a couple of mooks to scare us away.
Title: Round 3: Master Boom Boom

Description: Your next challenger found his strength on a beach. Particularly in a box labeled "dynamite."

He proves however that found strength can be as deadly as personal strength.

When you are ready, face this Master Boom Boom in the Western Arena.

 Quest Hand-in: Well fought, challenger. That was a fierce opponent.
Title: Into the Fray

Description: The Burning Legion has beaten us here, but so too have the Illidari. It looks like the demon hunters are holding their own, but just barely.

Come, let's put that weapon of yours to use. I'll figure out our next move while you crush the Legion.

 Quest Hand-in: You are a most welcome sight, <name>. And, you brought considerable firepower in the form of Archmage Khadgar.Malevolence has been portaling us back and forth between here and the Fel Hammer. We pushed the demons out of these ruins, but they are stronger than any we have encountered before.Your leadership is greatly appreciated. If we do not crush this Legion invasion now, they will overrun Azsuna and then the rest of the Broken Isles.
Title: Success!

Description: The test was a resounding success! We can certainly use this device to start repairing the domes.

Carry word of the test results to the Stormspire and let Ghabar know that I've also found a pattern in the damage to the shield generators. Key pieces of generator units have gone missing from a number of sites. This is no accident, {name}, no technological failure. We're being stolen from. 

 Quest Hand-in: I'll have my techs get to work on those repairs right away.Tashar's suspicion of sabotage worries me, though. I can't think of anyone who would be bold enough to steal our technology. Not anyone who knows what we're capable of, anyway. It may be time to lock down the Stormspire.
Title: The Lost Courier

Description: We're lucky we made it this far, {name}.  We were ambushed by Scourge as soon as we landed.

One of our men turned out to be a spy for the Cult of the Damned.  Thassarian appears to have more evidence of cultist infiltration.  Apparently it goes all the way to the top.

I've sent one of my best couriers to our outpost in western Dragonblight, but he has not yet returned. I fear he may have fallen to the Scourge. Will you go to Dragonblight and search for him? Courier Lanson is his name.


 Quest Hand-in: As I crossed the bridge into Dragonblight a small group of Anub'ar ambushed me! I was surrounded! Those monsters knew I was coming. I barely made it out of there with my flesh intact. This list I hold must be taken to Wintergarde Keep, but I am too badly injured to make the journey.
Title: Never Forget

Description: We had to escape Telmor with what few we could save.

Someone disabled Leafshadow's cloaking field; I know not who, but I suspect it had to have been one of our own.

We will retrieve our livelihoods in time, but we cannot risk losing our sacred artifacts.

If you are able, bring Leafshadow, our town registry, and our prayerbook to safety.

 Quest Hand-in: With these, we can account for our fallen and rebuild. We will persevere.
Title: The Admiral's Cabin

Description: It's possible we'll find further clues inside the admiral's cabin. You will find it directly below us.

See if there are any survivors or information that will lead us closer to the World Pillar fragment.  Be careful, {name}.  Whoever got the crew might still be out there.

 Quest Hand-in: This ship is filled with rats...
Title: Witch of the Woods

Description: A... a witch?!

I uh... I would love to help you, truly I would but... I must report to my father.

Why don't you go stop the witch yourself? For a brave adventurer like you, a witch should be no problem.

I'm sure my father would reward you greatly!

 Quest Hand-in: <Maynard studies the locket.>That ungrateful woman!
Title: Pressing the Attack

Description: Gul'dan's minions are on the run, commander! If you have the strength, now would be an opportune time to press forward and assault some of his other strongholds.

 Quest Hand-in: This is wonderful news, commander. We will soon have Gul'dan's ghoulish citadel completely surrounded!
Title: Join the Battle!

Description: I have here an urgent message from Sergeant Willem. Turns out that the Blackrock orcs have hired goblin assassins. They ambushed our battalion behind the abbey. Willem has asked me to send him a hero. You have to go help them, {name}!

Find Sergeant Willem north of the abbey at the command tent. Go!

 Quest Hand-in: It's true, we were ambushed. I don't dare send any more soldiers out there and risk losing them too. I need a volunteer. Someone willing to risk their life!
Title: Jewelcrafting Services Requested

Description: Hi, hi, hi {name}! Crafting orders are coming in left and right!

If you're looking for work, the Artisan's Consortium always has orders to fill!

You can take a look at our public orders, or if you've built up a network of clients for yourself, fill some guild orders or personal orders! Just get it done, done, done!

 Quest Hand-in: Thanks for your business! Keep on crafting, crafting, crafting!
Title: The Burning Coven

Description: Not even a Titan can endure their torture. Bring an end to the Coven of Shivarra.

 Quest Hand-in: Did you triumph in Antorus?
Title: A Dying Dream

Description: Deep in the heart of the swamp lies an ancient protector of the Dreamway, Witherheart.

He was among the first defenders to battle against the Nightmare, but he has fallen to total corruption.

It pains me to say it, but we must destroy him.

 Quest Hand-in: Today I grieve for a fallen ally, one who has wandered these forests for eons.He can now be at peace, knowing he gave his life to protect this sacred place.
Title: Away From the Herd

Description: <The Child of Torcali stares longingly out of her pen. Her gaze seems to be following the other nearby direhorns.

Perhaps she could use a distraction.>

 Quest Hand-in: <The Child of Torcali lovingly headbutts your leg.>
Title: Faceless Mask of the Long Night

Description: The endurance needed to make it this far is extraordinary and the feat of a long experienced adventurer. Yet, the longest night is nigh and with it our ultimate conquest. Those that fight the coming of eternal twilight know only futility, for in the Longest Night they will be on the edge of sanity forever.

 Quest Hand-in: Taking a step towards the Longest Night is already acknowledging the sanity you have lost. Do you risk the rest on such a fools errand?
Title: Daycare Director Agapanthus

Description: Amella has told me about the incoming whelps and about the daycare. Did you know Agapanthus is a renowned whelptender? I heard he fought back demons while rearing whelps! 

If he's as amazing as they say, I have much to learn from him. I only just received my Calling, but I will help in any way I can.

The Little Scales Daycare is in Valdrakken. I will gather my things and meet you and Agapanthus there.

 Quest Hand-in: Lasztak has just informed me of his rigorous study as a whelptender of the red flight. Most of my experience is hands-on. And you...<Agapanthus sighs and scratches his chin.>We will have to develop curriculum.
Title: Sarkoth

Description: {class}! I thought I would die out here with none to know of it. While I was hunting the scorpids of the Valley, I came across a particularly vicious-looking one. Hurling myself at it, I managed to inflict a massive blow to its claw before it closed around my leg.

I wasn't ready for its stinger though, and it sliced down and into my chest, cutting into my flesh and letting my blood. Please, you must kill the scorpid for me! My honor must be upheld! I fought it up on the plateau to the south.

 Quest Hand-in: My blow was not enough to kill him, but looking at the damage I inflicted gives me some small measure of pride. That small measure will be all I have to sustain myself if I die, and in that light, the short list of my life's accomplishments fills me with anger.
Title: Bearers of the Plague

Description: You show courage coming to the Ghostlands, {name}.  There is much work to be done here and not enough brave souls to do it.

I've a thankless task to offer you, should you have the inclination to aid our cause.  The very wildlife in this land has been tainted by the plague and we must stop it from spreading.  Hunt the ghostclaw lynxes to the east and south of here and return when you've slain enough of them.

 Quest Hand-in: You've done well, <name>.  It's important that the plague doesn't spread to the healthy wildlife in Eversong.  I have more work for you if you're looking for something to do.
Title: Blueprint: Steward Mail Pouch

Description: <You have discovered plans for a steward sized pouch, perfect for carrying mail.

Dactylis should be able to help you with crafting this.>

 Quest Hand-in: I see you have retrieved a new blueprint. I look forward to assisting you in your crafting.
Title: Socrethar's Demise

Description: Meet me down by the entrance to the Shattrath dome.

There, we shall issue our challenge to the Sargerei leader. If he accepts, it is there that he shall meet his end.

I must admit, {name}, I am looking forward to this.

 Quest Hand-in: Finally, it is done. This creature of darkness shall torment us no longer. Shattrath is free of his taint.
Title: Better Luck Next Time

Description: I'm afraid we've already had a winner for today, young {name}.  However, if you bring a shark, I'll see that it's released back into the waters, and I might just have a little something for you...

 Quest Hand-in: I'm afraid we've already had a winner for today, young <name>. However, if you bring a shark, I'll see that it's released back into the waters, and I might just have a little something for you...
Title: The Shatterspear Invaders

Description: If we didn't have enough on our hands with the land and the elements turning against us, it seems something has riled up the trolls to the northeast, and they've started on a war path. I'm not sure what their aims are, but they've already attacked several of our scouts and have besieged the cultists at the Tower of Althalaxx.

We've sent a contingent of our best Sentinels to counter their attacks. If you would travel northeast to the ruins and join them, I'm certain that they could use the extra hand.

 Quest Hand-in: Glynda sent you to lend a hand, did she? I'm glad she did - I could certainly use the help.I'm working on our initial plans to start whittling away at their ranks. Please feel free to help Tysha and Balthule in the meantime.
Title: Dustwind Dig

Description: I've got an idea, but it's a bit of a long shot.  Thankfully, long shots happen to be a specialty of mine.

North of here, the Explorers' League has uncovered a new set of titan ruins beneath the sands.  If there's anything older and wiser than dragons, it's titans.  Heck, I've heard rumors that the titans CREATED the dragons.

Talk to Lead Prospector Durdin at the camp to the north.  He'll have more information than I do about these titans.

What did I tell you?  It's a long shot.

 Quest Hand-in: Titans?  You wanna know about titans?You came to the right place, lad.  We're on the brink of somethin' big.
Title: Unnatural Consequences

Description: Lexera and her trappers have taken over the valley.

She is stronger than she looks, {name}, and she fights with the strength of a dreadlord. Do not go in unprepared. 

I can handle these demons. Go, find Lexera, and make her feel the consequences of her unnatural endeavors.

 Quest Hand-in: There is no joy when a Nighthuntress falls, but it had to be done. The truth is, she died the moment she aligned herself with the Burning Legion.
Title: Silence in the Stalks

Description: Hmm. Well that's not... great. But no cause for alarm, yet!

It has been a long time since our ring withdrew from here, and we probably need to go to its source to get it to return!

Unfortunately, I haven't heard from the Chief Mushroomancer, Cortinarius, since the crisis began.

Please, find him and help us rejoin the rings! Head west of Dreamsong Fenn to the Stalks. You can't miss them... just follow the mushrooms!

 Quest Hand-in: Finally, a friendly face! Are you with the Hunt? You don't look like you're from around here....
Title: Sinfall Veteran

Description: Sinfall's influence grows thanks to your triumphs, {name}!

Your accomplishments have not gone unnoticed, even beyond the borders of Revendreth.

Tales of your victories have echoed through the halls of Oribos. Zo'sorg, the Master of Conflict, has requested a meeting with you in the Enclave.

They have a keen interest in the art of war. I suggest you don't keep them waiting.

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, <name>. I have heard many stories of your prowess on the battlefield. I have interest in keeping great combatants like yourself well equipped. Zo'dash is authorized to further upgrade your armor and weapons.
Title: Feed Them All

Description: I am grateful for the help that your Alliance has given my people, but we are desperately short on food and supplies.

If we do not gather enough supplies to take care of both the Alliance and my clan, we will run out of food within the week.

Thankfully, there appears to be an abundance of fathom rays in the area, but I will need help hunting them in order to gather enough food for our camp.

Take this fathom hook and use it to pull down the fathom rays from above.

 Quest Hand-in: You have brought back a hefty supply of fathom meat. I will make sure that it gets hauled back to camp. Thank you for your service, <class>.
Title: Where's My Wolf?!

Description: My frost wolf, Nerok, was captured with me and the others. I do not know where they are keeping him, but I'll bet the so-called "beastmaster" who dragged us here does.

He is at the beast pens nearby, boasting about his catch to the younger hunters.

We'll see how he boasts with my axe in his skull.

 Quest Hand-in: Nerok and I are the only surviving prisoners, but we cannot leave just yet.
Title: Grom'tor, Son of Oronok

Description: My first born, Grom'tor, left to search Coilskar Point - directly southwest of here.

He's the warrior in the family - ill-tempered and blood-thirsty... Traits he inherited from his mother. Search along the outskirts of Coilskar Point. If you see naga corpses, Grom'tor is sure to be close.

When you find him, tell him this: "We spill blood for just cause." It will let him know that you are a friend to Torn-heart and prevent your premature death.

 Quest Hand-in: <Grom'tor grunts.>It's good you came. This maggot just spilled its guts. We've got them now!
Title: Equipment Recovery

Description: Please, {name}.  When the Hyldnir took our men, they also took all our equipment.  Of course, it's more important that we get our boys back, but if you run into any of our equipment, I'd really appreciate it if you brought it back to us.

You'll find their village just above us, to the north.

 Quest Hand-in: Thanks, <name>!  We'll see what we can do to salvage these parts!
Title: Continued Efforts: Scholar's Den

Description: We cannot allow the mawsworn a foothold so close to our own encampment. The attendants say they keep this place hidden from eyes, but I will not rest easy while I can see them.

Enter the Scholar's Den and cleanse the Jailer's forces from it.

 Quest Hand-in: You have performed admirably in this task, Maw Walker. We thank you for your aid.
Title: An Ancient Reborn

Description: I'm convinced that YOU are the herald of Aviana, {name}. It was you who first saw her and rescued her essence from the claws of a dragon.

Yes, I believe Aviana is to be reborn into our world. And you shall have the honor of ushering her over the threshold.

Take this incense and burn it before Aviana's egg in the room just above me.

The ancient awaits, {name}. Our deliverance is here!

 Quest Hand-in: I ... live.Those that tried to corrupt me and kidnap my children will soon feel the rake of my talons, <class>. Believe it.Continue to push forward across Hyjal. I will collect myself and assemble with the other Ancients.
Title: Word on the Street

Description: Hey, {name}.  There's a girl in the inn that's asking about you.  Her name's Leryssa.

I don't think she knows you, but she said she needed your help.  She sounded really desperate.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you for coming to see me.  I didn't know who else to contact.
Title: Bundle of Boulders

Description: Hey Uplander!

I heard you've been telling people I've been mean to you. 

I haven't, but they told me to be nicer to you because all you've done for us. 

Taken advantage of? More like giving you some honest work!

To make you and the others happy, I'll give you some boulders. 

See me in Loamm, 
Ponzo

 Quest Hand-in: Make sure to mention to Mimuup that I was nice to you, you hear?
Title: Pest Control

Description: Oi, mon! One of dose little snobold runts trashed our camp during da last dragon attack. Dey've been houndin us wheneva we turn our backs and I've had enough. 

To da east you'll find da snobolds hiding under da skirts of some of da local magnataur. Go slaughter dem. If da magnataur interfere on behalf of deir slaves, kill dem as well.

 Quest Hand-in: Good riddance, mon.
Title: The Nighthold: Gul'dan

Description: Gul'dan believed that the Legion was the destiny of the orcs, and has not paused in his brutal pursuit. Now, at last, the time has come to end his demonic crusade, and dispense justice for all.

 Quest Hand-in: Were you able to overcome the The Nighthold?
Title: Quel'Danil Lodge

Description: I may appear far from home to you, {class}, but quite a few of my people were led here by Ambassador Rualeth. We have settled with the high elves of the Quel'Danil Lodge, to the northwest, to train in the ways of the Light and enjoy the peaceful beauty of this land.

Such peace may be short lived. We have seen the Horde moving further west from here. Could you travel to Quel'Danil and give warning to Anchorite Traska? Her cabin is just north of the main lodge.

 Quest Hand-in: Yoro sends warning of the Horde? The Highvale have been cautious of an attack for some time now. In fact, we have been--<Screams and the clash of metal break out to the south.>By the light... they are here!
Title: Mud Hunter

Description: Hope you're not afraid of getting dirty.  Judging by the looks of you, that won't be a problem.

To the north, at the lava's edge, you'll find piles of dark mud.  I need it.

It'd be best if you didn't ask questions, and focused your efforts on following orders, {name}.

 Quest Hand-in: This is exactly what we need.Don't worry, <name>... the orc-killing will come soon enough.
Title: Crippling the Hive

Description: The mantid here are working feverishly to harvest amber from the tree.

Perhaps killing a pawful of them will slow their efforts.

 Quest Hand-in: While it is not a permanent solution, this should buy us some time.
Title: Placing Hodir's Helm

Description: The helm is forged.

Your efforts have not gone unnoticed, small one. Though there remains much to do, we sons of Hodir are grateful for your accomplishments.

In return, I offer you the opportunity to present Hodir's helm to our king and our brethren.

Fly to the sparkling tip of the small ice spike in front of me and read to our people from this tablet.

Enjoy the privilege, {class}. Never before has an outsider been given such an honor!

 Quest Hand-in: <Njormeld gazes up at Hodir's Helm, visibly moved.>That will do, little <race>.That will do....
Title: Rolling with my Homies

Description: {name}, you're about to host the corporate party to end all corporate parties. My research says that if you're seen having a good time at the party, your promotion quotient will skyrocket and explode!

So, with that in mind, might I suggest that you take your new company hot rod out for a spin?

Go pick up your friends. Just remember me on the way up when it all comes together and you're the new Trade Prince, okay?

 Quest Hand-in: Well done, sir. You all look very good riding around in the hot rod. I'm sure you made quite an impression on the citizenry.
Title: I See Dead People

Description: Th... they're ghosts! All of them!

Bryan was one of my best friends. Something is clouding his mind; we need to snap him out of it and get to the bottom of this!

He was always obsessed with his work. Maybe showing him one of his schematics would help. One of the spectral laborers might have one.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you, friend.
Title: Adopt a Tadpole

Description: One day every year, usually in mid-spring, the Winterfin tadpoles are given free reign of the village. I'm not sure why this tradition persists, as it usually results in heavy damage to the their buildings and food stores.

I usually try not to interfere too much with the goings-on of the tribe, but today, I take exception. Go out and see if you can keep an eye on one of the tadpoles.

 Quest Hand-in: Glrm. Mrr glrg.
Title: The Laughing Skull

Description: Ah, {name}, good. I need someone who is not of my clan to negotiate with the Laughing Skull.

We could use their help navigating this land, but they are dangerous and unpredictable, much like Gorgrond itself.

Follow this road and seek out someone willing to speak with you.

Perhaps they will see you as something new and be willing to talk first and stab later.

 Quest Hand-in: Ha! Curious. What are you?
Title: Diabolical Plans

Description: The demon dropped this parchment, which is amazingly written in the Orcish tongue!  The ones mentioned in it, Diathorus and Gorgannon, are the two infamous dreadlords that control the demons hereabouts.

The plans detail preparations for a demonic attack on Splintertree Post to the northwest.

You're certain that Valusha at Splintertree Post would be interested in these.

 Quest Hand-in: Dreadlords!  They plan to attack us here at Splintertree Post?!Not while I still draw breath!<Valusha crumples the demon-scrawled plans in her fist.>No.  We will not allow this to happen!  They are a blight upon our world!
Title: A Most Puzzling Circumstance

Description: You have accomplished the truly impossible. The brood mother of the Black Dragonflight lies dead at your feet. Seize her head and deliver it to Zardeth of the Black Claw.

 Quest Hand-in: What? How did you get this? Isn't she... Never mind the details, I suppose. You'll be wanting one of these baubles as recompense, no doubt.
Title: All An Aspirant Can Do

Description: I think we can agree that such a reply feels... somewhat hollow.

I choose to take faith that we have done all we can. All of us. I do not know what comes next, but perhaps the path will reveal itself. In the meantime, Pelagos and I will return to Aspirant's Rest for a moment of respite.

We will meet you there, though there is no need to hurry.

 Quest Hand-in: <Kleia smiles warmly at you.>Does this mean you intend to stay?
Title: Tazavesh: A Hard Bargain

Description: Ah, my work looks marvelous on you. You are the very image of legitimacy!

And now that I've provided you with my talents, you shall provide me with yours. Seek out my business associate, Fe'tajid, at the Gilded Landing and offer him your assistance.

I look forward to hearing of your success.

 Quest Hand-in: It seems our efforts to deceive the Zo were unsuccessful. But their efforts to kill you failed as well, so no harm done, yes?Perhaps a more generous reward is in order. Please accept this, along with my sincerest gratitude.
Title: Malfurion Returns

Description: Do you hear his voice?

Malfurion seeks our aid! Keep your head high, {name}. The ancients stand with you this day.

 Quest Hand-in: We must push them back!
Title: Mr. Floppy's Perilous Adventure

Description: Excuse me, Mister, do you know the way back to the soldiers' camp?

Mr. Floppy and I decided to go for a walk in the woods, and my brother Walter was gonna come with us, but then he had squire things to do.

So Mr. Floppy and I went by ourselves, but we got lost, and there were a whole bunch of hungry wolves, but we found this tower.

The wolves went away, but we're still lost.

I asked Mr. Floppy, and he doesn't know the way back. Would you help us? Please?

 Quest Hand-in: Thank goodness you found Emmy! When she left without me, I was worried she'd get lost.I'm glad to see Mr. Floppy's back safe and sound, too.
Title: I Work... For the Horde!

Description: Would you believe it?  These orcs hired me to help them shore up damaged fortifications and build explosives.  What a dream job!  It's too bad we're so short on materials, but a clever goblin like myself learns how to make do!

Can you help me?  I need salvaged wood and metal from the ruined battlements along the Path of Glory.  Go down there and salvage, and watch out for those red-skinned orcs!

When you're done, come back for big rewards!

 Quest Hand-in: This stuff is great!  A little bent and a little burnt, but I've never let low grade materials stop me from making precision high explosives.Thanks, <name>.  You really have an eye for quality trash!
Title: Some Wicked Things This Way Come

Description: Phineas did well in bringing you to me, {name}. There is much work to be done.

We'd best get to it!

As a master of the dark arts, I need you to help me whip these newcomers into shape. Talk to them. They come from many walks of life--all of them unfamiliar with the dark arts.

Learn their wishes. 

Their hopes.

Their dreams.

This path we walk can bestow gifts unending and power unimaginable. One just needs to know what one truly desires...

 Quest Hand-in: Only one or two pairs of cold feet, hm? <Madam Shadow chuckles.>Excellent.Now that we know who wants to be here, it is time to determine who deserves to be here.
Title: The Black Morass

Description: The Infinite Dragonflight have abandoned all pretense of subtlety. They plot to destroy the Guardian, Medivh, and prevent the Dark Portal from ever opening. While outwardly, this may appear a boon to the forces of the Alliance, it is in actuality catastrophic and will result in your world ending.

You must venture through the timeway leading to the Black Morass. Go west and then south, past my future self, until you reach the tunnel that houses the swamp specimens. Cross over and speak with Sa'at.

 Quest Hand-in: Indeed, if the orcs never make it to Azeroth, the Alliance will never form. Eventually civil war will break out, further weakening the human kingdoms.Ultimately the Burning Legion will invade Azeroth, destroying it in the absence of any defenders.
Title: Making Time

Description: I guess I shouldn't be surprised to find myself here.

This is not the Azeroth I wanted, but it's the one I have. We're fighting to preserve what's left and take the world back, but your arrival has caused some trouble. 

We use the essence of those elementals out there to fuel our protections and keep ourselves safe. See that shield? That's the only thing keeping us from discovery and annihilation and you drained our resources. Bring back some of that essence and we may survive another day.

 Quest Hand-in: You've given us some breathing room.
Title: A Mlrglrmg For Grlmrgl

Description: Mrglm, rmgrlg mrlgmrl.

Grmrglmrl mlrmglrgr mlrmlgr! Rglrmgl rmglrgmlr mlmlglr mglgrgrlm - grlgmr, mlgr - lrgmlrgr rmgrmlg mlrg! Mlrgr?

Mrlgmrlgmrl rmglrmglr!

<Pearlhunter Phin makes a stabbing motion.>

 Quest Hand-in: Mrrgml... mlrgmlrg. Mlrmglrg gmrlr!
Title: Hero's Call: Western Plaguelands!

Description: By order of his royal highness, King Anduin Wrynn, all able-bodied citizens of the Alliance are to report to Thassarian at Andorhal.

On the heels of our early victories in Andorhal, the Forsaken have decided to launch a counterattack. Your help is needed to beat back the Scourge and Horde and reclaim lost Andorhal.

To reach Andorhal, travel north through the Hillsbrad Foothills and follow the road beyond Chillwind Camp.

For the glory and honor of the Alliance!

 Quest Hand-in: There is much to be done here. Both of our enemies are relentless and would slaughter us without mercy the moment we sheathe our blades.
Title: Aalgen Point

Description: You wanna hold territory on this chunder puddle of an island, right? Right. That means linkin' up with camps on the outskirts, mate. 

I know this bloke called Heidirk. Scrappy fella, loves to get into the thick of it. Headed out to the eastern coast with those drakes of his.

Have a look for him. Remind him he owes me a pint or two!

 Quest Hand-in: Chambers sent you? He can down a tankard with the best of 'em, I'll give him that. But if he says I owe him anything, he's a liar!Don't you worry, my drakes and I will hold the point here. But more of this shore will need to be secured before your campaign can find victory.
Title: Garrison Campaign: In the Shadows

Description: I need your help. Iskar has gone missing. I have reason to believe he has followed the remnants of the Sethekk who have been gathering here in Tanaan. I've been investigating and... what was that?

<Reshad's voice drops to a whisper>

There is movement in the shadows, we are being watched!

Take these vials, they form a gas with a terrible smell when the liquid comes in contact with the air. Smells terrible, they won't be able to resist it. Use them to drive our watchers out of hiding.

 Quest Hand-in: So the Shadow Council is involved? Interesting...
Title: The Art of Flow

Description: All done, {name}! We have but one more step and Shal'Aran will have all the mana it needs.

Now that I have better access to the ley line below I can break the pool so that it will flow through properly. Given the chaotic state of this ley line it will require all of my concentration to redirect the energy.

I must warn you that we will attract attention while I am doing this. You will need to protect me while I complete the process.

Speak to me when you are ready.

 Quest Hand-in: It is done. Shal'Aran will have no want of mana now.
Title: Down From the Sky

Description: The archers of Ramkahen are highly skilled, but the bows of the Amathet have the advantage of range. This makes our incursions into their territory highly dangerous.

You have a knack for fighting behind enemy lines. If you could thin out their ranks, it could provide us an opportunity to push their lines back for once.

Will you help?

 Quest Hand-in: The Amathet's arrows no longer darken our skies.We must take this opportunity to strike!
Title: Leyline Feed: Elor'shan

Description: <The leyline feed appears to be intact and undamaged, but is not functioning. An infusion of Ancient Mana should be enough to render it operational again.>

 Quest Hand-in: <As you imbue the feed with the mana the structure stirs to life. Your skin tingles as the surrounding air becomes charged with arcane power.>
Title: The Ritual of Tides

Description: Long ago, the first Farseer of the Earthen Ring was given a vision of the elements.

In the vision she foresaw the arrival of a new Farseer, one who would lead us through a time of terrible crisis and unite the elements.

{name}, I believe that you are the Farseer of this prophecy, called to lead before you were ever born.

The time has come to fulfill your destiny!

When you are ready, we will perform the Ritual of Tides and call upon Neptulon, the first of the four great Elemental Lords.

 Quest Hand-in: I have seen you before, Farseer.<Lord Neptulon judges you silently for a moment before continuing.>I sense the potential for great power within you. We shall see if this prophecy holds true...
Title: Opportunity

Description: We recently came upon schematics that indicate a weakness in Icecrown Citadel.  An opening in its defenses, both figuratively and literally.

The captured diagrams show an orifice leading several hundred feet into the ground.  We're unsure of its purpose, but our scouting has revealed it to be of high importance to the Scourge.

Speak to Sergeant Kregga below Icecrown Citadel, she's leading the attack on the site.

 Quest Hand-in: Just in time, <name>.  Koltira spoke highly of you.  Perhaps you'll be able to push the scales in our favor.
Title: Titanium Powder

Description: Hello {name}!  Do you have anything to trade?

 Quest Hand-in: Wonderful!  Another batch of powder!Just between us jewelcrafters, I've been making hand over fist selling "pure titanium" jewelry to the local Dalaran mages.  Even with their superior intellect, they aren't particularly savvy with their gold.  If you get more, I'll be here.
Title: The Ring of Blood: Rokdar the Sundered Lord

Description: This fight is gonna be painful, {name}. Do you have any friends that are brave enough to help you out? The ogres managed to get a giant from Blade's Edge named Rokdar! Trust me, you're gonna need friends, he seems unbeatable! He's hard as a rock - literally!

If you still want to fight him, step into the Ring of Blood and he will come.

 Quest Hand-in: You've got the ogres sweatin', kid! Here's a little something extra this time - don't use 'em all in one place.Are you ready for another fight? Gurgthock's bettin' the bank on you!
Title: A Good Axe

Description: I was a damned fool for throwing my axe at that sea hag. We can't afford to lose focus.

The battle ahead won't be easy. I'll need another weapon to help us fight to the waystone.

Looks like these soldiers have plenty of armaments. Let's keep an eye out for one I can use.

 Quest Hand-in: This lacks the balance and craftsmanship of a good Frostwolf axe, but it will have to do.Let's get moving.
Title: Restock: Surveillance Equipment

Description: I have an urgent matter to discuss.

As you are aware, a murder occurred at the last Ember Court. That is an unacceptable failing on my part and I apologize.

I would like to acquire additional surveillance equipment to ensure we are prepared if it happens again.

After that is resolved, we can discuss security options for future Ember Courts.

 Quest Hand-in: I tolerate many questionable activities in the court, but murder will not be one of them.The full breadth of our Security options are available to us now.
Title: The Shadewalker

Description: Now that the demon gates have been destroyed, the power of the forest must be replenished. The Forest Heart must be retrieved!

Gaivan Shadewalker, a powerful druid of the claw, has gone southwest, past Felfire Hill, to the Dor'Danil Barrow Den. Therein rests the Forest Heart. It is protected by the druids of Ashenvale deep below the ground.

Seek out Gaivan and tell him of what has transpired, {name}.

 Quest Hand-in: You are brave to come here, <class>, but you may be too late. All of the druids are either dead or have been driven insane.Still, your tale is intriguing, and if what you say is true, then Gnarl must have the Forest Heart and soon, or Ashenvale will begin to wither!
Title: Crumbling Defenses

Description: When da attack started, we pushed out to take da field as quickly as we could. Dere forces were deep and endless... we underestimated dem. Now some of our best shaman be stranded out dere, exhausted, far from our defenses.

Make your way out and take da pressure off of our stranded brothas. Even a small break in battle be a chance to get much needed room ta breathe.

Be swift, {class}.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you, <class>. Many Earthen Ring owe dere lives to ya dis day.
Title: In Memoriam

Description: Surely Thorim has told you of the tragedy that divides us.

It was in Thunderfall, northeast of here, that these events unfolded. The frozen fossils there are a reminder of that dark day, as are the spirits that haunt that place.

If my people are to forgive Thorim, something must take the place of those images. A memorial must be constructed to bring our hearts peace.

Go there, {race}. Collect the fragments of Hodir's Horn that was shattered that day.

 Quest Hand-in: Another good deed you have done on Thorim's behalf, <class>.This will help to soften the hearts of my people towards him.
Title: Calling of the Council

Description: <The arcane anomaly addresses you in Khadgar's voice.>

Though I am loathe to interrupt your fight against the Legion, I must request your help in a matter of... diplomacy. We face a grave threat, and we require the full might of Azeroth's people to overcome it.

The Horde must become part of the Kirin Tor once again. Some will not agree with this position.

Please join me outside the Violet Citadel in Dalaran. We have repositioned the city to defend the Eastern Kingdoms, above Karazhan.

 Quest Hand-in: Jaina's reaction was unfortunate, but not unexpected. She has endured so much...Though it was Garrosh Hellscream who ordered the obliteration of Theramore, the only thing she can think of when she looks at you, or any Horde, is her desire for vengeance. I hope one day she can overcome that hatred.Enough ruminating. We must prepare the Kirin Tor for war.
Title: Grimtotem Supremacy

Description: Throughout all of Greatwood Vale you will find Grimtotem under attack by the Horde. Hellscream's armies show no mercy and no compassion, killing anything that stands in their way.

But no more! Take the armaments you brought for us and find Grimtotem in battle with the Horde. Give them the weapons of the Alliance and watch as they destroy their Horde assailants! Go, there is much work to do, ally.

 Quest Hand-in: The fight is far from over, <name>. The Horde generals still live...
Title: Missive: Assault on Lost Veil Anzu

Description: Some of our best scouts have gone missing in the vicinity of the lost ruins of Veil Anzu.

Rokhan has requested any available resources be dispatched to identify the threat and see if any of our men yet remain alive within the ruins.

 Quest Hand-in: News about da assault beat ya back, boss-mon. And some spoils of the fightin'.Ya be a force to be reckonin' with.
Title: Slightly Used Weapons

Description: This spear appears to be in good shape, given the condition of its former owner.

Guardian Velomir mentioned to keep an eye out for useful materials, perhaps a few more of these spears can be obtained from the Magmasworn.

 Quest Hand-in: Good find, <name>! These should be useful.
Title: Mission: Predator of the Cliffs

Description: During my routine patrol of the mountains this morning, I spotted a huge white bird diving down to the farmlands.

It lifted an entire yak in its talons and disappeared among the cliffs.

Today a yak, tomorrow a farmhand!

We must eliminate this bird before it chooses its next victim.

 Quest Hand-in: You did it, <name>! I feel at ease knowing the Valley safer now, because of you.
Title: Clear-Cutting

Description: We've managed to hold this hill, but the wicker creatures have moved in to surround us.   

We're not going to be able to move into the town if we don't get them off our flanks. This is where you come in, {class}.

See if you can clear out some of their numbers in the lumber fields. That way, when we move in, we only need to worry about one front.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent. It was starting to feel a bit claustrophobic on this hill.
Title: Proving in War

Description: You wish for a 'real challenge' do you? So be it. I know of some large-scale conflicts that could possibly challenge even me.

I am quite curious to see how you fail... I mean do. Let us see if you can prove yourself to me.

 Quest Hand-in: Well, then. I suppose I am forced to concede my assumptions about you and be impressed. But only a little. Here, you have earned this.
Title: Garden Variety

Description: Are you enjoying the butterfly garden?

You know, there's a much larger garden just to the south of here. An older drakonid by the name of Gryrmpech tends to it.

He could always use an extra pair of hands. He has an 'assistant', but I've never actually seen him. I can't imagine he's of much help.

If you stop by, be sure to let him know that Xina sent you.

 Quest Hand-in: Oh praise the Titans, help at last!
Title: Empty Chairs

Description: I don't want to detract from the festivities, but there's someone missing who should be here.

This is a time for all dracthyr to come together, but Rathane might not see it that way-- he was Sundered Flame, just like us. And though he left them after what happened at the Aberrus, I fear he's still grappling with the guilt. He seemed rather distressed.
