Would you go find him? And make sure he's alright, and that he knows he's welcome?

 Quest Hand-in: There is a lot of work to be done, a lot of things to be mended.<Rathane looks down at the broken horn signet in his hand.>But we can help each other.
Title: Coward Delivery... Under 30 Minutes or it's Free

Description: We're seeing more deserters show up at our gates with each passing day. We simply do not have enough room to keep all of these maggots caged up. Especially not if we want to keep the pigs happy.

<Nork snorts as he laughs.>

I want you to escort one of these cowards to the crossroads east of here and fire this flare gun. One of their captains will show up when they see the flare and take the coward off your hands.

Report to Scout Tungok on the east road once the delivery has been made.


 Quest Hand-in: Good job, <name>. That's one less filthy, useless, Alliance scum-bag that we'll have to provide for...If you're lookin' for more work, the tauren and blood elf nearby need some help.'Course we've got our own set of problems to deal with out here as well...
Title: Tablets of Fire

Description: I'm expecting the arrival of a courier traveling from Northrend. He's carrying a collection of ancient titan treasures, ones I'm hoping will shed light on my troubling visions. The shaman should've arrived on one of the recent zeppelin flights and I'm starting to get worried.

He was to meet me by the zeppelin tower southwest of Orgrimmar's gates, but I don't want to miss my audience with the warchief. Would you be willing to look for the courier and see what's delaying him?

 Quest Hand-in: Why would Twilight's Hammer take an interest in these tablets? Their contents are a mystery to our most learned scholars and deciphering them will take some time. If Twilight's Hammer knows about these relics and desires them, what more are they plotting?We are most fortunate that you protected them from capture, <name>.
Title: Victorious

Description: Once again I ask you to bring this essence to the Engine of Innovation.

 Quest Hand-in: Have you noticed that each bottle is brighter when you bring it here? It shows that you are meant to walk this path.
Title: The Crumbling Hall

Description: An ancient mogu artifact has been uncovered in the Guo-Lai Vault, beyond the Hall of Statues. We've made repeated attempts to retrieve it, but none have been successful.

We cannot let this artifact fall into the hands of the Shao-Tien. I need someone capable to retrieve it, and quickly.

Are you in?

 Quest Hand-in: When everyone else lets me down, you follow through. That's why I like you.Thank you, <name>.
Title: What's that Rattle?

Description: Did you see that glowing rattle on the ground outside of Isha's hut?

 Quest Hand-in: Interesting....
Title: Journey to Ardenweald

Description: The warning you received from the Primus needs to reach the Winter Queen of Ardenweald, {name}. The Eternal Ones must stand together against the coming darkness.

The Winter Queen oversees the cycle between Death and Life. In her forest slumber ancient spirits of nature that must be reborn.

I fear the anima drought will have taken an especially grim toll upon her realm. 

The night fae can lead you to the Queen. Bring her this message, and she will know what needs to be done.

 Quest Hand-in: We haven't seen anyone come through the gateway in a very long time! Certainly not someone like you.What brings you to Ardenweald?
Title: An Unnatural Drought

Description: The soil sample you brought me is nearly devoid of moisture, {name}. If the soil itself is losing moisture, then the creatures that live in the Dead Mire must be suffering terribly.

I've seen what happens when the region's fungal giants begin to wither and die. The pain drives them mad, causing them to attack anything in their path.

These creatures have no idea what's happening to them. They're beyond our ability to save, so the best we can do is to end their suffering.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you for helping with this difficult task, <name>. Our work in the Dead Mire is not yet done, but now our efforts will focus on doing what we can to restore balance to the area.
Title: Fly to Silvermoon City

Description: {class}, for a very modest amount of coin, I can send you swiftly flying through the air on one of these magnificent beasts.  And, it's safer than walking there, I can assure you!

When you arrive in Silvermoon City, seek out Sathren Azuredawn in the Bazaar.

Speak with me once more when you've decided you're ready to brave the skies.

 Quest Hand-in: What's this? Sathiel wants all of this!?Did you bring anyone with you to help take it back?
Title: Undersea Inflation

Description: Fine! Fine. You argued me into it. You can help.

I'm leaking air worse than a zeppelin stuffed with quilboar! My air valve must have come loose somewhere in the trench.

I brought spare air balloons - make yourself useful and go fill one up, will ya? And find my valve! I'll need that too.

I bet the crabs snatched it up... pinchy, greedy little things.

 Quest Hand-in: Ya know, I should have given you a weight belt so that you wouldn't just float away, air balloon and all. Lucky for me you came down here with armor and all! Hah!
Title: Running Rampant

Description: There is one thing that every army needs, and that is a supply line.

The enemy camp to the west contains a large beast herd, which serves as the yaungol army's main source of food.

Luckily for us, the yaks and mushan beasts of this region are easily scared.

Sneak in, give the beasts a good slap, and watch the results.

 Quest Hand-in: Ohohoho! I saw those animals trailing dust from up here.Those yaungol are probably still wondering what happened.
Title: Reconnaissance Flight

Description: It's about time we had planes up and running in this place.  The professor's been asking me to check out a strange weather pattern coming from the northeast.

Thing is, I'm going to need a co-pilot if we're going into uncharted territory.  No way in hell I'm heading out there alone.

What do you say, tough-guy?  You might learn a thing or two.  And once you learn to deal with the northern winds... you can pretty much fly anywhere.

 Quest Hand-in: You saved my life up there, buddy.  Nice flying!
Title: Powering Down the Portal

Description: Destroying the crystals will stop them temporarily, but it will be meaningless if we do not deal with the person controlling the portal itself.

I heard their overseer, Ingra, shouting orders for more power so that she could bring the stronger Legion lieutenants through the gate. We must stop her to truly seal the portal for good.

 Quest Hand-in: A portal that big will not be reopening any time soon. I would say that counts as weakening their defenses.
Title: Coaxing the Spirits

Description: Your friends back at the refugee camp are unaware of the true and imminent danger that the Twilight's Hammer cultists have already brought into the world.

For you to deal with that, we'll first need to get some help from the dead of Auberdine.

Search through the ruins of the town and find the corpses of Thundris Windweaver, Elissa Starbreeze, Taldan, and Caylais Moonfeather. Coax the spirits from their bodies and then return with them to me here.

 Quest Hand-in: So much death and pain. Can there be any doubt that there is more yet to come?All I wish to do is move onward into the Goddess's embrace as do these others.But first, let us see if we can keep even more misery and destruction from being spread.
Title: Assault on Menethil Keep

Description: We'd barely pulled ourselves together after the flood when the Dark Iron hit the town. My men and I all rushed to defend the townsfolk, but the crazed fools retreated right into the keep itself.

They're holed up good, and we can't destroy the keep. Not with half the town in ruins already.

Take my place, {name}. I'd take the leader on myself if he hadn't dealt me this blow. Enter the keep, slay Horghast, and bring this to an end!

 Quest Hand-in: He's dead! Thank the Makers...I don't like the looks of them, lad. The Dark Iron I've tussled with were never this crazy. Something's getting to these sods...
Title: Limited Supplies

Description: Hello, {name}. It's good to see a fellow alchemist again.

I've been supplying our camp with necessary potions to deal with the demons, but lately I've been running low on supplies. Normally when scouting parties go out, they return with empty vials, but as of late fewer have been returning.

I try to recycle as much as I can, so you see, those vials are precious to me. If you'd be willing to go out and retrieve them, I could show you what I've been making to help combat the demons.

 Quest Hand-in: You've found some! These will certainly be enough to get us by for a good while longer.As promised, here is a recipe for one of the potions I brew to help in our fight against the Legion.
Title: The Battle For Crusaders' Pinnacle

Description: <Highlord Fordring holds a banner of the Argent Crusade.>

This banner is like no other, {name}. It carries with it a powerful blessing, able to sanctify large tracts of blighted land.

You must take it northwest, through the Breach, to an area the Scourge have mockingly named Crusaders' Pinnacle. Plant the banner atop the skulls of our fallen brethren at Crusaders' Pinnacle and defend it against attack. Once the land is sanctified, return to Father Gustav.

Go now, {name}. Hold no fear in your heart.

 Quest Hand-in: Blessed Light! We have taken the pinnacle! Finally, construction of Justice Keep can begin. Highlord Fordring and the knights are already en route to our new base. You must meet them there, <name>!
Title: Fires and Fears of Old

Description: We've found the blades, bound them together with wood and shade, and blessed them with an ancient incantation. If I'm not mistaken, it's time to use this thing.

The sprites spoke of an ancient piece of sap within the Amber Hibernal, a mantid cave near their empress' palace. That must be the "Blood of Ancients" that the prophecy spoke of.

Whatever's inside that sap must be important. Good luck, {name}.

 Quest Hand-in: There was a... a mantid inside that amber? I never would have thought that the solution to our war on the mantid would be... another mantid.There are still many things that I have left to learn, but I do know this: that CERTAINLY wasn't a beer recipe.
Title: Academic Exploration

Description: {name}, good to see you. What do you think of my shop so far? Not too bad for just one person, huh?

By the way, High Examiner Tae'thalan has been digging around Azsuna, and asked that I send you to see him.

Knowing him, he probably thinks he's found yet another world-shatteringly powerful artifact.

 Quest Hand-in: Hello, <name>. I'm glad you came.I've found something that may serve both of our interests.
Title: Reports to Orgrimmar

Description: Eitrigg will have to be happy with the part of the report that I've finished. Tell him to expect more in the future.

<Gar'Thok hands you a stack of roughly folded papers.>

This should cover the most important details of the increase in Alliance forces working out of Northwatch. Please apologize to Eitrigg for me and let him know that we've had our hands full here, trying to keep Razor Hill secure and supplied. When you're ready to return to Orgrimmar, simply speak to Burok and hire a wind rider.

 Quest Hand-in: Ready to return to Orgrimmar with those reports? I can arrange a flight for you right away.
Title: Convention at the Legerdemain

Description: Arille Azuregaze at the Legerdemain Lounge has a convention coming in and needs a feast pronto!

You need to provide some Northern Stew and a Jug of Wine from the cheese shop "One More Glass" in central Dalaran.  The owner of the cheese shop owes me the wine and you should find it somewhere around the shop.

Bring the wine and stews to Arille.

 Quest Hand-in: This is plenty of food for everyone!  I am sure the customers will be pleased.
Title: Into The Wild Green Yonder

Description: We will do all that we can to assist you, {name}. The proto-brood have volunteered to fly you across the Breach and into Scourgeholme. Rescue any captured Argent Crusaders that you find. Return them immediately to the Vanguard Infirmary, located at the center of this base.

Choose one of the Argent Skytalons in the pen behind me and go!

Scourgeholme is located northwest, across the Valley of Echoes, through the great Breach.

 Quest Hand-in: Arthas... He strikes recklessly - without care or caution. We have caught him off guard.<Highlord Tirion Fordring pauses, lost in thought for a moment.>We will bolster our defenses and weather the storm.How good are you with a cannon, <name>?
Title: Message to Hellscream

Description: <Barthus tears out the last page and rolls it up.>

Take this to Hellscream at once! In the meantime, I'm going to send a team to scout out the farms.

Be sure to tell Hellscream that we're going to need reinforcements. 

 Quest Hand-in: <Hellscream reads the journal entry.>Is that all?
Title: Crabby Crew Stew

Description: Shouldn't you be in the mines? Look, I won't tell Morrison if you won't. I wouldn't want to be stuck in those mines, either. 

We could use a hand out here, though. The crew is getting crabby. We've been eating nothing but slop and the occasional rat for weeks. 

I hear one of the deckhands makes a marvelous crab stew. Can I count on you to secure the meat?

 Quest Hand-in: You've done good, <name>. We'll be eatin' like kings tonight!
Title: Swift Approach

Description: I've taken the liberty of performing some preliminary scouting. The naga may not be aware of our position, but they are not entirely unprepared for intruders.

Beyond their patrols, they have set up magical sentry devices that will warn them of unwelcome guests. Fortunately, they seem to have sacrificed quality for quantity, and there is definitely a window in which the devices can be destroyed before their alarms are answered.

I trust that you can see to this before our other soldiers arrive.

 Quest Hand-in: Well done, <name>, and just in time too. The Admiral just started sending more men out. Strong sword arms to be sure, but I doubt they possess quite the same awareness and finesse that you do.We were lucky to have you here when things went south. I suspect you will have a large role to play in things to come as well.
Title: Squirrely Clean

Description: The larger animals are often too far corrupted to save, but you'd be surprised how hardy the little ones are.

Take the squirrels, for example. After washing in corrupted water, they can spread illness far from the original source, but it's slow to affect the squirrels themselves. In fact, a simple washing will result in a clean squirrel and a safer forest!

Here, take this bottle of cleaning mixture. Grab and scrub any squirrel you see in the woods to the south... they'll be thankful for it!

 Quest Hand-in: Aren't they just adorable?It's those little victories that keep me going. We'll save this forest one squirrel at a time.
Title: Vereth the Cunning

Description: I've already heard some rumors regarding Malykriss and Arthas's new death knight order, but I assumed it nothing more than filling the void. These numbers suggest he's trying to take it up a notch though.

We dispatched one of our best to Malykriss not long ago - Vereth the Cunning. You should be able to find him on the Rise of Suffering, just west of Malykriss, and inside the Court of Bones.

Try not to draw too much attention on your way in.

 Quest Hand-in: The Vile Hold... a testament to how much Arthas hates losing. Let's drive the blade deep.
Title: No Bot Left Behind

Description: You left Earl-E behind, and a giant worm ate him! He's got sentimental, uh... monetary value. 

We don't leave any bots behind!

Kill that worm and get Earl-E back.

 Quest Hand-in: You saved Earl-E! I am forever grateful <race>.
Title: In The Face!

Description: The naga are using those giants to stamp paths through our minefields. Time to put that SFG to use!

Head over to the entrance to the southern minefield - I think you can figure out the rest.

 Quest Hand-in: BAM! In the face! Nice shot, kid.
Title: Tending the Forge

Description: If you're looking for an instructor, I'm sorry to say I... Ah, you're not an apprentice! My apologies. Allow me to introduce myself. 

I am Custodian Vernagos, one of the caretakers of these ruins. More specifically, the task of restoring this workspace to its former glory has fallen upon my very tired shoulders. 

Would you be able to lend a hand? All the reagents I need are nearby: ice elemental cores, embercones, hornswog leather...

Fairly standard, easily gathered stuff. What say you?

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you, <name>. The embercones will burn hot. The elemental cores will temper the heat. And this leather... is fairly disgusting. But the bellows they produce will more than suffice!Now all I need is time.
Title: Can We Keep It?

Description: He's only trying to eat us because he's so hungry! 

Fish! Nobody can turn down some tasty, ice cold, raw fish!

Frigidfish are the best, ever. You can fish them up all over the ocean! But if you can't fish one yourself, Jinkutuk in Iskaara will definitely sell you some. 

Bring me so many he won't be hungry any more!

 Quest Hand-in: Scaps is gonna love these and then we're gonna be the bestest of friends!
Title: The Lost Shield of the Aesirites

Description: If you listen real close you can hear cannon fire coming from the northeast. That's Captain Ellis's ship, Sister Mercy. Thing is, Ellis and his entire crew were killed 'bout a month ago.

<Harry nods.>

Ghost ship...

If it's info you be wantin' 'bout the shield, Ellis is the man to ask.

Sister Mercy docks on the small island between here and Sorlof's Strand to pick up more souls for the ship's crew 'bout once every five minutes. There be no shortage of souls 'round these parts...

 Quest Hand-in: Arrr, me'n'me crew pilfered that thar shield! We be tryin' to get her back from that no good, landlubbin' scallywag, Sorlof! Ye come to help, arrr?Well, as ye can see we be runnin' a skeleton crew!<Captain Ellis laughs.>Sister Mercy be needin' another powder monkey to man the big'uns o'er on the poop deck. Think ye be up to the job, me hearty?Help me crew take Sorlof down and we'll split the booty! Ye can have the shield, me'n'me crew gets the rest!
Title: In Pursuit of Power

Description: There is still one other pair of blades that could be of great use to you in the battles to come.

I can brief you on what we know if you would like to pursue them.

 Quest Hand-in: I think that is wise. We need every weapon we can gather to defeat the Legion once and for all.
Title: A Living History

Description: The Winterpelt finally trust us enough to ask for aid.

We must nurture this trust so we may one day clasp their paws in friendship!

This Winterpelt, Jyrra of the, uh, Fuzzy Feet, says their elders went into hiding during the Primalist attack on their village. I don't yet understand their language, but it seems the elders left markers to help the clan find them later.

It's time to let the Winterpelt elders know it's safe to come home. Will you convey this message? It seems a simple enough task.

 Quest Hand-in: Wait... is it true? You've come |A:furblan-d-17:0:1.00|a|A:furblan-d-26:0:1.00|a|A:furblan-d-31:0:1.00|a|A:furblan-d-18:0:1.00|a |A:furblan-d-25:0:1.00|a|A:furblan-d-25:0:1.00|a|A:furblan-d-30:0:1.00|a village? Has |A:furblan-d-29:0:1.00|a|A:furblan-d-31:0:1.00|a|A:furblan-d-33:0:1.00|a fighting stopped?
Title: Catch and Release: Islefin Dorado

Description: If we over-fish this spot there will be no fish left for anyone. Sustainability is key.

Bring me any fish you want to return to the pools.

 Quest Hand-in: I will return these to the pools. Managing the fisheries is an important responsibility.
Title: The Demon's Trail

Description: Malfurion is nearby. I can sense him..

Search the summit of Andu'talah while I continue to scour the forest.

Be swift, {name}. Time is of the essence!

 Quest Hand-in: My husband, Malfurion, what has become of him?!Answer me!
Title: Necrolord Veteran

Description: The might of the Necrolords grows thanks to you, {name}.

Your accomplishments have not gone unnoticed, even beyond the borders of Maldraxxus.

Tales of your victories have echoed through the halls of Oribos. Zo'sorg, the Master of Conflict, has requested a meeting with you in the Enclave.

They have a keen interest in the art of war. I suggest you don't keep them waiting.

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, <name>. I have heard many stories of your prowess on the battlefield. I have interest in keeping great combatants like yourself well equipped. Zo'dash is authorized to further upgrade your armor and weapons.
Title: Time for Slime

Description: It takes a special sort of fisherman to reap the bounty of Undercity's burbling slime troughs. Think you can handle gathering some of the squirming, sentient slime mold slithering about down there?

You can try to fish them up, but they're wily; you might be better off just diving into the ooze and grabbing them.

Remember, they're only useful alive and intact... who'd want to eat a dead slime mold?! Disgusting.

 Quest Hand-in: These slimes look perfect.  I will send these along to Eunice for preparation, thank you.
Title: In the Shadow of Crimson Wings

Description: It is unlike Alexstrasza to remain out of contact for so long, particularly when the very essences of the dragonflights' power are being made manifest. 

While our allies here tend to the injured, we must seek out the Life-Binder at once.

When you are ready, we shall ride to the Vermillion Redoubt together.

 Quest Hand-in: We owe you a great deal of gratitude. You have the support of the red dragonflight in your efforts to save Azeroth.
Title: The Cursed Remains

Description: There are remaining beings here that pose a direct threat to us ever reclaiming this sacred city. Magister Kalendris and Illyana Ravenoak are both extremely dangerous and need to be disposed of as quickly as possible.

Exercise caution, for with there being so few remaining feeding off of Immol'thar's energies, they are likely to be stronger than they first appear.

 Quest Hand-in: Your dedication will make this all that much easier.
Title: Breaking the Line

Description: Vol'jin be callin' for an all out attack on da naga that have taken over our northern isle. Many of our men were already engaged with their forces near da bridge, but several of us are breakin' through their lines ta assault their isle itself.

Speak to Jornun right 'ere to secure a ride to da isle. Once there, seek out Morakki, da Captain of da Watch. He will be tellin' ya how ya can aid in da battle.

 Quest Hand-in: Good to have ya, brotha.Vol'jin makes us all proud in dese moments. It feels good ta be tacklin' threats head on.
Title: Construct Part: Indomitable Hide

Description: <This could be used to construct a powerful abomination. Perhaps Rathan will know how we can use it.>

 Quest Hand-in: This ingredient can help construct a very powerful abomination. You should save it incase we find a use for it.
Title: Ancient Mana

Description: Without the Nightwell to feed upon, my comrades and I will have to live off the land itself.

Ancient mana from the underground leylines can reach the surface in many forms, most commonly as crystals or gems.

<Thalyssra picks up a small stone and, whispering words of power, traces a rune upon it with her fingertip.>

This stone will glow when ancient mana is nearby. Please gather as much as possible! It will be a precious resource in the weeks to come.

 Quest Hand-in: Keep a lookout for those crystal formations all over Suramar. We will need them.
Title: Priorities!

Description: Those "orc" things ransacked the brewery and made off with my family's finest barrels of cider.

I know there is a war out there, but I am not a brewer who will stand idly by while his prized vintage is chugged by undeserving lips.

The "Horde" will likely put up some resistance. Why don't you put that weapon to good use and help me recover my cider?

 Quest Hand-in: I see that you two have been busy. Thank you for recovering our kegs.
Title: Unlocking Our Past

Description: Bring me an assembled Key

 Quest Hand-in: A wise choice. All these squabbles over the throne will not solidify our defenses. We must craft weapons and gear to fend off the djaradin.
Title: "Let the Fires Come!"

Description: The Headless Horseman will attack the village at any moment!  Fires will be everywhere!

{name}, will you face the fires of the Headless Horseman?  When he comes, you must join the fire brigade.  Grab a bucket and toss it on the fires, or pass it to a friend who's closer to the blaze.  If you put out all the fires then we may yet be saved!

 Quest Hand-in: The fires are out!  You and your fire brigade were victorious!  Hah!The Headless Horseman's attack has failed, but until he and his head are destroyed together, he will return.Until then, however, let's take comfort in the safety you brought our children.  I am honored to have watched your brave work today.
Title: An Embarrassment of Corpses

Description: Look around us, {name}. Everywhere you turn there are corpses piling up like mountains. These disembodied souls are desperate to return to battle.

We will use their fervor to turn the tide.

Rally the disembodied souls around the battlefield and bring them to my stitchers at the corpse piles to build them new bodies!

 Quest Hand-in: The work of a Maldraxxian soldier is never complete!
Title: Crate of Crab Meat

Description: This crate, labeled 'Crab Meat', seems to have fallen from a recently sunken cargo ship.

Adarrah would surely welcome such a find, considering the ordeal she's had to endure.

 Quest Hand-in: Why, <name>! What a surprise!If anyone ever calls your character into question you be sure to send them my way.I'll tell anyone who'll listen that in my moment of need, you gave me a case of crabs...
Title: Akunda Awaits

Description: I've spoken to every troll out here, asking if they've seen Rakera. As you might have guessed, Akunda is de only name dey know. 

Let's hope someone within de temple will be able to tell us something useful.

 Quest Hand-in: Dis is Rakera. I have no doubt. But for some reason, she does not remember me... or herself, it would seem...
Title: Aces High!

Description: Again we meet, {race}. I confess, your presence is beginning to grow on me.

Am I correct in assuming that you've come to hone your aerial combat skills?

As always, my pets stand ready to bring fiery destruction to the enemy.

Speak, and they shall be at your disposal.

 Quest Hand-in: I noticed some improvement today, <class>. At moments, it was as if you were one with the drake.You are welcome to practice with my precious pets at your leisure.
Title: A Way Out

Description: My spies report that our High Overlord did not leave the way he entered, nor any other way we know of. No signs of him were seen at any of the known exits from the Stockades or the sewers. He simply was in his cell one moment, and gone the next.

Begin your investigation around the city of Stormwind. There must be another way out that we do not know of.

Dark Ranger Lyana will meet you there. Her tracking skills are second to none.

Do not fail me, my champion.

 Quest Hand-in: There is no time to waste. Let us begin our investigation.
Title: Death's Challenge

Description: Born of the Lich King's victory over Illidan Stormrage in the heart of the frozen wastes, Death's Challenge is a rite of passage that all death knights must undergo.

Seek out other death knights of Acherus and challenge them to a duel. They must accept and fight until a victor emerges!

Go now, {name}! Victory for the Scourge! Glory to the Lich King!


 Quest Hand-in: To the victor goes the glory, <class>! Well done! The Lich King looks favorably upon you on this day.
Title: Empty Stables

Description: The war in the valley has taken its toll on our soldiers. We must revitalize our forces!

If we can fill up the stables, the Wolf Riders will once more be able to ride out into the field of battle.

Take this muzzle and track down the frostwolves that inhabit the nearby forest. Once you find a wolf, use the muzzle to tame the beast. Bring the tamed beast back to me so that I may place it in the stable.

When we have enough wolves stabled, the Wolf Riders will rejoin their patrol on our front lines.

 Quest Hand-in: I can only hope that those charged with collecting ram hides are as determined as you, <name>.At this rate, we will have the stables full in a matter of hours!
Title: Assault on Violet Hold: Cheating Death

Description: Hobart was showing me a copy of a design you found, and it got me to thinking of a new module for Reaves.

Unfortunately I didn't have the materials required to test it.

Could you make me a couple Failure Detection Pylons?

I'll also need a plasmatic laser bolt. You should be able to find one in the Violet Hold.

 Quest Hand-in: <Didi takes the pylons and begins tinkering with them and starts writing some notes.>Yea, that should do the trick!One new and improved Reaves module schematic for you, <name>.
Title: Understanding the Scourge War Machine

Description: We must take solace in the fact that Slinkin's death, while tragic, was for the greater good. His discovery coupled with your heroics in the mine and the samples you returned brings us one step closer to understanding the Scourge war machine.

Take this package to High Commander Halford Wyrmbane. It holds a sample of the strange ore and my analysis.

 Quest Hand-in: <Halford opens the package and reads the analysis.>I am by no means a scientist, <name>, so you'll have to forgive my plebian understanding of what has been written. Now, according to this analysis - assuming I have the brain power of at least an adolescent school boy - we still don't know jack squat about the Scourge war machine. The only thing we do know is that the Scourge uses this foul metal to craft its siege engines, armor and weaponry.
Title: Fading Embers

Description: This is a difficult situation, my friend. Wounds and insecurities cannot be easily dismissed. Only time--and cooperation--can soothe the sting born of longstanding rivalries.

But there are more urgent matters to address. If there is a large force of drakonids still loyal to the memory of Neltharion, this land is much more dangerous than any of us expected.

Emberthal still pursues Sarkareth--alone. She must be made aware of the threats that surround her. We must find her and give her aid.

 Quest Hand-in: Sarkareth may try to hide behind the might of Aberrus but to no avail.
Title: A Rocky Start

Description: <As you thumb through the book, you see odd-looking runes carved out of jewels embedded in the stone pages. Seshuli notices you looking and approaches you.>

Ah, dat's been a treasure of mine for many years. Beautiful, isn't it? No clue what it says, but I've always reveled at de thought of something being written in jewels.

Come to think of it, I wonder if Grazzul would know what it says. {name}, would you mind taking it over to him and see if he can translate it?

 Quest Hand-in: What do you need?<You hand the book over to Grazzul and ask for it to be translated. As he turns each page, wondrous expressions cross the scribe's face.>I've only heard of such books in existence but I've never seen one before. Do you know what dis is?Dis is ancient earthen. And dis book is centuries old!Of course I'll help to translate it, only... well... my ancient earthen isn't so great. I'll need some things to do dis.
Title: Create Your Own Strength

Description: That Benthic armor you carry has been lost beneath the tides for too long.

There is still power within it.

Voidbinder Sturzah may be able to provide insight.

Take your find to our intrepid ethereal friend, and see what he can do with it.

 Quest Hand-in: There is bond formed between the ocean and what comes to rest beneath its waves.The glowing man will be able to use the Prismatic Manapearls to improve the Benthic items.This will prove most beneficial.
Title: Vanquishing the Darkness

Description: The darkness grows. The cycle continues.

Do what you can to stay N'Zoth's efforts. If we do not stand against the corruption we may some day find ourselves drowning in darkness.

 Quest Hand-in: Your dedication to stemming the corruption remains invaluable, <name>.
Title: Return to Honor Hold

Description: {name}, while you were on your mission in Zeth'Gor, I received news of my commanding officer, Colonel Jules.  He was stricken with a demonic corruption while fighting near the Gor'gaz Outpost, and his situation has grown very bad.

You have made such great gains for us against the fel orcs.  Your strength in battle is without question... is your spirit just as strong?

Please, return to Honor Hold and speak with Klatu, in an upper room at the Honor Hold inn.

 Quest Hand-in: Yes, it is true.  Colonel Jules' situation has grown much worse these past days.  Anchorite Barada is busy praying for him... let us hope he may be cured.
Title: Underworld Loam

Description: The frame that you brought me earlier will not be sufficient to hold molten metal without reinforcement. A rare kind of earth can be used to cool and imbue the frame, giving the adamantite an unnatural strength.

Underworld loam, as the earth is known, is accorded great value among the naga. Few enough of them possess it, and in Outland, I know of only one naga who uses it -- Hydromancer Thespia, who resides in the Steamvault of Coilfang Reservoir.

 Quest Hand-in: This should do the trick. I'd hoped for a bit more, but to be honest, we were lucky to get our hands on any at all out here.
Title: Word from the Deep

Description: A dark soul has infiltrated the Zanchuli Council, seeking an accord with Queen Azshara.

Some followed, through greed or fear. Others were too trusting and believed his lies.

We fall, one by one. They will soon clear the path of resistance.

Azshara's motives are hidden behind a vast darkness. She reaches into a place from where she cannot return.

I would pity her, but she killed my followers...

When the time comes, I will rip her apart.

 Quest Hand-in: It seems the naga have moved up in threat level from "mere nuisance". These are dark days indeed.
Title: A Chief of Legends

Description: The gorlocs of this swamp were once simple creatures. Pests, perhaps, but never raiders, thieves, or dog-eaters.

It is their chief, Grrlgllmesh, who has led them away from their nature.

Put an end to him, and the gorlocs will threaten us no more.

 Quest Hand-in: With their chieftain slain, the gorlocs will no longer bother us. I am astounded by how strong they became under Chief Grrlgllmesh. I have never seen such primitive creatures rise up against a mighty civilization like ours before. Are we not so different? So much further evolved? I suppose not...
Title: Offer of Freedom

Description: Just as I was, some of the Briarbane venthyr you encounter will have been compelled to serve Matyas. They likely will not want to fight you, but will have no choice. Once they are injured, they may be willing to pause to see if one of the sinstones you recovered earlier is theirs.

Free those you can. The use of a sinstone to compel others isn't fair.

 Quest Hand-in: You've made some friends today.
Title: Poached, Scrambled, Or Raw?

Description: The venomhide hatchling's stomach growls as it gestures to get your attention. It begins scratching pictures of silithids into the dirt, adding small ovals underneath them. It looks at you hopefully and gestures at the circles.

They can only mean silithid eggs. The Noxious Lair, in western Tanaris and near the border with Un'Goro Crater, would probably be a great place to find the eggs your little hatchling wants.

 Quest Hand-in: Your hatchling licks its lips after devouring the meal of silithid eggs. For a moment, you think it seems disappointed that feeding time has come to an end.
Title: Burn Before Reading

Description: The scroll you recovered details all manner of horrific ways to 'integrate' fallen kyrian into Gharmal's constructs.

It is also incomplete. There must be more of these among Stitchflesh's remaining followers.

I saw a number of surgeons and their lackeys retreat into the Hall of Chains just ahead as we arrived. I suspect they hold more of these scrolls.

We must ensure they are never read again.

 Quest Hand-in: Well done. I will see that these are destroyed personally.
Title: Mawsworn Shackles

Description: <The shackles are part tangible, part ethereal. They scream into your mind when held. 

Just the sort of thing Ve'nari might be looking for.>

 Quest Hand-in: <Ve'nari snatches the shackles from your hands.>Rather dangerous for a mortal such as yourself to be carrying these around.<Ve'nari lifts and lowers the shackles slowly, as if to determine the weight.>Though I must admit... these could prove useful.
Title: Saving the Guard

Description: The Moon Guard were once among the most powerful sorcerers on Azeroth. Most assumed their ranks demolished after the War of the Ancients, but it seems they have managed to survive in their ancient stronghold in Suramar!

I believe they could be valuable allies in our quest if they still oppose the Legion.

{name}, if you can save what remains of the Guard, I will work to convince the Council of Six to lend us additional aid.

 Quest Hand-in: It seems we have gained new allies. Let us figure out a plan of action.
Title: Lions for Lambs

Description: The invading orcs aren't fools. They are sizing us up, making sure that when they attack it will be to their advantage.

In the forest, to the northwest, are Blackrock spies. They peer at us through spyglasses, watching our every move - waiting. I want you take the fight to them!

Kill the Blackrock spies! We must show them that we know they are watching us and that we are prepared!

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent work, <name>. You've turned out to be quite an asset to this garrison. It's time for you to train!
Title: Demons Among Us

Description: Look around. What do you see?

<Allari glares at something over your shoulder.>

The Legion has already infiltrated the Horde... even now, they are among you.

We must protect your Warchief.

When you are ready to see what lies beneath the veil, say the word.

 Quest Hand-in: It would seem the demon hunters' concerns were well-founded. To think the demons would dare worm their way into our city during this period of mourning!This does not bode well for the rest of my kingdom.
Title: Fresh Legs

Description: It's come at great cost, but we've completed our inspection of the site.

The news isn't good. Nearly everyone has been slain or captured. Only a few veteran guards remain unaccounted for.

The scouts have done all we can here. You must pick up where we've left off.

Sounds of a skirmish are coming from up the hill to the northeast. Have a look, {class}. We can only hope there are some who have survived, and that they may have some intel we can use against this enemy.

 Quest Hand-in: Late though ye may be, it's good to see a friendly face.Now stop standin' around with yer thumb up yer nose. there's work to be done!
Title: Glomp is Sitting On It

Description: What? Leave it to Dizzywig to expect a mutiny on the cheap.

No matter, mon, we can make this work. First we need the money. Cap'n Garvey likes to hoard the loot we've been earnin', money I can use to pay off my handpicked mutineers.

The treasure pile is just outside the barracks here. You'll need to take care of Cap'n Garvey's "treasurer" first. Now, Glomp ain't no pushover. Believe me, I tried pushing him over once. He don't budge for nothin'.

 Quest Hand-in: Look at that. We're loaded! In mutiny, you gotta make the money first. Then when you get the money, you get the power. Let's go get some power, <name>...
Title: Lone Wolf

Description: My eyes and ears fly across Azeroth, bringing me back news of many things. My ally Goldrinn took to the barrows of Moonglade in mourning upon the death of Varian Wrynn. He has been untouched in the dream... until now.

Demons have been seen invading the very same barrows, killing many more of our mortal druids in the process. You must go. Save Goldrinn, avenge our people! Take my hatchling Thisalee with you. Her tenacity and bloodlust is welcome in my clutch. You shall have my aid.

 Quest Hand-in: If Goldrinn is in the Dream, he's defenseless! We've got to help!
Title: The Valiant's Charge

Description: In your training as a valiant, you'll have the chance to test your skills against valiants representing other cities. Although a valiant's battles are not a formal part of the competition, you will learn valuable lessons about the fighting styles and weaknesses of your opponents.

The valiants are a spirited lot, competing amongst themselves for honor and notoriety.

Train as a valiant until you are confident of your ability to best all who face you, then bring me the seals you have earned.

 Quest Hand-in: Impressive, valiant. I will make the arrangements for your test immediately.
Title: Cut Off the Heads

Description: Okay. We're stuck in the middle of three mogu armies, and Uncle Chen is too hurt to move yet.

It's not hopeless though. We have the chance to take out the leaders of these armies. Maybe that will slow them down or distract them long enough for us to get back to the gate!

See if you can get out there and take down the biggest, baddest mogu you can find. Those will be the commanders.

 Quest Hand-in: Good job. The mogu are not as strong without their leaders.
Title: An Urgent Request

Description: Champion,

A matter of great urgency has arisen--one that requires your immediate attention.

Due to the sensitive nature of recent events, I must withhold further details until we can speak in person.

There is much to discuss. Regent Lord Lor'themar Theron awaits your arrival in Orgrimmar.

 Quest Hand-in: It has been some time since I last stood here, staring into the distance...How could this have happened?I'm afraid I have difficult news to share with you, <name>.
Title: Momentum

Description: We can't just rest on our laurels here, babe. We've got to keep this momentum going! People are talking about us.

Unfortunately, they're also talking about this air-headed gnome, Kelsey, who's apparently been running jobs right alongside us. If we're going to drive her out of what's rightfully a goblin town, we need to seal the deal here.

We're going to take care of Gadgetzan's pirate problem for them, for good. Head south to Lost Rigger Cove, I'll meet you there.

 Quest Hand-in: Good thing you're here! I'm gonna need a lot of help if we want to beat these gnomes to the punch.
Title: Forgotten Memories

Description: Have we met before? I'm sorry... but I don't remember your name.

My name is... Arylina... I think. My memory has been so foggy since the great explosion happened that sent us underwater.

Oh! But look! I can see the sun and the stars again... I wonder what happened?

I used to keep a diary, but I can't find it anywhere. If I just had my diary back, I'm sure I could remember more.

Will you help me find it?

 Quest Hand-in: Oh... I remember now. This all happened so long ago. I think it's time for me to rest...
Title: Bounty: A Few Fathom Rays

Description: The fathom ray population is eating all of the coral buds to the east. If we do not cull their numbers, we may have an environmental catastrophe on our hands.

Once you have finished, report to the quartermaster to claim your reward.

 Quest Hand-in: This will ease our efforts in Nazjatar.
Title: Breaking Down the Defenses

Description: We need to keep a close watch on the Kirin Tor and their day-to-day activities. Normally this would be easy. We would sneak in a spy and have them report back to us.

However, we've run into a slight problem I believe you can help us with.

The Kirin Tor perimeter wards have increased in power. It's next to impossible to get someone past their lines. If they were disabled we might be able to sneak in before they can be repaired.

 Quest Hand-in: Good work, <class>. With your help we were able to successfully sneak several spies behind enemy lines.
Title: The Displaced Paleblade

Description: <He looks down at the dead saurok at his feet, looks up at you, then points out down the lake shore. It seems he wants you to find and kill more of these saurok.>

 Quest Hand-in: <He smiles at you and nods his thanks.>
Title: Tol Dagor: Jewel of the Tides

Description: <An absence you assume to be a mistake, you quickly survey the area for something that might fit there yet you find nothing.

However, there appears to be a drunk here shouting at the shrine. Perhaps he might know the whereabouts of the shrine's missing piece.>

 Quest Hand-in: <As you affix the gem back into the center of the shrine, a strange pulse emanates from it.The shrine, now whole again, begins to hum with energy.>
Title: Face to Face With Consequence

Description: I do not know the history of this war that you fight, and I am not interested. This land responds to negative energy in kind. The hatreds, doubt, and violence you have brought here now ooze out of Pandaria like blood from an open wound.

Your actions have wrought havoc all over these ruins! Clean up after yourself and meet me in the village below - I will do my best to explain what is happening here.

 Quest Hand-in: I am glad you took responsibility for your actions. Left unchecked, negative emotions can quickly overwhelm an individual here, just as they started to overwhelm the one you call "Nazgrim."
Title: Snapper Soul

Description: <The Snapper Soul is determined. The shape of the dragon turtle will be yours to call upon.>

 Quest Hand-in: Ah. The essence of the dragon turtle! A fine shape. It is now yours, should you choose to use it.
Title: Infiltrating Our Enemies

Description: With the Light at our side, we should focus our efforts on figuring out who among our enemies could be a potential ally.

Any of your champions should be capable of infiltrating enemy ranks, giving us a better understanding of how to approach this.

Even so, it is a delicate task. Proceed with caution.

 Quest Hand-in: Your efforts have provided us with the information we need to move forward.It's been discovered that there are a few defectors among the Scarlet Onslaught.
Title: One Small Step for Magic

Description: It is time to embrace the future.

I have mastered every magic known to our kind. I will master this one.

By applying the principles of arcane magic it is fairly trivial to control the primitive fel energies within the material you have given me. I need to move to live prey next.

Let us start with a small summoning. Defeat the creature for me and watch how a true scholar works!

 Quest Hand-in: Yes...This power is... different. Brutal, blunt, powerful.I can control it. I can master it!
Title: The Sleeper Agent

Description: Your work here is done, {name}. Morton and Megs can take it from here. 

Head back to Boralus and let Halford know we've secured the weapon. 

Don't you worry one wink about Grong. Morton and Megs will make sure he's well looked after.

 Quest Hand-in: Are you certain about this? Our secret weapon is a gorilla? I suppose I'll just have to trust that the gnomes know what they're doing. Thank you for your report, <name>.
Title: Glory to the Horde

Description: This is a global war, {name}. It has spilled onto Pandaria, and it has set hot spots across Kalimdor and the Eastern Kingdoms ablaze. How will you fare on an organized battlefront? I would like to see for myself.

I look forward to hearing your report from the front lines.

 Quest Hand-in: <Wrathion hungrily listens to tales of your exploits on the battlefield, his eyes gleaming bright red.>Ohh... oh! Incredible! In the very eye of battle, one's true heart is revealed.You do not disappoint, <name>.Neither does this Horde of yours.
Title: Rivenwood Captives

Description: Something, most likely the walking dead known as the Scourge, has agitated the creatures hereabouts.

While escorting the sage here, we lost most of our hunting force to the riven widows -- huge and deadly spiders, which inhabit the Rivenwood to the north.

I must stay here to protect the small force we have left, but you... you could see if my longrunners are still alive, trapped within the riven widow's cocoons.

Would you do this, stranger?

 Quest Hand-in: That was a very brave act, <class>. I did not know that your people were capable of such selflessness.Next time I will heed the warnings of my elders and steer clear of the Rivenwood. I advise you to do the same.
Title: The Darkmist Legacy

Description: I am chained to this place...it takes so much effort just to speak to you. I can barely maintain this shape.

I could help you, but please, help me pull myself together first. Once I'm more focused on this plane, I should be able to do it...

If I could just leave this tomb, the soil itself outside is full of ancient arcane deposits, laying forgotten for centuries. Could you bring me some?

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you! Thank you...I feel much better. With just a bit more...
Title: The Light of Elune

Description: My sisters lie slain on the soft earth of Ashenvale.

We are trained to expect losses. Soldiers die in battle. But this... this was a despicable attack, even for the Horde.

We have little time to grieve, but we are not savages like our enemy.

Please, {name}. Help me say a prayer to Elune in honor of the fallen. Their wisps deserve the light of her blessing.

 Quest Hand-in: Elune bless you, <name>.
Title: Return of the Lich Hunter

Description: Okay, I going back to Frenzyheart Hill to make sure all Frenzyheart know what you done for wolvar and for Zepik. You great hunter and they dumb to think you not.

Go back to hill and talk to Elder Harkek... I make sure he knows you not traitor before any other Frenzyheart.

Thank you, Lich Hunter.

 Quest Hand-in: It good to see you again. I knew you not a traitor, I glad Zepik prove me right.I hear you Lich Hunter now - that pretty good! You make Harkek proud.
Title: Cindermaul, the Portal Master

Description: Twilight's Hammer is using these corridors, and others like them, to move supplies from the elemental planes up into Azeroth. In order to seal these passages off, we're going to need to know how they're constructed.

Find for me the Tome of Openings, used by the elementals to open gates between the planes.

Cindermaul the Portal Master should have one. You'll have to kill him. Careful! He's probably got some tricks up his sleeve...

 Quest Hand-in: This is the tome we've heard about?<Jordan hefts the stone slab into his arms and looks it over.>I see... I guess it's good that I can read some of the elemental script. I'll work on translating this. Meanwhile, there's one final problem to take care of.
Title: Spill Their Blood

Description: The Scourge cannot create their flesh monsters without blood and embalming fluid to preserve the parts and keep them functioning. If we can deny them these materials, their army will fall apart and we can easily destroy their creations.

Throughout the labs where the flesh giants and abominations are cobbled together, you will find vats of embalming fluid and large orbs filled with blood. Destroy these, and bring death to any who would stop you!

 Quest Hand-in: <A dark, hollow laugh greets you as you report to the darkrider.>You reek of victory, <name>, and that is good news, indeed.
Title: Strings and Things

Description: Glimmerflies are creatures of anima. Though they look delicate, they are quite strong!

Filaments from etherwym tails are sturdy. They should help hold onto glimmerflies. 

Collect for me!

 Quest Hand-in: <Kowalskos pulls on the filaments with all his might>See? Very strong!
Title: She's Got it Where it Counts

Description: Word is you're looking to drum up support for Loosecannon. Well I'll buy in if you help me. They took my poor Miranda! 

Boss Tornsail says I had too much to drink and bet her in cards. I don't really remember what happened last night, but I can hold my liquor and I'd never bet my bird! I suspect funny business. She might not look like much, but Miranda's the fastest damn falcon you'll ever see.

They're watching me, so you go free her. She'll fly someplace safe and I'll get her later. We got a deal?

 Quest Hand-in: Ha! Did you see her fly out of there? Like the wind!Thank you, <name>. You and Cesi can count on my support.
Title: Neeka Bloodscar

Description: There is much work to do in recovering from the assault and bracing ourselves for the next one. I will need coordination from all of our scouts.

Neeka Bloodscar is our finest tracker, trained in the harsh Badlands. She has been sent west to Splinterspear Junction to watch for Alliance activity.

Go to Neeka, {name}. Tell her of what has occured in Stonard. Assist her in any way she requires.

 Quest Hand-in: I hope the sight of my sniveling amuses you, <name>. It will be the only joy here.
Title: My Own Death Pony!

Description: That is such a beautiful death pony, ever since I saw my first one I have dreamed of ...

 Quest Hand-in: <Your butler is nearly in tears.>I get my own death pony to ride? You are the best mortal I have ever met!
Title: Ancient Armaments

Description: Fighting a war on several fronts has taken its toll on our supplies. Our blacksmiths cannot repair and replace our soldiers' armor quickly enough, which is leaving us ill-equipped to face so many foes.

Though the Amathet's armor is ancient, it is titan-forged and formidable. If we were able to salvage any, it could prove very useful to our defensive efforts.

Can you help?

 Quest Hand-in: Thank the Light you've returned! Our soldiers need this armor badly. Your efforts will safeguard the lives of many in Ramkahen, <class>.
Title: The Shadow Wardens

Description: The Shadow Wardens are back in the Regrowth. I know that they take the loss of Fandral from their custody very seriously, so it wouldn't take much prodding to bring them to the Firelands to hunt the Druids of the Flame, and perhaps aid us otherwise in the process.

Should you come upon enough marks, you should seek out Captain Saynna Stormrunner at the Sanctuary of Malorne and secure her aid.

 Quest Hand-in: I see. It is time for us to join the hunt in the Firelands then. My sisters will be with you, <class>.
Title: Do a Barrel Roll!

Description: When I trained as a Brewmaster, I didn't expect to use my knowledge like this...

Did you know beer catches fire when lit? Well, with yaungol oil mixed in, it's downright explosive.

I've mixed the oil in with these kegs. Roll them at the yaungol over by the gate, and ignite them when you get close. 

It'll take a few seconds for the keg to blow, but when it does...

Well, let's just say I wouldn't want to be over there.

Which is why I'll be over here. Mourning the loss of this brew.

 Quest Hand-in: Whoo, that was an explosion! Several, in fact.Sad my beer had to go, but at least we're safe, for now.
Title: Home Sweet Dirt

Description: Green dragons prefer a home that is both natural and mystical, imbued with the power of the Emerald Dream.

The Emerald Gardens will certainly have many materials with which to build an appropriate nest for this little one. Perhaps we should speak to a member of their flight to find something to bring them comfort as well.

 Quest Hand-in: May this whelp grow roots strong and firm.Not literally, of course.
Title: Hunting Zul

Description: Zul is pulling all of his forces back to his stronghold at the Temple of the Prophet.

Rastakhan has sent word that he is marshalling an army in the Zocalo with anyone still loyal that can carry a weapon. Looks like the old king had more loyalists than Zul expected.

That, and he has three of their eldest loa gathered to his side.

Go and lend your strength to their army.

 Quest Hand-in: When hunting one who has foreseen de future, it is best to proceed with a measure of caution.
Title: Feline Frantic

Description: Greetings, stranger.

<Mayruna bows to you.>

We arrived from Val'Sharah a short time ago with hopes of settling here. Our journey was not easy and we are weary.

These owlcats have made a mess of our camp, as you can surely see. Would you be so kind as to assist us with cleaning up?

Then perhaps you can help us establish a new moonwell!

 Quest Hand-in: All is in its proper place. We are that much closer to being settled.
Title: Drunk Angry Murlocs

Description: Those no-good Bloodfins ran off with all of the beer!

I've been experimenting with brews that only use ingredients native to Nazjatar, but it's still a work in progress. For now, I must rely on whatever I can scrounge up from the shipwreck.

My supply of beer was already limited, but now it's all gone thanks to those thieving Bloodfin murlocs! We're going to have some very angry customers here if we don't get it back.

Please recover the stolen lager from Bloodfin Village before it's too late!

 Quest Hand-in: Good work, <name>! You've recovered pretty much all of the stolen beer. Those Bloodfins are more trouble than they're worth!
Title: The Final Relics

Description: I have excellent news, {name}. I have uncovered the last set of our missing relics! 

It may be difficult for you to locate them, but I have developed the proper research to aid you.

Please, review the last of our missing relics. We are so close to finding them all!

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you for your continued aid. The reliquary will be restored, thanks to your diligent work.
Title: Old Friends

Description: Alright then, grab onto the ladder. We gotta get outa here!

We'll make a flyby of the town, and then I'm gonna get you to some old friends!

 Quest Hand-in: I told you we would meet again, <name>.Unfortunate that it's under such dire circumstances.
Title: Bug Off!

Description: This cave is crawlin' with nasty shale spiders! How's a girl supposed to get any work done with them gobbling up the miners AND the ore?!

This seemed like a good opportunity to use my newest invention, Bug Off. See, all you have to do is spray this stuff all over the shale spiders. They hate it and it doesn't seem to have many long term side-effects for the miners!

What could possibly go wrong?

Take this handy sprayer and get to work!

 Quest Hand-in: Now that's what I like to hear! I bet those spiders will think twice before messing with a Bilgewater operation again!
Title: A Fallen Friend

Description: A bracelet delicately woven with living vines falls from Vivanna's wrist as she is slain. In the vines is written, 

"Until Winter's end.

-Flwngyrr"

 Quest Hand-in: <They take the bracelet from your hand. A minute passes before they speak again.>Her favorite was Azurebloom Tea.Thank you for bringing this to me.
Title: Reconstructing "Fear and Flesh"

Description: Another tome written by one lost to N'Zoth's madness. I dread to think of what vile words await us within it.

But if we are to strengthen your cloak, then we must know more of that which it was meant to resist. See if you can find the remaining pages so that we can complete this tome and make use of the knowledge it holds.

 Quest Hand-in: Perseverance in the face of darkness.Our work continues...
Title: Under the Crooked Tree

Description: My three sisters from that tree hung,
The crimes accused there was not one,
The youngest sister did escape,
As the noose looped around their nape,
Old Ravencrest is the one to blame,
This curse for you to lift our shame.

 Quest Hand-in: My dear sister laid to rest,A tortured hero proves their best,Today I do lift this curse,And offer you a token, a small purse,My other sisters are still gone,There comes a day to right their wrong...
Title: Breaking the Hopebreakers

Description: The Fearstalker has surely sent her hunters across the entirety of the Banewood in search of us, {name}. 

Draven informed me that some of her top hunters are scouring Dredhollow as we speak. We can use this to our advantage. Slaying them should get her attention.

<The Accuser hands you a collection of bright red vials.>

Throw these on her hunters. It should draw the attention of the devourers infesting this place.

 Quest Hand-in: Sounds like it worked better than expected. Perfect. The Fearstalker stands no chance.
Title: Primordial Answers

Description: Revelations await us within this vault. Perhaps we'll find a way to protect ourselves against Primalist magic. The elementals hiding in these vaults are wild, ancient, and free of Primalist control. Perhaps they hold the secret to helping the elementals on the surface.

I have an idea. We'll need four primordial cores. Then we can construct a talisman that can purify and remove the influence of Primalist control from the elementals outside.

If you help us, I will share what we have found here.

 Quest Hand-in: These primordial cores are all I need here. Please let me share with you the things I have found. May they help you in your efforts.
Title: The Fearmaster

Description: I am not gonna take this anymore. My wife, bless her, poured her heart and soul in to that ranch making it what it is today.

Them yaungol got a leader over there being all smug and what not. I'll pay you handsomely if you knock that smug smile off his filthy, stinking, good for nothing face.

 Quest Hand-in: Yee haw! I knew you humans might be good for somethin'. He must of made a very satisfying "thump" when he hit the ground.
Title: Vile Touch

Description: If these spiders are born with corruption in their veins, then their broodmother must be at the root of this evil.

Let us make our way to the far north end of the cave and seek out Githyiss the Vile. The answers we seek lie with her.

 Quest Hand-in: Githyiss and her brood were being corrupted by this totem. This is a furbolg totem.This is very troubling indeed. This means the Gnarlpine are still a danger to these forests. We let our guard down too soon.
Title: Those Aren't Masks

Description: {name}, there are demon squids out there that are eating gilblins' heads and then taking them over! They better not come in here!

Think you could swim out northwest onto Deepfin Ridge or into the Sira'kess Front and bring me back some of those Merciless things? Preferably dead, I think.

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, they're ugly, but they mostly look harmless. Mostly. They're almost cute in a way.Here, let me clean the gilblin stuff out of these. I've got an idea....
Title: Arcane Cache

Description: <The heavily reinforced chest is of naga construction and appears to be reinforced with a magical lock of some kind.

Magical reinforcement aside, the cache still requires a key to unlock.

The key is most likely being held by one of the nearby naga soldiers.>

 Quest Hand-in: <The magical barrier dissipates as you insert the key.>
Title: The Reason for the Season

Description: Gifts, treats, presents... bah, I say!

Those goblins pollute the true meaning of this season - the Feast of Winter Veil.  This is a time of renewal; the land slumbers under a blanket of snow brought forth by Greatfather Winter, who is NOT the bumbling fool over there in the red suit!

If you're interested in learning what the Feast is all about for yourself, ask Sagorne Creststrider.  I'm sure he'll be surprised that someone cares about history rather than getting presents.

 Quest Hand-in: The Feast of Winter Veil, you say?  Alas, in times past it held a more substantial meaning to us tauren.  Nowadays, it seems as though others have turned the legend of this season of renewal into something that helps to sell candies and presents.It's no surprise that Furmund is bitter about that sort of change.  He and other tauren like him cling to our past like a banner of war.  While I think a little celebration is always good, it is important to remember the origins of the Feast.
Title: Blind Fury

Description: Tarenar wasn't joking when he said that he didn't care about judgment and caution.  He nearly took off that high elf's head as he ran into the Plaguewood, looking for Gidwin.  You should go after him.

The Plaguewood is a big place, {name}.  Good luck.  I hope to see you boys come out of the woods in one piece.

 Quest Hand-in: I haven't found anything but brainless undead, and plenty of them.  I was just about to kill my way into Stratholme when you arrived.Did you have any more success?
Title: Aerial Challenges

Description: <Flaps flaps his wings excitedly, dropping both a note and a singed rodent at your feet.>

Dragonrider! Your flight prowess has become well known. Come test yourself in Aerial Challenges across the Dragon Isles.

Speak to any Bronze Timekeeper to get started.

 Quest Hand-in: Another challenger? Welcome! Aerial Challenges are timed races on courses throughout the Dragon Isles. Beat track times to earn your rank.
Title: Storm's End

Description: I've no doubt he can feel our presence, but so long as Lord Stormsong maintains his spell the first move is ours. 

We have him surrounded, cornered like the rat he is. We must end this together.

 Quest Hand-in: Samuel was a good man, with a true heart. A fool... but our fool.
Title: Just a Drop in the Bucket

Description: Now, mix a tiny amount of rot into the water, and mix thoroughly.  There, that's it.  This solution will still be very powerful, and we only need a little bit of it.

On the lake's southeastern border, you will find a plague cauldron with several cultists nearby.  Put on your cultist disguise, then approach the cauldron and put in ONE DROP of the solution you made.  No more, or you may risk your very life!

 Quest Hand-in: It should take them weeks to get their operation running again.  Thank you, <name>.
Title: All's Quiet on the Southern Front

Description: Return now to Overlord Krom'gar, {name}. Inform him of our status and of what you have done to ensure that Malaka'jin does not fall.

We thank you for all that you have done. Perhaps some day soon you will have your own region to command.

 Quest Hand-in: Lok'tar ogar! You are the embodiment of what it means to be a Horde soldier, <name>. If only we had more like you, this war would be over and Kalimdor would belong to the Horde - UNCONTESTED!Rise now as a champion of Krom'gar!
Title: Return to the Chamber of Shadows

Description: Lord Jorach Ravenholdt sent me out to find you, {name}. He wants your counsel on some matter of importance.

He requests your presence back at the Chamber of Shadows.

 Quest Hand-in: It is good that Valeera was able to find you so quickly.There is something important that you must immediately attend to.
Title: Gjalerbron Attack Plans

Description: These plans detail an imminent attack upon Camp Winterhoof. It would appear that the frost wyrm, Glacion, who circles overhead, is to be used for the offensive.

Surely Celea Frozenmane would be of some assistance in this matter. Deliver the plans to her at the camp to the east.

 Quest Hand-in: <name>, we cannot let this come to pass!
Title: Salvation

Description: The valley is swarming with fel-corrupted creatures who are beyond saving, yet there still may be some that could use our help.

Take this manaroot salve and apply it to any animals you see. If the fel magic hasn't taken hold, the salve might be able to mend their wounds.

 Quest Hand-in: You risked your life freeing those animals from a life worse than death. I commend you, <name>.
Title: The Spade's Blade

Description: Did you notice the script along the base of the handle, {name}? It says "Herbalist Tharillon," in the writing of the nightborne.

The handle does little for us, but perhaps the blade of this spade will give us some information on how to harvest the starlight rose without failing quite so often.

I would start my search for it in Suramar.

 Quest Hand-in: The blade is enchanted - of course it would be. I'm certain that we can replicate this enchantment here in Dalaran.Shame that that herbalist wasn't more agreeable. There may have been more that we could have learned from him. At least he's still alive out there, somewhere...
Title: The Court of Harvesters

Description: Partnerships such as ours will be key to Revendreth's revival. 

As Harvesters, we have the ability to extend our powers to mortals, though the decision must be unanimous. To that extent, the court has gathered and is awaiting your arrival.

Let's not keep them waiting.

 Quest Hand-in: Welcome to our humble court, <name>.
Title: The Mind of the Enemy

Description: The demon jailors spoke of an upcoming invasion. Their army is gathering for something big, and it worries me greatly.

Let us find whatever information we can about their plans.

 Quest Hand-in: The intelligence you have gathered is further proof that the prophecy cannot be ignored. The Legion's attack is imminent, and we will not survive without the paladins as our allies under the Light.
Title: Ancient Crypt Key

Description: <A magical device found on the mogu island invaders, it contains no more power.

You are aware of similar devices that were used to activate ancient titan machinery in the mogu vaults of Pandaria.

This particular one teems with a foreboding presence.

The Lorewalkers may know more about this device.>

 Quest Hand-in: Oh, hello my friend. We do not get many visitors here any longer, it is good to see you. What is it you have there?Ah, yes, I see. A rare device of mogu origin. We have seen these before, many years ago.During the Age of a Hundred Kings, the mogu found necromancy. Powerful mogu necro-lords ruled their tribes from crypts dug deep beneath the surface.Many such crypts remain, unearthed or awoken by the wound in the world, I cannot say which.Oh! And I have something for you, as well. Here.
Title: Catching Up with Friends

Description: Now that you've learned the fundamentals, you may have an easier time upgrading lower-level gear.

We can use the Friendship Censer trinket as an example. If you have acquired more powerful trinkets in the past, it will cost us less resources to upgrade this trinket.

You'll notice that fewer Flightstones will do the job! No crests required.

Go ahead, try upgrading the trinket or a lower-level piece of equipment that you have. If you need another trinket, Innkeeper Floressa sells them.

 Quest Hand-in: With this knowledge, I bless you to go forth and achieve the power you've always imagined. If you ever need a refresher, speak with me!
Title: Counting Sheep

Description: How frustrating. A rabid stag did this while my brother Olekk and I were scouting.

<Watu gestures at his bloody leg and winces.>

Are you here to help? After the primalists attacked, our herd of argali scattered into the pines. Their wool and milk are essential to the camp's functions.

Take this whistle, which commands Wish to herd the argali back home. Sondo the butcher has her favorite treats if she needs extra encouragement.

 Quest Hand-in: So our argali live. Give Wish an extra pat for me, will you? I would do it myself, but I can't move. <Watu sighs.>
Title: Friends Above

Description: Iskar disappeared and now the Shadow Council is at our throats. These can't be unrelated events. We need to go to the last place he was seen, the ruins of Kra'nak.

I've asked a friend to set up a camp nearby. I say we head there to continue our search.

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, <name>. You're just in time.Aktar says the Shadow Council are teaching the Sethekk their vile ways. There are even a group of High Arakkoa that have joined the Shadow Council's banner!I wonder how does Iskar factor into this?
Title: The Seat of the Naaru

Description: Do you know anything about the naaru?  They're these angelic beings that have been helping the draenei for a really long time.  I've seen a bunch around Shattrath.

They say that one naaru, O'ros, was with the Exodar when it traveled to your homeworld.  I should like to see for myself.

Can you take me there?  I bet we could get there fast by using one of the portals inside the Temple of the Moon in Darnassus!  When we get there, if you get lost, we could always just look at your map.

 Quest Hand-in: <You feel, more than hear, the musical voice of O'ros chiming in your mind.>Thank you for bringing this child to me, <name>.  She is very special indeed, and will grow up one day to be an important figure amongst the draenei.  This is in no small part due to the kindness that you have shown her, and the impression that you have made.
Title: Deeper Into the Darkness

Description: This recent change of events allows us to continue our journey to discover what darkness lies beyond the sands.

It will not be easy, {name}. We stand on the precipice of the unknown, but now the tables have turned.

<Wrathion glances at your new attire.>

You do dress the part. 

Let's see what insights your return to the Halls of Origination bring to light.

 Quest Hand-in: Removing the corruption from the Halls of Origination has shifted N'Zoth's attention elsewhere. The attacks on Uldum and Vale of Eternal Blossoms continue to grow.
Title: Sigil of the Black Hand (Heroic)

Description: <Goraluk sighs with... relief? ...or perhaps regret?>

Once I walked these halls with pride, holding my head high as an orc of the Blackrock clan. But this is a wrong path. Our hammers were meant to craft axes, swords... not these machines from the stranger's whispers.

The Warlord will not be swayed, but by force. If you can retrieve essences from the Foundry's most powerful guardians, I can craft for you a sigil that will permit direct access to Blackhand's Crucible.

 Quest Hand-in: You have done it!<Goraluk takes the items from your hands, and turns his back for a few moments>Now, I will touch this Sigil to your hand, and the entrance to the Crucible will open at your touch. Good luck.
Title: A Few Things First

Description: Lately I've been working with the ore of this land, leystone it's called. I've found its qualities to hold remarkable strength and durability. We'll need a lot of it for this.

There is felslate, but that's a probably too tainted for what you're looking to do with this barding.

You know, I also like to adorn my pieces with something sparkly, like a jewel. I've heard that the elves of Suramar have particularly beautiful ones. Perhaps you could acquire one for this project.

 Quest Hand-in: You got them! Now to upgrade your barding.Never say a blacksmith can't improve on a leatherworker's work, I always say. I mean never. I mean... well you know what I mean.
Title: Ending the San'layn Threat

Description: Blood Prince Dreven has barricaded himself in the lowest deck of this ship. He's trapped down there.

Don't think that makes this easy for us. A cornered beast is more dangerous than a free one. But, if we have the will and wisdom, he can be slain.

Follow me. I will break the barrier blocking his lair and we will face him together.

 Quest Hand-in: <Shandris raises her eyes to the sky and speaks somberly.>Ande'thoras-ethil, sisters. Shaha lor'ma.
Title: A Falling Star

Description: <Khadgar ponders the information that you brought to him.>

You say that it cut a swath through the Felstorm and was emanating power enough that your scout could feel it coursing through their body?

Something that powerful could prove to be a potent weapon against the Burning Legion!

I will inform the other order leaders of your discovery while you investigate the matter further! A gryphon awaits your command at Krasus' Landing! Light guide you.

 Quest Hand-in: Most curious indeed! This is no object of the Legion's making. Let me have a closer look.
Title: The Djaradin Have Awoken

Description: I wish we'd time for more pleasant introductions, but we can't all be Chronormu, can we?

I am Selistra, majordomo to Alexstrasza the Life-Binder, Queen of the Dragons.

Queen Alexstrasza asked me to convey her kindest regards and escort you to her at the Life Pools.

But I'm afraid I must ask for your assistance before we go meet her.

Our ancient rivals, the djaradin, have awoken from their slumber under the earth and have already assaulted a nearby outpost!

 Quest Hand-in: The djaradin have awoken? This is not good, <name>...
Title: Stem the Tide

Description: Skovald has profaned the Gates of Valor with his demonic allies. Among his forces his twisted mystics have conjured portals to ferry his fel allies from their blighted worlds. 

If we wish to stem this tide, these portals must be destroyed. 

I will gather my allies. Take this horn and signal when you have found a portal, and we will strike from the skies!

 Quest Hand-in: I do not understand, the portals are closed and yet Skovald's demonic forces still assault the gates! We must find where they are coming from!
Title: Merda Stronghoof

Description: Just as the land continues to grow, my team is stronger than ever. Are you sure you wish to combat me? There is no shame in admitting defeat now.

 Quest Hand-in: Your victory is well-deserved. Your skills are superior to my own.
Title: Break the Unbreakable

Description: With the claw, we are ready to break through the Jadefire's defenses.

Head into the ruins to the northwest. Beyond the frontline of the satyr you'll find a narrow pass heading to their corrupted moonwell. An enormous wall of demonic flame bars the path, but the Claw of Tichondrius should be able to dispel it.

Beyond the barrier you will find the leader of these forces, Xavathras, guarding the corrupted moonwell. Slay him once you are through!

 Quest Hand-in: See what can get done with a little cooperation?I'll make sure the claw is given to people responsible enough to contain such things... assuming it can't be destroyed.
Title: Small Skull

Description: <Inside of the gelatinous remains of the slime you find a small skeleton.

Someone in Rustbolt might be missing. 

You pick up the skull, it might still be able to be identified.>

 Quest Hand-in: Another one? Don't worry, there's no tragedy behind this skull. It's not real.When we first started finding the skeletons, we feared the worst. Our children getting lost in the wastes and devoured!But no, the kids are safe.It's him, he's tormenting us. King Mechagon. Heard he has some new technology, calling it "thrice die mentioned smithing." Lets him make whatever he wants.And he chooses to make fake baby skeletons.<Vera shakes her head.>Just toss it in the grinder with the rest.
Title: Where Are They Coming From?

Description: The Lich King's tireless minions labor away night and day to assemble scores of abominations and flesh giants down there in the Fleshwerks.

Yet, that is not enough. More and more skeletal constructors keep appearing to increase the pace of work.

If we do not discover where they're coming from and how they're able to work so quickly, we'll be overrun before we can act in force. Search to the southeast and see if you can find the source of these skeletons.

 Quest Hand-in: <You tell the darkrider about your discoveries at the summoning altar.>I suspected such. We can't let this continue. Our first priority is to destroy those summoning altars and then deal with the mess the Scourge has already created here.
Title: Alterac Valley Graveyards

Description: The graveyards in Alterac Valley are prized territories.  Both the Horde and the Alliance fight savagely for these sacred grounds.  Are you, {name}, ready to join that fight?
