Description: I sent Scout Pazerp to get a better look at the portal. She should have reported back by now; what could be taking her so long?

She is one of my best scouts, I hope she is alright.

 Quest Hand-in: Poor Pazerp... this news is unsettling to say the least. The Iron Horde seems to have an unending supply of troops.
Title: Invaluable Asset Zapping

Description: See the fissure running through Area 52?  We did that!  <grin>

It's yielding up all sorts of goodies for the X-52 Nether-Rocket, but we're running short on equipment.

We had an operation at the Arklon Ruins to the southeast until the Burning Legion moved in.  I need you to take this Ultra Deconsolodation Zapper to the ruins.  Use it to beam our gear back to Lead Sapper Blastfizzle down in the fissure.

Junior Technician 3rd Grade {name}, this is your chance for that promotion.  Don't blow it!

 Quest Hand-in: You must be the one that zapped all of that sapping equipment back to us here from the ruins!  Hooray for you!I've already reallocated the equipment out to our other locations.  Now we'll be able to expedite our fissure operations on this whole island by an order of magnitude!  The nether-rocket will be completed in no time!Hmmm, that's odd.  Wait a minute, did you say that you sent four things back to us?  I only got three...
Title: Bringing Down the Iron Horde

Description: Ever since the fall of Blackrock Foundry, Gul'dan has been turning the Iron Horde into... something worse. The orcs who once flocked to Grommash's banner, through either fear or thirst for revenge, are now embracing the fel.

Wade into the battlefields of Tanaan and lay waste to Gul'dan's forces. Orc or fel orc makes no difference. Gut what remains of the Iron Horde!

 Quest Hand-in: You gave them the glorious death they craved, <name>. Soon Gul'dan will have no one left to do his dirty work.
Title: Militia

Description: The war has proven costly and our ranks have been steadily depleted. But the Horde is nothing if not strong. Each and every citizen of Orgrimmar is worth ten Alliance weaklings on the battlefield.

Rally the citizens and form a militia! Remind them of their slain brothers and sisters!

 Quest Hand-in: Our armies swell while those of our enemies wither away.
Title: The Conquest Pit: Bear Wrestling!

Description: So you're interested in the fights, eh?  Well, Krenna has outlawed pit-fighting for all enlisted combatants.  But you, my friend, are technically a free agent and are not included in this prohibition.

Nice loophole, eh?

Anyway, if you're interested I can start you off with something easy, a measly bear.  I'll even let you bring friends along!

 Quest Hand-in: Nice work, mon!  Here's your cut.
Title: Blueprint: BAWLD-371

Description: <This blueprint details how to build what appears to be a machine capable of altering the local weather systems.

You should be able to upload the blueprint to Pascal-K1N6's database in Rustbolt.>

 Quest Hand-in: Have you recovered a new blueprint, my fleshy friend?I will add it to my database posthaste.
Title: The Black Gate

Description: We've heard rumors that one o' the strongest eredar might enter this world through the Black Gate soon.

If these rumors are to be believed, it could even be Archimonde the Defiler. If he arrives unchallenged, Draenor itself is likely to fall.

 Quest Hand-in: You have saved Draenor from one of the strongest demons in all creation, Commander. They will sing songs of your victory.
Title: Groundbreaking Data

Description: Aye, we triple-checked the site before we set up here. Nary a peep from the ol' earthly deep.

But there's been rumblin's today, and they're gettin' closer! I tell ya somethin' ain't right!

Ye don't have to take my word for it - the Tremor-Tracker is just about finished collecting data. Check it out an' see fer yerself!

 Quest Hand-in: I KNEW somethin' was wrong! IN YER FACE, Alexston!Ah, excuse me.Now, where have I seen machines like this before?Oh yeah! The Dark Iron!
Title: A Deeper Dive

Description: Something just isn't adding up about these Amathet. Why would protectors of titan works attack and damage the Forge of Origination?

I think we need tae take a closer look. I think I saw a monument on the terrace over there. Perhaps the writings there could tell us more about these tol'vir.

 Quest Hand-in: This monument was a good start, but it still doesn't explain what we're looking for.Fortunately, uncovering mysteries is what the Explorer's League does best!
Title: Message from the West

Description: <Torvus shakes your hand, giving you a letter in the process.>

<Torvus speaks under his breath.>

Just play along, {name}.

It is good to see you here, soldier! Lord Hellscream has undoubtedly sent his strongest warriors to Lord Agmar!

<Torvus speaks under his breath.>

Read it and then destroy it in the fire pot next to me.

 Quest Hand-in: <Torvus nods at you.>So we are understood? I will return to my lord and tell him that you have accepted.
Title: Scrying Hard or Hardly Scrying

Description: There are others that harness the shadows to do their bidding. You know of them, commander... the Shadowmoon orcs.

They have begun to master their craft... they call to the shadows beyond this realm...

I desire their power. They have one who possesses a staff of particular interest... we should claim it as our own.

 Quest Hand-in: Yes... yes... this will do nicely. We can use this to do great things.Thank you, commander.
Title: It's You!!

Description: Yes, can I help...

<Sassy's jaw drops to the floor.>

{name}!  Is it really you?!  Look how big and strong you've gotten!  Let me feel that bicep!

Me?  I've been trying to make my gold here in the jungle.  We're mainly in resource acquisition, but we also do tourism.

I know, genius, right?

Hey, listen.  I was thinking... the naga explorers to the south carry Akiris reeds, which we could sell, and use to stuff visitor mattresses.  You interested in killing some naga?  It'll be just like old times!

 Quest Hand-in: I knew you had it in you, boss-man.  You know what they say: You can take the <race> out of the islands, but you can't take the murderous tendencies out of <name>.
Title: A Gift From the Six

Description: {name}, without you some of the Legion's strongest agents would still be roaming Azeroth, threatening to undermine all that we've accomplished in this war.

Such a deed merits more than mere recognition.

If you would accept it, we would like to formally reward your heroism in the face of such darkness with a portion of our power.

 Quest Hand-in: We hope the increased power to your weapon will prove useful on the Broken Shore and beyond.
Title: The Demon Prince

Description: The Jadefire satyr that have overrun so much of Felwood work directly with the Shadow Council.

These satyr answer directly to the ancient and powerful Prince Xavalis. Some say he is the son of Xavius, the first satyr, blessed by Sargeras himself.

Whatever his nature, he must die if we are to scatter the Jadefire and reclaim our barrow dens. Journey deep into Shadow Hold and slay him. Show him no mercy; he will have none for you.

 Quest Hand-in: The demons begin to fall! Take heed, <class>. You will find even stronger foes deeper within Shadow Hold.
Title: 10 Tickets - Last Month's Mutton

Description: Step right up, step right up!  If you have tickets from the Darkmoon Faire you'd like redeemed, then just say so!  You can redeem tickets in various denominations for wondrous and fantastic prizes.  Don't be shy, give it a try!

 Quest Hand-in: Here you go, here you go!  A prize fit for a king!  Congratulations to you, my friend!If you have more tickets you'd like to turn in, then please let me know!  For as long as the Darkmoon Faire is here, I'll redeem your tickets.
Title: That's Just Rude!

Description: I'd share if they asked. They just go clickity-claking up my kawphi plants. So rude! You should teach them a lesson.

Dumb Makrinni.

 Quest Hand-in: Too mean? Naw, not too mean. They deserved it.I don't gum up their plants. Not ever.
Title: Deep Impact

Description: Queen Azshara seeks entrance into the plane of water, for what I do not know.

She believes that the ancients held the keys to finding its location.

I have personally been charged with scouring the ruins in this region, and none shall rest until we discover the secrets we seek!

Submerged just to the north are a concentration of ruins. Use this staff to search through the rubble.

Return to me only when you have located that which we seek!

 Quest Hand-in: Yes! You've found it!Neptulon's engravings... there can be no mistake!
Title: Saur Loser

Description: Inside the Beast Pens you will encounter some of the most skilled beast tamers in the Zandalari military. They are trained to kill with axe, beast, and claw. This is where they build their cavalry.

We need you to kill any Zandalari you find in there before they can get their mounted monstrosities out into the open battlefield.

 Quest Hand-in: A trained Zandalari beastcaller with a mount unleashed on the battlefield can kill twenty times their number. Your preemptive attack has saved many lives. Thank you!
Title: Learning From The Past

Description: Now that we finally have a hold on this wretched island, we can start to investigate how it got in this condition.  Some of our troops have discovered journals around the entrance to Cursed Depths cellblock just east of here.

These journals are of particular interest to our elder scribes back at base camp.  I need you to recover four of them and bring them back to me as fast as you can.

{name}, be careful down there, that place is crawling with undead.

 Quest Hand-in: These journals are in excellent condition <name>.  We will begin deciphering them immediately.  Only time will tell what secrets they hold.
Title: Border Issues

Description: They've closed off the entire valley! No wonder so many people have been complaining about trading with the Brennadam market.

We have to do something about this. These people need to make a living!

You're going to have to be an honorary cadet for me here, {name}. Tell these ruffians to clear the road!

 Quest Hand-in: Good work! Now these fine people can go about their lives.
Title: Return to the Broken Peak

Description: Of course, this is no mere story. Ban-Lu served as the personal mount of each of the previous Grandmasters, accompanying them through their travels as a faithful and trusted companion.

But... he has not revealed himself since you have become Grandmaster. This is troubling.

The last time he was seen was at the Peak of Serenity, after the fall of Grandmaster Hight.

It is there that we must begin our search for him.

 Quest Hand-in: A senseless loss of life, and for what?<Master Bu looks heavily at the portal and shakes his head.>
Title: That's Not Us

Description: First things first... it looks like we got ourselves a problem.  These miners down the pathway to the right have been runnin' around like a chickens without they heads on.  My best guess is that they dug too deep and found somethin' nasty... a demon, an elemental, or some kind o' tentacley beast.

Tak'arili don't like surprises.  Find out what the problem is and take care of it, then we get ourselves back on track.

 Quest Hand-in: So it was a demon?  Those miners never seen a demon before?  We're in the Blasted Lands, mon!  Demons are everywhere!<Tak'arili sighs.>Ah well... let's get on to da good stuff, shall we?
Title: Pure Evil

Description: We know that Kolramas, the crashed necropolis to the southeast, was carrying a large amount of an ore known as saronite when the trolls shot it down.

My scouts tell me that much of the saronite is strewn about within the innards of that thing.

Eitrigg and his friends back at The Argent Stand want a bunch of the stuff so that they can study it.

I want you to head in there and see if you can collect enough for them.

 Quest Hand-in: Can you not feel the pure evil of the stuff?We must use the expertise and magics at our disposal, combined with the power of the Holy Light, to pierce the veil of iniquity surrounding this tainted ore. We must determine its origins.Quickly, hand the saronite to me!
Title: Clefthoof Training: Darkwing Roc

Description: The windrocs of Nagrand are a smart predator, often swooping down on unwary prey in packs. If your beast doesn't keep an eye on the sky, it's likely to lose both of em.'

Head on out to Nagrand and take on the fiercest windroc of the bunch, the Darkwing Roc. That'll be a good test for the both of ye.

 Quest Hand-in: From now on, I'm sure your mount will always remember to keep one eye on the skies. Great job!
Title: Where the Hammer Falls

Description: You saved us all, shaman! Thank you!

Thrall wants to dive right into the Maelstrom and retrieve the Doomhammer, but I worry - he was badly wounded in that last fight, and that demon Geth'xun may still be alive down there. We should go with him.

Hop on Stormbeak when you're ready and we'll track down that artifact!

 Quest Hand-in: The Doomhammer could be anywhere here. And that demon is still alive.
Title: The Prophecy of Velen

Description: The Prophet spoke of this day: That on this island, in this new world, our allies would find us.

"We will be tested. They will ask that we pay for the sins of our fathers..."

At the time, I did not understand the meaning behind his words, but seeing this creature and her reaction to us, it is now coming into focus. The corruption of our people has been felt even here.

Venture south. It is there that we found this being. Find its kin and tell them of our people.

 Quest Hand-in: You say that you've found one of our crew and that she is injured? I will send one of my crewmen to your village immediately!
Title: Champion of the Winterpelt

Description: Thank you for all that you have done, {name}.

It is all too easy to turn within and simply continue on as you always have.

The Winterpelt will rejoin the world. We will return to the path our ancestors strayed from.

And we will never forget your part in this.

I have gathered the tribe and our new allies together to celebrate. Speak with me when you are ready to begin.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you, friend.
Title: The Rabbitsfoot

Description: The Broketooth hozen stole our Rabbitsfoot! He was the grummle with the biggest luckydo.

This is very bad fortune indeed. Please, {race}, we need our Rabbitsfoot back. We need his good fortune back.

Can you search the Broketooth Outpost for him?

 Quest Hand-in: Look what Broketooths and Knucklethumps did to grummle waystation. Hardly a luckydo to be found.Grummles had a deal with the hozen. We give them food, and they don't ravage. Whenever they think to ravage, Shado-Pan remind them not to ravage.But all of Shado-Pan are away defending the wall now. And the hozen want more food than the grummles have.
Title: Daio the Decrepit

Description: That text lists someone named Daio as being instrumental to the demonic ritual. They can't possibly mean Daio the Decrepit!

I never knew he was Kirin Tor. I only know him as an elderly warlock who trains young recruits in the infernal arts. This would certainly explain his change of occupation.

He most likely holds key information for this to work. Though retired, I believe he is still out in the Tainted Scar in the Blasted Lands. You should seek him out.

 Quest Hand-in: Our order suffered a great loss that day. It is a shame we chose to hide it instead of study it.You have another critical element to the ritual, and we are one step closer.
Title: Something Stewed

Description: Finally, we're going to need a feast. And none of that "finger food" stuff! This crowd wants meat, and lots of it.

Gather up venison from Highland elk and does. Highland worg are good eatin' too - bring back some ribs. We'll show you a feast like you've never had in all the Eastern Kingdoms, friend.

 Quest Hand-in: Lookat that! You're practically bent double under the weight of all that meat. I'd better get my people cooking.
Title: The Blue Seed

Description: I remember seeing a blue seed with red leaves nearby, but it was in a cave behind a wall of brambles. I didn't think of it at the time, but maybe you could use the red seeds to get us in?

I wish I didn't mix up the instructions or we wouldn't be in this mess. But maybe it's all going to work out anyway. Let's go!

 Quest Hand-in: The seed!
Title: The Captain's Logs

Description: Now that you've got that thing under control, let's gather up the lumber I was supposed to be collecting. Otherwise these orcs are going to build a catapult out of ME!

Fresh lumber should be stockpiled all around the area. Use the shredder to collect all you can.

 Quest Hand-in: Great! You've loaded the shredder to capacity. You're getting pretty handy with that thing...
Title: Home, Home On the Range

Description: <Cyrus peruses a map.>

Hmm... Along the road to Fort Daelin... to the north... somewhere in the Deadwash.

<He points to a section of road on the map.>

I've marked a spot on your map that seems likely. I think that will get you close enough. 

I'll report back to the Lord Admiral with what we've learned. Good luck, and I hope our shipwright is willing.

 Quest Hand-in: <Dorian takes her time to read over the letter. Her brows steadily rise.>
Title: Restorative Venom

Description: Meerah here found your friend in the dunes. The lightning strike nearly killed her. It might still, without treatment. 

The wasps within the grove have a painful sting, but their venom also has restorative properties. 

I can extract what I need from their glands.

With an ample amount of venom, we should be able to soothe your friend's wounds.

 Quest Hand-in: <Kiro quickly inspects the glands.>These should work well.
Title: Clearing the Way

Description: Only the most battle hardened, noble and positively fearless will submit to Legoso's mission. The exarch will not order any agent of the Hand to take on the task of destroying the Vector Coil and dispatching Sironas. He refuses to send any draenei to their death - which is what the mission is: suicide...

<Corin sighs.>

My job is to soften up the Sunhawk defenses. You are to slay Sunhawks near the Vector Coil and keep the path clear for our champion - whoever that may be.

 Quest Hand-in: Hopefully a hero arrives before they are able to call forth reinforcements to guard the area you just secured.
Title: The Great Swog

Description: A peculiar coin fished up around the Dragon Isles.

You've heard rumors from fellow anglers of a creature in the Ohn'ahran Plains who collects such things.

 Quest Hand-in: <The Great Swog regards you.>
Title: Proving Pit

Description: Ya done quite well for ya'self, {class}. I'm sure I could teach ya a trick or two here and dere, but I not be wastin' ya time on tiki targets no longer.

l put one last trial before ya den, mon. Head over to da provin' pit in the middle of dis area and fight a real baddy - one dat wants ta kill ya back. Just let the jailor by the pit know when ya ready.

 Quest Hand-in: Ya handle yerself quite well. Ya gonna be quite powerful some day.
Title: Eating Through the Defenses

Description: Not sure why and don't rightly care, but for some reason the coven can't come near my onion field. So long as my crop doesn't give out, I can hole up in here as long as it takes.

Unfortunately, those boars got the same idea and now they're eatin' up my harvest! If they keep that up, soon there'll be nothin' keepin' the coven at bay!

If you can do me a favor and thin them out, I'd be happy to let you take some of these onions with you.

 Quest Hand-in: That oughtta do it for a spell.Thanks for the help, stranger.
Title: Fel Bent for Leather

Description: Ah, my faithful assistant. I have just the task for you.

As you have seen, fel power permeates living tissue and can easily be coaxed out.

Also, these damned bats are driving me to my wits' end. There is an opportunity to kill two bats with one blade, it seems. Your blade.

Take this crystal. It should rip those hellions from the sky and into your waiting arms.

You may as well bring back their hides, if only to shut up that fellow in the corner for a few moments.

 Quest Hand-in: I can no longer hear their shrieking. Finally, peace and quiet!
Title: The Moving Mists

Description: <He looks down at the dead fog creature at his feet, looks up at you, then points out into the mists surrounding the lake. It seems he wants you to find and kill more of these fog creatures.>

 Quest Hand-in: <He pats you on the shoulder and nods his thanks.>
Title: A Grapple a Day

Description: So these trials are what will get us the Aegis, and the next one is on the top of that mountain? That may prove problematic.

The only way I see up the mountain is through that vrykul city, and the gates are shut tight. We should be able to grapple over, though. If you don't have a launcher, I managed to wrangle a spare from one of these vrykul.

I'll scout ahead and see if I can find a good spot to get in.

 Quest Hand-in: That looks like it'll do the job nicely. Let's get in there before we're spotted.
Title: The Shifting Pack

Description: Dere's one loa I'm extra interested in seeing: Gonk! I've heard de priests say dat he's de most welcoming of de loa. He even lets his followers worship other loa as well!

But de best thing about him is dat he and his followers can change into many forms. I want to do dat!

Will you take me to meet him?

 Quest Hand-in: Did you see how Gonk changed me into all dose shapes?Maybe one day I can do dat by myself!
Title: Raiding the Boulderfist

Description: The Boulderfist have recently raided Drywhisker Mine, and are sitting on a large amount of iron ore.

We want it back.

 Quest Hand-in: This will do. Throm-ka, <name>.
Title: Eye Spy

Description: This terrible thing makes my hair stand on end. Cho'gall uses these to control his minions - now it's time to use it against him.

Let me see... hmm, it's all cloudy. All I can see is you. Why is it showing me you?

<Garona sets the eye out in front of her.>

Look into the eye and tell me what you see. Peer into Cho'gall's lair! What is he doing? Is he heavily guarded? Tell me!

 Quest Hand-in: You've gone pale, <class>. What did the Eye show you?You saw Cho'gall? Wait - Cho'gall saw you? He's watching us? He's watching us right now!?Damn this stupid dark magic! I'm going to have to infiltrate Cho'gall's stronghold myself.
Title: Mysterious Azsharite

Description: Azsharite! This mysterious crystalline substance has been used to forge weapons of fel power, but in our hands, we've discovered that it's capable of focusing enormous amounts of energy. It may be the biggest goblin discovery since kaja'mite.

But what is it? Where does it come from? Why is it located only here? Science demands an answer! I need more samples to study. Search out Azsharite deposits all along the nearby cliffs. 

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, excellent. Some of these samples look fresh. I'm going to be up to my neck in this stuff trying to solve this mystery!
Title: The Upper Hand

Description: It troubles me that Dezran would sacrifice himself so willingly for Sarkareth... And that Amythora and Marithos would leave Dezran to save him.

We both know the loss of waking in a new world. But Sarkareth wallows in the darkness of our past. I cannot let him continue to recruit our people.

Sarkareth awaits in the next room. I do not wish to kill him, but we must bring him to justice.

Let me know when you are ready.

 Quest Hand-in: I now feel only pity for Sarkareth. Nothing was left of him but an empty husk driven into madness.
Title: A TON of Artifact Fragments

Description: Every little bit counts.

 Quest Hand-in: Good work, <class>. We won't let you down.
Title: Stop the Presses

Description: This is it, {name}. As the one propagating the ideas that drive the rebellion, if we can stop Belaphon, we'll see the end of the rebellion.

Try to bind her with my ring, though you'll likely need to weaken her first. If she's willing to surrender, we'll bring her to Alexstrasza.

I imagine the Queen of Dragons will have a lot of very choice words when they meet.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you, <name> - you've aided us in opposing this rebellion from the beginning. Now Valdrakken is safe, and more importantly, I will see that the dragonkin are treated with the respect they deserve.
Title: A Source of Terrifying Power

Description: <The clutch-keepers seem to be using these blinding white crystals as magical foci. Peering inside, you see thick tendrils of black smoke swirling in the center. One of the workers at Klaxxi'vess may know more about this material and why it is so abundant in the wastes.>

 Quest Hand-in: Do you have any idea what this is? It's amber!But it is polluted with fear.I would not expect an outsider like you to understand the consequences of this.
Title: Darkmoon Furies Deck

Description: Now that you have gathered all of the Furies cards together into a deck, a ninth card mysteriously appears with the same backing as the first eight.   On this card is inscribed, "Return these cards to the Darkmoon Faire and be rewarded."  You have heard that the entrance to this faire appears near Mulgore and Goldshire every month.

 Quest Hand-in: So you have put together a deck of Furies.   Your gesture of returning it to us will create a tie between you and the Darkmoon that will not soon be forgotten.   Allow me to present you with one of the greater Darkmoon cards as a small token of our appreciation.
Title: Game of Thorns

Description: <Jarrod is clearly injured. He winces in pain as he begins to talk.>

My lead forest operator, Shelly... she is being held not far from here...

 Quest Hand-in: <Something is moving under all of these roots.>
Title: Allies in Dalaran

Description: Welcome to Northrend, {name}. I have been asked to arrange travel for you to Dalaran so that you can meet with our allies there.

Ride the gryphon to Dalaran and once you land, make your way to our inn there, A Hero's Welcome. Find Isirami Fairwind and speak with her immediately.

She can help you bind your hearthstone to the city so you can use the Silver Enclave's portal to travel back to Stormwind quickly.

 Quest Hand-in: Welcome to Dalaran! This inn is part of the Silver Enclave, the headquarters of the official Alliance presence in our city.Don't forget to bind your hearthstone here for easy travel to the city and access to the portal to Stormwind next door.
Title: It Goes to 11...

Description: We must strike while the vrykul forces are in disarray! Take the harpoon control mechanism to Nifflevar and locate the northernmost harpoon building on the bluff side of the village.

Once there, commandeer one of the vrykul harpoon guns that are stationed on the building's deck. Use the harpoon gun to rain hell upon Wyrmskull Village! Destroy the longhouse, dockhouse, storage facility and any defenders that the vrykul may send at you!

Do this and Daggercap Bay will become a much safer port!

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent work, <name>! You took out a good chunk of their dragon riders and really pissed off their leadership.Are you ready to head back to Valgarde and report the good news to Zorek? If so, I've got a crazy idea!
Title: The Dark Lady Calls

Description: Champion, the Dark Lady has need of you.

We cannot speak more of this here. Make haste to Orgrimmar at once.

Best not to keep her waiting.

 Quest Hand-in: My guards are stationed at the door to ensure that this meeting stays private.Now, let us discuss Varok Saurfang.
Title: A Fate Most Noble

Description: Welcome, Worthy One!

I am Greeter Mnemis. It is my duty and pleasure to assist you on this, your first day among the kyrian.

Allow me to congratulate you. Your fate is reserved for the most noble of souls. Only those who lived a life of service may call Bastion home.

I am certain you have many questions- all new aspirants do! Please allow me the honor of introducing you to the next chapter of your existence.

We will begin when you are ready.

 Quest Hand-in: I hope that was informative and relaxing.
Title: In Strict Confidence

Description: If anyone knows where the admiral is, then surely it must be his captains on the ships in Onslaught Harbor.

<The lord-commander rubs his hands together.>

Welsington and Hartford are their names if memory serves. Go beat the information out of them and then end their miserable lives.

I want to know where the grand admiral is hidden!

 Quest Hand-in: They resurrected Landgren? He's the one that will know where the grand admiral is then!
Title: In Search of the Eye

Description: The Raven's Eye should be somewhere within the courtyard. This is where Ravencrest's lieutenants used to plan their strategies in life. Hell, it looks like they still might be doing so in death.

It has to be around here somewhere. Your skill at lock picking should prove invaluable.

 Quest Hand-in: A ledger? Wait, let me look.<Valeera reaches out and begins thumbing through the tome's pages.>This is the key!
Title: Death to the Vilebranch

Description: We won't give them a chance to react. You must re-enter Jintha'Alor and charge all the way to the upper tiers.

The Vilebranch berserkers and shadowcasters are dangerous enemies, {name}. When the others see their bodies thrown across the walls, they'll know we mean business.

Don't leave any Vilebranch hearts beating!

 Quest Hand-in: It won't be long until we're the only trolls left breathing on these walls.
Title: Visions of Danger

Description: {name}, Spiritwalker Ussoh has revealed a disturbing vision to me regarding Baine Bloodhoof.

He has asked that you speak with him as soon as you can.

Return to me after. We will have much to discuss.

 Quest Hand-in: Sylvanas will execute Baine Bloodhoof soon... unless we act.
Title: Drowned Sorrows

Description: Argh, 'tis a horrible life. I should be in a watery grave right now, not sittin' here by the fire, breathin' fresh air.

The crew tried so hard to save my beautiful Maiden's Folly. Bless the boys, bless their hearts.

O'Breen made it to shore safely but we weren't so lucky. The seas just sank on us, I swear.

One second we're afloat and the next water is rushin' in. And those beasts! Killed all the survivors. Horrible naga scum. I went black and ended up here, saved.

I want those beasts dead.

 Quest Hand-in: Nice work out there, <name>.Those scum deserved what they got. While nothin' will ever bring me ship or me crew back, the death of those naga gives me some solace.
Title: The Arena of Annihilation

Description: Ah, I can still remember running fights out of a muddy hole in the ground back in Nagrand. We've come a long way, eh, Wodin?

I tell you, there's nothing more these Tiger monks like than a good scrap. So much so that they've paid good coin for me to set up shop here and help draw the strongest fighters from all around!

So how about it? You and a couple friends up for a few rounds in the Arena of Annihilation...? Big money, big prizes!

 Quest Hand-in: Gurgthock said you he'd make it worth your while, kid. Take your pick!
Title: Stiff Negotiations

Description: Well it seems you were of a bit of use after all. It's not been my experience to meet many a {race} that are.

We don't have any more use for you here. Head into the Vice and see if my brother Zort could use a hand. He went to see if he could con the giants into laying down their lives so that we don't have to. He certainly wasn't known for having the brains in the family.  

 Quest Hand-in: I can think of some uses for you, go ahead and stay for a bit.
Title: Ruag's Report

Description: Here is Ruag's report, {name}. Let him know his scout is still here.

Do not speak of Helgrum. I will not distract others with news of tragedy.

I have to be strong. We all have to be strong.

 Quest Hand-in: <Ruag reads over the report.>I see.  Thank you for this information, <name>.
Title: Back to the Chamber

Description: The Heart o' Azeroth is gettin' stronger every day, and it's makin' a difference.

Make yer way tae the Chamber o' Heart, champion. Yer talents are needed.

 Quest Hand-in: The Heart o' Azeroth never ceases tae amaze me. Well done, champion!
Title: The Shifting Tides

Description: I'm no tidesage, but even I can tell that whatever you have there is probably not a good sign for the bastion. 

There's one of those Tortollans, Rikal, who's been helping us figure out a solution to whatever the naga are planning in front of the levee. He'd probably like to see this.

 Quest Hand-in: Hmm.... This is concerning. Very concerning.
Title: Call to Arms: Mechagon

Description: Our mission in Mechagon is being compromised by the Horde incursion. 

Get into Mechagon and take out as many as you can.

 Quest Hand-in: Good work, <class>.
Title: Pebble

Description: If you hadn't noticed, there's a very small elemental that has taken a liking to you. If you stay on the ground for even a few moments, I'm sure you'll spot him.

You seem to be quite adept at making friends down here. A good talent to have.

 Quest Hand-in: <Pebble seems quite happy to meet you.>
Title: Ruumbo Demands Justice

Description: You! Wanderer! Bow before the might of Ruumbo, great god of the Timbermaw tribe!

Hear my will! The evil Deadwood tribe lives in the village behind me! They are big jerks!

I mean, they... they sully my name with their wicked misdeeds! They persecute my cherished Timbermaw tribe and hurt them!

I demand you inflict my justice! Defeat the Deadwood and I will give you my... my favor! Yes! The favor of RUUMBO! 

 Quest Hand-in: It worked!I mean, uh, YES, the will of Ruumbo has been carried out! You have done well, creature! You may have these shiny coins!
Title: This Blows

Description: So. This is what evil lies behind the attacks on fair Thunder Bluff.

Let us move forward. It is time to put an end to this abomination.

Tell Hamuul Runetotem what has happened here upon our return; I'll need to oversee the return of my people, repairs, and the like.

 Quest Hand-in: A massive prince of the wind, you say? The herald of Al'Akir, the Windlord?Madness. All of it.All of Thunder Bluff is in your debt, <class>.
Title: The Fate of Gordawg

Description: Looming monstrously between us and the inner chamber is the great fury we have sought to return to the Throne of Elements.

Gordawg stands before us enthralled; a slave to the pale and their mysterious master. My heart is heavy with grief to see such a great creature mindless and enslaved by evil.

There is no going back, in order to push forward you must go through Gordawg.

It pains me, but Gordawg must be slain.

When the deed is done, we will return the fury's heart to the Throne of Elements.

 Quest Hand-in: Gordawg was a mighty ally. The elements will mourn the loss of the fury, but death was the only answer. Gordawg would not have wished to stay a slave to evil.Though Gordawg is no more, the heart of a fury is eternal and unbreakable. In time, this brightly glowing heart will take shape into a new earthen fury.Such is the cycle of life upon the Elemental Plateau.
Title: Silver Victory

Description: A victory is a twin-edged axe. It stakes a claim, but it also foments rebellion and revenge. We must be complete and decisive.

 Quest Hand-in: Without each battle, or sovereignty here grows, Commander.
Title: Moat Monster!

Description: Sometimes fishing means throwing something back, {class}.

We've been overfeeding these frogs for just that occasion.  We've fed these frogs bloated spiders, that were fed bloated flies, and now, we are going to feed a real monster.

The moat above, in the Ruins of Lordaeron, is home to our very own moat monster.

Today is feeding day.  But we must train it as well.  In this bag, you will find a decoy kit and some bloated frogs.  Use the decoy kit, then toss the frogs to the monster when it appears.

 Quest Hand-in: The dead feed the flies.  The flies feed the spiders.  The spiders feed the frogs.  The frogs feed our moat monster... It's a beautiful circle of life with the goal of ending life.
Title: Bubble Craze

Description: <Agrikus shouts at you.> I have no more poppy tea!

...Oh, you're not one of them. Praise the Titans. Someone made "Bubble Poppy Tea" the most fashionable drink on the market this week and I've sold out of the herb completely. Please, could you bring more poppies before they return in droves?

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you, <name>, thank you.Please, take my field notes. Study them to improve your herbalism.I need to... make some tea...
Title: Illegible Orc Letter

Description: You've discovered a parchment with an impressive looking Horde seal imprinted upon its page. Unfortunately, the rest of the document is completely illegible as it is in orcish.

Take the letter to Boog. He might know what to do with it!

 Quest Hand-in: <Boog takes the letter from you and begins to examine it.>Interesting.<Boog smells the parchment.>Hrm... Troubling...<Boog folds the paper in half and looks at you.>Can't understand a damn thing written here - if that is writing. Could just be toilet paper. Sure smells like it.
Title: Spirit of the Thistle Bear

Description: In these woods reside three great spirits, that of the Stag, that of the Thistle Bear, and that of the Moonstalker. These spirits make powerful allies, but you can only align yourself with one of them.

If you wish to align yourself with the Great Thistle Bear Spirit, take this incense to a cave just east of the great whirlpool. Meditate before the great spirit while burning the incense on the ground between you, and face his trial to earn his blessing. Should you succeed, return to me.

 Quest Hand-in: For countless ages I have walked these forests and lived in these mountains. Through snow and fire, I have watched civilizations crumble and nature press on. Now, the very earth turns against us, and it becomes very apparent that we must fight if our legacy is to continue.Your heart is true, and I would choose you as our champion. If you value the thick hide and resilience of my kind, then accept my boon. Know that the other spirits will not accept you once this choice is made, so choose wisely.
Title: Testing the Prototype

Description: I've been working on a portable generator repair kit for use in some of the harsher climates that the Consortium operates in. Granted, it wasn't designed for Netherstorm, but we shouldn't have any problems with it.

I had already scheduled a test with one of my best techs up at Eco-Dome Farfield beyond the Netherstone to the northeast. Take this prototype to Tashar. He'll know what to do with it. If it works, we can use it to reinforce the shield generators at the larger domes.

 Quest Hand-in: This looks a little peculiar. Ghabar definitely didn't have Netherstorm in mind when he designed it.Don't look so surprised, <name>. Netherstorm is tame compared to some of the environments I've worked in. Nevertheless, a failing dome is always a concern.
Title: Gearing Up

Description: Dem ogres whipped me real good. My arm be broke, a few ribs snapped, t'ink even me spleen be hurtin' from dat beatin'. Nothin' a troll can't handle though but I be needin' a moment ta recover.

What I really be needin' is me gear dem ogres took from me. Dey got me garb in a chest near a hut to da south, me glave in a chest next to da tower wid da Bonecrushers, dey even got me mask, it over near da lava! Could ye go find dem while I take a breather?

 Quest Hand-in: Ah dat be me stuff! Give me a moment ta put me stuff on mon. Then, I gonna take me an ogre ear for every bone I had ta pop back in place.
Title: Return to the Grove

Description: Now that my grove is safe, I can turn my attention to the threat you speak of.

To hear of Cenarius' plight is disturbing indeed. Tell Malfurion that I shall meet him at the Grove.

 Quest Hand-in: Wonderful. The Archdruids have already assembled.
Title: Dread Head Redemption

Description: I sense that Durak is more than he seems. Demonic power is dangerous and it is easy to fall to its corruption - even for a trained warlock. 

I do not trust him, {name}.

Find this Durak and tell him that the Horde will have nothing to do with him.

 Quest Hand-in: Grah... very well.I'll remove the bounty I had placed upon your head. Though I am sorely tempted to end your life anyway, just on principle.Be sure that you never raise my ire again, <name>. Now, get out of my sight...
Title: Foothold: Drustvar

Description: It seems Drustvar has a big seam of Azerite underground.

Do you like profit? I LOVE profit. This seems like a golden opportunity, if ya catch my meanin'. Time is money!

          - Trade Prince Gallywix

 Quest Hand-in: You have chosen to sail to Drustvar.
Title: Dagra the Fierce

Description: Der be another trainer not far from here that you ought to fight to test your worth.

Dagra the Fierce waits on the northern slope of Thorn Hill, east of The Crossroads. If you be beatin' her, you just might have what it takes.

 Quest Hand-in: You fight with the determination of one who does not fear defeat, but does not tolerate it, either. You will go far.
Title: Memories of the Dead

Description: The runes on this ring you found are still legible: it was given to "Kalytha" when she was granted admission to the Academy. With the right spell or two, this personal trinket of hers is the gateway to her soul.

Take the ring back to Lake Mennar. Kalytha's spirit should now be visible to you on the shore of the lake. Touch her and the ring will allow you to see the world as she sees it, forever reliving her final hours. Probe her mind, {name}! Speak to the others and learn the secrets of Lake Mennar...

 Quest Hand-in: You reel as the spirit's vision fades, relieved to once again feel the earth beneath your feet and the comforting rhythm of your own quickened heart.
Title: Goren, Goren, Gone!

Description: We... we left the goren alone for too long. They have grown bold and forgotten who we are.

Kill them! Kill them all. Rip them apart until they scream. Remind them what happens to anyone who tries to attack a Laughing Skull village.

Oh, and welcome to Gorgrond.

 Quest Hand-in: Ripfist's dying wish has been satisfied. Goren corpses litter the ground, and these corpses have not gone unnoticed by the nearby goren.
Title: Recently Living

Description: You may have noticed the walking trees near Elrendar Falls.  As the keepers of nature, they are infused with a primal magic we can reform to our own purposes using the pure water you have already brought to me.

Unfortunately, the green keepers are gnarled and twisted creatures, so you may need to kill a few before you find a useable branch.

 Quest Hand-in: You've done as I've asked, <name>, and you may take your reward now.
Title: Harbingers of the Void

Description: Our scouts have made a horrifying discovery, {name}.

The souls of the prisoners are being used to summon creatures from the void.

Inside, three beings of darkness already await - the Essence of Shadow, the Essence of Darkness, and the Essence of Anguish.

They must be destroyed immediately, before their power can be unleashed.

 Quest Hand-in: I knew I could trust this task to you, <name>.
Title: Crocolisk Mastery: The Trial

Description: I warn you, stranger -- do not make any comments about crashing the ship. I already get enough of it from the rest of the expedition.

If you're looking to try your hand at hunting, though, you should test your skills against the wily mangal crocolisks. They live all along the river to the south, and in the Wildgrowth Mangal to the east. Prove you can hold your own against them and we'll talk again, hunter.

 Quest Hand-in: Impressive, <class>. Are you certain you're not a member of the expedition?No, I'm certain of it. There would've been a crash joke in there somewhere.
Title: Encroaching Elementals

Description: The crafters, artisans, and explorers of the Dragonscale Expedition are ill-suited to the vigors of battle.

But not you and I, {name}.

Here in the Dragon Isles, let us use that strength to protect those who can't protect themselves.

Clear out the elementals encroaching from the north, so the expedition can focus on their noble pursuits.

 Quest Hand-in: For the Dragonscale Expedition!<Captain Garrick salutes you.>
Title: Clandestine Operation

Description: You have long been a trusted hero of the Alliance, {name}. And like the rest of us, you have endured many hardships to reach this point.

Now, I must ask even more of you. Will you hear me out?

 Quest Hand-in: The time to make our move is now.
Title: Follow That Cat

Description: The real Mauti has run off with Grent Direhammer, but being the wise hunter that he is, he has fired flares off so you can track him.  Find Direhammer before it's too late!

 Quest Hand-in: We be here... Da hunter, he be in da cave.  Da beast... Sometin' ain't right about her...
Title: Chaos Theory

Description: Despite their strength and their numbers, even the Burning Legion requires order to fight. Disrupt that order... and they fall like the rabble they are.

The plan is simple. Let chaos reign in their ranks, and the day will be ours.

 Quest Hand-in: Now that their forces are in disarray, let us proceed.
Title: In Search of Suna

Description: I have bad news. When I returned, Suna was already gone.

The others say that she took her things and headed down the road to the east, muttering about hunting down the source of the yaungol aggression.

I cannot allow her to venture into dangerous territory alone.

I've already prepared a group of soldiers to push further east.

We are leaving shortly. Hop on the caravan if you wish to travel with the Shado-Pan. You can also meet us there if you wish.

 Quest Hand-in: Well, we made it.
Title: The Grimtotem are Coming

Description: The cowardly Grimtotem have attacked us by surprise when we were least prepared!

You will be of most help to Thousand Needles elsewhere, {class}. We have heard rumors that the goblins and gnomes somehow survived in a giant barge out on the salt flats.

Motega Firemane is at the base of the summit. He can get you a canoe to take you there.

Do you mind helping us fight off the Grimtotem on your way to him?

 Quest Hand-in: You want a canoe to go out to the salt flats? But, surely the race track has been destroyed?!Nonetheless, for your bravery, you will have the last one!
Title: Proof of Strength: Gronnling Scale

Description: This scale is proof of your strength at slaying ogron and your gladiator friend has born witness!

Take the scale back to Limbflayer and claim your accolades!

 Quest Hand-in: A gladiator saw you tear this off the back of a gronnling, which I am sure did not part with it easily. It is more like a stone than a true scale though as these brutes are part stone it seems. Not an easy trophy to collect!
Title: Charging Up

Description: Emberthal wanted this guy Sarkareth dealt with yesterday. I understand! I hate waiting too!

This door is frustratingly hard to crack... But! I have a plan because I always have a plan! My recipe for success is being one step ahead of everyone else. It's worked for me so far! Sorta.

So, about this plan... I might need your help!

 Quest Hand-in: Tuberros is a life saver! These should do just fine! Now give me a moment to calculate the energy flux and... hmm... Yes... no, nope, ok, maybe...
Title: The Klaxxi Council

Description: I must report to the Klaxxi. They would not have woken me unless the situation were dire.

You have not been entirely useless. For that, I will spare your life.

The council may even find a use for you.

 Quest Hand-in: This is a sacred meeting place for the Klaxxi.It would be wise of you to let me do the talking.
Title: Johaan's Experiment

Description: Harmless pumpkins, right?  Or so it would seem.  If we are to defeat the Scourge advances from the North and the human infestation from the South we need to start realizing the full potential of our gift of undeath.

With a little ingenuity a simple pumpkin becomes an agent for our Dark Lady.  This pumpkin, laced with my latest formula, will prove to be quite a treat.

Yet another Scarlet Zealot has been captured and is being kept outside, by the gazebo.  Take this pumpkin to the fool.

 Quest Hand-in: By the Light!  Finally some food!  Sweet, sweet pumpkin....
Title: Visitors

Description: My sources at the Menders' Stead have informed me that we will be having some visitors soon.  A group of paladins - led by a worgen tradeswoman, of all things - will be arriving here shortly.  I look forward to meeting them.  Particularly one of them.

Would you mind stopping in and checking in on them?  I can't say for sure, but by the time you get there, they should just be crossing the Thondroril River, far to the west.

 Quest Hand-in: Yes?
Title: Timeless Nutriment

Description: As you have surmised, the flora and fauna of this island are quite unusual. Not all explanations are mysterious, however. Sometimes, we must listen to the land, to hear the tales of the world around us. Have you considered that the creatures of this island grew to such proportions simply from the nutriment of the land you walk upon?

You will find nutriment in abundance throughout the island: ripe fruits, eggs, meat, flowers, nuts, and even the stones themselves. Eat, and discover the power of the land.

 Quest Hand-in: The island gives in abundance, in nutriment and in answers. You only need look around to find what you seek.
Title: Report to Zurai

Description: With the arrival of Field Commander Romus and his forces, the Alliance and their draenei friends have grown bold. They're militarizing every old draenei ruin from here to Shattrath.

In response, the trolls have established a new outpost in the eastern part of Zangarmarsh, just south of the Dead Mire. Swamprat Post, they're calling it. I'm glad they have a sense of humor about living in a place like that, because I wouldn't relish it.

The post's commander has asked me to send anyone I can spare.

 Quest Hand-in: To be honest, I had expected more, but you'll have to do. Welcome to Swamprat Post.
Title: The Unseen Blade

Description: Stormwind is too important to fall to the Legion, and I don't trust Shaw or his SI:7 goons to take care of the Hand on their own.

The two of us will have to handle this while there's still time.

Use extreme caution. The entire city is on edge from murmurs of the cult's activities, and we're already kill on sight.

The other Shadows spoke highly of your skills. Are you in?

 Quest Hand-in: Every second I held those blades again was torture. They're all yours.
Title: Flow Control

Description: If all goes as planned, the manastorm will cause the leyline to flare up, sending a great surge of energy through the arcway.

In order for the surge to reach Shal'Aran, we must seal off any outlets along the way. If we miss even one, the mission fails - and hundreds of people will be vaporized by the energy blow off.

Thalyssra had better be sure about this tree.

 Quest Hand-in: If my map of the arcways is accurate, that should be all of the outlets we need to worry about.
Title: Respite

Description: Thank you for everything you have done for us. 

We've been able to get back on our feet now, and Butterfingers has cooked up a meal. 

We lost a member of our team and everyone is still a bit shaken... We could do with the morale boost of a good meal.

Would you like to join us?

 Quest Hand-in: Returning these artifacts is the least we can do. And the opportunity to study additional artifacts is tantalizing!Thank you for helping us, <name>. This opportunity for study will be huge for the Dragonscale Expedition.
Title: Scheduled Pickup

Description: You've proven yourself more than capable in battle, {name}. As you know, there may be Shadow Council forces anywhere around Auchindoun, including near Telmor.

Tuulani's powers as a soulpriest have not yet fully manifested; she isn't capable of protecting the shard alone. I need you to join her at Telmor to make sure the crystal makes it to Auchindoun safely.

 Quest Hand-in: It's not safe here. The Shadow Council has already taken the city!
Title: The Meaning of Wrath

Description: I will gather my forces and dispense a portion to Korthia immediately. I will also see to it that they are provided the tools Baroness Vashj and Kael'thas were able to conjure so that we might further defend against nathrezim incursions.

Other duties require my attention before I can descend on Korthia. I must secure Dominance Keep against further infiltrators.

I suppose the Primus will want an update. You may tell him you were successful.

 Quest Hand-in: Your strength in battle remains uncontested. Today, though, you prove your strength of diplomacy. I have already issued orders for the deployment of the Stonewright's forces. Well done in bringing her into the fold.
Title: Tidying Up

Description: Ionized Minnows are a scourge of these waters. They strip the ocean floors of any food, making it difficult for other species to survive.

These fish have little to offer other than being a food source for larger fish. I want to see these larger fish, so I have a plan to clear the waters of these minnows and lure the bigger fish out from its hiding place.

Let's start by using my Minnow Vac to catch Ionized Minnows for me.

 Quest Hand-in: With these minnows, we can build the trap.
Title: An Intriguing Plan

Description: Prospector Rokar has decided to help us. He's concocted a plan to use the iron dwarves' strength against them.

I must admit, our new 'friend' is more insightful than I'd given him credit for. He's correct in that our numbers are too few for a direct attack.

Travel to Dun Argol, in the snowy regions to the southeast, and capture all the parts of their war golem blueprints from the iron rune-smiths there. Bring the assembled blueprint to Rokar and we'll see if his plan has any merit.

 Quest Hand-in: So Tormak's going to go ahead with the plan? I suppose he wouldn't have sent you if he didn't.Oh, bother... Now how am I going to figure out how to put this together under all this pressure?
Title: Doomcaller's Robes

Description: The unmentionable Old God slowly awakens from his slumber beneath Ahn'Qiraj.  The terrible fate that awaits Azeroth could come in days or years; time has no meaning for beings of his power.

When the stars are favorable, he will lash out against all living beings with terrible wrath.  You must find him before then and find a way to bring his existence to an end.

Do this and bring me a piece of his husk.  I shall grant you armor no mortal has ever worn... armor fit for one who has slain a god!

 Quest Hand-in: I did not expect you to return from your attempt, <name>.You've fulfilled a destiny greater than that of most immortal beings.By slaying C'Thun you've not only saved all of Azeroth, you've also tipped the scales of cosmic events beyond your comprehension.Accept these robes as a symbol of the glory and burden that will come as a consequence of your actions.May their power aid you in the challenges that await you, god-slayer!
Title: Schematic Reassimilation: Unsuccessful Prototype Fleetpod

Description: <This schematic contains the pattern of a new protoform construct. Present it to an appropriate protoform forge and it may instantiate one of these creatures for you.>

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent. With this schematic and the right components, a new song can begin here to accompany you.
Title: Gifts of the Forest

Description: These gorm have gone out of control! We need to stop them.

I have a plan, but I cannot do it on my own. We lure the gormlings to the Banks of Life by using special totems that are drained of their anima. If you can retrieve the wood required for the totem, I can prepare the ritual.

Take these pipes. Find the Culex trees growing on the banks and play a song for them. You will recognize them by their pale green leaves. The wood must be given freely for the ritual to work.

 Quest Hand-in: Good. This should do it!
Title: Mogu Runes of Fate

Description: Greetings, {name}. I am privileged to offer you an excellent opportunity. Through the centuries, we've honed a method by which the very laws of chance themselves can be bent. With a Mogu Rune of Fate, valuable artifacts will find their way into your hands more frequently inside the palace of the Thunder King.

 Quest Hand-in: May the stars smile upon you, <name>.
Title: Journal Entry: Experiments

Description: <This ancient page is bound in ambient magic and scribed in an old draconic dialect.>

<Scalecommanders would have a great interest in the contents of this document.>

 Quest Hand-in: Good. More of our history in the voice of someone who lived it.<Azurathel reads over the journal entry growing more and more stoic.>This is... disturbing. As soldiers we knew there was a degree at which we were expendable. But to read this...Thank you for bringing this to me. We need to get this translated so others can read it.
Title: Back To Camp

Description: I saw Mordigan run out of there like a dwarf possessed. I'll go chase him down and make sure he gets back to the others in one piece.

If you hug the cliff and jump down the waterfalls, you should be able to avoid stirring up any more of the gorlocs. 

See you back at camp.

 Quest Hand-in: It appears you've managed to return our dwarf. And in a single piece, no less. On behalf of both our team and the Dragonscale Expedition, I thank you. We'll get Mordigan some fluids, then start packing up. There's nothing in these hills save blood and salt.
Title: A Druid's Form

Description: Thank you for rescuing me, {name}. Allow me to aid you in your druidic studies.

To escape from the pit, I took on the form of a stag. I may know of a way you can learn to do the same.

Come with me. There is an ancient druid stone nearby. Let us use it to commune with the wilds.

 Quest Hand-in: Good! I can sense the blessing of the spirits flowing through you.Focus, and you should find that you can take on a new form.
Title: A Personal Favor

Description: Hmmm?  A box you say?  Or was it several?  Do you know what material the box was constructed from?

And what was the name of this merchant?  Empoor?  Are you certain that he's one of the Broken?  I don't do much business with their kind.

Perhaps my memory would be jogged if you were to do me a favor?

The Skithian arakkoa - primitive casters that they are - recently stole a huge shipment of my more exotic goods.  I want it all back!

You can find Veil Skith just to the south of Shattrath City.

 Quest Hand-in: Yes, indeed, I do believe that it's all getting clearer now.And I think that your diligence in this matter deserves more than just the information that you seek.
Title: Lay Them to Rest

Description: I would ask a favor, outsider.

As you step through the graves of ancient heroes, you will no doubt come across spirits of the restless dead, agitated by the Bonespeakers misdeeds. They must be returned to the earth where they are buried, so that they may be judged as well.

Take this bough - it carries with it the essence of the Runewood. Channel its power into a weakened spirit, and it will return to rest.

 Quest Hand-in: I see you carry a branch of the Runewood. Then it was you who laid the spirits to rest? Though I do not know your purpose, outsider, I appreciate what you have done for our people.
Title: Still Alive

Description: Wait, what was it that I heard? Was it... "feast on the dragons"? We must check on grandfather, right away!

Let me know when you're ready to depart.

 Quest Hand-in: No... we're too late!
Title: Meetup with the Caravan

Description: The pyramid inside of the Maker's Terrace in Uldum can be used as some kind of super weapon that will end all life on Azeroth.

<Harrison thinks a moment.>

You need to continue the research you've begun. Head to the southern end of Kalimdor, to the desert of Tanaris. There's a caravan there that's about to leave for Uldum.

Perhaps you can tag along.

 Quest Hand-in: Harrison sent you, hmm?How fortunate!
Title: Imposing Threat

Description: One of my scouts has returned with word of a mogu leader under the central tower. He needs to be removed.

Would you be willing to do this for me, {class}?

 Quest Hand-in: I appreciate what you've done for us this day, <name>.
Title: In the Name of Loken

Description: The iron dwarves stand as one of the fiercest and most coordinated foes in Northrend. Wherever we have traveled, they have battled us with the name of Loken on their lips.

We must learn who this Loken is and what he seeks. The locals may be of help.

To the northeast, at the Redwood Trading Post, a human named Hugh Glass peddles his wares. Further east, at the Ruins of Tethys, you'll find a stone giant named Gavrock. Ask them about this Loken. They've got to know something of use.

 Quest Hand-in: So he is the mastermind behind the iron dwarves? We must find out what he has been ordering the iron dwarves of Dun Argol to do.
Title: Jaded Heart

Description: The more powerful remnants of that horrible manifestation may be too much for you to handle on your own, {name}.

I fear I'd be of little help in terms of actual combat, but I can suggest a solution.

The great jade statue was soon to become a living serpent - one of our revered celestials. Its construction imbued it with special powers that may sufficiently weaken these adversaries.

 Quest Hand-in: <Cho looks at you despondently.>This jade was meant for... so much more.
Title: Special Access

Description: Mateo will have the other mirror shard we need to access the medallion. He is likely in my former manor in Archivam.

It is guarded by Nourman, a loyal dredger. Nourman is ever committed to his duties, regardless of the situation.

Mateo likely maintained the same rule to access the manor--possess the fangs of those granted access. If you collect the fangs of the commanders of his operation, Nourman will let you pass.

 Quest Hand-in: <Nourman carefully inspects the fangs.>Checks out. Strange that you got so many. Say, you don't look like a venthyr. <Nourman shrugs.>Don't matter to me. You got the fangs, you go inside. Them's the rules.
Title: The Boon of Alexstrasza

Description: You must understand, young {race}, that cleansing the body in favor of life anew is something well within my grasp... removing the plague of undeath without affecting the body, however, is beyond the scope of the powers that I control.

If this Bridenbrad is the beacon of light that you profess him to be, perhaps he will endure such a cleansing and thrive, but I cannot state with confidence that this is the salvation that you seek. Take it and go with all of my blessings.

 Quest Hand-in: The breath of Alexstrasza... you have gone to the dragon-queen herself? I'm extremely grateful.I understand the risks of such cleansing and I am prepared. Proceed, <class>.
Title: Salanar the Horseman

Description: The Four Horsemen will need perfect steeds. This is no simple task.

For the next step of our campaign, I have organized a mission to the Realm of Shadows.

The goal of the mission is to find Salanar the Horseman, leader of the Dark Riders, and summon him to Acherus.

The mission is currently waiting your assignment.

 Quest Hand-in: The Ebon Blade champions sent to the Realm of Shadows have successfully returned to Acherus.Salanar the Horseman will be arriving shortly to begin preparations for the dread steeds. You should meet with him when he arrives.
Title: To the Mor'shan Rampart

Description: Kadrak at the Mor'shan Rampart to the north is calling for aid.

The rampart rests on the border between the Northern Barrens and Ashenvale. It is the front line in the fight against the Alliance.

We're driving the night elves out of the forest. We'll claim its resources for the Horde!

To get there, take the Gold Road north out of the Crossroads.

Destiny calls!

 Quest Hand-in: You're the reinforcements that Thork sent?You'll do fine as long you can kill night elves. The forest is crawling with them.
Title: Shatter the Shards

Description: Atop the battlements of Corp'rethar, the Lich King's minions have erected three crystals, the shards of horror, despair, and suffering. Should our men reach the walls of Corp'rethar, he will unleash these weapons on our army.

In full effect, the crystals will afflict the minds of our men with paralyzing pain and fear. Then, the Scourge will be able to slaughter them at will.

Find these shards, destroy them, and bring me their broken remains. We cannot allow the Lich King to deploy these weapons!

 Quest Hand-in: <Thassarian takes the crystal shards from you and speaks in a quiet voice.>I remember these...Lesser men would easily crumble beneath their assault. You have done well in removing their threat.
Title: A Lashtail Hatchling

Description: Upon dealing the final blow to the lashtail eggs, you look down to see a newborn hatchling looking back up at you.  You can see it studying you, learning your features and following your movements.

The lashtail hatchling has formed a bond with you.

Your original assignment was to thin out the raptors, but you have fulfilled your egg quota, and this one is an innocent newborn.  Perhaps someone back at Grom'gol Base Camp will know what to do with a raptor hatchling.

 Quest Hand-in: Yes, the little one seems to have taken a liking to you.  I suppose that one raptor alone and raised among orcs is much less deadly than a whole pack of them.  Keep her, <name>... she may come in handy.In fact...
Title: This Ain't Mine

Description: Your arrival is timely, {name}. Sylvanas's loyalists have collapsed part of the canyon path to Orgrimmar. 

We are cut off from our vanguard and I fear that they will be destroyed if we cannot reinforce them quickly. Our forces are few in number. We cannot afford to leave them stranded for long.

Tinkmaster Overspark and Gazlowe believe they have a solution. Hurry and aid them however you can.

 Quest Hand-in: We may have rejoined the vanguard, but Sylvanas's forces have been harrying our front line.
Title: Rebuild Our Trust

Description: You still have the same strength you had before it seems.

The question is - do you have any loyalty left within you?

I have one more task so you can demonstrate that loyalty again.

 Quest Hand-in: So, you have done as we ask and are ready to rejoin our ranks?Once you complete this task with me you will leave your current Covenant and rejoin the Necrolords.
Title: WANTED: Worg Master Kruush

Description: The poster reads:

"Worg Master Kruush leads the worg riders of the Bleeding Hollow clan.  A price has been placed on his head, for his riders exact heavy tolls on supply trains to Spinebreaker Post."

"Scouts report him within Zeth'Gor, and the hero able to bring the severed head of this villain to me will earn the thanks of the Horde, and a large bounty."

"-Captain Darkhowl"

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, so you slew that villain, Kruush!  Well done, <name>!  Well done!  His death will defang those cursed worg riders.  In fact, I hope you took a few of them out during your foray into Zeth'Gor!Here's your reward.  You earned every piece of it!
Title: Taking Precautions

Description: I'd be wary of anyone identifying himself as the rightful owner of the crate and its contents. He didn't warn you of the danger?

Here's a better idea: let's work together to recover the crate and ensure that its contents can't hurt anyone. To protect ourselves, we're going to need a draught made from a few ingredients that can be found around the city.

Acquire some strange dust, get vials from an alchemy merchant, and pick some blood nettle from the fields north of the city.

 Quest Hand-in: Sometimes, I think I should've followed my father into alchemy.This concoction should protect us from the worst effects of carrying or handling the crate. Bottoms up!
Title: Curses & Cultists

Description: The wheat has been separated from the chaff. Now the fun can truly begin.

I have an exciting... field trip... planned for our students. But they are not yet ready. Take my grimoire and have the pandaren, zandalari, and tauren try their hand at curses. 

I found some uninvited guests loitering on the edges of our fairground. They should make excellent, if unwilling, test subjects.

Oman will have the honor of summoning the group far afield, and I will instruct him as such.

 Quest Hand-in: It worked! That grimoire of Madam Shadow's really is powerful...I hope I didn't startle you, <name>.
Title: Raptor Stalking

Description: It is time to step up the challenge.  Venturing into the jungle and bagging 10 lashtail raptors should be sufficient.  They will certainly be stronger than the raptors you have already disposed of.

The lashtail raptors mainly stay southeast of here, near the Kal'ai Ruins.

 Quest Hand-in: Hemet Nesingwary Jr. doubted you, but his doubts were unfounded.  You are absolutely destroying these raptors.
Title: Lost Records

Description: Some of the record keepers fled to this mountain when Korthia was pulled into the Maw.

I see no sign of them, but they may have left records behind. 

Take this beacon. I fashioned it using information from the previous record keepers you rescued.

It will lead you to any intact records that are on this mountain.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent. I should be able to extract the Primus's message from these records.
Title: The Heart of the Matter

Description: Well, laddie, half of me wishes I could stick around a while and take in the sights with ye.

I've seen some mighty amazin' things in my day, but this here takes the cake.

Sadly, I have a fair bit o' research ta do on these discs before I make my way into the Halls of Origination.

You seem ta be worth your salt, perhaps ye'd like ta tag along and see how a REAL archaeologist works, eh?

 Quest Hand-in: Bout time ye showed up, lad.Now let's get goin'! There be work ta do!
Title: Plant Pruning

Description: I have a hunting den not far from here where I gather my trophies as well as reagents for the Laughing Skull. Not long ago this giant plant monster charged in from the overgrowth and was killed by several of the giant rock monsters. Since it died smaller plant beasts have sprung up and made a mess of the place.

They have also cut me off from my best source of reagents. Kill them, I will attempt to reach my den and salvage what I can...

 Quest Hand-in: They just keep coming back! I would hate to lose this hunting ground. We shall find a way to clear this growth, I swear it.
Title: Garrison Campaign: Darktide Roost

Description: We are getting reports that Iron Horde warships are docking on a small island just south of Shadowmoon Valley.

We sent in some scouts, but we haven't heard back from them yet. It might be worth investigating.

Dungar Longdrink has a gryphon waiting for you when you are ready, commander.

 Quest Hand-in: These savages have no honor, it is time we deal with the Iron Horde presence on this island.
Title: Tomb of Sargeras: The Tomb's Mistress

Description: Slay the Naga Mistress who is tainting the denizens of the ocean beneath the Tomb.

 Quest Hand-in: Were you able to overcome the Tomb of Sargeras?
Title: Iron Docks

Description: The Iron Docks is one of the Iron Horde's greatest assets in this war. Our scouts have reported that the docks are alight with activity, indicating imminent attack.

Skulloc, son of Gruul, was seen leaving the Blackrock Foundry, armed to the teeth with powerful cannons, and has been loaded onto their mightiest warship. It does not matter where they intend to strike, commander - you must sack the Iron Docks and defeat Skulloc before they ever leave.

 Quest Hand-in: Without Skulloc and their precious docks, da Iron Horde be a wolf pack trapped within their own cave... unable to hunt.
Title: Oh Sheepie...

Description: Sigh... you guessed it... Sheepie is gone... AGAIN.

Stupid sheep! Gives me so much trouble!

I hate to ask you again, but I promise this will be the last time.

Can you find him for me?

 Quest Hand-in: What? Sheepie is... gone?<Chee Chee's lip begins to quiver.>
Title: Path of Wisdom

Description: You seek to continue down the path of wisdom?

 Quest Hand-in: You continue to prove yourself, <name>.  Accept this, not as a gift, but as a tool for the fight against the Scourge.
Title: Hope Never Dies

Description: So, mortal, you are here looking for someone. Well it just so happens that, clever as I am, it's quite possible I know where they are.

Allow me to propose a trade. That amulet you carry... it holds an interesting power.

You give me the amulet, and I will help you find this Maldraxxi baron.

And then you will leave. I don't mean to be rude, but I really prefer to keep a low profile.

Allow me to speed things along.

 Quest Hand-in: Keep up. We have little time.
Title: Smooth as Butter

Description: Screed likes to say his flying is as "smooth as butter." I think "butterfingered" is more like it!

Take a look at the wreckage over there. He calls it a "rough" landing.

Sure, we got shot at, but I'd be willing to cut him a little more slack if he didn't brag about his piloting skills so often!

I think I'm going to make him a batch of wings to drive the point home. To the east, in the Valley of Bones, you'll find bonestripper buzzards. Their wings are plump, juicy, and perfect for my needs.

 Quest Hand-in: Ravager Eggs.  Bam!Hellboar Bacon. Bam!Buzzard Wings. Bam!  Bam!What a great meal.  You've really got to try it.
Title: Bearer of Good Fortune

Description: This key appears to be for the animal cages spread throughout Cliffspring Hollow. Tharnariun would surely appreciate if you took advantage of the situation to free some of the uncorrupted duskrats and thistle bears that are still being held captive.

 Quest Hand-in: I am pleased to hear that you were able to free some of the remaining wildlife. With a bit of good fortune, we will find the cure for the corruption that the others have faced before any more of them die.
Title: A Nose for Magic

Description: I have it! The readings from the ruins are unmistakable. Somewhere to the south and west of the ah... "foot", as it were, is a source of great magical energy.

It can be nothing but the Eye of Xibala!

We will need to place a few more scrying vessels to pinpoint the Eye's exact location.

Meet me deeper in the ruins. I will personally oversee this effort.

 Quest Hand-in: I seem to have overestimated the ah... accuracy... of my scrying.And thus, our enemies have located the Eye first.
Title: Restless Death

Description: What could lead someone to do this... 

I can perform a ritual that might aid these poor creatures passing on. Take these totems and place them along the river. With enough anchor points, I should be able to help them move on.

We'll move ahead to look for a ritual site.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you, <name>. Give me a moment. We will begin the ritual shortly. Let us hope we can bring rest to these souls.
Title: The Good People of Hearthglen

Description: See those reagents over there?  And these supplies right here?  Those belong to the Argent Crusade.

Gnolls are known for thievery, but as far as I know, Hearthglen hasn't had any incursions since the Redpine came.  Very suspicious.

I know a few helpful folks within Hearthglen: Morris Vant, Outfitter Mendelev, Bree Ironstock, and High Cleric Alphus.  All can be trusted, and are well-connected.  Question them, to find out if they know anything about these lost supplies.

 Quest Hand-in: Did you notice, <name>?  Many names were mentioned, but one name was mentioned far more than the others.Bisp.
Title: Belly Full of Fae

Description: The local flora have gone somewhat wild during this anima drought.

It seems they swallowed most of the young fae who were tending to the wildseeds here.

At least now we know where they've been.

Oh, don't worry. This isn't the first time this has happened. We can last quite a while inside those plants.

Take my dagger. Use it to cut through the shrubbery and free the other wildseed tenders.

 Quest Hand-in: Great work. This should help get the Tranquil Pools back to normal.I admit, I had thought the worst when I couldn't find any of the tenders. I'm glad they were only eaten by the local vegetation.
Title: The Twilight Prophet

Description: The missive reads as follows:

"The Hour of Twilight is upon us. The world-shaman Thrall approaches Wyrmrest with the Dragon Soul in hand, feebly whimpering one final threat to destroy our glorious master."

"Stop Thrall, and we win our war. I will be watching you from nearby."

   ~ The Twilight Prophet

 Quest Hand-in: It is truly as we foresaw: Benedictus was the Twilight Prophet. And now he is no more.We dealt a mighty bow to the Twilight's Hammer today. Let us hope that it was a deathblow.
Title: The Slumbering King

Description: A sheaf of parchment drops from the still hand of the overlord. Upon it you can discern the outline of the rituals that are taking place in the catacombs below.

However, it appears that the queen of the vrykul, Angerboda, is having difficulty awakening King Ymiron. The ritual is taking place within the large chamber, known as the Winter's Terrace, on the north end of Gjalerbron.

If you hurry, you may be able to stop her before it is too late.

 Quest Hand-in: I'm not sure that I like the sound of that one bit! The Lich King absconding with Ymiron can only mean trouble. Unfortunate that you weren't able to kill him along with his queen.Still, you've put a huge dent in their plans and bought us the valuable time that we need.And who knows, with the way you get around, you'll likely run into King Ymiron again. I'm sure that he won't fare so well the next time you meet.
Title: A Lovely Apple for Ella

Description: How are you today, {name}?

 Quest Hand-in: Really? For me?Such a lovely apple shouldn't be eaten alone.Here, please have half.
Title: Darkblaze, Brood of the Worldbreaker

Description: As Troteman cuts out, the world around you grows eerily silent. In the distance you see a full grown black dragon!

 Quest Hand-in: <A single tear rolls down Troteman's left cheek.>They died in defense of the Alliance. In defense of our kingdom! Heroes, all of them, and they will be laid to rest as such.
Title: The Essence of Time

Description: It is about time that I revealed to you my purpose on this island.

The bronze dragonflight's powers have diminished greatly - we can now only catch furtive glimpses through time. It is... quite frustrating.

But we are not entirely without means. I hold in my hand the Vision of Time, an artifact of my own creation. The creatures of this isle have passed through time, and may carry with them some of its essence. With it, we will fill the hourglass, granting us a window into the timeways once more.

 Quest Hand-in: Epoch stones are quite rare. The crystallized essence of time, they require a rapid passage through the ages to form. Their presence here indicates that the island may not exist in one time at all, but shift rapidly from timeway to timeway.That is of little importance at the moment, though. There are important moments in time that require our attention. Give me a moment to grind the stone and add it to the Vision of Time hourglass.
Title: A Moment's Respite

Description: Anduin insisted that our allies would come for us. I confess I had begun to doubt him.

I'm sure you have many questions. I'll do what I can to provide answers, but I'm afraid even after...
