What has it been... weeks? Longer? Time loses all meaning in a place of such darkness.

Forgive me. Let me tell you what little I can.

 Quest Hand-in: I need time to recover after that battle. Thrall could use rest, too.While we rest, perhaps you and Mograine can seek answers.
Title: Building a Perimeter

Description: We are prepared to try to construct a perimeter around the village using the energy source taken from the blood elves. I can't guarantee that it will work, but we have to attempt it.

Otherwise, the mana creatures will surely continue devouring the spirits of the fallen Kirin Tor.

Use this device at the small runes around the perimeter of town to release the energy there. If I've woven the field correctly, we should start noticing a difference once you've used the device at each point.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent work. Keep your fingers crossed, <name>. I'm going to activate the shield.
Title: Pterrortorial Dispute

Description: De courtyard of Zanchul has been overrun by pterrordaxes driven mad by some dark ritual. Power is coalescing here, and it is hard to tell who or what is causing it.

I need to track down de source. In de meantime, you take dis, de power of Gonk, and call his allies to help you in battle. Slay dese maddened pterrordaxes.

When you are done, tell Raal to get his flock under control.

 Quest Hand-in: Did you have to kill so many?
Title: Silkwing Cocoons

Description: The silk from the cocoons of the silkwings are used for all manner of things in the village. We can never get enough, and we never have enough.

It is difficult to harvest the cocoons from the larva once they begin the process of metamorphosis.

Our warriors are occupied with the assault on our village. If you could gather these for us, that would be helpful.

 Quest Hand-in: Good quality cocoons, these. I can see you've gotten the hang of harvesting them.We have experimented with trying to raise our own silkwing larva, but unfortunately the small ones do not produce enough silk to be of use to us.
Title: Little Pamela

Description: The battle for Darrowshire still haunts me, {race}.  I wake up in cold sweats, convinced that I'm still there; that it is happening all over again.

I've coped with the loss of my comrades, but the loss of my family members is still cripplingly painful.  One of my kin lost during the attack was my young niece, Pamela.

If you are brave enough to enter Darrowshire, will you search for any sign of Pammy?  Darrowshire's ruins are due south of here.

 Quest Hand-in: Hello.  I'm Pamela, what's your name?
Title: How to Catch a Glimmerfly

Description: Yes! Proper tools collected. Now to catch glimmerflies!

Anima drought more severe in northern pools. Many Starving Glimmerflies, most eager to drink from our animyllis blooms.

Place blooms, then while glimmerflies are drinking attach to filaments! Then return to me.

 Quest Hand-in: <Kowalskos gets very excited> Wow! It worked! I hope they hold me up, too!
Title: Battle At The Iron Front

Description: The war against the Iron horde rages on.

Not far from here at The Iron Front, our warriors are engaged in mortal combat with the enemy. They fight tenaciously and with great fury, but the losses have been severe.

Go to The Iron Front and show the enemy that we will not falter in this war.

Show them that we fight as wolves!

 Quest Hand-in: Thanks to your aid, we have gained a foothold at The Iron Front. Soon, Gul'dan and the Iron Horde will have nowhere else to run.
Title: Culling the Furbolg Threat

Description: Directly to the north of Astranaar are the Thistlefur furbolg. My scouts report that their numbers have grown greatly over the past few months. If they grow too great, they may find the courage to attack Astranaar directly!

Go to Thistlefur Village and kill as many of their kind as you can.

I shall remain here in Astranaar and await word from you. Elune be with you, {class}.

 Quest Hand-in: Well done, <name>.We are under constant threat from the furbolg. Hopefully this will keep them at bay for a bit longer.
Title: Orientation: Iskaara

Description: Welcome to Iskaara, friend.

Word of your exploits in Brackenhide has already spread among our people. You have already met many of us, and there are more who would like the chance to exchange knowledge and wares with you.

Please, take a moment to familiarize yourself with some of the friendly faces around Iskaara. We are a community that supports one another, so just as you have much to offer us, many of our people have much to offer you in return.

 Quest Hand-in: I hope you have a pleasant time in Iskaara. As you know now, many us are fine craftsmen and merchants. I encourage you to continue to ask around and learn what all of my people have to offer.
Title: Securing the Beach Head

Description: Something troubles me, {name}. The Twilight dragons knew just where and when to strike our airfleet. It's as if they knew our plans.

Twilight spies cower within our midst!

I'm going to take one of our remaining ships back to Orgrimmar to roll some heads. I need you to stay behind and secure this front. The Dragonmaw shaman are powerful; I have asked them to open up a portal to Orgrimmar, and I need you to help.

So. Start helping!

 Quest Hand-in: Your Warchief is decisive, <name>. He makes things happen. I like him.Let's talk about this portal that he wants!
Title: She Loves Me, She Loves Me NOT!

Description: Oh, sweetie! You're never going to guess who's down in the slave pits to the north.

<Sassy shakes her head sadly at you.>

Candy's down there, and she's working for the Trade Prince. She dropped you like a bad habit and now she's working for the other team. but it gets worse. Since you "dealt" with Chip, she's dating the Trade Prince!

I don't know about you, but if she were my ex, I'd rip her fickle heart right out of her chest.

 Quest Hand-in: I'm sure she deserved it, <name>. She should never have betrayed you like that.It gives me the shivers to think that she might have kissed that monster, the Trade Prince!
Title: The Third Trial of Ursol

Description: You've proven to me your strength and your courage, but do you possess the ability to apply yourself when it matters most?

This final trial will reveal all.

 Quest Hand-in: You have passed every trial I've placed before you and emerged victorious. You are worthy indeed of my brother's legacy, and have earned my blessing!Go, seek out the claws and claim them as your own.
Title: Zonya the Sadist

Description: {name}, a rare opportunity has arisen that I think you will be interested in.

Zonya the Sadist in southern Stonetalon Mountains has returned to the battle scene. I must suggest that you face her to further hone your own abilities as a tamer.

 Quest Hand-in: Did you enjoy the taste of victory? It'll be your last, mon. Things do not get easier from here.
Title: Blueprint: Microbot XD

Description: <This blueprint details how to build what appears to be an adorable miniature robot.

You should be able to upload the blueprint to Pascal-K1N6's database in Rustbolt.>

 Quest Hand-in: Have you recovered a new blueprint, my fleshy friend?I will add it to my database posthaste.
Title: The Bronze Dragonshrine

Description: Sometimes High-Oracle Soo-say tell stories about a shrine to dragon-things, not like great rain stone, but different. Soo-say tell us maybe we see ourselves there, but not like in a shiny. Soo-say mean we could see what we are like many years from now.

You take us there? We remember shrine to bronze dragon-things in place called Dragonblight. Soo-say say great rain stone show him shrine to northeast of Wyrmrest Temple, or northwest of place dryskins call Wintergarde Keep. We go?

 Quest Hand-in: We very glad you brought us here, <name>. We always worried what would happen to us when the orphan matron found us in Sholazar.
Title: A Champion Rises

Description: Congratulations, {name}. You have mastered many kinds of combat and overcome all the challenges you've faced. There can be no doubt that you are ready to compete with the best warriors who have gathered at the tournament, against the champions of the capital cities.

Justicar Mariel Trueheart has asked to speak with you, {name}, and to formally enter you in the champions' grand melee.

 Quest Hand-in: I welcome you as a champion of the tournament, <name>. As a champion, you will be able to compete for the grand championship of the tournament. You may also choose to become a valiant with another Alliance city's delegation and in time, a champion for that city as well.All champions must have the assistance of a squire, <name>, and you are no exception. Allow me to appoint one of ours to accompany you in battle. He will proudly carry the banner of any city that has named you a champion.
Title: Network Security

Description: We must lock down the facility. Otherwise my esteemed colleagues from the palace could uncover my secrets, which puts any teleporters I build for you and Thalyssra at risk.

<The inactive attunement device near Oculeth hums to life.>

This will take us to my secret test chamber beneath the mountain. From there we can begin the lockdown sequence and make our escape!

 Quest Hand-in: Did we... make it?
Title: Assault on the Heart of Shattrath

Description: Sargerei forces from deep in Shattrath have grown stronger and bolder by the day. We can no longer risk ignoring the threat that they pose.

Bring allies if you wish to face the Sargerei so deep within the city.

 Quest Hand-in: News about da assault beat ya back, boss-mon. And some spoils of the fightin'.Ya be a force to be reckonin' with.
Title: Nature Provides

Description: This is interesting, it says that leystone reacts violently with anything it views as a contaminant. Our foreign-mined flux was enough to cause the small explosion.

Local ingredients, however, have learned to coexist with leystone. Up in Highmountain, an herb called foxflower grows that can be turned into a suitable flux.

Go and gather some foxflower that we can turn into a usable flux.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent work. Let's get these turned into flux right away.
Title: Learning From the Dead

Description: I heard you were traveling to Black Rook Hold.

It was once home to the legendary Lord Ravencrest, a brilliant tactician. His knowledge may be exactly what we need to give us an edge against the Duskwatch.

While you are at the Rook, keep your eyes peeled for any books that might have survived the ages that outline the Ravencrest's strategems.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent. The knowledge in these books should prove very useful in the days to come.
Title: Tears of Pandaria

Description: All of this started with our ponds. In a single day, all of the water retreated down into the earth. When there was no more water in the ponds, it began to fall from the sky.

Despite endless torrents of rain, the ponds do not fill. It's as if the land itself thirsts and cannot be quenched.

Now the ponds birth horrific manifestations of despair. Elementals made of water from the sky and salt from the earth; the tears of Pandaria.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you, <class>.It's time we take back our land from this curse.
Title: Snacks for Stonehead

Description: <Stonehead has amassed a wide variety of half-eaten oddities.

He'd certainly appreciate you bringing some new, creative snacks for him to try.>

 Quest Hand-in: <Stonehead's eyes light up when he sees the massive pile of semi-edible delicacies you brought him.>You best bud! Best bud free to go wherever he want!
Title: Crisis at the Sunwell

Description: By the naaru, I thank you, {race}, for your efforts.

Our work is far from finished, however, and I must request that you undertake a critical mission - one as important as any I've issued.

Our forces are spread thinly. To compound the strain, we've had to dispatch a contingent to Azeroth to investigate developments at the Sunwell Plateau.

You are needed there, {name}. Report to Larethor. Tell him that I wish we could spare more men.

 Quest Hand-in: Another soldier from Shattrath? A welcome sight!Wish there were more of you, but we'll make due with what we have. Whatever's going on out here won't wait for us to make ready.Have a look around, <class>. There's much that needs doing. Pitch in and do your share.
Title: A Particular Process

Description: As you might have noticed, Vintner Iltheux is very particular about his wine making process, but his ancient recipe was crafted with only the Nightborne in mind. 

We need something different to please the diverse palates of the Horde!

Talk to Nomi and see what he has in mind to spice things up.

 Quest Hand-in: Good to see you again, <name>. I've already made improvements to the vintner's recipe.
Title: Lightning Strike Assassination

Description: The base of the tower is patrolled by the Captain's elite guards. So here's what we're going to do: we're going to grapple straight up to the top, slice-and-dice the VIPs, and bail out using my portable low-altitude parachute. I'll rig the tower to explode behind us. You be sure to grab Captain Grunwald's head for Chawg. Got it?

Do NOT accept this mission unless you are prepared for UNMITIGATED BADASSERY. Is that clear? 

 Quest Hand-in: I'm impressed by the cleverness of our new goblin allies, but I'm even more impressed by you, <name>. Look at the gaze of terror frozen onto the Captain's face! He never saw your attack coming. Imagine the fear this will cause in Northwatch when they see what happened to one of their precious officers in night elf lands.Well done, <class>. Our assault proceeds...
Title: Hags of a Feather

Description: The drogbar you freed me from were unusually aggressive. The tribe in the nearby caves seems to be apart from the rest of them, but that didn't stop the Bloodtotem from going on the offensive just in case, capturing some of their number.

That move left the woods exposed to the harpies, however. Your help dealing with these witches would not go unnoticed by Torok. Bring back their feathers as proof of death.

 Quest Hand-in: I could hear them screeching from here. With this victory and the defeat of the Witch of the Wood, Torok will surely be willing to see you.
Title: Set Them Ablaze!

Description: I'm not sure if ye've noticed, but my tower's much taller than any o' the other towers here around the Gorge.  Some dwarves pride themselves at how deep they can dig, but not me.  Sometimes I think I shoulda been born a Wildhammer.

I still don't like the sight o' those other towers, though.  Reachin' up like that, ticklin' my tower's feet.  Here, take this torch, an' use it on the braziers atop those other towers.  They'll be sorry they ever built 'em to begin with.

 Quest Hand-in: Looks like ye know how to light things on fire!  An admirable trait in any <race>, for sure.
Title: Retrieving the Goods

Description: <Audi looks around and then lowers her voice.>

I'm sure Shauly told you a bit about our work here. When Jaxon and I are out in the field 'hunting,' we've been collecting pieces of the ethereal eco-dome generators and hiding them in the nests of our prey, the raptors in Eco-Dome Farfield.

It's a remote area to the northeast of the Stormspire, close to the Netherstone. I don't anticipate you'll run into many ethereals there, but would you be willing to help us collect the dome generator pieces?

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent work! The most difficult part of the project is done. Now, all we need is a way to get these back to Area 52 and attract the interest of the Cenarion Expedition as well. There should be enough here for our own needs and to earn a little profit on the side.
Title: The Fate of Sylvanas

Description: The time has come.

Let this bring the dark saga of Sylvanas Windrunner to a close and herald a new dawn for the Shadowlands.

Speak to me, and we will begin.

 Quest Hand-in: How could I possibly pass judgment to Tyrande's satisfaction when she and her people were the ones most wronged by the Banshee Queen?
Title: A Bloody Treat

Description: I have heard that a clan of the mogu called the Dokani have mastered the harnessing of life force into a substance they call "anima."

If this stuff is indeed life condensed into a liquid form, then it could have spectacular properties when applied to our aqir larva.

Go see if you can bring back some of this anima in a form that we can use. We'll see if our little friend here likes it!

 Quest Hand-in: He sure took a liking to that! I guess it helps that it's blood-flavored.I'll keep note of any changes the anima causes in our friend's growth.
Title: A Spirit's Might

Description: I seek to understand more about the Martial beings in this realm.

If you could place one in a wildseed, as you did for me, I could observe the restoration process.

 Quest Hand-in: This is nothing like my home world, but it is still quite fascinating.
Title: The Captive Engineer

Description: Argh... I'm sorry, {name}, but I'm too weak to fight. They kept me alive, but just barely.

I'll keep an eye on the mole machine while you look for Thaelin. He should be somewhere close!

 Quest Hand-in: <name>! Oh, yer a sight for sore eyes!The prototype mole machine was able to track me here all the way from the shop? I even impress myself sometimes.Now that I know Hansel is safe, I can enact the brilliant escape plan I've been working on. Glad to have ye here for this!
Title: Supporting the Troops

Description: I'm no military expert, but this battle looks to be in our favor.  Our defenders are equally matched with their deathguards, but the farmers' militia has taken them by surprise from the rear.  For the Alliance!

Still, we should all do what we can to make sure that we win.  Travel east into Andorhal and slay the Forsaken deathguards that are fighting with our men.  The sooner they die, the quicker we can re-take Andorhal!

 Quest Hand-in: You fight well, <name>.  I wish I had your ability... and your bravery.
Title: Finding One's True Purpose

Description: All our efforts have led us here.

With the combined wisdom of the Archivists, and a little help from a {race} {class}, we will attune the Lodestaff to the relics that we seek.

Should we succeed, we will have what we need to re-establish the Archive.

Our sacred work can then continue.

 Quest Hand-in: So much has been taken from us. And yet, due to Roh-Senara's sacrifice, there is hope.
Title: The Zapthrottle Mote Extractor!

Description: The swamp gas is truly amazing, and can be very useful, mon!  But first, you gotta be able to suck it up, and that, my friend, requires a Zapthrottle Mote Extractor.

Now, I could just give you the schematics, but I'll need something in return first.  How about some spare parts?  Last time I checked, there were plenty lying around near the broken steam pump at the Dead Mire, far to the northeast.

I heard that the withered giants spread the pieces all over that dried-out lake bed.

 Quest Hand-in: Alright!  Now if we only had a stretchy loop, a parchment clamp, a guzzle tube and some sticky duck ribbon.  Then we could really make something!Ok, ok, I guess you've earned this, <name>.  Have fun!
Title: Into the Pit

Description: Besting a tethered opponent is one thing.  Fighting other bear riders on equal footing is another.

Head into the Pit of the Fang and use what you've learned to defeat your opponents.  Good luck, sister.

Glory awaits, should you succeed.

 Quest Hand-in: You really did it!  You made it out with your health.  Wish we could say the same for your bear.It's going to take a while for her to recover.  Fortunately you won't need her for a while.
Title: Time for War

Description: You should return to Nathanos Blightcaller to begin working with The Honorbound.

 Quest Hand-in: <Nathanos looks over the gathered resources.>This should do it.
Title: Suspicious Hoofprints

Description: Rows of hoofprints lead away from the still-smoking skeleton of the Shady Rest Inn. There are at least a few visible impressions, with more rows of prints almost imperceptible in the soft mud of the marsh.

 Quest Hand-in: Hoofprints, eh? It is true that there is an extraordinary amount of centaur activity in the lands near the Dustwallow Marsh. In brief excursions into the Barrens, we found their camps and holdings dotting the area.I'll send out Falgran Hastil, one of our trackers, to see if he can find where the tracks lead.
Title: Something in Your Mind

Description: <Looking into the crystal, the light around you is slowly drowned in inky smoke. An imposing presence crushes down on you, whispering unintelligibly in your ear. Looking for the source, you see nothing, but the sensation grows. Your head begins to swim as the darkness deepens and the noise becomes deafening.

Summoning all your willpower to steel your resolve...

The light has returned, the noise silenced, and you stand with a humble crystal in your hand.

Perhaps Wrathion knows more about it...>

 Quest Hand-in: <Wrathion's brow furrows when he sees the crystal.>It is fortunate you brought this to me. Impressive that you were able to handle it while retaining your sanity. In fact... this may provide us with an opportunity.<Wrathion strokes his chin, lost in thought.>I will not mince words, <name>. This will certainly prove dangerous. However, I have full confidence that you are up to the task. Now, let us wield N'Zoth's own power against him.
Title: Exploring Our Past

Description: With your help, we can now delve deeper into the secrets of this land.

Nearby lay the Zskera Vaults. Within these large underground chambers, Neltharion stored various treasures and forgotten research. Exploring these vaults would be most beneficial.

Please travel with Tacha and Jeb and assist them as needed.

 Quest Hand-in: Behind these massive doors lies a multitude of chambers to explore. Are you ready, <name>?
Title: Fourth and Goal

Description: It's all up to you, kid. You demolished the Steamwheedle Sharks, so now all that's left to do is to kick the winning goal.

<The coach leans in close and whispers in your ear.>

Now, just between you and me, I think we should do this one right. I don't want you to just kick a goal... I want you to kick it so far it sails between the two smokestacks behind the goal!

I've modified the footbomb to give you the extra power that you'll need.

Now get out there and make me proud!

 Quest Hand-in: Uh... you did it, kid. You REALLY did it! We won the game and....DID YOU SEE THAT DRAGON?!!!
Title: Trial of the Naaru: Strength

Description: Four trials you must pass before you are deemed worthy by the naaru.

The trial of strength is divided in two. You must destroy the leader of the Coilfang Steamvaults, Warlord Kalithresh, and bring me his trident. Slay the extra-planar being known as Murmur, in the Shadow Labyrinth of Auchindoun, and bring me his essence.

Do this and you will have passed the trial of strength.

 Quest Hand-in: Well done, <name>. You have passed the trial of strength.
Title: Sealing Fate: Piles of Marks of Honor

Description: These seals provide an additional chance at treasure in dungeons and raids, but at what cost? Killing others isn't honorable, and yet you collect marks for honor? I suppose I can use those marks for an additional treasure. That is the offer I present.

Remember, you can only obtain three seals per week. This counts as one of those three. Next week, I will have others.

 Quest Hand-in: A simple exchange with complex results.  That's the art of doing business.
Title: Wicked Webs

Description: Some of our scouts have not reported back for duty. We fear they have succumbed to the deadly spiders in the vicinity.

Hope may not be lost, however. The spiders often wrap up their live prey in cocoons for later consumption.

Go search the pillars to the north for cocooned victims. You may yet be able to save some of our brethren.

 Quest Hand-in: Our lost allies have already made it back. They are shaken, but alive. Thank you for rescuing them.
Title: Blood Knight

Description: The power of the ranseur has been spent, but we are victorious! With Vorath defeated, perhaps the Scourge will be more easily dealt with--thanks to you.

Meet me back in Silvermoon. Your efforts and heroism today will not go unrecognized.

 Quest Hand-in: Congratulations, and well earned.
Title: A Worthy Weapon

Description: Of all the times to have such rotten luck!

My tournament blade has gone missing. I've heard the bards telling tales of travelers offering winter hyacinths to a lonely maiden in return for gifts. Those hyacinths grow only on the ice flowing from the Ironwall Dam, on Crystalsong Forest's northwestern border with Icecrown. Gather the flowers and take them to the circle of lamps in Drak'Mar Lake in northeastern Dragonblight, near Zul'Drak and Grizzly Hills. Ask the lonely maiden for a worthy blade.

 Quest Hand-in: This is a fine weapon that will help me crush the competition. Thank you, <name>.
Title: The Earth Gives Way

Description: You may stay here to see what comes of this relic, or meet me afterward in Loamm. That is Honeypelt's home, which she offered us respite at while you were still in the cave.

I would only ask that you check on Wrathion. He may be a ceaselessly buzzing pest, yes, but... these recent events force me to admit I care for his well-being too.  

There are only so many black dragons left. We must look out for each other.

 Quest Hand-in: Is that depressing lump of moods, Sabellian, alright?...What? I care enough to at least ask about him!
Title: Freezing the Pipes

Description: It's time to break out the I-Scream Cryocannon!

We lifted the tech from the frost cannons on the river boats. If it's one thing that we gnomes are good at, it's miniaturization by way of making everything else that much bigger!

I need you to take the cannon down there into the cave and freeze the pipes we setup in the walls. That'll jumpstart them.

 Quest Hand-in: Do you hear that, <name>? That's the sweet hum of the refrigeration kicking in.We'll be able to store our inventory down there in no time. Thank you!
Title: Necessary Harvest

Description: Between the Mawsworn attacks and your presence here, our supplies are dwindling. It pains me to say it, but the most immediate solution for replenishing our resources is the local wildlife. 

It is unfortunate that it has come to this, but it is what must be done. Cull some of the local wildlife, and help us replenish our supplies.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you. Your efforts are greatly appreciated.
Title: The Windrunner's Fate

Description: Finding Sylvanas is our only priority!

We will cover more ground if we split up. I will lead a team into the hills above the enemy's camp while you search the wreckage itself for any signs of the crew.

Once we've cleared the high ground, I will meet you at the far end of the beach.

 Quest Hand-in: So, she escaped after all...
Title: Return More Lost Souls

Description: Souls still continue to pour into the Maw. Can you venture out again to save more?

We must thwart his plans.

Return to the Maw and rescue any more that you can.

 Quest Hand-in: Oh, you found so many more deserving souls!I will make sure these souls are well taken care of here in Ardenweald.
Title: Brew of the Month Club

Description: Membership has its privileges.  Being part of the "Brew of the Month" club means knowing where to get the latest and greatest brew.

Bring your "Brew of the Month" club membership form to Larkin Thunderbrew in the Stonefire Tavern in Ironforge.

 Quest Hand-in: Your paperwork looks to be in order.  Welcome to the club, <name>!You can expect to get our mail at the start of every month.  If you like what you got, stop by and we can sell you some more.  This is the club that keeps on giving.
Title: Werk In Progress

Description: We received an... unusual delivery recently. I'm still in a bit of shock.

Some sort of flying contraption released a huge crate just overhead, parachute and all. If it weren't for the wind it would have landed nearby. Instead, it drifted down the hill below.

They left a note too. It would have been lost had it not been wrapped around a sizeable rock.

<Darkrider Arly massages a spot on her forehead.>

I don't know what it is, but if it'll help clear out the area, I'm all for it.

 Quest Hand-in: I was not expecting that!
Title: The Focus on the Beach

Description: The mage hunter forces are active on the Glittering Strand to the south of Moonrest Gardens. My guess is that you'll find a heavily guarded focus on the beach and a captain who is in charge of it.

No doubt the captain will have some sort of controlling device on their person. Get the controller and use it on the focus.

With any luck, we'll be able to get some more information about what they're really up to out there.

 Quest Hand-in: How very odd that it imprinted this information upon you magically.So, not only do we know that they've redirected the flow of the power coming out of the Moonrest Gardens, but we now know that the power is being purposefully changed in some way. Just what are they up to with all of that magic?I don't like where this is leading, <name>, not one bit!
Title: Orcish Groceries

Description: In here is a recipe for the traditional feast left for the ancestors at the Kosh'harg by the clans. We're going to have to substitute some ingredients that, you know, no longer exist... 

But it will for the better! We'll bring some Azeroth flair to this traditional dish!

I will teach you each piece of the recipe, but it will be up to you to gather the ingredients and actually cook it. Orc traders have come from all over, so you should be able to find everything you need right here in Razor Hill.

 Quest Hand-in: We tracked down everything on our list! What's next?
Title: Rulers of Dire Maul

Description: Now that we've put the hurt on them at the ruins, it's time to attack the ogres in their own territory.

The Gordok are the "upper class" of the Gordunni clan, chosen to defend Dire Maul. They'll know we mean business once we start taking out their strongest members.

Nothing fancy here, {name}. Just get out there and crack some Gordok skulls.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent! Even these fools will soon know that to stand against the Horde means death.
Title: The Feast of Winter Veil

Description: Here - if you are interested in learning more about the Feast of Winter Veil, read this book.  While I think our recognition of the legend is the appropriate one, I'm enough of a scholar to appreciate the collection of all information into a single source.

When you're done, take the book to Muradin Bronzebeard.  I know for a fact he'd be interested in hearing that others have taken an interest in the older legends.  

 Quest Hand-in: The legends and lore surrounding the Winter Veil are ones that have faded from the forefront of public thought over the years.  While I recognize that the goblins are helping to revive the season for their own ends, the fact that the citizenry thinks about it at least in some form does good to keep such lore alive.Your desire to go beyond the material and learn about our past is an admirable trait, young <class>.  I salute your erudite nature.
Title: Bell of Remembrance

Description: <The bell is scratched and damaged. You remember the Curator being very interested in this item.

Maybe someone at the Crypt of the Forgotten will know more.>

 Quest Hand-in: Greetings, Maw Walker.Why have you come to me? I have heard so much about you.
Title: How's the Hunter Holding Up?

Description: Tings ain't looking good.  Dat panther was under some powerful magic.  We better check on dat hunter an' see how he be doin'.

 Quest Hand-in: Oh... Me spine...  Brother, is that you?
Title: No Stone Unbroken

Description: When the warring clans came into the Vale, the Baruk deigned themselves worthy to lay claim to the ancient grounds of Guo-Lai.

They are not.

Show these usurpers their place, and you may earn a modicum of favor with the Rajani.

 Quest Hand-in: The Baruk will soon learn their place under the foot of the Rajani.Well done.
Title: Recruiting The Troops

Description: As her name suggests, Imp Mother Dyala is adept at summoning imps.

While the council controls Dreadscar Rift, her services will be ours to use as we see fit.

Speak to her if you wish to train a pack of imps.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent. These troops will be invaluable in our defense of the Broken Isles. Deploy them on missions, just as you would with our champions.
Title: Reactivate the Constructs

Description: We sent a number of our war constructs north into Needlerock Slag, but none of them ever returned. We know that the stone trogg mystics have done something to them.

What we're concerned about is that the mystics will control and turn them against us, like they have with the fungal giants.

{name}, go into the stone trogg town and reactivate the constructs.

 Quest Hand-in: That was a nice bit of work, <name>.With our constructs back up and running behind their main lines, it's only a matter of time now before we make the big push through and rescue the Stonefather.
Title: Plague...Plague Everywhere!

Description: The best part about this plague is that even when it visually fades away, the remaining residue is still quite potent! However, we still have an enormous area to cover before we're done, with plenty of Godfrey's defenses in the way.

It appears that the spirits that served Baron Silverlaine and Commander Springvale in life now guard them in death, and Godfrey is using them to deter us. Show them all the iron will of the Forsaken!

 Quest Hand-in: Cromush has both a thick skull and a fool's brain, and we'll use that to our advantage. By the time anybody finds out about the plague's true potency, it'll be far too late.Thank you for keeping quiet during his tirade. I promise you won't regret it.
Title: Capture More Dispatches

Description: Despite our efforts, the Horde continues to send scouts to the area of the Icecrown Glacier, to the west of the Ironwall Rampart and Aldur'thar.

We can't afford to let the Horde gain the upper hand with this scouting operation. Take the dart gun with you again and show the Orgrim's Hammer scouts no mercy! Bring the captured dispatches to me.

The Horde's wasted efforts will be our gain.

 Quest Hand-in: <The high captain accepts the dispatches.>This is just what we need. Not even the Horde is so stupid as to charge in blindly against the Scourge. With their reports in hand, we'll be well prepared.
Title: Old Stonetusk

Description: I have a grim task for you, {name}. Not every kill is a measure of skill. Some are measures of kindness. 

There's an old bull mammoth wandering the forest east of Camp Antonidas. I saw him from a distance awhile back, and I hear his sad trumpeting every so often. Clearly he's in great pain.

He's started crashing blindly through the undergrowth, and I'm worried he's becoming a danger to others. 

It'd make my old heart glad if you put a fellow weary soul to rest. Bring me his tusk so we can honor him.

 Quest Hand-in: This brings me no joy.But I'll hang his tusk in a place of honor.Thank you, <name>.
Title: It's a Trap!

Description: There's is no cause of fury greater in this world than that of Gruul and his sons. They slaughtered my people - my children - and now I will have revenge.

I have fashioned a trap from dragon fire, and if you're clever enough, you can use it to kill even a gronn.

Just hurry, take the trap to Rexxar. My thirst for revenge must be quenched.

 Quest Hand-in: Hmm, a trap fashioned from the essence of dragon fire? I wonder how Sablemane comes by such rarified substances?It does not matter. What does matter is that we are going to use it to slay a son of Gruul.
Title: It's Scrap Work...

Description: {name}, I'm glad you stopped by.

The Ub3r-Spanner, capable of crafting powerful constructs, and its schematic have been lost for years. Intel tells us that its schematic is located in a locked cache in The Abandoned Junkheap.

You'll need to overcharge its electric barrier to gain access. Take my Current Culler and soak up some of the latent current from the sentries there and zap that chest open!

<Layla makes finger guns and explosion sounds>

Up for some treasure huntin'?

 Quest Hand-in: Great, let me see what it says!
Title: Sending Stone: Protest

Description: <This sending stone still holds ancient words spoken from Adamanthia to Neltharion in an old draconic dialect.>

<Scalecommanders would have a great interest in the contents of this document.>

 Quest Hand-in: Well, good to see a black dragon standing up for us, even if it was too little too late.I wonder what this "Aberrus" is. If it is another place where dracthyr were held then we may need to find it.I will add this to the translated logs. I recommend taking a look as you find more of these.
Title: How To Win Friends And Influence Enemies

Description: In my travels across this world I have made several interesting discoveries. For instance, did you know that with the proper amount of encouragement one can extract all the truths that a man dares hide? As luck would have it, I happen to have some encouragement on hand.

<Keleseth pulls something out of an ornately jeweled box.>

These are my "persuaders." Equip them and take to the field, death knight. Apply the pointy ends to the soldiers of New Avalon. Discover the truth about this "Crimson Dawn."

 Quest Hand-in: An awakening? What nonsense do you speak, boy! What kind of fool would deliver their people into the very heart of the frozen wastes? Perhaps, though, this courier holds the answer.
Title: ...And Following Seas

Description: My brother Derek died in the Second War, only to be raised against his will by the Banshee Queen. If not for Baine Bloodhoof's courageous act of defiance, Derek would have been turned into a weapon against my family.

He's lived in torment since his awakening. I feared he would be lost to us, but he has received help from an old friend of mine who has also been recently raised--Calia Menethil. She has guided him back from the brink of despair.

I am on my way to pay them a visit. Care to join me?

 Quest Hand-in: Welcome. It's nice to have company.Ah, Jaina has arrived.
Title: Bombing Run

Description: You can fly around as a crow... so what!  Ever annihilate something on the ground while you were flying?  Want to?

Forge Camp: Wrath and Forge Camp: Terror, to the north and south, are a major pain in my backside, as well as being a threat to peaceful Ogri'la.  With all of those fel cannons shooting down the Skyguard left and right, we can't get through there to take care of business.

Want to prove yourself?  Take these bombs and knock out their ammo stacks.  Just don't let them shoot you down, too!

 Quest Hand-in: Well, well, well, I guess you had it in you after all.  Good work.  Maybe Old Man Keller was wrong about you after all.<Sky Sergeant Vanderlip smirks.>
Title: Dissension Amongst the Ranks...

Description: Researcher Tiorus was kind enough to put this concoction together for the final strike. I merely pour it upon this tabard that you have provided for me and the item is imbued with the essence of the Illidari filth.

Take the enchanted tabard and travel to the Eclipsion Fields, southwest of Eclipse Point. Once there, use the tabard to transform into an agent of Illidan. While in disguise, slay the crazed colossi that wander the field. They will think it an attack by the Eclipsion and sever all ties!

 Quest Hand-in: Well, well, well... If it isn't the grunt I sent out into the field. You're back and in one piece.<Or'barokh nods.>I knew you wouldn't let me down, soldier. You've stopped a major Illidari advance and, in doing so, earned yourself a little reward.
Title: Seer Udalo

Description: I hope you're not shocked when I reveal to you that the pieces of the Medallion of Karabor you obtained from my minions are mere replicas.

<Akama shows you an identical medallion in his open palm.>

My Deathsworn and I have kept the secret from Illidan for as long as possible.   We are however, still missing the final piece.

Udalo came to me in dreams  to announce he had found it.  Unfortunately he is held by Kael'thas inside the Arcatraz in Tempest Keep.  Find him and see what he knows.

 Quest Hand-in: The Ashtongue Seer has been long dead.  As you turn over his body, you spot writing scrawled on the floor.
Title: Encased in Amber

Description: You know who would probably know a lot about how to properly incubate this egg? The mantid!

Of course, they're too busy trying to kill us to share their expertise, but there might be another way to benefit from their knowledge!

Perhaps we could repurpose one of their incubation chambers. That could help speed up this process, I'm sure!

If you could find and mark one for me, I could airlift it out of there.

 Quest Hand-in: This is perfect! What a cozy little home this will make for our egg.
Title: The Sorrow and the Fury

Description: My greatest regret is the treatment that we - no, I - gave to Nyxondra.  I forced her to lay eggs, then I performed experiments on them.  Over, and over, and over again.

Even as a mother myself, I can only imagine her sorrow.

No... I mustn't be weak.  Our work is, after all, for the benefit of future generations of black dragons.  Her sacrifice was necessary.

She circles the Ruins of Kargath, northwest of New Kargath, insane with fury.  Please, heroes... put her out of her misery.

 Quest Hand-in: Just think... Nyxondra may end up being the mother of the new black dragonflight.  In death, she has given a gift to the future generations of Azeroth.
Title: Warchief's Command: Silverpine Forest!

Description: All able-bodied members of the Horde are hereby ordered to report to Grand Executor Mortuus at Forsaken High Command in Silverpine Forest.

Now, more than ever, your help is needed in routing the enemy infestation of the region and conquering the port of Gilneas!

To reach Forsaken High Command you must travel south through Tirisfal Glades and enter Silverpine Forest. From there, follow the road south until you reach Forsaken High Command.

Onward, brother! Destiny calls!

 Quest Hand-in: Most excellent! A new recruit has arrived. There is much to do... much to do I say.
Title: The Challenger's Ring: Snow Blossom

Description: News of your feats has been traveling around the camp, {name}.

In fact, Snow Blossom would like to test your skill in battle.

You had best prepare yourself, {class}. She is not easily defeated.

If you can prove your worth to her, you will win a valuable friend.

 Quest Hand-in: Ahhhh, so you bested Snow Blossom in battle, did you?She will be stinging from that loss for a while, I'd wager.However, you have done well to win her to your side.She does not warm to strangers quickly, but through time, she will prove to be a loyal and dependable companion.
Title: A Shattered Path Through Time

Description: I've been reading some books about this cataclysm that happened to Azeroth.

You know what's tough? Seeing places you were used to get destroyed by a dragon.

You know what's even tougher? Fighting in those places and surviving!

 Quest Hand-in: You're looking tougher already!Let's see how tough you are next time we talk. Remember, being tough is all about consistency!
Title: A Far Furbolg Friend

Description: Barst was one of the toughest furbolgs I've ever known. It says something about Frostbite that his pack beat him in a fight.

Last I heard, Barst left for some island off the coast of Iskaara. Called it his "retirement" or some other garbage.

Tell Barst it's time to get back into action. 

Oh, and don't be fooled by the way he talks. He'll tear you in two if you look at him wrong.

 Quest Hand-in: Well, look at you! You made it all the way over here! How can I help you?
Title: Forest Disappearances

Description: A moment of your time, friend?

A short while ago a sylvar named Partik came seeking the aid of our grove. He said his village was under attack by the gorm and was in danger of crumbling away altogether. I told him we could not spare any soldiers, but their people were welcome to take refuge with us.

However, it has been some time since he left and I have not seen or heard anyone from that region since.

Can you go investigate? He came from the northeast.

 Quest Hand-in: No, no... what is happening!?
Title: Report to the Queen

Description: Mueh'zala's forces are routed, and it's only a matter of time before the Wild Hunt completely purges them from Ardenweald.

But something tells me that the struggle between Bwonsamdi and Mueh'zala is far from over. That creepy little mask has gone silent...

You should hurry back to the Heart of the Forest and report to the Winter Queen. She will decide what we do next.

 Quest Hand-in: Welcome news, indeed. I will not soon forget Mueh'zala's transgressions.
Title: Hjalmar's Final Execution

Description: You now wield my most powerful skill, young warrior. 

Now use it to finish me! These ogres trapped my spirit here long ago for daring to defy them.

Only through a glorious death will I finally be allowed to rest. 

It is the only way I will see my brothers and sisters in the afterlife.

 Quest Hand-in: You seem stronger! If only all ghosts were as honorable as that one...
Title: We Burn the Dead

Description: I saw lots of bodies here. Kaz always said to burn the bodies.

That way they can't come back as the mean greens.

We should burn the bodies.

 Quest Hand-in: That was stinky.
Title: The Charred Granite of the Dark Portal

Description: Kasim wants you to gather granite chips from these chunks of rock around the Dark Portal.  I don't know what he'd want rocks for, but I have my suspicions, and they're not pleasant ones.

Use this pick and look for small outcroppings of rock along the edge of the portal's blast radius.

 Quest Hand-in: I hope this is what the gnome wanted.
Title: Rise No More!

Description: Have you seen the ghosts wandering the graveyard?

They are risen ancestors, the spirits of slain mogu who have been called back to this world.

When angered, they attack swiftly and silently, and their numbers increase by the day.

They do not belong here. Destroy them, and send them back beyond the grave.

 Quest Hand-in: Wonderful work, <class>. This will help our offensive a great deal.
Title: The Strength of Our Bonds

Description: Asha has passed, but we share a bond that cannot be severed by death. Even now, her spirit urges me onward to Grom'gar.

The Iron Wolf claims our attachments make us weak... that love makes us vulnerable.

He is wrong.

Karg is my strength, and I his. I will free him from his chains, and together we will show the Thunderlord clan the strength of our bonds.

 Quest Hand-in: Help me out of these chains. We have work to do.
Title: Mission Report: Dino Research

Description: Your followers have sent a report regarding the mission at Verdant Hollow.

It details that the mission was a success and a variety of dinasaur specimens have been recovered.

Deliver the report to High Commander Wyrmbane aboard the Wind's Redemption.

 Quest Hand-in: It seems the mission was a success. Well done, <name>.
Title: Much to Learn

Description: Freshly arrived for your training, your first task is simple: Speak to Master Shang Xi.

 Quest Hand-in: Today is the day when your fate will be decided. Do you have the strength and cunning to be a <class>? Or are you destined to a life working in the fields?Each has its place, but I can sense that you aspire to greatness.Let us begin our training, my newest pupil.
Title: Terms of Surrender

Description: I have good news, commander: we've already taken Lok-rath.

<The warchief grins.>

The Horde's soldiers have captured most of the Warsong, including their leader, Uruk Foecleaver.

I saved the honor of accepting his surrender for you. They're waiting for you inside, commander.

 Quest Hand-in: Commander <name>.Terms of surrender? Hmm... let me think.
Title: A Tangled Web

Description: We have had a disturbing report from the Anglers fishermen of Sri-La Village, {name}.

Many of their villagers are missing, taken by the spiders who live in The Widow's Wail, a cave along the coast to the north.

The victims are dragged into the dark depths, wrapped in cocoons, and left to become the spiders' next meal.

We believe that some of the people may still be alive. There is still time to save them! I need you to go and rescue as many villagers as you can find.

 Quest Hand-in: You have done a great deed today, <name>. This is the duty of the Order of the Cloud Serpent - to protect the people of The Jade Forest.
Title: Formal Introductions

Description: Greetings, {name}. Do not be alarmed. This is merely a projection of my current form. It's the only way my companion and I could keep watch without revealing ourselves.

The ethereal who approached you, Marid, is little better than a swindler in the guise of a legitimate merchant. I'd like you to consider working with me instead. My purpose out here is to find out more about the unusual dragonkin on this ridge. Meet me at the north end of the ridge and we will discuss this further.

 Quest Hand-in: My name is Tyrygosa, of the brood of Malygos, but most call me 'Tyri.' My companion is the paladin Jorad Mace.Word of these strange dragonkin has already traveled far and I fear that too many will rush to exploit them for profit without realizing the true nature of what they're dealing with. With your help, we're hoping to gain insight into these creatures before others discover their presence.
Title: The Azure Span Advanced Tour

Description: The advanced courses in the Azure Span are designed to elevate your dragon riding skills to new heights! 

Just... make sure you don't fall from them!

When you're ready, seek out my bronze colleagues and fly those courses!

 Quest Hand-in: Nicely done! You have almost mastered all of the advanced race courses in the Dragon Isles!Now! On to Thaldraszus and the last set of challenges!
Title: Twilight?! No!

Description: Gerstahn is too heavily guarded and too smart to leave her post, so I'm not going to kill her.

You are.

I'll throw in a little something I picked up off of a guard to make it worth your while.

 Quest Hand-in: The Twilight's Hammer's presence only complicates our mission here further, but you've done your part for now.  You've earned a reward for your efforts...and some rest. Let's get out of here.
Title: Completing Your Arsenal

Description: Highlord, there is still one last weapon out there that would aid you against the Legion.

If you would like, I would be happy to go over our latest information on its whereabouts.

 Quest Hand-in: Agreed. We must seek it out at once.
Title: Onward to the Blasted Lands

Description: We appreciate your assistance here in this swamp, {name}.  I would like to inform you that I have received correspondence from Nethergarde Keep.

Enohar Thunderbrew has requested help in investigating the shipwrecks of the Red Reaches, but we have had none willing to make the journey, and I could not leave the Harborage.

Nethergarde Keep sits in the Blasted Lands, south of the Swamp of Sorrows.  Do not journey too close to Stonard on your way.

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, has Avuun sent ye? Good, good...
Title: The Stuff of Legends

Description: It is an honor to make your acquaintance, {race}.

Your deeds echo in the ears of Azeroth's creatures, mortal and immortal alike.

I shall present the heart of Ragnaros to Kalecgos when he arrives. Its power is to be harnessed to further endow your weapon.

The ceremony is to begin shortly. I have been appointed to escort you there when you are ready.

 Quest Hand-in: Your heroic deeds will never be forgotten, <name>.
Title: Shivertail's Den

Description: The Frostwolf pup looks at you with his big eyes. He howls and stares into the cave.

It's unusual for a wolf this young to be wandering around by itself. Shivertail's parents must be nearby.

 Quest Hand-in: Shivertail snuggles up to his mother. He is clearly happy to be reunited with most of his pack.
Title: The Blue Dragon Oathstone

Description: The Azure Span has stabilized for now and more blue dragons have arrived... just in time.

It's time to return to the Azure Archives and reclaim the oathstone.

I would request your presence there, {name}. You've been a great boon throughout this ordeal.

 Quest Hand-in: The Oathstone is empowered once more. There is much to do... but the Azure Span is at least returning to what it once was.
Title: Making Acquaintances

Description: It's nice to see someone else taking a vested interest in the arcane arts, you know. It's all too rare these days if you ask me!

Unfortunately, I must meet Cordana to handle an important matter, but we're in luck! One of my good friends in the Kirin Tor has agreed to help you connect your arcane sanctum to the ley line network.

He's waiting at my tower. Let's leave immediately and introduce you to one another.

 Quest Hand-in: I am Magister Krelas. Pyromaniac.Pleasure.
Title: On the Trail

Description: In my visions, I witnessed Tyrande cutting through an endless storm of malevolent, nightmarish beings.

Up ahead... is that...? Yes. I believe it is the very place I saw.

Come. It may hold a clue as to where my mother has gone.

 Quest Hand-in: Some vile force in this place intends to stop us from finding Tyrande.If experience serves, that means we must be on the right track.
Title: Death on Two Legs

Description: The Alliance has made landfall. If we do not defeat them here, any hope of a Horde presence on this continent is lost.

Go to the battlefield south of here and slay Alliance you find.

Show them how any Horde who still stands on two legs will be the death of ten Alliance!

 Quest Hand-in: Well done, <name>. I see your time in this land has hardened your resolve and sharpened your skills.
Title: Eye of Azshara: The Frozen Soul

Description: Ah, Deathlord. It is good to see you. I happen to have a fascinating task for you, should you be in the mood for adventure.

I recently came across an obscure reference to an ancient amulet that was created by Queen Azshara herself! It is called the Frozen Soul Pendant and it offers tremendous power to those who channel the power of frost.

I have reason to believe that it may be found somewhere within the Eye of Azshara.

Retrieve the pendant for me, and it will prove most useful in my studies.

 Quest Hand-in: So this is the legendary Frozen Soul Pendant! I sense a great power in this item...I will begin my study of it at once. You have my gratitude, Deathlord.
Title: Forbidden Love

Description: My son, Kral'za, is beyond stubborn. 

After we split from the Shadowmoon Clan he refused to let go of his relationship with a young Shadowmoon orc.

I forbid him to see her anymore. He ran off earlier today and has not returned. 

I don't trust Dol'mak. Like the other Shadowmoon orcs she continues to dabble in the void.

 Quest Hand-in: Aka'Magosh, <class>. I knew that void witch was no good.
Title: Fear of Falling

Description: Some young find their wings sooner than others. At least yours had the sense to keep them open.

I would not worry too much about its safety- little ones tend to bounce.

As for this failure... the young must keep trying, and they must learn not to fear falling. It is now your task to teach it.

<The loa smiles at you, all teeth.>

If it is reluctant to learn, you might consider bribery.

 Quest Hand-in: <The hatchling inspects your hands warily.>
Title: Every Little Death Helps

Description: <The whispers are faint, but grow louder as you hold the blade in your hand.>

So weak... need... blood... souls...

<The voice trails off, but you can still sense the dagger urging you on.

It is a familiar sensation.>

 Quest Hand-in: Ah... much better. How cruel of you to leave me in such a state!But we can reminisce later. No doubt you have many questions. As you know, I can offer countless answers.
Title: No Time to Waste

Description: Commander, we're in luck. The antidote recipe is fairly simple.

I was able to make a small amount with what I had on me. You should take it to Lunzul before it's too late. It should keep her alive long enough for me to make more.

 Quest Hand-in: By da spirits... me head be hurtin'...
Title: Boar Training: Thundercall

Description: The elements can sometimes pose a problem for some beasts. Ever seen a ram in a thunderstorm? They'll hide behind anything larger than themselves. I'm not sure if they think the world is ending or what, but it's not great if you're atop one at the time.

In Nagrand, off on a windswept cliff high above the shore, is a creature made of pure thunderstorms. Hop atop your boar and face off against Thundercall, and we'll see if it gets spooked.

 Quest Hand-in: Well, it's a bit wet, but seems to be in good spirits. I'll get 'er dried off and into bed.
Title: The Secret of the Fungus

Description: It smells here and there are whispers.

I feel there is a connection between the plants and beasts here. Special mushrooms seem to focus the beasts' attention.

Go and get some of these for me. I... need... them.

 Quest Hand-in: Yes, they smell... wonderful. These will help me find the power of this marsh and take it for my own.
Title: A Proper Shikaar Send-Off

Description: We're here to rescue the captive tauren, but I have a personal request.

The place we are assaulting was once my home. The Nokhud took over after a surprise attack during the civil war.

Take these Shikaar banners. When you kill a Nokhud or one of their allies, plant a banner on their corpse. I want to send a message--if they continue to occupy our home, they will pay in blood.

 Quest Hand-in: I saw the banners all across the highlands. It will not change what happened, but it puts a smile on my face.
Title: Drink to the Dead

Description: The Forsworn are ravaging the temples of Bastion, and the aspirants are leaving behind their supplies as they flee.

All those wonderful bottles of nectar falling into the hands of the Forsworn? I think not! 

There's no way we can save all of the aspirants, but we can keep the Forsworn from taking those supplies. Besides... we could all use something to drink around here.

 Quest Hand-in: Uh, I see you brought back a few friends?
Title: Unlocking the Power

Description: There's somethin' special waitin' fer ye back in the Chamber of Heart, champion.

I won't spoil it, but ye best get back there as quick as ye can.

 Quest Hand-in: Have we got somethin' fer ye, champion! Yer gonna love this.
Title: Encroaching Force

Description: We've spotted a Zandalari war party down on the beach just outside these walls. We need to eliminate them before returning to camp.

Are you up for the task?

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you, <name>. That's a worry off my mind.
Title: A Perfect Costume

Description: Judging by your weight, build, and size, we're going to dress you as an orc.  Their army is made mostly of orcs, so you'll fit right in.

Do you know much about tailoring?  If not, then consider this your first lesson.  My crafting table over there has all the necessary supplies on it.

Go ahead and grab whatever you think is necessary, then bring it here.  Thelaron will fix you right up.

 Quest Hand-in: That's it?  That's your disguise?I'm feeling less confident about our chances.  It was nice knowing you, kid.
Title: Chosen Burden

Description: With the Crucible of Nazsharin, all that remains is to inform Lady Naz'jar of your success.

 Quest Hand-in: Well done, my Battlemaiden.This crucible will serve as a font of power for our summoning ritual. With it, Sira'kess will beckon our allies from the depths to bolster our already swelling forces.
Title: Last Stand at Whistling Grove

Description: We might have a chance to beat these flames back thanks to your work in the Inferno.

Still, more wildlife is threatened. Keeper Taldros ran north through the flames, to Whistling Grove.

See if you can help him!

 Quest Hand-in: The forest is being devoured!
Title: To Dinah, at Once!

Description: The Horde may have never known one more loyal than Gorat. He never failed to complete a mission, and it would seem that he refuses to allow this to be his first.

Gorat had you deliver this vial for a purpose. Dinah is the daughter of a revered shaman, and is more powerful than she appears. Bring her the vial and hope that we are not too late.

 Quest Hand-in: Let's have a look, <class>.
Title: Crane Mastery: Needlebeak

Description: So, now that you've got a vibe for how cranes fight, I've got a doozy for you.

Needlebeak!

Or at least, that's what I'm calling him. Biggest crane I ever saw. And its beak is so sharp it's like a sword.

Northwest of here you'll find the big water fall that kicks off the Dojani River. Needlebeak likes to hang out by the waterfall.

You bring me its beak as a trophy and I will talk you up a good game to Nesingwary.

 Quest Hand-in: Now THAT is a trophy. Looks intimidating. Wait... is this your blood on it?
Title: The Hayward Brothers

Description: The Hayward Fishery can be found far to the south.  The Hayward brothers have been running it for years.

They don't make it to town very often, except to trade their fish.  Send word to them that the evacuation is underway.

 Quest Hand-in: You here to give us a hand?
Title: Path of Wisdom

Description: You seek to continue down the path of wisdom?

 Quest Hand-in: You are a true champion of our cause, <name>.  None can claim to be more dedicated to the struggle than you.You are a bastion of wisdom and our allies speak of you with the greatest reverence.  Many of them owe you their own lives.Accept this humble gift as a reward for your many triumphs.
Title: Return to Zuldazar

Description: You know kid, I think I've got it all covered here. My guys will find all the Azerite they can here and make me rich!

I mean, you know, make the Horde rich. With power!

Anyway, you can go tell Nathanos we're done here. This base is the best place to launch any attacks against the Kul Tirans here in Drustvar -- that's a Gallywix guarantee!

 Quest Hand-in: You've established a foothold in Drustvar with the goblins? Good.I will have my men keep an eye on Gallywix's activities there. Just in case.
Title: Just Passing Through

Description: We must act quickly, {race}! We can't risk letting those precious seeds become fully digested. They need to come out, NOW.

Forage up some blackroot from the riverbank just west of here and I'll make you a purgative that should get things moving.

Hurry now! And remember, you brought this upon yourself....

 Quest Hand-in: These should do just fine...<Anderhol deftly twists the stalks, collecting their slick fluids in a tiny vial.>There we go, now it's time to get down to business.
Title: Watcher Mahar Ba

Description: It's time for you to visit the Watcher.  He's been in a bit of a mood lately, and I'm not quite sure why.

Head up to the top of the mage tower and check in with him.  I don't have any work for you here, but I'm certain that he will.

 Quest Hand-in: My associates were correct to send you to me.  I have a problem which may threaten the sanctity of Nethergarde, and I need someone more capable than most.
Title: Gambling Debt

Description: I heard you did a little work for Terry.  I was hoping someone reliable would show up around these parts.

See, pirates love to gamble.  They, however, do not love to pay their gambling debt.

If you're interested in collecting some coin on my behalf, I'd be willing to give you a cut.

Let's start you out with an easy one.  "Silvermoon" Harry's a bit of an eccentric, keeps all sorts of expensive blood elf knickknacks inside his tent - yet when I see him he always pretends to be broke.  Get my gold.

 Quest Hand-in: A job well done.  Here's your cut, <name>.  There's more where this came from.There's no shortage of deadbeat pirates on this island.
Title: Gizelton Caravan

Description: You look like a capable {race}. Perhaps you're looking to make some money? Cork and I started this caravan to make a bundle of money; little did we know the dangers of turning a buck!

Up ahead is Mannoroc Coven... normally the demons ignore us but something has the kodos spooked this time. I'll pay you to protect the caravan past Mannoroc Coven. Once we are safely past you can receive your reward from our business associate Smeed at Scrabblescrew's Camp.

 Quest Hand-in: Not sure it's a prosperous proposition to be paying so much money to protect the Gizelton Caravan. Cork and Rigger only make one gold piece a week, but as long as they keep paying for my kodos I can care less how they run their business.
Title: Enhanced Combat Tactics

Description: Won'sa said the quilboar have kidnapped the missing expedition... including my daughter.

The quilboar will kill you if you're not prepared. They're much smarter and deadlier than murlocs.

I won't see you die by their hands. We're going to spar one last time.

When we are done, you will cleave a path straight through the quilboar!

 Quest Hand-in: You're ready to slaughter the quilboar! Let's speak to Won'sa and see what she knows.
Title: Fire Brigade Practice

Description: The brave dwarves of Kharanos can form a fire brigade in an instant, now that the Headless Horseman is around. Do you want to help?

South of here, the mountaineers set up a small area to practice fighting fires.  Go there and throw buckets onto the blazes.  You can fill a bucket from the water barrel here.

Good bye, {name}.  When you're done with fire brigade practice, please visit us again!

 Quest Hand-in: You're smudged with soot!  You must have been extinguishing fires!Well done!  As an honorary member of the Fire Brigade, I beg you to return here if ever the village needs you!
Title: Sign of the Dusk Lily

Description: Simply... astounding.

I have not felt this clear of mind in so long.

I am still weak... I need to rest. But first...

<Vanthir gestures to the top of his cage with a trembling hand.>

Show them that the Dusk Lily triumphs this day.

 Quest Hand-in: I will see that he is made comfortable next chance I get. We made a great stride forward today, <name>.Elisande will not soon forget that we do not simply abandon our own.
Title: On Larion Wings

Description: As a flightless being, you will unfortunately never feel the joy of flying alongside your companion.

However... you could still fly with Andira.

It seems you have earned Andira's trust more than I've seen her with anybody else. Would you like to try a flight course?

Take wing with Andira, then fly through the rings. Don't stray off course or take too much time to get between rings or she will leave you behind!

 Quest Hand-in: The feeling of soaring through the air, the gentle flap of your larion's wings...Even though I have my own wings, there's no feeling quite like it.
Title: Symbol of Hope

Description: Champion--Ebyssian, Sabellian, and Wrathion have come to an agreement of who should lead, and are presenting a unified front. All three were quite eager to speak of your contributions and aid in Zaralek Cavern as well. It seems that they are also in agreement that they could not have succeeded without you.

High praise indeed--and well deserved.

Please, stay for a little longer. The other Aspects and I have matters to discuss, and I believe you should be here as well.

 Quest Hand-in: We still have much to do--but the sight of five united Aspects fills my heart with hope... and with joy. Thank you. Your part in this will never be forgotten.
Title: A Disturbance in Ashenvale

Description: The damned Horde! Clever bastards, I'll give them that. They diverted at the north fork of the Barrens and are now marching on Ashenvale.

The kaldorei forces already set sail for Silithus--must be halfway there by now. The only defenders still in the area are the Darnassian City Guard. They are en route to Astranaar, but they won't last long against an army. Their commander goes by the name of Delaryn Summermoon.

Find her, {name}, and buy us time. We will get our fleet there as soon as we can.

 Quest Hand-in: Are you the one Malfurion sent?
Title: Dredging up a Name

Description: Oi, why aren't you addressing me by my proper name? Wait, I don't remember my name, proper or other. Does this mean I have amnesias? Oh no, I don't have a name, please, help!

 Quest Hand-in: Oh yeah, that name totally fits my personality, or at least I think it does.
Title: Total War

Description: Some of the Wildhammer still cling to the hope of reclaiming the Thundermar Ruins to the north, across the river. Burn them out! Smash open kegs of Thundermar ale. That wicked brew is potent enough to explode when set aflame.

Don't ask me why.

And don't ask me how they drink the stuff.

 Quest Hand-in: Yes, yes. Burn them out, as you would flush groundhogs from their holes...Well done, <name>.
Title: Aiding Revendreth

Description: Take flight to Revendreth, where those that are loyal to the Shadowlands are under siege from the forces of Sire Denathrius.

We cannot allow them to fall. Without the aid of Sinfall, the forces of Revendreth will grow unchecked, and their dark alliance with the Jailer will threaten us all.

We of Bastion will not allow this to happen! Raise your swords, ready your shields, take wing and bring the glory of Bastion to Revendreth!

 Quest Hand-in: Even those that are far from our lands are necessary allies in these dark times. With faith and honor we will serve them, and the Shadowlands, until evil clips our wings!
Title: Mastery Of The Shield-Breaker

Description: You'll need to learn how to break through an opponent's defenses to succeed in mounted combat. Take this lance and mount the stabled Quel'dorei steed just outside the pavilion.

Once you're mounted, seek out Valis Windchaser. He'll be on the northern edge of the tournament grounds at the training area east of the Aspirants' Ring. Valis will teach you the basics of using a ranged shield breaker attack to make a ranged target vulnerable.

 Quest Hand-in: Commit Valis's lesson to memory, <name>. It will mean the difference between winning and losing your mounted combat matches.
Title: The Incredible Egg

Description: <The aqir seem to have been in the process of empowering this egg with void magic.

It looks to be far from hatching, so it should be safe to study to find out what they were planning to do with it. 

Someone in the Explorer's League might be interested in taking a look.>

 Quest Hand-in: Fascinating! You say that the aqir were trying to empower this egg?You did the right thing by bringing this egg into my care. Just think of the wonders we'll uncover when it hatches!You look worried.
Title: Vengeance Will Be Mine!

Description: This is why the Legion fears us. We have the ability to turn their secrets against them and in so doing become stronger than they ever can be.

Quickly, {name}, teach us what you have learned.

 Quest Hand-in: I blame myself, <name>. Mannethrel was already struggling. It is a never-ending battle we all must endure... to control the fel energies that we have taken in.Maybe it would be best if you held off teaching the others for now. We can not afford to lose anyone else.
Title: A Wee Bit O' Cloth

Description: {name}, is that you I hear rustlin' about out there? It's me, Angus Stormbrew!

There are cultists everywhere, so ye best keep yer voice down. Lean in close and cover yer nose while we talk!

This is the only outhouse in all o' Silithus! Trust me I spent hours lookin' all through the night. I decided to sneak in for a wee drop-off before the cultists woke up, but I've got a uhh problem...

There's no cloth to... you know...

See if ye can find me a wee bit o' cloth and sneak it in through the door!

 Quest Hand-in: Aye! This'll do nicely! Just give us a wee minute here...
Title: The Gardener's Apprentice

Description: Basilton! Lord Basilton, where are you?

My executive assistant and apprentice, Lord Basilton, has gone missing! He loves to explore, but he's even worse at defending himself than I am. I'm a gardener, not a warrior!

Could you please go find that layabout? I need him here so I can think. He's usually in the shed, digging through piles of junk.

Be careful though. He can be a bit prickly at first.

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, there he is! My lovely assistant. Who's a good boy? A good, spiky boy? Basilton! Who's the spikiest? That's right! You are!Ahem. Thank you, <name>.
Title: The Crown of Heaven

Description: Do you recall Mason's Folly, the hilltop east of here where you and I met before?

I'm going to use the Lightning Lance to create something special, and I certainly can't do it in here.

Meet me atop Mason's Folly so that we may celebrate our victories together!

 Quest Hand-in: The Crown of Heaven! Use this to augment any piece of headgear.It will also act as a third eye - I will be able to follow your progress as we embark on the next stage of our journey.
Title: Heroes of the Horde!

Description: Now to find their battle plans and take out their leaders! Should we succeed there is an orc high warlord who served in the war in Silverpine that is now stationed at Tarren Mill - located in the heart of Hillsbrad. He will grant both of us commendations for this! We will be heroes of the Horde, {name}!

Onward! Together we will defeat the Alliance filth!

 Quest Hand-in: <High Warlord Cromush salutes.>He will be honored as a hero of the Horde, just as he always hoped. What you and Orkus did will save hundreds of lives and ensure that our foothold in Hillsbrad is not lost.
Title: A Brokered Deal

Description: Hey, {name}. I've found a lucrative business proposition that'll help me... us... greatly! See, Au'narim is willing to give us supplies if we can help him recover from a trade deal that went sideways.

Apparently, several of his cohorts never returned from a job. He needs us to follow their path and recover the item they failed to deliver. Simple, right?

To ensure we don't have any mishaps, I've taken the liberty of acquiring a few items that may be of help to us.

So, you in?

 Quest Hand-in: I knew the Maw Walker would deliver.
Title: Chasing the Leader

Description: The locals and the league have been working together tae reclaim relics in this here cave up the hill. But it seems that we've angered the previous residents. I think the marines can keep the expedition safe fer now, but I dinna how long they can keep it up. 

We need yer help before things go south! Find Hilde Firebreaker, the leader of our expedition. She ran back into the cave fer somethin' or another.

 Quest Hand-in: Yer here to help? Finally!
Title: Flexing for Nougat

Description: That's an... interesting costume you have on.  Even though you're being nice and helping a child trick-or-treat this year, I'm afraid I'm going to have to ask you to perform a trick for me!

Let's see... you look so strong and buff in that... costume... let's see you flex!  Yes, go on now and flex for me, strong man!

When and only when you flex, I'll give you some tasty Stormwind Nougat.  It's a great Hallow's End treat.

 Quest Hand-in: You are truly mighty, haha!  Well done, and thanks for being such a good sport.  Here's your candy.Happy Hallow's End, <name>!
Title: Learning the Ropes

Description: Now that you are a pet trainer, it's time to test your skills!

Head out into the forest and pick a fight with a battle pet.  Come back to me after you have won and I will continue your training.  Good luck!

 Quest Hand-in: Nice work, <name>!  You're better with those pets than I thought!
Title: Path of Ascension: Mad Mortimer

Description: Your soulbinds request your strategic mind in another trial.

Their sights this week are set on Mad Mortimer, that they may learn from the lessons his memory teaches.

When you are able, report to Artemede to return to the Path of Ascension. Aid your soulbinds in defeating Mad Mortimer to prove their growth.

 Quest Hand-in: Congratulations on the victory. I look forward to hearing what your soulbinds have learned.
Title: Search Stillpine Hold

Description: As High Chief, my immediate concern is the root of the corruption in Stillpine Hold.

Why did the wildkin - once our allies - attack us? Why have they taken residence in Stillpine Hold?

Perhaps something inside will hold the answer. Search Stillpine Hold for clues as to the source of corruption.

 Quest Hand-in: The blood crystal radiates a sickly aura that seeps into the water of the cave.
Title: Heart of Flame

Description: You are the first mortal to witness a dragon council, {name}, and among the only beings in Azeroth to take part in the choosing of an Aspect.

My ascension has endowed me with incredible power. I have taken the liberty to strengthen Tarecgosa's bond with you, though she will require a more... permanent home.

I would have you venture one last time into the Plane of Fire and bring me the heart of Ragnaros.

When next we meet, I will be able to suitably thank you for all that you have done.

 Quest Hand-in: You have done well, <name>.Now prepare to receive a hero's reward.
Title: The Bigger They Come...

Description: Killing the smaller mantid works mostly as a distraction. It forces them to replenish their numbers before they consider any serious offensive.

The big ones, though - we kill a few of those, and we really disrupt operations on the island. That buys ourselves a substantial amount of time. With mantid, it's like their size is directly proportional to their importance in the empire.

So kill some of the big ones for me, while you're out there.

 Quest Hand-in: Well done, well done. That should keep us safe for a few days, at least.
Title: Words of Warning

Description: Thanks for helping me, {name}.  My name's Sasha.  Listen, I have to get the hell out of here.

The people that sent you here... my people... they've changed.  They're not good people anymore... and they want to turn you into one of... one of them.

This... 'test' they sent you on is just the beginning.

Head to the northwestern end of Silverbrook.  You'll find something of interest to you.

Good luck... and trust no one.

 Quest Hand-in: Who's there?  Are you here to kill me?Please!  You don't have to do this!
Title: Mission Report: Mudfisher Cove

Description: Your followers have sent a report regarding the assault on Mudfisher Cove.

It details that victory was hard-fought, but all of the guards previously defending the outpost have been slain.

Deliver the report to Nathanos Blightcaller aboard The Banshee's Wail.

 Quest Hand-in: It seems the mission to create an additional foothold in Drustvar was a success. Well done, <name>.I will send you to oversee the fortifications at once.
Title: Hitting a Walleye

Description: Sometimes, I fish for fun.  Other times to relax, but sometimes I want a challenge.  That's where the hardened walleye comes into the picture.  This prized fish is not caught for us to eat, but for the challenge.  You can find the walleye in Stormwind Lake just north of the city.  Think you are up to the challenge?

 Quest Hand-in: Nice work <name>!  I see you are quite the fisherman these days.  Might just have to take you out on the boat soon and see what you can really do!
Title: Blightbeasts be Damned!

Description: You've no doubt seen the army of Anub'ar blightbeasts that are being constructed at Icemist Village. The Anub'ar have plans to send those monsters against our soldiers at the Wrathgate. This cannot happen!
