Venture west to Icemist Village with this flare gun and use it to call down one of my war riders. Climb on its back and command it to destroy the blightbeasts that are out of reach from the ground!

Once you have decimated their aerial forces, return to me for your reward!

 Quest Hand-in: <Valnok salutes.>And now they have been crushed by air! Perhaps soon you will be called to Angrathar, hero!
Title: Return of the Crusade

Description: I have witnessed the relentless advance of the Scourge firsthand. It is only a matter of time before they swarm our gates. 

The fate that befell Silvermoon must never be repeated. 

Death knights from the Ebon Blade have stepped forward to combat the threat, but even they will need reinforcements.

The Argent Crusade has answered the call once more. I ask that you aid them in keeping our people safe, {name}.

Their commander awaits your arrival.

 Quest Hand-in: <Commander Throgg grunts.>You must be the one.
Title: Into Twilight

Description: The safety of my people is of the utmost priority.

It is likely that Ner'zhul has taken the prisoners to Shaz'gul, his stronghold to the southwest.

I do not wish to use aggression against him, but he may force my hand.

Meet me at Twilight Glade, {name}. Then, we shall try our best to recover the prisoners.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you for coming, <name>. There is much to be done.
Title: The Old Fashioned Way

Description: While you experienced the raw majesty that is Nightwell Infusion, Margaux was busy preparing another demonstration for you.

Head across the bridge and to the left, then again across a bridge and to your right. You will find her on the juicing veranda.

Enjoy the remainder of your tour!

<Sylverin offers an intensely fake smile.>

 Quest Hand-in: I will be certain to have a bottle of your arcwine prepared for you before you leave.
Title: Building a Better Gryphon

Description: I've heard that the Wildhammer dwarves maintain a gryphon roost at their fortress down in southern Shadowmoon Valley. If you're going down there, would you speak to them on my behalf? I have some ideas on how to improve their gryphons!

Why stop at armoring them when you could attach an altimeter, a rear view mirror, and rocket? Imagine how fast you could go with one of those babies strapped to your gryphon's back! I'll call it the TurboGryphon 8000!

 Quest Hand-in: <Brunn's face reddens until its color is indistinguishable from his beard.>He wants to do WHAT to my gryphons?If that little pipsqueak puts anything other than a saddle on them, I'll personally travel up to Blade's Edge and stuff that rocket o' his down his throat!
Title: Rescue at Glopgut's Hollow

Description: Well speak of the devil in a blue dress. Fanny's gone and gotten herself kidnapped by ogres!

I don't trust the Thundermars to be able to mount a rescue on their own. I'll round up my gryphon riders and provide some air support.

I'm sure they can use an extra {class} down there, {name}. Grab your gear and look for Colin Thundermar in the Glopgut ogre camp. It's southwest of here, below the cliffs. Hurry now!

 Quest Hand-in: Good to have you fighting at my side again, <name>!And I see the Firebeards have come as well. I suppose they'll provide a distraction while me and my boys do the heavy lifting.
Title: Where's The Chief?

Description: This is the only part of the fortress we haven't yet searched, {name}. If Commander Eranog is anywhere, it has to be here.

<Velomir glances towards the nearby doorway.>

Let us see what we can find out.

 Quest Hand-in: Damn it all! The commander was behind this? I cannot believe he would betray us like this.
Title: Seasoned Wolf Kabobs

Description: Seasoned wolf kabobs are a house favorite!  Sure, I can make you some.  But first I'll need the supplies.

Bring me five wolf skirt steaks.  The dire wolves near the river north of town are good to hunt; I wouldn't stray too far into the woods if I were you.

 Quest Hand-in: Mmm-mmm! The skirtsteak's the best part. It's not an efficient way to cook, though.Here, have this recipe. It's a little different, but flank meat's easier to come by when you really need a meal.
Title: A Flash of Bronze...

Description: As you survey the devastation of the vale, a flash of bronze catches your eye. Unless you're mistaken, a tiny gnome is trying to catch your attention from the balcony above Mogu'shan Palace, just outside of the Seat of Knowledge.

You should see what she wants.

 Quest Hand-in: <The tiny gnome's eyes reflect the light with a copper sheen. She is not what she seems.><name>! I have been waiting for you. The bronze dragonflight has need of your services.
Title: The Remedy of Lordaeron

Description: The time has come. By the Light, I pray our plan works.

Master Apothecary Faranell's wagons have reproduced the plague eater many times over, and the bats are ready to deploy them.

If you see a place where our forces could spread even more of the remedy, you can signal them with a flare.

Take to the skies, and let's put an end to this blight. For Lordaeron, and for the Forsaken.

 Quest Hand-in: We did it. By working together, we've cleared the surface level of the deadly plague cloud.It will take more time to clean up the lower reaches of the Undercity, but it's a fine start.
Title: Shard Times

Description: As you have surely noticed, a slain demon leaves behind Nethershards, solidified residual energy from the Twisting Nether. I require a significant quantity of them for an experiment I'm conducting... oa shards, to be precise.

Why are you looking at me like that? We've had this conversation before. I did the math.

I need exactly oa shards. Fewer would be inadequate. More would be absurd.

Don't question my methods. Go!

 Quest Hand-in: It has been pointed out to me that I can, on occasion, get a bit carried away.This... <clears throat> might possibly have been one of those times.A single Nethershard will suffice for my purposes. I'm certain you can put the rest to good use.Let's not speak of this again.
Title: Warlord of the Bleeding Hollow

Description: You have shown great strength and fortune, for you have delved into Zeth'Gor and lived!  Now, let us hope your fortune holds, for I have a dire task to ask of you...

Warlord Morkh sits within the barracks of Zeth'Gor, commanding his fel troops against us.  His tactics are as clever as they are cruel, and I must admit that his successes against us have cut deep.  And so, {name}, I ask you to remove Morkh from his seat.  Bring me his armor so that we might display it for our soldiers and bolster them.

 Quest Hand-in: You've done it!  Morkh is slain!  Now, we have a fighting chance against the fel orc beasts!Thank you, <name>.  Your aid to the war effort here is beyond measure.
Title: The Great Fissure

Description: We're dangerously close to becoming fenced in by Alliance forces.  With the influx of sin'dorei pilgrims from Azeroth, we must establish a route that's safe from our enemies' prying eyes.

I've given it some thought and have arrived at a solution.  We're to establish a secret path through the Great Fissure.

Yes, even though the area is crawling with brutal rock flayers, they are merely beasts and can be taught to fear us.  I want you to go and kill a good number of them.  They shall learn fear.

 Quest Hand-in: Good job, <name>.  That should teach the rock flayers to stay far away from us.
Title: Bring Down the High Shaman

Description: Our scouts in the field report that High Shaman MacKilligan has moved out of Thundermar and is fighting amidst the Thundermar Ruins northwest of here, across the river.

He's a dangerous one, {name}, responsible for the deaths of many a Dragonmaw. He WILL be destroyed, that is not the question.

The question is: will you be the one to earn the glory of the kill?

 Quest Hand-in: The High Shaman has been brought down! Thundermar will no doubt try to send others, but on this day, the Dragonmaw are triumphant.
Title: What's Your Specialty?

Description: Hey, {name}! Have you decided on a combat specialization yet?

Since you're a {class}, you already know about the different classes available to adventurers. But did you know that there are also areas of specialization within each class?

Choosing a specialization is an important decision. Your specialty determines your combat role in a party, as well as the kinds of weapons and abilities that you will use.

Let's go speak with Tamanji to learn more about specializations!

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent choice of specialization, <name>.Feel free to test out your new abilities on the training dummies outside on the upper level of the building.
Title: What Will It Mine?

Description: <Although worn from repeated use, the pickaxe still seems salvageable. Perhaps there's something nearby that can be mined?>

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, what do we have here? A rare find, indeed! Brinestone is quite volatile and should only be mined with special equipment. Even then, its collection frequently disturbs the elements, so mine with caution.
Title: Bounty: More Hydras

Description: Our forces are desperately outmatched when it comes to the hydras. They are ferocious, tenacious, and deadly. We have retreated almost entirely out of the western region of Nazjatar.

If we are going to hold the line against the naga, we need to make sure the western region is safe for our forces. Destroy as many hydras as you can manage, then report to the quartermaster.

 Quest Hand-in: This will ease our efforts in Nazjatar.
Title: Lighting the Way

Description: We need reinforcements! Someone has to fight through and light the signal flame.

It's all up to you, {class}. No pressure or anything.

 Quest Hand-in: Outstanding, <name>. Your timing couldn't have been better!
Title: No Weapons For You!

Description: Alright, these cowards want to fight? Let's see how well they do without any weapons.

I'm sure you must have a torch, or something. Burn their weapon racks.

Burn them all!

 Quest Hand-in: Let's see them wage their war now!
Title: The Last Gasp of Y'Shaarj

Description: A dark, vaporous substance stains the floor of the room. This is all that remains of the Old God Y'Shaarj.

 Quest Hand-in: Do you see? Even now it fades from being.
Title: A Tamer's Homecoming

Description: Yer ready to enter the full circuit of pet battlin', matey. Go back to yer trainer, Mish Burnhep, in Stormwind, and prepare for the adventure of a lifetime!

 Quest Hand-in: I'm so proud of you, <name>. You're ready for the big time!
Title: A Plea From Beyond

Description: <You can't make sense of the spirit's urgent plea, but maybe Choluna can decipher what's going on here.>

<Speak with Choluna back inside the shrine!>

 Quest Hand-in: Slow down, <class>! You look as though you've seen a ghost...
Title: Pristine Remains of a Paragon

Description: This artifact has been restored to a remarkably excellent condition.  Perhaps you will put it on display at the Seat of Knowledge, so that lorewalkers and archaeologists can study it.

 Quest Hand-in: This will aid lorewalkers and archaeologists in understanding the history of Pandaria.
Title: Cloth Scavenging

Description: The humanoids of the northern lands wear garments that can be converted into cloth if you know how.

For a few gold I am willing to teach you the art of Cloth Scavenging that will give you additional frostweave cloth from the humanoids of Northrend that you slay.

 Quest Hand-in: May you slay many humanoids and take their cloth.
Title: Making Contact

Description: You aren't one of the zombies...

A troll?  I did see one, just before the outbreak...  He warned us, told us to be on our guard... But it was too late.

Your troll friend headed to Booty Bay to warn them...

 Quest Hand-in: I be tellin' Baron Revilgaz about da Zandalar threat now...
Title: Destroy the Forges!

Description: In my folly, I'd thought Valduran's project at Narvir's Cradle, a large construction area to the south, no more than a grotesque monument to "Keeper" Loken's cruelty.

Now we know the truth, that it was meant to be used as a weapon against us and our allies. We must not allow this iron colossus to reach completion, {name}, for it will mean the end of the refuge.

Go to Narvir's Cradle, find the lightning forges the stormforged artisans use, and sabotage them.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent work! Oh, it won't stop the iron dwarves, but it'll take them valuable time to rebuild those forges. I daresay we've gained the advantage.
Title: A Message to the Zandalari

Description: I know we're here to hunt the Horde, but this is an opportunity.

Exiles or not, these are Zandalari trolls, and the Zandalari have all but put in their lot with the Horde.

Let's show them what we do to friends of the Horde.

 Quest Hand-in: I hope you left a few alive.They need to learn to fear us.
Title: Greatfather Winter is Here!

Description: Have a wondrous Winter Veil, friend!  Be sure to say hello to Greatfather Winter!  If you've been nice this year, you'll receive wondrous treats on the day of the Feast of Winter Veil.  Be sure to tell him what you hope to get this year!

Also, be sure to stock up on treats to give those who've been nice this year.  We have a great selection to choose from.  Fresh from our farm to your plate - it's Smokywood Pastures wholesome goodness!

 Quest Hand-in: Ho ho hello.  I am Greatfather Winter, and I - courtesy of the fine folks of Smokywood Pastures... "Fresh from our farm to your plate, it's Smokywood Pastures wholesome goodness" - would like to wish you a fantastic Feast of Winter Veil.If you've been good this year, maybe you will receive treats from Smokywood Pastures as your treat for the Feast of Winter Veil.  Huzzah.
Title: Silver Lining

Description: Once the Scourge have a target in their sights, they'll stop at nothing to acquire it.

You're doomed to a mindless existence as a walking corpse....

<Stefan's face twists into a cruel grin.>

... unless we can use their desires against them.

I'll explain later. I have complex magic to prepare which requires certain material components.

Travel due east of here to the land beneath the Reliquary of Agony. Slay the ghouls and abominations you'll find there and return to me with their remnants.

 Quest Hand-in: <Stefan sifts through the foul components.>Well, it's far from perfect, but it'll have to do.Now brace yourself, <class>. This is where it gets good....
Title: Plans of Attack

Description: <The attack plans are written on the parchment in fluorescent squid-ink and bound together with Azshara's seal.>

Orders from our queen:

Queen Azshara has commanded that all naga forces prepare for a full assault upon the Alliance invaders in our land. Details for the attack have been distributed to your various unit commanders.

The Alliance shall tremble at the might of our queen!

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent work, <class>. You've done the Alliance a great service. With these plans in hand, we will be able to prepare our defenses in advance of the attack.
Title: Shooting the Breeze

Description: Taz and I are having a spirited debate over who kills more efficiently: shadow hunters or frostwolves.

Care to get in on the wager, commander?

I've been focusing on talbuk because of their fierce majesty. They truly encapsulate the grandeur of Nagrand as any native of Draenor knows.

 Quest Hand-in: Twenty-four, huh? That's fine work.I brought back fifty.I'll send someone out for the meat. Waste not, want not.
Title: Anima Instincts

Description: Voras is clearly content to roam the Elder Stand. We will need a way to lure it to us once we are ready to fight.

Did you notice the wildseeds in the clearing where we spotted it? Voras must be feasting on the concentrated anima contained within them.

There should still be some expended wildseeds from before the drought in the Gormhive. Let us create bait too tempting for Voras to ignore.

 Quest Hand-in: I am amazed that this contains so much concentrated anima. You will surely lure a devourer to you with this!
Title: Taking the Horn For Ourselves

Description: {name}, it's Eitrigg.  I want you to hold onto that horn.  I'm sure we can improvise and find a way to work it into the plan.

I'm more than a little concerned about what Kaoshin said about attacking Redridge.  We knew an attack was imminent, but not this soon!

Return to me, with the horn.  We will talk again here, in Chiselgrip.  And try not to ruin that disguise.  You're not done with your undercover work yet.

 Quest Hand-in: True, an attack on Redridge is an attack against the Alliance... but it is also an attack against innocents.I won't stand for that.  Not as a Crusader.  Not as an orc.It's time we taught the Blackrock clan - my old clan - that their raiding days are over.
Title: The Froststone Vault

Description: Look there, across the Reach! Primalist forces are converging on Froststone Vault.

The storm they seek to unleash must be locked inside.

<Emberthal winces, wrestling with her broken memories.>

We fought this enemy before, and won. Neltharion commanded that the vault be secured, but I... cannot remember why...

This is no time for contemplation. Rally with Sarkareth and the Ebon Scales at the vault. Ensure the enemy does not breach it!

 Quest Hand-in: Steady there, <class>. The Ebon Scales will put an end to this incursion.
Title: One Special Spirit

Description: You've been a huge help to Tirna Vaal. I need to bring this anima to one of our newest wildseeds.

I'd love for you to come with me. It's only fair, since you're the one who recovered the animacones.

I'm quite excited for you! Let's go.

 Quest Hand-in: Starlight shines within Dreamweaver, radiant and serene.And... two rivers meet in a lush delta. A wildseed and a mortal, both new to the forest. Bonded by spirit and by fate.Long has it been since the boughs beheld such an event. The weald will be watching.
Title: Maktu's Revenge

Description: Last time Maktu was out hunting hydras for hides at Serpent Lake, he was attacked by the biggest hydra he's ever seen. Maktu reached for his spear, but it was too late. He had just enough time to escape becoming hydra food.

Who knows? Maybe next time, Maktu not be so lucky. Maktu wants to be there so there won't be a next time. Will you help Maktu get his revenge on Mragesh?

 Quest Hand-in: <Maktu nods approvingly.>Maktu is thankful for your help. Maktu's pride is satisfied. He will not be caught off guard again.
Title: Void Inoculation

Description: All entities touched by shadow leave behind traces of void when they are defeated, If you collect enough in your travels through the city, return to me, and I will distill it into its undiluted form. 

We can save more of my kin.

 Quest Hand-in: Another soul freed from the cruelty of the void.
Title: Mast Effect

Description: Kua'fon was peering over de edge and managed to fall off de cliff again.

Normally he gets back up here on his own, but it be taking too long this time.

Best go down to de beach and find him. He is probably stuck up one of de ship masts out there.

If he will not come down, you can try bribing him with more fish.

 Quest Hand-in: <Kua'fon picks at his teeth with a wing-claw, carefully avoiding eye contact with you.>
Title: Personal Property

Description: You can detect no hinges or openings on this box. Were it not for the shifting of items inside, it could easily be mistaken for solid metal.

If anyone could know the method of its opening, it would be Highlord Mograine.

 Quest Hand-in: <After tracing a complex pattern of runes on each of the box's surfaces, the outline of a lid appears and a click echoes through the chamber.>Here you are, <race>.
Title: Deck 'Em

Description: That ooze seems really hungry!

He ate my backpack, compass, pickaxe, and my hearthstone cards.

Get my cards back!

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you! I'll grab my cards here, and meet you back in town!
Title: Tirna Scithe: A Warning Silence

Description: The songs of Tirna Scithe have faded as the grove wanes, yet there is now silence. Droman Oulfarran's voice has not been heard in some time. The trees whisper of penumbral shadows, discordant songs, and dying roots. All is not well.

Friend of Ardenweald, travel to Root-home. Delve into the Mists. Remove that which threatens us.

 Quest Hand-in: Word of your aid has been sung through the roots. Thank you, friend of the forest.
Title: Against the Giants

Description: While it's going to be crucial to defeat the Scourge on the ground, we mustn't neglect the gate itself.

The flesh giants on the ramparts are capable of hurling massive boulders and chunks of ice, inflicting devastating damage to enemy infantry below.

Muster a force and defeat these giants. We need to know just what we're up against in terms of their strength.

Oh... and bring me their spines. If memory serves, there's a little trick I can share with you.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent. These look to be usable samples.Time again to use the enemy's strength against them....
Title: Risking It All

Description: Wait, what?! How could he be so reckless? Blowing the ship free is insane! They could kill Shen-zin Su, and all of us with it. 

I know we don't have much time, but we need to think of another way...

 Quest Hand-in: The first step is done, but now we must save Shen-zin Su!
Title: Take Them Down!

Description: In order to maintain the relative safety in the Southern Barrens, we must put a stop to the current leadership of the Razorfen tribe. Although Charlga Razorflank commands her people through powerful mysticism, her true power is in the strength of the elders around her.

Slay them. Hunt down Bonetusk, the pack leader. Stop Roogug, the overseer of Geomancers. Crush Ramtusk, the quilboar Warlord.

Return to me when the deed is done.

 Quest Hand-in: You've done well this day. Agathelos would have taken many lives in its fury.
Title: Here Comes the BOOM!

Description: {name}, they stole all my fireworks, the little scamps.

You didn't see them? I was just on the verge of creating a new module for Reaves when these kids came in here and ran off with my fireworks.

I need them back if I'm going to finish what I'm working on. Can you go get them back for me?

 Quest Hand-in: <Didi takes the fireworks from you and continues to work at her bench.>There we go. All done!Apply this to your bot, and you should be able to launch fireworks wherever you want! ALL explosions are beautiful in their own way... but fireworks really are something else.
Title: WANTED: Ra'tok the Hammer

Description: I've got an issue that could use your assistance, commander.

A few of our men spotted an Iron Horde lieutenant wandering in the cliffs near here. We suspect she's directing their forces to strategic ground as they land on the Orunai Coast.

I would feel much better about the safety of this fort if you could take her out.

 Quest Hand-in: All hail your glory, commander.
Title: Spread the Good Word

Description: Before I can ship you off to Doctor Malefious with the good news, you will have to run a simple field test of the blight with the modifications I have made.

The hungering dead stream out from what remains of Old Wintergarde. Commandeer a vehicle from the east gate and drive it northeast through Vengeance Pass until you reach the twin towers at the southeastern edge of Wintergarde. Drop the blight bomb on the undead that cover the area. Report back to me with the results!

 Quest Hand-in: As much as it irritates me that we may have assisted the Alliance, I declare the field test a success! Next stop: Agmar's Hammer!
Title: Dumphry's Request

Description: Fel orcs might be complete barbarians but their smithing is not as primitive as you might think.  Only fel iron can be used with this mold if we want to end up with a working key - anything else would probably end up breaking it.

Bring me some fel iron bars, a bit of arcane dust and motes of fire.  I'll try my hand at it, but I make no promises.

 Quest Hand-in: Let's try it then.  Let's see what fel orc crafting is all about.
Title: Proclamation Investigation

Description: My lord seldom leaves our holdings along the northern coast, and visitors are expressly forbidden. For most, tidesages like myself are their only connection to the house proper.

Lord Stormsong usually delivers orders through proclamations posted throughout the valley. None have reached Brennadam, but if there are any posted here we may be able to find some answers.

 Quest Hand-in: Independence?!This is too far. A shattered Kul Tiras will never stand!
Title: Paragon of the Nightfallen

Description: A very grateful Thalyssra has requested your presence. She wishes to reward you for your exceptional aid.

 Quest Hand-in: Greetings outlander, liberator, Huntmaster, friend..Our gratitude goes beyond anything mere words can define.Take these trophies as a token of our gratitude and a share in the spoils of war. The more you aid us, the more we can provide you.
Title: Slap and Cap

Description: Oh for... not again! If you heard the deputy yelling out there, that means we've got a fullblown oil leak on our hands! It's those filthy worgen again!

Listen, it's going to be total chaos out there. Sleep-deprived goblins running around screaming and not knowing what to do. I need you to snap the workers back to their senses.

A good, swift backhand across the face should do it! Once they shake themselves off, they'll get to work capping those gushers!

 Quest Hand-in: It's not working! We're going to have to shut it off at the source.Go talk to the Deputy outside, he'll walk you through it!
Title: Mauti

Description: I got da feeling dat somethin' ain't right wit' dat panther, {name}.  It ain't natural.  I gonna need to perform some rituals over da body.  Put Mauti down, an' den let's see what we can find out, {name}.

 Quest Hand-in: High Priestess Kilnara be behind dis abomination.  Dis ain't looking good.  We should see to da dwarf and then make our way to see what other trouble be going on.
Title: Dredging up an Assistant

Description: Here we go, onto the dredging part.

Just like we made that biggun here earlier!

I mean we don't need the stone of binding or three other dredgers, but you'll still be throwing stuff into the muck!

So it's the same. 

You head to the shore with this here Kaja-Infused Dredger Mix I whipped up for you.

Toss it into that muck pool and let's meet that new dredger butler of yours!

 Quest Hand-in: It worked! Of course I knew it would. Now what to name this guy... but first I am go'n to dismiss him so y'can test out the binding of the contract.
Title: Necro Overlord Mezhen

Description: The dead ones are at Gjalerbron and they have necromancers with them?

We must eliminate the leader of these necrolords.

Do whatever it takes, {name}, but see to it that Necro Overlord Mezhen, and whatever he's attempting to accomplish, is neutralized.

We cannot afford to see the vrykul successful in whatever they are doing with these undead creatures!

Look for Mezhen on the platform in the rear right section of Gjalerbron.

 Quest Hand-in: <Chieftain Ashtotem breathes a sigh of relief.>That should take some of the pressure off.<name>, time and again you have proven your value to the taunka of Camp Winterhoof. Please, choose something from our bounty. I insist.
Title: Theotar's Mission

Description: Oh the Accuser sent you? How keen!

I do, in fact, know the fate of Prince Renathal... at least part of it.

When our assault on the Master's keep failed, we were both captured. I was banished to the Ember Ward, but the Prince was dragged off to Sinfall.

I'm cultivating an escape from this Light-blighted land to follow after him, but the Light here... it makes it hard to think.

My parasol once protected me, but the ruffians destroyed it. Help me rebuild it, and we'll find the Prince together.

 Quest Hand-in: <Exposure to the Light is clearly causing Theotar to lose control of himself.>Gubbins... Where are you?
Title: Proving Pit

Description: Ya done quite well for ya'self, {class}. I'm sure I could teach ya a trick or two here and dere, but I not be wastin' ya time on tiki targets no longer.

l put one last trial before ya den, mon. Head over to da provin' pit in the middle of dis area and fight a real baddy - one dat wants ta kill ya back. Just let the jailor by the pit know when ya ready.

 Quest Hand-in: Ya handle yerself quite well. Ya gonna be quite powerful some day.
Title: The Vintner's Assistants

Description: Vintner Iltheux oversees all arcwine production for the Horde. 

He's used to making wine himself, but the Horde sent in help to speed up the process. 

It's had the opposite effect. 

We need to get to the bottom of this. 

How about you tour the vineyards and see how things are running? I have a few more questions for the vintner.

 Quest Hand-in: It sounds to me like we've found our problem.
Title: Waking the Beast

Description: Thanks to you and the Captain, Nespirah has full control of her body... but most of the naga don't know this yet.  Once we make our escape, she will activate her biological defenses and destroy the naga from within.

Make yourself ready... I will now tell Nespirah to begin the countdown.

 Quest Hand-in: It appears that I owe you my life, yet again.  Thank the Light that you found me before you and your shaman activated those bio-defenses.
Title: Leader of the Pack

Description: Excellent work so far, {name}.  Our scouts have identified the leader of the Forsaken ground assault.

One of Sylvanas' handpicked dark rangers is overseeing the battlefront from the Walden house near the shore.  Take this whistle and use it when you're close to her.

I'll have my men let loose our attack mastiffs to take her down.  Be careful, {name}.  You don't want to engage her alone.

 Quest Hand-in: You did it, <name>.  That should take the wind out of their sails.
Title: Warmth of the Sun

Description: The desert nights in Uldum can get awfully cold. I fear for our little egg's ability to withstand these temperatures.

These Amathet to the East seem to have mastered the harnessing of the sun's energy. If we could borrow some of their expertise, we could use it to keep the egg nice and cozy.

Keep your eyes open for something we can use.

 Quest Hand-in: You've found a solar collection device? Perfect!Now our egg will be nice and toasty through the chilly nights.
Title: In Fungus We Trust

Description: I've cultured these unusual spores you dug up with a most magnificent cocktail of ... reagents ... that I'm fond of. I'm eager to see how my manipulated spores react to the waters of the Crossroads oases.

The Stagnant Oasis to the southeast should provide us an uncontaminated site for our experiment. Simply plant this culture in the moist soil anywhere near the oasis, and document the results for me.

Be sure to cover your mouth, {class}.

<Helbrim grins disarmingly.>

 Quest Hand-in: Explosive spore clouds? You don't say ... tell me more. Choking? Stinging? Burning of the eyes? Was there itching? Nausea? Mortification? Delightful, DELIGHTFUL! You've certainly earned your commission, <name>.That skin rash of yours should pass in a day or two.
Title: Twisted Hatred

Description: I must warn you, {name}, this matter must stay between us. The satyr are enough of an embarrassment to us already, and this one is much too close to home.

He is called Lord Melenas. He resides in the nearby cave of Fel Rock, to the north, where he has gathered a large group of grell warriors. His heart is black as night, and he plots something most foul.

You must find him within his nearby cave just to the north of here, and bring me his head.

 Quest Hand-in: With Lord Melenas laid to rest I can finally move on to other matters. Thank you, <name>.
Title: Missed Me By Zhat Much!

Description: Okay, {race}! Zhis just got real!

Somevone zhinks zhat zhey can get rid of me zhat easily, hmm?

Ve shall see about zhat! Nozhink can shtop zhis vork! Nozhink!

<Schnottz looks around at the encroaching flames.>

Ve should probably get out of here.

Huury up! Time is vastink!


 Quest Hand-in: It is times like zhese, zhat one learns who his friends really are...
Title: Care to Barter?

Description: Hey, Uplander!

I hear you like helping. Maybe you could help me out? 

I need some packages sent to Valdrakken. If you don't peek and don't ask, I can make it worthwhile. 

Stop by when you're in Loamm. We can work out a deal!

Your new friend, Ponzo.

 Quest Hand-in: I can smell my letter on you. Ready to help?
Title: Blueprint: Emergency Repair Kit

Description: <This blueprint details how to build what appears to be a repair kit for mechanical creations.

You should be able to upload the blueprint to Pascal-K1N6's database in Rustbolt.>

 Quest Hand-in: Have you recovered a new blueprint, my fleshy friend?I will add it to my database posthaste.
Title: What the Drust Knew

Description: Ahoy, {name}!

If you have a moment, I could use your assistance. I've recently received a large shipment of Drust relics that I've been processing.

Most of them have been nothing out of the ordinary, but there is this one that is special. Just holding it makes my hair stand on end. 

With you being my best pupil, I was thinking that it would be fun if we disenchanted it together, to see how it was made.

What do you say?

 Quest Hand-in: I'm sorry, <name>, I didn't think that enchantment would be so complex. I thought I could maintain the incantation.I guess that's it. With the relic destroyed the technique behind its construction is lost.A shame, really. It's not often that I'm left dumbfounded by another enchanter.
Title: Voices From the Dust

Description: <Drakuru places the Eye of the Prophets on his brow and the Heart of the Ancients on his chest.>

We be close, mon, very close!

The Drakkari Tablets be all dat remain ta be found. Nobody be knowin' how old dey be or what dey be sayin', but with the eye and the heart Drakuru can be readin' dem. Dey lie deep inside the crypt at Drakil'jin, due east of here.

Once ya got the tablets, get sacred mojo from the oracles and protectors so ya can summon me there. They'd be proud to be dyin' for such a cause.

 Quest Hand-in: We've done it, <name>!We have all of the components we need to perform the cleansing ritual.
Title: Havi's Test

Description: I could sense your power the moment you arrived in this land. You carry great purpose and a heavy task.

Know that the Aegis of Agrammar rests in the high halls of the All-Father. Only if you prove your valor, can you claim it against your foe.

Many trials must you face for this, but first I must know your strength. My stew is incomplete, and my old bones couldn't carry the ingredients up the hill. 

You look like you have a good arm. Will you help an old man finish his stew?

 Quest Hand-in: Hah, you throw like a shieldmaiden!What? That's a good thing! Try the stew, young champion, and savor the taste of a task well done.
Title: Release the Hounds

Description: I have heard the familiar howls and barks of bakar that are missing from camp.

Our beloved dogs are trapped in cages, waiting to be ripped apart by those... those things.

We have a duty to our companions. Free them and witness the true might of a Shikaar bakar!

 Quest Hand-in: Magnificent beasts, aren't they?Every bakar holds a special place in Clan Shikaar. They are our fellow hunters, guards, and our most cherished friends.
Title: Might of the Sentinels

Description: The Twilight's Hammer? Here?

This is far more serious than I expected. We've got to put a stop to this. I don't know if I'm ready to lead such an offensive, but I'm not about to let my fears get in the way of what needs to be done!

I will rally our forces from Feathermoon Stronghold. Head to Dire Maul, make your way to the arena, and disrupt Cho'gall's activities; we will launch our attack during the confusion.

 Quest Hand-in: Welcome back from the battle! The Twilight's Hammer have been disgraced in the eyes of the Gordunni, and driven from Feralas.We've shown the glory of the Alliance in full force today! Be proud!
Title: Wrangle Some Aether Rays!

Description: Wanna help the Skyguard and Ogri'la?

Just hear me out before you walk away, hot stuff.  We're in need of remounts!  The bombing runs and missions to Bash'ir Landing have taken a toll on our mounts.

The aether rays that fly around Vortex Summit, and the Crystal Spine to the northeast, look like they'd do just fine.  You don't even have to bring them back here, though that would be nice.  Just break and rope them, and we'll track them down later.

Think you can wrangle me up some?

 Quest Hand-in: Woo hoo!  Nice job, <name>!  Those rays are going to make excellent mounts!Stick around kid... the Sha'tari Skyguard can always use a man of your obvious talents!
Title: Diaries of the Dead

Description: <The enchantments preserving this journal are intact, but fading. It appears to be the diary of a citizen of the city. You turn to a random page...>

Then he had the audacity to enter our summoning circle and demand we evict his study space at once. Who willingly steps into the chaos of a summoning ritual? He is mad. We call him that now -- Mad Mardivas.

Of course, he was bitten on the leg by a lesser summon, and...

<It continues -- not useful, but you surmise there may be more such tomes.>

 Quest Hand-in: <You see a glowing lock, and Mardivas' journal is next to it. You glance at the final pages.>The rune locks have been stabilized, and organized in such a way that only one with my level of logical acumen would be able to decipher.Oh, to see the faces of the would-be thieves, thwarted! Yes, yes, yes that is it! I shall work on a ward that allows me to view the thieves in the act! Genius, genius, I am.I simply need a bit more time...
Title: Demon Duty

Description: Listen, {class}, I know this assault on Splintertree has everyone worked up, but if we forget about the satyr portals we'll come out of this crisis to face an even larger one.

<Locke stares at your expressionless face.>

You don't know about the portals?

To the northeast, in the regions of Satyrnaar and Xavian, the satyrs are attempting to summon in demons to bolster their numbers.

We must be vigilant in closing those portals, no matter what issues we face here!

 Quest Hand-in: Good work, <race>.One less thing we have to worry about!
Title: Life After Life

Description: I could sense that his friend bore a deep scar. Something in this place reopened it--perhaps so that it could heal cleanly this time.

Now it is Kolgar's time to heal.

In the terrace above us, you will find my friend Trellain working with the enchanters. Tell him that I require one of the vessels he uses in his work. He will give it to you freely.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you, <name>. This will be suitable.
Title: Spread the Enchantment

Description: Algeth'ar Academy has put in an order for more enchanting rods. We need everyone to pitch in if we are going to fill the order on time. Could you be of assistance?

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you. With this order filled, the Academy will be churning out more enchanters in no time!Here, study this. Even as a skilled enchanter, there is more for you to learn.
Title: The Lunar Festival

Description: It's that time of the year, {name}! The Cenarion Circle invites all denizens of Azeroth to partake in our celebration of the Lunar Festival. You will find the Lunar Festival Harbinger in this very city at a location marked by a blessed circle of moonlight. She can tell you more about the holiday.

 Quest Hand-in: Welcome, <name>.  Are you here to join in the festivities?
Title: The Missing Handler

Description: I just received word from Warbeast Kraal dat one of their handlers is missing.

Dis is not usually a problem, but dey are expecting a large hatching dis year. Dey will need all de hands dey can get!

Go on and see if you can find de handler, name of Bazo or something, and tell him to get back to de Kraal.

 Quest Hand-in: <Handler Bazkoji rests with his sword still held in hand. He died fighting.>
Title: The Battle for the West

Description: Our base is barely built and already the Iron Horde sets up defenses against us. Still the plan worked and we fight on two fronts.

I have received word that Durotan has finally breached the western gates as well, but is bogged down in a pitched battle. You should go see the situation for yourself.

 Quest Hand-in: Now you see what we face here. We will keep as much pressure here as we can so your base can remain free to attack all over the jungle.
Title: Crown of Prosperity

Description: Your crown is so colorful! Such beautiful pinks and yellows and blues... if only it could last.

Although those particular flowers cannot, I know some that can!

Similar flowers to those bloom every Lunar Festival. They hold a special connection to Elune that I can empower, thanks to you. Retrieve them for me, and we can fashion a crown that you can enjoy year round!

 Quest Hand-in: Such a multitude of colors! These flowers will bring happiness to all who see them.This crown shall bring you great prosperity.
Title: Inheritance

Description: Glad you could make it, soldier.

<Damos gives you a sardonic salute.>

This is surreal. We're back in a place we knew long ago. Now it's in ruins. And it's crawling with all kinds of new wildlife. 

I guess it's true what they say. You can never go home again.

Enough talking. Time to work. Emberthal wants this place locked down.

 Quest Hand-in: Thanks for the assistance, <name>. You're a real asset in the field.After this is over, we should meet up in Valdrakken. I think there's a couple watering holes with our names on 'em.
Title: Wake of Ashes

Description: It feels as if the Maw itself is sentient... and taking notice of our presence.

We must leave at once. Bolvar must be informed of what is happening here.

I will bring my father with us. Lead the way out of here, {name}. With haste.

 Quest Hand-in: Now to get you and your... associates out of here.
Title: Equipment Blueprint: Trained Shark Tank

Description: This appears to be a blueprint for some sort of naval equipment.  We should take it back to our Shipyard and see if someone can decipher it.

 Quest Hand-in: This is a blueprint for some high tech naval equipment.  I should be able to reverse engineer the plans and have this equipment available for you shortly!
Title: Allies in Azsuna

Description: <Your bloodgazer hatchling emits a terrified squawk, and you sense the spirits of Azsuna are nearby.> 

<The spirits of the elves of Azsuna must seem strange and unnatural to your pet. It may instinctively fear them.>

<Show your falcosaur that you and it can work alongside the spirits of the Court of Farondis.>

 Quest Hand-in: <The hatchling is more curious than afraid of the ghosts in Azsuna now. It will need some time to recover from this adventure.>
Title: The Start of Something Good

Description: While the rest of our army sets up camp -- you should follow me. I spotted something... interesting... on my way back from Zoram'gar.

I'll admit, not even I could have predicted such fortuitous happenstance.

Come with me, {name}. And bring a pickaxe.

 Quest Hand-in: You heard the warchief, we got work to do!
Title: Help Mudsprocket

Description: The Steamwheedle Cartel's new outpost in the southern part of the marsh isn't faring so well. The zeppelin carrying supplies to Mudsprocket crashed, leaving them without vital tools, food, and medical supplies.

Follow the road down south and into the marsh's interior. You'll pass by Tabetha's Farm and the Stonemaul Ruins before the road brings you to Mudsprocket. Offer any help you can provide to the town's leadership.

 Quest Hand-in: I won't turn down any help! We're in the process of setting up here and trying to make the most of what we've got, until those supplies from the zeppelin arrive.
Title: Other Interests

Description: Madam Goya is interested in many unusual items other than just rare metals.

Keep an eye out for these particular items during your travels in Nazjatar.

Deliver them to me and Madam Goya will consider you for special access.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent work, we shall speak again.
Title: Forged by Trial

Description: {name}, my friend.

I have thought of you as an ally for some time now. The thrill I felt when you decided to join us in Bastion... I knew you would be a boon unto our ranks.

Our bond has been forged by the trials we face. Without you, I could have fallen to my newfound knowledge as Achillon did.

I wish to cement our bond. I would be honored to soulbind with you.

 Quest Hand-in: You, me, and our dear Pelagos.I challenge anybody to name a better team.
Title: Stretch Your Wings

Description: I am heartened to see that so many escaped the War Creche. My own weyrn... was not as fortunate.

<Emberthal stands in silence for a moment.>

There are other creches throughout the Reach, filled with dracthyr in peril. Strong wings will be needed to reach them.

Focus. Remember your training. Get a feel for the wind again. You must regain your strength and fly to the other creches.

The time for rest is over.

 Quest Hand-in: You are getting the hang of this a lot faster than I was!But then, you finished your <class> training. I was hoping to specialize as a diplomat.
Title: Power of the Chosen

Description: The necropolis is nearly in position. Now is the time to strike!

We must force Gharmal into the open together. Join me on my roc, and we will unleash your runeblade's power on the juggernauts.

The Margrave will be unable to ignore their deaths. Once they leave their blighted tower, we can finish them once and for all.

 Quest Hand-in: Such power! Gharmal will have no choice but to face us now.
Title: Just In Case

Description: When we set up shop the first thing we built was the cannon. Seemed like a good place fer it.

We started buildin' the base up around it when them chompin' acid spittin' varmints came crawlin' out of the ground.

The upside though is the cannon is built, just not loaded.

We have to go down to the bottom floor of this thing anyway so may as well grab some Doomshot if you see any on your way down.

Better to load the cannon and not need it than to need it and not have it loaded.

 Quest Hand-in: While I hope we don' need to fire the big gun, I kinda hope we can fire the big gun.
Title: Lefty Loosey, Righty Tighty

Description: Okay, I think we're ready for the penultimate assault... before you can bring down Mechazod, you're going to have to dismantle his lieutenants first!

You'll find Twonky, ED-210, Max Blasto, and The Grinder at the West Point, North Point, Mid Point and South Point stations, respectively.

To get them to show up, just turn the valves at the stations to mess up whatever they're trying to do out there. You can't miss the places, they all have spinning lights.

 Quest Hand-in: Wow, you survived!I guess all that's left to do now is to deal with Gearmaster Mechazod.
Title: The Rear is Clear

Description: Excellent work, {name}! The rear is now officially clear. We'll take care of the stragglers. I want you to go back to Marshal McBride, standing in front of Northshire Abbey, south of here, and let him know that the goblin situation is under control.

Farewell, {class}.

 Quest Hand-in: With your help we have managed to secure the northern and western sectors of Northshire. We still have a rather large contingency of Blackrock orcs to the east and they've begun burning down the forest!
Title: A Portal Away

Description: Xylem may have escaped, but a trace of his portal remains.

Now that you have freed his apprentices from his corruption, I will set them to work trying to find a way to reach him.  Once I find something, I will alert the Kirin Tor.

I only ask that when you do confront the Archmage, that you try to spare his life. I believe that the good man he once was still exists beneath the shadow that has taken him.

Farewell, {name}.

 Quest Hand-in: So Xylem has been corrupted by shadow magic and has escaped with the Focusing Iris? This is not good.The Kirin Tor will pool our efforts with those of his apprentici-- I mean, apprentices. We must track down the archmage before he does something drastic.We will be in touch.
Title: A Dire Situation

Description: With their wolf pack reduced, the Horde is looking for replacements.  Unfortunately there's another source nearby.

The Bloodmaul ogres in the ravine below to the east keep a strong pack as their own sentries.  I hated sending you to kill the Thunderlord wolves, so why don't we do something different this time?

I've derived a magic powder from the dust that naturally falls off the wings of our fey drakes.  Sprinkle it on the Bloodmaul dire wolves to make them undesirable to the Horde.

 Quest Hand-in: I'm glad to hear that it worked.  The fewer the number of Nature's creatures that have to die, the better.With all that you've done for us already, I must say that I'm beginning to grow very fond of your company.Take care, <name>.
Title: Build Your Barracks

Description: You are going to want to build your barracks, which you're gonna need to properly bash faces.

The first step is to go find the blueprints and learn 'em. I think I left some blueprints lying around here somewhere.

Next ya gotta pick which plot you want us to build it on. Just point it out on my architect table and we'll get started constructing that thing right away.

 Quest Hand-in: This will be a mighty fine barracks, I think. I am sure Warmaster Zog will complain about how it needs to be bigger, and with more spikes. He likes spikes...
Title: Sticky Situation

Description: We were hauling batteries to the excavation site and I crashed my freakin' car!

My sister didn't even look back. I took the turn a little fast, so what? It happens!

Point is, the batteries went flying everywhere and I'm in no condition to lift them out.

So what do you say? Wanna help me out?

 Quest Hand-in: You're a real doll. Let's get out of here.
Title: Wings for the Kraal

Description: It seems your little one needs a moment to rest after dat adventure. I will look after it.

If you want to make yourself useful while you wait, I heard de pterrordaxes to de north have been laying lots of eggs recently. Go collect de ones dat are wiggling and making noises. Dey are about to hatch.

Our beasts breed well, but we always need more wings for de kraal.

 Quest Hand-in: I will get dese to a handler. We should be de first thing dey see if we want to keep dem.
Title: The Old Knight

Description: These days Cyrus is the Harbormaster, but he used to be one of Daelin Proudmoore's most trusted knights!

I lost my mother when the Scourge hit Lordaeron. My father sent me here to be raised away from the war. I don't know much about him... just that he was a Stormwind knight who gave his life fighting the Lich King.

Daelin hand-picked Cyrus to raise me and forced him to take a desk job. It's the only reason he wasn't at Theramore.

He's probably checking in that other Alliance ship. Let's go!

 Quest Hand-in: I've never seen Cyrus fired up like this!Sounds like we have work to do.
Title: Cutting Your Teeth

Description: It's nice that you've been helping out Toshley and his scientists.  I, however, do not have the luxury of indulging in my 'personal' interests.

If you want to make a difference around here, you'll do what I ask of you, and right now, I need weapons.

Our guns are effective at range, but when the bugs get in close, we need to have powerful melee weapons as a backup.

The teeth of the daggermaw lashtails in the northern part of the Razor Ridge make for great vibro-weapon blades.  Scare me up some.

 Quest Hand-in: Good work, kid.  All of the pain is worth it if even one of my soldiers' lives is saved by your efforts.I think you should benefit from your sweat and tears, too.  Since we're going to have a new batch of weapons soon, why don't you take one of mine?
Title: Battlezone

Description: It vould appear zhat anozher opportunity has arisen for you to redeem yourself, {race}.

Zhis little emergency has set me back a few tank gunnahs.

You zhink you have vhat it takes to fill in for vone of zhem?

My tanks are just vest of zhe camp. Get out zhere and put an end to zhis silliness!

 Quest Hand-in: Auch!If I vere an inch or two taller, I'd be dead!
Title: Stormheim

Description: It is good we found you, {name}!

Sky Admiral Rogers has sent word for you to meet her in Dalaran. It sounded important. She awaits your presence in the Violet Citadel.

Make haste!

 Quest Hand-in: It's an honor, <name>.
Title: The Enemy's Insignia

Description: This battered badge carries the insignia of an enemy officer. While worth little more to you than the metal it's made from, this piece would have significant value to a collector of military memorabilia.

Professor Thaddeus Paleo of the Darkmoon Faire is famous all over Azeroth for his large collection of military artifacts. Show the badge to him the next time you visit the Darkmoon Faire.

 Quest Hand-in: This is a remarkable example of an officer's insignia. While many of them visit the Faire, none are willing to part with their badges. Would you be willing to accept some Darkmoon tickets in trade?
Title: The Fruit of Our Efforts

Description: It is my job to maintain appearances here.

<Margaux smiles apologetically.>

You will have to endure a little showmanship while I walk with you through the vineyard. It is the only way to avoid suspicion.

I will try to help you as I can, but only when it is safe to do so.

Come with me- our first stop is the tasting pavilion. There you can sample some of our work.

 Quest Hand-in: You may want to cleanse your palate - we craft some strong flavors here!
Title: Patching Up

Description: Remember all that gnomish duct tape you brought me?

Well, I've found a use for it. The body of this flying machine is so banged up in places, that I'm going to need to reinforce it if I ever hope to fly.

Dorain over there has been telling me that the taunka use steam cured caribou leather for making watertight containers. Marsh caribou live all around the village and in the Flood Plains to the south. Get the best hides you can find and cure them over the steam vents in the Geyser Fields.

 Quest Hand-in: Fantastic! A few more tweaks and I'll be an airborne goblin!
Title: The Basics: Hitting Things

Description: Alright, mon. We start simple. I need ta know dat you know the basics of the arcane arts.

Go thrash dose tiki targets. Take it slowly. Natural-like. I'll watch how you form your casts and we'll go from dere.

 Quest Hand-in: Not bad, mon. Ya have a natural flow to ya spells - you may have a talent for dis.Some rough edges ta be sure, but we'll get dose ironed out here and I'll teach ya a few new tings as we go.
Title: Anduin's Decision

Description: You have done all you can for the Prince's friends.

You completed your mission and found the White Pawn - Prince Anduin. Admiral Taylor and the other SI:7 agents will be eager to have the boy safe in their custody.

It is time to return home.

 Quest Hand-in: He did WHAT?!?!?He's lucky that I haven't found him yet, because when I do, I just might kill him myself!Whatever he thinks he's doing... chasing after this Vale... it is not behavior fit for a prince!If we didn't have more pressing matters at hand, I would send our entire fleet chasing after his heels!
Title: Arming the Tribe

Description: We spotted some of Tongo's gang scouting de arena while you were away. It seems dis may be de calm before de storm.

We need to get de weapons you brought back from Tongo's hideout into de hands of our fellow outcasts. Mojambo's gang could attack any minute now.

We need to be prepared. Take de weapons and get dem to de unarmed members of de tribe.

If Mojambo thinks he can raid our home without a fight, he's got another thing coming.

 Quest Hand-in: It's a good thing you armed de tribe! Mojambo and his gang are attacking as we speak!
Title: Speak with your Ambassador

Description: <The dragon in elf form takes your letter of introduction, perusing it for a moment and then stashing it away within his sleeve.>

Everything seems to be in order. However, if you don't mind, I would ask that you speak with your ambassador here at the temple.

She has something of great import for you that needs taking care of before we send you up to the queen.

<He pats at the letter under his sleeve.>

I'll keep this safe for you until your return.

 Quest Hand-in: You must be <name>. I was told you'd be coming.I have something that I think you're uniquely qualified to take care of and by doing it, you'll be ingratiating yourself with the dragons here.
Title: Spoils of War

Description: The warring clans are relentless and our warriors are going through armor faster than I can keep it repaired.

If you find yourself in battle with the other clans, see if you can salvage any undamaged armor pieces from their soldiers. We should not let good resources go to waste.

 Quest Hand-in: The wayward clans should learn that such fate awaits all that would oppose the Rajani.Take your reward, outsider. We are done here.
Title: Realignment

Description: Now for this ley line. It looks like my fears were correct -- the decay has spread into the line itself.

We'll need to purge the decay and speed along the healing process, but I can't channel enough energy with my mirror image alone. 

Focus yourself on this ley crystal here. My connection with you will help me teleport here physically. Then, I will be strong enough.

 Quest Hand-in: We did it. Great work, <name>. Breathe the fresh air again!With this ley line restored, and Khadgar finishing up on the one in the tower, the Oathstone should be ready to claim. I must return to the Azure Archives shortly.
Title: Mission Report: Missing Supplies

Description: Your followers have sent a report regarding the mission at Vulture's Nest.

It details that the mission was a success and the lost supply shipment has been recovered.

Deliver the report to High Commander Wyrmbane aboard the Wind's Redemption.

 Quest Hand-in: It seems the mission to recover the supplies was a success. Well done, <name>.
Title: Ritual Effects

Description: I will need some assistance in conducting the ritual to allow us to gain passage to Fate's End. To help me with that, you will require the proper items and attire.

Normally I have free access to these things, but the recent upheaval has blocked myself and many of my brothers and sisters from obtaining them easily. However, the fallen tidesages across the span have all you will need.

Collect a ritual knife, lantern and robes from the fallen and these so-called prophets.

 Quest Hand-in: Wonderful. These are more than just a costume, they're an essential part of our traditions. For the ritual to work, you'll need to step into the role as fully as you can.
Title: Insurrection: Crafting War

Description: Refugees are flooding in to Shal'Aran, and many are willing to fight for Thalyssra's rebel army.

They need weapons, training and help from anyone who can provide it.

Go to Shal'Aran and lend your assistance.

 Quest Hand-in: This is an unexpected problem, but we have more soldiers than food or weapons.
Title: The End is Now

Description: Our forces have control of the House of Constructs, thanks to your intervention.

Now, all that remains is the fall of the instigator themselves--Margrave Gharmal.

This battle has been long in the making, {name}. I am at your side without hesitation.

Let us go to this monster. We will join Xandria to see him slain.

 Quest Hand-in: It is time.
Title: Beachfront Property

Description: It's time for Venomspite to expand!

We'll take care of the Onslaught in due time, but I want you to spearhead our efforts on the Forgotten Shore. The property value has outstanding potential and just look at that view!

Unfortunately, there's an infestation of human ghosts, shipwrecked crews and the like who haven't quite realized that they're dead.

Clear the beach and the waters off the shore, and maybe you and I will talk about building a cozy, new mausoleum down there soon.

 Quest Hand-in: Can't you just see it now, <class>? It'll be the vacation spot of Northrend!What do you think of the name, "Hansen's Cove", or maybe "<name> Bay"? Kind of catchy, don't you think?
Title: To the Broken Shore

Description: It would seem that Kanrethad's twisted followers have begun their ritual on the Broken Shore.

We must act quickly. The Burning Legion cannot be allowed to use Kanrethad as their weapon.

We have acolytes on standby, ready to perform a ritual of summoning on the Broken Shore when you're ready.

 Quest Hand-in: You're here, Netherlord! Quickly, there's no time to lose!
Title: Reclaiming Goods

Description: Not long ago a merchant vessel, the Blind Princess, was raided by murlocs.  Although the ship escaped intact, much of its cargo was dragged overboard by the creatures, including a very valuable statuette of Terenas Menethil.  We want that statuette recovered.

Search the coastal murloc hovels for crates, barrels and other evidence of lost cargo.  Find the Menethil statuette and return it to me.

 Quest Hand-in: This crate is covered with clawed scratches, and the marks of water damage.  Prying it open reveals soggy and rotted straw, as if something of value was stored in the crate.  You search through the straw......and find an armload of red-colored bottles.
Title: A Meeting With The Magister

Description: I've placed an enchantment on the tabard that should allow you to slip past the Sunreaver Sanctuary's defenses for a short period of time. You should have enough time to find your way into The Filthy Animal and meet up with the Sunreaver contact there, one Magister Hathorel.

Obtain the copy of Ancient Dragonforged Blades that his men borrowed from Wyrmrest while your disguise holds, and return it to me.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent work. Now that this is in our hands, we must get it to Caladis Brightspear as soon as possible. We can't risk the book falling back into Sunreaver hands.I'll ensure that Shandy Glossgleam gets his tabard back without incident, along with a healthy reward for his help.
Title: Shadowmoon Invasion!

Description: Your arrival couldn't be more timely, commander.

Shadowmoon raiders have been spotted closing in on the garrison.

You repelled their advances at Teluuna Observatory, and created chaos at Shaz'gul.

Now, they surely seek retribution. They will throw everything they have at us.

I have the entire garrison on high alert. Are you ready to face them?

 Quest Hand-in: I don't think they were ready for that. The Shadowmoon will think twice before attacking us again.
Title: Matters of Loyalty

Description: I have no authority over such matters. You must speak to our leader, Drek'Thar. I have already sent word of your arrival to Frostwolf Keep. Drek'Thar will be out to speak with you personally.

 Quest Hand-in: <High Warlord Cromush's face turns white.>THEY HAVE FORSAKEN US? THEY HAVE FORSAKEN THE HORDE? This cannot be!I...<Cromush falls to one knee.>I... I WILL BE FINE. We will do this without their aid. To hell with the Frostwolf!
Title: Zero Tolerance

Description: Ignorance! Dis be intolerable, mon! My entire batch of blight be useless!

Dat mongrel, Darmuk! He be responsible for watchin over da blight. He failed me, mon!

Dis be a good lesson for ya, {name}. Failure be like a disease dat spreads. Ya gotta catch it and kill it early, before it be killin' you!

Take dis scepter. It make my scourged trolls stronger. Use dem ta kill Darmuk. He be lurkin' down below just to da south.

Let dat be an example to all, mon. Don't be failin' Drakuru!

 Quest Hand-in: Ya done good, <name>. You be learnin' faster than I had hoped.Go now, get ya some rest. Soon I be givin' ya an even greater test!
Title: New Babies

Description: That's better, but there's still something wrong. I'm getting desperate here, {name}.

Can I call ya, {name}? Great.

Look, I think I have it now. I know what's wrong.

They miss their babies.

Yeah! When they first came here, the, uh... the bastard hunters that... abandoned them said they left the babies behind.

If we're going to save them from a life of misery, if we're going to save those babies, <under his breath> and turn a tidy profit, we've got to get them some new babies!

 Quest Hand-in: You did it, <name>! Mama, papa, and family. It brings a tear to my eye.Here, take this runty one. Now that I have the whole herd, this one's just an extra mouth to feed and won't fetch anything at market.
Title: A Personal Request

Description: If you have a moment, Deathlord... there is a personal matter I would like to speak with you about.

Some time ago, a brother of the Ebon Blade was imprisoned beneath the ruins of Lordaeron by the Dark Lady.

Sylvanas has refused all attempts to negotiate his release. Now, our world faces destruction and the time for diplomacy has passed.

Koltira Deathweaver cannot fight the Burning Legion in chains.

So we will break them.

 Quest Hand-in: Sylvanas will not be pleased with our actions, but we have more to worry about than offending the Dark Lady.
Title: Iron Rune Constructs and You: The Bluff

Description: You always gotta have a contingency plan in case your main plan backfires! That's why I've built in some anti-intelligence systems into the construct.

Your shiny new ride might rouse some suspicion while you're at Baelgun's excavation site. That's what your bluff ability is for! Just use that any time you're confronted and you'll be safe from harm.

Test it out on Lebronski by walking on his rug. Once he starts huffin' and puffin', use the bluff!

Get on the work bench when you're ready to begin.

 Quest Hand-in: You showed him! Now it's time to put you in the field.Feeling confident, I hope...
Title: The Warchief's Fleet

Description: Our reinforcements from Kalimdor arrived last night. Three orc gunships full of supplies, weapons and soldiers. Three orc gunships lost to Bloodfang's damned worgen.

How could an entire orc fleet lose to a small band of enemy combatants that lack any siege weaponry? An important question that you will answer for me.

Gather your gear and report to the orc admiral, Hatchet, at the Forsaken Rear Guard, southwest of here.

Get those orcs operational, {name}.

I await your full report.

 Quest Hand-in: This fiasco may go down as one of the biggest embarrassments in the history of naval warfare. How did this happen? Drunk happened. That's how.
Title: Venthyr Arsenal

Description: <Forgy reads the letter you hand him.>

Ah, Rendle sent you. Should've said so.

No problem. I'll get you everything you need to be bashing skulls at that court.

Gonna need some help convincing my boss for the time off, though.

Real stick in the muck, yeah?

Say you take care of some of the troubles around here, tell everyone it's for me--that'll do it.

 Quest Hand-in: Nice work. Boss gave the all-clear for me time off.See you there, Maw Walker.
Title: Ritual Reagents

Description: The Skull of the Man'ari, oh good choice! It's very powerful and it's held by an even more powerful Dreadlord!

There is a weakness, the skull has a will of its own! If we can commune with the skull we might be able to convince it to serve you instead!

We will need reagents from the floating city before we can perform the ritual to commune with it. Dust from a fresh grave, dark oil, and a powerful alcohol catalyst.

Oh, and blood! I sense a beast whose blood should be perfect.

 Quest Hand-in: Very good! Now, we're ready to begin.
Title: Tower Knowledge

Description: The woven power of this box can only be unlocked by feeding it pride and memory. In its weave are incantations I have seen used in the other realms to siphon or condition a soul. This... abomination... has used these tools of redemption and honor to create a lock.

As you challenge the floors of Torghast, your skill, speed, and efficiency will all contribute to Tower Knowledge which this box can feed upon. 

Feed it to retrieve the powers within.

 Quest Hand-in: <The box hungers, reaching into your memories of Torghast for past deeds to feed upon.>
Title: Vol'jin, Son of Sen'jin

Description: Even in da Echo Isles we have heard of da traditions of da Golden Road.

We must walk in da presence of royalty and hail da accomplishments of Vol'jin so dat his spirit be welcome here amongst da ancient kings.

I shall carry da ashes, if you light da fires.

Know that any member of any other tribe may contest us. As our champion, we will need you to fend them off if they do.

 Quest Hand-in: Vol'jin. I must admit, I am impressed with his deeds. Had we met in dis world, I am sure he and I would have had much in common.
Title: The G-Team

Description: That Murd Doc is crazy, {class}. Never, ever, let you find yourself in an aircraft with that gnome.

Stealth usually isn't my thing, and it's certainly not going to be yours. Go down this hallway to the Launch Bay and dispose of the Electrocutioner 6000.

The Electrocutioner is in charge of the aircraft...

...and I hate aircraft. I'm not getting in any sort of aircraft!

Use this parachute to drop down afterwards and speak with Commando Face for your next job.

 Quest Hand-in: Took you long enough. Get behind the pillar before you blow our cover!
Title: Heart of the Ancients

Description: Secrets of da ages, be revealed to me now!

<Drakuru peers through the Eye of the Prophets.>

Ahh, great be mah destiny, {name}. You be lucky ta know me....

There! I be seein' it, mon. The Heart of the Ancients. Dis be too easy!

You gunna find da heart lyin' near da corpse of a goblin east of here. He be up in a chamber, near a river of broken trees.

Hurry, mon, before someone else be findin' it!

 Quest Hand-in: This unfortunate goblin must have unearthed the Heart of the Ancients during his excavations in the region.It's doubtless that he had no clue as to its nature.You determine that it must have been overlooked in the chaos sweeping through the area.
Title: More Armor Scraps

Description: {name}, we need more armor scraps to supply our troops!

 Quest Hand-in: These are some good pieces, <name>.  I can use them to fashion new equipment for our troops.If my supply level gets high enough, then maybe our seasoned fighting units will enter the field!
Title: Ride to Thunder Bluff

Description: For a small fee, I will give you a wind rider to Thunder Bluff.  There's no faster way to the city!

If that is acceptable, speak to me again when you are ready to go.

If you're taking those hides to Ahanu, then I think he's at Hewa's Armory, at the base of the wind rider tower in Thunder Bluff.  And that's right where you'll land!

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, a new bundle of hides.  I will get to work on these immediately!Thank you, brother.  You have done me a great service.  Here are some coins to pay for your time and travel costs.
Title: It's A...

Description: Oh my! This egg is going to hatch at any second!

Well, looks like this little guy is eager to meet you.

Are you ready?

 Quest Hand-in: Congratulations! It's a beautiful hatchling of your own.Please take care of it, <name>.
Title: Fanning the Flames

Description: Strange thing about wind, it can be hard to wrap your hands around it.

Best practice for me has been finding some sort of living wind. If it can punch you, you can punch it back, and it won't slip through your grasp.

Head over to the Shrine of the Summer Breeze to the south and summon just such a living wind using this wind stone. Best it, gather a Fluttering Breeze from it, and come back over this way so that we can figure out what's next.

 Quest Hand-in: You know what it is to seize opportunity. I think you and I are kindred spirits, <name>.
Title: An End to the Killing

Description: Let's return to the upper decks and see what our current status is. Shandris should be there by now.

I know Shandris and Falstad well enough that they will be there with the captain of this ship, dead or alive.

 Quest Hand-in: <name>! I only just received the message of your success in Zandalar. Well done.I'm sorry for everything that you've been put through on behalf of this war. We have only one option if we want to stop the Zandalari from aiding the Horde.When the time is right, we will send our fleets to Zandalar. Your hard work will ensure we have a breach in their defenses to begin our invasion.Thank you once more, <name>. We owe a great debt to you and your allies.
Title: Pristine Edicts of the Thunder King

Description: This artifact has been restored to a remarkably excellent condition.  Perhaps you will put it on display at the Seat of Knowledge, so that lorewalkers and archaeologists can study it.

 Quest Hand-in: This will aid lorewalkers and archaeologists in understanding the history of Pandaria.
Title: Move Like No Other

Description: Sorry about the holographic projection... I literally need to be in two places at once these days.

A holy barrier that protects against fel magic, you say? I have just the thing to bypass it and enable Malevolence's teleport.

<The high elf rummages around in his pack, a shocked look quickly coming over his face.>

Sneaky! Look there... that imp just made off with it!

 Quest Hand-in: I'll make sure to give the grimoire to Malevolence so that she can unravel its mysteries.Meanwhile, we have some Black Temple scouting to conduct.
Title: The Future of Mechagon

Description: Now that Mechagon City has been cleared of its remaining dangers, it may once again be a place of peace and prosperity for gnomes and mechagnomes alike.

It is time for me to speak with Prince Erazmin regarding the future of our peoples. It is my sincere hope that we will forge an alliance that will last for generations to come!

When you are ready, please join us at the High Tinkertory for a special address.

 Quest Hand-in: This has truly been a glorious day for both gnomes and mechagnomes! We could not have done it without you, <name>!
Title: Test Flight: Ruuan Weald

Description: Hey, {name}.  I'm glad I caught you!  I have a very important mission!

Here is a nether-weather vane.  I need you to take some in flight readings for me and deliver them to my cousin in Ruuan Weald.

Speak with Rally and take a Zephyrium Capacitorium flight to Ruuan Weald.  While you're flying, spin the vane!

After you land, bring the spinning vane to O'Mally Zabnabber.

Good luck, {name}.  And don't delay!

 Quest Hand-in: Oh, you took readings from the nether-weather vane?  Splendid!  The data gained from this instrument -- coupled with my measurements of druid magic -- will bear much fruit!Oh, the applications will boggle the mind, I assure you!
Title: Roseate Essence

Description: <The pigment milled from this flower is of an exceptionally high quality.>

<Professor Pallin would be interested in seeing this.>

 Quest Hand-in: How did you get an extract so pure? Show me exactly what you did, step by step.Fascinating. Do you mind if I write this down, so I can show my other students?
Title: Primal Pests

Description: <Azurathel glances suspiciously at the proto-dragons lurking on the ridge behind him.>

I'd swear that those proto-dragons edge closer to camp every time I turn my back...

Those are not the dragons Wrathion invited us here to meet.

Proto-dragons are ruthless predators who cannot be reasoned with. We must be ruthless in return.

Cull their numbers to keep their ambitions in check, or this expedition will be over before it begins.

 Quest Hand-in: That may dissuade them from attacking the expedition camps for a time.It's eat or be eaten in the Dragon Isles, <name>. You'd do well to remember that.
Title: A Unified Swarm

Description: It seemed as though the mantid had been producing the corrupted amber for some time before our... intervention. It stands to reason that they are keeping a stockpile of it somewhere.

The Shado-Pan's scouts have been reporting an increased presence of the swarm's warriors in Klaxxi'vess. I would wager that they are guarding the corrupted amber.

Meet me there. If we have a chance to destroy that amber, then we need to take it.

 Quest Hand-in: If the entire swarm were empowered by that corrupted amber, N'Zoth would have an unstoppable army under his command.
Title: Spring Gatherers

Description: If you're looking for something to do, I hear there are mages in the settlements near capital cities - Razor Hill, Brill, Bloodhoof Village, and Falconwing Square - who have been recruiting egg hunters for help with some research they're doing. I'm not sure of the particulars, but I'm sure they'd tell you.

 Quest Hand-in: Yes! Yes, I think I have just the task for you...
Title: Friendly Competition

Description: So you wish to join the competition, {name}? Best of luck to you.

Be the first to gather a sack full of hides and talons from local wildlife and return them to me before the other competitors!

Winner earns the opportunity for an apprenticeship under craftsman Garaal.

Good luck!

 Quest Hand-in: Congratulations, <name>! You did it!The other competitors are nowhere to be found!Garaal will be most pleased. With such an abundance of supplies to work with he and the other craftsmen will have no trouble staying busy.I'll start tanning these immediately. They'll be ready for delivery in just a moment.
Title: Assault on the Iron Siegeworks

Description: Iron Horde war machines are being shipped onto battlefields by the dozens, and our forces are struggling to hold their ground. Most of these machines seem to be originating from the Iron Siegeworks in eastern Frostfire Ridge.

A strategic attack to disrupt and dismantle the Iron Horde at the siegeworks could be just what we need to turn the tide of the war.

 Quest Hand-in: Word of the assault has already made it back, as have some spoils from the fight.Well done sir, if you don't mind me saying.
Title: Wipe That Grin Off His Face

Description: We must send Foreman Swindlegrin packing if we're going to shut down his mine permanently, but be careful. His bodyguard, Meatpie, is a large, mean ogre, and  isn't likely to let you see the foreman without a fight.

The two probably occupy a platform that would let them look out over the entire Venture Company operation at Swindlegrin's Dig.

Remember, the dig is on the far side of the Suntouched Pillar to the northeast. Good luck, {name}.

 Quest Hand-in: What a relief to hear that the Venture Company will trouble us no more. You have my thanks, and that of Hemet for dealing with this problem. A game hunter cannot, in good conscience, lift her weapon against another person.
Title: From the Abyss

Description: My warp rift generator is complete. You can now use it to summon a true prince of the void, a creature whose soul shard will tell us much of what lies beyond.  

Go south in Void Ridge and use my warp rift generator near the void stones.  Look for a cluster of crystals near the edge of the abyss.  A huge warp rift will form and Void Baron Galaxis will surely appear.  

Destroy this creature and bring me his soul shard.  

 Quest Hand-in: You have saved my life's work <name>.  They called me insane, they laughed at me, they thought I was mad for my obsession with the Void Ridge and Warp Fields.  Now with this soul shard I can unlock the secrets of the voidwalkers.  I will command the power of the abyss.
Title: The Battle of Alterac
