Take my knife, swim down there and cut off their tails.  You should be able to use the tail to zap any stonefish you find.

 Quest Hand-in: Nice one, <name>!  I tell ya, golden stonefish are not easy to come by so this is a nice treat.
Title: Aviana's Grace

Description: If this was only the distraction, where is the main force? Who else is under attack? We need to figure out who else is in danger! Aviana should know, she's got eyes everywhere.

Let's go ask her. We should be able to contact her in the back room.

 Quest Hand-in: Nature is in dire need, mortal. You must fix it.
Title: What We Overcome

Description: I understand now. All of us that were touched by Domination were able to tap into something. Whether nobility or vengeance, it gave the strength to resist.

With all that I have faced, I have to remember that I am still here.

And if there are those willing to stand with Sylvanas, I have to believe they will stand with me as well.

I'm ready to try again. This time, I will overcome whatever I face.

 Quest Hand-in: All the shards are now infused with the resistance we gained from our experiences with Domination.It was not easy, for any of us. But I am proud of what we were able to accomplish, together.As for the rest, our future is in the hands of the Primus.
Title: Reefwalker Bark

Description: Yes? What is it?

 Quest Hand-in: We use reefwalker bark for many things, from buildings to armor. I will distribute this bounty to the camp, thank you!
Title: If a Gem Isn't Pretty

Description: The kith of Loamm request the skills of a jewelcrafter! I have seen the wondrous sparkling gems in this glorious city, and the niffen below wish to see them as well. We don't see very well, so we know the value of a good sparkle!

Our chief Gemfinder and Jewelshiner, Miss Fanilly, wishes to see some beautiful gems. I bet she'd love the ones named after Alexstrasza and Ysera!

Please deliver them to Loamm as soon as you can, won't you?

 Quest Hand-in: Oh, are these the gems? Hmmm... I have to admit, I was expecting them to be prettier!I suppose they just need a bit of elbow grease and a spit shine! Watch this!
Title: Locating the Longshot

Description: We're going to need a bigger gun if we hope to free Xe'ra.

One of the other bunkers crashed closer to the Xenedar. If Baraat was on it, he will have already begun surveying the area. Perhaps he's found the main cannon of the ship.

If you head over that way, make sure he hasn't died, will you?

 Quest Hand-in: We're under too much pressure here. And it's so close to us...
Title: A Tempered Blade

Description: These blades that I wield are newly forged. The time has come to temper them in the blood of my enemies.

I have heard that you are skilled in the ways of battle. I too am proficient in the business of death and I would be honored to fight at your side.

Accompany me, {class}, and together we will spill the blood of our enemies.

 Quest Hand-in: It was an honor to fight by your side, <name>. If you should have need of me in the future, you need only ask.
Title: Challenges in Ardenweald

Description: Ardenweald was once a place of peace and regrowth, but no longer.

Foes assault the weald from all sides, dark creatures that serve no masters.

They will not be exempted from the hand of justice. We will bring the trials of Revendreth to bear upon them.

They will see what we do to those that must be broken.

I accuse these souls of sins against the Shadowlands. Mete out justice in the name of Revendreth.

 Quest Hand-in: Those that have no masters have learned a lesson today.We are their masters, in the end.
Title: Scavenging a Solution

Description: The Blooming Foundry created this area. It maintains the automa, the creatures, and the plants.

The overgrowth is its fault.

We need to enter the Foundry to fix this land. This constructor can break through when it is working.

Many automa in this area stopped moving long ago. Find usable pieces inside them.

 Quest Hand-in: This will work.
Title: Free Air

Description: The Primalists are using these massive orbs here to hold off Kalecgos. 

At this rate, Kalecgos will be too injured to continue the fight. If he falls, I won't be able to fend off Raszageth.

The empowered gem you hold should allow you to disguise yourself as an elemental to sneak ahead.

Use the gem to destroy the orbs. That should give Kalecgos room to unleash his power.

I will focus my attention on shielding the tower from Raszageth.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you, <name>. Now it's time to show the Primalists the true might of the Aspect of the blue dragonflight!
Title: HELP!

Description: HELP! They're gonna eat me! I just know it!

Find the key, I know it has to be on one of these ogres.

If you get me out of here, my father will reward you handsomely! He's the leader of Telaar, Arechron.


 Quest Hand-in: I'm really sorry about this, <race>. He's always getting himself into trouble. I just wish I could put a leash on him...
Title: Warchief's Command: Searing Gorge!

Description: All able bodied members of the Horde are hereby ordered to report to Jack Rockleg at Thorium Advance.

The Shattered Hand reports that the Dark Iron dwarves of the Searing Gorge seem to be preparing for something. Your duty is to learn all you can about their scheming and put a halt to it.

You can reach the Searing Gorge by following the road west from the Badlands.

Destiny calls!

 Quest Hand-in: We, too, are suspicious of the Dark Irons' recent activities.
Title: WANTED: The Epoch Hunter's Head

Description: The tastes of my customers range from the mundane to the exotic. And sometimes they want to do very mundane things with the exotic objects they seek.

Such is the case with my latest request. My client, who shall remain nameless, wishes to obtain the head of the Epoch Hunter to mount on his wall.

{class}, will you find a way to travel back in time to Old Hillsbrad and procure said head for my trophy-hunting patron?

 Quest Hand-in: I see you are returned to the present time intact.<The wind trader looks around.>It doesn't appear that anything has changed. But then again, how would I know?That's a nice cut; my customer will be pleased. Here is your reward.Come back tomorrow and I will have another request for you to fulfill.
Title: The Laboratory of Mardivas

Description: <Several pages are devoted to notes on an experiment, a hastily written journal entry follows.>

At last, my research into the base elements has begun to bear fruit!

With careful application of the right base reagents and some arcane power I've managed to combine the essence of the elements in such a way as to create life!

Further investigation will be needed to determine what the various mixes of the elements will yield.

<The writing ends here.>

 Quest Hand-in: <The magic of the system appears to have been drained. Perhaps after some time has passed it can be used again.>
Title: Lost in the Darkness

Description: Some would say that we are lucky to be alive. Those people would be idiots. At least had we died we would not have had to face the Warchief's wrath. Alas, what's done is done! Now we must attempt to regain our lost honor.

The third ship in our fleet sank off the coast of the Skittering Dark, northwest of here. Those that made it to shore quickly found themselves swarmed by the giant spiders of the area and encased in webbing.

If there are survivors we must free them! Go, {name}! To the Skittering Dark!

 Quest Hand-in: Lok'tar, <name>! Once the ale wears off my orcs will be ready!
Title: Armor Kits

Description: You might not realize this, but running a traveling carnival is costly!  Everything wears down so fast it's a wonder we can turn a profit.

Because of all those hidden costs, we're always looking for ways to maintain our equipment as cheaply as possible.  Our tents, for instance, tear regularly but I've found that leather armor kits make great patches.  Can you find and bring me some armor kits? That'll save us a bundle!  Do that, and I have a fistful of Darkmoon Faire tickets for you...

 Quest Hand-in: Great!  This will work great!  I just noticed a rip in a tent over yonder, and one of these armor kits is just what I need to patch it up!Thank you very much, <name>.  These armor kits will save us a ton in repair costs.  Here are your tickets - you deserve them!
Title: Waycrest Manor: The Fallen Mother

Description: This is all a lot to process...

The Marshal... gone? My mother... the leader of the coven? It's just too much...

...but we have come too far to turn back now. It is clear that my mother and father, as I knew them, are gone.  It is time we cleansed the taint from this land.

We must take the inquisitors and find them in Waycrest Manor. We will end this, once and for all.

 Quest Hand-in: I do not relish what we've done, but it was necessary for the good of Drustvar.I only hope the sacrifices we've made will be worthwhile in the end...
Title: The Deadliest Catch

Description: Oi! No time to waste!

Seems Deepwarden had one more thing up his sleeve... and it's the catch of the day!

This'll be a hunt for the ages, and I won't let ya miss out.

Okri will fly you out to the wall. Get ready!

 Quest Hand-in: My inadequacy to rule lead to Deepwarden's near takeover of not only the fishing operation here, but the village as a whole.I can no longer allow myself to sit quietly and allow people like him to walk over me to do as they please! I've learned that, thanks to you.
Title: Water of Life

Description: Take my Water of Life and pass it into the corpse of the drowned dwarf.

He was a worker of metals in life, and though his body now feeds my loch, the Water will allow him to tell you what you want to know.

Then, take your information and be gone from my demesne.

 Quest Hand-in: The Hammer of Twilight? And you say you got this information out of a drowned Wildhammer dwarf?You're kidding, right?
Title: WANTED: Murmur's Whisper

Description: When I'm done speaking, you may not want to take this commission.

I have an eccentric client who specializes in the study of dead realities. It is rumored that the being known as Murmur destroyed the last world from which he was summoned. The professor is interested in examining his 'whisper' as he called it to understand how it is that Murmur accomplished such a feat.

Will you journey to the Shadow Labyrinth within Auchindoun and retrieve it for me?

 Quest Hand-in: I was worried that you might not return. I trust that you didn't go deaf from fighting Murmur?Here is your reward. The professor will be pleased no doubt, though I worry what he ultimately wishes to do with this thing.Come back tomorrow and I will have another request for you to fulfill.
Title: The Golden Lotus

Description: The Golden Lotus have guarded the Vale for centuries, keeping it safe and hidden from harm.

Recent events have unleashed terrible horrors upon our sacred vale, but allies of the Golden Lotus still stand against them, attempting to bring peace.

If you wish to help, you had best join them at the Setting Sun Garrison.

 Quest Hand-in: Well met, <race>. You look capable. Glad to know we have a decent <class> on our side.
Title: Building Defenses

Description: We'll be able to push those monsters back now, but my defenders won't stand a chance unless we build a forward barricade for protection.

There should be plenty of lumber to build a barricade near the entrance to town.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you. We'll be better able to protect the town.
Title: Hero's Call: Eastern Plaguelands!

Description: By order of his royal highness, King Anduin Wrynn, all able-bodied citizens of the Alliance are to report to Fiona on the east bank of the Thondroril River.

The Argent Crusade needs your help to win back the Eastern Plaguelands from the grasp of the Scourge.

To reach the Eastern Plaguelands, cross the Thondroril River from the Western Plaguelands and look for Fiona on the eastern bank.

For the glory and honor of the Alliance!

 Quest Hand-in: Perhaps you can help, <class>.
Title: Darkmaster's Scourgestone

Description: <The scourgestone in your hand feels as real as everything else in this memory. It chills your very bones as it rests in the palm of your hand.

While it may be a relic of a past time, the Argent Dawn should nonetheless be made aware of its existence.

The ritual conducted upon Eva's journal may have had greater consequences than either of you anticipated.>

 Quest Hand-in: A scourgestone? I don't understand. How did you ever find this? After all we have done, here and upon Northrend...No, it does not matter. I will take it off your hands and ensure its destruction, <name>. Surely this is one of the last in existence. Surely.If it happens that you find others like this, bring them to me as well. I hope for all our sakes this is the last we ever speak of this.
Title: Not In Our Mine

Description: That blasted necropolis blindsided us! In the wake of its destruction Wintergarde Mine was lost. Worse yet, Kel'Thuzad's acolytes have raised the slain miners as Scourge and are using them to supply their siegesmiths with materials from our mine!

The supply line must be halted and our lost brothers must be put to rest.

Travel to Wintergarde Mine, northeast of here in the Carrion Fields, and destroy the risen miners. Return to me with their miner cards so that I may put their passing in our registry.

 Quest Hand-in: <Leoric takes the cards from you.>I will get these to our recorder and deliver the grim news to the families of the miners.There is still much to be done if we are to succeed here and ultimately at the Wrathgate. Lord Fordragon is depending on us.
Title: The Power Within

Description: Do you have a moment, Conjurer?

The power within your weapon has grown exponentially as you have fought the Legion, but I cannot help but wonder if there is something... more... hidden away deep within. Perhaps even a new form entirely!

The very thought demands we find out for sure.

You are familiar with the ancient blue dragon Senegos in Azsuna, yes? Meet me at his repose once you are able and we will discuss more.

 Quest Hand-in: Senegos has generously offered us his assistance in the journey ahead.A truly kind soul.
Title: News From the East

Description: Westguard needs to know what's going on here, {name}. I want you to personally deliver the news to Captain Adams.

Whenever you're ready, let me know and I'll put you back in the construct for one final flight. It'll take you to Westguard Keep, but more than likely blow up in the process.

It's been a pleasure...

 Quest Hand-in: Wonderful... As if having the Scourge all up our you-know-whats wasn't enough, now we got some angry ancient titan construct to deal with!I'll need some time to chew on this information, <race>. In the meantime there's plenty of work that needs doing here.
Title: Down with the Quilboar

Description: I have discovered that the quilboar are performing a necromantic ritual on a survivor from the missing expedition.

The ritual is being performed by the tribe's leader, Geolord Grek'og. 

Slay Grek'og and save the survivor.

Show this brute that the Horde is not to be trifled with.

 Quest Hand-in: You sure got some guts! I respect that. I joined this expedition thinkin' it'd be a quick and easy way to make a little profit.But now with all this necromancy and crazy ogres... maybe I can make a LOT of profit!
Title: Dangerous to Go Alone

Description: I trust you know well all that Elysian Hold can provide, but that alone will not be enough to thwart Denathrius.

You must have a soulbind to aid you, Maw Walker.

Seek out Soulguide Daelia in the chamber below. She has prepared for the ritual.

 Quest Hand-in: I see even now that your soul burns brighter than most.
Title: Take Me To Your Leader

Description: I am glad you are here, {name}.

This... Khadgar, the archmage who found my message, has called a meeting.

He wishes to meet us at the entrance to the city as soon as possible.

Will you accompany me? I have the strangest feeling that he will not be alone.

 Quest Hand-in: Hello again, champion. I see we are all here now.
Title: Burnout

Description: Your pump sabotage has caused pipes to break all over camp. The goblins are in a panic over the geysers, and it's about to get worse.

Take the gathered explosives and use them to set the geysers aflame. We're going to do as much damage to the camp as we can, and keep that oil from being used to fuel shredders... or worse, Horde warships.

 Quest Hand-in: Look at them run... the live ones, that is. Glorious.
Title: Loaded for Bear

Description: <This glittering cannonball stands out from the others. You notice the familiar sheen of Azerite across the surface.

You can't help but notice the nearby cannon, conveniently pointed at the ships loaded with stores of Ashvane Company weapons.>

 Quest Hand-in: <Better to destroy these new weapons than to let them fall into the wrong hands.>
Title: The Battle Ring

Description: We have some fresh trainees that are far from being a danger to you, but in numbers, they may prove enough of a challenge. And if not, they could use the lesson in humility.

Step into the battle ring when you're ready. Don't go easy on them.

 Quest Hand-in: Very impressive. It seems they have much learning to do. I'll see to that.
Title: Firestone Point

Description: Can you do me a huge favor, {name}? My sister-in-law's uncle is in the Earthen Ring, and he's here in the Barrens studying the impact of the Cataclysm, down at Firestone Point. He says their camp is surrounded by quilboar and I worry that they might get overrun.

Can you check in on Dorn Redearth for me? I'd hate for anything to happen to him, what with the close family bond and all. 

 Quest Hand-in: What? Little Logan thinks I might need protection?It's me doing the protectin'!The quilboar here are poised to rampage. They've choked off the entire south, and we're the only thing standing in their way.
Title: The Ever Drowning

Description: Stay close, Champion. I have some magical items that might help us defend briefly against magic attacks, but Azshara was the greatest mage our kind has ever known.

I do not feel confident that these trinkets will hold back her power for long, or even be usable afterward.

Speak with me when you are ready.

 Quest Hand-in: The flood has stopped for now. That is good because I do not think I have enough charge left in these items to shield us from another wave like that.
Title: Burn the Bodies

Description: The bugs seem to be indiscriminately laying eggs all over the nearby corpses.

They are using them as food to spawn more of those horrible things. Disgusting!

We can mourn the dead later, but if any more bugs are allowed to hatch we may not live long enough to do so.

Burn the bodies and destroy those eggs!

 Quest Hand-in: Grisly work to be sure, but we were left with no choice. Thank you <name>.
Title: Ferry Pass

Description: <Cyrus takes an official looking document from his jacket, signs it, then offers it to you.>

Here, this will give you access to the ferry system.

 Quest Hand-in: There are ferry stations all along the interior coastline of the sound. Don't forget about them during your travels!
Title: Wayshrines of Zuldazar

Description: <A calm but thunderous voice enters your mind.>

My child grows under your care. I am pleased. Now, I would have your aid.

There was a time long ago when the roads of Zandalar were under my protection. Those who walked them gave praise, and in return I gave them my blessing. Fewer wander now.

My shrines remain, their purpose forgotten. You will help me to restore them.

Begin in the north. See to the wayshrine there. If you find any lost travelers, see that they know my blessing through you.

 Quest Hand-in: Most of my goods have spoiled in de heat and rain, but take dis token of my appreciation.We can finally go home.
Title: Halls of Valor: The Light Within

Description: We cannot ignore the Prophet's vision, {name}. To do so would mean that everything we know and hold dear will be lost to the Legion.

We must focus on what we know, and that is that the Light must walk among us.

Within the Halls of Valor you will find an ascending val'kyr by the name of Hyrja. Recover a spark of her Light and release it within our temple.

 Quest Hand-in: <Saa'ra's soothing voice fills your mind.>Your gift of Light is a welcome one, <class>.
Title: Allegiance to the Horde

Description: Your people suffered a great betrayal by the Alliance. You succeeded in fighting off the Darnassian attacks and the spies from Ironforge. Now you defeated a powerful Scourge leader at the footsteps of your home. Your worthiness is no longer in question.

It is clear now that we need each other. Return to Lor'themar. Tell him I have heard your message and accept. 

<Saurfang crushes the letter inside his palm.> 

Welcome to the Horde, elf.

 Quest Hand-in: Your work has helped advance our race's cause a tremendous deal.Brace yourself for great changes, <name>.  We are now officially part of the Horde.
Title: Transmutation Master

Description: Iron to gold, water to fire... if you want to become an transmutation master, then I can show you the way.

The training is very expensive, so you'll have to bring me some of the finest transmuted materials in the world.

Remember {name}, you can only learn ONE specialization, so if you complete your transmutation training, then potion and elixir specialization will no longer be available.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent!
Title: Taming the Wilds

Description: A hunter like yourself needs a good pet by your side. Did you not bring one with you?

Hmm. I suppose I shall have to compensate for your lack of training.

Listen closely and learn quickly. I will teach you how to tame a beast and make it your pet.

You will need one if you are to fight the quilboar.

 Quest Hand-in: Fine work. The lessons you learn from the inimitable Mithdran Dawntracker will last you a lifetime.Now, down to the business of our quilboar foes...
Title: Paint Vial: Copper Trim

Description: <Marvelous Martini could make use of this item.>

 Quest Hand-in: A unique choice, for those that want to be different.
Title: Set it Off!

Description: Things are looking good.  Let's do this.

The stack of bombs is right near the pit.  I'll start to evacuate the men.

 Quest Hand-in: These bombs look pretty potent.  They should at least put a dent in the surrounding structure.
Title: Gaining the Advantage

Description: The troops of the Shattered Sun Offensive will need every advantage they can get to beat back the allies of Kil'Jaeden. My colleagues in Stormwind have created oils which will strengthen the blades and armor of our troops.

The key ingredient, nether residue, pervades Outland  -- if you know where to look. Any master herbalist, skinner, or miner who knows the signs can gather it while plying his trade. Those herbs, ores, and beasts native to Outland may all bear the residue.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you for your help, <name>. No contribution to the war effort is too small. Our men are going to need every advantage they can get in this battle.
Title: Operation: Mechagon - The Mechoriginator

Description: My father's madness won't be contained to this island.

King Mechagon is creating a massive device capable of reversing the Curse of Flesh across the entirety of Azeroth!

Any races forged by the Titans will return to their original state. For us gnomes, that means fully mechanical. For dwarves and troggs, stone. Vrykul, iron.

The list goes on, but most races aren't even ON the list. Anything not forged by the titans will be completely obliterated.

We must stop King Mechagon before it's too late!

 Quest Hand-in: That robot... that AI... was not my father.My father died the day he abandoned his body and soul for full mechanization. The day he betrayed our people.The burden of leadership has rested on my shoulders for some time... Only now, do I feel I can embrace it.I will lead my people with wisdom, ingenuity, and humility. Thank you, <name>.
Title: Return Lost Souls

Description: Souls continue to pour into the Maw, circumventing the natural order of the Shadowlands.

The Jailer denies these souls their rightful eternities. Only you, Maw Walker, can set things right.

Return to the Maw and save all that you can.

 Quest Hand-in: Well done. They have been spared a truly cruel existence.
Title: On Wounded Wings

Description: I see my peers fall in pain, their wounds from the Void overtaking them.

We cannot allow ourselves, or each other, to give up hope.

Share your anima with our wounded brothers and sisters. Help them stand tall for another fight!

 Quest Hand-in: My disciples resolve, standing to fight another day.I will not take that in vain.
Title: Cleaning Up the Pools

Description: <A single tear rolls down the face of Iron Eyes.>

I have heard that you are heading back into the pools to the west. I have something for you to do while you are out there, {race}.

The gnomes, who care nothing for the land, have polluted it with their machinery. I want you to pick up any spare parts that you come across.

Return them to me here. I will see to it that they are properly disposed of before we leave this place for good.

 Quest Hand-in: It is the taunka way to leave the land pristine before we move on.We will be traveling to our capital, Icemist, very soon. You have helped by allowing us to depart that much more quickly.Thank you.
Title: The Ordo Warbringer

Description: <The shield is down. Time to head into the cave and slay the Warbringer of the Ordo!>

 Quest Hand-in: Once again you've accomplished what no one else could.Was there any doubt?
Title: Obstacle Course

Description: It is strange that these docks were abandoned by the Iron Horde, but up ahead our scouts report trouble.

A set of Bleeding Hollow scavengers is busy looting the abandoned buildings to the northwest.

Further down the road orc cultists are doing... something... near the Dark Portal.

We should try to recover any orders or information as to what is going on here, then meet with our scouts further in...

 Quest Hand-in: It be good ta hear da road is safer, but here be another problem.
Title: Dawn of the Infinite

Description: My vision is hazy, but there is no mistaking what I saw. A dark alliance opposes the bronze dragonflight. One I do not know if I shall be able to overcome...

I ask you to meet me in Eon's Fringe, {name}. We will speak more of this threat there. If there is any who I would entrust with safeguarding our future, it is you.

 Quest Hand-in: Yes, it is I! Chromie from the future! Nice to meet you. Again.Now, I can't talk too much about when I'm from or why I'm here. Protecting the timeways and all that, you understand. But I know exactly what's going to happen and exactly how to stop it!
Title: Cause Without a Rebel

Description: Good to see you again, {name}! Alexstrasza doesn't think we can stop the rebels effectively through force, despite the successes you've had.

To find other ways forward, Alexstrasza has called Maldra Flametongue here to talk about the rebellion and what drew her to it.

Perhaps it would be helpful to join the conversation, and see what Maldra has to say. To avoid prying rebel eyes and ears, they will be meeting below us, on the second level of the Seat of the Aspects.

 Quest Hand-in: I've found the rebels are stockpiling a huge number of bombs beneath the Valdrakken aqueduct! We must stop them!
Title: Super Jiro

Description: The outsiders have disrupted the tasks and purpose of the jiro. We cannot allow this to continue.

We will empower a larger jiro to help combat these threats. Jiro Prime will destroy the enemies that threaten Zereth Mortis.

Help direct Jiro Prime to resolve our crisis.

 Quest Hand-in: Order has been restored. We thank you for your assistance.
Title: Power of the Primus

Description: As a Necrolord, your duty is to defend the Shadowlands. To carry out such service, the Primus grants us his strength.

Stand upon the altar of the Primus. Let his power become your own.

 Quest Hand-in: You are a Necrolord, <name>. We stand strong.
Title: Corner Crossing

Description: If Saurfang was headed in this direction, it would have been difficult for him to avoid the Three Corners watchpost. 

We could simply walk in there and demand information, but I have a feeling that they would not part with it willingly.

So we will take another approach.

I have procured this potion from our alchemists. It will turn us into--ugh--humans for a while.

We can then question the guards. Perhaps someone saw something.

 Quest Hand-in: So, Shaw was involved? SI:7... again.Perhaps a coincidence, perhaps not. We have little to go off of. Let us assume Saurfang continued his path eastward, off of the main trails.
Title: The Sixth Sense

Description: For my plan to work, we need to break the spell on my body that is anchoring my spirit to this place.

However, my mortal remains are buried deep within this forest. There are wards within it that are designed to trap spirits who are still attached to the material world. Once my remains are cleansed, I will be able to move freely through the woods.

Until then, I'll need you to disenchant the wards we come across.

Speak to me when you are ready, and I will lead you to my grave.

 Quest Hand-in: Good work!<Sef looks introspective for a moment.>I just realized I never told you my plan.
Title: Band of Unending Life

Description: The rings worn by the Qiraji lieutenants are rumored to grant them formidable abilities.  The corrupted gems that adorn them could, in theory, be swapped out with more pure materials to create uncorrupted versions of the rings.

The gems that adorn Qiraji idols would work quite well, as their quality is superior.

Bring me the ring and idols and I'll create a powerful ring for you, fellow druid.

 Quest Hand-in: I will swap the gems on the ring for you.  You'll find the finished piece is much more... agreeable.
Title: Banners, Banners Everywhere!

Description: Isn't it wonderful to see Darkmoon banners everywhere? It's my favorite part of setting up, but we have so many old and tattered ones that need to be replaced.

If you've some skill with a needle and thread, would you mind making a banner from this kit and putting it up in some loose stones scattered around the grounds of the faire?

It's missing a few pieces, but you should be able to get what you need from any trade goods vendor in Elwynn Forest or Mulgore.

 Quest Hand-in: Thanks for helping with those banners. You have quite a talent for needlework. Next time the Darkmoon Faire's in town, why not come by and help again?
Title: Truth or Fiction

Description: I thank you for the timely delivery, {name}. You are turning out to be one of the Hand's better agents.

If only we knew who they reported to in Bloodmyst and more importantly, where this sun portal was... They seem to have it tightly guarded - wherever it may be.

Would you be interested in some reconnaissance work?

If so, take these orders back to Vindicator Boros. He will give you your next mission.

 Quest Hand-in: It's a good plan, but a dangerous one. I'm sure you'll be fine.
Title: The Frozen Earth

Description: We captured these elementals from nearby, and I have plenty of defenders now. But, it takes a great deal of power to make them strong enough to stand up to our enemies.

The frozen earth at Drak'Mabwa to the northwest have what I need to maintain our defenses. I'll need more of their essence if I'm to keep this up.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you, <class>. Those essences should be enough to fuel my casting for quite some time.
Title: The Graveyards of Alterac

Description: The battle lines of Alterac Valley are ever shifting.  Territories swing back and forth as we meet our opponents in deadly combat.  And graveyards, {name}, are where battles rage most fierce.

I want you to attack an Alliance held graveyard!  Find a graveyard with an Alliance banner in its midst and pull it from the ground.

Do that and your task for me will be complete, but... if you hold the graveyard for a few minutes, then it will be ours and troops will come and relieve you.

 Quest Hand-in: Well done, <name>!  With each graveyard under our control, the spirits of our enemies will wander more lost and aimless.
Title: Further Advancement

Description: As the war against our enemies progresses, so must we.

We are now able to perform new research. Seek out Archon Torias to continue advancing the Order Hall.

 Quest Hand-in: Our power grows.
Title: News From Beneath

Description: Before I arrived, I was informed that the Life-Binder has need of our aid. There is news of the Incarnates, and she requests our presence at the Seat of the Aspects.

As for Emberthal -- there is very little we can do for now. It is best we allow her to reflect and gather thoughts alone.

 Quest Hand-in: The Aspects have gathered. Let us not keep them waiting.
Title: Trading Favors: Necrotic Wake

Description: We of the brokers place value on things that may seem strange to an outsider like yourself. Objects that are unusual or one-of-a-kind are things we may find more valuable than others.

So let us make a deal, hm? Should you find yourself in possession of one such object, I will offer a trade for something you may find more valuable.

I hear that the forces of Maldraxxus have made an attack on Bastion. Such things rarely happen without objects of power in tow, no?

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, quite a find, we rarely get a glimpse into the mechanisms by which the House of Rituals enact their dark designs. I am eager to delve into this tome, purely in the interests of knowledge of course.You may choose from some of our procured items as a reward.
Title: That's Going to Sting

Description: <Niya speaks loudly to be heard over the buzzing coming from the collection of needler nests behind her.>

I've caught Moonberry trying to steal these nests for her pranks over ten times already!

The other faeries said I was crazy to bring the needlers out here. Too wild! Too unpredictable!

But that's exactly why we need them.

Lord Herne's scouts report powerful Heralds among our enemy's forces.

Take one of these nests, and use it to surprise the Heralds!

 Quest Hand-in: I wish I could've been there to see it myself!A fitting end for the Heralds...
Title: Throwing SI:7 Off the Trail

Description: SI:7 is dogging our heels at every turn. We must make certain that they do not catch wind of what we are up to.

To that end, I have some suggestions for you in the form of missions. Send your champions, assign your forces, it matters little to me. The important thing is that we keep them out of Val'sharah and away from Black Rook Hold.

At least until we can decipher that damned letter.

 Quest Hand-in: Surprisingly nice bit of work there. What I am hearing from our scouts is that the diversions are working perfectly.As an added bonus, some of my suspicions about a particular item, which will prove useful in deciphering the SI:7 letter, have come to light in Stormheim.
Title: Dark Offerings

Description: The spirtibinders of the Zandalari perform sacrificial rites to appease the loa and their vile gods. These dark rituals involve the sacrifice of our people.

Destroy any offerings you can find among their tents in Za'Tual and perhaps we can stall the sacrifices.

 Quest Hand-in: The tide of blood is slowed, at least for a time. Thank you for your efforts in stalling the sacrifices, <class>.
Title: Lost Treasure

Description: I sense that one of my kind's artifacts has been taken and stashed away in the Cache of the Legion.

We cannot give them time to discover its power. If you would kill the Gatewatchers and retrieve it for me, I would be most grateful.

 Quest Hand-in: You have done well. Any advantage we can take away from Kael'thas' forces is to our benefit.
Title: Crackdown

Description: Thalyssra is right to be concerned!

The network has not responded to my attempts to re-establish connection with the Waning Crescent. I do not know what happened, but given the circumstances I believe it prudent to investigate in person.

{name}, would you do the honors? I will send you as close to the Waning Crescent as I can.

 Quest Hand-in: Someone must have informed the Grand Magistrix of Vanthir's involvement in the rebellion. Such violence is...Elisande... How could you?
Title: See the Invisible

Description: Yeah, yeah, your stuck-up mage friend there hit it on the nose. The imps over at Shadowlurk Ridge are hiding the key to the satyr's barrier in the nether. It's right there, but you can't see it or touch it unless you're shifted.

I guess you're out of luck though, because only imps can phase shift! So you should just close your eyes, turn around, and let me go...

It was just a joke! Don't hurt me! I'll need slime from the cursed oozes around these ruins. Bring me enough to cover you from head to toe!

 Quest Hand-in: Oh good, you're back! Don't leave me alone with her! She's crazy!Gimme that, I'll have you seeing the invisible in no time!
Title: Package Recovery

Description: You take the package and confirm that indeed it comes from Magistrix Erona.  Alarion would probably want you to bring it to her.

 Quest Hand-in: By the Sunwell!  That's the third outrunner we've lost this month.I appreciate your courage in venturing into Dawning Street.  The guards need to keep a closer eye on these blasted Wretched.
Title: You Say You Want a Revolution

Description: If what you say is true, {name}, then we have friends within the Dragonmaw Clan. We can support an insurgency from within their ranks and avoid a lot of bloodshed on both sides.

I can help, but the most dangerous part is up to you.

My Axebite Warriors will launch an offensive on the shores. During the confusion, I need you to slip behind the lines and speak with your revolutionary contact, Zaela.

We'll arm the Dragonmaw and overthrow their fel masters! 

 Quest Hand-in: <name>, what are your people doing? Are you attacking the Dragonmaw or are you here to rid us of Mor'ghor's corruption?Ah, I see now. I like the way you think. Warchief Mor'ghor won't even know what hit him.Let's do this!
Title: Antoran High Command

Description: The Legion has spent over 10,000 years planning their invasion of Azeroth. Defeat their leaders so they can never threaten our world again.

 Quest Hand-in: Did you triumph in Antorus?
Title: Missing in Action: Eitrigg

Description: Are you familiar with Eitrigg? He is the worthy orc warrior who was leading our forces against the Felrage naga nearby.

Unfortunately the naga captured many of our soldiers during a recent skirmish. Eitrigg went after them and has not returned. I fear something terrible has happened to him.

Please try to find him!

 Quest Hand-in: The filthy naga ambushed me. I will not fail again.
Title: Securing the House

Description: Your journey into the Maw was impressive, but it will take even more phenomenal feats to earn the loyalty of the Maldraxxi.

Increase your renown among our ranks, Maw Walker. The Maldraxxi are dedicated soldiers, but they will not follow just anyone into battle. Let your deeds prove your worth to them.

 Quest Hand-in: Your actions have attracted the attention of the other houses--and those who question their orders.
Title: Pelt Collection

Description: The springpaw that inhabit this region are known for their high quality pelts.  We've even seen night elf scum travel to these lands just to poach them.

Our skirmishes with the Amani have put a bit of a strain on our supply of gear and our rangers don't have much time to hunt for pelts anymore.  If you'd be willing to lend a hand by collecting springpaw pelts, I'd be happy to reward you with a hand-crafted piece of armor.  You'll find springpaw stalkers all around the woods north of here.

 Quest Hand-in: These will do perfectly, <name>.  Take this piece of armor as a reward.  I'll be able to make more with the pelts you brought me.
Title: Rewind and Reconcile

Description: <You sense powerful time energy emanating from the relic you retrieved after your fight with Chrono-Lord Deios. It appears to have an engraving of two arrows pointing to the left. You should show it to Nozdormu.>

 Quest Hand-in: Chronormu mentioned that she found a time relic after your fight with Morchie. That device forced time to move quickly forward. It seems this relic is of a similar power, only it can rewind the threads of time, returning one to an earlier point.I shall safeguard it, <name>. We would not want such a device to fall into the wrong hands.
Title: A Blue Feather for Jogu

Description: Tomorrow's crop will be... oh, I can't see it yet. I need something to drink, first.

 Quest Hand-in: A nice blue feather for me? Thanks, <race>.
Title: Leave Every Soldier Behind

Description: Hmmm.

The ogron possess something of value to the Iron Horde. I'm sure they're unaware, likely just bored and in  need of something to torture.

I'd be inclined to just let them be, it's a fate they deserve. But we can't afford not to follow up on this clue. With any luck, it will help us stop the Iron Horde from turning Gorgrond's most fearsome creatures into weapons.

Try to find this Corporal Thukmar and his notes. We'll meet you there.

 Quest Hand-in: We have the notes. Let us see what they reveal about our enemy's strategy.
Title: A Little Patience

Description: King Varian needs decisive adventurers to help him resolve a showdown between Tyrande Whisperwind and a detachment of Horde warriors holed up in the Temple of the Red Crane.

Report to him immediately!

 Quest Hand-in: Good to see you again, <name>.We have a delicate situation on our hands here. We need to plan our next moves carefully.
Title: Ancient Power

Description: Hozen skulls are prized tokens among my village.

We use them to perform ceremonial rites, and the older the skull, the more potent its magic.

Luckily for us, the hozen are careless, filthy beasts. They leave the skulls of their dead scattered among their huts and campfires.

Collect these skulls for me, and I will reward you handsomely.

 Quest Hand-in: It is good to see that you are so resourceful, <name>. It is a trait admired by my people.The fine specimens you have brought me will produce powerful magic.
Title: A Round for the Guards

Description: The guards who defend Ironforge put their lives on the line against our many enemies, and it's up to us to take care of them.

Today, their rations consist of two dwarven favorites, haggis and Ironforge pale ale. Would ye be so kind as to help me distribute them? That way, everyone gets his food in a timely manner and we can move on to other tasks.

 Quest Hand-in: A full guard is a happy guard, as I always say. Thanks fer yer help, <name>.
Title: Blades of the Anointed

Description: The problem with the Scarlet Crusade is that they keep coming back, even after death.

Behind those resurrections is High Inquisitor Whitemane. With her death, so goes the Crusade.

To give her the final rest, we need two swords of legend, each with a lost but storied history.

Luckily for me... er, us, these two blades of the anointed are at rest here within the monastery.

Find them and once you've killed Whitemane, plunge the blades into her corpse to make the death permanent.

 Quest Hand-in: <The second anointed blade floats just in front of the wet statue. Steam rises from the sword.><You get the uncanny feeling that the Hand of Providence has been waiting for you.>
Title: Key Hunting

Description: My pockets are empty. I have no more vault keys!

See if you can find any Zskera Keys, and Jeb and I will see what we can find. If we pool our keys, we can open a lot of doors.

 Quest Hand-in: We also found some keys! I can't wait to open more doors!
Title: The Stone That Started A Revolution

Description: You may look at Scourgeholme now and see a rancid pit of decay, but one day it will be a place of glory and honor. Highlord Fordring has deemed it "Justice Keep."

Alas, even an impregnable fortress like Icecrown Citadel began with but a single stone. So begins our search for the stone to start a revolution.

Travel to Crystalsong, south of here, and seek out the Unbound Thicket in the east. Once there gather crystalline heartwood from the thicket floor and elven masonry from the Ruins of Shandaral.

 Quest Hand-in: Heartwood by nature is resistant to disease, rot and plague. This heartwood, however, goes so far as to repel such things! The masonry, affected by the fallout of the Unbound Thicket, will work in much the same way.Soon we will break ground.
Title: The Rook's Guard

Description: Black Rook Hold is not the same place I knew. Its walls have crumbled, a ghostly echo of its former glory.

If Lord Ravencrest has returned, then surely he will have his former officers at his side.

Kester Farseeker, captain of the guard.

Trelan Shieldbreaker, peerless master of maces.

Starlys Strongbow, who could split arrows while blindfolded.

If we stand any chance of entering the tower itself, they must be eliminated.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you, <name>. May their spirits be at peace.
Title: Betrayal

Description: The time has come to end this charade, {name}.

As valuable as your information has been, we must bring Drakuru down and bring his project to an end before his freaks are unleashed.

We've modified your scepter for the job. When the time is right, you will be able to use it on Drakuru's Blightbloods and turn them against him. It's your only hope of defeating him.

Fight well.

 Quest Hand-in: So, it is done.We still have much to do, but our work here will be much more manageable thanks to your efforts.Please accept this as a token of our gratitude.
Title: Stronger Than Reeds

Description: Gather me reeds from the nearby pools.

Do not question why. Do, and then observe the results.

 Quest Hand-in: Good.No number of reeds have ever withstood my might.Step back, and let me dispel your doubts.
Title: The Sleepless Legion

Description: The Shan'ze are animating an army from the statues in the center of the isle, an army that batters our defenses day and night. Destroy any of the walking statues you see. Our defenders will greatly appreciate it.

 Quest Hand-in: Your efforts are appreciated, <class>.
Title: Hero's Call: Arathi Highlands!

Description: By order of his royal highness, King Anduin Wrynn, all able-bodied citizens of the Alliance are to report to Captain Nials at Refuge Pointe.

Ancient Stromgarde's honor must be redeemed! Too long have ogres and criminals sullied its streets. Travel north from the Wetlands and cross the Thandol Span to reach Arathi. Follow the road to Refuge Pointe and present yourself to the captain.

For the glory and honor of the Alliance!

 Quest Hand-in: Would that you were a company, but we'll have to make do with with what we have.
Title: Pay to Play

Description: It's doesn't matter if you were invited or if you just showed up. Drogbar, niffen, or {race}, everyone pays for the Glimmerogg Games! 

Even I did, and I'm runnin' this show!

<Brogg points aggressively to a ticket of his own.>

I know you can't pay in drogdollars, but you can pay in snacks for everyone. And we love mushrooms and fish! Bring Brogg some food, and we're square, okay?

 Quest Hand-in: Good work, uplander. Now Brogg has snacks for the week!...I mean, we have snacks for everyone!Now, get out of here. And have some fun, brul!
Title: Echo of Garrosh Hellscream

Description: Our final destination will take us to the depths beneath your city of Orgrimmar.

The way there is barred, but I can get us inside.

Meet me outside the gates of Orgrimmar and we will descend together.

 Quest Hand-in: Yes, this thrums with power! This is precisely what I needed.
Title: Grand Prize

Description: Today we have a contest for extreme anglers!

Just be one of the FIRST FIFTY PEOPLE IN THE WORLD to bring me 40 tastyfish fished from the schools found along the coast of Stranglethorn, and you will receive a prize!

Oh, and don't delay... tastyfish go bad quickly!

 Quest Hand-in: Hurry up and turn those in if you want to be declared the Master Angler!  I have been standing around here for HOURS with nothing to eat!   Hand those suckers over!
Title: Keys to the Ruin

Description: At last, our target is within reach.

The necropolis rests above us, moored to this platform by a necrotic restraining bolt.

Twigin can fly you to the apex of the necropolis. It will be ours to command once you insert this keystone.

We will prepare for our departure. Rejoin us when you are done.

Victory will soon be ours.

 Quest Hand-in: Come, <name>. Would you not witness your success firsthand?
Title: Yeah, Definitely for the Kids

Description: I don't know if you've ever seen Orphan Matron Meliana before, but she is a goddess come down to humble Lordaeron. Her hair, those cheekbones, and...

...and anyhow, these flowers are for the kids at the orphanage where she works. Tell Meliana that they're from me. For the kids.

 Quest Hand-in: These are from Emery, I assume?<Meliana blushes.>That dummy. Gotta admire his persistence, though...
Title: Stone Dragontooth

Description: <This might be something Emila Bellocq is looking for.>

 Quest Hand-in: It's very old, but you can still tell what it is... I will make sure this is filed away safely.
Title: Frostmourne

Description: We must press on, hero. We've come so far... we're so close to our goal.

I must delay a moment to send Elandra back to the airship. I'm uncertain how we're going to escape with so many men lost and so few to keep our path in secure.

Continue on. I will meet you in the Halls of Reflection. 

 Quest Hand-in: The Halls of Reflection. Finally.Let me know when you are ready. Arthas may not be here, but it would be naive to think that he would leave Frostmourne unguarded entirely.
Title: A Dangerous Alliance

Description: SI:7's latest report about Twilight's Hammer and Dark Iron activity worries me, {name}. There's evidence that they are preparing a joint attack from within Blackrock Mountain. We'll be hard-pressed to turn back such a combined force, but if we act before they're ready to strike, we might be able to blunt the attack.

You must go into Blackrock Depths and capture the Twilight's Hammer attack plans from General Angerforge in the West Garrison. Do not hesitate to take out the elementals supporting his forces.

 Quest Hand-in: I'll send these plans to the king and his strategists immediately. If the Dark Irons and their Twilight allies manage to recover and attack, our men will be ready for them. Well done, <name>.
Title: Traitors!!!

Description: The goblins you'll find working with the Defias are officially traitors to the Bilgewater Cartel, the Shattered Hand, and the Horde itself!

I haven't yet been initiated into the Shattered Hand, so my loyalties lie strongly with my people. Helix Gearbreaker apparently has no time for such associations, and works on building a mast for the Defias Juggernaut. On behalf of Miss Mayhem and myself, would you kindly 'dispose' of Helix?

 Quest Hand-in: My employers do not take kindly to traitors.On the flip side, they are renown for their kindness towards the loyal! You deserve to be rewarded!
Title: Drag 'em Down

Description: A single Dragonmaw drake is worth a dozen Wildhammer gryphon-riders. Take them off of their lice-ridden birds and they're nothing.

Even you can slay them easily, Horde-{class}.

Hunt gryphon riders flying over the river north of Bloodgulch. Take this hook and fling it at them as they fly by. Their momentum will hurl them from their mount, right to your feet. Finish them! Kill a few Thundermar gryphon riders and I'll believe your Horde is as mighty as you say.

 Quest Hand-in: You look a little battered. Those dwarves didn't give you any challenge, did they?Still, that was an impressive show.
Title: Drake Hunt

Description: I need more drake hatchlings to continue researching the runes covering their bodies.

They can be found around the northwest edge of the valley....

<Raelorasz pokes his hand with a spear and coats the tip with his blood.>

Take this and use it on one of them. Wait for it to become subdued, then bring it here to me before it expires.

 Quest Hand-in: The fate of these young drakes need not burden your conscience, <race>. Malygos alone is accountable for this.I am working ceaselessly to discover the secrets of these runes.Rest assured, we shall take no more lives than we must.
Title: Akunda's Blessing

Description: You have proven worthy of my blessing, {name}.

This means should you choose me as your loa, you can call upon my power when needed.

Commune at my shrine to receive my gift.

Know that whatever you choose, you will always be welcome within these walls.

 Quest Hand-in: If at any time you require my gift, commune at a shrine built in my honor to receive my boon.
Title: The Hunt's Gratitude

Description: The forests of Ardenweald are safer with your help, envoy of the kyrian.

As a reward for your aid, we shall allow you to capture our memory. It is an honor to be chosen to help train the mighty warriors of Bastion.

Whenever you are ready.

 Quest Hand-in: The Wild Hunt are incredible hunters. I look forward to seeing what your soulbinds learn.
Title: Our New Allies

Description: Have you seen those demon hunters yet? I'm not entirely sold on their allegiance to our cause, but while we have them, we may as well exploit them.

Everybody needs glyphs, you know.

Go see what you can discover about them. Azsuna is as good a place as any to start.

Perhaps my genius has worn off on you and you'll be able to create your own recipes based on what you learn.

 Quest Hand-in: Are you here to reinforce us, <class>? We could always use your strength.
Title: Prospector Gunstan

Description: Say... you haven't been to Southmoon Ruins yet, have you?  Oh you simply MUST.  They have all sorts of fascinating titan artifacts.  Head west, and look for the Explorers' League tents.

 Quest Hand-in: What, you here to help?
Title: Amulet of Rukhmar: The Apexis Device

Description: Now that the keys have been activated, the Apexis device that leads to the amulet should be accessible. 

The Arakkoa research states that it is likely located in Lost Veil Anzu, within the "shrine to the raven god."

 Quest Hand-in: I'm glad to see this out of the claws of the Adherents of Rukhmar. I'll get this to Dr. Jones right away.
Title: Flower-Pickers and Potion-Quaffers

Description: Now that we know the foxflower flux is safe to use, we can start stocking it. That being said, I don't particularly feel like picking flowers. Do you feel like picking flowers? Didn't think so.

Go talk to the alchemists and herbalists across the way. I'm sure we can set up some sort of work order arrangement.

 Quest Hand-in: Now that that's all taken care of, we can move on to improving our recipes.
Title: This Means WAR (Wild Arachnid Roundup)

Description: The Highlord was generous enough to send some of his recruits to protect us here at the mill.  With your horsemanship skills, and their martial prowess, we can do away with this spider problem easily.

Hop back on that mustang and scare those spiders again, but this time, scare them all the way up here to the mill.  These Hearthglen recruits can handle things from there.

 Quest Hand-in: That's much more like it!  Now my lumberjacks can get to work again.Nice riding out there, <name>.  You cut a pretty impressive silhouette on that mustang.
Title: Justice for the Hyals

Description: Although these Grimtotems were simply a nuisance to me, Captain Vimes will want to know of your deeds. Bring him the news that you have tracked down and dealt with those responsible for the burning of the Shady Rest Inn.

It's too late to save Jim Hyal's family, but perhaps the Grimtotems will think twice before attacking anyone connected to Theramore.

 Quest Hand-in: <The captain listens to your report intently.>We have avenged James and his family, but not even that can restore what was destroyed.
Title: A City Under Siege

Description: We will never control the Eastern Plaguelands if we do not control Stratholme. Not only is it a point of incredible strategic importance, it also houses our enemies' leaders - Balnazzar and Lord Aurius Rivendare. Their Risen and Scourge armies threaten to erase all the progress we've made.

The Argent Crusade is well-suited to this task. Travel west through Stratholme's main gate and speak with Packmaster Stonebruiser. He will direct you further.

 Quest Hand-in: What a relief it is to see an able-bodied soldier that's on our side! There's plenty for ye to do around here, <race>.
Title: Tear It Up

Description: The Alliance may be cowardly, but they are not fools. Their assault would be formidable, if it were directed at lesser creatures.

To sustain a siege and put pressure on our troops they are air dropping in supplies to support their ground forces.

Search the beaches and docks to the south for any airdropped supplies and smash them.

Let the Alliance see their food and ammunition destroyed before their eyes and despair.

 Quest Hand-in: Just remember, the weapon of choice is not always the weapon with the longest range or heaviest amount of damage. In the end, the best weapon is the weapon that works every time.
Title: Punting Season

Description: Baby turtles are sweet, even if they can be somewhat bitey.

<Mylune holds up a bandaged finger.>

But they're so slow with their tiny little legs, they can't escape the fire creatures who are attacking Hyjal!

<Mylune claps her hands together.>

PLEASE save them, {name}! Pick up the wee turtles and punt them into the water of the Ashen Lake. Don't worry about the kicking, they have hard shells.

They also have hard teeth, so don't pick them up by the mouth.

 Quest Hand-in: <Mylune's voice echoes in your head, along with an unwanted image of playful kittens.>You saved the wee turtles, <name>! I hope you gently, lovingly kicked them as hard as you possibly could.
Title: Even Giants Fall

Description: The Zandalari worship the loa; animal spirits they often call to their aid. They may be trying to bind these spirits into a huge golem. The outcome would be disastrous.

I've sent ahead a scout to gather more information, but I think this task may require your expertise.

Stop that ritual at all costs!

 Quest Hand-in: It's fortunate that you were able to intervene, <class>. Who knows what damage that golem would have caused had he not been stopped.
Title: Bubbling Red Muck Dye

Description: Is that one still bubbling?

 Quest Hand-in: Ooh, its still warm. I could live out in the Ember Ward. I will save this for the next time we need to dye my doublet. I want to remind you that we will need one for each dying, but I can keep this one ready.
Title: Queens And Future Kings

Description: A swarm of marrowbore queens have been laying eggs atop the ruins of our house. We may be able to use this to our advantage.

With Twigin's help, eliminate the queens and recover larvae from the eggs.

I have a plan for the larvae that may allow us to use the marrowbore to our advantage.

 Quest Hand-in: Now to put these to a useful purpose.
Title: Answering Aggression

Description: I weep for the Nightborne this day.

<Silgryn gestures out the door.>

Elisande demonstrates the ultimate disdain for her people. So many lives... wasted!

All to relay a message: This is what happens to those who defy her.

{name}, my friend, we must answer her. We must show her that she cannot slay her people without retribution.

Fight back, {name}.

 Quest Hand-in: It had to be done.
Title: A Precision Approach

Description: Gnolls are awful creatures. Smelly. Always scratching, laughing at you. And there are multitudes here and more are constantly arriving. We, and by that I mean you, could reap them like wheat for days and never get anywhere. They can't be suffered to stay here.

We must strike at the heart of the snake! Remove their leadership and they'll be paralyzed with indecision and despair. 

What do you mean why are we doing this? Isn't it obvious? They're gnolls! What more reason could one need?

 Quest Hand-in: How they must despair!
Title: Mission: Forsaken Intel

Description: Right, so I think you should get this stuff over to Peppy Wrongnozzle back at the keep. She's something of an amateur alchemist, but she's the only one we've got.

One thing about Peppy; she does love her drink. So, you'll likely find her at the tavern 'soaking up the atmosphere'.

I'm sure she'll know what to do.

 Quest Hand-in: Oh... hey, that'sh different!Okay, let me shee that shtuff. I jusht love tinkering with alchemy!Interesting, interesting... here, I think I know jusht what to do. A little mixing of that with the jusht the right amount of thish.You know, I think a little dash of this rotgut will help, too ...hic!
Title: Vision of Time

Description: You wish to hear how the Mag'har orcs joined the Horde? It may be one of the strangest ways we gained an ally!

It all began with a plan from Eitrigg. He had a fragment of the Vision of Time that Garrosh Hellscream used to travel to Draenor.

Chief Telemancer Oculeth believed there would be a way to go back to Draenor and get the Mag'har orcs to join the Horde.

This tale begins with a visit to Oculeth in Zuldazar...

 Quest Hand-in: <name>, it is good to see you. I have been in need of an assistant to attune this fragment for some time now.
Title: Captives at Deatholme

Description: Ah, yes. I possess a draught that will break most forms of alchemically induced stupor.

Side effects include confusion, nausea and - in rare cases - temporary blindness. All much preferable to whatever the Scourge plans to do to those prisoners in Deatholme, if you ask me.

Best of luck, brave {class}. You are going to need it.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent job, <name>.  Without your help those prisoners would've lost their minds and souls to the Scourge.
Title: Tortollans in Distress

Description: Our first task is to rescue the tortollans captured by the blood trolls. 

Keeshan's report indicates the tortollans are familiar with all things Nazmir. They should know about the Horde's operations here.

The tortollans tend to stay neutral in most matters. They'll give us details on the Horde's plans if we make a fair trade.

We'll meet afterwards at our other outpost, Redfield's Watch, north of Torga's Rest.

 Quest Hand-in: We've the information we need from the tortollans. We have to push on, time is of the essence.
Title: Kang Bramblestaff

Description: Kang's pride regularly becomes overconfidence, which often leads him down dangerous paths. His current path is as dangerous as any - he is headed deep into the Krasarang Wilds.

I wouldn't normally ask a favor of a stranger, but... would you make sure that he is well? It would give me relief to know that a brave {race} was looking out for him.

 Quest Hand-in: I'm pretty sure this settlement wasn't here a few weeks ago. Where did these people come from?
Title: Salve via Mining

Description: If you possess a Cenarion beacon while mining in Felwood, you will be able to see tainted vitriol that corrupts a vein of raw metal.  I know how to purify that vitriol and turn it into a reagent that goes into making Cenarion plant salve.  You will then use that salve on plants you find in the wild that need saving.

If you have collected any tainted vitriol, I'll give you some Cenarion plant salve I have already prepared.

 Quest Hand-in: Very well then, here's some Cenarion plant salve. If you find more vitriol when you mine in Felwood, remember to hold on to it for me! The more of it you find, the more salve I will be able to make.
Title: The Soulhunter

Description: Imonar is the deadliest bounty hunter the Twisting Nether has ever produced. Find a pit to throw him down.

 Quest Hand-in: Did you triumph in Antorus?
Title: For Science!

Description: Samples... yes... must have samples! These, ah, experiments... I mean, these unfortunate laborers must be studied.

Travel southeast to the first farm and kill the risen ghouls. From their decrepit corpses you must recover flesh samples. Bring them to me!

<Arnauld wrings his hands together and laughs maniacally for no discernible reason.>

Must test!

 Quest Hand-in: These samples will give us a better understanding of the mindless undead. Take these coins as a reward.
Title: Coup de Grace

Description: Look at that. Lirastrasza's destroying them!

There are still drakes that she's downing that need finishing off, {name}. We don't want the stinking Twilight healers to get them back up into the air.

Time for a little Coup de Grace.

 Quest Hand-in: Good thing that you and Warlord Krogg made friends with the red dragons.
Title: Compy Stomp

Description: The raptors and compies of the Zandalari represent a substantial threat to our forces here. They are superb hunting beasts that can track prey over great distances and are often lethal to encounter when caught unawares.

I need you to head into the Beast Pens and cull their numbers. We need to make sure to slay them before they are fully trained.

 Quest Hand-in: We lost three good soldiers when we first arrived on this island. Killed in their sleep by compies that had snuck into their tent. Some nights I still hear the screams.
Title: Recipe for Destruction

Description: Atop Manaforge Ultris lies the tear in the nether that the void lord, Dimensius, came through. That tear provides Dimensius with a link to the void, rendering him immune to physical harm. If we can get a lock on the conduit that Dimensius is using to keep himself phased out of this plane of existence, we can destroy it and then destroy Dimensius.

To do this, we're going to first need you to collect fragments of Dimensius from the void creatures that he sends out to do his dirty work.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent. With these fragments, we can calibrate a bomb that will destroy the void conduit atop Ultris. With the void conduit destroyed, Dimensius's connection with the void will be severed and he will be left defenseless!
Title: Stormstout's Hops

Description: All three farmers have delivered their hops to Halfhill. Perhaps you should check in with Chen to make sure that he received them.

 Quest Hand-in: Look at all these hops! This is quality stuff, too.We're making headway, <name>. Soon we'll have all the ingredients to finally start brewing.
Title: A Taste For Tail

Description: It could be days before we're ready to make our way to the surface, and to be honest, I'm already beginning to get hungry.

I hate to be picky, but when it comes to seafood, I'm afraid there are very few things I can stomach.

If you come across any lobster types, I would happily pay you what coin I have with me for their tails.

 Quest Hand-in: Oh, my!That's some of the biggest, juiciest tail I've ever seen!
Title: Go Fetch

Description: Now THIS is a savage land worthy of my level of heroism!

Oh, hello, I did not see you standing there, staring at me. Perhaps you have noticed that every piece of my armor is an ancient relic, forgotten by time.

As you have properly surmised, an adventurer of my stature does not have time to complete the menial requests I am given daily. I must remain here, yelling aloud to the trade district so that others may witness my heroicness and be inspired.

Today I require a Nightmare Bell, do find one.

 Quest Hand-in: I see you have completed this menial task admirably, almost as if you were intended to experience such a thing. Ah fate, what do you have in store for me next?
Title: Supply Recovery

Description: We seem to have arrived at just the right time!

The Gordunni have been enchanting armaments for the Iron Horde and it looks like they haven't picked up the latest shipment.

We could put that gear to far better use! Lets go hunt down their shipping containers. I brought some signal flares that we can use to call in an air pick-up when we've secured the shipment.

 Quest Hand-in: Alright, that should be the last one we need. Nothing feels as good as knowing you are stronger than your enemy!
Title: The Conquest of Azshara

Description: {name}! Was it you who piloted the wind rider who bombed the command center? It was a direct hit!

My scouts tell me that you gravely wounded Jarrodenus, flight master of the night-elven skychasers and de facto commander of the opposition.

The opportunity to strike is now - I don't have time to assemble a full assault. Rush the command center building and kill Commander Jarrodenus before his backup arrives. Bring me his head... and Azshara is ours!  

 Quest Hand-in: ...Then it is done!<Chawg surveys the battlefield.>There are still pockets of resistance around our camp, but this rearguard action appears to be masking a full-fledged retreat to Ashenvale. Azshara is ours!The Warchief will hear of this victory and your part in it. But we will surely need the help of a <class> like you elsewhere. Be sure to speak with Kroum here in camp before you leave.
Title: Return to the Grove

Description: Now that my clan is assembled, we shall return to the Grove of Cenarius.

Speak to Malfurion when you arrive. We will find out the cause of Cenarius' illness.

 Quest Hand-in: Wonderful. The Archdruids have already assembled.
Title: Grand Master Obalis

Description: I see the triumphant tamer returns to again test himself against me. Very well. I accept your challenge.

 Quest Hand-in: By defeating me, I grow stronger. I urge you to be wary during our next encounter.
Title: An Offering of Light

Description: I sense it. The nobility in Xe'ra's heart. Her relentless defiance of the Legion. Let this be her legacy.

In building the Vindicaar, we fashioned the Netherlight Crucible to harness the tremendous powers at play on Argus. I believe Xe'ra's essence is one key to that potential.

Yet the Light alone is not enough. Without balance, there can be no harmony, no cohesion.

Infuse this essence into the crucible, champion. It is the first step in unlocking the strength needed to end the Burning Crusade.

 Quest Hand-in: An important first step, <name>.If we can bring balance to the Netherlight Crucible, I believe it will make your weapon even more powerful.
Title: Two Paths to Tread

Description: Did that answer your question?

Oh, you wanted a way to completely resist Domination magic? That I'm afraid I do not know. The First Ones' language will only delay the inevitable.

What I can tell you is that if you want to find more deliciously complex phrases of the First Ones' language, you should go to the Endless Sands and search the vaults.

I wish I could go myself, but it has been overrun by those nasty Mawsworn.

Good luck with the rest of your studies!

 Quest Hand-in: This Elder has given us an important answer to this puzzle. But now we must act on the information. Though, doing so will be difficult.First we must infuse the helm with those indecipherable phrases from the First Ones that are in the Endless Sands.But that will not be enough on its own. We will need more. Let me prepare, while you acquire what we need. I will send word for you after.
Title: A Call to Action

Description: <As the raven stares into your eyes, a familiar voice fills your mind.>

Champion, I require your aid. It seems Helya has shown her hand.

Steel yourself then come to me.

 Quest Hand-in: It is good of you to come.
Title: Culling the Herd

Description: It seems that Kael'thas' forces have twisted the Botanica's specimens beyond saving. I do not want to see them unleashed upon Outland as so many others have.

There is one, Laj, who I would like to examine. He is different somehow. Perhaps we can learn from him.

 Quest Hand-in: You have done well thus far, <name>. However, there is still one more task I must ask that you complete.
Title: Paying Tribute

Description: Our patron Niuzao is a mountain on wheels... very difficult to move, even more difficult to stop. My point: once we get him moving, the mantid will have their arms full trying to slow him down.

The easiest way to get him moving is to put food in front of him. Luckily for us, food in our temple is plentiful... even in wartime.

I will send one of my strongarms with you, to shoulder the load.

 Quest Hand-in: He will get up. Soon. Maybe not today, but soon.And when he does...<A smile grows on Paosha's face.>
Title: Cornering Gor'krosh

Description: If Gor'krosh is a truly a raptor, you should be able to track it down just like any other animal.

See if you can find its trail. We know it's been around here recently. Corner it in its lair and end this once and for all!

Make sure you return to Razor Hill straight away once you make the kill. The Farseer will need proof of the deed.

Thank you, {name}. May the spirits guide your blade. Lok-tar!

 Quest Hand-in: <Aggra inspects the blood on your face carefully. Satisfied with what she sees, she nods.>A clean kill. You have defended the young and the weak honorably. The spirits are pleased.You have earned the blessing of the clan....You may have your clothes back.
Title: Trouble From the Ground Up

Description: Teegan's a fool to think the quilboar caused this sudden overgrowth. Look around you. I've been watching these plants bloom and sprout daily - each generation is more mutated than the last. This isn't tribal magic - it's something primal. And dangerous.

The day before last a great druid passed through our camp. Seek out Naralex, somewhere in the midst of this jungle. He'll know what to do.

And bring him some plant samples from around the overgrowth to help his studies.

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, samples from different parts of the overgrowth? These will be immensely helpful, yes. Thank you, <class>.
Title: A Heap of Delicious Worg

Description: We're going to need fresh meat, which means you're going to be hunting worg.  The worg on this side of the steppes should be your target.

<Troteman produces a large blade, which he hands to you.>

Hunt the giant ember worgs.  Once you've killed them, use this saw to remove the choicest bits of meat from their bodies.  You will find these worgs all over the steppes, but the closest pack rules the land just to our northeast.

 Quest Hand-in: This meat looks good... but I think it needs a little "seasoning".  I'll make sure that gets taken care of.Thank you, <name>.
Title: Halls of Valor: Odyn's Challenge

Description: Odyn himself sends a message. He and his warriors await worthy contenders within the Halls of Valor.

Defeat the champions of the Halls of Valor, and claim glory.

 Quest Hand-in: Were you able to overcome Odyn's challenge?
Title: Assessing Your Spirit

Description: It is clear to all that you are indeed a skilled combatant.

There is one challenge here that continues to test even the strongest among us. I would have you attempt to best a well-known centurion, beloved by all aspirants. It is called Athanos.

Consider this a test of your spirit.

If you can withstand this trial, then I will deem you ready for what lies ahead.

 Quest Hand-in: This is always a painful lesson. We do not think less of you for it.
Title: Clam Bait

Description: You have the look of a fisherman, {class}! I love to fish - been fishing all my life. The best bait to use is soft-shelled clam meat; the fish just can't resist, you know what I mean?

Up north you will find a wrecked ship off the coast. Soft-shelled clams are littered throughout the area. If you bring me back 10 pieces of soft-shelled clam meat, I will give you something in return.

 Quest Hand-in: Perfect mon, this is just what the witch doctor told me to do for my headache. He says, "Mai'Lahii - go fish. It'll make you feel better"Well, I feel better already, thanks mon!
Title: Armored Carp

Description: Armored Carp are a delicacy around these parts.

Unfortunately we can't fish them up since they snap our hooks with their powerful jaws.  Take this fishing spear and see if you can catch a few for us.

 Quest Hand-in: Careful with that carp, <name>.  They have been known to bite fingers off!
Title: Loramus Thalipedes Awaits

Description: The enchantment on these amulets was not complex.  Together, their power will grant you access to Razelikh, the amulets' creator.

I am prepared to perform the ritual on you and Loramus.  Speak with me when you are both ready.

 Quest Hand-in: It would seem that we are prepared to face our demon, <name>.  We have the amulet's blessing, we have the stone knife, and I alone know the demon's true name: Rakh'likh.  Together, this may be enough to defeat the Defiler.
Title: Continued Efforts: Mauler's Outlook

Description: My Eyes tell me that the Mauler's Outlook is near the newly formed road from the Maw into Korthia. It would provide a strategic and tactical advantage.

Unfortunately, the area is overrun with shardhides.

If we can secure the area, it will provide us with a clear path to the west, as well as a point of observation to monitor the Jailer's forces.

 Quest Hand-in: The tactical advantage we now hold is a huge win against the Jailer's Forces. Well done, <name>.
Title: Corki's Ransom

Description: <Arechron shows you a grime covered letter.>

I just received this letter. It's from a clan of ogres known as Warmaul that rule the northwestern lands of Nagrand. It says that they have Corki and if we don't cooperate, they're going to eat him. Admittedly, Corki is a moron, but he's still my blood. Will you rescue him, {name}?

I presume that he's locked up in a cage somewhere on Warmaul Hill. That should be your first stop.

 Quest Hand-in: They've got me locked up good this time, <name>. The Warmaul king, Cho'war, has the key.
Title: A Calling in Maldraxxus

Description: Today marks the beginning of our path to victory.

Enemies surround us on all sides. Aid our troops on the battlefield and return with the resources we need to wage our war.

Once we have secured our home front, we can direct our efforts outwards.

Such is your calling. Failure is unacceptable.

 Quest Hand-in: Our rival houses will think twice before stepping foot outside of their strongholds again. Blood and glory to you, Maw Walker.
Title: Bottled Up Inside

Description: There were many souls that opposed Margrave Gharmal's attack on Bastion. Those of us that spoke out, were stripped our bodies, imprisoned in the Etheric Vault, till our souls faded away, starved of anima.

My friends are still imprisoned in the vaults. We will free them, and build an army of constructs to fight for you!

 Quest Hand-in: We make a good team, <name>.
Title: The Bad Dogs

Description: In my haste to escape from Lethlor Ravine, I forgot to tie up one loose end: Nyxondra.  She's free, and she's sounded the alarm among the black dragonflight.  Half the flight is here in the western Badlands, combing for this egg.

I'll take care of hiding the egg.  You're going to take care of some of the more troublesome dragons.  And you'll have help.

I've paid off a couple of mercenaries to help you.  You'll find them inside this inn.

 Quest Hand-in: You're the <race> we've been waiting for?  It's about time you got here.  My legs could use a stretch.Come on boys!  Let's go kill us some black dragons!
Title: The Darkness

Description: For thousands of years, the Darkness was held at bay. The wards stood... protecting Highmountain.

Now they are gone, and evil is free once more.
