The Darkness that haunted our dreams... that even the kobolds spoke of only in frightened whispers... has come.

Uul'gyneth, herald of the Old Gods, paves the way for his masters. Unless we stand together and defeat him, all is lost.

You must hold nothing back, champion. None of us can.

 Quest Hand-in: I cannot put into words how much you have done for us this day, or how grateful I am to have you as an ally.You have our thanks, hero. You have MY thanks.I owe you a great debt for this.
Title: Lycanthoth the Corruptor

Description: I think I understand what's happening here. The Twilight's Hammer fears that the ancients may someday rise up to oppose them. They'll do anything to stop the return of Goldrinn.

This "Lycanthoth" is a twisted version of our beloved wolf god, summoned by the Twilight's Hammer to replace him.

Bah! It is but a shadow of Goldrinn's power. {name}, kill this beast so that the true ancient can return. Take this incense and burn it in the Maw of Lycanthoth east of here. Slay that beast and free Goldrinn!

 Quest Hand-in: You were brave to face down Lycanthoth, <name>. Like myself, he was a primal force of nature... but his origins were from a darker place.Those who birthed that beast reached deep into the blackness, channeling powers never intended for this world.Come, <class>. Climb onto my back, and let us show these beasts the true face of ferocity!
Title: Get Your Bearings

Description: I think a proper introduction is in order!

My name is Taelia, member of the Proudmoore Guard and squire of Sir Cyrus Crestfall.

<Taelia salutes firmly.>

Cyrus asked me and Flynn to break you out of that Ashvane prison and get you settled in here at the market, but he neglected to mention that you're with the Alliance.

I must say, it's an honor.

Let's get you up to speed.

 Quest Hand-in: Ready to meet the Harbormaster himself?
Title: The Wayward Waywatcher

Description: The Waywatchers have kept the roads of Thaldraszus safe for travelers for as long as I can remember. It is a duty that my family has upheld with honor for generations.

Alas, my sister Alvi seems less than interested in that honor of late. She is supposed to report to me here each morning, but I have not heard from her in over a day. 

If you find a bronze drakonid east of here, lazing about with her head in the clouds, I ask that you direct her to me. Otherwise, I will have to seek her out myself.

 Quest Hand-in: Oh, gracious, a traveler. Please forgive me, I am a bit of a mess at the moment.
Title: In Memory of Ysera

Description: Oh, no! Now I think I understand. Theramus...he misses Ysera, and she can't come back.

Come! I suspect I know where he went. We won't bother him further, but it'll be good to tell him that we're sorry, and that we'll give him the space he wants.

We are here for each other, within the nature all around us.

 Quest Hand-in: <Theramus looks quietly upon the newly restored shrine.>
Title: Hero of the Sin'dorei

Description: This is the beginning of a new chapter in the history of our race, {name}.  Our lands will be reclaimed and we shall cement our bond with Sylvanas and her allies.

Take the traitor's head to Regent Lord Lor'themar Theron in Silvermoon City.  He'll be eager to hear the news.

 Quest Hand-in: Now that's one face I was not expecting to see so soon.This is quite the good news, <name>, in more ways than you can imagine.
Title: The Count of the Marshes

Description: This bloody mandible comes from an unbelievably large creature. The nether ray that it belonged to has to be the largest ever seen in Zangarmarsh. Judging from the condition of the mandible, the count must've abandoned a diet of carrion in favor of living flesh.

Surely the Cenarion Expedition would be interested in such a specimen. Watcher Leesa'oh has a small camp to the west of Quagg Ridge.

 Quest Hand-in: Are you sure that's real? I mean, I knew there was large wildlife in the marsh, but there are giant creatures and then there are GIANT bugs.Come to think of it, the sporelings did mention a story about a fearsome nether ray that used to terrorize them before the boglord incursion.What if the stories are true? Oh, dear. I'd better take that for safekeeping. The expedition will want to know about this.
Title: Shadowguard Dispersion

Description: Lend me the aid of your order once again, that we might end the Shadowguard threat permanently. While you confront the Legion, we will face the void. The attack commences once your forces arrive.

 Quest Hand-in: With L'ura defeated, and the voidcallers eliminated, the Shadowguard's dominance over the city has been crippled. if our campaign against the Legion is successful, there could be a future for the creatures living here.
Title: The Seat of the Triumvirate: Armor of the Triumvirate

Description: This reforged key will grant entry into the armory inside the Seat of the Triumvirate.

Locked away inside is the Armor of the Triumvirate, crafted in the days before Sargeras brought ruin to our world. We cannot let this armor be stolen by the Void's forces.

Once the armor is in your possession, please bring it to Archivist Ionaa. He has collected our most sacred relics in the cave just up the path. No doubt he would be very glad to receive it.

 Quest Hand-in: The Armor of the Triumvirate! I never believed I would see it again. It is a reminder of our proud history, one which the evil of the Legion will never overshadow.Gaal told me of your dedication, <name>. It is fitting that you don this armor. May it serve as a beacon of the Light in these dark times.
Title: To Tame A Thunderspine

Description: Lizi is healed, but she's still nervous about leaving her spot. In the wild, she'd forage about a musken's weight of plants a day. It's impossible for me to do that! We need her to move out of the water and to the grasses.

I'll keep trying to coax her out, but in the meantime, could you help me forage? I hear there are especially nutritious high-fiber leaves in the Emerald Gardens. Please bring back any you can find!

 Quest Hand-in: This should tide her over until she can forage by herself again.
Title: Where There Is Smoke...

Description: Burning Blade assassins have infiltrated the garrison. We must not let them take the Heart of Gorgorek, commander.

 Quest Hand-in: The assassin appeared out of nowhere.Baros took the blade that was meant for my heart. I ripped out the throat of our attacker... but I was too late.Baros gave me this flower before he passed.<Thorn holds up the rose. A tear rolls down her cheek.>
Title: Engineering Services Requested

Description: Hi, hi, hi {name}! Crafting orders are coming in left and right!

If you're looking for work, the Artisan's Consortium always has orders to fill!

You can take a look at our public orders, or if you've built up a network of clients for yourself, fill some guild orders or personal orders! Just get it done, done, done!

 Quest Hand-in: Thanks for your business! Keep on crafting, crafting, crafting!
Title: Back to Basics

Description: There are certain things that everyone needs, from the basic household cook to the master chef. One of the city's most important staples is rice flour. Most families keep at least one basket of rice in their houses and the residents of the Craftsmen's Terrace and Tradesmen's Terrace are no different.

I often ask my students to help with the task of pounding rice into flour since it's good practice and an endless task. Why don't you give it a try?

 Quest Hand-in: It takes a lot of effort to ensure that there's enough flour for everyone's needs. Thank you for your help, <name>.
Title: A Centaur's Best Friend

Description: It isn't safe for us to remain in the open, {name}.

The gorlocs forced my hunting companion, Baba, into a cave to the east.

Set me free, then we shall rescue Baba. I will meet you in the cave when the path is clear.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you, <name>. We are safe in here and can speak freely. I will protect Baba from any gorlocs that dare venture in while he rests.
Title: WANTED: Braxicus

Description: Wanted for attacks against the Alliance!

Braxicus is responsible for the gruesome deaths of several of our finest soldiers.

Last seen near the vicinity of this command poster.

Extreme caution advised!

Upon completion of the mission, report to Lieutenant Hawkins for commendation.

 Quest Hand-in: Well done, <class>. Braxicus has been terrorizing our soldiers since the day we arrived on Nazjatar.
Title: A Very Precious Cargo

Description: We weren't the only ship in our convoy to get caught up in this mess. Our flagship ran aground to the east. It was holding a very precious cargo and I need you to bring it back here.

 Quest Hand-in: Who are you? Where's my dad? I'm hungry. Can I have a sword? Where's my dad?!
Title: Walk With The Earth Mother

Description: Much has changed outside of Mulgore, {name}. The world is torn, and our Horde allies have turned down dark paths. We must guide them. Even in the darkest hour, we will bravely hold our heads high, and honor the Earth Mother in all we do.

You must go, {name}, and be this example. Go to Orgrimmar. Tell Saurfang how the Grimtotem were driven out. Let him know our pride and discipline, our strength and sorrow.

Tal at the Skytower will send you on your way. Go in peace, and never forget your people.

 Quest Hand-in: The Grimtotem forced from Mulgore... if Baine speaks for this, you are indeed a fierce warrior.From this day, your strength is no longer your own. It belongs to me, and the Horde, as a weapon of war.Hellscream's eyes are upon you, <name>. Victory or death!
Title: Get Kraken!

Description: The Sunreavers and Silver Covenant sent ships north to engage the Kvaldir at Hrothgar's Landing, but were intercepted and detained by a Kvaldir Raiding vessel.  To make matters worse, the Kvaldir have found a way to call forth the dreaded Kraken that lives beneath the North Sea.  If anyone on board is to get out alive, that Kraken must be driven away and the Kvaldir's summoning ritual ... disrupted.

Crusader, take these spears and an Argent Hippogryph will take you to the battle.

 Quest Hand-in: Crusader, you may have bought those sailors just enough time to escape,  Maybe next time, those Silver Covenant and Sunreavers will listen before running head first at the enemy.
Title: Suspiciously Quiet

Description: Can you spare a minute, {name}? I haven't heard from my two apprentices, Scrumpy and Tucky, in some time. 

This is concerning. 

I sent them to fetch us supplies for the inn. They couldn't have strayed too far...

Please find them, but I warn you... They're... quite the handful.

 Quest Hand-in: <The young vulpera nervously puts his hands behind his back.>Do we know you? Noriko said not to talk to strangers...
Title: Secrets of Leysmithing

Description: I could spend hours poring over the details of this fascinating manuscript!

...is what I would say if this weren't the simplest of tasks for someone of my skill level. It's about something called "Leysmithing". Here.

<The gnome scribbles down a translation on the back of the scroll.>

There it is, word-for-word. Bring me something interesting next time.

 Quest Hand-in: I hadn't even thought far enough ahead to realize you'd need this to be translated, too. Good thinking.See, this is why I keep adventurers like you around the shop.
Title: Rigging the Wager

Description: Care to help settle a bet, chum?

Those tauren are Skyhorn, and they fancy themselves big-time hunters. I bet them a pretty penny that they wouldn't be able to take out some of the biggest beasts in Stormheim.

If you take em out before they do, I'll split the wager. Deal?

The first is a big eagle nesting in the foothills. They call him Spitefeather. You can bait him with some meat, but he's up pretty high, so you'll need a grapple gun to get there. I think there's one of them layin around here...

 Quest Hand-in: So you took him out, eh? Those tauren are gonna be so jealous when they get back!  Naturally, you'll have to wait till the tauren get back and pay their wager before I can give you your cut. But in the meantime, I've got another target for you.
Title: The Blight Congress

Description: We, the Forsaken, have been through a lot since the destruction of Lordaeron. But we're determined to keep our home.

Why should we give up what we've fought so hard to carve out for ourselves?

Calia is still a relative newcomer in some ways, but obviously she's known to our people. How could she not be, as the sister of Arthas himself?

I hope we can move forward, and that she can really help. Her voice could be a powerful one, if she is really truly committed to the people.

 Quest Hand-in: I expected that my presence might cause friction. But I'm grateful to Lilian for her mediation, and for giving me the chance to show that I am committed to helping the Forsaken people.But now, I must prove it.
Title: Avenger's Pauldrons

Description: It is said among us that the ornate shoulder armor worn by the mortal races started as an attempt to emulate the wings of a dragon.

Bring me the bindings worn by the highest Qiraji leaders and I shall shape them into a set of pauldrons more dreadful than even the wings of Nefarian himself!

 Quest Hand-in: From the materials you bring and from the scales of our fallen Qiraji foes I make you these pauldrons, mortal.  May they grant you the protection you need and may the sight of them strike fear into our enemies.
Title: The Catalyst's Boon

Description: I have an urgent message for you, adventurer.

The Revival Catalyst seems to be responding to the land's rumblings--perhaps even your feats!

Miraculously, it now shares its power for nothing in return except one's mere presence.

Antuka will know more. Go with haste, {name}. This is wondrous news.

 Quest Hand-in: Every week, the catalyst will grant you enough power to imbue one piece of equipment.Keeper Tyr must be watching us. Wherever he is, this is no coincidence.
Title: A Time of Revelation

Description: I can feel Ateena's dark voodoo up ahead. We need to stop whatever she is planning with dis "G'huun".

Be ready for anything, {name}. We do not know what power Ateena truly has.

I do know one thing. If G'huun is threatening my people, den it will die, just like Ateena.

 Quest Hand-in: De blood troll threat is bigger than I ever imagined. Dat construct is enough to destroy all of ZuldazarWe need more than de Horde to stop dis.
Title: Koukou's Rampage

Description: We have more than just our cellars to worry about.

Koukou, our beloved mushan, has gone crazy! Just look at him!

I've tried cajoling and pleading and yelling and soothing, but nothing has worked.

I'm afraid he is no longer of his own mind. There is only one way to save him, and our brewery.

Strike swift and sure. He will not feel a thing.

 Quest Hand-in: You did well to help the Brewers and bring this news to me.From what you have told me, it sounds as if Koukou was possessed by some dark energy. Could it be...?No. That is impossible.
Title: Observational Records

Description: Greetings, Maw Walker, a moment of your time?

As you no doubt know, my cartel has quietly spread observational devices all across Korthia. But that data is no good to us if it is not retrieved. Which is where you come in.

The records at Mauler's Outlook should be ready to collect. You won't see the devices themselves, but the data will appear to you as a bright orb.

Bring those data to me, and I will reward you handsomely.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent, this data will serve us well. We can begin to answer some of our questions about Korthia, and the Mauler's Outlook. Was it always home to such terrible creatures, or did was it something more?And here is your reward, as promised
Title: Return to Stardust

Description: Huntress Jalin will be pleased to know that the way to Windshear Hold is now clear. Please return to Stardust Spire and inform her of your success. She will most assuredly have more work for you now that our path is clear.

Thank you and good luck, friend.

 Quest Hand-in: With the airways clear our hippogryphs will be able to move into Stonetalon freely. Well done, <name>!Now on to more pressing matters. What you witnessed at Trueshot Point was a small sampling of the decimation left in the wake of Hellscream's legacy. As Warchief of the Horde, Hellscream has declared Kalimdor as the Horde's sovereign territory. All that would oppose the Horde are destroyed.We are Kalimdor's last line of defense. Should we fall, Kalimdor will also fall. The Horde must be stopped!
Title: Proof of Strength: Botani Bloom

Description: This bloom is proof of your strength at slaying botani and your gladiator friend has born witness!

Take the bloom back to Jonaa and claim your accolades!

 Quest Hand-in: The botani are nothing to be trifled with. They are incredibly cunning and their powers are strong on their home land. Taking one of their blooms is an true example of your fighting skill!
Title: Slay Loguhn

Description: Already it goes from bad to worse. There is only one course to take... regrettably, Loguhn must die!

He's the alpha male of the Snowfall Glade tribe and one mean wolvar. But it's the only way to get a short break from their attacks and stealing forays.

You will find the "Render of Flesh" in front of his hovel upon the northern rise of the glade. It's larger than the others and hard to miss. Kill him and smear his blood upon yourself, both to show your dominance and respect.

 Quest Hand-in: Loguhn's honorable sacrifice at your hands is exactly what my people need. Now we will make the most of the wolvar in-fighting for his place.It will have to be enough.
Title: A Blade Fit For A Champion

Description: I've heard that the Alliance champions are seeking after ancient blades for their warriors. We can't afford to let them have that kind of advantage.

There's an old legend from Grizzly Hills about a maiden cursed with a frog's form to protect the blade she has long guarded. She lives among the lake frogs on the shore of Ashwood Lake, just east of Ashwood Post. The only thing said to break the curse is a kiss, freely given. Apply this balm before kissing anything, {name}. Otherwise, you'll catch warts.

 Quest Hand-in: So the tales were true? This blade should be enough to best anything those Alliance entrants can come up with.
Title: Shopping Around

Description: Look, I told that shady character that there might be a shop more open to his, uh, wares in the Drag. Droffer's and Son Salvage is the name of the place.

Look for Dran Droffers. He oversees the 'salvage' of rare and valuable objects from all over Azeroth.

 Quest Hand-in: Leave it to Droffers to have a buyer lined up already. We should combine our efforts to track down this thief and keep the crate's contents from falling into the wrong hands.
Title: Obsidian Essays

Description: It's not common these days, but we do have a few of our histories in writing--well, carvings really. We can trace the etchings with our fingers! 

We used to use clay tablets for this, but they were brittle, and prone to breaking. Not good if you want to preserve history!

I hear the djaradin carve their important texts into volcanic glass. If they can manage that without shattering the tablets, we could probably learn a thing or two from their techniques!

Take some samples back to Loamm for study.

 Quest Hand-in: Very interesting... they might look like brutes, but this carving requires a light and careful hand. Not to mention enormous amounts of patience.With any luck, we'll both make something as fine as these one day, eh?
Title: Is This Stuff Still Good?

Description: You find what appears to be a crate of food, left behind when this camp was abandoned.  On the outside of the crate, you can make out a stamp that says "PROPERTY OF MARSHAL EXPEDITIONS".

Perhaps you might find someone who could use this?

 Quest Hand-in: Oh... wow... it's some really old food.  Hey Hol'anyee, take a look at this!  This <race> brought us those old rations that we abandoned!No, not from Marshal's Refuge... from the old base camp!I'm not sure I want to peek inside.  I'll just give it to Nolen, I guess... he'll know what to do with it.
Title: The Golem Lord's Creations

Description: The latest SI:7 intelligence on Blackrock Depths is troubling, {name}. It appears Twilight's Hammer is working with the Dark Iron engineer, Argelmach, to create war golems powered by elementals. These golems could prove to be a devastating weapon if used against us.

You must prevent that from happening, {name}. Find the Manufactory in Blackrock Depths, capture the blueprints he's using to make those golems, and recover the elemental modules he's using to power them.

 Quest Hand-in: I know a couple of engineers who will want to take a look at those plans. They won't be using these golems anytime soon. Good work, <name>.
Title: Home Is Where the Hearth Is

Description: I don't know about you, but I'm in the mood for some good ol' fashioned recreation!

Why don't we head over to The Wyvern's Tail and cool off with a few pints of Cobo Cola?

While we're there, speak with Innkeeper Nufa to make The Wyvern's Tail your new home. That way, if you ever find yourself stranded without a flight master nearby, you can use your hearthstone to return to the inn.

Not only is it faster than a wyvern, but you'll save yourself some dough in the process!

 Quest Hand-in: As long as The Wyvern's Tail is your home, you can find a warm fire here when you return.
Title: King of the Hill

Description: Loksey is ready. It is finally time to begin the hunt.

Take him to Wanecrypt. The Fearstalker and the other hunters will be there already.

Hurry now. She does not like to be kept waiting.

 Quest Hand-in: Let us begin, shall we?
Title: Planting the Seed of Fear

Description: It seems that Jerrod has you hunting the murlocs to the north.  That's good... we can use their parts for our poisons.  I get a little worried sometimes, though...

The Vile Fin spawning grounds are not far off Tirisfal's northern coast, so you'll probably notice several tadpoles among the adults on the shore.  If these impressionable young murlocs were to seek revenge against us... that could ruin us.  Go chase them, and show them that the Forsaken and the Horde are not to be trifled with.

 Quest Hand-in: Did they run from you, <name>?  Good.  This is better than killing them... if they live to tell the tale, then future generations of murlocs will learn to fear us.
Title: Things Are Not Goren Our Way

Description: The abandoned mine shaft has been overrun with goren!  They seem to be responding to commands from a big one farther down in the mine.  If you can take him out, the rest will probably retreat.

Once you have those goren cleared out, we can get that mine up and working!

 Quest Hand-in: Nice job, <name>! Let's get this mining operation started!
Title: Whose Vault Is It Anyway?

Description: I do not know what we will find in the vault or why Sarkareth wants access to it, but I hope we are not too late.

Before we continue any further, Tuberros should lead Rannan and Perisimona back to Loamm.

Come and talk to me once you are ready to move forward.

 Quest Hand-in: I still think we should have sent them back to Loamm, but I trust Ebyssian's judgement.
Title: Atonement

Description: Our history with the orcs is one of constant conflict, {name}.  We were once near driven to extinction due to their bloodlust and have since then avoided them even when not under demonic influence.

Yet, this retaliation... it's not what Sedai would've wanted.  Speak with our elder, Amaan the Wise.  He will help shed light on these events.

 Quest Hand-in: Can I offer you any assistance, <name>?  You sound troubled.
Title: The Roughnecks

Description: NEW JOB OPPORTUNITIES!

Do you seek danger? Beasts in great quantities? Perilous adventure?
Do you also prefer the rugged outdoors to the dainty frilly froo-froo estate life?

Well, you might be cutout to be a ROUGHNECK, suppliers of all gryphon mounts in Kul Tiras.

Inquire at the Roughneck Camp in Westwind Weald about this exciting new opportunity.

Applicants must NOT be afraid of heights, feathers, and/or death.

 Quest Hand-in: Here for the job are ye? Well buckle up house cat, it gets rough from here on out.
Title: Ley Litter

Description: The ley line is here--I can feel it! 

But first, we must stop the gnolls. That ancient will be their greatest weapon.

There are some ley crystals the gnolls have gathered. Thankfully, they don't seem to understand the power that the crystals hold. 

Bring me as many as you can. They'll empower my mirror image and help me summon something useful from the Archives to take that monster down!

 Quest Hand-in: What were they doing with these? Using them as back scratchers?!<Kalecgos pinches the bridge of his nose.>...I suppose we should be grateful they didn't figure out their true potential.
Title: Whispers in the Dark

Description: Did ye hear that as well? That cannae be good.

If N'Zoth gains access tae this chamber, we'll all be done for! 

We need tae figure out where he's accessing the chamber and shut it down, before he does more than just whisper at us!

 Quest Hand-in: What have we done?If it weren't for Ra-den's sacrifice, N'Zoth would've had the chamber, and Azeroth would've been his for the takin'.
Title: A Travel Journal

Description: <This book appears to be a travelogue of this book's personal journey around Ardenweald! And self-written and published no less!

Flipping towards the end you see yourself enter the picture as a villain, unjustly attacking the book and opening it. 

You read "This book appears to be a travelogue of this book's personal journey around Ardenweald! And Self-written and-"

You hurriedly close the book, feeling queasy. It should go back to Archivist Dreyden.>

 Quest Hand-in: It was writing itself? How fascinating! The feeling of recursion will pass.
Title: Four Heads are Better than None

Description: Now, while we're about to launch the attack upon the Twilight Gate, there is one last loose end to tie up: Za'brox and Beeble'phod, the disciples of Cho'gall.

Intelligence has placed them within the Den of the Disciples, a small ogre cave at the southwest corner of the Twilight Gate.

Please head back in and kill them.

 Quest Hand-in: <The noble lady grins wickedly.>That's quite a gruesome trophy collection you have there. I would have believed you if you had simply said they were dead, though I do appreciate the extra effort. Thank you for having the foresight to take care of them.The Twilight Gate will soon be ours. Time to move up to the Twilight Citadel.
Title: Saving Warpwood

Description: Just inside the eastern wing of Dire Maul one of the warpwood ancients, Furgus Warpwood, still lives uncorrupted. You must travel there and help him drive out the terrible creatures that have taken it as their own before they set their sights on Camp Mojache. Perhaps we can even enlist his aid afterward to ensure we maintain our presence in Feralas with enemies on so many sides.

 Quest Hand-in: Your face shows signs of desperate conflict. I honor your presence, brave <class>.
Title: The Infested Protectors

Description: The trees of this land are ravaged by the power that was unleashed from Auchindoun.  The foul magic that was unleashed blasted the land into the wastes you see all around.  The trees that survived are now infested with wretched wood mites that crawl under their bark and gnaw at their flesh.  

Rotting forest-ragers and infested root-walkers are breeding grounds for the mites.  They are found along the edge of the wood to the east.  Destroy these creatures and then kill the mites that flee their husks.

 Quest Hand-in: You have done much to help Terokkar Forest, <name>.  With the worst of the mite colonies destroyed we may yet be able to reclaim this wasted land.
Title: Mean Gulls

Description: Must... catch... Need more...

The gulls... they bite... scratch... take...

I need them gone... but... I must... catch...

 Quest Hand-in: The gulls are... no more...Now... I can catch more...Yes... catch more...
Title: The Ordo Warbringer

Description: You've taken the shield down at Fire Camp Ordo. Go back there before the shield goes up again.

Time to head into the cave and slay their chief!

 Quest Hand-in: You've done it, <name>! I'm in your debt!Again!
Title: Direhorn Soul

Description: <The Direhorn Soul is brutal and tenacious. The shape of the direhorn will be yours to call upon.>

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, the direhorn. This shape is now yours to call upon.
Title: Call of the Gladiator

Description: Your merciless rampage has not gone unnoticed, gladiator. So many of your enemies have fallen before your might. It is because of your unrelenting savagery that Imperator Mar'gok himself has requested your presence at the grand Highmaul Coliseum. It is at Highmaul that a battle of epic proportions awaits.

Should you heed the call of the gladiator, present this sigil to my brother, Kharg. He is the arena master residing outside of the Coliseum in Nagrand.

 Quest Hand-in: A bold decision, gladiator. For most, death is the only thing they find at the Coliseum. Surviving here is more than a test of skill, it is a test of wills. Do you have the fortitude to become a champion?
Title: Shards of Corruption

Description: <You feel the pull of something dark and inhuman on your mind, it's writhing tendrils digging in, tugging at your sanity. You feel compelled to collect more shards... all of them.>

 Quest Hand-in: <You feel a foreboding presence in your mind, it seems... very pleased.>
Title: Torek's Assault

Description: Hey!  {class}!  Come here!

My raiders and I are about to attack the Silverwing Outpost to the west.  Our target is its leader, Duriel Moonfire.  Scouts report the outpost is defended heavily with sentinels and warriors.  The battle will be glorious!

Do you want to share in the glory, {name}, and aid us?  If so, then when it's over you can report our success to my superior, Ertog Ragetusk in Splintertree.

What do you say.  Are you with us?

 Quest Hand-in: So Torek's attack was successful!  Well done, <name>.  Night elves are decent foes.  A little skinny, but strong and fierce!  I'm sure the battle was something to see...And I hope you gained a scar or two!
Title: Magnets, How Do They Work?

Description: Getting useful machine parts out here on the island has been difficult, {name}.  We have been trying to repair the broken siege engines here in camp but we keep running out of useful parts.

Our second regiment reported some wrecked out siege engines in a old battlefield to the west.  Maybe we could find some parts over there?

You are going to have trouble finding anything in that old battlefield so take this magnetized scrap collector and put it to some good use.

 Quest Hand-in: These parts will really help us out, <name>!  Who would have thought you can find stuff this useful in all that old junk?
Title: *Gurgle* HELP! *Gurgle*

Description: *GURGLE*

HELP!*GASP*

ORKUS IS DROWNING! HELP ME, QUEST GIVER {name}!

*GLUB*

Dwarf threw Orkus into the water! Must not die!

*GURGLE*

The shame would be too great.

 Quest Hand-in: <Orkus' face turns as red as his armor.>I... uh... the human must have cast some type of mind-altering spell on Orkus. Orkus will explain.
Title: Hot Stuff

Description: I have a plan to quadruple the recommended torque for a standard speargun of this size, but according to my calculations the act of firing the weapon would shatter the casing. And possibly cleave the planet in two.

I can weld together a chassis 100-times stronger if I had a good source of pure elemental flame for the smelting.

Unbound Emberfiends are roiling around west of here, in the Humboldt Conflagration. Killing them should render them down to pellets of molten fury. Bring me some!

 Quest Hand-in: Marvelous! I'll smelt this down into a delicious soup. An angry soup. Of molten metal.
Title: Lessons of the Past

Description: I have returned! You must have known that a world so rich in history could not keep me away for long!

<Lorewalker Cho chuckles, holding his enormous belly.>

I have perhaps been taking part in too many celebratory feasts, now that the Vale has been cleansed. There is so much to celebrate in Pandaria!

Should you find any future evidence of titanic influence on the native species, I will be here, heartily enjoying the roast clefthoof.

 Quest Hand-in: Another excellent find from our most illustrious hero! I will immediately begin transcribing your heroic deeds!
Title: Axe and You Shall Receive

Description: {name}, your strength and leadership inspires awe in all of us!

The Valarjar are prepared to furnish you with a full set of armor to aid in the fight against the Burning Legion. Continue expanding your influence across the Broken Isles, and we may yet achieve victory.

 Quest Hand-in: The might of the Valarjar stands with you, <name>.
Title: The Pools of Youth

Description: North! Go north to the Pools of Youth. Get some of the water but be on your guard.

The mogu list this as a "high value" target. Kang Bramblestaff will meet you there if he has not already arrived by your side.

 Quest Hand-in: You... you found the pools! The waters do exist!Something is wrong though. I feel equal parts shadow and light swirling in this vial.
Title: A Ring Unbroken

Description: Our defeat at the Broken Shore was decisive. The Burning Legion has a foothold on Azeroth, and the best of our armies are retreating in tatters.

The elders of the Earthen Ring have called an emergency council near the heart of our world - the Maelstrom. {name}, your triumphs throughout Azeroth and Draenor are the stuff of legend. We need you more than ever.

Join me at the Maelstrom. Stormcaller Mylra will be flying there shortly - find her at Krasus' Landing here in Dalaran.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you, <name>. You saved me. You saved us all.I was... outmatched. My relationship with the elements has changed since the events on Draenor. I have some soul-searching to do. <name>, you must carry the Earthen Ring forward without me. You are the leader they need.
Title: Deeper into the Woods

Description: We need to go deeper into the forest. The witches are clearly up to something even worse than I'd imagined.

As much as I have a duty to return to Lady Lucille with Master Ashton, I also have a duty to find out more about this threat to our people, and stop it if I can.

Going further into the forest is not without risk, but I believe it is one worth taking.

 Quest Hand-in: By my ancestors' anchors that is a large army! At least it doesn't appear to be mobile yet. And the tree... Clearly it is the focus of their efforts.
Title: Ruins of Ammon

Description: These things seem to be everywhere and all at once!

Either this was an organized attack, or there are far more of them than we can even comprehend.

Regardless, this is bad for us... really, really bad.

{name}, I need you to travel to the Ruins of Ammon and find out what the situation is like over there.

If they need help, please try to lend a hand!

 Quest Hand-in: Seeing you here is like stumbling across an oasis in the desert, my friend!
Title: Dismantling the Opposition

Description: The Forsworn mobilize!

We cannot allow them to march.

Attune to Bron, share your power with him.

Between the three of us, we shall destroy this new centurion army!

 Quest Hand-in: Exhilarating! Bron grows stronger with your power.
Title: Temel, the Sin Herald

Description: <Before flying away, Echelon shouted an additional command.>

Expropriate Temel as well. He will know how to exploit the sinstone properly.

 Quest Hand-in: <Echelon eyes Temel suspiciously.>I never liked this runt.
Title: Too Many Irons in the Fire

Description: We must not head into battle prematurely. Before we go after Orgrim, we must first deal with his troops.

If we are to succeed in our mission of wiping out the Iron Horde from Talador, we need to start on these shores.

 Quest Hand-in: We will have fewer enemies to deal with at our backs. Lok'tar.
Title: Essence of the Iron Vanquisher

Description: Redeem your Essence of the Iron Vanquisher with Lady Liadrin to select a Vanquisher armament of your choice.

 Quest Hand-in: <name>, your courage and dedication has made Draenor a safer place. Take these armaments and go in the Light.
Title: The Princess Trapped

Description: My name is Myzrael.  I am a princess of the earth, and my captors, the giants, have trapped me deep beneath the Arathi Highlands.  These crystal shards are the only way I can speak with the surface world.

Please help me.  Allies of the giants, the Drywhisker kobolds, have a shard like this one in their Drywhisker Gorge, to the east.  To power the cluster, you must gather motes of Myzrael from the kobolds and apply them to it.

I beg you, {name}, aid me!

 Quest Hand-in: Ah!  You activated these shards.  Already I feel more myself!But alas, I am still far from free...
Title: Worldvein Rumors

Description: Gather intelligence to assist SI:7 in identifying the location of the Fluctuating Worldvein.

 Quest Hand-in: This is exactly the intelligence Mathias Shaw wanted me to watch out for, I will pass it over to him immediately. I am sure he will have a Mission waiting for you.
Title: Getting the Bladespire Tanked

Description: I'll not take another sip of that ill-smelling muck!  But it does give me an idea.

<Borgrim gets a twinkle in his eye.>

So here's the plan.  We know that the Bloodmaul practically live off of this swill.  But I wonder what their enemies, the Bladespire ogres, think of it?

{name}, I want you to take the rest of this rubbish and see if you can get the Bladespire ogres tanked.  You can find them by heading north from Bloodmaul Outpost through the ravine.

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, hahaha!  That's what I thought.  I guess ogre's will drink anything.Stupid, the lot of 'em!Well, I must say even though I didn't get my brew, you have given me a great start to my vacation.Tell you what... we have all sorts of stuff here we don't really need.  Can I offer you something?
Title: Strangers in a Strange Land

Description: Did we... did we reach Zereth Mortis? And are we walking on water?

What a wondrous place! At least, from what I can tell through this fog.

I think I can make out a structure in the distance. Perhaps we will find answers there.

 Quest Hand-in: I will not abide agents of the Jailer defiling this land!
Title: Steer Clear of the Beer Here

Description: Someone left some beer out up on the southern rise and now the sprites have developed a taste for our brew. They've been sneaking into town all morning, stealing whatever kegs they find.

Bring back what you can. A pandaren worker without brew is just... it won't be very productive. We need the men in good spirits.

 Quest Hand-in: The workers will love you for this!
Title: Chemically Compounded

Description: Now dat I have everything I need, I can finish dis project. My latest transmuation will be my finest yet!

But dis is not de place to test it. It could draw too much attention.

If you want to see it for yourself, little mixah, meet me to de north. Dere is a cave dere dat should be a safe spot for testing dis out.

 Quest Hand-in: This bag must have belonged to Zukashi. As you rummage through it, you see a slip of paper that appears to be torn.You grab the parchment and begin reading.
Title: Murder Was The Case That They Gave Me

Description: Here's the deal, kid, we've got a full-blown murder on our hands. Double homicide... Single horse... icide.

Worse yet, we're in Westfall. I could throw a rock behind me and hit a dozen hobos with motive enough to want to wipe these people (and horse) out.

Now I don't know who did this and I sure don't appreciate having to come to this dump to investigate the deaths of a couple of squatters, but I'll be damned if I don't find the perp. You want to help? Go talk to some bums. The hobo... knows.

 Quest Hand-in: Gnolls and murlocs? Horse poopy, pal! Gnolls and murlocs didn't kill these people. I've seen what gnolls and murlocs do to people that they kill and this... isn't it. Too pretty. Too... perfect.Furthermore, the Furlbrow's had been squatting on this farm for 5 years. No, whoever wiped them out had a reason. This is murder, plain and simple and we're gonna get to the bottom of it...
Title: Fine Dining

Description: In my living years, I was the greatest warrior of the swarm.

Help me regain my strength, and I shall show you.

I smell the salt sea nearby, and where you can find the sea, you will find briny clackers.

Bring me their tails. I must feast upon their flesh.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent. This shall give me the strength to vanquish my foes.
Title: Lakeside Landing

Description: When the trouble with the Venture Company started, I asked Marvin Wobblesprocket and his wife, Tamara, to take their flying machines east to River's Heart. I asked them to setup a small camp there so that we could use them as a relay to fly in supplies and survey the area.

They should have arrived by now and started setting up. River's Heart is near the center of the basin where the rivers converge. Search for Lakeshore Landing on the northeast shore. Marvin mentioned it would be the best spot.

 Quest Hand-in: So, Hemet sent you? We were just about to let him know that we've gotten things up and running here. Please forgive Marvin if he seems to be ignoring you, but he gets very absorbed in his work.
Title: To Stonard

Description: Regardless of whether you assist me within the temple, your people must be told of what is brewing here.

Southwest of the temple is the Horde town of Stonard. The orcs there wage war with the new human arrivals to the swamp, a raging conflict that I foresee only worsening.

It is not my role to interfere in mortal affairs, {name}. I simply ask you bring warning to your people of what lurks within the temple.

 Quest Hand-in: We have no time to send orcs to the temple, <name>. The humans come, and they are many. Stonard must be defended!
Title: Ze Gnomecorder

Description: Zese goblinz dizgust me. Zer filzy goblin technology iz inferior to anyzing gnomish, yet...

<Professor Xakxak sighs.>

It iz ze last piece of ze puzzle! Wizout ze filzy goblin technology ze gnomecorder cannot be built!

Venture eazt into ze "Skunkworks" and take from zem zer filzy goblin junk! You vill most likely find zem on goblin technicians.

<Professor Xakxak laughs mockingly.>

Goblin technician? Vut iz zat anyvay?

<Professor Xakxak shrugs.>

Zome kind of oxymoron?

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, ze junk haz arrived! Zit is ze last piece of ze puzzle! Now to zet it up! Standby, <name>!
Title: To Orgrimmar

Description: A darkness in me mind be keeping me from remembering what happened da day I named Sylvanas warchief.

Take me glaive and travel to da pyre where I was cremated in Orgrimmar.

Master Gadrin be packin' enough juju to call me to dat place.

Go, and I be seein' ya dere.

 Quest Hand-in: Vol'jin might be havin' confidence in me skill, but I asked some allies to come aid us. Dis not be an easy task. Talanji be da better choice for such a ritual, but I will do me best.
Title: In Her Clutch

Description: The crystal sings to the Klaxxi. They sense a paragon in the clutch, east of the tower.

Clutch-keepers are trying to pollute this one. The Klaxxi will not permit this.

Go and find the paragon. Place your hands on his chamber, and the Klaxxi will channel their whispers through you to break him free. Protect him if you can.

 Quest Hand-in: My slumber was interrupted by sudden dreams. Unspeakable nightmares.Then I awoke.The Klaxxi have spoken to me. I have my orders. There is much to be done.
Title: Allegiance of Kul Tiras

Description: It is time for her maiden voyage, {name}.

This aptly named vessel will carry us and her crew across the vast sea to Stormwind Harbor. There we will meet Anduin and I will seal the pact we made so many moons ago.

Kul Tiras will stand with the Alliance so long as I am Lord Admiral.

Thank you for your assistance in this endeavor.

 Quest Hand-in: I accept this gesture in the spirit in which it was made, <name>.The Kul Tirans have been valuable allies, and now we have a physical manifestation of that bond.I thank you for your continued support of the Alliance. We continue to grow with your aid.
Title: Growing the Farm II: The Broken Wagon

Description: Hey {name}. I've been looking at that wagon every day, day in and day out, since the day I moved in. Quite an eyesore, don't you think?

I heard in town that Fish Fellreed is quite handy with tools. She might be able to fix it up, and then we could turn that patch of land into a plot for farming.

Why don't you talk to her and see if she'd be willing to do the job?

 Quest Hand-in: You need my help fer somethin'? You came to the right gal!
Title: A Gift From the Six

Description: {name}, without you some of the Legion's strongest agents would still be roaming Azeroth, threatening to undermine all that we've accomplished in this war.

Such a deed merits more than mere recognition.

If you would accept it, we would like to formally reward your heroism in the face of such darkness with a portion of our power.

 Quest Hand-in: We hope the increased power to your weapon will prove useful on the Broken Shore and beyond.
Title: A Mile in My Shoes

Description: Oh, where have my manners gone? Technically, I suppose I am the host here.

Allow me to tell you a little bit about myself and my people before asking questions of you.

 Quest Hand-in: I suppose the best way to explain what a Lorewalker is all about is to show you...
Title: First Assault

Description: Now that we have had time to assess our enemies' weaknesses, it is time for us to deal the yaungol a direct blow.

Go and confront the Osul Sharphorn up the mesa to the west.

Let them know that we are here, and that we are not scared of their threats.

 Quest Hand-in: Well done, <name>. I hope you showed those cretins no mercy.
Title: Lumber for Lakeshire

Description: Magistrate Solomon requested a bundle of wood for his hearth. However, he's been too busy to come by and retrieve it.

If you wouldn't mind running it down to him at the town hall, I'm sure he'd appreciate it.

 Quest Hand-in: Thanks for delivering the lumber. I was going to go pick it up myself, but the townsfolk have been crying wolf all day.
Title: Put on Your Best Face for Loken

Description: Using the images you've captured, I've created everything you need for your overseer disguise kit. You'll make a fine iron dwarf, if I do say so myself.

Take the kit with you to Dun Argol, use it to disguise yourself, then go to the easternmost building on the broad middle tier of the city.

There, you should see a pedestal where the thane and overseers receive their orders from this Loken. Activate it while disguised and learn all you can from the communication.

 Quest Hand-in: Could it be that Loken isn't really exaggerating? The titans' stone and iron sons fighting against each other for control of the ancient city of Ulduar. This is madness, <name> and it could destroy our only chance to learn the true history of dwarvenkind!
Title: A Fighting Chance

Description: Blessed be the Light! I need your help!

On my way into Hillsbrad I noticed several families of adorable little deer. As I went out to pet one of the little fawns a ravenous mountain cat leapt out and killed it. I fled to Tarren Mill and swore to solve the plight of the hill fawn. Now, after many days of tinkering, I have created the hill fawn's salvation!

Take my wand into the fields to the west and use it to empower the wee hill fawns. Once empowered they will be able to fend for themselves!

 Quest Hand-in: WHAT!? No, don't tell me that, <name>! It can't be true! My... I... I would never...I won't give up, <class>. Just you wait and see. I will save those fawns!
Title: Chapter II: The Harvest

Description: I have seen a creature working with the ancient saplings, imbuing them with anger and hatred toward creatures unlike them.

Perhaps it is this botani who is responsible for the unusually aggressive nature of ancients here in Tangleheart.

Would killing this botani do us good? I fear I would be no match for it alone.

- Frenna

 Quest Hand-in: Ya took out the big nasty did ya? Yer sure to be causin' some real trouble out there!
Title: A Gift For Jogu

Description: Sometimes I feel sad for Jogu. He's the only jinyu around, and I don't think he has any friends. Other than his smelly bottle, of course.

You know what? I've got an idea. Farmer Yoon has a basket of craneberries inside his house, and a few apples as well. I'm sure you could bring them to the stillmaster in the Halfhill Market and get him to brew something special for Jogu.

 Quest Hand-in: <Jogu takes a long swig from the hooch.>That'sh it! I've got a new favorite drink. An' it'sh this one!You know what, <name>? You're alright. I mean it, man!
Title: Interesting Times

Description: {name}, I don't mean to alarm you, but we may be experiencing some... temporal disturbances.

Have you ever heard the phrase 'I hope the past doesn't come back to haunt you?'

Come visit me in the Valley of Spirits and we can speak more.

 Quest Hand-in: <name>, you're here. You must have received my letter.
Title: No One Here Gets Out Alive

Description: This farm is under lockdown! Nothing gets in and nothing gets out! We're still assessing the situation to try and figure out exactly what happened, but my theory is that the laborers ate the mushrooms and somehow mutated into hideous undead monsters. I mean, how else could this have happened? This is just a farm! We grow mushrooms here! And sludge! Yes, sludge!

Take a look around, {class}, because now that you're here you can't leave until this issue is resolved.

See for yourself!

 Quest Hand-in: As you can see, they're all monsters! Most of my guards died and the ones that managed to escape are now holding down the barricades, preventing any of these potentially dangerous creatures from getting out.We need your help!
Title: Interesting Times

Description: {name}, I don't mean to alarm you, but we may be experiencing some... temporal disturbances.

Have you ever heard the phrase 'I hope the past doesn't come back to haunt you?'

Come visit me in the Stormwind Royal Library and we can speak more.

 Quest Hand-in: <name>, you're here. You must have received my letter.
Title: When There's a Will, There's a Way

Description: The Oculus appears to have fallen to the Burning Legion and is heavily shielded. We will need to figure out a way to get you inside. 

I suspect your champions can help us out quite a bit.

 Quest Hand-in: Your champions have done well. I think I should be able to get you into the Oculus now.
Title: The Twilight Overlook

Description: The dragon they're speaking of is Abyssion, {name}.  It's not going to be easy to get the fragment off of him.

Meet with Mylra again.  She is operating nearby at the Twilight Overlook.

She will tell you what our next move will be.

 Quest Hand-in: So we're going to have to take on Abyssion to get the fragment?  This operation just got a whole lot more difficult all of a sudden.
Title: The Full Prophecy

Description: Dat snake of a prophet, Zul. I never trusted him. Always felt like he was never telling us de whole prophecy.

Enter de Temple of dis "Prophet" and see if he recorded any of his visions.

We must learn of what our prey intends, before our real hunt may begin.

 Quest Hand-in: Zul has fallen so low as to wish to raise Dazar himself? Can Zul even be called a Zandalari anymore?
Title: Mending Old Wounds

Description: You'd better think twice before setting foot in Ratchet, {name}!  Word's been getting around of your dirty deeds.

You're in luck though, a ship just arrived with many wounded from an encounter with the Bloodsail Buccaneers.  This is your chance to prove you're not a complete scoundrel.  Lend us a hand by bringing linen cloth for bandages and empty vials for potions.

 Quest Hand-in: I'm happy you're seeing the error of your ways, <name>.  Keep the supplies coming; we're not going to forget about you so easily!
Title: Rest and Relaxation

Description: Every adventurer should rest when exhaustion sets in - and there is no finer place to get rest and relaxation than at the Lion's Pride Inn!

My best friend, Innkeeper Farley, runs the Lion's Pride. If you tell him I sent you, he may give you the special discounted rates on food and drink.

To find the Lion's Pride Inn, travel south along the road from here -- you can't miss it!

 Quest Hand-in: Rest and relaxation for the tired and cold -- that's our motto! Please, take a seat by the fire and rest your weary bones.Would you like to try a sampling of some of our fine food and drink?
Title: Your Second Engineering Work Order

Description: Place another work order with my assistant. Once it is complete, we will leave it out here for you to collect.

 Quest Hand-in: We look forward to serving you again.
Title: The Fastest Way to His Heart

Description: Oh, girl! You're never going to guess who's out on the oil platform to the north.

<Izzy shakes her head sadly at you.>

Chip's out there, and he's working for the Trade Prince. That cold-hearted snake dropped you like a bad habit and now he's working for the other team. I even heard he's going out with that tramp, Candy Cane!

I don't know about you, but if he was my ex, I'd rip his still-beating heart out of his chest.

 Quest Hand-in: He got just what he deserved. There, there, don't cry. You'll find someone else that'll treat you right.Here, let me take that... we wouldn't want people to think that you're crazy.
Title: Dyed in the Fur

Description: I can't believe they tried to physically rip the magic out of the material!

It seems we were never in danger of my secrets falling into the wrong hands after all. Better safe than dead...

In return for your help, I will share with you my methods of fusing magic to cloth.

Flytrap Ichor is very rare in this region, but I do have a bit in reserve. Take this woven fur and dip it in the ichor here. You will see for yourself what all of the fuss is about.

 Quest Hand-in: There, you're on the path to becoming a true Hexweave tailor.Do not share the secrets I've shown you here with anyone.
Title: Repair and Restore

Description: You've already attuned several mirrors without incident. I do believe it's time you try your hand at repairing them instead.

It's quite easy once you've found the fragments, but there are a few things of note to keep in mind. 

Repaired mirrors are fragile and unpredictable. They often break with a single use, and it's never a guarantee that using one will translocate you somewhere safe. 

Here's a few shards to get you started. 

Restore the mirror to working order and see where it leads.

 Quest Hand-in: You found a boon? Well done! One never truly knows what awaits beyond the mirror.
Title: Your Fortune Awaits You...

Description: "Your fortune awaits you outside Palemane Rock."

The fortune Sayge handed you feels slightly warm to the touch.  Grasping it firmly, you see an image of the Palemane Rock of Mulgore.  Focusing closer in on the image, you see a tree stump that sits close to the cave entrance.


 Quest Hand-in: A quick search of the tree stump reveals a lockbox from within it!  It would seem that you have found your fortune!
Title: Boar Training: Riplash

Description: This boar is at home in the rocky plains of Gorgrond, so it will be easier to train. As with other beasts, we will begin the training in the place it calls home.

Test your boar against the great predator Riplash, a raptor known to hunt boars.

 Quest Hand-in: A mighty kill. Your beast will need to rest now.
Title: Manastorm Mystique

Description: The Manastorms are... unique. 

While their romance can be explosive, the spark that fanned that flame was quite small. Oddly, Millhouse is having an uncharacteristic crisis of confidence. 

We need you to help bring them together. May the titans have mercy on us all...

 Quest Hand-in: You kept events as they should be, and helped two people find love.That is good. We should focus on the positives here. Not on the mayhem they will cause in the future.
Title: Rustbolt Requisitions: Storm Silver Ore

Description: I've received an urgent request from Tinkmaster Overspark.

These supplies are needed!

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you, <name>. Your contribution has been logged in our records for posterity to appreciate!
Title: The Point of No Return

Description: One of our rangers reported seeing Suna up the hill to the northwest.

I am relieved to find her safe. I had feared what she would do in her grief.

Would you go speak to her on my behalf?

Take this totem with you. If you encounter any danger along the way, you may find it useful.

 Quest Hand-in: What? She was possessed by the Sha of Hatred?No. NO!Despite our differences, she was one of us. Today, the Shado-Pan has lost a dear sister.Her death will not be in vain. I will not rest until I have defeated the Sha of Hatred!Suna, I swear this to you!
Title: The New You

Description: A new outfit? You don't say! There's quite a buzz surrounding your party. Everyone who's anyone on the island is going to be there.

Well, happy shopping. Swindle Street has some of the best bargains anywhere!

 Quest Hand-in: Oh yeah, you're going to look hot! You're going to replace the Trade Prince any day now at the rate you're going!I can't wait to be a kept man!Let me have all that stuff and I'll help you get into it right before the party.
Title: A Very Special Kind of Fuel

Description: All Legion constructs, including the Fel Hammer, are powered by souls. If we are going to take the command center to Niskara, we are going to need some very powerful souls, indeed!

You are a very creative person, {name}. I am certain that you will find a way to get what we need from the right sorts of creatures.

 Quest Hand-in: Of course. Like all Legion constructs, the Fel Hammer is powered by souls. You have collected some of the most powerful souls around.They should be enough to take us anywhere you want to go.
Title: Don't Look Them in the Eyes

Description: Keep your head down, {name}. No need to draw unwanted attention.

Looks like the orcs are piling that balloon up with some type of ore from the mine. Get in there and take the ore from the orcs. Bring me back whatever you manage to grab and I'll ship it off to the professor for examination.

Before you go, a word of advice: you can avoid the Krom'gar pretty easily in there as (1) they're dumb as dirt and (2) they can't see anything if they're carrying ore. Of course, you need to kill them to get their ore.

 Quest Hand-in: Not too much trouble, I hope. With these samples we should be able to figure out what they plan to do with the ore and the big bomb.
Title: The Coffer of Promise

Description: I'm not quite certain what ta expect 'ere, so stay on yer toes, eh?

These codes should reveal the coffer's true purpose, and present us with the tools to thwart Deathwing's efforts in Uldum fer good!

Stand back!

 Quest Hand-in: Of course! I had a hunch this is what we'd find.Had no idea about the organic transformations, though, I must admit.There's more to this old relic than I'd dared to hope.
Title: Test Flight: The Zephyrium Capacitorium

Description: I built an amazing device, the Zephyrium Capacitorium, and I'm sure it'll work perfectly, but... do you want to help me test it?

There's plenty of hazard pay!

Speak with my twin over there, Rally. Good luck, {name}. Come back after your experiment.  Or... if that's not possible due to sustained injuries, your next of kin can report to collect your pay.

 Quest Hand-in: Wow, you made it!  And not a single bruise or compound fracture!  See, I told you everything would work out!Here's your pay, <name>, though I factored in medical expenses and you don't need those... so that's a bonus for you!
Title: Understanding the Language of Death

Description: Take the book and follow the path leading up to the barracks. Once inside the barracks take the staircase down to the prison. At the prison you will find Inquisitor Hallard and our mayor, Godfrey. I believe Godfrey might be the missing piece of this puzzle and Hallard the man to put it all together.

Go now!

 Quest Hand-in: Perhaps, with proper motivation, Godfrey will tell us what he knows about the tome.<Hallard turns to Mayor Godfrey.>Isn't that right, mayor?
Title: Rock Meet Dynamite

Description: Thanks for your help out there, but we have to ask another favor from you.

These elementals must be coming from somewhere in the mine and we need you to locate that source. 

You seem more than capable of handling yourself in there, but just for extra security I am going to send you with some of Prim's special dynamite. It has an extra kick from the Azerite dust that you gathered.

Get in. Find the source. Put a stop to these elementals.

 Quest Hand-in: A trogg? Hmmm... He may have eaten quite a bit of Azerite to be able to cause all this.With him gone, now we can clear out the remaining creatures here and get back to digging! Thank you for your help.
Title: The Magical Kingdom of Dalaran

Description: Hello, {name}. You may or may not be aware that we Kirin Tor moved our city here to Northrend.

No longer does Dalaran sit under its protective dome on the shores of Lordamere Lake. Now the city magically floats above the Crystalsong Forest.

We believe you to be ready for your journey to the city. Speak with me again and I will cast a spell of teleportation to transport you there.

When you arrive, seek out Archmage Celindra and give her my signet as proof that we spoke.

 Quest Hand-in: Welcome to Dalaran.I'll see to it that the ring is returned.
Title: The Sunfury Garrison

Description: After Prince Kael'thas's forces destroyed the village and imprisoned the archmage in the Violet Tower, they withdrew to Sunfury Hold to the northeast. The very men who destroyed our village and slew our fellows toast their 'amazing victory' while we are helpless to avenge the fallen.

We must not allow these crimes to go unanswered! Be the instrument of our vengeance, {name}. Go to Sunfury Hold and claim the lives of those responsible for this crime.

 Quest Hand-in: What you've done this day can never bring back the fallen, but perhaps it can help soothe their spirits. Although, truth be told, no amount of blood can quench my anger over the actions of Kael'thas.
Title: Another One Bites the Dust

Description: The Alliance have planted themselves off our southern coast and continue to pepper our ground forces with cannon fire. Let us see how great their siege is without such support.

Board the enemy vessels and destroy their reserve ammunition. This will take the teeth out of their bite.

 Quest Hand-in: Ah! Look at them burn. These new Alliance craft require more to destroy them permanently however. I am sure they will have those fires out in a day or two.
Title: How to Maim Your Dragon

Description: <You sling the gore-spattered gryphon corpse over your shoulder, its wings dragging to the ground.>

<Highland Black Drakes roost just southwest of the Crucible of Carnage, along a ring of low mountain peaks.>

<If you drop the gryphon corpse there, a drake is sure to start feeding. With its guard down, you should be able to attack it until it is weak enough to mount and fly.>

 Quest Hand-in: That was an impressive aerial display, <name>, but I wish it had come at a better time.Narkrall is a great warrior, but he's also an impatient fool. He's about to get himself killed ... and we're about to lose one of our most important weapons in the battle for the Highlands!
Title: Arakkoa Exodus

Description: I assume you're familiar with the arakkoa, commander? Great, flying birdfolk. Extremely territorial.

Some, however, have withered wings - a disease, maybe. They seem to be outcast from arakkoa society. You find them now and then, squatting in forgotten ruins or peddling trinkets on the roadside.

It seems the Iron Horde has incited the arakkoa by moving into their lands, and the outcasts are fleeing in droves.

We should make contact with these outcasts - they could have valuable information.

 Quest Hand-in: <The arakkoa merchant looks you up and down.>Well-equipped, aren't we? Azik is betting you are someone of importance to your people.Come closer, friend. Speak with me for just a moment.
Title: Elder Charms of Good Fortune

Description: Greetings, {name}. I am privileged to offer you an excellent opportunity. Through the centuries, we've honed a method by which the very laws of chance themselves can be bent. With an Elder Charm of Good Fortune, valuable artifacts will find their way into your hands more frequently.

 Quest Hand-in: May the stars smile upon you, <name>.
Title: The Secret of the Fungus

Description: I'm beginning to sense a strong... connection... between the fungus and the creatures that inhabit it. There are certain mushrooms that are stronger than others.

I believe if I had some samples of these I could use them, track the source of this foul fungus and... deal with it.

 Quest Hand-in: Sadly, I'm growing used to the smell of these spores. In fact, they smell quite pleasant now. Perhaps if I eat these it will speed up our work here...
Title: Agamaggan

Description: I sense a being of immense power within these twisted thorns, {name}. The entire area has come alive at its presence.

It must be the Spirit of Agamaggan! He was one of the first and most powerful beings to ever live - the Quilboar worship him fervently.

All the vines you see across the land are a result of his blood; of his sacrifice to save Azeroth in the War of the Ancients.

If there's any being that could steer the Quilboar towards their noble roots, it would be him.

You must seek him out.

 Quest Hand-in: <The Spirit of Agamaggan looks at you. An ancient voice echoes inside your head.>I've been waiting for you to come here.
Title: The Dragon Isles Await

Description: Wondrous news, my friend! The Dragon Isles are awakening!

My people left our lands dormant in the wake of the Sundering. But now, at long last, we feel the call to home.

While the Isles hold many wonders, there are perils as well. We will require the aid of our mortal allies in order to reclaim our legacy.

Meet me in Stormwind. I must present the Aspects' invitation to the Alliance.

 Quest Hand-in: The Aspects' invitation extends to you as well, friend.
Title: Taming the Wilds

Description: As a hunter, you need a trustworthy beast at your side... or else these quilboar will slaughter you.

When you're ready, I'll teach you how to tame such a beast. Then you must find one to be your loyal companion.

 Quest Hand-in: You've got a loyal companion by your side. Take good care of them, and they'll take care of you.
Title: The Imp Mother's Gift

Description: While we have already given you what power we can, we would like to present to you a... cosmetic... upgrade to your artifact.

On behalf of the Council of Six, Dalaran, and Azeroth, we thank you again, {name}.

 Quest Hand-in: It is small compensation for the deed you have accomplished, I hope it is enough.
Title: A Letter From Nadja

Description: The letter is addressed to Nadja's contact Dimwiddle in Darkhaven. It is clearly sealed with Nadja's mark. It is certainly of great import, you should make sure the letter is delivered.

 Quest Hand-in: Uh, what can Dimwiddle do for you? Oh, a letter... <Dimwiddle sees Nadja's mark and his eyes go wide> yes, thank you I have been awaiting that letter. It's from my aunt <Dimwiddle winks at you> she has been ill. I will make sure to tell everyone you helped deliver important letters!
Title: Cub's First Toy

Description: The winterspring cub plays with a small tuft of fur from a large animal, batting the discarded hair about. While your cub looks like it's enjoying the new game, you wonder if it might get more enjoyment from a proper cat toy.

With a little bit of leather from a yeti pelt and some feathers from crazed moonkin, you could make a respectable toy. You'll need a hide from the yeti in the Ice Thistle Hills southeast of Everlook and feathers from the moonkin at the Hidden Grove or Owl Wing Thicket.

 Quest Hand-in: Your Wintersrping cub seems thrilled with its new toy, but there's no telling how well it will survive the cub's enthusiasm.
Title: Safety in Numbers

Description: I've taught you all that is practical for now.

It is time we joined with the other survivors.  The others mentioned that King Greymane and his royal guard are just south of here.

We should go there and seek safety in numbers.

 Quest Hand-in: You've done well in coming here.  If we Gilneans stick together we might yet defeat this terrible enemy.
Title: Harnessing Their Power

Description: Ol' Grommash Hellscream found a way to weaponize the gronn. Vol'jin wants to know how.

Travel to the Iron Front and kill one of them big beasties, then bring back its war harness. You might be needin' help.

 Quest Hand-in: You lugged that thing all the way back here? You must got a bit of gronn-blood yourself, commander!We send this to the goblins at Orgrimmar to take a look at.
Title: A Safer Place

Description: <The murloc seems to be in rough shape. Perhaps it would be safer with your allies in Newhome.>

 Quest Hand-in: <Mrrl seems at home in his new spot and his family has also taken up refuge here. It is unlikely you will be able to remove this new murloc infestation.>
Title: Cataloging Horror

Description: I... I need to bring the evidence of this insanity back to my flight. It may destroy us, but my people need to know what happened here. 

I borrowed some cataloging cameras from Tellywin. Can you join me in documenting these atrocities?

I can provide you with a similar protection to that which I gave in the vault. I will leave any fighting to you; I cannot bring myself to cause any more suffering than my flight has already wrought. 

Let us be done with this as swiftly as possible.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you. To know that this was occurring before my flight's fall...  sickens me to my core. I will take these photographs to our leaders. If we cannot learn from our history, we are doomed to repeat it.
Title: Deepflayer Dust

Description: Why, I just got another letter from my good friend Mistie. She's been looking for interesting ingredient ideas for her smelly concoctions!

A while ago, the kithguards took down a deepflayer near Loamm. I noticed a peculiar dust it shed when it perished. It had a unique aroma to it, and I'm sure Mistie would love to experiment with something like that!

Could you gather some from the deepflayers near Loamm, then bring it to Miss Mistie? You'll be doing us a favor, too!

 Quest Hand-in: Oh yes, this'll do nicely! Can you smell that with your nose? It's very fragrant!
Title: Mothallus!

Description: The esteemed Journeyman Chu would appear to have created a monster. It is silken death with wings.

Mothallus.

You have already faced its brood. Now we ask that you help us face the creature itself.

Please, {class}, venture into the pit and rifle the bait. This will bring the beast to you.

Our mothfighters will assist you as you need, though silk tends to stick to them more than most so you may need to help them, should they become overwhelmed.

 Quest Hand-in: We are pursuing perfection in our art and in ourselves. Along the way many mistakes will be made.I'm sure by tomorrow this field will be swimming with more mistakes. Still, we thank you for your help.
Title: The Emerald Nightmare: Il'gynoth

Description: Our Champions have discovered the source of the corruption.  The Emerald Dream has been infested by the Legion and if we don't put our efforts towards stopping them, this will be only the beginning of the corruption.  It must be stopped here.

 Quest Hand-in: Were you able to overcome the Emerald Nightmare?
Title: The Dreadblades

Description: I can promise ya a safe journey to Eliza's position, but once we're there... well, we both know there be no guarantees.

The plan is simple. We'll take the Crimson Veil as close as we can get her without being seen and disembark from there.

Once we're ashore, we'll board the Horizon's Edge, bribe her mutinous crew to hand it over, and hunt down Eliza and her legendary blades wherever she may be.

Just say the word when yer ready.

 Quest Hand-in: You did fine work today, lad.
Title: Rough Edges

Description: I apologize for not meeting you in person, {name}, but this method seemed most timely.

Our war against the Primalists has always troubled our queen, but recently she has grown increasingly upset. Something weighs on her. I know how heavy the burdens of the mind can become.

She left Valdrakken some time ago, saying she needed to find a quiet place to think, but... I am concerned.

Please--seek her out, and make sure she is all right. She does not need to know I sent you.

 Quest Hand-in: It grieves me to see Vyranoth in such a dark place, but I still have hope that we will stand together as we once did.I have warned her about Iridikron. That is all I can do.The rest is up to her.
Title: Your First Inscription Work Order

Description: Now that the scribe's quarters are complete, we can start producing war paints for you. When you have the ingredients, please speak with my assistant to start the first work order.

 Quest Hand-in: Let me unpack that for you.I should let you know - while we managed to expedite this one, future work orders will take longer.
Title: They Sent Assassins

Description: Have you ever seen a goblin, {name}? They're wretched little monsters that love only two things: gold and themselves.

The Blackrock orcs have enlisted the aid of goblin assassins to kill our soldiers. If you look to the field in the north you can barely make out their silhouettes, sneaking about in the grass.

I need you to head out there and kill every goblin that you see. They need to learn that nobody messes with the Alliance!

 Quest Hand-in: That will teach those monsters! They'll think twice before taking another mercenary job for orcs.
Title: In Sprite Of Everything

Description: The sprites of Shan'ze Dao have always been capricious tricksters, but now they have fallen under the mogu's influence.

Even as we speak, they gather under a new leader.

We cannot allow this to happen.

Their mischievous pranks were one thing, but united, their dark magic is too powerful and too dangerous to comprehend.

Take out their leader before it is too late.

 Quest Hand-in: Good work, <name>.The wood sprites may look harmless, but that's what makes them so dangerous.
Title: One Lich's Trash...

Description: It is said that one person's trash, is another's treasure. When it comes to relics, the adage is particularly true.

The House of Rituals is notoriously secretive, which means any knowledge we can glean from them will be all the sweeter.

If we sift through their detritus, I'm sure there are all sorts of treasures we will find.

 Quest Hand-in: This is simply marvelous! This will provide some excellent insight into the history of Margrave Sin'dane... and possibly something we can use to our own benefit later on.
Title: Reach West

Description: You and your drakes seem to enjoy your adventures in Forbidden Reach, don't you? 

I heard the windstreams in the western Forbidden Reach are especially good today. Why don't you try a few courses out there?

 Quest Hand-in: You both look you had quite a workout. Way to go!
Title: A Hand in the Dark

Description: Imagine being trapped in a world you didn't know existed--a reality unbeknownst to even yourself.

Thoughts, fears, and dark desires cloud the mind, coupled with irresistible temptation.

So many are lost to the darkness, unable to resist these temptations, but not all.

Do what you can to preserve those that fight against the darkness. We mustn't allow them to fall.

 Quest Hand-in: The withering whispers lie in wait. Remain vigilant, <name>.
Title: Path of Ascension: Kleia

Description: Artemede has been personally training Kleia, running her through combat meditations and drills.

She has come far, and she is prepared to take on another trial in the Path of Ascension.

Return to the coliseum and guide her as her tactician so that she may reach victory.

 Quest Hand-in: As we expected. Kleia's strength continues to grow.
Title: Unwelcome Memories

Description: The botani in the Everbloom Wilds are doin' some sorta foul magic to create these plant... well... zombies, basically.

I've seen what happens with armies o' mindless slaves. The Lich King...

<Delvar's eyes close.>

No matter. We cannae let this escalate any further. I heard o' a particularly nasty one they've just made... let's kill it and see what makes it tick.

 Quest Hand-in: I'll be takin' a close look at this... thing. We can't have a repeat o' Northrend.
Title: Soul in Hand

Description: My instincts were correct. Whatever dark magic binds these souls together also keeps them more or less coherent.

It will take time, but we will find out what this thing knows. My interrogation will require use of the helm, but rest assured I will return it to your care.

Let's bring our prize to the Lord Admiral.

 Quest Hand-in: It seems your search was a success.Enough rest. There's much to be done.
Title: Judgment of the Black Prince

Description: Now. To the final stage of my plan. Time to fulfil your grand purpose.

Using your newfound powers, it is time to bring this war to its conclusion. Destroy Garrosh Hellscream. Your people demand it, and future generations will sing your praises as the harbinger for the glorious new world we shall build together.

I have no reward to offer you. I have already done everything in my power to ensure that you succeed. You are on your own.

End Hellscream's reign.

 Quest Hand-in: <Wrathion is FURIOUS. News of Hellscream's defeat and King Wrynn's gesture of peace must've already reached the black dragon's ears.>
Title: Assault by Air

Description: I've got some boys suited and ready for their drops inside of Ymirheim. I could use you to see them there safely.

Inside the walls, the vrykul have set up some kind of automated spear guns that have been tearing up our transports. We had our engineers install a Suppression Turret to shut down those spear guns - just fire a round near any gun and the smoke should block its sight and clog its gears.

Hop on the turret and see to it that all my boys make it to their drops in one piece.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent work, soldier. We could use more able bodies like you around here - stop by another day if the operation hasn't wrapped up.
Title: Broker's Bounty: Valdinar the Curseborn

Description: A spike-armored Mawsworn named Valdinar the Curseborn is hampering the efforts of the Cartel in Korthia.

Anyone who exterminates this evil will be rewarded. 

Use caution. Valdinar is a powerful foe. You may require several allies to defeat him.

 Quest Hand-in: Thanks to you, Valdinar the Curseborn will no longer hinder Cartel Xy here in Korthia. You have my personal thanks as well, Maw Walker. I see many great things in our future.Please accept this reward as a token of our gratitude.
Title: Unto Dust Thou Shalt Return
