Description: <You take the second anointed blade in hand and feel the power of both swords course through you.>

<There is but one thing left to do. As the mysterious, hooded woman explained, to put an end to the Scarlet Crusade, you must thrust both blades into the corpse of High Inquisitor Whitemane.>

 Quest Hand-in: With Whitemane gone for good, the Scarlet Crusade is finished. It's just a matter of sweeping up the refuse.Thank you, <name>. Not just for myself, but for everyone opposed to mindless hatred and bigotry.And, thank you for these two new blades. Anointed anew in her blood, they should serve me well as I take the fight to Scholomance and deal with Darkmaster Gandling.I bid you adieu for now.
Title: Takes One to Know One

Description: While we should never miss an opportunity to strike out against the Alliance, we mustn't forget about the Scourge.

We won't have the numbers here to make a proper assault in the glacier for weeks, but that won't keep us from learning all we can know about their defenses.

I have asked our resident death knight to advise you in this effort. After all, who better knows this enemy than they?

Allow me to introduce Koltira Deathweaver.


 Quest Hand-in: <Koltira looks you up and down.>I hope for your sake that you're up to this, <class>.
Title: Rubble Trouble

Description: If you want to get a boulder in there, you can use my own patented Boulder-in-a-Box! Normally I'd just sell you one up front, but I'm fresh out of materials.

Earth elementals have been popping up on the peak directly south of town. They're a good source of rubble. If you bring me back a good amount, I'll pay you for the restock, and I'll throw in a Boulder-in-a-Box absolutely free!

 Quest Hand-in: Looks like a good amount! Here's your pay, as promised...
Title: Shadow Priest Sarvis

Description: Are you still here, {name}?  You know, I'm only a deathguard.  I don't have many tasks I can hand out to passers-by like you.

I'd recommend that you talk to Shadow Priest Sarvis.  I remember, he helped me get on my feet after I was plucked out of that tomb.  I'm sure he'll do the same for you.

You'll find him just inside the chapel, here on the west side of town.

 Quest Hand-in: Greetings, <name>.I see you wield a weapon.  Can you fight?
Title: Just Ask Alice

Description: Mr. P is sick, mister. Won't you help him? All you have to do is find his hat and batteries and he'll be all better. I'd go get them myself, but I can't leave Mr. P alone!

His hat was stolen by the meanies in the Venture Co. over at the water wheel and his batteries are hidden around Windshear Crag. You'll just have to look real hard for those!

Would you kindly bring Mr. P's stuff back so he can teach those baddies in the Horde a lesson?

 Quest Hand-in: <Alice claps excitedly.>Mr. P you're gonna be ok! Hooray!<Alice expertly places all of the parts you collected into Big Papa.>Oh, Mr. P! I knew it!
Title: Wayward Winds

Description: Bah! Work together, she says? 

But... if the Gleamfisher believes there is a chance we can help the other tribes... we must try. 

For the wind spirit Kraunot to acknowledge us, we will first have to tend to his element. The nearby wind elementals have been agitated ever since the land began to awaken.

While I inspect this boat you two made, you go and fight to dismantle them, then bring me their restless motes. That should bring some calm back to the area.

 Quest Hand-in: I will tend to these motes, so they dissipate harmlessly. Kraunot will be pleased.
Title: The Maw

Description: {name}, your arrival has set Maldraxxus ablaze. If you have any honor, you will do as I ask.

I believe I know where our answers may lie. The baron preceding Draka was lost to the Maw. It is said you have entered that dark abyss... and returned.

If the baron survived, he may know our next course of action.

You came here from Oribos. Return there, and see if you can find a way back to the Maw.

 Quest Hand-in: What news from Maldraxxus, <name>?
Title: The King's Path

Description: Now that I have seen the Broken Shore and the terror of the Burning Legion first hand, my eyes have been opened to the truth.

I speak not of the unfathomable evil of the enemy, but of the bravery and sacrifice that such evil brings about in the hearts of our people.

My father once told me that every king must carry the weight of his own crown. Mine has never felt heavier than it does at this very moment...

Please take me to the place where my father died, so that I may honor his sacrifice.

 Quest Hand-in: You have helped me more than I can say, <name>. For that, you will always have my thanks.
Title: Precious Little Left

Description: I have not been able to leave the safety of my guardians to search, but there are three tomes of great importance to me and mine. 

They contain secrets and cantrips that the Nightborne must NOT obtain. 

<Lothrius raises his hand to your forehead, cementing the names of three tomes into your mind> 

If we cannot best them, we must preserve all we can. Hurry, {name}.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank the Mother Moon... They survived!
Title: The Nighthold: High Botanist Tel'arn

Description: The Nightborne are adept in more than one kind of magic, and we will likely face formidable foes inside the walls of the Nighthold. Their strongest mages and warriors must fall before we can hope to face Gul'dan.

 Quest Hand-in: Were you able to overcome the The Nighthold?
Title: Whispers on the Winds

Description: Hello, {name}. It's been a while, and I wish we had more time to catch up.

But you see, I've just had a rather enlightening... no, make that foreboding... yes, a foreboding conversation with an old friend.

Sometimes a revelation can be both, after all.

I really must tell you of what I've learned.

 Quest Hand-in: Your reaction is understandable. I dare say I felt the same.
Title: Together, We Ride

Description: The four covenants are working together here along with the automa. 

Unfortunately, some of our soldiers have been separated or wounded and are unable to return back here.

If you could aid them, that would help tremendously.

 Quest Hand-in: The fewer losses we suffer here, the longer we can hold the line.
Title: The Yorgen Worgen

Description: My kinsmen at Raven Hill are concerned with curing the feral worgen in these forests. The condition itself cannot be lifted, but sanity can be restored to those not too far gone.

While most here have proven beyond help, we keep an eye out for those that retain vestiges of their minds... attachments to their old lives.

I've seen a lone worgen lurking the Yorgen Farmstead, digging in a pile of dirt between the buildings...could you check out that pile and see if he's left anything?

 Quest Hand-in: Sounds like a close call! But he ran off without harming you further...He might be still fighting it. Master Harris must know!
Title: Blood of Hir'eek

Description: Spooky chantin' in the next room can only mean one thing: someone's askin' for the ol' what-fer!

I'd give ya a hand but I gotta drink a couple-a potions before I'm back on me feet.

Take out that blood witch and I bet the magic'll dissipate.

 Quest Hand-in: Always thought witches dinnae wear clothes when ritualisin'. And where was 'er broomstick?
Title: The Knowledge of Black Rook

Description: You have honored me with your help and now I wish to return those favors to you. On that pedestal there is all my research. Take it with you and learn from it so you may carry on my legacy.

Thank you again, {name}.

 Quest Hand-in: This is... this is amazing! There are techniques in here I'd never imagined trying. Good work, <name>!
Title: Turning the Earth

Description: Despite their corruption and madness, the Winterfall barely cling to their shamanic powers. It disturbs me to see the power of the elements used by them to harm my tribe and other innocents.

We will turn their totems against them! Take my own totem with you into Winterfall Village. Use its powers on the Winterfall's totems from afar, and the fury of the earth will be unleashed on all nearby!

Needless to say... keep a safe distance!

 Quest Hand-in: May the Winterfall never threaten the Timbermaw again. Thank you, <name>.
Title: Buzzkill

Description: Some nefarious no-goodnik is tampering with my Buzzboxes!

I've been trying to get the Buzzbox network back online since we were able to drive the Horde out of Darkshore, but I'm getting no reading from boxes 456, 627, 111, and 854!  I'd be willing to bet that some stragglers from the Bilgewater Cartel are to blame!

See if you can get those Buzzboxes back online, will you? We'll need their readings if we ever want to permanently fix the corruption problem here.

 Quest Hand-in: You did it! The Buzzbox network is back online!Now, if I can only remember the passcode to this thing we'll be in business!
Title: What's Your Specialty?

Description: Hey, {name}! Have you decided on a combat specialization yet?

Since you're a {class}, you already know about the different classes available to adventurers. But did you know that there are also areas of specialization within each class?

Choosing a specialization is an important decision. Your specialty determines your combat role in a party, as well as the kinds of weapons and abilities that you will use.

Let's go speak with Thega Graveblade to learn more about specializations!

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent choice of specialization, <name>.Feel free to test out your new abilities on the training dummies outside on the upper level of the building.
Title: Plague is Thicker Than Water

Description: Come closer, my apprentice... I have a mission of dire import!

A necromancer came to our house recently, sent by the lich Margrave Sin'dane! He seemed so polite, always eager to lend a hand in my lady's most volatile creations.

But I grew wise, my apprentice. The way he skulked around, prodding for our most sensitive experiments...

He was trying to steal our slimes! I know it!

You should admonish him quite harshly. Show that no harm will come to our friends!

 Quest Hand-in: Our slimes will be safe, my dear apprentice!
Title: Seeking the Truth

Description: Okay, now down to business.

The Bloodmaul have unearthed some monstrous artifact I've heard them call the Soulgrinder. It's a nasty bit o' sorcery that their chief uses to give himself incredible magical power, but it comes at the cost of needing to feed upon souls to maintain it. Every day, more and more corpses pile up from the slaves killed to maintain it.

We need to go find Borgal and get rid of this Soulgrinder!

 Quest Hand-in: Secluded cave across the lava, check.Creepy piles o' bones, check.Okay, this looks like the place. We're gonna have to watch ourselves, I'll bet Borgal isn't here alone.
Title: Twilight Skies

Description: I just got word from Orgrimmar that the Warchief wants us to move out. We wouldn't have been ready if it wasn't for your help!

The plan is for the air fleet to take off immediately, and for the navy to follow close behind. Hellscream will be accompanying the air fleet and specifically requested that you come along with us.

No time to delay! Go to the Southern Rocketway Terminus here in Azshara, and check in with Friz Groundspin. I'll bring the zeppelin around to pick you up.

 Quest Hand-in: Another <class> for the Highlands? Here, sign this indemnification waiver...
Title: Together We Are the Horde!

Description: What began with a simple feast led to a battle against an ancient evil seeking to consume the world.

My kind of day!

Your deeds have helped secure an alliance between Orgrimmar and Highmountain. These tauren will make a valuable addition to the Horde.

The Warchief will be pleased.

 Quest Hand-in: It seems we have secured a new ally. You have done well.The Highmountain tauren are famed for their prowess in battle. I look forward to the pummeling they will unleash upon the Alliance.
Title: Da Voodoo: Stormer Heart

Description: With voodoo, our troops might have a chance at beating back the Grimtotem assault. With that said, I need several ingredients if I am to invoke black magic.

The first ingredient on my list is a heart from a cliff stormer. The beasts have nearly been hunted to extinction, but a few still exist around these parts. Find one and recover its beating heart!

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent. Once I have everything I need I will mix it all together and unleash the voodoo! Woe unto our enemies!
Title: Favor Amongst the Brotherhood, Lava Core

Description: The Thorium Brotherhood sympathizes with your plight, {race}. This is why Lokthos has been empowered to bargain.

Offer 1 Lava Core and you shall be granted favor amongst the Brotherhood.

 Quest Hand-in: Your offering has been accepted. Favor you have gained. Continue and you shall be allowed access to the ancient trades.
Title: Never Hunt Alone

Description: Prustaga is almost certainly on her way to the Temple of Storms, which is where I imbued Titanstrike with the Thunderspark.

If my deductions are correct, she'll attempt to reverse the process and infuse the spark into herself, thus attaining the godlike power she craves!

Hopefully Thorim isn't off cavorting with his hounds again. If Prustaga has the local vrykul on her side, things may get... complicated.

 Quest Hand-in: Brann will hardly believe his ears when I tell him what happened. What an adventure!
Title: The Broken Crown

Description: Our friends have returned from the Sepulcher of the First Ones with a familiar face.

Anduin... What terrible things he has endured. 

But as difficult and painful as it is, we must uncover what he knows. The Jailer has blocked our way within the Sepulcher, and we risk falling victim to Domination ourselves if we blindly follow.

He is our best hope.

 Quest Hand-in: The suffering he endured... This will be difficult to overcome.
Title: Sneaking Out

Description: I'm grounded indefinitely! Doesn't my Ohn know I'm turning sixteen next spring? I should be able to leave when I want to.

You look like you could help me out. I do have an escape plan: by channeling these totems, I'll concentrate the air and create quite a stir. But I can't go around placing them, because I'm under maximum wind watch. Even Togo won't help me.

But with your help... Please! I promise I'll show you something cool.

 Quest Hand-in: Whew, thank you! Freedom!
Title: Agility Training: Run Like Hell!

Description: Before we go any further, we're going to have to get you into shape.

Devotion to the Old Gods is not going to save you when some emerald dragon comes chasing after you.  You need to be fleet of foot, if you catch my drift.

Enough said.  We'll summon your trainer... your job is to run away from him without leaving this camp.

Go!

 Quest Hand-in: Oh.  You're still alive.Not bad.
Title: Against Overwhelming Odds

Description: Though you puny mortals have come to a truce, I have heard rumor that some of you still harbor grudges.

If you gather some friends, I know a place you can show the other side who is truly superior.

And to make it interesting, if you are successful I have a prize for you.

 Quest Hand-in: Well done, <class>. Well done indeed.
Title: Putting the Gob in Gob Squad

Description: Yo! We gotta get the rest of the Gob Squad back if we wanna fix the A.F.M.O.D.!

So, our mech got trashed. It was rough. The rest of the Gob Squad are hidin' out there, waiting for word when it's safe.

Take this tracker. It'll tell ya when you're getting close to one of the squad. When you get real close, you should see 'em.

That'll tell any of the squad nearby that it's safe to come outta hidin' and come back here.

With the right goblins and parts, we'll be killing Alliance in no time!

 Quest Hand-in: I gotta tell ya, it feels good to get the gang back.
Title: Bombs, Away

Description: By the sea's foamy beard, what a blast!

They've brought goblins, and if there's one thing I know about goblins it's that they like to blow things up.

I saw a few of them carrying large bombs, and I presume that they are going to blow up the town. I would like to keep the town, so how about you head out there and steal as many of those explosives as you can find? After that, let's blow up their demolishers and stop this infernal bombardment!

 Quest Hand-in: These look particularly nasty. I'm glad they aren't blowing up in our faces.
Title: Guaranteed Delivery

Description: <The broker appears to be from Cartel Ve. Perhaps they were once an associate of Ve'nari.

Clutched in their hand is a list of items and a containment orb.

Finishing this broker's task and sending the items back to Ve'nari will surely earn you some compensation.>

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent, <name>. I wondered what had become of that particular associate. It pleases me to know that their demise was not a complete loss.
Title: A Personal Summons

Description: <An unfamiliar feeling wells up from deep within you, flooding your mind with thoughts and images.>

Hear my words, {name}.

Our world finds itself in the grip of a terrible crisis.

I call upon you to lend your aid in this desperate hour.

I am Naraat.

Seek me out at once, and your calling shall be revealed.

I await you at the Eastern Earthshrine in Stormwind City.

 Quest Hand-in: May your sense of honor and duty serve Azeroth well, <class>.
Title: Nath'raxas Hold: Rescue Mission

Description: Your forces are adequately equipped for the mission to save my people from Nath'raxas. Order your champions to bolster my assault, and together we will dismantle the Legion's stranglehold over the region.

 Quest Hand-in: We were a great civilization, once. But, now?... Thank you, <name>. Our combined forces freed many from Nath'raxas. With fewer slaves, and the Army of the Light on their doorstep, the Legion's influence over this region will be greatly diminished.
Title: Pterrible Ptorment

Description: The Zandalari treat their skyscreamer pets as little more than scuttling vermin, bending them to their will with violence and torment.

I can hear one writhing in pain at their hands.

Find the tormented skyscreamer within Za'Tual and help it break free of its captors.

 Quest Hand-in: It what?! It killed its master? Wonderful. These skyscreamers  have more fight in them than I realized. Thank you for helping free the beast, <race> - it is one less threat to the Horde, and one more for the Zandalari.
Title: Return to Sinfall

Description: {name}, we must get the medallion back to Sinfall as soon as possible. 

We saw how fierce Mateo's forces were, just imagine what destruction Denathrius will bring if we linger around.

I will return to Absolution Crypt in a moment. With all the work you've done, I can begin to resume my duties.

My first order of business will be to recruit a new sinkeeper. Oh how I dread interviews...

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent work, <name>.With the Curator's medallion in hand, we are one step closer to victory.
Title: Oozing with Opportunity

Description: They called me mad! As a matter of fact, they still do!

Ah, but none of them have the mental acuity of Doctor James Mortimus of the very much in-tact House of Plagues, nor his handsome smile! Fools!

With the catalyst you have so kindly provided, dear...whatever you are...certainly not a kyrian...

I digress!

We shall get to whatever it is you wanted in a moment, for now is the time of SCIENCE! Come, come, let me show you the wondrous fruits of my labors!

 Quest Hand-in: It appears you were successful. Well done, as always.
Title: The Farseer

Description: The Thunderlord warleader... {name}, you have to stop him.

He went to attack Drek'Thar at the Pool of Visions to the northwest!

 Quest Hand-in: Wolf Home is saved, but I sense a stronger enemy just over the horizon.
Title: Legacy of the Mad Mage

Description: <This rather large jewel has an inscription etched on its base:

Property of Mardivas. If found please return to my laboratory. 

Perhaps this laboratory can still be found somewhere?>

 Quest Hand-in: <The ancient lock clicks open, revealing the contents within.>
Title: The Red Market

Description: You came with de Princess Talanji?

I need a hand with a most unsavory task. Crimson cultists have made demselves a market for blood magic. Dis is bad, mon. Dis is very bad indeed.

I need you to go down dese steps and bring back any evidence you can of blood practices. And destroy their chalice. Big chalice. Don't forget de chalice.

 Quest Hand-in: Blood magic is an infection. It spreads like a disease if not purged.
Title: Ship Logs

Description: We've got mogu and Zandalari working together on the Breath of Pa'ku. They've got records on the Zandalari fleet's ships.

We've been making educated guesses regarding the Zandalari fleet. It's time to upgrade our intel.

Go in there and get the naval records from anyone on board that ship.

Oh, and take these jet boots. You'll need them to reach the boat if you're planting bombs on the hull.

 Quest Hand-in: Perfect! I'll get these documents back to Halford. We'll be able to coordinate future attacks with this.
Title: Masking For a Friend

Description: The Outriggers have fought some pretty tough monsters and Horde savages aren't so much different. The Blight Specialists they brought weren't especially tough, but they were the most dangerous.

Kill a few of them and bring back their face masks. Okri can work his mechanical wizardry and build us better masks of our own in case any Horde scum dare show their blight-spreading faces around here again.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you, mainlander. I'm sure Okri can make us some top-notch gear with these.
Title: Ember Court Ambassador

Description: Expanding your influence is quite simple.

Find someone. Ask them what they want. Give it to them.

Congratulations. You now have influence with them.

If we wish to engage the other realms and win them over to our side, we must do the same on a larger scale.

So go to the other realms. Give them what they want. Expand our influence.

 Quest Hand-in: Our contacts in the other realms have already reported positive chatter surrounding your actions there.<Lady Ilinca smiles.>Our influence grows.
Title: The High Commander's Vote

Description: If we're to pass a resolution for war, the high council's vote needs to be unanimous.

I'm certain High Commander Kamses will give us his vote once he hears about what happened at Orsis.

Please speak to him in Ramkahen and make sure that's the case.  I must make preparations in case our plan fails.

 Quest Hand-in: No need to fill me in on the events in Orsis, <name>.I've heard about them already.  And about you.  Any enemy of Al'Akir is a friend of mine.
Title: Finding Tahli

Description: After eons of tranquility, the Maw's influence has brought sorrow to Zereth Mortis. One of our acolytes, Tahli, has found it particularly difficult to process recent events. She left some time ago and has not returned. 

Will you check on her? She was last seen heading toward the ruins that are buried under the sands.

 Quest Hand-in: Even now, this place is beautiful.
Title: Blessing of Zim'Rhuk

Description: <Zim'Rhuk is impressed and frustrated that once more you seem to have dodged his guardians. At least for now.>

<Place the offerings before him and he will grant you his blessing again.>

 Quest Hand-in: <Zim'Rhuk forces an image into your mind of one of his guardians squishing you beneath its foot. Perhaps you should attempt to appease Zim'Rhuk with more offerings.>
Title: Return with the Bad News

Description: The greatmother will need to know, {name}.

Will you please return to Taunka'le? Tell her that I will be following shortly.

 Quest Hand-in: What word do you bring from Highmesa?<You explain what you know and give the greatmother the bad news concerning Longrunner Bristlehorn.>My... my grandson!<The greatmother fights to keep control of her emotions.>He died an honorable death like a true taunka!You were the last to be with him, <name>, so he shall always be a part of you. I give you my thanks for completing his last wishes.
Title: WANTED: Gorgebeak

Description: Thief! Pilferer! Menace!

The insidious menace known as Gorgebeak threatens our harvest of ambrosi for tribute to our great Archon. She must be stopped!

If any are willing to take on this foul fowl, I have tracked her nest to the western edges of Firstborne's Bounty. Proof of her demise shall be amply rewarded.

--Gerdus

 Quest Hand-in: Our harvest is saved! Oh thank you, brave adventurer, our tribute may be saved yet!
Title: Memories

Description: Thank you for listening to me, young one. I have a favor to ask. 

Don't worry. No more stories.

When we left this place, I left a... time capsule of sorts. Would you... would you be able to retrieve it for me? We left it at the bottom of the Ruby Life Shrine, hidden behind one of the pillars.

I hid it with a sigil. If you activate it, you should see my time capsule.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you, young one, you have given me a lot to think about. It seems like I put this in the time capsule. I don't think I have much use for it anymore, maybe it's useful to you?
Title: Thalyssra's Abode

Description: While you were busy in the city I reached a roadblock in my withered research. 

I feel I am close to overcoming this barrier, but I'm afraid I cannot do so without some more advanced tools.

I hid among my possessions an item called an Arcane Amplifier. It does precisely what its name entails.

It is more than likely that the Magistrix ordered my estate dismantled. If the Amplifier remains, it will be in fragments.

Recover the whole, if you can.

 Quest Hand-in: How lucky we are that it could be recovered... thank you.
Title: A Stitch in Time

Description: Hm...I don't know that I've ever been to this time, before.

I suppose I should explain myself. My name is Delormi, and I'm the last remaining member of the Synchronous Tailors.

We make sure the fabric of time stays, well, mended. But I've found a number of new tears cropping up.

In fact, I believe that's why I've arrived here in this time. Perhaps you could assist me in tracking them down and repairing them?

 Quest Hand-in: And that takes care of those, although...Something's still wrong...
Title: A Cooling Trail

Description: <The amulet burns hot in your hand. The magic that runs through it tugs slightly at your grip.

Perhaps the enchantment spoken of by Bolvar can now be used to find Mograine.>

 Quest Hand-in: <Darion is trapped within the cage. He appears unconscious.>
Title: Speak with our Quartermaster

Description: {name}, the Frostwolf Quartermaster is looking for recruits, for tasks that lead into the mines of Alterac Valley.  Speak with him; he will tell you more.

Follow the road west into the bunker, then take the west exit and you'll find our quartermaster.

 Quest Hand-in: Hail, <name>!  It is good to see a <class> like yourself, eager to do his part for the Horde.  Speak with me again, for I have vital tasks for you...
Title: An Unfortunate Event

Description: <You have no means of identifying the corpse, but the clothing appears to be that of an imperial guard from Zuldazar.

A quick search of the area reveals a trail of blood that heads off to the west. Perhaps if you follow it you can discover the cause of death.>

 Quest Hand-in: You do not look like one of de prisoners. I... I could use your help.
Title: The Quartermaster

Description: {name}, our quartermaster charged me to direct new recruits to him.  He needs supplies from caches stored in the mines of Alterac, and he'll probably send you to get them.

Follow the road.  You'll find our quartermaster to the west.

 Quest Hand-in: It's good to see fresh troops here, <name>, but with a little luck you'll get into some action and won't be fresh for long!Speak with me again.  I have tasks I must discuss with you....
Title: Aspect Power

Description: The Mother Oathstone is an ancient gift bestowed to our flights by the Titans. If what we have learned is true, I might be able to reactivate it and in doing so restore our aspectral powers.

Though we are unsure of the outcome, if this has the slightest chance of working I must attempt it.

{name}, I would appreciate if you would join me in this.

 Quest Hand-in: What happened, <name>? Where is Alexstrasza?
Title: Convention at the Legerdemain

Description: Can you believe da horde has outlawed cannibalism...it just ain't right I tell ya!  I guess I should keep me mind on me work when we gots an order to fill.

Arille Azuregaze at the Legerdemain Lounge has many a guest a'comin to his place, mon.  You gots to be providin' some Northern Stew and a Jug of Wine from the cheese shop in central Dalaran.

Bring the wine and stew to Arille.

 Quest Hand-in: My guests should find this acceptable.  Just don't tell them it came from Awilo.
Title: Fear No Evil

Description: Have you embraced the Holy Light yet, brother? It is through the Holy Light that we are saved! It is through the Holy Light that I am able to heal these overly demanding soldiers! And it is through the Holy Light that you will be able to venture out into the field to the north and rescue our fallen brothers!

Take this prayer book with you into the field and cast the Light's healing touch on the injured.

 Quest Hand-in: I think you now understand the power of the Light. The Light giveth hope, brother and the Light taketh from the darkness! BLESSED BE THE LIGHT!
Title: Trial by Demonfire

Description: We are out of time. I have reports that a pitlord has come to Meredil. 

I have dispatched a strike force. We cannot let this demon flank our army here, nor can we let him find Shal'Aran. It is time to temper these recruits in a real battle.

Join our forces in Meredil, engage the demon, and help us ensure this new army of ours is not lost in its first conflict.

 Quest Hand-in: Well done. Sometimes a single victory is enough to bring an army together. With time, these recruits shall train others, and we can grow our army to many times this size.
Title: More Beads for Salfa

Description: You've certainly earned my trust, {name}, but you may need to continue to earn the trust of my untrusting tribe.  There is something you can do to earn that trust.

The Winterfall are known to carry spirit beads to ward against foul spirits.  These beads have clearly failed in their purpose, as the Winterfall themselves are the agents of corruption.  Bring to me these spirit beads from fallen Winterfall furbolgs; for every set of five you bring me, you will earn recognition amongst the Timbermaw.

 Quest Hand-in: Once again, you prove your honor to us!  I will make sure that your deeds are known amongst my kind.Remember to bring any of the Winterfall's beads you find to me.  For each set you continue to bring to me, I will speak on your behalf to the tribe.
Title: Potent Protection

Description: Here ya go, I got them onions bundled up nicely for ya.

Give my regards to Miss Waycrest, will ya? Her allies are welcome on my farm anytime.

 Quest Hand-in: The coven is vulnerable to onions!?  I remember my nan used to tell stories about them warding off evil, but I never thought to take it literally!This is quite the discovery!
Title: Peace of Mind

Description: We are a forward post, charged with monitoring potential adversaries. Once the Alliance launches its Desolace campaign, our work here will ensure that there are no surprises.

Recently, one of our scouts was caught and sacrificed by the Burning Blade at their stronghold to the west. Since then, we've been assaulted with threats and taunts from a Burning Blade wretch named Kohor.

Their days here are numbered, but I will pay handsomely for that one to be silenced now!

 Quest Hand-in: It is done.Captain Pentigast should be able to sleep in peace now that Kohor's threats have been silenced.
Title: A Wealth of Whelp Snacks

Description: Agapanthus says there are more snack orders ready to be retrieved, but we both have our hands full.

Would you run out and collect snacks while we tend the whelps?

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you for bringing in more snacks. This will tide them over for now.
Title: Arm the Wards!

Description: We've succeeded in reactivating the crystal wards around the sanctum, but why stop there?  We'll build defenses around the other structures, but the Wretched are stubborn and continue to steal power from the crystal wards.

Hunt them down and get the mana remnants they carry.  Use the remnants to energize the sanctum wards; the safety of our operation depends on it.

 Quest Hand-in: Good work, <name>.  The wards are slowly regaining their power.  Sun's Reach will be ours in no time!
Title: Arming the Army

Description: The recent battles have greatly depleted our supplies, and we will need arms for our new Valarjar. 

The kvaldir have an abundance of weapons, armor, and other spoils from their raiding stockpiled in stolen crates. 

Confiscate whatever you can!

 Quest Hand-in: Good. These will be invaluable in the coming battles.
Title: Meet with Avaros Dawnglaive

Description: You should make your way to Orgrimmar as soon as you can, {name}. Avaros Dawnglaive has sent word that he wishes to speak with you about a matter of importance to the Horde. Look for him at The Barracks in the Valley of Honor.

 Quest Hand-in: The Horde will soon have need of your skills, <name>.
Title: Kill the Shadow Council!

Description: What!  Those guys are Shadow Council?!

{name}, you have to go back in there and waste them!  I want you to take out their leader and as many of their executioners and summoners as you can.

After you're done with that, report back to Advisor Faila at Stonebreaker Hold.

Good luck, {class}!

 Quest Hand-in: That is unfortunate news!  But, of course, I made the right choice in sending you out there to help Neftis.  The last thing that we need is the Shadow Council establishing a strong point right on our doorstep!<name>, you've earned yourself something nice.  Go ahead, take your pick.
Title: Every Day I'm Smugglin'

Description: Hey! Wanna make some quick gold?

See, I had a mishap a few weeks ago with a shipment. Too much grog, dark seas, sudden rocks. You know, that old story.

Anyway, my cargo's been floating out there and no one will get it back for me. Can you believe it? You bring my cargo back and I'll pay you a generous recovery fee.

We got a deal? Great!

Oh, uh, watch out for the sharks. Did I forget to mention the sharks?

 Quest Hand-in: Hey thanks! Bit damp but still good.
Title: The Nighthold: Gul'dan

Description: Gul'dan believed that the Legion was the destiny of the orcs, and has not paused in his brutal pursuit. Now, at last, the time has come to end his demonic crusade, and dispense justice for all.

 Quest Hand-in: Were you able to overcome the The Nighthold?
Title: Knocked for a Loop

Description: While you're focused on murlocs...

Many murlocs are known to wear jewelry to attract a mate. I'm willing to bet that we can use some of the same jewels they use.

Collect some of their jewelry and bring it back to me. The wetter, the better!

 Quest Hand-in: Oh yes! There are some fine looking jewels here. Let's just scratch the goop off, and...
Title: By the Sea, Nevermore

Description: The Klaxxi'va have spoken to me, outsider. The paragon is hidden in the Briny Muck only, he is not so hidden anymore.

The lizard men surround him. He cannot fall into their scaley hands.

You will find him; you will awaken him. Do not return without him!

If you do this the Klaxxi will be pleased with us. 

 Quest Hand-in: What... what sort of creature are you?How have you awoken me?
Title: Vote of Confidence

Description: I will endeavor to protect my son until the votes are cast.

Coryn Stelleris is a predator even among the nobility. It does not surprise me that he should stoop to such depths to ensure his own success.

Tell Ly'leth that she has my support. Unequivocally.

You may also choose to tell her that Coryn Stelleris will hurt her, if she gives him a chance.

Be careful.

 Quest Hand-in: I know of Coryn. We will not underestimate his venom, rest assured.Thank you for helping Aurore. She is a dear friend of mine.
Title: Friend of the Exarchs

Description: Only three members remain of the Exarch Council, but we are all deeply indebted to you. The vote is unanimous: Your Alliance will have our full support on Draenor.

We are also going to place a draenei representative under your direct command. Three potential candidates are here in the courtyard. Speak to them and choose who you want - we will dispatch him or her immediately to your garrison!

 Quest Hand-in: An excellent choice! We'll send your pick directly to your garrison to help with any missions you encounter.Now, about those supplies you requested...
Title: Fight Fire and Water and Air with...

Description: Did you hear the man going on with his incessant yelling while you were up there? That's Haethen Kaul, their leader.

It's a well known fact that he's gone insane from the power he's drawing from their bound elementals. Unfortunately, it makes him nigh invincible.

If you're to fight him, you'll first have to kill each of the elementals, gaining their wards in the process. That should protect you from Haethen's magic.

Well, most of it anyway.

 Quest Hand-in: An excellent display of <class> prowess.I believe that a reward is in order. Something appropriate for a powerful man such as yourself.
Title: Urgent Care

Description: Excellent timing, {name}.

Kelsey Steelspark has been sending communications to the capital cities looking for aid.

Mekkatorque's condition is quite dire and time is of the essence.

Hurry to Boralus Harbor, she will be watching for you.

 Quest Hand-in: You are just in time.
Title: Whispers of the Djinn

Description: This brazier is obviously magical, but it seems impervious to your attempts to invoke its power.  If only you had a Tol'vir Heiroglyphic keystone to help decipher the engravings on the side.

 Quest Hand-in: It appears as if this particular brazier has trapped a minor djinn, and freeing him would certainly bring a reward.  Right?
Title: No Bull

Description: Twinbraid's patrols always throw us right into the thick of danger. If it's not Horde ambushes, it's a quilboar hit-and-run.

The problem is them lousy landquaker kodos. Big walkin' walls of fur, shakin' the ground... We can't see or hear an ambush creepin' up on our backside.

Go scare 'em off from our patrol, here. Killing a few should drive the herd south and out of what's left of me hair.

 Quest Hand-in: I thought you might be responsible for them clouds of dust I saw to the east. Nice work! Them bulls ain't sissies.
Title: It Starts in the Sewers

Description: Compared to the rest of the city, this part of the sewers is relatively calm. This is good - we can extract more Sunreavers in peace than we can in war.

Find as many citizens as you can. Tell them that it is not safe here, that they must leave the city at once.

And try to stay clear of the Silver Covenant. We don't want to cause a scene if we can avoid it. Not yet, anyhow.

 Quest Hand-in: Let's press on.
Title: Have They No Shame?

Description: Archmage Berinand loaned me his research on the Arcanomicron, some sort of map that Malygos is trying to assemble.

I made the mistake of discussing it with a group of Horde adventurers and now it's gone!

It must have been them. Please, recover the book.

 Quest Hand-in: You found it!? Yes, yes, it's all here.Please, take this with my gratitude.
Title: Untold Truths

Description: We are here by order of Varimathras! The mission of the Shadowstalkers is a simple one: spy. Well, spy with a little assassination on the side.

One of my best field agents has gone missing. I haven't heard from him in days, which has left me fearing the worst. No, not death! Death would be ideal. I fear he may have gone rogue... turned traitor even.

His last known location was northern Mightstone Quarry. He was gathering intelligence on the Nerubians. Find him.

He better be dead...

 Quest Hand-in: It doesn't get much deader than this... Strangely, the Nerubians did not devour the corpse.After careful examination you see that Luther's death was self inflicted - deadly poison. Smart. Nerubians won't come near this toxic corpse.You notice that Luther is holding a journal.
Title: Knickknack Takeback

Description: Nisha told me you came here in search of an exile. One named Rakera? 

We don't know her, but we might be able to help you find her. 

You help us, and we help you. Deal?

We survive by scavenging. We trade what we find, but the sethrak that raided our burrows made away with many of our knickknacks.    

I always knew they were ruthless, but never imagined they'd be so greedy.

Take back what the sethrak have taken, and I'll see that you are provided safe passage through the dunes.

 Quest Hand-in: You're more resourceful than you look.
Title: Plug the Geysers

Description: There are several geysers nearby that will be erupting soon.

Unfortunately, the elements in this area are not stable enough to handle the force of the eruptions.

I need someone to plug the geysers while I use the elements to redirect the pressure to a safer area of Nazjatar.

Take this sealant and use it to plug the geysers while I work to restore the elemental balance.

 Quest Hand-in: Good work, <name>. Thanks to your help sealing the geysers, I've been able to stabilize the elements and redirect the pressure to a safer location.
Title: Captain Sanders' Hidden Treasure

Description: Searching through the barrel you discover another piece of parchment.  This one reads:  Now from this here barrel, face ye North.  Straight as the crow flies, keep ye walkin' till you see the empty jug next to the lone windmill on the sea bluffs.  If ye poke around that jug, ye just might find what you're lookin' for.

 Quest Hand-in: You're on your way to the jackpot, treasure seeker!
Title: Chapter III: Ritual of the Charred

Description: I have seen a strange ritual performed by ancients. They step into fire, burning the leaves from their branches and charring their bark.

I call it the Ritual of the Charred. If we want to weaken the ancients, we can get rid of them before they become even stronger.

- Frenna

 Quest Hand-in: You saw 'em burn off their own leaves? That'd be like me cutting off my cute-as-a-button pigtails!
Title: Captain Conrad

Description: Looks like there's couple o' guards posted by this hut. If I had ta guess, Captain Conrad'll be in there.

Somethin' still feels off about this place, though. Why don't ya go on ahead and I'll hang here in case things go south fast?

I got yer back, {name}.

 Quest Hand-in: I was wondering when you would come for me. I must admit that I am not as captive as you might believe. Quite to the contrary, in fact.
Title: Overcoming the Trial

Description: These new footpads can give Pelagos the edge he may need to defeat Kalisthene.

Return to the Path, {name}. Equip Pelagos with these footpads and overcome your opponent.

It may take a few tries, but all trials do.

Go in service, and in glory!

 Quest Hand-in: More trials lie ahead, <name>. Your future experience with the Path of Ascension is yours to guide!
Title: Healing the Lake

Description: Thank goodness, I think it'll work!  I have an agent for you to spread at Silverline Lake to the south.  It will neutralize the effects of the irradiated ship's power crystal that fell there.

Swim out and scatter the neutralizing agent near it.  Don't worry, you won't be exposed long enough to become irradiated.

 Quest Hand-in: From what you describe, the neutralizing agent worked! I just wish that I knew how long it will last; we really need to remove that power crystal from the lake entirely.Thank you, <name>! I will tell Tedon to try the neutralizing agent on one of the captured beasts at once.
Title: Imperator's Rise: Imperator Mar'gok

Description: The conditions are ripe for a decisive attack against the Highmaul, commander. Will you engage?

Descended from a long line of sorcerers, Imperator Mar'gok is the grand Imperator of Highmaul. He is both cunning and brutal, and allied himself with the Iron Horde when he recognized what it would be to oppose them.

Travel to Highmaul and defeat Imperator Mar'gok. Without their leader, the Ogre Empire will descend into chaos for many years.

 Quest Hand-in: A brilliant victory, commander! Imperator Mar'gok be defeated. You indeed be a champion of da Horde!
Title: Until Death Do Us Part

Description: Filthy scum! Leaves me for his damn crusade. Because "the Light is the most important thing we have against the threats the undead pose."

Well, what about his children?! What about ME?! Night after night I sat patiently waiting for him... always second to his blasted duty!

Well, witness what "justice" brings you, {name}! He's dead and I'm bearing the very thing he was trying to stop!

Take this piece of junk and put it on his tomb at the Sepulcher. I want nothing to do with it anymore... or him!

 Quest Hand-in: You place the worthless pendant on the grave, and the gemstone within the setting seems to dull noticeably.As you stand to leave, you look down at the pendant; it lies lifelessly over the hands of the relief sculpted into the top of the coffin. Your thoughts are interrupted by a stiff, cool breeze passing over the Sepulcher. For a moment everything around you is silent.
Title: No Accounting for Taste

Description: <The machine buzzes for a few moments  before Wizbang's voice breaks through.>

Interesting! The source of this corruption definitely came from something external--no surprises there--but it appears that in this case they've been eating something foul. A large mammal probably. Most likely a bear.

Search the beach for a bear carcass for me. Slightly east of there would make the most sense, on the inland side of the beach. Bring me the sample back at town.

 Quest Hand-in: This definitely looks like the stuff they were eating. Let me take a closer peek...
Title: To Light the Way

Description: Helya must think her challenge unwinnable. We will show her different.

I am unsure what she did, but Helya has weakened you somehow. I have seen similar effects on my shieldmaidens, and now they are trapped by Helya's minions.

I may know a way, however. The Kvaldir ships carry special lanterns bound to this place to navigate through the fog. It is said that the light of these lanterns can release bonds of the spirit.

There is a kvaldir ship nearby. See if you can find one there.

 Quest Hand-in: This appears to be what we need. Now, we can prepare for the battle ahead.
Title: Watch Your Step

Description: This is somewhat simple and somewhat not simple. All the way up there are Energy Conduits. Rather like this one right here one might say! Indeed, I do say.

Now for you. You must use my jump pads to ascend the pinnacle, and you must touch all of the conduits you see along the way. When you get to me at the top, you should be all juicy with energy, because really that's the only way to be.

And be sure to keep moving or you're likely to be sent for quite a trip!

 Quest Hand-in: It is in this moment that most of my apprentices wonder if there was a logical purpose to storing the energy for my portal in those conduits so that it has to be collected in such a fashion.Of course there's a purpose! I wish to study your behavior... your strategies, your mistakes, your frustrations, your triumphs. Those are the entire point of these trials.Now, more. More trials! Doesn't that sound exciting?! Of course it does.
Title: Spike the Punch

Description: Step one in causing a mutiny? Make it seem like leadership is incompetent.

If the captain wants to sell our souls to the Ashvanes, we're going to need to get dirty.

I hate to say it... but we've got to muck up the booze.

That'll make the crew angry at the captain before you can even blink.

 Quest Hand-in: That is not what I...You know what? Sure. That works.
Title: Explorers' League Document (4 of 6)

Description: The document bears the Explorers' League crest and seems to detail transport routes utilized by the league into and out of Loch Modan. Sooty smudges lead you to believe it was likely stolen by the Dark Iron spies in the area.

You recall mention of missing documents at the Explorers' League building in Thelsamar.

 Quest Hand-in: Ug, I can't believe they got their hands on our transport routes - that was just asking for trouble!!Thank you for getting this back to us before they were able to do much with it! You probably saved us a lot of heartache. Please accept some coin as a reward for your efforts.
Title: Hit Medicine

Description: Our warriors are fighting to keep the yaungol at bay in the Kun-Lai Pass to the northwest.

Take this liniment.  It is a powerful medicine that has been passed down in my family over the generations.

Use the dit da jow to heal the injured warriors if you do not have healing powers of your own to use on them.

 Quest Hand-in: You have my thanks, <name>. You have shown great honor through your actions.I hope that my family's dit da jow was of some use to you.
Title: Merda Stronghoof

Description: Are you ready for a real measure of your prowess, {race}?

Merda Stronghoof has made camp at da place dey call Karnum's Glade in the Cenarion Wildlands of Desolace. Fighting a trainer as powerful as her will put your skills to the test, eh?

 Quest Hand-in: The resilience of Desolace cannot compare to your own desire to grow. I applaud your efforts.
Title: Desecrator Annihilator

Description: My mother was a hero. She deserves peace and rest, not this... enslavement! None of our heroes do.

They must pay for this. And our ancestors must rest once more with their weapons, with honor. Take the weapons back from those desecrators!

 Quest Hand-in: This is a good start. I can use these weapons to free their owners... I hope.
Title: Master vs. Commander

Description: I've been doing a little digging - or whatever you call digging in naval terms. Snorkeling?

Gul'dan has sent his most powerful flagship on a scouting mission to the four corners of Draenor. He is mapping out all the oceanic ley-line conjunctions. This is information that I could use to upgrade your ring... But in Gul'dan's hands, it could be catastrophic.

Scramble the fleet, {name}! Hunt down his infamous flagship, "The Master's Call," and steal that map before they complete their mission. Hurry!

 Quest Hand-in: Yes yes, this is it. This map is invaluable. By triangulating these oceanic junction points we can graph out Draenor's key ley lines. Hmmm... there's where I built my tower, of course. Energy also seems to converge near Karabor. And here, by the throne of elements.Oh very good, we'll be able to put this to use very soon.
Title: Atul'Aman

Description: Jakra'zet and his troops attacked while we were away. 

Serrik fought well, but it wasn't enough. The keys are gone, and it's only a matter of time before the barrier is broken.

Your friends have already given chase. 

Jakra'zet must not be allowed to resurrect Mythrax the Unraveler. He must be stopped before it's too late!

We don't have much time. 

Meet me at Atul'Aman! We must catch up with Kaja and Rakera and stop the ritual!

 Quest Hand-in: We must hurry. Your friends are already inside!
Title: Understanding the Shadowlands

Description: As I sat upon the Frozen Throne all those years, {name}, I could peer into the Shadowlands. Brief glimpses, clouded and uncertain. Sights both wondrous and terrible.

We must work together to make sense of what has happened. To prevent the Maw from consuming all of reality.

Whatever Sylvanas and the Jailer want, we must stop them. But we cannot do so alone.

Perhaps Tal-Inara can put us on the path to find answers.

 Quest Hand-in: Your path and that of the Purpose are becoming one.
Title: The Storm King's Vengeance

Description: My people have been decimated by the Lich King. The Scourge now use the corpses of storm giants to create mindless flesh giants, or worse, stitched together aberrations like Thrym.

I will stop at nothing to see them all driven from this world. We will work together to destroy the Scourge that threaten Zul'Drak.

We will kill them all: Navarius, Algar and Thrym!

When you are ready, let me know and we will begin our destructive journey.

 Quest Hand-in: Unbelievable! This will be a story for the ages, <name>! One man rode upon the head of the king of storm giants and decimated an entire Scourge army!And I was there to see it all happen...
Title: The Lost Spirits

Description: In the attack on the quarry, the shaman and craftsmen working here were slain. The violence threw the spirit world into utter chaos and we'll be unable to guide the ancestors home unless we find a way to soothe the spirits of the murdered.

The aggressors themselves pay no heed to the spirits, but their companions, the beryl hounds, sense the spirits and hold them in thrall.

Kill the beryl hounds, and using the raw energy left behind, break the imprisonment of the spirits of the innocent.

 Quest Hand-in: I can sense the upheaval in the spirit world beginning to calm. You have done well, <name>. The spirits of the ancestors are fortunate to have your help in this time of need.
Title: The Demons Below

Description: Something, someone, intended us to never awaken. I sense their presence is still here in the barrow.

<Koda takes a moment to stand.>

My body is weak from deep slumber.

If you would aid us, clear our barrow of any enemies.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent. The chambers are clear. Very impressive, <class>.
Title: Takin' Down the Beast

Description: Bad bat gon' get smashed! Need ammo! Ammo in Dredhollow!

 Quest Hand-in: Haha! Smash time!
Title: Tainted Arcane Sliver

Description: You've found an odd sliver of crystallized mana on the corpse of the tainted arcane wraith.  The sliver is different than others you may have seen in that it is as dark and sinister-looking as the wraith you looted it from.  Just holding it gives you a sense of unnatural foreboding.

Arcanist Helion at the gazebo of the Sunspire on Sunstrider Isle just might be someone who would have a use for the sliver.

 Quest Hand-in: This is... most interesting.  And when I say interesting, I mean more disturbing than anything else.Our efforts to reassert control over the isle in the time following the destruction of the Sunwell have been a challenge.  I suspect that whatever foul source is corrupting the isle is at the heart of it all; this sliver may be of some aid in uncovering what's really going on.You were wise to bring this to me, <name>.  Take this as compensation for your diligence.  Thank you.
Title: Shutting Down Manaforge B'naar

Description: I was having a friendly discussion with the Aldor while you were gone.  Manaforges sure look like modified naaru technology from Tempest Keep.  Apparently, most naaru constructs have certain safeguards that allow them to be permanently disabled in case of emergency.

The procedure is usually initiated at a control console via an access crystal.  Lo and behold, according to the roster you secured, such a crystal is in the possession of a fellow called Overseer Theredis.  Obtain it and see what you can do.

 Quest Hand-in: Of course it worked!  I'm a spymaster; my information is always accurate.Anyhow, I have a whole new exciting job lined up for you.  You want to hear about it?  Of course you do.
Title: Sating Snapdragons

Description: It's time for the snapdragons to feed, but it's a job best left to someone a little more expendable. 

The beasts will eat anything, including your arm if you don't move it away quickly enough. 

Luckily for you, they've developed a taste for Chitterspine Roe.

 Quest Hand-in: I'm surprised they didn't make a meal out of you.
Title: More Sparklematic Action

Description: The Sparklematic 5200 is empty, awaiting a grime-encrusted object to clean and three silver coins to start!

 Quest Hand-in: The Sparklematic 5200 comes to life, lurching to and fro.  Inside, the helpless grime that has encrusted the object placed within it is being pulverized by the machine's gnomish cleaning agent.The Sparklematic 5200 comes to a halt, heralded by a familiar "ding!"  The item receptacle of the machine spirals open, revealing a neatly wrapped box.
Title: Fashion History and a Philosophy of Style

Description: Greetings, {name}. I am a fashion historian and I have astonishing advancements in tailoring, leatherworking, and blacksmithing that I must share with you. Why? 

A true legend is only as good as their ability to form an epic silhouette on the battlefield and--let's be honest--this is not where you shine. 

Speak to me again if you wish to learn.

 Quest Hand-in: Glad I could share the Hammerbeard System of Style and Taste with you. Are you ready to work for your legacy in your chosen profession?
Title: Put Out The Fire

Description: Lord Magmathar's minions must first be dealt with if we're to retake this area and put a stop to the fiery destruction of the forest.

The lava ragers on the flow to the north are strengthened by being on their own element. I fear that on your own, you won't have much chance against them.

When you are ready, speak to me again, and I will summon one of my own to assist you.

 Quest Hand-in: You acquitted yourself well in battle on the field. However, I'm afraid that Lord Magmathar has taken notice of you and the destruction that you've wreaked upon his minions.You will have to deal with him or he is sure to burn you alive, <name>.
Title: The Taunka and the Tauren

Description: The Scourge have seized control of the capital city of the taunka, Icemist Village! All living taunka that escaped the massacre are being held in protective custody at the Westwind Refugee Camp on the western border of Dragonblight.

Lord Hellscream believes that the taunka must join the Horde if they are to survive and has sent a tauren emissary to Westwind to bolster our relationship with the winter tauren. Travel to Westwind Refugee Camp and seek out Emissary Brighthoof. You will assist her.

 Quest Hand-in: What you see here is all that remains of the taunka from the Borean Tundra and the Dragonblight. They are a broken people... battered and brought to the brink of extinction.<Brighthoof shakes her head.>Only the Horde can save them now. Only the Horde can mend their broken spirits. We will nurse them back to full health and they will in turn strengthen the Horde in Northrend.
Title: Bring Me The Egg!

Description: Now that you've been initiated, I want you to get me that egg! Use the Jump-a-tron and try to hit the nest dead center. But be careful! Bodily injury or serious permanent damage may occur from a bad jump.

 Quest Hand-in: Well, it's no egg... Hey! I love chicken too! I'll just chomp right through this ginourmous talon! Thanks!
Title: Nemesis: Killer of Kezan

Description: <Kuros hands you the bloody heart.>

The ritual is complete. Your nemesis is marked for death.

Now your work to rid this world of the enemy truly begins. Kill all goblins that stand defiantly against the Alliance. Let their deaths serve as a warning to the rest of the Horde: they will leave Draenor or they will die.

Return when you have quenched your rage with the blood of goblin.

Conquer our enemy and be known as the killer of Kezan. Fail and be nothing.

 Quest Hand-in: The truth of your deeds is in your eyes. Your hunger for the enemy sated with cries for mercy and rivers of blood.Take now your place as killer of Kezan.
Title: Strategic Deployment

Description: For years, I guarded the gates of Orgrimmar. The city's greatest weakness has always been its multiple entrances. We should strike at all of them to seize victory.

Wrynn and I have drawn up orders for deployment. The mages will cover our flank. Greymane will close in from the west, and the elves will take the north. We will send Mayla to reinforce Thunder Bluff's defenses in case Sylvanas launches a counterattack.

Bring the orders to our commanders.

 Quest Hand-in: No matter what our strategy, taking Orgrimmar will be no easy task. I should know.
Title: A Monument to the Fallen

Description: Bring these fragments to Njormeld. He will use the pieces of that sacred relic in the construction of a mighty monument.

May it soothe the pains and heal the scars my people have borne these many years.

May its presence help to bring about a new age that sees us once again in glorious battle at Thorim's side.

Go now, {class}. Njormeld awaits you.

 Quest Hand-in: <Njormeld's eyes become noticeably moist as he pours the contents of the bag onto the anvil.>The Horn of Hodir....This was a sacred gift to our people from Hodir himself, <race>. It is a relic of great importance to us.When you next return to our stronghold you shall see the fruits of your labor.Farewell.
Title: Abduction Reduction

Description: We got actual ABDUCTIONS happenin' here, {name}!

Honest to gold, flying robots are swoopin' into town and snatchin' up people like it's closin' time at Gallywix's buffet!

Lucky for the Rustbolt Resistance, Gazlowe called in me and my explosives to save the day.

You wanna pitch in? Take one of my rocket launchers and blast those containment crates outta the sky.

Whatever they've got trapped inside will come tumblin' down real fast, so you gotta run underneath and catch 'em.

 Quest Hand-in: Nice shootin' out there!And, hey, don't worry if you "accidentally" missed a Mechagnome or two... I did too!<Penny winks at you.>
Title: The Court of Winter

Description: My Court informs me that you bear an important message.

You may now deliver it.

 Quest Hand-in: The Banished One stirs and Ardenweald's power withers in drought.
Title: Noressa

Description: She is still in there, {name}. Noressa, my wife.

She is in the Promenade while we wait outside, preparing to strike. Who knows what has happened to her?

Please, friend, I fear the worst. Tell her there is hope outside.

We had a small house in the south of the Grand Promenade, by the water gardens. She will probably be there during this madness.

 Quest Hand-in: I cannot possibly thank you enough. We will be reunited, and I will see we are never separated again.
Title: Deiza Plaguehorn

Description: You have not yet turned to the true path of undeath. Perhaps another battle will show you the way.

 Quest Hand-in: Perhaps undeath is not the answer...
Title: Mastery of the Crystals

Description: Sparktouched are still being attacked by puppy-men... we think they maybe not stop if we not make them stop. We have secret weapon though... we sent it out to Soo-met so he can use to protect all Oracles.

Secret weapon is from Great Ones themselves... extra shiny crystals found inside sacred Great One temples. Be very careful... no break them.

Crystals are in chest near shrine at Sparktouched Haven, in far southwest. You go use crystals to help Soo-met beat the puppy-men.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you, dryskin.I hold onto these crystals here to keep us safe. Maybe you come back soon and help us more.
Title: A Rare and Unusual Spirit

Description: It's a joy to see the progress you've made in the restoration of the conservatory, {name}!

But there's still more work to be done.

We have found another inert spirit. A dark dream is preventing its awakening.

In this dream, the spirit is caught in the midst of a feud between ancient beings. Both are a bit on the unsavory side, but one is much, much worse than the other!

If you were to defeat the Father of Sleep, it should nudge the spirit from its slumber. Will you help?

 Quest Hand-in: Another dream vision fulfilled. This is remarkable!
Title: If You Want Peace...

Description: Maldraxxus is a land which revels in strife and conflict. But they should also be bound by honor.

If their honor has been tossed aside, then they may move their forces beyond just Bastion.

Take care, danger lies beyond that gate. It is a realm of heroes as well as a realm of villains.

 Quest Hand-in: Well? Why aren't you out there fighting?
Title: Wind Master To'bor

Description: You're a tough mother, {name}. I think your talents are better suited elsewhere - like the root of the whole damn problem!

<Razgor points to the west.>

A thousand Scourge, at least four full sized floating death machines and who knows what else.

But you're gonna find out and then you're gonna handle it... That's right, you're gonna beat the hell out of the Scourge army that's currently beating down our door.

Get to the top of Warsong Hold and report to Wind Master To'bor. He'll be expecting you.

 Quest Hand-in: Ay, mon. I been expectin' you.<To'bor points west.>Take a peek. Across dat tundra be death, mon... death.
Title: No Mercy!

Description: It is as I told you. They were not merely idle words spoken in a fit of anger.

Time and again, the Horde have demonstrated their disdain for everything we hold dear and holy. They must pay with their lives for their transgressions against the light.

All of them.

Just imagine a world free of their stain, {name}. Envision the joy our children will know. Think of the reverence your descendants will have for your memory, knowing they owe their happiness to you.

Now go, and make that vision a reality!

 Quest Hand-in: Well done, <name>!Hunt them down and make them pay!
Title: A Feast of Shadows

Description: Many arakkoa died in Veil Akraz. From the outside, all seems still. Empty.

But in this place between worlds, death never goes unnoticed.

Stray life essence seeps through from the other side; a feast for the beings who prowl here.

Slay the shadow creatures here, and gather from their corpses the fine dust they produce. I will need much of it to perform the rites of the Talon King.

 Quest Hand-in: Good. With this much dust we can delve deep enough to reach the Talon King's refuge.
Title: Corrupted Songflower

Description: You have found a sickly, corrupted version of what appears to be a songflower plant.  A pungent, unhealthy odor emanates from the plant.  It desperately needs some sort of attention if it is to be turned back to normal.

 Quest Hand-in: You apply some Cenarion plant salve to the songflower. It immediately begins to shed its corrupted form, blossoming into a vibrant and healthy plant.
Title: More Than Expected

Description: Ya definitely more den expected, mon. I'm sure dere's more important stuff we can be usin' ya talents on now. Ya don't need ta hang out with da newbloods no more.

Head down to da village to da southeast and make yaself known. Lend a hand here and there and I'm sure ya make yer way up to sometin' more prestigious quick enough.

 Quest Hand-in: Ya tha new recruit everyone's talkin' about, eh? Welcome ta tha Darkspear.
Title: An Imprecise Burette

Description: Here are your burettes. Should you ever be in the need of anything else, don't hesitate to ask.

<Ms. Xiulan holds up the hair and continues to chuckle to herself.>

 Quest Hand-in: Oh yes, these are fine. Fine indeed. Unfortunately they need to be calibrated in order to for us to get any accurate readings off of them.
Title: Araj the Summoner

Description: With the animus destroyed, the next logical step is to take out Araj himself, and to take a shard of his phylactery.  You've probably already seen him, lurking at the fountain in the center of town.

Take my grenades with you.  They won't do anything to Araj, but if he decides to summon any of those skeletons, you can use them to blow them away.  Again.

 Quest Hand-in: Araj dead... this is good.  The Royal Apothecary Society has done its part.  As have you, <name>.
Title: Muskpaw Ranch

Description: There's another Pandaren settlement out here, Muskpaw Ranch. I don't know if they're alright, what with everything that's been going on with the Yaungol invasion.

You've been so helpful - you should go check up on them, friend!

 Quest Hand-in: Wha? Who the heck are you? What are you doin' here?Oh, you wanna help?
Title: Felwort Sample

Description: This herb bubbles and seethes with a foul energy. It is smooth, dry, and cool, yet somehow quite painful to touch.

Your herbalism trainer in Dalaran will want to see this.

 Quest Hand-in: Oh. I don't like this herb at all. I'm fascinated, but I don't like it.<Kuhuine peers into the center of the plant.>Look at the size of these seeds, <name>. We can use these. Make sure you harvest them carefully next time.
Title: Twilight Plans

Description: We're not fully aware of the intentions of the Twilight's Hammer cultists to the southwest.  We fear an attack on Lor'danel, however their motives might go well beyond that.

I need you to go to the Twilight Encampment and get your hands on their plans.  Hurry, {name}.  We might not have much time.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent job, <name>.  Now give me a moment to examine the plans you've brought me.
Title: A Message from the Justicar

Description: Justicar Trueheart has sent a personal request for your immediate assistance, {name}.

The frozen winds of Icecrown await your return.

 Quest Hand-in: I am glad for your return, <name>.
Title: An Unexpected Friend

Description: Oh, {name}, I nearly forgot!

To help you with your mission here in Nazjatar, Atolia and I put together some items you may need.

We should swing by and grab them when we have the time!

 Quest Hand-in: Welcome to our lovely, and yet terrifying, little neighborhood. If you survive, I may be able to pull together a few more items for you!
Title: Cycle of Life

Description: Ysera sleeps in the Emerald Dream, watching over both the Dream and Azeroth. But a horrible nightmare has taken hold in the Dream, and now I fear that Ysera is being affected by it.

Recently, I asked her to aid in the fight against the Scourge that are raising frostwyrms at the other dragonshrines. She misunderstood.

Instead, she told our dragonshrine's defenders to treat those not of the green dragonflight as enemies.

I need you to slay some of the skytalons. The shrine must regain its balance.

 Quest Hand-in: Do not regret the part that you played in the cycle of life. Birth, death, and rebirth are all part of the natural order.
Title: Swift Approach

Description: I've taken the liberty of performing some preliminary scouting. The naga may not be aware of our position, but they are not entirely unprepared for intruders.

Beyond their patrols, they have set up magical sentry devices that will warn them of unwelcome guests. Fortunately, they seem to have sacrificed quality for quantity, and there is definitely a window in which the devices can be destroyed before their alarms are answered.

I trust that you can see to this before our other soldiers arrive.

 Quest Hand-in: Well done, <name>, and just in time too. The Captain just started sending more men out. Strong axe arms, but I doubt they possess quite the same awareness and finesse that you do.We were lucky to have you here when things went south. I suspect you will have a large role to play in things to come as well.
Title: Call on the Farseer

Description: I am sensing something very special about this child indeed.

You should take her to visit Farseer Nobundo, here in the Exodar.  I believe that he has been expecting the two of you.

Look for Nobundo upon the highest terrace in the Crystal Hall.

 Quest Hand-in: I had hoped, but despaired she was only a figment of my imagination.  The child is amazing!It's unheard of in this day and age that one of the draenei should exhibit such ability with the elements without any training.  She must have inherited this power from an ancient ancestor.I will send a missive to the orphan matron in Shattrath City requesting that the child be allowed to come stay with us.Please, keep her safe until then.
Title: Critters of Draenor

Description: I love collecting pets, and I've picked up a few unusual pets here in Draenor.  What would you say to a battle?  If you can defeat my humble team, I think we'll both learn a few new tricks.

 Quest Hand-in: Not bad.  Not bad at all.  Stop by the next time I'm in the neighborhood, and I might have some new pets to check out.
Title: Do the Honors

Description: It looks like all that's left to do is to place the orbs on the pedestals at each corner of this mechanism.

We appear to have stumbled upon what may be the most important find in modern history.

<Harrison looks at you for a moment, then hands you the orbs.>

Well, go ahead, {name}.

We'd have never made this discovery without you.

 Quest Hand-in: Well, now. Would ya look at that!As amazing as this is, I am confident that there's more to our discovery than meets the eye...Much more.
Title: Creeping Death

Description: Scorposhi venom usually induces a slow, creeping death.

It's remarkable that your friend has survived this long.

As with most antivenoms, the thing that kills is also the thing that heals. 

I'll need to extract the venom from several scorpashi stingers to craft the cure.

When the extracted poison is mixed with cactus root salve, we will have the antivenom we need to treat his wounds.

 Quest Hand-in: Be gentle with the scorpashi stingers, it will only complicate matters worse if one of us become poisoned. The venom of the scorpashi is highly toxic.
Title: The Weakest Link

Description: They say a chain is only as strong as its weakest link.

I subscribe to that theory and expand upon it.

Rather than removing that weak link, one must... strengthen it.

The other links will step up their performance out of fear of they themselves becoming the weakest link.

In my army's case, our weak link has a name.  Salhet.

You'll find him training near the bottom of those stairs.

Start him off with something easy.  The hyenas on the hills to the west, perhaps.

 Quest Hand-in: It is a great honor to meet you, <name>!  I've heard much about you.
Title: Back on Their Feet

Description: {name}, I could use your help. With their long shifts, our warriors down at the southern front of the battlefront are fighting to the point of exhaustion, and many of them have been exposed to the mantid poison.

We need more people to tend to the wounded. I've prepared some bandages with the herbs you brought me, but if you have some healing skills, those might work even better.

Please, {name}, get our men back on their feet so that they can get back here to safety.

 Quest Hand-in: There are several warriors that owe their lives to you. You have my deepest appreciation, <class>.
Title: Storming the Legion

Description: I did my best to fight the demons off, but there were too many even for my skill...

As I lay dying, I overheard the dreadlord commanding a Felskorn alchemist to contaminate my brew and then return to the Broken Shore. 

If you could acquire some of the poison, I'm sure we can concoct an antidote!

 Quest Hand-in: Good, you made it!
Title: Specialized Secrets: Mining

Description: What wisdom do you seek?

 Quest Hand-in: Patience, young one. There is still much to learn.But you may celebrate today, for you understand more than you did before.
Title: Blade of Eternal Justice

Description: The Qiraji and their servants wield items made with the rarest and finest materials: bones from gargantuan ancient creatures, gems from the depths of the earth, metals pure and strong.

Just the sight of Qiraji artifacts fills me with an urge to practice my craft with their shattered and smelted pieces.  Prove your allegiance to the Circle, {name}, and I will make you a powerful weapon from the finest Qiraji materials.

 Quest Hand-in: You've done well, <class>.  This is a masterwork hilt... the balance is perfect.Take your weapon, <name>.  Wield it with great confidence and vanquish our enemies!
Title: Infiltrating Shipwreck Arena

Description: The giants at Shipwreck Arena are very fond of smashing ships that sail too close to shore. They take the sailors prisoner and use them for their own amusement.

I suppose it will be easy for you to infiltrate the place. It's breaking out that will be the difficult part.

 Quest Hand-in: Did you get my bottle? Are you here to help us escape?
Title: Sholazar Basin

Description: Hemet Nesingwary was last heard from leading an expedition into the jungle depths of Sholazar Basin. His expedition has not been heard from since.

Monte Muzzleshot is a pilot who was dispatched to provide them supplies, but he hasn't returned, either.

Archmage Pentarus in Dalaran is standing by with a flying machine to take you to the last known location of Monte Muzzleshot.

 Quest Hand-in: Aye, Hemet's here. He's at the camp, just go northwest toward the river and you'll soon see it. And for the love of the Light, lad, have him send someone to cut me down!
Title: Tree Delivery

Description: Here you go, one instant Super-Gro Insta-Tree made with 80% natural ingredients!

No roots, no muss, no fuss. Just give it to Kilram and make sure he stands the heck back when he uses it.

 Quest Hand-in: Alright! Stand back now and watch what a true quality weapon can do!
Title: Eliminate the Shadow Council

Description: These ruins are full of Shadow Council adherents. We can't afford to let them scatter all over Draenor once Gul'dan has been dealt with.

No, we need to eliminate every one of them down to the last orc.

 Quest Hand-in: Necessary business. We don't dare risk letting them grow more powerful.
Title: Forced Hand

Description: We try to be nice to puppy-men ever since they came, but they nothing but mean.

We okay with them being dumb - they not do much harm. Now they mess with sacred shrines though. Sacred shrines not for messing with. The Great Stones are here from all the way back when the Great Ones made us.

We wouldn't know what to do if the Great Mist Stone were hurt. Go to their camp to north... make puppy-men stop and not come back!

 Quest Hand-in: You squash good. Thank you for help.
Title: They've Got Golems

Description: I've sacked countless ruins across Vol'dun. Everything from saurolisk-infested dens to the cursed Port of Zem'lan.

I don't say this to brag. I want you to understand that I know what I'm doing.

I've survived this long because I take my time, avoid risks, and only take what I need.

That's what we'll be doing here today.

Omi reported heavy golem activity on her first scouting trip into the ruins. Zandalari golems are formidable. We need to learn what's powering them before we head in.

 Quest Hand-in: The golems are powered by souls? Hmm... We're dealing with a very powerful enemy. We should take extra precautions.
Title: Dead Man's Chest

Description: Well gosh, as you can plainly see there's this really big battle with these pirates here going on. We're doing our best to make sure they never bother Gadgetzan or our new gnomish homes there ever again!

By killing them.

So how about helping us? We really wanna make sure we kill more than green-nose over there and her awful thugs. I'd really appreciate it!

 Quest Hand-in: Good job! We're really cleaning up around here!
Title: Never Outgunned

Description: This is our new home now, and we will fight to keep it!

We may be outnumbered here, but we aren't going to be outgunned.

Find us every axe, sword, spear, crossbow, and gun for our rebellion!

 Quest Hand-in: This is a good start.
Title: Dark Binding

Description: Even as we speak, the pale within Shadowfall Canyon are enslaving the elements to their will. Many elemental spirits have already been enthralled, and more will follow.
