The pale must be stopped and the elementals they enslave set free.

Journey into Shadowfall Canyon and set free those elemental spirits which are not fully enthralled by the pale. As for the elementals already enslaved by the pale, the only mercy we can give them now is to release their bonds through death.

 Quest Hand-in: The pale have been taught by Cho'gall to enslave the elemental spirits of this land. When an elemental is enthralled in this manner, it cannot be reversed even by a Farseer such as myself.
Title: Conqueror's Spaulders

Description: It is said among us that the ornate shoulder armor worn by the mortal races started as an attempt to emulate the wings of a dragon.

Bring me the bindings worn by the highest Qiraji leaders and I shall shape them into a set of pauldrons more dreadful than even the wings of Nefarian himself!

 Quest Hand-in: From the materials you bring and from the scales of our fallen Qiraji foes I make you these pauldrons, mortal.  May they grant you the protection you need and may the sight of them strike fear into our enemies.
Title: Salt of Shards

Description: The Abyssal Lord left behind a small pile of faintly-iridescent sand.

 Quest Hand-in: Ahh, the trophy of an epic battle. Well fought, <class>!
Title: The Fate of Bloodbane

Description: With the riders of the Host of Suffering dead, now is the time to put an end to their true leader: Orbaz Bloodbane.

Mograine caught up with me while you were off and told me that he found where Orbaz is hiding. Under Icecrown Citadel itself, there is an immense pit - you will find Orbaz just outside its lip.

Some of the Ebon Blade's strongest agents have already been dispatched - gather aid and join the fight. It is time for Bloodbane to die.

 Quest Hand-in: Mograine himself arrived to see the deed done then? I imagine there was some ill blood between those two - no surprise that he wanted a piece of the wretch.You've done exceedingly well, <race>, and you shall be awarded appropriately. The Ebon Blade thanks you.
Title: Reinforcements...

Description: It would appear as if we are running out of big, stupid orcs to send at the enemy. This is a problem. Thankfully, I may have a solution.

Take this whip and head west to Boulderslide Cavern. Within the cave you will find a filthy nest of kobolds. Use my whip to subdue the beasts. Once subdued they will do whatever we ask them to do.

Return to me when you have amassed a sizable army of kobolds.

 Quest Hand-in: In times of crisis, a desperate act may be all that is needed to secure victory. Sending a swarm of kobolds at the enemy may be the edge that we need to win.
Title: The Ancient Trials

Description: <As the raven stares into your eyes, an odd voice fills your mind.>

I know who you are, champion, and I know what you seek.

Come to me, if you think yourself truly worthy.

 Quest Hand-in: I'm sure your head is filled with questions. Answers will come, in time.I am Havi, and my words are those of the Valarjar - the glorious keepers of the Halls of Valor. You will need my help if it is the Aegis you seek. Oh yes, I know your goals outsider. As I know many things...
Title: To Valdrakken

Description: Thanks to you, we narrowly avoided a complete catastrophe.

However, we should convene with the other Aspects and share word of what happened here.

Please meet me at the Seat of the Aspects within Valdrakken. I'm sure the others will have insight into what Raszageth and her Primalists are attempting.

There is a crossing into Thaldraszus north and a bit east of here. The flight is scenic, but do not take too long getting there.

 Quest Hand-in: Welcome to Valdrakken, <name>. Kalecgos says there is news about the Azure Span.
Title: Banish the Demons

Description: You've arrived at the perfect time, friend!  We are in need of assistance.  In return, you will receive something very rare, which will help us both in the end.

We're not a violent ogre any longer, but the demons nearby threaten to overrun us and the Skyguard.  The problem with demons is that, once killed, they come right back in new bodies!

But, if you use this crystal to summon a banishing portal, when they die near it, their essences will be drawn in and banished back from whence they came!

 Quest Hand-in: That'll teach them!
Title: A Delivery for Thorg'izog

Description: General Thorg'izog is staying among the ogres in the Firegut Furnace, a cave on the western edge of Dreadmaul Rock.  I'd like you to deliver this to him and the ogres.

Inside this package, you will find the worg cutlets you obtained, marinated in the fel slider cider that we took from the Altar of Storms.

I would avoid eating it if I were you.

Bring it to General Thorg'izog.  He will make sure that his troops are fed and, with any luck, he will eat some himself.

 Quest Hand-in: Well would you look at that!  My favorite soldier comes through in the clutch!I'll make sure to get this distributed among the ogres.I'll see you in Redridge, soldier.  For the glory of the Blackrock!
Title: The Primalists

Description: My memories are still clouded from stasis, but I am certain we have encountered these Primalists before.

<Dervishian grits her fangs.>

It is no use. Trying to remember feels like chasing fragments of a dream.

Perhaps you can fare better. Look for any clues as to what--or who--motivates these invaders.

 Quest Hand-in: The Primalist speaks of unleashing a terrible storm.Could an even greater threat be locked away somewhere on the Reach?
Title: The Tortusk Takedown

Description: In the wake of the chaos down south, this "Tortusk" brute seems to have rallied all of the Razormane refugees to his banner. Under his leadership, he's turned them into little more than brigands. There's no negotiating with his type; Tortusk must be destroyed.

If our prisoner is to be believed, you'll find Tortusk southeast of here at a place called Thorn Hill. Search the bluffs where he has a commanding view of the road. Kill him, {name}, and the immediate threat should cease.

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, so Tortusk behaved as I expected? Went right for your throat? It is good that he's dead.The Razormane quilboar have been separated from their leadership in the southern Barrens, no doubt allowing an animal like him to come to power. Perhaps without his influence we can start a dialogue with the survivors... Although hotter heads may prevail.
Title: Deeprun Rat Roundup

Description: Avast ye scallywag. Arrrr... Arrrr ye looking fer work? We gots a serious rat problem down here an' not enough hands on the poop deck.

What do ye say? All ye needs to do is take this here rat catchin' flute and play the melody around the vermin. They'll follow ye to the ends of the world!

Just capture five of the little buggers and bring em back here. We needs em alive.

Arrrrr...

 Quest Hand-in: These'll werk nicely, matey. Me brother needs em still tickin' and kickin,' else they go sour... Ye don't want to taste no sour rat kabob.
Title: Nothing Remains

Description: Nothing is left for me here. My old clanmates have turned into foes, and Gul'dan is desecrating what remains of my people.

You and your Frostwolf allies still have some fight left. If you pledge to depose Gul'dan, I will stand by your side. I will go to this garrison of yours and together we will build a shipyard that will rule the red seas of Draenor!

Let your people know I am coming.

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, ya found us a shipwright? Good! Ya followers be eager ta take on da open seas.
Title: Return to Gloom Hollow

Description: Old God G'huun behind destruction of this seal. Commanding blood trolls to destroy final one within Zuldazar.

Titan Keeper Hezrel must aid in destruction of blood trolls. Cannot allow Zuldazar seal to be destroyed and G'huun to be freed.

Must leave interior of Atul'nazman. Meet Titan Keeper Hezrel outside of temple, will help return to Gloom Hollow.

When task is complete, Titan Keeper Herzrel must establish contact with other keeper within G'huun containment chamber.

 Quest Hand-in: We have everything we need to go after de blood trolls. We need to get moving.
Title: To Meet Mother Kashur

Description: Do not be alarmed by what you might see once the effect has taken hold! These spirits are all around us - always. The potion allows your mind to be able to understand and ultimately see the spirits. You will need to be under its influence if you are to speak with Mother Kashur.

You will find her a great ways to the southwest, at the Ancestral Grounds.


 Quest Hand-in: The potion that you drank has no real effect. You can only see a spirit if they allow it. The potion is merely a symbol of your belief and dedication. It was a test and you passed...
Title: The Mighty U'cha

Description: Looking around, you see bits of red fur laying around this part of the cave.  It appears to match the consistency of gorilla fur.

Based on your conversations with Gremix, you know that he would almost certainly be interested in a red gorilla hide, if you were to obtain one.

 Quest Hand-in: Wow, look at this one!  Not just the color, but the size of it... you could cover a tauren with this.Here you go, <name>.  You've earned this.  Stick around, I'm sure we can find something else for you to do.
Title: Neltharion's Lair: The Earthen Amulet

Description: That you were even able to acquire the Egg of Gaiath  is an incredible feat in itself, but the next step may well be impossible. Still... it is our only hope.

For the ritual to work, we will need to awaken the latent elemental energy resting inside of this egg.

There is an item that just may have the ability to do this - a relic known as the Earthen Amulet, rumored to have been created by Loken himself.

It was lost many ages ago, and has fallen into the hands of Dargrul the Underking.

 Quest Hand-in: Yes, this is exactly what we need! I can get to work at once!
Title: THAELIN!

Description: That little...!

<Yrel tries to maintain her composure.>

Thaelin Darkanvil sent us a shipment. It was supposed to be engineering parts.

Instead, when we just opened one of the crates, out popped a baby goren. Do you know how destructive those things are?

And, of course, the one baby immediately set about letting all the other ones loose.

Want to help me get some revenge?

 Quest Hand-in: Outstanding.<Vindicator Yrel beckons you closer so that the two of you can conspire.>
Title: Rolling Up the Sleeves

Description: The Caverns of Time? Strange... I spent many timelines in this very place.

What's special about here-- now?

We'll have to discern as much later on. It looks like we aren't the only ones who've been affected by these rifts...

Let's do the Bronze Dragonflight a favor and clear out these anomalies.

 Quest Hand-in: It seems no matter when one is, there's always something to fight...
Title: Teamwork Lesson: Naraxas

Description: <While victorious, your snowfeather hatchling squawked and pecked at its allies during some of those last fights. Showing it a good example of teamwork might help.>

 Quest Hand-in: <The hatchling looks like it might have absorbed some of that lesson, at least it enjoyed the trip. It will need some time to recover from this adventure.>
Title: Abjurist Belmara

Description: This worn, sturdy tome is no spellbook, as you might expect a Kirin Tor mage to carry. The pages of the volume are covered with hand-copied stories, accompanied by colorful illustrations.

The tome seems to be far older than its former owner and may have even been a family heirloom. A powerful tie to the book may have been the last thread tying Belmara's spirit to the ruins of Kirin'Var. Returning it to its proper place on the bookshelf in her quarters might help appease her restless spirit.

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, yes. I'd heard that Abjurist Belmara had an old book of stories, but I had no idea that she brought it with her to Outland. I'm certain her spirit will rest easier knowing that you've found it and returned it to her dwelling.
Title: A Lovely Apple for Chee Chee

Description: Me not same as mountain monkeys. You get that straight.

 Quest Hand-in: For me? Red apple? So shiny! So juicy! Thanks, boss!
Title: The Gordunni Orb

Description: In addition to clearing out the ogres...

Estulan mentioned something else about the ogres. He said the ogre warlocks may have some sort of orb, or other item of power

He was terse about it, but seemed upset...he said there was "no way they could be Highborne", so I think he wants to know just where they got them. Bring me back one of these orbs.

 Quest Hand-in: Is that it? Let me see here...
Title: Champion Armaments

Description: We will need armaments and equipment for our Champions.

 Quest Hand-in: The order has been placed.  Once the shipment arrives it will be here for you to collect.
Title: Path of Might

Description: You seek to continue down the path of might?

 Quest Hand-in: You continue to prove yourself, <name>.  Accept this, not as a gift, but as a tool for the fight against the Scourge.
Title: The Power to Reforge

Description: I forged the key using a pristine argunite crystal. Unfortunately, the only ones remaining are used by the Army of the Light's defenses.

Hmm... dendrite clusters might be an alternative. They were used by the elite of Eredath to power simple devices. If enough of the city ruins are still intact, I'd wager the fallen magi or the broken may still have some in their possession. 

Of course, I would need a great many clusters to reforge the key. It seems you have your work cut out for you.

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, yes. Combined, these clusters should provide just enough power for me to fuse the key fragments back together.
Title: A Sacrifice of Anima

Description: The last thing we need for this counter-curse is some attuned anima.

Of course, we don't have much to spare. That means this is more of a sacrifice than it normally would be.

But you know what? The spriggans made this mess, so they should help clean it up. Some really nasty ones have been causing mischief in Tirna Scithe. They should have the anima we need.

Thiernax looks like he could use some nice, vengeful, therapeutic spriggan stomping. I'll have him meet you there.

 Quest Hand-in: HA! That will teach those spriggans! You mess with the mistrunner, you get the magical horn!Now we have the anima we need! And, conveniently, it's already attuned to the bad attitude of the one who cast the curse.
Title: Documenting the Timeways

Description: You... {name}, was it? You assisted with our archival in the past. Well, technically it was the future, but I believe you understand. Time is highly relative.

I require more information for our archive. While you and Nozdormu don't intend to overwrite this timestrand, as you did in the End Time, we can still benefit from more data.

I require information on Captain Varo'then, one of Azshara's pretty little handmaidens, and... hmm... oh, how about that big felguard, just down those stairs?

 Quest Hand-in: We rarely enjoy the opportunity to employ a brave <class> like you. Our archive grows more thorough, thanks to your efforts.
Title: Green Muck Dye

Description: There are so many muck colors, how do you choose just one?

 Quest Hand-in: I have only visited the Banewood Muck Pool once, but I found it was a bit crowded myself, I definitely prefer working solo. I will save this for the next time we need to dye my doublet. I want to remind you that we will need one for each dying, but I can keep this one ready.
Title: Trading Up

Description: Hobart thinks he's going to feed us on those tiny clucker eggs? Bah! We're going to get some real eggs!

I've already set up some traps on the Raptor Rise up the path to the east. Take this bunch of wild clucker eggs and lay them in the traps. The spiny raptors will go right after the clucker eggs, and then you'll get to trade up to their larger eggs.

Genius!

 Quest Hand-in: Nice! Look at the size of those things!There's no way that Grapplehammer's going to be able to top those!
Title: Privileged Information

Description: I'm not the only prize the Iron Horde brought back after raiding my workshop.

Overlord Blackhammer, the maniac in charge of this operation, took my notebook as his own personal treasure.

Manufacturing techniques; schematics for new inventions; embarrassing doodles.

It's got all my secrets!

Can I count on you to help me get it back?

 Quest Hand-in: Aye, there she is.Thank you, <name>. Let's get out of here, shall we?
Title: Gauging Success

Description: Vicious louts... they did a lot of damage with those spears.

<The captain winces slightly as he clutches a wound on his side.>

We'll hold here as long as we can for all the men to make it. I need someone to scout their numbers to see how much damage we did.

One of the biggest groups of them was around the corner on the northwest portion of this round terrace, and the other was a bit farther to the north in the small tunnel, also on this middle level of the ruins.

Up for some scouting?

 Quest Hand-in: Still so many? They must want something very important here to come in such numbers.I will be honest with you, <name>, because you deserve at least that: I don't know how much hope there is. We will retreat shortly, but we won't be able to defend ourselves when they strike back. We don't have anywhere to run... we're running out of options.I'm sorry, I should keep such thoughts to myself. Do me a favor and don't mention any of that to the men. I'll figure something out.
Title: Join the Battle!

Description: I received an urgent message from Sergeant Willem. Turns out that the Blackrock orcs have hired goblin assassins. They ambushed our battalion behind the abbey. Willem has asked me to send him a hero. You have to go help them, {name}!

Find Sergeant Willem north of the abbey at the command tent. Go!

 Quest Hand-in: It's true, we were ambushed. I don't dare send any more soldiers out there and risk losing them too. I need a volunteer. Someone willing to risk their life!
Title: A Good Offense

Description: Korl was told to watch the naga, so watching the naga I am.

They're bad, friend, you know... just... terrible, horrible, bad monsters. 

I don't think I can just watch any more.

They say the best defense is.. something...

Help me teach them being being bad gets you smashed!

 Quest Hand-in: This was my best day. Thank you, friend.
Title: Spiced Rib Roast

Description: Spiced Rib Roast is a light meal that can be made by those skilled in cooking. If you are not learned in this profession, you may be able to acquire the services of a cook elsewhere.

 Quest Hand-in: Yes, these will do nicely. I'll get them salted and cured right away!
Title: Army of the Damned

Description: You probably think you're quite strong -- fighting these undead and crushing their bones beneath your war machines.

That is nothing compared to the strength it took to create them.

I saw the prince do it himself.  I can show you how it happened... if you'd like.

 Quest Hand-in: The prince's true power wasn't his ability to make armies out of corpses... that was easy.But killing his own men, with whom he'd shared many battles... the prince's true power was his ability to do what had to be done.
Title: Delights to Delve For

Description: Rumi and Morsel?

Gosh, that was quite a long time ago now. Eating a fish with a dragon and duck chef duo sounds like the beginning of a tale Elder Poa might tell for the younglings. We'd be hard-pressed to forget such a happening!

The fish was a Savory Deviant Dealfish, a top Tuskarr favorite! They're rare, but found just off the coast here.

Fair warning - it's azuretooth mating season. Those bloodthirsty fiends will take a chunk out of you for messing with their favorite snack.

 Quest Hand-in: Oooh hoo! You smell that? Nothing fresher than fresh-caught right from the sea!Morsel and I simply must spend another summer with the Iskarra. There is simply no better way to learn more about an ingredient than with the artisans that source them.
Title: We've Got Crabs!

Description: {name}, you're just in time. Everything's ready for the crab hunt!

Okay, okay... I know what you're thinking. A founding member of D.E.H.T.A. that condones hunting?

I'm going to level with you, {name}. I've got a bar full of hungry murlocs that only eat three things: crabs, fish, and people.

If that's not reason enough, crabs are overpopulated in this region and they're decimating the local grub worm population!

How many innocent grub worms need to die before we do something, {name}?

 Quest Hand-in: That's quite the case of crabs you've got there, <name>. Well done! Please set it down behind the bar and I'll take care of the rest.
Title: The Lodestone

Description: If we can locate what's luring the giants northwest, we might be able to stop them before they reach their destination.

Although I was able to decipher many of the runes on the samples you brought me, the ones I don't know concern me the most. When I visited Giants' Run, I noticed a large broken tablet jutting from the ground where the northeastern part of the area met the snow at the foot of Frostblade Peak. Take this sample, compare the runes with the tablet, and see what you can learn.

 Quest Hand-in: <Aderan listens as you describe your findings.>Of course! This Megalith must be the key to the Iron Dwarves' plans. We must destroy it before their plan comes to fruition!
Title: Rat Soul

Description: <The Rat Soul is curious and sociable. The shape of the rat will be yours to call upon.>

 Quest Hand-in: Ooh, a rat! They're so clever!
Title: A Shade of Dread

Description: The last ingredient is perhaps the deadliest.

The dreadshade flower grows all along these hills.

It is by eating these poisonous plants that the local wildlife has become so venomous.

A single drop of dreadshade nectar can stop a kunchong's heart.

Go and bring me some of these flowers. Do not be tempted to taste them.

 Quest Hand-in: Many would not know the value of what you hold.You have done well, Wakener.
Title: Wildlife Rescue

Description: It doesn't take an ecologist to see that the wetlands are in real trouble.

But Iskha's got us stuck here examining dead creatures when we ought to be stopping them from dying in the first place! The red dragonflight is about preserving life--not dissecting it!

I love Iskha, and he's good at what he does, but if we wait until he's done puttering, there won't be any wetlands left to save. 

I'll manage his overthinking. You get out there, get your boots muddy, and rescue some wildlife.

 Quest Hand-in: There! The wetlands are fixed! Meanwhile, Iskha is still doing his taxidermy... I mean research!Wait, what do you mean the elementals keep coming?
Title: Combustible Contagion

Description: It is true that we may have a lead on Sylvanas. Though I want nothing more than to get my hands on the Banshee Queen, the situation here at Greywatch requires immediate attention.

Yesterday, a regiment of guards returned with word of Forsaken forces in the woods. Several of them bore signs of a blight, similar to the one we endured in Gilneas. It would appear these Forsaken seek to unleash this blight upon Greywatch.

Seek out their caches and destroy them, before the blight overtakes us!

 Quest Hand-in: The deed is done. You have done a great service to the worgen of Greywatch, <name>.
Title: Unseen Protection

Description: We will not let the city of Dalaran fall.

If the Legion is planning an attack, the Unseen Path will be there to stop it.

Our scouts' most recent reports list a few other areas that sound like they could really use our help, whether they realize it or not.

As soon as you're able, send your hunters to take care of the threats.

 Quest Hand-in: Whether they know it or not, the people of Azeroth have the Unseen Path to thank for their safety.
Title: Pilfering Perfume

Description: I knew they were up to no good! There's some sort of mind-affecting chemical in here, but I can't get a handle on it with such a small sample. I need the real stuff.

Don't just go over there and buy it! I don't want you giving these scumbags one copper. Nah, you gotta get it from the source, discreet-like.

I'll disguise you as a package runner. I saw a stockpile guarded by their goons outside the gates. Go run by, and DON'T stop, or they'll make you! They'll toss you a crate. Bring it back here.

 Quest Hand-in: You got it, huh? Good job, kid. Top notch. Let's see what we got here.<He cracks open the crate and rummages around inside.>
Title: A Show of Gratitude

Description: Your presence here fulfils an ancient prophecy, Maw Walker. I am certain you and your allies will save us.

Perhaps I judged your broker friend too harshly. She did escort you to Korthia, after all. 

Please extend our thanks to Ve'nari, and let her know we are happy to answer her questions.

She... does seem to have quite a number of them.

 Quest Hand-in: A thank-you is polite.A favor is better.
Title: Totem of Tikti

Description: You begin to read the totem, better able to pronounce the words and phrases. Words start to form in your head. You think that the totem is telling you to go across the Crystalbrook river to the east. Perhaps your destination is on the other side of the river.

 Quest Hand-in: The totem has various primal markings. You see owls, bears, wolves and stags carved into the surface of the totem.You note a strange collection of symbols that makes your mouth form the word T-I-K-T-I.
Title: Cannonball Swim

Description: Help out a fellow swabbie?

Keelhaul asked me to gather up some cannonballs at the bottom of the ocean.  Let me tell you why this doesn't work for me.

- One: I have tiny arms.  Look at them!  Do you really think I can pick up a cannonball, even underwater?

- Two: I have a weak respiratory system.  I start to white out after holding my breath for more than ten seconds.

- Three: There are sharks.

You gotta help me, {name}!  I've been demoted as far as I can... I don't want to see what comes next!

 Quest Hand-in: Thanks, <name>.  I'd been hearing whispers about "Pretty Boy" and a "boo-box".  I don't think I want to go in the boo-box.
Title: The Chain Gun And You

Description: We've set up chain guns and barricades directly to the east and to the west. Our injured soldiers are hiding in both rooms - trying their best to not alert the mindless ghouls to their presence.

Now that we have ammo, I need you to man one of the chain guns and use it to blast a path clear for our soldiers! Once you're on board, call a soldier out from hiding and then lay down heavy fire to keep the Scourge off him!

Get a move on!

 Quest Hand-in: <name>, I haven't seen heroics like that since Silithus!I'll be sure that each and every one of those soldiers puts in a recommendation to Lord Fordragon that you be promoted!Now, on to more pressing matters. We've gotten reports back from our scouts that Thel'zan is close.
Title: Shaping Fate

Description: The Jailer's power and malevolence continue to grow. So must our resilience.

Stand amongst your allies, {name}. Push back against the darkness that would consume us all.

Together, we will yet prevail.

May the Purpose guide your hand.

 Quest Hand-in: The threads of fate weave through you, Maw Walker.Just as the prophecies foretold.
Title: More Venom Sacs

Description: Many refugees still need treatment for their poisonous wounds.  Have you brought more venom sacs for me to use, {name}?

 Quest Hand-in: You have my thanks, <name>.  The naaru have extended their protection to these unfortunate souls; it would be a shame if they made it to Shattrath and perished to previous wounds.
Title: Old Stomping Grounds

Description: Once, long ago, I journeyed to Ardenweald to assist in putting down a threat now long forgotten.

I remember that while there, I saw small creatures taking tiny clusters of anima--animacones, the fae called them--and buried them under the soil.

If those clusters are still there, we must gather them for ourselves!

I should be able to unearth any of the animacones we encounter. Let's go hunt for them!

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you, Maw Walker. This extra anima will tremendously aid our efforts.
Title: Fortunate Souls

Description: {name}, I am glad to see that you survived the wreck. Many were not as fortunate...

I am capable of stalling the enemy here for now, but this position is not defensible long term.

We need to find somewhere safe for our forces.

Once we have taken measure of the wounded we will push on. In the meantime, find as many survivors as you can.

Nazjatar will claim no more Horde lives today!

 Quest Hand-in: So few.... It will have to suffice. Without you, we would be even fewer.
Title: Swiftwind Post

Description: The raid you planned for Swiftwind Post in Drustvar was successful. Well done.

The outpost is ready to be claimed.

Make your way to Swiftwind Post in Drustvar and establish fortifications there.

Swiftwind Post will be an essential outpost in our campaign against the Alliance.

Go with honor!

 Quest Hand-in: Welcome, <name>. This is a fine location for an outpost! Thanks to your leadership the Horde has yet another foothold in Drustvar!
Title: Warchief's Command: Eastern Plaguelands!

Description: All able bodied members of the Horde are hereby ordered to report to Fiona on the east bank of the Thondroril River.

The Argent Crusade has reinforced its presence in the Plaguelands and it needs your help to consolidate its victories.

Cross the Thondroril River at the eastern border of the Western Plaguelands and look for Fiona on the far bank.

Destiny calls!

 Quest Hand-in: Perhaps you can help, <class>.
Title: Torgos!

Description: There's a creature in the Bone Wastes so fearsome that only the dauntless dare to stalk him.

I speak of Torgos, king of the bonelashers, who circles over Veil Rhaze on the western edge of the wastes.

Too bad that there's an arakkoan scarecrow there, known as Torgos's Bane, which keeps him at bay.  I'd bet if you laid his mate Trachela's carcass at the foot of that scarecrow he'd come down anyway.  She can be found at Carrion Hill in the northern wastes.

Bring me one of Torgos's tail feathers.

 Quest Hand-in: Color me impressed, <class>.  Torgos was one of the toughest creatures I know of this side of Nagrand.Well, I suppose that's good enough for something from the Allerian Stronghold treasury.  Take your pick.
Title: Taking Out the Tidecaller

Description: Nezara's shield might be down, but that doesn't mean she's defenseless. 

There's a brute by her side that may cause trouble. I'll take a stab at him so you can take down the Tidecaller.

 Quest Hand-in: You do good work, <name>. Always a pleasure.
Title: The Dead and the Damned

Description: <A powerful mind again touches your thoughts.>

Gorelix the Fleshripper is a monstrous demon. The butcher of a thousand worlds, he has exterminated countless races with his axe, the Maw of the Damned.

A group of Ebon Blade was dispatched to slay him but they have gone missing. You will succeed where they failed.

You will not be alone in this, I've sent Baron Sliver ahead to assist you.

Go, obtain the Maw of the Damned and ensure that Gorelix is no more.

 Quest Hand-in: That axe makes me feel uneasy, <name>. Its power is undeniable, but its very essence embodies the eternal hunger.We will use it because we must do whatever it takes to win this war. Still, I'd be careful with that weapon if I were you.
Title: A Fresh Trauma

Description: Azeroth is strugglin' tae survive, but new wounds are formin' at a rapid pace.

I can sense her cries o' pain risin' from the north... in a place o' ancient power...

<Magni closes his eyes, as if listening to an unseen voice.>

By the Forge! Somethin's gone wrong in Mount Hyjal. The World Tree, Nordrassil, is in danger!

Meet me there, {name}. There's no time tae lose!

 Quest Hand-in: If we don't heal these wounds, the World Tree might not be standin' much longer.
Title: An Occupation of Time

Description: Look--{name} is it?--I need your help. I know most everyone in this cave thinks that we're not in a position to be worrying about anything but our own hides right now, but I cannot dismiss my ancestors so readily.

All I want from you, while you're out in the city proper, is to keep a watchful eye out for objects of significance. The statues interest me especially.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you so much for taking this seriously.This is some of the first definitive proof of other members of the Vashj family. Very interesting. And I'd never even heard of either of the other two figures you mentioned until now.So much of our history was lost during the sundering - it's exciting to have a chance at reclaiming some of it.
Title: Scourge War Machines

Description: The Scourge's war machines make it exceedingly difficult for us to gain ground. They must be our top priority.

Though they are well protected, we must destroy them if we are to clear a path for our ground forces and grant them an opportunity to strike.

Plant these charges underneath the war machines and then clear the area.

 Quest Hand-in: A job well done, <name>.Now our forces can advance without worrying about the enemy's weaponry.
Title: The Mech of Death

Description: We have reports of a goblin machine causing havoc among our troops up ahead. They call it the A.M.O.D.

It is a crude machine compared to what the Lightforged have aboard the Vindicaar.

Together, you and I will bring down this machine. Go, I will await for you near the machine and engage it when you are ready.

 Quest Hand-in: You fought well! It is a shame we must part soon, I would have enjoyed fighting side by side with you.
Title: All That Remains

Description: We had lived peacefully among the Owlbeasts of this island for many years. You can imagine my surprise when they stormed the beach and attacked us.

I fought tooth and nail but was easily overpowered. As I blacked out from the vicious blows that I had been dealt, I prayed that my family not suffer.

When I awoke, all was quiet. The sand was soaked red with blood - their blood. They were devoured whole.

I care not for vengeance, {name}. I only ask that their remains be returned to me for proper burial.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you, <name>. Their spirits will be at peace now.
Title: A Thorn in our Side

Description: Information we've received from Executor Arren in Deathknell contain all the details we need to wipe the human infestation from the lands.  According to the information, The Scarlet Crusade has assigned Captain Perrine and a brigade to the ruined tower southwest of Brill.

Kill 3 of his zealots and 3 of his missionaries.  And while you're there, see if you can dig up any other information about what they're up to.

 Quest Hand-in: It sounds like we'll have to keep our eyes out for this Voss character.  I don't expect any Forsaken to receive a reward if we capture her... I'm just worried she'll eventually turn against us.
Title: Scanning the Stacks

Description: Hi, {name}! Do you want to play a game?

I have been reading about the greatest hide and seek game in all of Azeroth!

I think I can improve on the strategies this book suggests. Let us play a round and test my hypothesis!

 Quest Hand-in: I need to refine my strategy. You are really good at finding!I love hide and seek! Let us play again sometime!
Title: Acquisition: Runeforged Shackles

Description: <The chains here are carved with domination runes, imbuing them with the magic needed to subdue the most powerful of the Mawsworn's prisoners.

No doubt Ve'nari could find some use in studying these runes.>

 Quest Hand-in: Chains? Not exactly hard to find around here... wait, those runes...You have a keen eye, indeed. The magic here is worth further study.
Title: Winterfall Runners

Description: Very interesting, {name}...

When this toxic substance is mixed with the water from the hot springs, it loses its toxicity, only retaining the ability to temporarily affect those that ingest it. This must be why the Winterfall protect the hot springs so fervently -- they need them to purify their firewater.

We need to stop this -- cut off contact between the Winterfall and the Deadwood. A group of runners walks the distance between their village and Felwood. Find and defeat them, and steal their shipment.

 Quest Hand-in: <Donova examines the contents of the crate.>I wonder if consuming this substance makes the furbolg more aggressive. They do seem much larger...
Title: An Undead's Best Friend

Description: As is usual practice, the undead at the saronite quarry to the southwest starve plaguehounds to keep them extra aggressive. Use the shade to get up close and feed some of those hounds and I promise you they'll be content to leave you alone, if not side with the hand that fed them.

Don't get too close to those things until you've fed them though. Their noses don't fall victim to your shade's elusiveness.

 Quest Hand-in: Put them right to sleep, didn't it?
Title: Elemental Influence

Description: Narn says not all the Rustpines followed Stoneheart or the Primalists.

Some resisters are held against their will. Totems spewing rock and mud restrain them... to force them to obey. 

Shatter the totems. Set them free!

 Quest Hand-in: I will never forgive the Primalists for making our clan suffer.
Title: Parts Unknown

Description: Brambley... I still canna' believe it.

I canna' leave the lad here... not in this place... not like this.

Help me find the rest of him, so I can take his remains back home where he belongs.

We'll give him a proper burial... it's what he deserves!

 Quest Hand-in: <Angus wipes away a tear as he speaks.>Brambley, lad... I promise ye'll have tha' best burial money can buy! An' all the ale ye can drink...
Title: Return Lost Souls

Description: Souls continue to pour into the Maw. As long as this is still happening, we need to save as many as possible!

The Jailer twists the cycle of life and rebirth. This cannot be allowed to continue! We must thwart his plans.

Return to the Maw and rescue those that you can.

 Quest Hand-in: Oh, wonderful news!I will make sure these souls are well taken care of here in Ardenweald.
Title: Hoard Behavior

Description: The whelps like to spend time with Sir Pringly, but their treading over the space has worn down his habitat.

Would you retrieve another shrubbery for him? And while you are out, he could use an adorable new toy. And incense.

We cannot let his space fall into disrepair, of course.

 Quest Hand-in: The habitat is looking wonderful, <name>.This should last Sir Pringly for a while until the whelps wear it out again.
Title: King Da'ka

Description: King Da'ka? More like King Dooker.

My king sent me to talk to this new king. This new king took my things and tried to take my wings.

Negotiations are ooked. Go, sticket to that angry wikket.

 Quest Hand-in: Good. Gorillas gotta learn: Kings gotta earn. If they not earn, they not learn.
Title: Overthrone

Description: The council is in harmony, wakener.

Our ritual will bring about the demise of the empress and allow us to secure the future of our great empire.

Behold the power of the Klaxxi!

 Quest Hand-in: We are... undone, wakener.Your efforts appear to have become imperative to our cause.On behalf of the remaining council, I implore you to continue in your assistance.
Title: Suit Up!

Description: There... I've created a disguise that should make you indistinguishable from the Scourge.

You'll be free to walk among them as long as the disguise holds. Only the blightguards will be able to see through my illusion. Watch out for them!

Another thing you must know is that the disguise is unstable and may drop unexpectedly, so stay alert.

Let's test it out. Use the choker and visit the Scourge vendor just east of here. Return to me with a bottle of bitter plasma.

 Quest Hand-in: So? How are you enjoying Scourge life?Believe me, it's not all it's cracked up to be....
Title: Forbidden Practices

Description: You come at a good time, {name}. I have need of a weapon such as yourself.

Yazma's spies say dere are blood cultists in our ranks. King Rastakhan has charged me with tracking down any trolls guilty of practicing blood magic and purging dem.

Take dis totem, route out those with de stench of blood magic, and cleanse dem from dis holy place.

When you are done, tell dat lazy Hexlord Raal to get off his perch and help keep dis place secure.

 Quest Hand-in: What? Dat sneering, vile raptor zealot is calling me out for not doing my share? Bah!
Title: From the Shadows

Description: He turned into one of them... didn't he?  How do we even begin to fight an enemy that can do this to us?

My father's arsenal's certainly a good start, I suppose.

Worgen are hiding in the alleys ahead.  Take one of my mastiffs to find them more easily.

We're going to need to clear the way ahead if we're going to move these cannons above ground.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent.  I'll start rounding up some help to get these cannons positioned.
Title: Show Them Gnome Mercy!

Description: <The blood drains out of Toshley's face.>

These orbs are made up of both nether energy and souls, some of them gnome souls!

How dare they!  Were they the ones killing our people that traveled north?!

{name}, you must put a stop to this, and the only way to do that is to finish off their leader, Nexus-Prince Razaan.

You'll have to coax him out of hiding though.  I'm guessing that you can do that by killing a lot of his Razaani ethereal.

Bring me the collection of souls that he no doubt has.

 Quest Hand-in: Good riddance to him!  Thank you for putting an end to their macabre twisting of magic and technology.As a true hero of gnomes everywhere, I hereby bequeath unto you our highest honor... some power converters and your pick of any of these.I know that you'll put them to good use!
Title: Side Effects

Description: Scrapper Minoire's use of enhancers creates unpredictable betting implications. It is quite unhealthy... for our profits!

For a nominal fee, Au'larrynar can provide you with a "special" enhancer that Minoire will not be able to resist: a potion that turns the one who imbibes it into the ultimate combatant... and teaches them a lesson in restraint, as well.

I cannot wait to see Minoire's next match in the arena!

 Quest Hand-in: Scrapper Minoire will have to forfeit her spot in the contest.
Title: Mystery Solved

Description: Your efforts have paid off. The great risks you have taken have proven worthwhile.

You have discovered the object of the nagas' desire and their reason for overrunning the coast of Desolace.

As for the engravings you've discovered, your duty is clear...

 Quest Hand-in: The vision was true!You have singlehandedly succeeded where others have failed.The Circle will have no choice but to pay attention to these findings.
Title: Blood Tour

Description: My legs are getting a little restless again.  You interested in taking a little tour, {name}?

We're going to take a trip around Dreadmaul Rock.  I'd like to investigate some of the Blackrock army before we make our move, and I figure we might as well kill some of them while we're on the way.

 Quest Hand-in: <Keeshan is covered in blood and sweat.>That was exactly what I needed.
Title: Just A Folk Story

Description: What!?! This don't make any sense! <Fish's face falls.>

What's this mumber jumber about a maiden and an ancestor and a buncha stairs?

I can't make any reason outta this, can you?

Well, there are lotsa folks 'round here who're much older than you and me, {name}.

Can you go talk to the folks in Halfhill? I betcha they might know somethin'! 

 Quest Hand-in: Of course! It makes perfect sense. So the location of the treasure must be where the lake meets the mountains!
Title: The Looming Dark

Description: It is good you have returned safely from Revendreth, {name}. We sensed a betrayal that has shifted the infinite threads of fate.

The Maw surges with power. We must know the cause.

 Quest Hand-in: You have done well. See that you continue to do so.
Title: A Stone Cold Gamble

Description: The second target is a basilisk called Stonefang that lives off the bank of the nearby river. 

I put a bigger wager on him, so if you can take him out I'll make sure you get a cut.

I'll need his jaw to verify the kill. Hurry, before those tauren get him first!

 Quest Hand-in: Well, well. I half expected to find your statue on the riverbank. You're gonna get a nice payout once those tauren get back...You haven't seen them around, have you?
Title: A Dormant Burner

Description: I've heard that someone over in the engineering shop is selling a burner that might be usable. You could likely negotiate a fairer price than I could!

The shop is just across the street. I'll make a note on your map for you.

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, this burner is exactly what we need for the alchemy table!Wait just a moment... No, no, this will never do!
Title: Collective Soul

Description: Souls in Maldraxxus are bound together in war. We draw strength and wisdom from those around us.

Should you fall in battle, part of you would remain with your fellow soldiers. Just as they would remain with you. 

Plague Deviser Marileth has volunteered to teach you the process of soulbinding. From what I have seen, yours will be a powerful bond.

 Quest Hand-in: I'm so pleased to see you again, my apprentice!
Title: He's Gone Mad!

Description: Ol' Wildtusk has withstood years of attacks by young hunters that are overeager and underskilled.

None could take him.

His wounds have finally done him in. He just won't go down. Find that crazy riverbeast bull, and help him let go of his mortal shell.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you for helping him on his way.Dat Wildtusk, he has been watching dese hills for years long past. Some beast will have big shoes to fill!
Title: Contribute Supplies: Irontree Branch

Description: I'm always glad to collect rare materials for better fishing gear.

If your harpoon is good enough already, bring me any spare irontree branches you find.

 Quest Hand-in: A good, solid branch. Thank you, my friend.
Title: Analynn

Description: I see you have once again found me. I presume you wish to do battle once more? Yes, let's.

 Quest Hand-in: Your pets are ecstatic about their victory. I hope you are as well.
Title: Speak with the Dead

Description: So many souls perished beneath the waves. Too many sacrificed for her ambition.

It is strange that the spirits here have not departed. I wonder if they even know they are dead?

Still, their knowledge might be useful to us. If you could question the spirits, they might be able to point us in the right direction.

 Quest Hand-in: The Javelins? I thought them lost!
Title: Restoration: The Bradensbrook Investigation

Description: We have uncovered forged orders from the Shore. They have a fel influence about them. They guide the reader to believe they are legitimate. It orders Black Rook Hold to attack a "demonic enclave" just south of their walls. There's only one enclave they could be talking about, Bradensbrook!

Is it possible these would be able to convince the undead to attack Bradensbrook? You should head there immediately and either warn them, or render aid.

Specialization: Restoration Shaman

 Quest Hand-in: A bit late for the warning, eh? Still, I appreciate that we haven't been forgotten.
Title: No Friend of Mine

Description: Tools. I cannot work without my tools!

Famos, my former apprentice, stole them all when she went to the Forsworn.

It breaks my heart. She had so much promise.

She must be stopped.

 Quest Hand-in: My tools. At least Famos took care of them.
Title: Full of Surprises

Description: You continue to surprise me Maw Walker, your presence here is most unexpected!

Since we are both here, I believe we should work together.

The Jailer has a vault full of valuables, somewhere in this rift.  Locate it for me, or bring it here to be opened and we'll share the wealth together!

 Quest Hand-in: This is quite a profitable partnership. I am certain Cartel Ve will be most unhappy with our success.
Title: Stonedark Relics

Description: The murlocs managed to steal some of our sacred relics and carry them down into the lower cavern.

While we warm up, do you think you could go find them?

 Quest Hand-in: You found them! Not sure how you carried them all at one time...
Title: Stabilizing Suramar

Description: Elisande's plan has backfired. She thought to stamp out our rebellion by making an example of the Waning Crescent. 

Instead, she ignited the flame of the shal'dorei better than I ever could.

We must maintain a cohesive campaign against Elisande and the Legion by fighting them in every corner of Suramar. 

Show the people that there is still hope - that there are still heroes willing to fight for them!

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you, <name>. Every day we come closer to freedom for Suramar.
Title: Samophlange

Description: The Venture Company have a small research facility west of here, just past the Sludge Fen. I don't know very much about what they're doing, but did manage to discover that they're experimenting with something called a "samophlange".

Now what the heck is a samophlange? Well, whatever it is, I want to examine it, so I need someone to go get it.

I obtained a copy of their control system operating manual, you should be able to figure out how to disengage the samophlange from it.

 Quest Hand-in: A variety of buttons, levers, and blinking lights are somewhat erratically arrayed on the face of the control console. A small gauge indicates that the apparatus is currently operating within optimal levels, and indicates that control valves one through three are currently open. There is a small keyhole set into the lower right side of the control panel.
Title: Goodnight, Gronn

Description: I've outdone myself again.  I've fashioned a sleeping powder for you to use on Grulloc, the gronn I spoke of who is guarding what I want.

Grulloc keeps himself at the Cursed Hollow, an area at the eastern edge of Dragons' End on the other side of the Circle of Blood.

If I were you, I wouldn't tarry long once you have his sack.  The effects of the dust won't last long.

 Quest Hand-in: <Baron Sablemane peers inside the gronn's sack and seems satisfied.>Very well, you have upheld your end of the bargain.  And now, I will gift your Commander Stonewall with the trap.
Title: Sindragosa and Malygos's Rest

Description: The preparations are now complete. Kalecgos and Alexstrasza should be here soon with the remaining essences of Sindragosa and Malygos.

Both suffered such violent ends. I heard even with his last breath, Malygos cursed Alexstrasza.

And Sindragosa--she was slain ten thousand years ago by Nelthar... by Deathwing. Yet she was reanimated by the Lich King and slain by adventurers. I can only imagine the state this essence is in...

Forgive my ramblings. Kalecgos and Alexstrasza should be here shortly.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you for aiding Senegos, <name>.It's time to return to the archives.
Title: WANTED: Junkbrat and Roadtrogg

Description: Responsible for a spree of mayhem and chaos throughout the Heaps, resulting in the theft of energy cells, spare parts, and the consumption of Improbable Mechano-Chicken Wings without payment.

Special caution around Roadtrogg, who has demonstrated a violent attitude towards living things.

Elimination of these two felons is of the highest priority.

 Quest Hand-in: It's about time we saw the last of those two!
Title: Butler to the Great

Description: A ghostly dinner party awaits, ready for the spread and its dinner guests.

 Quest Hand-in: I can't believe it's finally over.
Title: The Eternal Palace: We Can Make It Stronger...

Description: Now that it's functioning, it occurred to me while repairing it that it has the capability to output even more energy.

Of course that'll require stronger materials to upgrade and the only place I can think of is in the Eternal Palace.

Azshara's army and even herself carry items of extraordinary power. If you could bring some of those back, I could at the very least test my theory and see if it's viable.

 Quest Hand-in: Yes, these'll do nicely. Good work, <name>.I'll get started right away on upgrading the core.
Title: Elemental Goo

Description: Instead of using the tired old method of setting gems into rings and such, I use an innovative new method.  I simply glue on the gems with Barnsworth Elemental Glue!  The professor needs more elemental goo for another batch, though, and I have a whole bunch of setting to do.  Can you go get me some?

 Quest Hand-in: Thanks.  Erm.  Just set them over there.  I need to figure out how to get my hand off of this jar�
Title: Eel Filet

Description: Yes? What is it?

 Quest Hand-in: My favorite! How did you know?I will cook it up for the camp, everyone is going to enjoy this.
Title: Payback

Description: We thought we were safe behind Leafshadow's cloaking veil.

<Vindicator Kaluud wipes the blood from his face.>

Someone told the Shadow Council's forces how to disable it. We were able to hold them off at first...

Most of the town was slaughtered in the attack. Please, you must avenge our fallen. Rout these invaders out from Telmor forever!

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent. The shards are at last together!
Title: An Opportunistic Strike

Description: I'm impressed you made it this far. But don't get too full of yourself.

Most of the fodder you plowed your way through were amateurs at best. Only one combatant will leave this arena a champion.

Each of the five... uh, three houses has fighters in the field. Most merely seek to test their own limits or earn a bit of favor. Only a few have a real chance at claiming victory.

Seek out those challengers if you wish to claim true glory this day.

 Quest Hand-in: Still walking on two legs? My hopes for you are rising.
Title: In My Sights

Description: I used up all me bullets on a wee invention of mine. I call it: Tha Deployable Bullet Dispenser!

Oh aye. It shoots in-der-scriminantly wit'out all that messy and time-consumin' "aiming" or "thinkin'" that us people-folk are wont ta do.

We had deployed quite a few of 'em east o' here when this swarm of plants came a'thrashin from tha trees.

I didn't 'ave time ta go back an' get me turrets. Would ye mind gettin' them back fer me? Or at least, what's left of 'em?

 Quest Hand-in: Ohhh me poor innocent bullet dispensers! Look what they've done ta yeh.Well at least they went down shootin', tha's how I'd like ta go.Ere's tha schematic fer 'em. Deploy 'em near somethun' yeh don't like!
Title: The Frostwolves Stand Ready

Description: Though we have lost much this day, the Frostwolves stand ready to uphold our pact with your people.

To honor this agreement, some of my clan have asked to join your ranks and fight alongside your forces.

Our numbers are strained so I ask that you chose only one.

Speak with me when you have made your decision.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent choice. I will be sad to see them leave, but I know they will help strengthen our combined packs in the coming conflicts.I will see that they make their way to your garrison as soon as they have said farewell to their loved ones.They should be ready the next time you need to send followers on a mission.
Title: Corrupted Whipper Root

Description: You have found a sickly, corrupted version of what appears to be a whipper root plant.  The visible roots of the plant appear tough and leathery, and a slimy film hangs from the plant.  It desperately needs some sort of attention if it is to be turned back to normal.

 Quest Hand-in: You apply three Cenarion plant salves to the whipper root. It immediately begins to shed its corrupted form, blossoming into a vibrant and healthy plant.
Title: Runnin' On Empty

Description: I've never seen this quality of oil! Problem is the oil needed a little extra refinin'.

I heard of this system where you use ocean water to speed up the process. I don't have time to waste down here, so I just threw the barrels into the bay.

Pretty good idea, I know. Problem is, I'm not sure how to pull it out of the bay...

Maybe someone of your expertise could help me out.

 Quest Hand-in: Oh, yuck! Why are these barrels wet?! Oh nevermind! At least you got here before they made me work. I can't think of anything more horrible!
Title: First Degree Mortar

Description: Hey bud! Like explosions? Of course you do. Who doesn't like explosions?!

I've got mortars set up on the ridge to the east to hold the naga back. Go forth, recruit. Mortar them... mortar them all! Ahahahah.

 Quest Hand-in: Can you believe they PAY us to do this?
Title: WANTED: Lady Naz'jess

Description: Wanted for attacks against the people of Nazjatar. 

Lady Naz'jess has been driving the weapon masters to create crueler devices.

Last seen skulking about Zanj'ir Terrace. She is vicious, proceed with caution.

Upon completion of the mission, report to Seacaller Unow for commendation.

 Quest Hand-in: Well done, <class>. Lady Naz'jess had become a thorn in the side of the people here.
Title: Alpacas Gone Wild

Description: Our herd of alpacas escaped dis morning. Dey're out dere wandering de dunes as we speak.

Probably for de best, if you ask me. We'll all be dead soon once Mojambo comes back.

Since you seem to care so much, take dis alpaca whistle and use it to round dem up. I blow de whistle every day at feeding time, so de alpacas should come running home when dey hear de sound.

 Quest Hand-in: Looks like you recovered most of de herd. Good work... even though Mojambo and his henchmons will probably murder us in our sleep and take de alpacas for demselves...
Title: Escaping the Mist

Description: I can hear the mist creatures outside. Their yells are driving me mad, but I dare not try to escape. And where would I even go? How long would it be until they caught up with me and executed me like the others?

I wonder, how far has the mist crept, stranger? Has it overtaken this whole continent?

Would you be willing to help me try and escape the mist? I think I can lead us back toward my father. I still sense his life spirit. He is close.

 Quest Hand-in: It is whispered in the winds, friend. Your name is known to the elements. You have done a great service to Mootoo on this day and you shall be rewarded.
Title: The Heart of the Forest

Description: I knew we were gonna get along! Welcome to our covenant. Well, almost.

There's just a few details left. Little things. You know. Oaths to be made, blood pacts to sort out, firstborns to be promised.

<Moonberry snorts a laugh.>

I'm just kidding!

Well, not about the oaths part. We take those seriously around here.

I'll meet you at the camp outside the Heart of the Forest!

 Quest Hand-in: This is going to be such fun!
Title: Patchwork Command

Description: Recent events make it even more apparent that holing up here and making sporadic attacks isn't enough to keep our kind safe, much less retake Grim Batol. We need to be more aggressive, we need to strike into their heart.

I've agreed to send dragons to the aid of your commanders. They were already hatching a plan to strike at Grim Batol, so you should focus your attention there first.

You should be able to find Patch in Dragonmaw Pass, in the canyon below us to the south.

 Quest Hand-in: You got the dragons in the game! Good on you.We'd already laid out plans for our ambush by the time the dragons contacted us. They're helping by cutting off their retreat.It's not too late for you to join in on the fun though. We saved some for you.
Title: Wendies

Description: It's a mystery where these boys were taken, but it ain't much of a mystery who did it. Roughnecks believe an eye for an eye and then some.

Let's put down some of those monstrosities.

 Quest Hand-in: This'll help protect my boys down the hill. Well done.
Title: Chicken of the Desert

Description: I've got an idea, but we're going to need bait.

The other day I saw a rabid blisterpaw hyena wander too close to the edge of the chasm, and one of the silithid comes diving out of nowhere. Nearly swallowed it whole! Horrible sight.

So we're gonna need hyena meat, obviously. Go gather some, make sure it's fresh, and bring it back here. There should be plenty just north of the camp.

 Quest Hand-in: Man, this stuff looks delicious. I'm half tempted to just fry some up myself.No! We've gotta focus on gettin' out of here.Maybe just one piece...
Title: Keep Them at Bay

Description: This wretched Westfall Brigade is proving a tougher opponent than we'd thought. Though few in number, they fight well and bravely, but we cannot afford to wait them out.

Conqueror Krenna's orders were to capture the port quickly. You must break the stalemate, {name}. Find the enemy's marines and slaughter them until the resistance ceases. Only then will we be able to claim ownership of the port.

Go quickly. We don't want to keep Conqueror Krenna waiting.

 Quest Hand-in: The port will soon fall to us. You have done well this day, <name>.
Title: Knock 'Em Out The Box

Description: Steelarm Pillagers have been taking all our parts and selling them to Bondo's gang.

Last night they stole all our Spiderspring Gears. The parts are in a bunch of crates they're guarding.

We need you to get our gears back, and show those Steelarm Pillagers they should pick on someone else.

 Quest Hand-in: Now we can assemble the mount's main spring drive!
Title: It Takes Guts....

Description: Greetings, {class}. It is kind of you to stop and listen to Kraz's tale.

For many years Kraz has strained to hear the spirits and do their bidding.

Recently,  many voices have been crying to Kraz from these ruins. They seek for a peace they cannot find on their own.

If you would help the spirits of those who have come before, enter this crypt and collect something that once belonged to those tormented souls.

 Quest Hand-in: Entrails? An interesting choice, <race>.Kraz shall see what is to be learned from them. Thank you for braving the depths of that place.
Title: Fruit of the Bloom

Description: We never know when something new may emerge from the confluence of creation and energy.

The Catalyst Gardens have blossomed with a new crop of fruit. Their seeds may have special properties, and we wish to understand them.

Please gather what you can find, and make the gardens safer for the future.

 Quest Hand-in: There is so much to learn from just these little seeds. What will they grow into? Will the vombata eat them?Thank you for helping me to understand this place further.
Title: Befriending the Locals

Description: Commander, I believe it best for the safety of this outpost if we secure an ally. We've made contact with one of the outcast arakkoa, but he refused to make any promises of alliance without speaking to you first.

He called himself Dusk-Seer Irrizar. Could you go speak with him, commander?

You can find him just southwest of Veil Terokk.

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, so you are the one your people spoke of so highly. We may discuss an alliance, but first...
Title: The Hidden Clutch

Description: With the major black dragons out of the Badlands, it is now safe to move the egg again.  You will find me on a small plateau, north of New Kargath.

Come and find me.

 Quest Hand-in: The egg must always be moving.  We are not safe anywhere.Deathwing, even in his madness, knows all the hidden places in this world.  The egg must not rest.
Title: Danger Near and Far

Description: We have done all we can about the Jailer for now, my friend. 

Other matters require our attention. Like the devourer rifts I recently saw opening to the east! 

If we do not stop them, those beasts will wreak havoc on this place.

Will you help me take care of them, {name}?

 Quest Hand-in: Someone inside needs our help!
Title: A Soul Saved

Description: Vyraz... all this time...

This cannot stand, {name}. We must avenge Krexus and cut him down!

He must have sent you to the Maw expecting that you would never return. He underestimated you. A fatal mistake.

Go with Mograine and claim Vyraz's head. I will warn our forces at the Seat of the Primus.

 Quest Hand-in: I cannot allow this wound to fester any longer. I will burn it closed here and now!
Title: Aid the Wounded

Description: <This Zandalari appears to be barely holding on.

There is a broken dart lying on the ground next to him. He appears to have dropped this bottle before he collapsed.

You grab the vial. Could it be some kind of antidote?>

 Quest Hand-in: Thanks, stranger. Dat was too close.
Title: Taking the Overlook Back

Description: There is only one way for us to take Largo's Overlook back.

I think you know what we need to do {name}.  Largo is pretty paranoid these days so you should be able to find him on top of the tower, looking for his imaginary navy to finally arrive.

 Quest Hand-in: Ha, we finally got Largo!  Nice one, <name>.
Title: Tools of War

Description: Zepik tell me that you maybe the best gorloc hunter he met... other than Zepik. Still big battle to southwest - you go help.

Zepik keeps some of biggest, baddest traps in his stash at Kartak's Hold... told Vekgar to use them for battle, so you use them too. Go pick out any traps you want and kill lots of big-tongues.

Lots and lots!

 Quest Hand-in: You almost as good with those traps as Zepik!
Title: The Egg Thieves

Description: The Bloodclaw are sadistic creatures. They have attacked the Ravenskar before and have stolen the eggs of the sacred ravens.

While you are within the Bloodclaw lands keep an eye out for the eggs.

I'll be waiting for you at the nest with as many baskets for them as I can gather.

 Quest Hand-in: These poor ravens have avoided a horrible future in the Bloodclaw lands.We will take far better care of them.Thank you!
Title: How to Save a Life

Description: Gunny is dying from a powerful curse, {name}.

Grand Warlock Nethekurse augments his power with a pair of mystical braziers. If you bring me an ember from that brazier, perhaps it can counteract the dark magic?

 Quest Hand-in: He was a good soldier.
Title: Enchanted Lock

Description: <The lock appears to be secured by a magical mechanism.

It is clearly one of Mardivas', and from what you can surmise from reading the journals, it is likely locked via an arcane puzzle.

You look around the room, and see something odd in the water.>

 Quest Hand-in: <With the puzzle complete, the lock springs open with a satisfying click.It seems that Mardivas' devised a series of similar such puzzles with which to secure his belongings.>
Title: A Worthy Weapon

Description: Of all the times to have such rotten luck!

My tournament blade has gone missing. I've heard the bards telling tales of travelers offering winter hyacinths to a lonely maiden in return for gifts. Those hyacinths grow only on the ice flowing from the Ironwall Dam, on Crystalsong Forest's northwestern border with Icecrown. Gather the flowers and take them to the circle of lamps in Drak'Mar Lake in northeastern Dragonblight, near Zul'Drak and Grizzly Hills. Ask the lonely maiden for a worthy blade.


 Quest Hand-in: This is a fine weapon that will help me crush the competition. Thank you, <name>.
Title: Severed Communications

Description: We've had a contact embedded in Magisters' Terrace gathering intelligence for us for some time now, but we've lost contact with him.

The information he was collecting is vital to our mission.

 Quest Hand-in: ...Come closer, <race>... Listen carefully to my words....
Title: Sowing Discord

Description: The Alliance reinforcements have established a foothold in the southwest region of Silverpine called 7th Legion Base Camp. Our primary goal at the base camp is to sow discord amongst the troops. This is a lightning fast assassination mission to kill their field commander, General Marstone. His death won't stop the Alliance advance, but it will certainly soften their ranks.

 Quest Hand-in: The rest of the Alliance fleet will arrive shortly, only to find their base camp decimated. Now for the second and most important part of our battle plan.
Title: The Collapse

Description: I have created and bound Alluvius using the Horn of Elemental Fury. He will respond to the horn's call when you stand near the southernmost sinkhole in the Geyser Fields.

The quake Alluvius will unleash should collapse the Nerubian tunnels and put an end to their flanking attack. I wouldn't be surprised if the Nerubian commander showed himself after the quake. If the collapse of the tunnels doesn't break the back of their assault, the defeat of their leader surely will.

 Quest Hand-in: Your efforts against the Nerubians have given us a reprieve from the overwhelming Scourge assault. Thanks to your accomplishments, we can strike at the Scourge fortress to the northeast without fear of attack from the west.As for the horn, I will safeguard it until next we need its power. Stormhoof gave his life to secure the horn and we cannot suffer its loss again.
Title: Finishin' the Job

Description: My team has finished settin' up th' powder kegs and th' detonator at the bottom o' th' cave in th' western part of Frostmane Hold. All you need to do is venture down there and activate th' detonator to explode the powder and collapse those tunnels.

That'll stop th' flow of troggs from th' deep parts of th' earth. Mekkatorque'll have an easier time of dealin' with the remainin' troggs if you can take out their leader, who calls 'imself Boss Bruggor. Good luck, {name}.

 Quest Hand-in: I could feel th' explosion way up here! My boys did a fine job riggin' up that blast, but it wouldn't have happened without your help. It's only fair that I split my contract payment with you for helpin' me finish th' job.
Title: A Hero's Headgear

Description: Rejek hears tales of giant metal men on faraway Stormwright's Shelf. Far to northwest, outside basin's lip, you will find it.

Imagine Rejek using heads of giant metal men as helmet. Make Rejek unstoppable! Make Rejek mighty!

You get for Rejek, but metal head might not come off metal body easy. Maybe steal bombs from little green men and their friends at Swindlegrin's Dig near Suntouched Pillar? Use bombs to get head off metal body, then bring to Rejek.

 Quest Hand-in: Rejek sees you were successful! Now Rejek try on new war helmet.
Title: Singed

Description: Standing here, seeing these two Sundered Flame before me, there is no more anger. I see the confusion in their eyes and how they look at each other... They are so uncertain of their future.

They remind me of myself and the moment I emerged alone, my creche dead and forgotten by passing ages.

I have to talk to them, {name}. Will you accompany me? As a friend?

 Quest Hand-in: Perhaps I could help them cope with their feelings of abandonment. Maybe... I can reconcile my own past and lead them to a better future--one they deserve.
Title: A Fistful of Slivers

Description: It's a shame that we've lost control of many of the creatures here on the island.  This was once a tranquil place of study and research.  Now it's all we can do to keep from being attacked by our own creations!

I'm going to offer you a chance to receive a magical boon in exchange for some collecting work on your part.  Bring me a stack of arcane slivers that are found on the mana-using creatures of Sunstrider Isle, and I will cast a spell on you that should aid your adventures on the isle.

 Quest Hand-in: Splendid - these will do nicely.  I've been doing quite a bit of thinking on the current malaise Sunstrider Isle suffers under.  One possible course of action I had pondered was to collect these arcane slivers from the beasts on the isle.  In doing so, they could be experimented on; this would provide a potential source of culpability.Anyway, I will tend to the research.  Allow me to place this incantation on you.  I believe you'll make good use of it!
Title: Supplying in Weight

Description: I really screwed up this time. I only stepped away from the campsite for a moment, but I barely returned in time to see the tarasek snatching up everything I had not bolted down.

Those supplies were expensive, and I can't exactly ask for help getting more! My sister Nori thinks I'm inept enough as it is.

If you are sure you want to head through the valley, would you mind keeping an eye out for any stray bags of supplies?

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you, <name>, but we have bigger things to worry about now.
Title: A Fizzy Fusion

Description: I'm sure you've made a lot of potions in your time as an alchemist. How would you like to help with something a bit more light-hearted?

I've always wanted to try creating a fruit-flavored version of our popular fizzy drinks. If you're willing to give it a try, you can buy some of the base drink from me and mix it with some moonberry juice.

Any innkeeper in Elwynn Forest or Mulgore should be able to sell you enough juice to make your creation.

 Quest Hand-in: Your creation looks promising. With any luck, we'll soon have a new favorite!Thanks for your help!
Title: A Worthy Hunt

Description: Wisdom is not gained. It is earned. If you wish to prove yourself worthy, you will do so in the manner of my people: learning as we act.

Find and hunt Thousandmile, the Elderbull, he who has escaped hunt for generations.

From this, you will gain the wisdom you seek.

 Quest Hand-in: The path to mastery is slow but steady. Honor the journey.If you seek additional wisdom, continue the good hunt. There will always be quests in the world, creatures to hunt and learn from.And I shall be here to help you understand the knowledge you gain.
Title: Thieving Little Pluckers

Description: I don't have the most glamorous job in the world.

I do not concern myself with matters of war or the deep mysteries of the halls of Uldum or what have you.

I am in charge of these grounds... and these grounds grow dates.

Now, these little date-plucking mongrels have gotten gutsy enough to stand on each other's shoulders to try and steal my precious fruit.

I will not stand for this.

Take this mallet, crafted by the titans, blessed by the sun-kings and who-knows-what-else and smash the runts!

 Quest Hand-in: You showed those thieving little scoundrels!  Great job.
Title: Lao-Fe the Slavebinder

Description: You can hear the spirit of Lao-Fe, the Slavebinder shouting taunts from the cave at the top of Tu Shen Burial Mound.

Defeating him will surely serve to ensure victory for the spirits of the pandaren monks.

 Quest Hand-in: Lao-Fe the Slavebinder was one of the most spiteful and vicious mogu of his time. May defeating his spirit act as a reminder to all the mogu in the vale of the fate that awaits them if they seek to defile the sacred pools again.Your strength is unquestionable. You have my respect, <class>.
Title: Trading Favors: Spires of Ascension

Description: The Kyrians of Bastion serve a unique role in the Shadowlands, ferrying mortal souls from their realms to ours. They are able to do so in great numbers, it would seem, in times of crisis or devastation.

We would like to know more about their travels to the realms beyond. 

Surely one of them has brought something back from another land? They are, after all, so very interested in memories.

 Quest Hand-in: A strange bauble, likely from another world. Yet, why would the paragon have brought this with her? Perhaps when carrying the soul of a child, as a reminder of something she had thought lost within herself? I will ponder this.You may choose a reward from our stores.
Title: Any Portal in a Storm

Description: Our friends in the Earthen Ring have been trying to open portals back to Stormwind, with no luck. But Thordun here tells me he might just have the key.

The crazed water elementals in the nearby Verrall River Delta have been sent into a frenzy. Thordun tells me we can channel their energy into a portal.

I don't understand all this elemental-claptrap, but I understand one thing: killin' elementals and takin' their whirlpool cores. Deliver them to Talaa in the courtyard! 

 Quest Hand-in: My word, <name>. These elemental energies are so powerful, so chaotic - no wonder the Twilight's Hammer has chosen to build their stronghold here!I should be able to channel these energies into something more benign and productive though. Let's give it a try...
Title: A Few Artifact Fragments

Description: Every little bit counts.

 Quest Hand-in: Every little bit helps.
Title: Legion: The Legion Returns

Description: Heroes of the Alliance, I write to you in Azeroth's darkest hour. From the maw of hell, the burning armies of the Legion have returned.

Our fleets depart for the Broken Isles at once. As a grand lance, we will pierce the Legion's lines and drive them back to the nether that spawned them.

Your ship awaits in the Stormwind Harbor, make haste.

 Quest Hand-in: Hail, <name>. I've got your ship assignment right here.But first, a bit of readiness is in order!
Title: Proof of Treachery

Description: Although Onyxia has been exposed and removed from the court, the Defias who carried out her plan must be punished. Carry word to Grand Admiral Jes-Tereth in Stormwind castle that the Defias are the ones who carried out the Varian's kidnapping. I have little doubt that Stormwind's armies will mete out swift and terrible justice to those involved.

I can use my magic to expedite your trip to Stormwind. Just speak to me when you're prepared to go, {name}.

 Quest Hand-in: So it was the Defias who served as the hands of Onyxia in this plot?<The admirall's face grows red with anger and her hands clench into fists.>You and Lady Jaina have done Stormwind a great service this day. The traitors will not live long enough to regret their crimes.
Title: A Proper Fate

Description: Warlord Kalithresh is in charge of the entire Steamvault operation.

I need you to kill him, {name}. The naga have left us with no option but violence.

Show him no mercy.

 Quest Hand-in: I wish it had not come to this, but the naga refused all attempts to negotiate.
Title: Wings Over Mount Hyjal

Description: {name}, is it true you're going to try to commune with the ancients?

Southwest of here is the Shrine of Aviana, the matron of all flying creatures. It's the home of my favorite instructor, Choluna. I've never encountered one who was so deeply in touch with the spirits of this world. You could learn a lot from her!

The recent attacks have isolated the shrine. But it's easily accessible from the air - look for the second biggest tree on Hyjal. Good luck!

 Quest Hand-in: Oh, you were sent here by Tiala? A wonderful student, she'll do many great things.Although I sense even greater potential from you.Please, stay a while in our shrine. There's much to do, but you can't accomplish anything with a troubled mind.
Title: Aftershocks

Description: These precocious whelps seem to be trying to recreate the very bomb that leveled Theramore. Predictably, they have yet to succeed. Still, I would rather not give them the chance to stumble into a more effective solution.

If our dear Aspect wishes to avoid simply turning the whole lot of them into mana dust, then I suppose I can refrain from carpeting the ruin in spellfrost. Someone will need to go and repossess their banal attempts at ordinance, though.

Do take care not to set them off, hmm?
