 Quest Hand-in: Well, <class>, I suppose you are not as hapless as most mortals who cross my path. You may deserve some modicum of recognition for your deft work....not from me, mind you. If you want a pat on the head, go ask Kalecgos.
Title: A Message of Terrible Import

Description: Your scout... he got me out of that hellish place. Fel orcs surprised us out in the jungle and dragged us up the mountain. They tortured us... killed all but me. I fear one of us may have given up our secret before the end.

I must ask you to go to the home of our order. Speak with Lagar, my leader, tell him... tell him Gul'dan knows.

 Quest Hand-in: We will speak more of this later, but thank you.
Title: Driftwood Derby

Description: One of the challenges of any new village is finding enough raw building materials. Fortunately, the ocean often brings us exactly what we need.

Take my boat and sail around the island. Along the way, you can collect driftwood in nets. But be wary. You may attract some unwanted attention!

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent work! This will help us build new homes, tools, and everything we need for a life here.We'll put it all to good use.
Title: A Minor Substitution

Description: Krenna, she be wantin' worg hides for all the outfits.  There's not gonna be enough worg hides for her army, though.  Not now, not ever.

Those worgs -- they be skinny, mon!  Here's what we're gonna do... if you can keep a secret that is.

East of Voldrune there be grizzly bears as fat as an ogre.  Those large hides -- those we can use!

Hurry, brother.  Krenna's not known for her patience.

 Quest Hand-in: I'm in your debt, mon.  Take this as payment.
Title: Crushing the Crown

Description: This ledger is full of locations, and I need you to investigate and take action, pal. This has gone on long enough.

Here's an entry I want you to check out: it's right outside Orgrimmar's gates, to the west! That can't be good. Get out there and rough 'em up.

Oh, and if you see something big and dangerous enough that it needs destroying, toss this bomb at it.

 Quest Hand-in: Good job, kid. You deserve a little somethin'. And hey, come back tomorrow if you get the time; I might have a job for ya.
Title: The Shadow Grave

Description: I'm pleased to see that you're up and walking around, {name}.  You've held up nicely, especially after being dead for so long!

Others weren't as lucky.  If you wouldn't mind, I need you to fetch my embalming fluid and some twine to stitch up these bodies.  You'll find both in the Shadow Grave, the building just behind me.

Here, Darnell will join you.  He knows the way.

 Quest Hand-in: Exactly what I needed.  You'll be an asset to the Forsaken, <name>.You know, word has it that you were quite the <class> in your previous life.  Perhaps I should assign you to a more exciting task.
Title: Relios the Relic Keeper

Description: The Dark Lady is correct in her assertion that I am able to unlock the codex. Unfortunately, I need a signet ring from a Dalaran archmage to do it. My own ring was taken when I died many years ago, but there still might be a way.

While Dalaran has floated away, the outskirts of the city remain. Far to the east lie the ruins of Dalaran. It is there that you will find an archmage known as Relios. "Take" his signet ring and bring it back to me.

You may use the portal behind me to get to the crater.

 Quest Hand-in: Perfect. I hope this wasn't too much trouble to come by, <name>. Relios was a pupil of mine back when I was a mortal man thereby making him a competent and formidable adversary. I suppose I could have warned you ahead of time.Now, let us see the ring.There we are...
Title: Investigate the Broken Shore

Description: All of us know the price we paid the last time we set foot upon the Broken Shore.

<Siouxsie turns her eyes to the ground.>

I recommend dispatching a scouting team to investigate the Legion's strength. We need to know what we're facing in that accursed place.

 Quest Hand-in: Grim tidings indeed.I suggest we continue sending our champions to scout out the dangers that await.
Title: Get Shredded

Description: I was scouting ahead while you were wreaking havoc in the mine.

Spotted a hulking, armored shredder in their lumber yard. Bet we could do some real damage with that thing! 

I tried to start it up, but looks like it might be out of juice. Maybe they forgot to charge it?

See if you can grab a fresh power core from one of the other shredders nearby.

 Quest Hand-in: <As the key clicks into place and the new core activates, a low hum begins emitting from the shredder. It accelerates into a high pitched whirring as the instrument panels light up all over the cockpit.>
Title: Natural Remedies

Description: It must be that the evil emanations from that giant crystal are summoning the mountain giants and driving them insane.

It's too big to move, and beyond our ability to destroy, but I know a way to quell its power.

I've summoned a circle at the northwest corner of the crystal on the ridge.  Take this seed to the circle and channel its powers to heal the land through the natural forces of rain, growth and insect repopulation.

Beware, {name}, I sense an external force at play here... this is not natural!

 Quest Hand-in: Goliathon?  Pathaleon the Calculator?KAEL'THAS!?Prince Kael'thas has a hand in this?<The earthbinder fumes.>It is insanity what he has done!  Dropping giant crystals from the sky and decimating the land can only be the work of a madman!I can assure you, the Cenarion Expedition will counter any further attempts by their forces to do this ever again.We owe you a great debt, <name>.
Title: He Who Would Be Forgiven

Description: <A voice from inside the moonwell flows over your mind, bringing you a perfect sense of peace.>

You seek to cure a child, but know that all things come at a cost. To the east lies Raynewood Tower. Standing outside the tower, next to my moonwell, is one who has fallen into corruption.

Avrus Illwhisper seeks forgiveness and redemption, {name}. Will you help him to attain that which he desires and in so doing achieve your own goal?

 Quest Hand-in: <The satyr sneers, but when he realizes you are not here to chastise him, he changes his expression.>Finally, my redemption is at hand. I have waited long for this day and I think I know how to help you in turn.
Title: Blessings of the Ancients

Description: You've earned the trust of the Cenarion Expedition, {name}.  It is time you spoke to the ancients allied with our cause, Ashyen and Keleth, and asked for their blessing.

Carrying the mark of an ancient will fill you with great power.  These boons will become more powerful as your renown among us increases.

Go, {name}, and ask the ancients for their blessing. 

 Quest Hand-in: You've returned.  Did you receive the ancients' blessings?
Title: Picking Up Pelagos

Description: Pelagos should have the seed by now! Can't start the ritual without the seed. He's likely still at Claw's Edge.

We'll see you there!

 Quest Hand-in: Whoops. Wrong seeds. I hope we can still find a use for these.
Title: Gormok Wants His Snobolds

Description: Two of my men have already been killed trying to confine the magnataur called Gormok the Impaler, yet the creature still rages. It howls for hours about being without its favorite snobold.

If the Argent Crusade didn't wish to use this monster in the coliseum, I'd slay it myself. Perhaps it's time to bring the beast its playthings. Take this net and travel to Garm's Bane in southeast Storm Peaks. It's just northeast of K3. Capture some of those snobolds and pray to the Light you've found the right one.

 Quest Hand-in: The sooner we get these stinking things out of my sight and into their cage, the faster my mood will improve. I wish the Argent Crusade had given the Silver Covenant the care of this creature. They're going to have to get their hands dirty when the battle for Icecrown Citadel starts and I have a feeling they'll prove fragile and fussy allies.
Title: The Tithelord

Description: With his army defeated, the Tithelord is vulnerable. Now, he has but a small contingent to protect him. Let us strike him down decisively. 

He draws power from these anima wells, keeping it all for himself. If you can hold his attention, I can not only empower you to defeat him but also disable the wells.

Speak to me when you are ready to begin. When the time is right, the baroness will lead our new recruits into battle.

 Quest Hand-in: A Maldraxxus archlich manipulating our Harvesters... This cannot go unanswered.I am pleased that Baroness Draka is equally eager to strike at Kel'Thuzad directly.General Draven will ready our armies while Laurent repairs the mirror. Be ready and take these as we prepare. We will ensure vengeance is met alongside our new allies.
Title: Tomber's Supplies

Description: How am I supposed to supply the war effort when I cannot even safely get my supplies here? I was promised an escort that never came. And then, I had to leave one of my carts behind to the west when I was attacked by a band of ghouls!

Want to help out, and get me open for business in the process? Go down the western road out of town and past the graveyard. On the other side of the Dead Scar is a fork in the road. The hill that my cart had to be left on lies just beyond.

 Quest Hand-in: With the rest of my supplies here, I can finally open shop. I'm sure that the high executor will be most pleased to hear that the war on Dar'Khan and the Scourge can commence.And, of course, there's the small matter of your recompense. Very well, <class>, here is the coin that I alluded to. Do be sure to drop by should you find yourself in need of any trade goods.
Title: Heritage of the Nightborne

Description: You are among the first shal'dorei to venture forth and explore the wilds of Azeroth. But now it is time to come home.

Return to Suramar so that we may thank you for helping our people reclaim a place in this world.

 Quest Hand-in: When we were liberated from the Legion, some among the shal'dorei believed we should remain isolated. Alone.Your accomplishments in Azeroth have shown that we made the right decision in reclaiming our place in this world. It pleases me to honor you with this symbol of Suramar's gratitude.
Title: Draconic Vanguard

Description: The Blackrock orcs don't come alone.  You've already seen that they've got the Firegut ogres and Smolderthorn trolls on their side.  Unfortunately for us, they're also teamed up with the black dragonflight.

The orcs and the dragons have already sent some of their champions to stand guard at rally points, which are marked by a dragon skull on a pike.  You and I are going to find these rally points and take out this vanguard before the battle starts.

Ready?

 Quest Hand-in: Your kill count is adding up, <name>.  We're chipping away at them.And we are going to win.  Redridge will NOT fall to these cowards.
Title: Airborne Winding

Description: Well hello there!

Word around here is that we've got your continued support--so we got a little something for you. Meet me in Loamm so I can hand it over!

Best,
Harlowe Marl

 Quest Hand-in: We're lucky to have you around!
Title: Coldtooth Supplies

Description: The Coldtooth mine is a storage depot for the Horde.  I can't stomach the food they give their troops, and the state of their arms and armor is atrocious!  But... in times like these when supplies are so important, we can use what they have.

Enter the Coldtooth mine and bring me back their supplies.  That will help keep the Alliance in fighting shape, and remove much needed equipment from the Horde's warriors.

Good luck, {name}.  The mine is to the distant south, deep in Horde territory.

 Quest Hand-in: You got them!  Well done, <name>!  I'll go through these supplies and get them ready for our own troops!
Title: No Crate Unturned

Description: That explosion will likely bring onlookers from the House of Rituals. We must act quickly.

Search through the debris for anything that looks out of the ordinary. It is likely that Kel'Thuzad's mystery reagent won't be hard to spot.

 Quest Hand-in: The runes on this blade... they are a hallmark of domination magic!This is not good, <class>.
Title: Not Here, Not Now

Description: I will travel to your people to make arrangements soon.

For now, begone. Leave me in peace.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent. We have more immediate concerns to deal with until he visits.Hulda Shadowblade requires your immediate attention, sir.
Title: Upgrades in Ashran

Description: You got some construction guides or assembly notes on ya? Oh man that's good news!

I know this guy in Ashran, goes by Torgg Flexington. He's got finished blueprints we need!

Go talk to this guy and bring back some good stuff for us to build, ok?

 Quest Hand-in: Oh YEAH buddy! We can work something out. I got plenty of stuff for you to buy!
Title: Corpse Cleanup

Description: Our friends continue to fall as these terrible insects pour of their nests and attack our camps.

It's a terrible job to ask of anyone, but we have to dispose of the corpses as quickly as possible.

We can't allow our dead to be used as fertilizer for growing their disgusting eggs.

 Quest Hand-in: I hope this will help keep the growth of their numbers at bay.
Title: Spared from Madness

Description: Kurzen's death is a relief, but what's more interesting, and perhaps more immediate, is the sign of some potential allies within the compound.

I don't care what it says on that prison record, I know EXACTLY why those 3 were locked up: refusal to follow orders.  They must have been spared from the madness, much like my fellow rebels here, and incarcerated for speaking up.

Find them, {name}.  Find them, and send them back here.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you, <name>.  It looks like my suspicions were correct... the three prisoners seem to have escaped the affliction that gripped Kurzen and the rest of his men.Before you arrived, Emerine teleported them over to Stormwind to get cleaned up after their ordeal.  They promised to return soon.
Title: Bounty: More Snapdragons

Description: Snapdragons are one of the most dangerous species on Nazjatar. The naga breed them for the viciousness and their ability as trackers.

If we hope to keep our positions hidden from the naga, we must take out these groups of snapdragons immediately.

After you are done, report to the quartermaster to claim your reward.

 Quest Hand-in: This will ease our efforts in Nazjatar.
Title: Strike the Earth!

Description: In case you didn't notice, the land here in the Wetlands is pretty messed up. Floods, earthquakes... and on top of it all, even the ground's got a wild hair now.

I never thought we'd be attacked by our own dig site, but sure enough, big chunks of it are now rampaging around trying to flatten any dwarf they see.

You look like a strong, strapping young {race}... mind going down there and slapping some sense into the clods?

 Quest Hand-in: That's showin' em what for! Good on you.
Title: Stronger Than Bone

Description: This giant jade tiger pillar doesn't seem to fit in amidst the hozen buildings.

What it does seem is very hard. Very solid.

You know just the person to bring this to.

 Quest Hand-in: GOOD! A true challenge. Let us put this pillar to the test!
Title: A New Direction

Description: {name}, as leader of the Illidari in Lord Illidan's absence, you must choose your second-in-command.

Kayn or Altruis. You can only choose one.

The chosen shall become your personal champion, and their ideology will color our decisions for the Illidari going forward. No matter who is chosen, our mission remains unchanged.

If you need a reminder of our past, gaze into the Pool of Judgment. Remember the sacrifices that forged us into demon hunters. Speak to me when you are ready to choose.

 Quest Hand-in: I see. I support you no matter your choice. With this new beginning, we shall rebuild the Illidari.
Title: Transdimensional Warfare: Chapter III

Description: <Sylvanas speaks directly through you.>

You must find the being responsible for keeping this dimensional pocket active. Likely that fool, Ataeric... Search the compound for him. Should you find him, do what you must to stop him from channeling his magic. He is undoubtedly protected by a powerful arcane shield, and will send minions of arcane energy after you.  Defeat the minions while they are near him to unleash their energies.  No mage can handle that much power!

 Quest Hand-in: Had I not witnessed what you did with my own eyes I would not have believed it, <name>. Now, with the Ambermill magi on our side, there is but one thing left to do before we retake Gilneas and send those Alliance dogs running for Stormwind.
Title: Fat Long-Fat: Rematch

Description: Fat Long-Fat has requested another match with you. I find this strange. And concerning.

He will be waiting atop the Dome Belrissa.

 Quest Hand-in: I believe I understand why he wanted to fight you a second time, though I need to speak with Chi-Ji before I can be sure.Come back soon, <name>. I think it is time you learned the true nature of Fat Long-Fat.
Title: The Holy Water of Clarity

Description: Hey, listen.  You don't look like any old tourist, and I'm in a bit of a pickle.  My cousin up north sent me this weird artifact, and I need your help to... ah... identify it.

To start out, I'm going to need you to obtain The Holy Water of Clarity.  Rumor has it that whoever drinks from this spring is given a vision of clarity.

Sounds pretty promising, doesn't it?

Obtain it from the Nek'mani Wellspring at the peak of the naga camp.  Good luck!

 Quest Hand-in: <The goblin downs the water in one gulp.>Ahh... do you know how hard it is to get fresh water in Stranglethorn?  It's no wonder that the nagas guard their shrine so ferociously!Oh, right... that artifact.  Clarity...I've got it!
Title: Cryptograms and Keys

Description: The repositories of knowledge within Korthia have layers of security--for very good reasons.

Each vault requires cryptographs in order to decode and disable the barriers. They are, for lack of a better term, the keys to every secret.

Search outside the Vault for cryptographs stolen by the Mawsworn and return them to me. I will keep them, and the secrets they protect, safe.

 Quest Hand-in: I am deeply grateful for your service in keeping our secrets from the Jailer.
Title: More Titan Relics

Description: What have you brought me today?

 Quest Hand-in: How did you find so many of these? This is a veritable treasure trove of relics! One day you must tell me your secret. Once again you have greatly increased our knowledge of the titans. The Valdrakken Accord will think well of you indeed!
Title: Mirror Attunement: The Banewood

Description: Work has been completed on a mirror that will allow travel between Sinfall and The Banewood. However, it has yet to be attuned.

The attunement process is quite simple. Just head to the mirror's location in the world, and pass through it once, returning to Sinfall. When you have done so, travel between the two mirrors should be seamless.

 Quest Hand-in: Well done! The mirrors have been attuned and can be used at your leisure.
Title: Pests

Description: Confound it all! These rat-faced thieves keep getting into all of our supplies! I swear, anything that's not tied down, and even some things that are, they nip off with'.

You want to make a difference for the war effort in Zandalar? Pop off as many of those buggers as you can find. 

Otherwise, get on with it!

 Quest Hand-in: A thief has come to steal from thieves?
Title: Dig-Boss Dinwhisker

Description: Grimesilt wasn't as high up on the chain as I thought.  We'll have to take out his superior and find out what he knows.

Dig-Boss Dinwhisker's his name, and he runs the Dark Iron digging operations within the Cauldron, just northwest of here.  His excavators and footmen patrol the eastern side of the Cauldron, digging downward, day and night.

He's not known to show his face out in the field very often, but if you slay enough of his men, he'll be forced to come out and deal with you.

 Quest Hand-in: A... an ember?  What is this thing?
Title: Kill it with Fire

Description: These vile spiders lay their eggs in corpses.

And sometimes the living.

We've seen several bodies of Sundered Flame who have fallen victim to them.

We can't let those eggs hatch if we want to survive here and defeat the Sundered Flame.

Take this torch. It is imbued with the power of air and fire. Point it in the direction of what you want scorched, and it will do the rest.

The Tuskarr don't mess around with spiders. I came prepared.

 Quest Hand-in: Good work. This should give us some breathing room.
Title: Voodoo Zombies

Description: Da people... Dey all zombies, voodoo zombies!  Dis ain't gonna be pretty, {name}.

You gotta kill dem.

But once dey killed, dere is a moment where I can save dem.  Change dem back into da person dey were before.

We gotta act fast.  Da zombies don' rest.

 Quest Hand-in: We done enough, <name>.  We can't keep fighting dese zombies.  We need to figure out da source of dis voodoo.  An' I tink I know where to start...
Title: Sanctum of Order Teleporter Online!

Description: <The telemancy beacon is deactivated, but intact. Some Ancient Mana should get it back up and running.>

 Quest Hand-in: <The beacon glows as you infuse it with Ancient Mana.>
Title: Emergent Strategy

Description: My son went where? Chasing our workers into the woods once again?

That boy is too soft-hearted. No matter what I do, he will never be strong enough to take over the family business.

I demand he come back this instant. He's got better ways to spend his time than going on wild goose chases for our employees!

 Quest Hand-in: Father is blinded in his pursuit of success. If he won't listen to our employees, I must!
Title: Shocking!

Description: Have you ever had a fresh dojani eel {name}?  No?

Well you have not lived then!  Head north up to the dojani river and fish up a few for us.   Be careful, those eels can zap you if you're not careful!

 Quest Hand-in: These look like some tasty eels <name>!  I'm sure you will love them!
Title: Rescue at Sea

Description: The Kvaldir have set up camp at Hrothgar's Landing, the small island to the North.  We sent Captain Aerthas Firehawk to the area, but they ran into a Kvaldir Raiding party heading to the Tournament Grounds!  The Firehawk is now under attack by the raiders and is vastly outnumbered. Get out there and show those Kvaldir why attacking the Sunreavers is a poor plan indeed. 

The Firehawk is between Hrothgar's Landing to the north and the Tournament Grounds, on the western side of The Sea Reaver's Run.

 Quest Hand-in: Great job, Champion.  The fight continues, but now the Kvaldir know that we do not tolerate such attacks.
Title: Champion the Cause

Description: Now you're starting to show potential! I'm guessing your name was well known on whatever mortal world you hail from.

But don't rest on your laurels. The harder you fight, the harder others will strive to strike you down. That's the Maldraxxi way!

Nothing wins the favor of the crowd like taking down a former champion. Two are in attendance today, attempting to recapture their past glories.

Slaughter them!

 Quest Hand-in: Good, the crowd's on your side.Now there's just one last test.
Title: Details of the Attack

Description: I want to know details, {name}.  Our supremacy over the Bloodsail is due largely in part to our stronghold here in Booty Bay, but intelligence also plays a critical role.

The Bloodsail maintain a few meager camps to the south which they call their "Southern Command."  Well, you're going to raid their excuse for a southern command, find their plans, and slaughter their men.  Return with whatever information you can find.

 Quest Hand-in: Perfect, <name>.  Now that we know their plan, it's just a matter of time.And to think the fools have dropped anchor just off the cape....
Title: The Highlord's Command

Description: You are right, Highlord. Our military efforts cannot succeed without solid logistics.

That means we need a steady supply of weapons, food, medicine, and other provisions.

Let us send our champions to establish a supply line.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent. Our paladins will be well equipped for battle.
Title: Field Repairs

Description: The Scourge is still reeling from our attack, {name}.  Now is the time to capitalize on our momentum.

The strategically important valley below us is wide open.  We've located a disassembled demolisher vehicle in what we believe is working condition in the southeastern corner of the Valley of Lost Hope area.

If you can get the remaining parts from the Scourge scavengers, you should be able to get it running again.  A single working demolisher can wreak havoc on the enemy's ground units.

 Quest Hand-in: The Demolisher has seen better days, but the structure hasn't suffered any permanent damage.  The parts you obtained should be enough to get it running again, at least temporarily.
Title: Concentrated Fear

Description: Amber is power. It brings life.

This... dread amber you brought me has been twisted. It is concentrated fear.

The Vor'thik know this well. Their kypari has been completely engulfed by sha, and they use the dread amber to quicken their own swarmborn.

Bring me the crystals used by the Vor'thik fear-shapers in their rituals. The Klaxxi will study them and decide on a protocol for disposal.

 Quest Hand-in: What would happen, I wonder, if you ate one? What would it do to your soft, pink insides?
Title: Administering Aid

Description: Unfortunately, it would seem many of your allies have already taken to fighting on these fel corrupted shores. 

They will never be able to gain the upper hand in battle while so many are suffering from the contagion. 

Take the counteragent and use it to administer aid to your allies. 

Roland and I will handle the injuries here.

 Quest Hand-in: Your allies have you to thank for their lives.
Title: The Gearmaster

Description: Gearmaster Mechazod is insane! He says that he offers us immortality by removing this so-called 'Curse of the Flesh', but what he's really making are robotic slaves!

{name}, we're pretty certain that he's still at the pumping station out in the middle of the pools to the east.

The last we saw of him, he was in the command hut up top. Go up there and research his stuff.

You must confront Mechazod if gnomes everywhere,... no, everyone everywhere, are to stay alive!

 Quest Hand-in: <The old gnome breathes a heavy sigh of relief.>It is done then... you have saved us! If you hadn't stopped him here, then who knows how far his madness would have spread?With the threats from the blue dragons and the Nexus War, not to mention the Lich King, the last thing we need is a mad creation of the Titans running loose!Thank you, <name>!
Title: Keeping the Dogs at Bay

Description: Not everyone who fled Taurajo was able to make it to Una'fe, {name}. Some died of wounds along the way. Others were jumped by opportunistic quilboar.

I'll take care of the grim task of finding and gathering the bodies. But there is something you can do for me.

Hecklefang scavengers prowl the lands south of here and are savaging the corpses, tearing at their bowels and dragging away the limbs of the dead. Please, thin their numbers so that I can perform the proper funerary rites.

 Quest Hand-in: So it is done.Normally these scavengers are part of the Earthmother's cycle of life. But on the heels of the devastation wracked by both the Alliance and the cataclysm, their numbers grow overwhelming. It is good to thin them out.
Title: Idle Hands

Description: If you want my help then you are going to need to help me first.

There is a group of spriggans that have assaulted the growthworks to the northeast. They are causing all manner of havoc and I simply will not abide this trespass into my lands.

Go there and teach them a lesson. If they will not flee, then slay them on the spot!

 Quest Hand-in: Good. It is the way of nature for the stronger to prevail.
Title: The Wasp Hunter's Apprentice

Description: Rakjak not dumb. Maybe you good at killing things. Maybe Frenzyheart can make you into real hunter.

Dajik hunts giant wasp things better than all wolvar. Go with Dajik to Sapphire Hive to southeast or to river in south and learn the hunt.

 Quest Hand-in: We kill many many wasps.Rakjak don't think they run out.
Title: Antiquated Methodology

Description: You possess the correct mindset for retraining a phalynx. I believe you could find great success here.

Before you commit, I implore you to go across the hill and introduce yourself to my rival, Nemea. She believes that her unreasonable, free-willed larions are better partners than my perfect phalynx.

Experience her lifestyle so that you may know how much greater my work is.

 Quest Hand-in: Pelodis sent you, did he?Sure his phalynx follow orders, but where is their depth?
Title: Stranger in an Even Stranger Land

Description: <You arrive alone at the precipice of a strange city, knowing the leaders of Azeroth remain trapped in the Maw.

Wherever you are, it is clearly very, very far from home.

It appears your arrival has been noticed.>

 Quest Hand-in: Could it be? An actual mortal being in the Eternal City? The Purpose be served!
Title: Teron Gorefiend, I am...

Description: With Gorefiend's items restored, there is but one last piece to this puzzle: A host.

<The ancient shadowmoon spirit's lips curl up  to form a wicked grin.>

Surely you did not believe the fairy tale that I told you. The Altar of Shadows is my prison. Without your help, I would have been stuck here for all eternity. Now, I will take over your body and you will destroy my captors and break these bonds. Refuse and we will both be stuck here forever.

Teron Gorefiend will be free!

 Quest Hand-in: You did what? FOOL!You must right this wrong. After all, it is your fault. Take one of these helmets. They are each infused with the ever-burning ash that you retrieved for me. More importantly, they will allow you to see the ghosts of Shadowmoon, including Teron Gorefiend.Should you ever find Teron Gorefiend, destroy him.
Title: I Am the Blade of the Light

Description: It's time to put all that power and training into the field.

Take the empowered ranseur, and cut a swath of destruction through the Scourge!

We'll meet you at the doorstep of Deatholme.

 Quest Hand-in: He's here. We've driven the fiend back into his cage.Now to send him to his doom.
Title: Kolkar Leaders

Description: The centaurs have plagued the tauren for years. And recently, the Kolkar centaurs of the Barrens have grown into a real threat. Normally they were disorganized in these lands, but new leaders have risen among them. Rallying them.

To preserve our holdings here, these centaur leaders must be destroyed.

Bring me the head of Barak Kodobane. He camps west of these Forgotten Pools.

Defeat him, then return to me.

 Quest Hand-in: Well done, <name>. Kodobane is just one strand of a tangled thread - there are other Kolkar leaders to kill elsewhere in the Barrens. Seek out my companions at the other oases if you wish to press the assault.
Title: The Eternal Nemesis

Description: <Helya's voice echoes in the sky above the altar>

You say that you do not belong here among the unworthy, outsider, but your spirit fragments so easily. How am I to know you speak the truth? 

I cannot, so you must show me.

Bring yourself to the eternal battlefield and face my champion. If you manage to defeat him, then I may grant you a pardon.

 Quest Hand-in: You do not look good. I take it Helya did not prove lenient?
Title: Shrine of the Storm: Whispers Below

Description: We must not let Lord Stormsong finish his work.

If he delivers the fleet to Azshara, all of Kul Tiras will be vulnerable. Countless innocents will perish -- or worse.

There is no time to wait for more of the Storm's Wake to arrive. We finish this now, for the good of all who call this valley home.

We finish this for Samuel.

 Quest Hand-in: I pray we are not too late. The fleet must return home.
Title: Ideas Can Come from Anywhere

Description: I didn't notice the tinkerer's spark in you when we first met.

But look at all of the blueprints you've recovered and uploaded to Pascal-K1N6's database.

I was wrong. And happily so, my budding junkyard tinkering apprentice!

But this is a dangerous moment in your creative development.

You must avoid complacency!

Take time off to find new ideas. Speak with builders that inspire you, reverse-engineer bots on the island, and be open to new ideas - no matter where they come from!

 Quest Hand-in: I see it! The spark of new ideas in your eyes...You've returned from your travels fresh and ready to brainstorm some blueprints!I have too. Let's discuss.
Title: Anima-Laden Dreamcatcher

Description: You stumble upon an enchanted dreamcatcher, placed so remotely that it has managed to collect a significant amount of anima without being harvested. Droman Dawnblossom in nearby Dreamsong Fenn would surely appreciate its safe return.

 Quest Hand-in: Oh my! How did that get there? No matter. This anima will nurture many souls. Thank you, traveler!
Title: The Cudgel of Kar'desh

Description: Bring me the elemental signets that the cudgel requires!

The earthen signet is held by Gruul the Dragonkiller. Gruul can be found inside his lair in the Blade's Edge Mountains.

The second signet is the blazing heart of a creature known as Nightbane. This mythical beast is said to reside in the hallowed halls of the prophet, Medivh.

Make haste!


 Quest Hand-in: At last!With these bonds broken and the cudgel in my possession I shall send  the sea witch back to the icy depths...
Title: Seeds of Renewal

Description: The Fangs of Ashamane are in danger, {name}. For ten thousand years a powerful magic ward has protected them from any would-be thieves, but the ward has weakened over time and is in danger of failing. My three most trusted Ashen have the Tel'andu seeds we need to perform the ritual of renewal,  but the woods are now crawling with demons and I fear they have fallen.

No matter what, we cannot allow the Legion to obtain the Fangs! Go and find the Tel'andu seeds, we must hurry before the ward can be broken!

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you, <name>.My heart weeps for those who we've lost this day. The Legion will pay for this, I swear it!
Title: Unwelcome Guests

Description: Our scouts have spotted iron dwarves in the valley north of here. I overheard King Stormheart sending you to visit Drom and I'm admittedly a bit worried about'm.

If you find any iron dwarves when you head down there, put'm down hard and fast for me, eh? I dun think they know exactly where we are or how to get here just yet, and I'd prefer to keep it that way.

 Quest Hand-in: Grim news, lad. Those iron dwarves seem to be increasing in numbers... we've been seeing them all over the mountains. I smell war coming.Thank you for dealing with this bunch... a little more time bought.
Title: Storm Warning

Description: Ah, {class}! I knew I would find you at the right place at the right time. 

The elements do not just threaten the Dragon Isles in our current time, but also from beyond. Go to the Temporal Conflux and travel through the rift into the future the primalists have overrun.

There, speak to Soridormi. She will have more details for you when you arrive.

 Quest Hand-in: We meet again, <name>. We have more need for your help, I'm afraid.
Title: The Home of the Frostwolves

Description: You have arrived in Frostfire Ridge. Farseer Drek'Thar can guide you from here.

 Quest Hand-in: <The shaman grins at the harsh, windblown shore.>Welcome to the home of my people, <name>.
Title: Cluckbox

Description: <In the sparking, smoldering wreckage of Unit 35, you find a small, black cube.

It looks to be made of a metallic substance and appears unharmed.

Looking closely, you see a single word imprinted in the metal -- "Cluckbox."

This particular mechanical fowl was operating quite strangely. Someone in Rustbolt will probably want to investigate.>

 Quest Hand-in: Is that the cluckbox from that rust-blooded Unit 35? I hate that thing!<Vera grabs the box from you and throws it to the ground. She stomps on it a few times, then once more for good measure.>Someone programmed that thing to wake up the island at dawn every morning! Who does that?<Vera glares in the direction of the city.>If you see that thing show up again, smash it good for me.
Title: Vengeance for the Fallen

Description: Too many of my people have fallen at the hands of the Bleeding Hollow. Their cruelty cannot be forgiven.

<The grieving orc looks up at you.>

Make them pay.

 Quest Hand-in: I admire your sense of duty, <name>. Even when your own survival hangs in the balance, you still find time to bring closure to a grieving widow. Well done.
Title: The Doctor and the Lich-Lord

Description: There are two... that must... be killed.

The doctor and... the lich-lord... are above. Find them... destroy them... before....

...it is too... late....

 Quest Hand-in: Bristlehorn is dead?!I should never have let him go there by himself.
Title: The Eyes Have It

Description: Very well then, {race}. You have purchased my services in blood. Take me back to the "Low Shaman" of Thundermar.

Oh yes, I already know where you're taking me. Blundy's meager, ale-soaked abilities are trivial. But you - you fascinate me, {race}. With my sight and your abilities, imagine the havoc we could unleash into this pathetic world together...

 Quest Hand-in: You found one? A gen-u-ine Eye of Twilight? Lemme see.Oh Gods. It's lookin' at me. It's lookin' right back!I need a drink. Can you face that thing toward the wall or somethin'?
Title: The High Priest's Vote

Description: High Priest Amet's vote is the only one that is completely outside of our control.

He will vote as his divinations tell him and nothing we do will dissuade him.

I figure that gives us even odds either way.

The only problem we face is that his clairvoyance has failed him ever since the barriers around Uldum fell.

He will not cast a vote unless he regains power over his divinations.

Take the stairs at either side of the Vir'naal Dam and Speak to him to see what you can do to help.

 Quest Hand-in: War, you say.Divinations for war are always difficult.  Some wars must never be fought, even if victory was assured.  Some wars have to be waged even if defeat is certain.
Title: Maggot Eye

Description: Maggot Eye is a foul beast, even by gnoll standards.  He leads a band of renegade gnolls through the land, tearing up the glades and stealing whatever corpses he can find along the way.

Those are our corpses!  We had plans for those!

Maggot Eye resides just up the path from us.  Show him no mercy.  Mercy is for the weak.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent work!  Now if only I can convince Jerrod to let us move our operation into that shack...
Title: Fascinating Fungi

Description: Ah, Uplander! Can I ask for your assistance?

The cavern below is full of mushrooms that are useful for all kinds of things! Miss Mistie has asked for help gathering them for her alchemical experiments.

She says the Gelcap mushrooms produce sticky spores that she can make into a balm, good for easing achy joints and bunions! I sure could use some after standing around on these hard stones all day!

If you can find her some, I'm sure she will make it worth your while!

 Quest Hand-in: These are incredibly sticky spores! Thank you, <name>! Next time you see Kayann, tell him I'll get him his balm soon--and some free sunscreen to boot! I don't know how he stands being up there all day!
Title: Newfound Allies

Description: Harbinger Mikolaas has done a commendable job of safeguarding Blood Watch, {class}, but our enemies are many and our resources few.

Our weakness is well known to our enemies, but your contact with the forces of the Alliance is something they haven't accounted for. I have prepared a letter of introduction to the people of Auberdine, the closest Alliance settlement, proposing cooperation in the fight against our foes. Take it with you and seek out Huntress Kella Nightbow near the docks west of the Exodar.

 Quest Hand-in: I can help you get to Auberdine. Fortunately, it's only a short boat trip away!
Title: Be More Uniform

Description: Head into the foundry. Proudmoore's guards have taken over there. They will provide excellent accessories for our disguises.

I can recreate their faces, but without the clothing, we won't make it far.

Gather enough gear to cover us. 

We'll need the Captain's jacket as well. 

There will be less of a challenge at the gate if we outrank them.

 Quest Hand-in: Well done, <name>. This is going better than I expected.
Title: Stubborn Winds

Description: The winds of change are blowing, {race}. Of that there can be no doubt.

There are many pressing issues vying for our attention and action. Chief among them is the spreading of our growing oasis.

Its growth has surpassed our hopes as well as our understanding, yet now it faces opposition.

To the west, where the grass meets the sand, whirlwinds prevent its penetration into the desert.

Go and eliminate this hostile obstacle to life!

 Quest Hand-in: You have done well, <class>.We will doubtlessly call upon you for assistance with more significant matters in the future.
Title: Another Heap of Ethereals

Description: The Consortium is keenly interested in wiping out all of the Zaxxis rebels at the Heap to the south.

{class}, if you would like to ingratiate yourself further with us, go back down there and bring back more of their affiliation insignia.

 Quest Hand-in: Traitors, all of them!Good work, <class>!  If you find your way back down there again, I'm always looking to add to my collection of their insignia!
Title: The Cleansing

Description: Of late I've had nightmares concerning a worg named Ulfang. He has called out for help, and you must go to him.

However, you do not have the means to speak with him, or walk amongst the other worgs. I know a way.

But first, you must cleanse your inner turmoil through meditation.

There is a shrine that sits at the top of Frostblade Peak, far to the northeast. A single path leads up to it from the western base of the mountain.

Meditate there to cleanse yourself and then return to me.

 Quest Hand-in: Already I can sense the change within you.Are you ready for what comes next?
Title: Sometimes Less Is More

Description: I don't really hate saurolisk, but there seem to be a lot more around lately. 

Stormsong's military used to thin out the population, but they didn't show up this year.

Maybe you could do the job they didn't!

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you.  I can rest easy knowing they are safe.
Title: Wrathion's Journal

Description: The whispers ceased as soon as I drank the potion. Thank you, {name}.

Still, it is gravely concerning that N'Zoth's influence could reach me even within the Chamber of Heart. If Wrathion has found a way to resist the power of the Old Gods, then we can use it to reinforce the Chamber's defenses.

Perhaps MOTHER can glean more information from Wrathion's journal.

 Quest Hand-in: Information from journal pages committed to memory. Formulating fortification schematics for Chamber of Heart.All data recorded and catalogued. Physical transcription no longer required.
Title: Calming the Storms

Description: These Primalists are relentless, unleashing elemental devastation across the Eastern Kingdoms and Kalimdor.

You must show the same determination, {name}. It is the only way to stop them.

Find their next incursion, remove the enemies within the primal storm area before it is too late and foil their efforts.

We must protect Azeroth!

 Quest Hand-in: Well done. Let us hope that buys us time before their next incursion.
Title: A Change in Direction

Description: Whispers of dissent have been spreading through the harbor, {name}.

You can hear the grumblings of pirates who do not want to give up their freedom!

Rumor holds that some of the other authority figures have goals that align with mine.

I forged some letters in the captain's hand. Deliver them... see who bites.

Or who gets in our way.

 Quest Hand-in: I hoped that Taryn would see the truth. Ah, well. So it goes.
Title: You Will Be Prepared!

Description: {name}, your strength and leadership inspires awe in all of us!

The Illidari are prepared to furnish you with a full set of armor to aid in the fight against the Burning Legion. Continue expanding your influence across the Broken Isles, and we may yet achieve victory.

 Quest Hand-in: Our glaives are yours, <name>.
Title: Soft Bushy Tails

Description: It's amazing what people value!  Take, for instance, a wooden stick with a soft bushy tail attached to it.  Now, you and I might think something like that isn't all that valuable... but if you give that piece of junk a neat name like "Savage Fuzz Tail" and put it in a pretty box, then people will think it's valuable.  Trash becomes treasure!

Get me soft bushy tails from the wolves of Desolace and the Badlands, and I'll give you Darkmoon Faire tickets.

 Quest Hand-in: Well done, <name>!  These tails will make great prizes for our visitors, and that means happy visitors... who talk to their friends and bring more visitors!Here are your tickets!  Have a good time at the Darkmoon Faire... and don't forget to tell your friends about us!
Title: Return to the Vindicaar

Description: That pit lord won't trouble our new allies any longer.

<Turalyon's brow furrows.>

Until another takes its place, at least. If there's one thing I've learned in our endless war against the Legion, it's to savor victories as you find them.

Come, let us take a moment to regroup back at your vessel. Alleria and I have been waiting a long time for a reunion with our son.

 Quest Hand-in: Our absence has wounded Arator. We knew it would. But we had to know that he was safe while we fought the Legion.Now that we are reunited, I will not let us be separated again.
Title: The Poisoned Mind

Description: Before we return to Klaxxi'vess, I wish to look upon the empire.

The Klaxxi Council told me that the enemy gathers outside the Empress's palace.

My poisons are ready. What better way to announce my return than with death and destruction?

Just be careful not to mix the two serums... at least not while you're holding the vessels.

Speak to me when you are ready to fly.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you for returning me home, Wakener, but I fear the war has just truly begun.
Title: Signed in Blood

Description: You're here at last, {name}.  Just in time as well.

News of Ragnaros' emergence has spurred a large wave of recruits to seek membership in the Twilight's Hammer.

If you're to infiltrate the cult, the time is now.  We will need recruitment papers -- signed in blood by a referring Twilight member.  Lure one of the new recruits away from the group and hit them with this blackjack.

If you're lucky, you'll be able to steal his recruitment papers.  Bring them back to me and we'll do our best to alter them.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent.  I'll do my best to alter these documents.
Title: At a Moment's Notice

Description: No longer must you take a larion across Bastion, Maw Walker.

With our gateways active once more, you shall enjoy instantaneous travel wherever you are needed.

Do note that you must still utilize a larion to return to Oribos or travel to the other realms.

Give it a try and see for yourself.

 Quest Hand-in: In time we may open new destinations for our gateways. Haephus can direct you further.
Title: Thunder Down Under

Description: Our army needs water, and luckily the elements gave us plenty of that when the cataclysm hit.  The water that filled up the canyon to the southwest should do the trick.

Unfortunately, the corpses of thunder lizards still sit at the bottom of the canyon, and their electrical discharges are a bit too dangerous.  I've got grunts that can lift them out of the water, but we need someone agile enough to attach the other end of the rope.  Are you my man, {name}?

 Quest Hand-in: The electricity was only one of the dangers.  If those carcasses rot too long under the water, that entire source becomes undrinkable.Well done, <class>.
Title: Three Princes

Description: The Gelkis reside in southwest Desolace. They are just as stubborn as the Magram, and since they have not suffered war and relocation, they are considerably stronger.

Humbling the Gelkis will require an extreme show of force.

Khan Shodo and his three sons rule the clan. Shodo is aging, and suffers from old war wounds. He never leaves the depths of his cave. The strength of his rule lies in his sons.

Slay them, and persuade the Khan to commit to our cause.

 Quest Hand-in: My sons all slain... my clan in ruins....Were I in my youth, I would tear you limb from limb!Go now... kill me or leave me to mourn alone, <race>.
Title: Trident of the Son

Description: <From the scratches he makes in the rock, you see several symbols: a trident, a mur'ghoul, the sun, a wrecked ship, and a rough stick-figure of yourself.>

<Puzzling out what the murloc is conveying takes a while. Obviously he wants you to get a trident from the Chillmere Coast, but the image of the sun is puzzling. That is until you realize he means his son.>

<His son was changed into a mur'ghoul! He wants you to find him to the south near the wrecked ship and return with his trident.>

 Quest Hand-in: <Reaching out to take his son's trident from you, Old Icefin's hand shakes a little. Could it be that the aged murloc is grieving?><Is that just extra moisture pooling at the base of his eye?>
Title: Empyrium Seam Chunk

Description: <At first you thought the ore to have a mirrored surface, reflecting the starry space above you. After breaking off a chunk, you realize that the ore itself has a starry quality all of its own.>

<Perhaps someone back at the Vindicaar can give you some insight on how to better extract these seams more efficiently.>

 Quest Hand-in: Empyrium is quite a sight to behold once it's been mined. And while the deposits of this ore require precision, the seams require exposure.If you spend some time picking away the surrounding rock, you'll find much more ore to harvest.
Title: Put It On

Description: Hey, {name}, I've got an idea for a disguise! Take one of these merciless whatchamacallits and put it on your head.

What could possibly go wrong?

Ready to put it on?

 Quest Hand-in: What happened? That thing wasn't completely dead! Maybe I should stick to mechanical stuff.It gave you a vision? Of killing all of us?! That doesn't sound good.Well, in any case, that Earthen Ring fellow, Erunak Stonespeaker, wants these specimens all taken out to him. I'll make sure he gets them. I don't want them anywhere near me.
Title: The Nighthold: Into the Nighthold

Description: Our work is very nearly complete. Now that the Heart can safely absorb power from fel magic, we need the strongest sources of it that we can get our hands on.

Gul'dan has called the nightborne's elite back to the Nighthold to aid him. The storm of fel energy above the palace has seeped into the very fabric of their being, even making its way into the crystallized pieces of the Nightwell that many carry with them.

Those shards are exactly what we need, {name}. Save as many as you can in your assault.

 Quest Hand-in: <Kalec sifts through the pile of Nightshards.>Yes, these are perfect! There's just one more thing we need.
Title: Wicked Wikkets

Description: {name} good wikket, they say...

{name} help hozen, they say...

No more grookin' {name}, they say.

That ok. Look out there. Wicked wikkets fallin' like rain, ripe for the grookin'!

Go, join the fun. But remember, Chief Kah Kah gets all the shinies! That's hozen rule number two.

<Jeek Jeek scratches his head.>

Hmm, all hozen rules are number two...

 Quest Hand-in: Wikket grookin' makin' hozen rich with shinies!<name> makin' a good second impression. And for hozen, number two is most important!
Title: What We Got

Description: Every fortress needs three things.

One: peons! Find Skaggit and have him get our peons back to work.

Two: building materials. I had the peons set up a cache for you where they will store resources they create while you are away. You should check it out.

And three: raw experienced muscle! Constructing buildings in a garrison can take some time but I think we can speed up your first building by hiring Skaggit's recently promoted Senior Peon II. Find him and tell him I sent ya.

 Quest Hand-in: Yeah, that's the stuff. Lumber, stone, peons, more peons. It's like we are building you a stronghold or something.
Title: Under False Colors

Description: If we wish to stay the executioner's axe, we'll need to throw Sylvanas off of our scent. I will take the ship near Chandlery Wharf, which has recently been taken by Irontide pirates. There, I will leave it under the guise of a pirate raid gone wrong.

Your task will be to ensure that Sylvanas' forces find this ship.

You must report to Nathanos that you spotted a stolen Forsaken vessel in that area.  You have no connection to Derek Proudmoore, so it should raise no suspicions.

 Quest Hand-in: A pirate crew dared abscond with a vessel of the Dark Lady's fleet? Clearly, they must be made to pay. I will dispatch our forces to search the area for the stolen ship. Thank you for this information, <name>. I will personally inform the Dark Lady of your... involvement.
Title: Fighting Fire With ... Anything

Description: The inferno raging up ahead marks the front line between us and the forces of the Fire Lord. The fire elementals unleashed here are unlike any I've ever encountered.

Can you help us stem the tide of destruction? Slay the raging firestorms... before they engulf Aessina's Grove and erase all hope of someday reclaiming this mountain!

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you, <name>. You've given us the opportunity to try to reclaim the upper hand.
Title: The Stormwind Extraction

Description: My lady is shrewd indeed. If we are to infiltrate Stormwind City, we will need the very best the Horde has to offer, and yet a team so small as to be able to infiltrate the heart of Alliance territory unseen.

<Nathanos peers at the gathered group, stroking his chin.>

Yes, I see.

The path ahead is clear. Speak to me when you are ready to undertake the Warchief's mission, {name}.

 Quest Hand-in: Well, here we are. Zuldazar. We had better stick with Talanji and Zul for now. The Warchief will be interested to know what happens next.
Title: On to Kharanos

Description: Some of the mountaineers under Stonegrind's command were telling me about the situation out at Kharanos. When the troggs took over Frostmane Hold, it sounds like the surviving trolls fled westward, deep into the heart of the dwarven homeland.

Now, they threaten the dwarven town of Kharanos. It sounds like they're going to need all the help they can get. You should go to Kharanos and introduce yourself to Captain Tharran. Just follow the road east out of Brewnall and keep going until you see the town.

 Quest Hand-in: If Gnomeregan Covert Operations is recommending you, then you must have made quite an impression. Your help will be most welcome here, as we've a wealth of enemies and few enough mountaineers to face them.
Title: Safety is Job One

Description: It's nearly safe for our men to come in here and take what's rightfully ours. The real danger now is Shaffar's personal army that he has crawling all over this place.

I need you to take care of his forces for me while I regain my strength.

 Quest Hand-in: Splendid! Haramad will be delighted to hear the good news! All of this ripe for his taking!
Title: Svarnos

Description: Excellent work on the island capture, {class}.  Now that we have claimed the island, we need to make these cellblocks useable for prisoners.  D-Block has been especially hard to clear out.  Unfortunately it has become overrun with demons of all sorts.

We have been able to thin out the demons but a large core hound has broken its way out of its cell and is wreaking havoc down there.  I need you to kill him and bring back his collar.

 Quest Hand-in: Svarnos is finally dead?  Looks like we can finally get to work setting up that cellblock then.  Thank you <name>.
Title: Cell Block Tango

Description: The sapper squad is ready. That means it's time for fun!

There's only one thing holding us up from our full-scale assault on Garm! I sent a runner to set a teleporter up behind him--successfully I might add--and he returned to get the power cell it needs to function. It isn't working yet... which means the power cell didn't get there.

I need you to look just on the other side of Garm's Bane for the power cell. When you find it, bring it farther east to Garm's Rise and activate the teleporter.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent!<A fierce grin creeps onto Ricket's face.>Let the destruction begin!
Title: More Booty!

Description: I need more armor scraps, {name}!  Do you have any?

 Quest Hand-in: Thanks again, <name>.  You do the Horde proud...
Title: Favor: Bottle of Redelav Wine

Description: This item will be of great interest to the brokers. 

Per your previous deal with The Night Market, you should bring it to Ta'xera.

You will be fairly compensated.

 Quest Hand-in: How decadent! Redelav wine! I'm torn on whether to keep it for my own collection or use this sought after wine for some valuable artifacts elsewhere.Nevermind, here's your payment.
Title: The Unkindly Faction

Description: <When passing the other faction recently, your direbeak squawked at them for food. It does not appear to understand that they are the enemy. Probably best to teach them before something bad happens.>

 Quest Hand-in: <The hatchling scratches the ground aggressively when you pass a member of the opposite faction. Mission accomplished! It will need to rest after this adventure.>
Title: Storm Brew

Description: Grandmaster, the Legion is attacking the Wandering Isle!

We sent defenders up to the Ridge of Laughing Winds, but they can't hold for long.

Our only chance is to finish making the Storm Brew. Chen and Aegira have already gone up to the Chamber of Whispers, but they are under heavy attack as well.

Speak to Tak Tak and take a kite up to join them at once!

 Quest Hand-in: I don't know about you, Grandmaster, but I think we should take a well-earned rest after all of this.
Title: The Scrapbot Construction Kit

Description: Searching the databanks of the prototype console reveals schematics for a scrapbot construction kit. With your engineering expertise, you could learn this schematic and produce scrapbot construction kits of your own.

 Quest Hand-in: You take note of the information displayed in the schematic and the materials required to construct the scrapbot kit.
Title: The Woods Have Eyes

Description: The sooner I can return the lady Waycrest to Highroad Gate the better, but I will honor her wishes if we can assure her safety.

There are dark things happening in these lands that you don't fully understand. If we must dally, then there are measures that need be taken.

First, the wildlife here can serve as eyes to dark powers. Kill them.

 Quest Hand-in: Not a beast in sight. Good.The foes of this land must not find us here in the open.
Title: Inform Leoroxx!

Description: Quickly, you must inform Leoroxx of what is transpiring up at Razaan's Landing!

Those orbs were comprised of souls, some of them Mok'Nathal!

 Quest Hand-in: What you say, is it even possible?  What am I saying?  Of course it is, if the spiritcallers say so.Remember before when I said that we might need your further assistance?  It would seem that I can tell the future.
Title: That's Not a Rock!

Description: Okay, these spiders are seriously creeping me out. Especially those egg sacs they leave lying around that I keep accidentally stepping on only to be covered in very little but very creepy spiderlings. Ug, makes me shudder just thinking about it.

I say you burn them. Burn them all.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you. I'd say I have about a week of Anji making fun of me for the screaming, and then I should be in the clear.
Title: Learning to Communicate

Description: To help, you must learn how to speak the Winterfin dialect. We'll work with the forces of nature and magic to do that.

Take this empty conch shell. At the bottom of the watery trench below exists Scalder, an elemental of air and watery fury.

Once she is defeated, use the conch upon her remains to capture her magical steam. Return the full conch to me, and I'll imbue my knowledge of the Winterfin tongue into you.

Luckily, a friend taught me a water breathing spell, which I will cast upon you.

 Quest Hand-in: Now I will be able to use Scalder's essence to impart my understanding of the Winterfin murloc tongue to you.
Title: Seeds of Fear

Description: Some of the corrupted kypari were shattered during the swarm's horrid march, casting slivers of sha-infested amber across the land.

Bring me any that you find in your travels, so that they may be disposed of properly.

 Quest Hand-in: As long as these shards blanket the land, our home will be a place of fear and death.
Title: And That's Why They Call Them Peons...

Description: These two are USELESS! When they first arrived I thought we were saved. Not so! Instead, Dontrag and Utvoch took one look at the mine and concocted some idiotic plan that involved standing here until... until we all died, I guess. 

You don't look nearly as useless. How about you lend a hand, friend? I've got dozens of peons, scared out of their gourds, hiding in the Deep Reaches. Find them and get them out!

 Quest Hand-in: I knew it! You are a hero! If I have anything to do with it, you'll be promoted to legionnaire!
Title: Identifying the Source

Description: Judging by what the children have said, we might have a primalist prowling the Wild Preserve.

This calls for immediate investigation.

According to what other researchers have observed, Primalists like to steal eggs and whelps to infuse them with power and corrupt them. Those that don't acclimate to the process suffer a slow death... not that the primalists seem to care...

We need them out of the Preserve. Attend to that, and I will try to distract the children. They must not know of this.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you, <name>! I'm certain that was... unpleasant.I'm sure you would prefer to limit your tasks to exploring and researching, but, unfortunately, we sometimes have to get our hands dirty protecting wildlife from those who endanger it.
Title: A United Front

Description: Our rebel fighters have been armed and morale is high - even the Alliance and Horde elves have ceased their squabbling.

We are nearly ready to march on the city.

Hand out this week's fruit, and then we can begin preparations.

 Quest Hand-in: The time has come.
Title: Defense Symbology

Description: As you know, {name}, we demon hunters must keep our darkness at bay, lest we succumb to it and become demons ourselves.

Up to the north, a demon hunter by the name of Baric Stormrunner is preparing to strengthen his markings. He could use your assistance with his ritual.

 Quest Hand-in: You've come to help me with my ritual? I thank you, <name>.In this time, allies are more important than ever.
Title: Rallying Maldraxxus

Description: We need all the help we can get! It's taking all we have to hold our ground against the other houses, let alone gain any ground against them.

Truth be told, your blade will be welcome anywhere. There are no shortage of battles to be won, foes to be toppled, or weary soldiers to be relieved.

Help us regain control of Maldraxxus, and in the name of the Primus I will see you are amply rewarded.

 Quest Hand-in: All who have reported back to me have said the same--you have brought victory upon victory to the House of the Chosen!On behalf of all who serve the Primus, you have my eternal gratitude.
Title: Rundown

Description: They're getting away!

These are the same naga that attacked the boats and carried away our friends. We cannot let them escape!

Take these spears and run them down with that seahorse of yours... don't waste your time dismounting, just keep after them and kill all that you can with the spears.

I will try to hunt down that Fathom-Lord. Meet me at the far end of the ledge when you're done.

 Quest Hand-in: Swift work. Very impressive.That Fathom-Lord got away... I don't see him anywhere. He's most certainly the key to finding our captured friends.I will hunt him down. He cannot stay hidden for long.
Title: The Hidden Clutch

Description: With the major black dragons out of the Badlands, it is now safe to move the egg again.  You will find me on a small plateau, north of New Kargath.

Come and find me.

 Quest Hand-in: The egg must always be moving.  We are not safe anywhere.Deathwing, even in his madness, knows all the hidden places in this world.  The egg must not rest.
Title: What Is This Place?

Description: <Pip's helm gives you a slight jolt.>

What is this place? It looks like they're doing something terrible to that nether dragon. The energy is being siphoned from the creature into that lady! We need to stop this ritual!

Kill Corla to get past this hall!

 Quest Hand-in: <Finkle's helm crackles with static.>We haven't got much time. Raz looked injured. If we get to him in time there might be a chance that I can turn him back into a regular orc!<You feel a sharp pain in the back of your head and hear the jingling of coins.>Sorry about that. I figured I'd send through some gold - for your troubles and all that...
Title: A Flare for the Dramatic

Description: I received a strange object with a note attached. Here, it seems to be written in your tongue, commander.

<Dear Mister Durotan,

I'm Penny... you know, from Azeroth? We met briefly back at {name}'s garrison. 

Anyway, like I told you, I have a fifth degree black hammer in engineering and I'm eager to serve. The more danger the better!

You just fire this old flare whenever you're in trouble and I'll be there, quick as a quark!

Hopefully,

Penny>

 Quest Hand-in: That didn't seem to do much, commander, except to give away our position to every creature in Gorgrond.Wait, did you hear something?
Title: At The Enemy's Gates

Description: Even as we ready for the tournament, Argent Crusade forces prepare the way for an assault on the enemy's stronghold of Icecrown Citadel.

In the Court of Bones in southwestern Icecrown, a few brave crusaders have set up a forward camp on the southern side of Corp'rethar. Equip your lance and mount the stabled campaign charger at the camp, then destroy the Lich King's minions.

Do not fear the masses of boneguard footmen, {name}, for they can easily be trampled under your horse's hooves.

 Quest Hand-in: Your bravery on the field has shown the crusaders what they already knew -- that our warriors are the best in Azeroth.
Title: Gourmet Kafa

Description: It was genius: kafa berries go in the goot, seeds come out.

Kafa'kota is already rare and worth a fortune, but my invention--Kafa'goot--is GOURMET.

But it's over now. Uncle is upset and peak is a muss. All that's left is to collect the rest of the Kafa'goot and never make it again.

I won't ask you to gather it--kind of a mussy task, not fit for hero-- just mark it so I can find it easily when the mountain is safe again.

 Quest Hand-in: Great, I'll get up there and... harvest them soon.<Cousin Gootfur begins wrapping long strips of linen around his hands.>Can't believe I thought this was a good idea.
Title: Show Me What You've Got

Description: It looks like you understand the basics. Now it's time to put everything together.

Head for the ring. Once you hear the starting pistol, you will have one minute to score as high as possible.

Gnolls are worth one point. Run 'em through with the harpoon!

If you see a paper zeppelin, bag it with your bolas for fifty points!

Leaping fences gives you style. Style gives you more points when you skewer gnolls or down zeppelins. It's super important, so don't forget to keep jumping fences!

 Quest Hand-in: What a showing!
Title: What's Your Specialty?

Description: Hey, {name}! Have you decided on a combat specialization yet?

Since you're a {class}, you already know about the different classes available to adventurers. But did you know that there are also areas of specialization within each class?

Choosing a specialization is an important decision. Your specialty determines your combat role in a party, as well as the kinds of weapons and abilities that you will use.

Let's go speak with Veruca Darkstream to learn more about specializations!

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent choice of specialization, <name>.Feel free to test out your new abilities on the training dummies outside.
Title: Thinning the... Herd?

Description: The furbolg are more numerous than we expected in these southern regions. They have also been far more aggressive here than we would like.

With our resources divided between hunting down elves and harvesting much-needed lumber, that leaves you to help me put an end to our furbolg distraction.

I have research to conduct here. In the meantime, I need you to take a more hands-on approach. Bring me the ears of nearby furbolg as proof to Tarkan that the problem is being dealt with.

 Quest Hand-in: Good work, <race>.This should keep them licking their wounds for a time.
Title: Thunder's Fall

Description: Warlord Kao commands de mogu from dis warship. It is time to put an end to dis incursion.

I should be able to hold off any stragglers dat may come to Kao's aid, but I can only maintain dis barrier for so long.

Be careful. Kao was one of de Thunder King's top generals. He will not fall without a fight.

 Quest Hand-in: De king is in danger!
Title: My Pet Roc

Description: Dorian's had me training and feeding the baby drakes he captures, and it has gotten me thinking. I want a pet of my own!

No, not a juvenile drake. I don't want a pet capable of biting my hand off!

However, in the Bonefields to the northeast of the camp, beyond the area dominated by the drakes, there's a large population of goretalon rocs. The grown ones are beyond hope of domesticating, but if you bring me the eggs from their nests, I can raise them from the time they hatch.

 Quest Hand-in: Oh, these are very nice! I've gotten so tired of robotic squirrels and chickens for company. It'll be wonderful to have a pet whose joints won't require oiling!
Title: Keep An Eye Out

Description: Avast!  Who goes there?

Argh, I am but useless without me special enchanted eye.  Bad enough to have lost me eyes in battle in the first place!  But by some stroke o' luck we docked in Menethil and a traveling wizard enchanted a special glass eye that let me see again.

Last night I ended up gettin' jumped by some Bloodsail Buccaneers on me way out.  Took me eye, they did!  Seems those blokes have found their way to Booty Bay.

Help an old sea dog out by gettin' me eye back?

 Quest Hand-in: Shiver me timbers and timber me shivers!  Ye found me beautiful eye!  Let's see if she still fits.<Kshhh-thunk><name> ho!  Blimey, I can see!!
Title: The Chieftain's Beads

Description: The ceremonial beads, decorated with shells and feathers, are worn by the clan's chieftain.

Perhaps Elder Sookh would be interested in seeing these.

 Quest Hand-in: Graw was the first to succumb to the madness, and the rest of the clan followed.With these, I will take the reins as our clan's new chieftain.Thank you, traveler. I will do my best to rebuild my clan.
Title: Satyrical Offerings

Description: You find it most amusing to think that this ancient relic is bestowing upon you a blessing meant for your enemies.

You determine to make as much as you can of this unintentional gift.

 Quest Hand-in: The divine brazier indiscriminately endows you with a blessing.
Title: Prototypes for Inspiration

Description: <Overspark pulls you in close and whispers.>

As the leader of this momentous expedition, I must stay with Prince Erazmin to ensure he's not swindled by this Horde hooligan.

But I cannot stop my research, or the Horde will gain the advantage!

Underlings like yourself must collect the technology samples required to fuel my legendary brainstorms.

Bring me prototypes from the island, and I will turn them into groundbreaking new innovations for the Alliance!

 Quest Hand-in: <Tinkmaster flicks through the prototypes you brought.>Interesting... provocative... inspiring! I can certainly turn these into something useful.
Title: To the Slaughter

Description: This entrance to the fortress is clear again, thanks to your help.

Inside is another story. Find your way inside and leave no ogre standing as you go.

 Quest Hand-in: Again we meet...
Title: Give Me Fuel, Give Me Fire

Description: A powerful core will not alone be able to power the portal. Like any powerful engine, it will require fuel - though an engine of fel energy must burn life force to thrive.

We will need blood potent in magical energy to keep our fel core running and sustain our connection to Xoroth. Fortunately, I have experience in these matters, and I know just the place where we can get some.

You'll need a jar or something.

 Quest Hand-in: That's... quite a bit of blood. I am impressed, <name>.I really should just start stockpiling this stuff. It has so many uses!
Title: Eaters of the Elements

Description: Drek'Thar has already begun his ritual, and it is powerful enough to draw the attention of the local goren. Those beasts are drawn to elemental magic like flies to a corpse.

I will have my hands full soon enough. Help us if you like but Drek'Thar must be allowed to finish his ritual.

 Quest Hand-in: I came seeking aid from the elements. I see now that we are the ones who must aid them.Come, <name>, witness what I have witnessed.
Title: The Warden's Pawn

Description: One of the few items of worth that we managed to loot from these ruins is this small jade statue.

We believe it to be a key of some sort, but we're unable to determine what it opens.  As such, it is useless to me.

Perhaps you'll have some better luck with it.

 Quest Hand-in: <The statue clicks into place on the large stone slab.>
Title: Zul'Mamwe Mambo

Description: The Skullsplitters are an embarrassment to the troll empire.  Their petty squabbles with the Bloodscalps have torn Northern Stranglethorn apart.  Where tribes like the Darkspear and the Zandalari thrive, the Skullsplitters fight over ruins.

I have been authorized to issue rewards to mercenaries who are willing to deliver punishment to the Skullsplitters.  I encourage you, and anyone you know, to travel south to Zul'Mamwe and cull their wayward tribe.

 Quest Hand-in: As promised, your reward.  You do the troll nation proud.
Title: Lost and Found

Description: Poor Mr. Allerton might yet help us find my brother.

<Leryssa unveils a voluminous book, not unlike an army recruitment ledger.>

I borrowed it, ok?  Let's see, does that enlistment card have a date?

William saw Thassarian at the enlistment line.  Their entries must be near each other... here it is!

He was assigned to... Unit S?  All the other military units are named after Alliance towns.

Who's in the unit?  Where are they deployed?  We need rumors.  See if the innkeeper's heard anything.

 Quest Hand-in: Can't say I can help you friend.  But I might know someone who can.
Title: Everything I Know About Cooking

Description: I'm so glad you enjoy my food. Are you interested in the recipes?  If so, you should learn them properly, from my teachers in Halfhill Market.  Everything I know about the kitchen, I learned from them.

Say, if you happen to pass through there, would you deliver this note to Sungshin Ironpaw for me? She was my favorite teacher, and I want her to know that I miss her.

 Quest Hand-in: My, that's so thoughtful. I love hearing from my old students.
Title: Elune's Tear

Description: I'd hoped Orendil's cure would save Relara, but I fear it only slowed the disease running through her. We must find more powerful medicine! Thankfully, Orendil spoke to me of further remedies should his first one fail.

Elune's Tear is a type of stone that rests in only one place: the remains of Iris Lake, destroyed by the eruption of Thunder Peak, northeast of Astranaar. Orendil said the stone will wash away corruption.

Please, {name}, bring me Elune's Tear and pray it will end my child's sickness!

 Quest Hand-in: Oh, you found it! Odd... it looks tarnished somehow. I will place the tear in a stew, and pray that it will cure her.Thank you! Thank you, <name>!
Title: The Consequence of Courage

Description: Thank you for healing me, {name}. I hope that we are earning one another's trust.

<Wrathion shudders.>

The Storm-Eater. I have never faced a dragon of such raw elemental power. If there are others like her...

Wait... where is Ebyssian? Did he survive? You must find him!

 Quest Hand-in: I am relieved you made it out, <name>.But I.. cannot help but feel lost.
Title: Highland Habitat

Description: The fish could be biting better, don't you think?

You know, that gives me an idea. Legend says these lakes and rivers did not always have fish. They say, these watering holes were stocked with fish when the dragons soaring overhead dropped them! Can you believe it?

Maybe you and your drake could give it a try?

 Quest Hand-in: Ha! The legends are true, how fantastic!
Title: Throwing Down

Description: Clever...

Just when it seemed we were getting things under control, they tunneled right underneath us and secured the shrine!

Now we're caught between two Nerubian armies and our predicament is worsening by the minute.

As our first course of action, we must stop them from reinforcing. Their tunnels must be sealed.

Take these grenades and throw them down their craters to the northwest.

 Quest Hand-in: We're not out of the woods by any means, but your efforts have helped to slow the enemy down.Captain Grondel up in Drak'Agal will likely have need of you.Farewell, <name>.
Title: Tol Dagor: The Ashvane Overseer

Description: Tol Dagor stands as a well fortified thorn in this nation's side.

As you are no doubt aware, Ashvane has taken every opportunity she could to throw any opposition into those cells. Among those in the jail are members of the Alliance that arrived alongside you and Jaina.

We now have permission and the needed muscle to free them. Meet up with Taelia on the eastern shore of the island, find the overseer, and take his key. With it, we will have access to the weapon vault and cells.

 Quest Hand-in: Most of those hostages have seen better days, but they will recover quickly. With Tol Dagor out of the way, Ashvane is quickly running out of places to hide.
Title: A Stitch in Time

Description: Hm...I don't know that I've ever been to this time, before.

I suppose I should explain myself. My name is Delormi, and I'm the last remaining member of the Synchronous Tailors.

We make sure the fabric of time stays, well, mended. But I've found a number of new tears cropping up.

In fact, I believe that's why I've arrived here in this time. Perhaps you could assist me in tracking them down and repairing them?

 Quest Hand-in: And that takes care of those, although...Something's still wrong...
Title: Ango'rosh Encroachment
