 Quest Hand-in: So dis is da fetish of da mighty Malacrass? It be a good addition to my collection, <name>. And now, I believe, rewards be in order.
Title: The Valiant's Charge

Description: In your training as a valiant, you'll have the chance to test your skills against valiants representing other cities. Although a valiant's battles are not a formal part of the competition, you will learn valuable lessons about the fighting styles and weaknesses of your opponents.

The valiants are a spirited lot, competing amongst themselves for honor and notoriety.

Train as a valiant until you are confident of your ability to best all who face you, then bring me the seals you have earned.

 Quest Hand-in: Impressive, valiant. I will make the arrangements for your test immediately.
Title: Multiple Dragon Isles Artifacts

Description: Do you have something for the archives?

 Quest Hand-in: Look at all these artifacts! This might take a minute. <Cataloger Jakes hastily makes several notes in her ledger.> Got it! Off with you, now! Come back if you have more!
Title: Champion Armaments

Description: See Lurr?  He big and strong, but not so smart, not like Murr.  Murr can make Lurr build good things for you, things for your Champions to wear and be smashier.  

First, you give Murr something?

 Quest Hand-in: Murr will make Lurr smash fast!  When he done smashing, we put it in box.  Box here for you later.
Title: Legendary Heroes

Description: Your radiate command and power, {class}. Exalted in the eyes of Frostwolf - the enemy cowers at the mention of your name.

Rise, Hero of Frostwolf. Rise and be honored!

Present your insignia.

 Quest Hand-in: Soon, all on the field of battle will be under your watchful eye. Command of the Valley and its troops will be yours!
Title: By Royal Decree

Description: Idiot gnoll not understand crown. Only understand violence. Beat them up or I eat you.

 Quest Hand-in: Good start... but have bigger plans.
Title: Victory, For Now

Description: The Alliance are victorious, and our forces are still strong.  Military strategy dictates that we attack the Forsaken now, while they are recovering and unaware.  I made a deal, however...

We will wait.  We attack Koltira and his troops when the time is right.  In the meantime, speak with Ginny Goodwin and take a flight to the Chillwind Camp, to our south.  Commander Ashlam Valorfist will give you your next assignment.

You will hear from me when you are needed again in Andorhal.

 Quest Hand-in: Word arrived shortly before you did, <name>.  With the Scourge ejected from Andorhal, we are one step closer to retaking Lordaeron.
Title: Seeking Solvent

Description: Gah! Not again. Another blown gasket....

Every time one of these goes, lubricant gums up all of the gears. Without solvent, it takes hours to clean.

Tell ya what, {race}. There's some fancy rocket fuel on the Venture Company barge in the dock there - element 115 I think they call it. That stuff makes for a great solvent.

Get me one of those and I'll make it worth your trouble.

 Quest Hand-in: Ahh yes. That'll save me hours.Take this for your trouble, friend. And keep an eye out for more element 115. I'll take all you can find.
Title: Talbuk Training: Orc Hunters

Description: The Warsong Clan of Nagrand are some of the finest hunters the world of Draenor has ever known. Their beast-killers will aid us in putting this mount to the test.

Out in Nagrand, you will find an orc by the name of Karak, the Great Hunter. He has slain more fierce beasts than any other in the clan. Face him astride your mount, and avenge the slain.

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, you have hunted the hunter. Many beasts will be pleased tonight.
Title: The Interest of Bruto

Description: You have done me a great service. This blade is as much yours as it is mine.

I offer you this blood oath: I shall serve your cause and lend my knowledge of blades and mining to your forces.

Will you accept it?

 Quest Hand-in: Now THAT is how you break out of a gladiator pit!You are fun. Your weapons are covered in a rainbow of blood types.I am going to follow you now.
Title: Rare Resources

Description: The Brokers are odd characters, but useful. They can find many things across the vast realms of the Shadowlands that we cannot. 

We have relied upon them to bring us useful materials for many years, but these days, we have little to trade.

They value a currency of their own making, coins of brokerage, as a general means of trade.

If you find any in your travels, I would appreciate a handful, as it would allow me to procure some rare and necessary items.

 Quest Hand-in: Oh, this is quite a find. These will allow me to procure some rather rare ingredients and materials, and with them, we may turn the tide against our foes. Well done.
Title: Sleeping Giants

Description: I've overheard what you've had to say with Greatmother Ankha. With all due respect, she's not having you go far enough.

You must also deal with the vrykul that lie dormant in the Waking Halls beneath Gjalerbron!

I have no doubt that the rituals involved with awakening them are the key to their downfall. Most likely the necrolords have some device that you can use to bring the vrykul out of their dormant state prematurely.

Surely such a disruption will prove fatal to the vrykul.

 Quest Hand-in: You did what had to be done. The unwise might consider it dishonorable to slay the helpless while they awaken, but in this case you would have been a fool to have done otherwise.And we certainly couldn't have just left them standing there to be ritually wakened, now could we?It was a brave thing you did for all of us down in those catacombs, <race>.
Title: Security!

Description: It's not as like I haven't got enough to think about here!

Keeping this place operational is hard enough without constant elf and draenei harassment.

Now, on top of everything, there's an assassin lurking around the camp who's killed an important diplomat... on my watch!

Whoever it is couldn't have gotten far, {class}. Scour the camp until you find her and then avenge the diplomat!

At least I can bring the assassin's head with me when I have to answer to Hellscream.

 Quest Hand-in: Well done, <class>.One last request - it would probably be best if none of my laborers knew this assassin ever existed.
Title: Scars of the Past

Description: The Army of the Light's warframes have won countless battles on Argus. Despite their power, not all who descend into the fray return.

My modifications to this frame should give us the edge we need, but several critical components are still missing.

There are remains of battles past in Nath'raxas that we can still scavenge. If you can find the pieces I need, the Legion will feel our fury yet.

 Quest Hand-in: Perfect! Thank you, <name>.
Title: Quid Pro Quo

Description: Quid is a very powerful and very ancient water spirit, though you might not know it with his child-like ways.

This morning, Quid nearly killed several villagers in the bar when he jokingly caused several of the water kegs to explode.

As long as the water flows, Quid will remain. He cannot be slain. But he can be reminded that we do not take his dangerous antics in jest.

Would you be willing to carry this message to him on behalf of the village?

 Quest Hand-in: For the sake of the villagers, I hope he remains at bay for some time.Thank you, my friend.
Title: Forces of Nature: Treants

Description: Some people think treants are good for little more than fetching drinks in a war. Most of them haven't seen an entire defensive line scattered by what they thought was cover.

And have you ever seen a peon try to chop one down and get surprised? I was in tears...

At any rate, they're immensely valuable allies. You'll find some wandering just outside  the Tower of Estulan and more in forest to the east, just southeast of Dire Maul. Be on the lookout for the Horde!

 Quest Hand-in: They may not look it, but some treants grow to be ancient protectors. We could use a few more of those around here...
Title: Nesingwary Will Know

Description: So da Gurubashi be on da rampage an' dey usin' serpents to lead da charge.

You know who be good at keepin' da animal population in check?  Da hunters at Nesingwary's Expedition.

Head over dere and see how dey doin'.  See if dey know a good way to get rid of da serpents.

If dey don't know, den you gotta at least warn dem dat dese serpents, it ain't all natural.

 Quest Hand-in: We know all about the serpents, <name>.  But there is something else out there lurking...  The jungle has come to life, <class>!
Title: Management Material

Description: Truun needs wood, huh? Normally I could provide, but not today.

With constant elf attacks, gathering lumber is dangerous work. The peons I have left are reluctant to venture into the woods.

You want wood? Then you go convince the peons to work.

And keep them safe! I cannot afford to lose any more!

 Quest Hand-in: It seems you've solved one problem only to face another, <class>.
Title: Against Their Will

Description: When the naga brought me down here, I saw many of my vrykul mining the sea floor. They had... squids... attached to their faces.

Whatever those things are, they must be controlling my kin and forcing them to work for the naga.

I do not know what will happen if you remove the squids, but I would rather my vrykul die than be slaves to the naga.

See me in Jandvik when the deed is done.

 Quest Hand-in: I must express gratitude for the vrykul you have saved this day.
Title: Direbeak Team Up

Description: <Your direbeak hatchling bites you. It appears to want to do something together as a team!>

<To learn, your hatchling must be at your side before you begin a battle, must be your first pet to enter the battle, and cannot die in battle.>

 Quest Hand-in: <The hatchling nips at your feet excitedly. It seems to like doing things with you quite a lot! It will need some time to recover from this adventure.>
Title: Not-So-Honorable Combat

Description: Atop the tallest peak to the southwest overlooking Jotunheim is Battlescar Spire. It is a place of reverence for the vrykul, second only to Valhalas in terms of where they prefer to do honorable combat.

We shall visit not-so-honorable combat upon it.

Gather your companions and fly to the spire. When you are ready, light the signal fire and I will appear within the body of Iskalder.

We will fight, you will win, and Vardmadra is sure to come to witness the battle!

 Quest Hand-in: I've put Vardmadra aside for the moment. She's someplace safe until we can enact our final revenge!
Title: Maldraxxi Protocols

Description: It looks shorter than the others, but... are those bullets?

 Quest Hand-in: Not going to lie to you, this sounds really dry. Do I at least get to wear their cool armor?
Title: Team Carry

Description: Algerson is about as useful as a legless horse. We're going to do this ourselves.

The mill is overrun with bizarre creatures. I'll handle those. You and these hearty volunteers will need to be the muscle of this operation.

Don't look at me like that, {class}. It's just a little lifting.

Once we have enough lumber, Sal will meet us for a pick up. Just stay close to me and focus on not dropping my wood, yes?

 Quest Hand-in: Why are you all sweaty?
Title: Brann Bronzebeard's Lost Letter

Description: To Whom It May Concern:

If you're reading this, I'm either dead or soon to be dead. It's hard to say. Most of the crew is dead anyhow.

Found information about a Titan. Great battle between him and an Old God. Yes, a bona fide Old God. Found ancient tunnel leading to Ahn'Qiraj. Taking it.

Take this letter to my old camp. Make sure my monkey is getting adequate food, water, and hugs.

-Brann Bronzebeard, Explorer Extreme

P.S. Watch out for crazy Old God worshipping night elf.

 Quest Hand-in: Well this explains a lot. If you ever find a way into Ahn'Qiraj, keep an eye out for ol' Brann. I'm afraid that he'll be powerless without his monkey.
Title: Protection: Aid of the Illidari

Description: Thankfully, we are not quite alone in uncovering the Legion's plots to infiltrate the city.

Kor'vas Bloodthorn of the Illidari has taken to patrolling the city streets on her own to find the source behind the recent attacks.

I do not entirely trust these 'demon hunters', but they have at least proved adept at their namesake. I suggest you find her and see what she has uncovered before the Legion strikes once more.

Specialization: Protection Paladin

 Quest Hand-in: You - I've seen you out on the isles.We need to move quickly!
Title: Compy Stomp

Description: The raptors and saurid of the Zandalari represent a substantial threat to our forces here. They are superb hunting beasts that can track prey over great distances and are often lethal to encounter when caught unawares.

I need you to head into the Beast Pens and cull their numbers. We need to make sure to slay them before they are fully trained.

 Quest Hand-in: We lost three good soldiers when we first arrived on this island. Killed in their sleep by compies that had snuck into their tent. Some nights I still hear the screams.
Title: Take The Fight To Them

Description: Our scouts report that Margrave Gharmal gathers their forces at the House of Constructs.

Our necropolis and our new kyrian allies have already begun an aerial assault. I need you to lead our forces on the ground.

Meet me within Zerekriss. We will begin our attack immediately.

 Quest Hand-in: Victory will be ours.
Title: There's Gold in Them There Fields

Description: We've still got some folks missing, and I could use your help finding them.

While Brennadam is now secure, I worry for some of our farms closer to the quilboar kraul. We relied on the militia in the past to keep the quilboar back, but now that they've retreated to the east I worry that our outlying farms are in danger.

Goldfield's farm is almost directly south of us, up the hill by the falls. While it's not surprising that he hasn't left, I would feel better if you checked in.

 Quest Hand-in: Roz always worries about me. I keep tellin' her I'm fine up here, but she never listens...
Title: The Scent of Blood

Description: I'm afraid that I wet my hands with saurok blood while you were away.

I'm sorry, but I could not help myself. Now, watch them attack me.

Pitiful!

Do they think to take vengeance for their fallen? Do they come challenge ME?

I, who have won a hundred wars? I, who stood alone against thousands and still shouted for my enemies to come?

No, these... saurok... will crumple before me like paper before the flame!

I shall show you my might, Wakener. Fight alongside me and see.

Here they come!

 Quest Hand-in: You have succeeded once again. Well done, Wakener.
Title: The Best Prevention

Description: If you've brought the High Exarch back to us, you are a welcome ally indeed.

More is needed of you. You see our soldiers out there, fighting against all odds? Defend them. Slay the enemy.

Strong words for a priest, perhaps, but every dead man'ari is one less blade at our throats.

Show them that the Light protects its chosen even as it scorches the unfaithful.

When you are finished, seek out Y'mera. She will have fewer troops, and more need of your abilities.

 Quest Hand-in: You fought well. The Light shines brighter, thanks to your efforts.
Title: Calling in All Favors

Description: {name}, the time has come.

We cannot allow Kel'Thuzad to wield the Ritualists' sorcery as a weapon. He must be destroyed.

Rally our forces. We march on the House of Rituals!

 Quest Hand-in: We were brought together by chance, but now we fight as one.Our victory today will be one for all Maldraxxi.
Title: A Cloudlet of Classy Cologne

Description: You seem the enterprising sort, {class}. How about we make a little deal?

Crown wants to offer samples of our latest holiday-themed products to as many potential customers as we can. Help us share the love while earning some fantastic Crown merchandise!

Your time, our money, friend. What do you think?

 Quest Hand-in: Nice work, <name>! People will be buying Crown colognes by the crate-load now that they've had a chance to try them.Here's a little something for helping us out.
Title: Obtaining Ogre Offensive Orders

Description: My sister, Mirana, is scouting the upper bluff while I've checked out the lower area. There are two particular ogre mages that do a lot of bossing around in the lower area.

They seem to have some orders or scrolls on them that would help us figure out what's really going on.

Collect that information and meet with my sister on the long stairway up there.

 Quest Hand-in: Glad you are here. I almost got killed up there at the top. Oh what are these papers? This is much worse than I imagined!
Title: Break An Arm

Description: The insurgents you marshaled gave me some bad news, {name}.

The arcanists loyal to Elisande have reactivated the Arm of the Magistrix. The most powerful construct ever attempted, it raged out of control and decimated an entire district before it was disabled. Truly they must be desperate to turn it against us.

The scouts have spotted it in the Crimson Thicket to the north. We cannot allow it to reach full power if we are to succeed.

 Quest Hand-in: We almost lost the invasion before we could begin. Good work.
Title: A Way Home

Description: We are only alive thanks to the ankoan and Azshara's desire to toy with us.

We will learn more of Okani's people in the times ahead, I am sure.

For now, we must establish a portal home. While Azshara is blocking our traditional methods of magical travel, I can sense a powerful convergence of energies nearby.

I believe we can use it to open a way home.

 Quest Hand-in: We are exceptionally lucky to have met the ankoan. Perhaps things are not as dire as they seem.
Title: A Display of Power

Description: It looks like all the big players are here. This thing's gonna be starting any moment now.

You'll probably want to get a good seat.

 Quest Hand-in: This is a troublesome turn of events.I'm afraid the Banshee Queen may have set in motion a ruinous path for the Horde. Keep your eyes and ears open, <name>. The day is not yet done.
Title: Wanted!  Otto and Falconcrest

Description: The Stromgarde Militia has placed bounties on the heads of Lord Falconcrest, and his bodyguard Otto.  Falconcrest heads the Syndicate's efforts in the Arathi Highlands, and his death would cause a major disruption in those efforts.

His bodyguard Otto, although not a strategic target, is a fierce opponent and has killed dozens of our defenders.

Their bounties may be collected from Captain Nials.

 Quest Hand-in: Falconcrest and Otto?  Wonderful!Here is your reward, <name>.  I am happy to pay it.
Title: The Cipher of Damnation - Ar'tor's Charge

Description: At last, we are ready. I will bestow a piece of my spirit upon you, hero. It will guard you and help you in your battle against evil.

You must then travel south of here towards the back of Illidari Point. Hidden in the ether is a vile creature known as Veneratus the Many. My spirit hunter will call him out when he is near.

Destroy Veneratus and take from his corpse the second part of the Cipher of Damnation.

 Quest Hand-in: <Ar'tor fades in and out of existence.>It would seem that my time is nearly at an end, hero.
Title: How to Repair a Titan Keeper

Description: Major system repair possible within nearby structure. Preliminary goal: repair auxiliary systems.

Scans detect three fallen titan keepers. Recover cores. Titan Keeper Hezrel able to retrieve data from cores.

Titan Keeper Hezrel goal: reboot auxiliary systems, reach nearby structure, restore all primary systems, seal corruption.

Result: corruption contained. Titan Keeper Hezrel able to aid against blood trolls.

Blood troll definition not found in databanks.

 Quest Hand-in: Cores recovered. Data validation and merge will begin shortly.
Title: While You're Here

Description: The Maraudine have raided the Gelkis camps for many years, stealing anything they could get their hands on.

One of their favorite torments is to take these relics of power which the Gelkis hold sacred, and bring them here to be defiled.

The Gelkis clan would certainly be grateful if you were to find and destroy these defiled artifacts.

 Quest Hand-in: The destruction of those defiled relics will ease the minds of the Gelkis, and will strengthen their resolve.You have done well.
Title: The Sundered Staff

Description: I have no choice but to trust you with the secrets of the Lodestaff.

In the right hands, such as those of a trained Archivist, the staff can locate influential relics from the afterlives of the Shadowlands.

It was split into three segments to ensure that it would not fall into the wrong hands. The invaders have found the pieces, but they are yet not aware of their significance.

Recover the pieces of the staff. Each segment is held by a different member of the Mawsworn.

 Quest Hand-in: I cannot fully describe the relief I feel now that we have the Lodestaff.
Title: Clearing the Walls

Description: <This scroll shows the locations of a series of pylons, that protect Perdition Hold from assault.

Destroying these Pylons could aid in the success of our attack>

 Quest Hand-in: The defenses are broken! Most excellent, Maw Walker.
Title: If We Could Turn Back Time

Description: A proper Timewalker never leaves a crisis half-resolved. Why wait and study when we have the tools we need already?

Since you have my original staff, I found a spare for me to use. I am sure no one will miss it. This is my plan: we team up on those rifts together and save the day! All the days, really. Sorry, I still get confused about the time stuff. 

What do you say? The task should be simple enough, right?

 Quest Hand-in: We did it! Right?Okay maybe there was a wrinkle or two--nothing Dante needs to know about. Also, an unexpected visitor..Still, overall I would say that went pretty well.
Title: Quiet the Cannons

Description: Now it's time to do something about those darn cannons up on the bluffs to the east!

If you'd be so kind, hop into your boat and cruise on over to the Southsea Holdfast. Up top you'll see a bunch of cannons firing down on us.

Those pirates don't know squat about engineering. It shouldn't be too difficult for you to clog 'em up and make them explode.

 Quest Hand-in: They're still shooting, but not nearly as much! Yeeeeeeeeeaaaaaaaaaaah!
Title: The City of the Dead

Description: An ancient city of the dead can only mean one thing. The Veiled Ossuary off the coast of northern Thaldraszus.

It's extensive, remote, and hard to approach. The perfect place to hide something. I'm not sure what we'll find there, {name}. But you can bet that it won't appreciate our presence.

 Quest Hand-in: Good, you're here! The sooner we begin the sooner we can leave.
Title: Brother Betrayers

Description: Watcher Moonleaf is from my dreams! If you are her friend, you are mine.

I was alpha male until the last full moon. Then the strange white worg, Garwal, came from the north, and with the help of my once-brothers, he quickly became alpha worg. There is something unnatural about him.

To help, you must first kill those who betrayed me.

Bjomolf hunts to the northwest of a place called Steel Gate. And look for Varg to the southeast, near the West Spear Tower.

They will not be fooled by your form.

 Quest Hand-in: The smell of their blood upon your muzzle pleases me. Brothers should not turn on each other.
Title: Honor Their Sacrifice

Description: There's nothin' we can do for the foragers the Primalists killed, but we can at least try an' provide some closure tae their kin.

See if ye can find anythin' of a personal nature on the fallen. I'm sure the Winterpelt will appreciate whatever ye can bring them.

 Quest Hand-in: It's not much, but it's somethin'. And that's what matters.
Title: The Challenger's Ring: Lao-Chin the Iron Belly

Description: Lao-Chin seems to have his head in the clouds... or, rather, in his beer.

After all of his recent battles, he seems completely obsessed with with trying to develop the perfect brew for fighting. 

That's well and good, but we need him to actually do some fighting!

You should go challenge him, see if you can snap him out of his rut. 

If you beat him, he'll probably want to go out and help fight just to try to one-up you!

 Quest Hand-in: Wow, you must have impressed Lao-Chin. He can't stop talking about how excited he is to go out and fight with you. Good work.
Title: The Road to Kun-Lai

Description: Ah! Greetings friend of Lorewalker Cho. I have a message for you.

<The strange little creature hands you a battered scroll case.>

The Lorewalker waits for you in Kun-Lai. Very dangerous to travel there, yes, very dangerous.

Look for guides along the road to help you find your way.

 Quest Hand-in: Oh, you are a friend of Cho's? Welcome! Welcome!I would serve you a banquet but as you can see we are in dire straights at the moment.Say, would you be willing to lend us a hand?
Title: The Fanciest Water

Description: I've heard lots of cockamamie rumors about this here brewery. I thought they were all false... until I saw that giant hozen.

So, it got me thinkin', what if the other rumors are true? I heard this one rumor just the other day about some water sprites that run around inside the brewery, causin' a ruckus and whatnot. Their bodies are actually MADE OF WATER.

I reckon a man could make some mighty fine beer with some fancy water like that. If you find any, could you bring me some?

 Quest Hand-in: Looks like plain ol' water to me. It's hard to believe it's actually the corpse of a real, honest-to-goodness walkin'-around living thing.Can't wait to turn it into beer and drink it.
Title: A Wing and a Prayer

Description: The time has come to face Eregos.

He draws strength from the energies he is charged with defending - sipping from the well of the great aspect Malygos.

However, defeating the Mage-Lord has allowed us to unlock the full power of our drakes. Use them wisely and Eregos shall surely fall.

 Quest Hand-in: I can already feel their defenses weakening!Not since the onset of this conflict have we dealt a blow of this magnitude to the Lord of Magic.Do not forget to visit Eregos' cache. Surely some of his treasures will interest you.
Title: The Golden Dream

Description: Ashyo must have experienced what we call the golden dream.

Many of us working here have seen it, too - often after a long day of toiling in the pools. It is said this vision--and the feeling of elation it brings--is a reward to the mind for working the body.

There IS an easier way, though we rarely resort to it anymore: a tea can be brewed using lotus root and dreamleaf, which grows around the shrine on the upper tier.

Bring the dreamleaf to Yan back in town and he can brew the tea for you.

 Quest Hand-in: Ah... dreamleaf! So you want to see the Golden Dream, do you?Come to think of it, I haven't seen the Dream in years - not since I was a cub spending long hours playing in the pools. Long before I took up the culinary arts.Looks like you brought enough dreamleaf for two cups of tea... so why not?Here's to better days!
Title: Cleansing the Afflicted

Description: With the sacred herbs and the bear's blessing, you must use this herb bundle to cleanse my brothers. The corruption spilling over from Felwood has driven them mad and they will attack any who come near. Expect the afflicted Blackwood to be angry with you until you have slain the spirits of corruption that haunt them.

When you have freed my brothers from their madness, return to me.

 Quest Hand-in: You have done well. My people have begun to emerge from their madness, but they will fall back into it if we do not deal with the source of the corruption.
Title: Staying Connected

Description: The Tongue of Ba-Shon should allow us to communicate from long distances, {name}.

If the relic works the way I think it will, I should be able to stay here and continue my meditations while you do some scouting in the Valley of Emperors.

Mishi will take you to the edge of the valley so that we can test my theory. I would hate for you to be in the tombs with no way to contact me. That would be horrible!

 Quest Hand-in: Very good! The relic works!It appears there is more going on in the Valley of Emperors than I had anticipated. It is crucial we figure out why the Mogu are opening the tombs.
Title: Reoccupation

Description: There's no shortage of Kvaldir to slaughter. They're obviously still reeling from our assault.  The city has been desolate so long, I doubt they expected any naga to contest them here.

There have been no reports yet of their leader. I'm sure that culling them further will force the coward to rear his head soon enough.

Shall we continue?

 Quest Hand-in: Hah! It seems you were right. That broken trident is serving you just fine. I suppose I don't get to see you claw anything to death today after all.
Title: The Missing Fisherman

Description: In the fevered dreams of our injured guest, she spoke of a fisherman, Cowlen, who was in some distress at Silvermyst Isle, to the southwest, off the coast of Azuremyst.

With all that has been happening, no one has had the opportunity to look into it, but I do feel a bit of worry. Perhaps there's something you can do, {name}?

 Quest Hand-in: My family... What have I done... What could I have done?Why must I be punished so?
Title: Hornswoggled!

Description: Oh, those hornswogs make me so mad!

<Keshki stomps her foot angrily, knocking her glasses askew>

They're big, greedy bullies! Just because the place is named after them doesn't mean they get to jump all around and eat everything smaller than them!

Here, use my jar of fireflies--it's a frog-minder's best friend. It'll calm the frogs enough that you can collect them, and we can get them out of harm's way.

And if any hornswogs get in your way, don't be afraid to bully them back!

 Quest Hand-in: Whew, all the frogs we helped are in the carrier!
Title: We Require More Minerals

Description: The Titans built two Ancient Stone Keepers to help protect Uldaman from would-be invaders and to oversee daily operations while Ironaya and Archaedas slumber. One is still fully operational in Temple Hall, but the one in Echomok Cavern has been corrupted by something.

I suspect that one of the Old Gods is responsible for this, and you're going to help me see if that is indeed true. Topple both of the guardians and bring me their power cores. They'll tell us all we need to know. 

 Quest Hand-in: Both of these cores are still far more potent than most of the cores we use  to power our own protectors, and these are ancient devices!Thank you, these will prove extremely valuable to our society.
Title: Nazgrel

Description: Escaping Stonemaul was the easy part. The ogre filth that rule the pits still have my son.

For a while they used him as leverage to ensure I would fight in their arenas. But now that I have escaped they will try to train him to replace me.

Please, rescue my son. If they see me they will kill him instantly.

 Quest Hand-in: This deed will never be forgotten as long as I or my son live. You have my gratitude, hero, and my loyalty.
Title: Prowling Polar Predators

Description: The species we've been sent to study is the frigidpelts.

Their hunting grounds have been tainted by ley lines. Arcane energies leech into the water and into the plants... and into prey species like the slyvern.

But unlike other organisms, the frigidpelts survive the process and gain power from it.

They also become aggressive--which is a problem. Engage a few, and I will take notes on their strength and aggression. 

My report will help the Kirin Tor decide what to do for them.

 Quest Hand-in: <She scribbles notes down in her journal.>Yes... Yes, this is all very helpful. Hopefully the Kirin Tor will be able to use this information to help others afflicted by the arcane sickness.
Title: A Visit to the Doctor

Description: So they've been embedding these ghouls with broken shards of saronite down in the Sanctum of Reanimation? We must put a stop to this, before these ghouls can be deployed against our troops.

Find the entrance to the Sanctum of Reanimation in the flesh giant lab area of the Fleshwerks. There, the ghoul mastermind, Doctor Sabnok, keeps the most fearsome of his creations, Patches. Free Patches from his chains and help him take his revenge on the doctor. Let his own creation be his undoing.

 Quest Hand-in: <Dakrider Arly throws her head back and laughs darkly.>A fitting end for the 'good' doctor, wouldn't you say?
Title: Glop, Son of Glop

Description: Glop had a son. In his grave hubris, he named it Glop. And so the line of fungalmancers continues.

I require you to slay this new fungalmancer. Your shaman ally has already returned, and awaits you at his cave in the southwest of Verlok Stand.

 Quest Hand-in: Perhaps one day, we shall slay these stone troggs more swiftly than they can breed, and in so doing, end the line of fungalmancers forever.In time.
Title: Bad Juju

Description: Look, between you and me, dere is no way we will drag my friend outta here without what got us into dis mess.

We saw three orbs in dis camp. Dey are filled with de power of blood magic and are used in dirty rituals. 

Blood is drained from "volunteers" to corrupt de tadpoles of Krag'wa into vicious crawgs.

If dis is a possible fate for children of loa, we must end it. 

Take dis vial and bleed de orbs dry. De chronicler will need to do research.

 Quest Hand-in: Ugh! Even I feel de corruption. I am sure Jabari will be able to find de secrets locked away in here. Thank you, <name>.
Title: Black Rook Hold: Into Black Rook Hold

Description: This thing is ancient. Just turning the pages risks them disintegrating in my hands.

Here, I have found it. An entry about the Raven's Eye.

<Valeera traces her finger from left to right above the page. A look of discovery comes over her features, which is quickly replaced by a frown.>

It says here that the last person to have possession of the eye was Lord Ravencrest himself. You are going to have to go into Black Rook Hold and take it from him.

 Quest Hand-in: We have it. Finally, we will be able to crack SI:7's coded letter.
Title: Trial of the Naaru: Tenacity

Description: Four trials you must pass before you are deemed worthy by the naaru.

In our travels we have encountered many dangerous beings. Some of these beings we incarcerated and placed in what is now known as the Arcatraz of Tempest Keep.

There is one prisoner, however, that is a victim of circumstance. A stowaway who was in the wrong naaru vessel at the wrong time.

Venture to the Arcatraz and rescue the gnome, Millhouse Manastorm. Ensure his survival.

 Quest Hand-in: Well done, <name>. You have passed the trial of tenacity.
Title: The Path of Redemption

Description: "The Path of Redemption," ever heard of it? It is allegedly a journal that holds the prophetic ramblings of High General Abbendis of the Scarlet Onslaught. Within that book can be found the motivations and goals of the Scarlet zealots - not to mention a whole lot of insanity.

Venture to Onslaught Base Camp, northeast of Wintergarde Keep, and recover a copy of "The Path of Redemption" from one of the Onslaught soldiers.

 Quest Hand-in: <Halford reads the journal.>Abbendis has gone off the deep end. The Light speaks to her now?Despite the inane ramblings, this journal gives us a never before seen look into the mind of the Scarlet zealots. This was a great find, <name>. Lord Fordragon will be pleased.
Title: Like A Dwarf In A Mine

Description: Baelog and Eric swear there's got to be treasure at the bottom of the mine. Why? Because it's a mine! An' we sure do love rocks that sparkle.

On our last trip, we were beaten back by huge ogres. Baelog held up the rear, swingin' his sword, while Eric rushed on ahead to try and find a quick exit.

Wouldn't you know, in all that excitement, I done lost my shield AGAIN?

<Olaf looks at you imploringly.>

 Quest Hand-in: By the light, that's her! You've done it again, an' I can't thank you enough! We'll try to be more careful next time.
Title: A Symbol of Hope

Description: Before Anduin followed the Jailer through the gateway, he dropped something.

I'm not sure what it was, but Jaina picked it up. Perhaps this is a sign that Anduin is still fighting back against the Jailer!

We need to find out what this object was, and why the young king left it for us.

 Quest Hand-in: Anduin Wrynn does not deserve such a fate.We must fight to save him, <name>!
Title: Dread Tidings

Description: The threat the nathrezim pose to our forces must not be underestimated. They are cunning, rivaling the best veterans of the House of Eyes, and we do not know their full plan.

Among the venthyr there is one whose wrath scourged the nathrezim from the Shadowlands for many thousands of years. 

I ask you travel to Sinfall, seek out Prince Renathal, and deliver to him this missive. I shall send one of my own spies, the Baroness Vashj, to meet you there. Make use of her experience with the nathrezim.

 Quest Hand-in: The nathrezim have returned? I dared not imagine they would ever grow so bold again.A shame they have not learned in their exile, and return to us as enemies instead of family.
Title: Blind the Eyes

Description: Strange forces have been interfering with my visions of late. The ever-watching eyes pierce through the veil, shattering my clairvoyance.

The eyes of our enemy peer into our very souls and pierce our minds. We must rip them out, if we truly wish to be rid of the curse on this land.

 Quest Hand-in: The eyes are closed, and my clairvoyance returns.Thank you, <class>.
Title: Defiling the Defilers

Description: I sensed a large accumulation of magic in the runes that we witnessed when you were scouting the cave. I will not have you toy with extracting the magic... often the most straight forward solution is the most effective one.

Destroy the runes... stamp them out and ensure that the Cult will not have access to whatever power that they've accumulated there.

 Quest Hand-in: Good. There is more to be done.
Title: Spray it One More Time

Description: You'd think Rinno could have sent more than a single {race} down here to give us a hand! That freeloader...

I'm gonna set this up. Head north from this room through the corridor and look for Sana. She's probably gotten herself lost in the last chamber, so check the side passages once you get there.

 Quest Hand-in: Rinno sent you! And you brought... fumigators? Ugh!
Title: Brotherly Love

Description: Maiev will be somewhere in the prison. I found her discarded armor on my way here.

Let's split up to search the cells more quickly.

We must find her.

 Quest Hand-in: <Maiev's face is bruised, her lips cracked, and her body covered in scars. She looks thin and ragged, but she moves with purpose.>For weeks they tried to break me. Amateurs!I kept my silence. I counted the minutes, measured their steps, and listened to the voices beyond my cell.I have been waiting for my chance to escape, and to strike back at my captors.Now, you bring my armor AND my blade. My salvation will be followed by bloodshed.<Maiev smiles.>
Title: Grip of Nightmare

Description: Most of the druids were able to escape, but the shrine is still swarming with enemies.

The shrine's leader, Sylendra  Gladesong, stayed behind to recover Malorne's Idol. We must go back and help her.

 Quest Hand-in: The satyr have never been this bold, or powerful. They took us completely by surprise, and our magic could not withstand their attacks. Without you, I would not have survived.I have only one purpose now - to recover that idol.
Title: An Audience With The Archmage

Description: Your Arcane Sanctum is coming along nicely, commander.

Everything's built to spec... except for one detail Gazlowe scrawled in at the bottom of the blueprint. "Don't forget to connect the sanctum to the ley line network!"

I, uh... I have no idea how to do that.

I'm sorry commander, but magic just isn't my thing. We did spot Archmage Khadgar and some Kirin Tor not far from here. To the east, up near the mountains.

Maybe we should ask them for help?

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, so you've built an Arcane Sanctum! Splendid!Troubles connecting to the ley line network, I take it?
Title: A Sound Defense

Description: Horde forces are attacking Tiragarde Sound. Make them regret every footstep upon our soil!

 Quest Hand-in: Everyone in Boralus cheered when we saw the explosions up on that airship! The Horde will think twice before assaulting Boralus again.
Title: Restless Dead

Description: Rumors are spreading of some new evil business happening in Stratholme of all places. We need you to head to Eastern Plaguelands and put an end to any new evil threats that may have taken residence there.

We have received contact from a member of the Argent Crusade who has offered their assistance to get you into Stratholme and find the source of this new evil.

 Quest Hand-in: Dead things in Stratholme isn't really a surprise anymore, but there's some new evil lurking within that we haven't seen before. Only the most courageous and strong willed should enter.
Title: The Gordok Ogre Suit

Description: Need another suit, do ya?  Well, I'm not going anywhere soon it seems - bring me another Ogre Tannin, and I'll make you another ogre suit.

 Quest Hand-in: Here ya go <name> - put this thing on, and you'll have ten minutes to do whatever.  Good luck!Oh, and if you happen to find a key to get me out of here, BY ALL MEANS LET ME KNOW!!!
Title: Reignite the Wards

Description: The demons are weakening my defenses. They must be far more powerful than what we've faced before.

Will you help me to reignite the wards to keep the Legion from overrunning our position here?

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you, <name>. That will give us the breathing room we need to launch our counter-offensive.
Title: Barbaric Battlements

Description: Twenty generations of Omosh have held this hammer, {name}. A hundred thousand tons of metal we have molded. Tragically, it all ends at Orokk, failure of the Omosh: Without kin and incapable of producing offspring.

I cannot let the secret recipes of Omosh die with me! Someone must continue the legacy, Omosh or not!

Prove to Orokk you are capable, {name}. Bring for Orokk the following: Two patterned bronze bracers, two bronze greatswords, and two sharp claws. Bring them for Orokk and we shall continue.

 Quest Hand-in: The bloodline will fade but perhaps the legend of Omosh will continue!You have proven that you are a blacksmith, <name>. For the blacksmith the reward is the satisfaction of seeing their weapons and armors coated in the blood of their enemies!May the breastplates you create for the generations ahead be drenched in the blood of your enemies!
Title: Kismetric Disc

Description: <Firim could make use of this item>

 Quest Hand-in: This is just what I needed! Take this in appreciation for your efforts!
Title: Protect the Home Front

Description: The Legion hasn't just invaded this city. Their evil is spreading across Azeroth, threatening the far corners of our world.

We must seek them out and stop them, everywhere their darkness touches.

We've dispatched scouts around the world to watch for Legion activity. As invasions arise, we'll mark the locations on your map.

Make them suffer, {name}!

 Quest Hand-in: You've done it! You've broken an invasion!If only that had ended our campaign. But the Legion will never relent until they are destroyed... or have destroyed us.Don't let up! Fight off more of these wretched invasions, <name>. The wyrmtongue we're holding captive here will reward your efforts.
Title: WANTED: Aggregate of Doom

Description: Attention all workers: 

We got ourselves a problem down in the thicket. 

A golem is trekking through the worksite, causing all sorts of trouble. 

Grab a rock and get to throwin'. The dredger that takes it out gets the rest of the day off. 

- Foreman Scug

 Quest Hand-in: You did it then? Fair enough. Now we can all get back to work.
Title: A Falling Star

Description: {class}t {name}, thank you for coming. I have a matter of some urgency that requires your unique talents.

The Order of the Silver Hand have reported that an extraordinarily luminescent object has emerged from the Felstorm and is currently falling towards the coast of Suramar. What I find most curious about this occurrence is that the object was reported as having "cut a swath" through the Felstorm itself.

Will you investigate? There is a gryphon awaiting your arrival at Krasus' Landing.

 Quest Hand-in: Most curious indeed! This is no object of the Legion's making. Let me have a closer look.
Title: The Kodo's Return

Description: The great beast rises slowly to its feet, the loose Barrens soil spilling from its revitalized limbs. Instinctively it trudges back toward its home at Grol'dom Farm.

You'll want to check in with Kranal Fiss to make sure the kodo made it. 

 Quest Hand-in: So that was your handiwork, <race>? Yes, the missing Kodo arrived just minutes ago. It will take many nights to nurse the poor beast's wounds, but thanks to you it's alive. And you saved a whole shipment!Please, take your pick of the gear that the kodo was carrying.
Title: Rustbolt Requisitions: Calcified Bone

Description: I've received an urgent request from Tinkmaster Overspark.

These supplies are needed!

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you, <name>. Your contribution has been logged in our records for posterity to appreciate!
Title: The Vile Blood of Demons

Description: Thalipedes wants demon blood.  Personally, the stuff doesn't even seem like blood to me - more like liquid rot - but that's neither here nor there.

Luckily for you, the area around the Dark Portal is crawling with demons.  Infernals, felhounds, felguards... they've all got what you need, in copious, pustulent amounts.

 Quest Hand-in: There's no doubt about it, you found demon blood.Loramus' requests aside, I'm sure Dar'toon is thankful for your efforts.  They've been struggling to deal with these demon distractions for some time now.
Title: Engineers: Not COMPLETELY Useless

Description: Unfortunately, I have no idea how to access any information within this core. But I know someone who does.

Head over to "Like Clockwork", the engineering shop three doors down from here. Timofey Oshenko owes me a favor. He should be able to extract the memory out of the core.

 Quest Hand-in: Oh, a memory core? One moment.
Title: Delicacy in the Dark

Description: Due to the nature of our clan, some resources are in short supply. We do not have the luxury of time to claim the land's metal resources.

The late khan established multiple trade connections with a variety of individuals, and I see no reason to discontinue their services.

The nearby bay contains buckets where we catch whelks - they're considered a delicacy for some of our neighbors. Bring a collection back to me for use in trade.

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, this will be helpful.It is hard for me to rely on outsiders for such a key resource, but I cannot think of an alternate route.
Title: The Nightborne Pact

Description: <Thalyssra winces and holds her abdomen.>

Ngh... I can ignore this wound no longer.

Help me patch this up. I will explain everything.

 Quest Hand-in: We must find a way to reclaim Suramar City.
Title: The Crumbling Village

Description: This journal belonged to Lewor, the leader of our grove. It says he found something to use against the gorm, but what if it caused all this?

There is only one way to be sure. Come with me to the village. Or what remains of it.

 Quest Hand-in: N-no... the village. They are all....
Title: Taken in the Night

Description: Our small outpost is under constant attack. Several nights ago, we were raided by the spiders of Netherweb Ridge, on the southeastern edge of the Bone Wastes. They poisoned many of our people, wrapped them in webs and carried them away. Some of our warriors took up arms and with little preparation pursued the spiders.

We have not seen the captives or our hunting parties since. We hope that some may still be alive, perhaps imprisoned by the spiders.  Our numbers are few. Will you search for our people?


 Quest Hand-in: You saved so many.  I didn't think we would ever see them again.  We cannot thank you enough, <name>.
Title: Vindicator Aldar

Description: With your help, we were able to find a solution to our problems faster than I could have hoped.

I don't have any other work for you to do. My apprentices and I can handle the rest.

You should go speak with Vindicator Aldar on the other side of the ship.

 Quest Hand-in: <name>, is it? I've heard good things about you and the work you've been doing in the short time since you came to.We'll definitely need your help getting things back to normal. Zhanaa, over there, could also use your help, I'm sure.
Title: Orders, Commander?

Description: Commander {name}, it's an honor.

We're barely holding on, sir. We have a week's supplies at best, assuming we have any troops left to supply in that time.

We have just enough material left to put up an inn or a trading post.

The inn would allow us to station reinforcements here, while the trading post would allow supply routes with the outcasts nearby.

We need your authorization for the project, commander. It's your decision.

 Quest Hand-in: Praise the Light you're here. I thought we were going to have to wait until a courier could reach you for a decision on this.
Title: The Burning Throne

Description: The time has come, {name}, to begin our assault upon Antorus. Everything we have fought for, everything our friends and family have sacrificed, has brought us to this moment.

We will fire Light's Judgment upon the walls of the accursed citadel and storm their seat of power. We will end the Legion.

After all you have done, it is fitting that you have the honor. Activate the Crown of the Triumvirate and let us finish our mission.

 Quest Hand-in: After so many years... so many sacrifices... victory is finally within our grasp.
Title: A Potential Ally

Description: One of the captured draenei is receiving some... preferential treatment, if you can call it that. While others are tied down and tortured, this one is tied to a stake and burned for the orcs' amusement.

Use this runestone. It should handily deal with the ring of fire that surrounds this draenei.

 Quest Hand-in: I owe my life to you, stranger. I offer you and your company my support. Together, we may make it out of this jungle alive.
Title: Favor: The Venthyr Diaries

Description: This item will be of great interest to the brokers. 

Per your previous deal with The Night Market, you should bring it to Ta'xera.

You will be fairly compensated.

 Quest Hand-in: <Ta'xera perks up at your offer.>Ah, what lies in these pages? Personal diary entries it seems. Very interesting. There's even one from the Accuser in here!This will be a treat to tear through.
Title: Secrets of the Mire

Description: The Shifting Mire takes its name from a unique phenomenon. By some force, the extremely fine silt will collect, and move on its own accord, travelling as if alive.

I originally worried this was some corruptive force, but my studies have shown the opposite; whatever energy invigorates this soil is positive in nature. Perhaps such vibrant life can be imparted onto the Broken to reawaken what they once were.

The silt may not take kindly to being collected, {name}. But please, help gather it.

 Quest Hand-in: It will have to be purified, but this will be most helpful. Thank you.
Title: Booty Bay

Description: Land of pirates, swindlers, and raiders! Zeros, once just a captive whelpling, has built a mighty reputation as an auction house trader in one of the most cutthroat places on Azeroth.

However, his recent investment blunder made the front page of the Booty Bay Journal. Rescue him before his debt is collected by the Baron.

 Quest Hand-in: You think I know anything about Booty Bay? Why yes, I do...
Title: Fletch Me Some Plumage!

Description: Say, {class}, while you're out there exploring the desert wastes, do me a favor?

Keep an eye out for Dread Swoops. Their oily feathers make for the best fletching, and to the right buyer they can fetch a handsome price.

Lucky for you, I know all of the right buyers!

 Quest Hand-in: Well now, that's quite a load of feathers, <class>.They'll make for a good pillow 'til I get 'em to market!
Title: Seams Familiar

Description: You find a necklace in the shape of an anchor with the name "Cabot" etched in a banner.

The name immediately brings up Myra Cabot, the mining trainer in Boralus.

The condition of the necklace makes it look like it has been well maintained. She probably wants it back.

 Quest Hand-in: By the Light! I thought I lost it forever!This used to belong to my great grandfather.<Myra clutches the necklace close to her heart for a moment as a tear runs down her cheek. After a moment, she looks around, shaking her head.>Nothing here can remotely repay this. It's not much, but I can show you how to get the most out of mining monelite seams.<Myra spends the next several minutes explaining several techniques to increase the amount of monelite mined from a seam.>
Title: A Great Idea

Description: Now that we've got a good pile of fresh chunks, we just tie it to this rope...and now you're ready to go catch me a silithid.

What? Don't give me that look, it's perfectly safe. Well, mostly safe. Okay, you might die painfully. But it'll be easy! Just throw this meat out there, wait for a bug to pounce on it, and then drag 'em back here by the rope!

Go after one of the swarmers. I haven't seen the other ones go for hyenas before, and you should find plenty of swarmers around the edge of the pit.

 Quest Hand-in: Look at the size of it! It's glorious. This ugly sucker's gonna help us bring down the whole hive.
Title: Links in the Chain

Description: Well, lad, I'm afraid I'm at me wits' end with these scales. Not quite sure how to fashion the remaining pieces fer a full set.

However, I've heard that the elves of Azsuna had some great crafters in their cities. Perhaps one or two of them still exist.

Go there and search fer a master. Maybe they can fill in the missing patterns fer us.

 Quest Hand-in: Yes, <class>? You seek to know the techniques of crafting elven mail?I see. Perhaps a bargain can be struck to benefit us both.
Title: A Day in the Groves

Description: Rymek was sent here by the blue flight to learn about and protect our gardens. 

I am glad for their support. We are few in number, and our losses have been great. The blue dragonflight commands powerful magic, so we can learn a great deal from each other.

Come. Let us demonstrate the green dragonflight's important role here in the Dragon Isles.

 Quest Hand-in: It is so peaceful here.This is Somnikus's favorite place to rest, but... he has been morose since his son was killed in the centaur attacks. But we shall focus on the present. Let us show Rymek our purpose here in the groves.
Title: Weed War

Description: You want some hops? I've got plenty in the shed out back. I'll gladly share some with you... if you'll help me weed my field.

Now "hop" to it! Get it?

 Quest Hand-in: You weed like a champion.
Title: Sentry Wards

Description: We've spotted heavy air support over their base, in the form of way too many dwarves on way too many griffons. Means we can't get any vision of the area from above.

A troll... friend of mine gave us a set of Sentry Wards, which we can use to spy on their base and get a vantage point on what's going on in there.

Bad news, friend - you're going to be the one going in there.

 Quest Hand-in: Good work, <name>. I've already been getting some useful information that should help make our next offensive even more devastating.
Title: Repel the Paratroopers

Description: The Alliance have caught back up with us at just the wrong moment, my friend. We took care of their ships, but they still have planes that are dropping their vaunted 127th Paratroopers onto the coast below.

It's all that the battlesworn and scouts can do to hold the two ramps against their overwhelming numbers. I'm certain that if you were to aid them, the tide would quickly be turned.

 Quest Hand-in: I've not seen a finer display of <class> prowess.
Title: Return of the Highborne?

Description: The wax seal on these orders has been freshly broken. You can't read the carefully-penned night elven script, but a small hand-drawn map indicates the nearby ruins. Underneath the map, written in a different language entirely, are a series of runes penned in a metallic, shimmering ink.

Ag'tor will no doubt want to see this important piece of intelligence. 

 Quest Hand-in: <Ag'tor squints at the parchment, turning it in the light.>No, I can't make sense of it either, but I don't like what I see. Are these arcane runes?I'll need you to deliver this to an expert.
Title: Warchief's Command: Borean Tundra!

Description: All able bodied members of the Horde are hereby ordered to report to the Warsong Recruitment Officer at Warsong Hold.

The Warsong Offensive needs your help to overcome the continued threat from the undead Scourge.

Take the zeppelin to Warsong Hold from Orgrimmar's western zeppelin tower and present yourself to the recruitment officer.

Destiny calls!

 Quest Hand-in: The Warsong Offensive could use more like you, <class>.
Title: In Every Dark Corner

Description: The Alliance's hold on Drustvar is weak. We will conquer it for the Horde!

 Quest Hand-in: Wherever the Alliance hides... we will find them.I'm glad Rokhan and the Darkspear are on our side.
Title: The Chamber of Khaz'mul

Description: In the Map Chamber there is a door which leads to the legendary Chamber of Khaz'mul. Who knows what secrets could be hidden inside!

What we do know is that it is guarded by Ironaya, a Titanic Watcher of immense size and power. You'll need to defeat her if you intend to unlock the secrets of Uldaman!

 Quest Hand-in: Don't worry about the chamber, my boys will check it out! You have more important things to do!
Title: Helya's Horn

Description: {name}, we need to bolster our army by any means necessary. The kvaldir are cursed beyond redemption, but they are fierce warriors and are a resource we should not overlook. 

They are eternally bound to obey Helya even through her death. If we can call them using her voice, they will follow us instead! 

We recovered Helya's Horn from her corpse. Empower it so you can call the kvaldir when we have need of them.

 Quest Hand-in: Revenge is sweet. The kvaldir will be forced to obey us, now!
Title: Network Diagnostics

Description: Unfortunately, we've got no clue where N'Zoth has been lurking since his escape. We do, however have an idea where he might strike.

Back when the keepers were imprisoning the Old Gods, they built defense mechanisms against their corruption into the titan forges. If N'Zoth wants tae corrupt Azeroth, he'll have tae go through them first.

Fortunately, we've got ourselves hooked up tae them now, so we can monitor them from here. Go ahead an' take a look.

 Quest Hand-in: I was hopin' we'd have more time tae prepare.Looks like now's the time tae act.
Title: The Catalyst Awakens

Description: Adventurer, can you feel it? High above the Catalyst Gardens, the Creation Catalyst hums with new power. 

This power will change the world itself. You must harness it at once.

 Quest Hand-in: The power of creation itself is in your hands.
Title: Heart and Soul

Description: The Forsworn that serve the Jailer dominate the skies above, but we know their weakness and shall use it against them.

Under my direction Mikanikos has created a supply of Trueheart Spears for our Protectors. When hit by these spears the Mawsworn will be weakened with their soul laid bare as they face their true self.

Collect the Trueheart Spears and use them to defeat the Mawsworn Myrmidons that fly above us.

 Quest Hand-in: There is great sorrow in this victory, but it had to be done.
Title: Touching Ground

Description: Their town is burning and their men are scattered and broken. I need every available man on the ground NOW to finish them off.

Grab one of the parachutes on the edge of the ship and get down there!

 Quest Hand-in: 'Bout time you showed up, laddy! Let's do some damage!
Title: Return to Boralus

Description: Shatterstone Harbor is an expansive foothold, and one that we will use to great advantage against the Horde.

I will leave Umbric and the others in charge here. Let's get back to the Wind's Redemption and return to Boralus.

 Quest Hand-in: The waters outside Vol'dun are rough, but Jes-Tereth is one of the best helmsmen on the sea!Let us roll one victory into another.
Title: A Solid Pet

Description: I worry about Ruszi. She is incredibly nervous and insecure, and she jumps at nearly anything! I have never heard of a black dragon so terrified of the world.

I believe the best way for us to build her confidence is to find her a companion. Something sturdy and strong that does not move quickly or suddenly.

The black dragonflight's charge is the protection of earth. Perhaps a small elemental will suit her well.

Speak to Lysindra at the pet shop in Valdrakken. She should have something suitable.

 Quest Hand-in: Look at this wonderful elemental! Hopefully it can help our little whelp build her confidence.
Title: The Path of Huln

Description: Armies are vital to the success of a war. But so are symbols.

For our people, few things make for a better symbol than the blessings of our most eldest ancestors.

Mayla must walk the Path of Huln.

The path is dangerous, and she may only bring two people with her: a spiritwalker to guide her and a champion to protect her.

Will you be the champion?

 Quest Hand-in: Quite a drop. Mind yourself in here, this is not a safe place.
Title: Him?

Description: Speak to some of the gnomes in Mechagon, enhanced or otherwise. Of my people, ask what they hope for in a leader of our kind. Of our new friends, ask what they appreciate most about their current leader.

From what I have learned thus far, the High Tinker has always led his people by necessity, he never sought or desired the crown. I believe the gnomes should be united once again. 

I seek a solution that will be most amenable to all. Will you gather the information I need?

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent, excellent, these are the results I was hoping for. You have strengthened my theory.
Title: Survival Skills

Description: The life of a hunter should never be dull. Living in the wild you never know what will happen next, but you survive on skill and instinct.

Show me you have the basic survival skills to live off the land.

 Quest Hand-in: You built your campfire with ease, and put a perfect sear on that steak. I'm impressed... and hungry.
Title: Shroud of the Makers

Description: It is good to have friends, {class}! While kindness is its own reward, there can be tangible benefits too!

Some friends of mine recently intercepted a shipment of Schnottz's plunder and found something that should serve your needs nicely.

It's a piece of titan technology that renders the user nearly invisible. If you use it in the enemy camp, you might be able to rewire their explosives and make a mess of their operation.

Each charge has a limited duration, so don't stray too far from safety!

 Quest Hand-in: Hah!I heard it from here! I wish I could've been there to see it!
Title: Report to Thomas

Description: Now that you have both medallions, deliver them to Guard Thomas at the bridge so that he might know the fate of his murdered guards.

 Quest Hand-in: You have confirmed my fears, <name>.  The murlocs are a threat we cannot ignore.
Title: A New Order

Description: Before we leave, I have one more task to ask of you.

While you were busy recruiting our inquisitors and driving the coven away from Arom's Stand, I took the liberty of placing an order with the local tailor. 

Using some of the sketches within the tome, I had him put together some uniforms reminiscent of those worn by the ancient order.

Since you will be leading our inquisitors, I think it's only fitting that you present them with their new regalia.

 Quest Hand-in: There, that was nice and official. Now, I think it's time we took the fight back to the Heartsbane. I believe the marshal has a plan.
Title: Dealing with Zeb'Sora

Description: The lieutenant here rushed us into battle with the trolls across the lake instead of scouting the situation first. We were decimated by his stupidity! You hear me Tomathren? You're an idiot!

Will you help us, {class}? Those trolls still need to be dealt with. I need to stay here and nursemaid him -- I think he's lost his mind.

Just head east to the other side of the lake into Zeb'Sora. I want revenge... bring me their ears so that I can fashion a nice necklace!

 Quest Hand-in: I appreciate your efforts, <class>! Thank you. Now, we can say that this expedition and all the lives lost on it haven't been in vain.
Title: Bloodlord Mandokir

Description: {race}.  {race}, {race}, {race}... you didn't think I was a friend, did you, {race}?  Ah, ha ha haaaa!

You've served your purpose.  I've returned to the realm of the living, and it's all thanks to you.  So, instead of killing you, I'm going to make you a deal instead.

Give me the raptor.

You must already know that she's no normal raptor, and I need a replacement for Ohgan.  Do it, or both you and the witch doctor will taste my rage.

 Quest Hand-in: I'm glad to see you've come to your senses.Come and visit us in Zul'Gurub sometime, <race>.  I'll be watching...
Title: Is That Your Goblin?

Description: I trust that's the green little one you've been looking for.  If I were you I'd step in before that Hyldnir splits him in half.

You've arrived in the middle of the Hyldsmeet, so all challenges must be accepted by participants.  There's nothing to stop you from taking your green friend's place.

 Quest Hand-in: Well done, young one.  It looks like our deal has been satisfied on both our ends.
Title: Unwelcome Outsider

Description: Hah! Look at you. Weak. Just like those puny hunters that brought you here.

You want to know the Nokhud? We speak through battle. 

Our battle ritual is called "the tabarr". We train. We spar. And it hardens us. Now there is no weakness in our clan.

Enough talk. Go spar.

 Quest Hand-in: The Nokhud prefer brute strength and power over all else.We do not see eye to eye on many things.
Title: The Foot of the Fortress

Description: We've enkindled your forces and the scroll is ready.

It's time for phase two - stealing a nexus crystal from a heavily fortified ogre compound.

We'll save the scroll to bring in reinforcements in our confrontation with the Gordunni Witch Lord. Let's meet at the base of the Gordal Foothills and take what is more or less rightfully yours!

 Quest Hand-in: My apologies for teleporting away. It's cheating, I know.I merely wanted to put a fire under your feet to get here quickly!
Title: Garrison Campaign: Onslaught at Auchindoun

Description: The Auchenai have sent me an urgent missive - Auchindoun is in jeopardy again! The Sargerei have renewed their assault  and breached the underhalls. I sense the hand of Gul'dan is behind this.

Gather your things and meet me in the Court of Souls West of Auchindoun at once!

 Quest Hand-in: I am glad you came at once. Something terrible is brewing beneath this holy place.
Title: Torn Bear Pelts

Description: Children love toys!  And no matter what race, I've found that all children love furry, plushy toys made from torn bear pelts!

You can get those pelts from the bears of Ashenvale or Hillsbrad.  Bring me a heap of them and earn yourself a heap of Darkmoon Faire tickets!

 Quest Hand-in: Nice pelts, <name>!  I'll get someone to sew these into a bunch of plush toys.  With a little stuffing and some paint, I think they'll be the envy of children across Azeroth!Tickets?  Ah yes, your payment!  Here they are!
Title: Apostate Liberation

Description: There are others like me, you know. Others that have removed the veil that the Scarlet Crusade has kept over our eyes for so long. 

They've been placed in cages, treated like animals, simply because their beliefs no longer line up with what the Onslaught deems is right and holy. 

They wish to redeem themselves. We should try to free them, if you think their lives are worth saving.

 Quest Hand-in: The mercy you have shown brings tears to my eyes.
Title: The Forlorn Spire

Description: Captain Saynna Stormrunner is launching an attack against the Forlorn Spire. If you head to the northeast, you'll find her at the bottom of the ramp leading up towards that rise.

Go there and escort one of her druids to the tower with any forces that she can spare. You'll have quite a fight ahead of you - make sure the druid lives to see the end of it or they'll not be able to seize the tower.

 Quest Hand-in: Well done, <class>. This should prove a good staging ground for pushing further into enemy territory.I sense Druids of the Flame nearby. Perhaps we shall have some sport of them as well.
Title: Free Your Mind, the Rest Follows

Description: <Rio said that the draught would not remain effective for long.>

<You'd better hurry into the hovel and administer it to as many Twilight Servitors as you can find.>

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent! Let's hope the damage wasn't permanent.Judging by the poor victims still in camp here, the Twilight's Hammer really messed with their heads.
Title: Hunting Zardrax

Description: {name}, maybe you be helpin' me wit' sometin'.

Talanji said dat Shadow Hunter Da'jul and her retainer, Kal'dran, ran off ta hunt down a lich named Zardrax.

They be goin' off ta a place called Burial Mound. I be worried dey be in over dere heads.

Can ya check ta see if dey be needin' help? We can't be losin' any of our allies in dis place.

 Quest Hand-in: About time... someone... showed up...! Ya gotta get... this lich... away from us!
Title: A Taste of Home

Description: Oh, finally! Another dracthyr to lend a hand.

My brother and I have been trying to cook up some rations to eat, but...

<Scaralesh gestures to his surroundings.>

Everything is so different around here. It's hard to find the same ingredients we used to cook with.

But we can adapt. Go ask the Horde if they have anything we can substitute for vegetable matter, protein, and emulsifying fluid. Then we'll really have a meal.

 Quest Hand-in: They don't look much like they did back home, but we <race> are resourceful. We'll give it a try.Who knows, maybe it'll end up being even better.
Title: Herbs Galore

Description: Herbs have been in high demand on my trading route, and I'm trying to restock my supply.  Would you be willing to trade?

 Quest Hand-in: It's been a pleasure trading with you.
Title: Basilisk Bucklers

Description: Interlinked scales are the key to stopping an arrow. The bucklers we make are the best in the plains. However, I am short of basilisk hides for my next order. 

I see you are interested in learning about our crafts. Gather basilisk hides from around the Dragon Isles, and I will give you instruction on our techniques.

 Quest Hand-in: These are of excellent quality! You have my thanks.For your help, please take some of the extra leather we have in our stores. I can also give you some insight about your trade, as I promised.
Title: The Ub3r-Spanner

Description: It's a shame that Gryzix had to die. Those Venture Co. make all of us enterprising types look bad!

At least we can still decode the Ub3r-Spanner schematic. Here, hand me that schematic and his decoder and I'll get this whipped up in just a second.

 Quest Hand-in: Here you go, <name>. Go forth and unleash your creations!
Title: Cleansing Drak'Tharon

Description: Drak'Tharon soon be cleansed of them foul undead and restored to her noble purpose. In return for your help, the keep's most valuable treasures be yours, mon!

Once ya be reachin' its top, ya must summon me, and I'll perform the ritual.

Alas, my summonin' will be comin' at a cost. Ya must collect mojo from the survivors.

 Quest Hand-in: We done a great thing, mon! And dis just be da beginning....Seek me out in Zul'Drak when da time be right.Dere be a war to be won, mon!
Title: Outpost Over Yonder...

Description: I see that you haven't visited my brothers at the Explorers' League Outpost south of here. Why don't you do Donny a favor and deliver this message to Stanwad. He'll be interested to hear about the activities of the iron dwarves up here.

Like I said, mount up and start heading south. You'll see the outpost right before you get to Baelgun's.

 Quest Hand-in: Yea, this isn't anything we don't already know. At least Donny's still alive.
Title: Firing Squad

Description: Come out back vizh me, {race}.

Zhere is somezhink I vould like you to see.

 Quest Hand-in: So, this Schnottz character is working with Deathwing!?This is even more distressing than you think...
Title: Pining for Nuts

Description: The Shu'halo use pine nuts in so MANY dishes: meat, fish, vegetables, even baked into breads or sprinkled over sweet pastries.

The Earth Mother has blessed us in that the very BEST pine nuts come from the trees upon these very mesas. Simply gather pine cones and toast them over a cooking fire to release the nuts within.

Would you please be so kind as to gather some? There are hardly ever enough to go around...

 Quest Hand-in: You work so quickly!I'll see that these are distributed to the various chefs and bakers of Thunder Bluff.Thank you!
Title: Surfacing Threats

Description: The tol'vir take the protection of the titans' constructs here in Uldum as a sacred duty. However, our numbers have dwindled, and we face greater threats with each day.

Even with the strength of our new allies, we will only be able to hold these enemies back for so long.  Should any of them surge in power, they may still be able to overwhelm us and endanger the forge. This is where your assistance is needed.

Speak to High Commander Kamses to assess our current situation.

 Quest Hand-in: The threat has abated... for now.Our scouts will continue to monitor enemy movements. With any luck we should be able to keep them at bay before they can make a move on the forge.Thank you, <name>.
Title: A Bittersweet Prize

Description: I... I don't know what to say.

All that is left is to return Willo... the vessel... to Polemarch Adrestes in Bastion. This sacrifice must not be in vain.

 Quest Hand-in: You have brought the vessel we require for the completion of the Crest of Ascension. I understand it came at a great cost.We must endeavor to repay our friends in Ardenweald one day.
Title: The Eternal Palace: Pushing the Limits

Description: Now that we know how to increase the potency of this tool, I think we can push its capabilities even further.

Bring me back more of those ornaments. LOTS of them.

Let's see just how far we can make this go.

 Quest Hand-in: Wow, that's...a lot!Alright, let's see what this thing can do.
Title: Hero's Call: Terokkar Forest!

Description: We have lost contact with the druids of the Cenarion Thicket

The King has commanded any able bodies of the Alliance to venture into Terokkar Forest and discover what has happened.

The thicket can be found by heading northwest through Terokkar Forest from Zangarmarsh.

 Quest Hand-in: I'm glad that Stonebreaker Hold sent you.  The druids of the thicket have been slain!  Only myself and one other have survived, and he's insane.I don't know what happened, but I intend to get to the bottom of it.  Whatever it was, it happened quickly and feels unnatural.Will you help me?
Title: Wanted: Fenistrasza's Skull

Description: <The posted sign is written in beautiful calligraphy.>

The archivists humbly request that all expedition members seek out Fenistrasza's Skull for our artifact archives.

If acquired, please deliver to Cataloger Jakes for processing and compensation.

Some expedition members have reported seeing it in the possession of an outcast djaradin in the western mountains, but no one has been unable to convince him to part with it yet.

 Quest Hand-in: <Cataloger Jakes frantically tries to prevent the magma pouring out of the skull's eye sockets from burning her other documents.>Okay, now I KNOW the archivists are putting out these requests just to annoy me!Nevertheless, I'll ensure this is properly documented, researched, and archived for the expedition.
Title: Blade of Blades

Description: The finest sword in existence has been lost!

Never in your pitiful adventures have you encountered such a blade, mortal. Foe Cleaver was forged to strike down the titans themselves!

I have wielded it against countless adversaries. Emissaries of the Light, minions of the Void, meddlers from the Gardens of Life... all have fallen before me! Soon the very planes of reality will kneel to my greatness!

Once I find my weapon, that is.

I insist you help me reclaim it. I know it's here somewhere!

 Quest Hand-in: Foe Cleaver! Now my crusade of conquest begins!You... you act as if you've seen finer swords, mortal. How dare you!Just you wait. You'll kneel before me just like all the rest!<The animate mutters and grunts.>
Title: Rallying the Earthen Ring

Description: We must be rallyin' da Earthen Ring for dis fight. What we be lackin' in numbers, we make up for in strength.

Go to tha temple and gather da restin' shaman from tha rear rooms. Norsala, Lorvarius, and I will be meetin' them at Lorthuna's Gate.

 Quest Hand-in: You've done what I thought not possible. Quite impressive, <class>.
Title: Unlocking Our Past

Description: Bring me an assembled Key

 Quest Hand-in: Good work, champion. This key will allow us to access more of the Citadel's lost secrets.
Title: Hidden Legacies

Description: Raszageth and her storms are gone, but our troubles are far from over.

The way to the Reach is clear again, and some of our allies have returned to establish a base camp. However, Sarkareth and the Sundered Flame have begun making their way there as well.

We need to secure the island. We would appreciate your aid.

 Quest Hand-in: Thankfully, our enemies have not discovered our scouts. The Incarnates and the Sundered Flame are both formidable foes. I'm uncertain whether we'll be able to safely monitor them again without retribution.The situation is heating up. Some of the dracthyr have already returned to the island, but they're going to need a lot of help building up their base of operations.You're about to be very busy, friend.
Title: Would You Like Some Flies With That?

Description: It's not always about making food for the orcs, {class}.  This time, it's about making food for what will hopefully be their replacements.

We need to start small, we need to catch flies.  Flies love rotting meat, and we love rotting meat... as projectile weapons!

Check out the Meat Wagons for any extra bits of meat.  Where you find the meat, you'll find the flies.

Bring me 25 bloated flies, and then I can start on the next stage of our cooking plan.

 Quest Hand-in: Ah!  Perfect!  Fat, slow and ready to be eaten!  Next up, we will feed them to our spiders.  Fatten them up, and then, we feed the spiders to the frogs...Listen to me go on.  You don't need to know all the details.  This is just a small step in a grand cuisine in a grand scheme.
