Title: The Terrible Truth

Description: It is with a heavy heart that I confirm your suspicions. The mantid are indeed under the sway of the Sha of Fear.

It was OUR sworn duty to confine that creature beneath our temple. Unfortunately, our vigil faltered, our defenses buckled, and the sha escaped. It is with the mantid now.

See for yourself. The mantid burrowed into the western side of our island.

 Quest Hand-in: Let me make this clear... that creature was NOT the Sha of Fear. Simply a shadow... a fraction of the sha's true power.No, the Sha of Fear is with the mantid now. The elders of my order need to be informed of this immediately.I will handle the rest from here. Thank you for your assistance, <race>. Once again, your kind proves to be an asset to Pandaria.
Title: Lofty Goals

Description: Air is a powerful element. It cuts through stone and fills sails to take us where we need to go.

My hypothesis is that air will be the most effective at removing this barrier. It's simple, really.

My scouts report they've found the Orb of Primal Gales. Scout Ri'tal can lead you to it. You can find them near Hornswog Hollow. Quickly!

 Quest Hand-in: Tae'shara stays above many tasks, preferring to delegate. I can see why the Orb of Primal Gales interests her. I'll hold onto it for now.
Title: Awakening the Senses

Description: I'm afraid old Baron here is past his prime. His nose can't catch a scent the way it used to. Others told me to put him down, but I can't bear the thought of losing my loyal friend.

Baron was always at his best when working, though. Maybe if you let him wander through these fields and dig up some old bones, it'll be enough to awaken his senses.

 Quest Hand-in: I don't know what kind of bones you and Baron found in these fields, but he hasn't had this much energy since he was a pup!
Title: Emergency Transplants

Description: With everything that's been happening over in Drustvar, there's been a sudden surge of wildlife in the sound. Normally, I wouldn't care, but they've been eating all the riverbud!

If things don't improve soon, we could try thinning their numbers so they don't consume everything, but I'll consider that the last resort.

Instead, could you go plant some of these seeds to produce additional food for them?

 Quest Hand-in: I can't thank you enough! Riverbud is absolutely critical to the wildlife here. Regardless, I said I'd teach you if you helped out, and I'll ever be true to my word.The biggest mistake that most herbalists out here do is allow the riverbuds to blow out when harvested.When you go to pick riverbud, you can't just rip them off the stem, or all the water will spill out. Instead, give them a twist first so they pinch the stem closed. Try it out!
Title: The Imp Mother's Tome

Description: See this giant cave? There's a terrifyingly powerful imp mother inside.

But that's not the good part. The good part is what she has.

Apparently, she's some kind of keeper of fel secrets. She's in there performing profane Legion rites and scribing them into a book.

We need that power! We need her tome!

 Quest Hand-in: Can you feel the power emanating from the book? I cannot wait to learn its secrets.
Title: Heart Of The Alliance

Description: I can't believe this has happened, {name}. After all we have been through here on Pandaria, will our people never learn from their past mistakes?

Brann's expedition returned recently from Mogujia, bearing a sample of sha for study.

I had my reservations about this endeavor in the first place, and my worst fears have been realized.

The sha has escaped containment. I do not need to explain the horror of bringing the sha into the heart of the Vale.

We must dispel any sha we can find, and quickly!

 Quest Hand-in: I see that you and my son have been hard at work. Thank you for taking the initiative to aid our cause here in the Vale.
Title: Food From Below

Description: Supplies are running low here in camp, {name}.  We have recently learned that the cellblock just southwest of here has a number of rations remaining from years of use.  We need you to gather as many of those as you can and bring them back to camp.

One more thing, the entire cellblock is overrun with prisoners so be careful.

 Quest Hand-in: These rations will really help the troops out <name>.  Thank you for your help.
Title: The Last Emperor

Description: From what I have gathered, this place used to be a tournament ground of sorts, where warriors from throughout Pandaria would show their prowess by following in the footsteps of their last emperor, Shaohao.

I have heard that when Shaohao completed his trials, he became one with the land, and enveloped Pandaria in a thick mist, obscuring it from even our abilities to penetrate the passages of time.

That sounds quite interesting, perhaps you should speak with him?

 Quest Hand-in: In my pride, I sought to keep Pandaria a secret, and once again I have found myself learning great lessons from this land. I am glad to be able to share my stories with my people, once again, in that they may learn as I have, and learn from my mistakes. Perhaps you, too, can still learn a thing or two from the lessons of Pandaria.
Title: Leave No Weapon Behind

Description: Battle supplies are hard to come by on this rock.  Every time we hold off another Alliance attack, it feels like we are fighting with sticks and stones.

Reports have come in that Keep Lord Farson on the north side of the island has a large stockpile of rifles that we could use.  Can you head down there and check it out?

Be careful {name}, Farson's followers will do anything to protect him.

 Quest Hand-in: Thanks for rounding these up for us, <name>.  Kind of hard to fight a battle without any guns.
Title: Thick Tiger Haunch

Description: I have a 'haunch' you have something for me!

 Quest Hand-in: The stripes on this haunch are so interesting, I wonder how they will cook? First I am going to have to tenderize it a bit, though. Time to beat some meat! Here is a little something for your troubles!
Title: Give it a Little Juice

Description: Well, I admit that I feel a little better about this. If Witch Doctor Jangalar's voodoo can make Ben'jin react correctly, as the science says he should, then what do we have to lose? 

Bless my formula or hex it or whatever they call it with Jangalar's voodoo cauldron.

 Quest Hand-in: The consistency is the same... does it seem a little carbonated to you now? Can't wait to see if this works better than the original formula which, I feel like I need to say, SHOULD have worked fine.
Title: Wolf Training: Moth of Wrath

Description: Deep in the forests of Nagrand are some beasts capable of evading almost any predator. The greatest of them all, the Moth of Wrath, is coated with a foul-smelling dust.

If the moth dust is enough to keep wolves at bay, it will probably be a pretty good test for your wolf. See if you can keep it focused and defeat the moth.

 Quest Hand-in: Glad to see you back. I will need some time to brush that dust off of your mount.
Title: Vorus'arak's Carapace

Description: <The carapace from the nerubian lord Vorus'arak, it looks ancient.

It appears that Vorus'arak did not want to shed his shell, and instead wore the same scarred carapace for a very long time.

All across the carapace, strange markings have been carved. It seems to be a language of some kind.>

 Quest Hand-in: What is this? A carapace? Yes, I see, this writing is in my language. It speaks of the swarm lord Vorus'arak, he has written of his journeys on his own chitin.He tells of the War of the Spider, of his escape through the tunnels with his brood.Vorus was a powerful digger, yet even his great strength flagged, and he was forced to consume much of his own young.In the end, they found an island, and survived. Until you arrived.Our history is important to us, here are some gems for your time.
Title: Murloc Mania

Description: The shore is littered with shipwrecks. This must be where the lost expedition crashed.

We cannot begin our search until our soldiers are healed. There is no honor in leaving the fallen behind!

Our medical supplies were stolen by murlocs. Slay the pests and recover our first aid kits.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent work. Let's get the survivors back on their feet.
Title: To the Dragon Isles!

Description: Our preliminary expedition has made landfall in the Dragon Isles.

Thanks to the efforts of those brave Dragonscale Expedition members, we've established a protected landing site in the Dragon Isles and made contact with the dragonflight's embassy.

Are you prepared to accompany us on our next voyage to the Dragon Isles?

 Quest Hand-in: Welcome to the Dragon Isles!
Title: My Heart is in Your Hands

Description: <Drakuru's voice fills your mind.>

Hey, mon! Dis eye of da prophets be great! I been usin' it to watch ya and I see ya got da heart now! Not bad....

Now ya just gotta bring it to my brazier at Drak'atal Passage, a short walk east of ya.

Ya must drink my elixir at da pedestal to summon me there. This time, ya need ta mix in some desperate mojo from the defenders there for it ta be workin'.

 Quest Hand-in: Impressive, mon! Fate be kind in bringin' us together.Soon I be avengin' me bruddas by cleansin' Drak'Tharon, and you be awarded Drak'Tharon's greatest treasure.
Title: Neltharion's Lair: Into Neltharion's Lair

Description: Our scouts found that not only have the drogbar obtained a Titan relic, but also they've amassed an army large enough to threaten the overworld.

Delve underground and stop the Underking before he can unleash the might of his drogbar army.

 Quest Hand-in: Were you able to overcome Neltharion's Lair?
Title: A More Challenging Career

Description: As ye can imagine, piratin' be in me blood. Spent many of the best years of me life lootin' and plunderin'.

Me favorite part was when takin' a chest filled ta the brim with gold and jewels, and buryin' it where only ye know.

Alas, that life be too chaotic for me nowadays. Swashbucklin' makes me tired, and grog makes me sick. But... I can still bury me treasure.

Bring me some booty worth buryin', and I'll teach ya everythin' I've learned about minin' over the years.

So, wanna be me scallywag?

 Quest Hand-in: A fine haul! Pull up a crate, and grab a tankard of rum! This story be a long one!<Over many drinks, Cinderfuse regales you with many a humorous and informative tale, including several about mining platinum.>
Title: The Big Squeeze

Description: So our missin' blue got 'imself dragged off to the big squeeze. Fortunately I am wise to the prise.

We'll soft foot it in like we work there, find your moose, avoid eye contact with the fangs, and chisel out of 'ere like we're masons. Follow?

 Quest Hand-in: It sounds like Huln might not have much time left!
Title: Rage of the Wolf Ancient

Description: Here we are deep within the realm of the fire god and what do we find? The little puppets of Ragnaros, scurrying around to do his bidding.

These Dark Iron laborers are finishing and packaging the weapons Twilight's Hammer hopes to use in their conquest of Hyjal. I don't care if they're here of their own free will or if they've been brainwashed or kidnapped... They're a foe of our beloved wolf ancient and they should pay the ultimate price.

 Quest Hand-in: Dead? Good. They sealed their fate when they threw their lot in with Ragnaros and his kingdom of flame.Leave their bodies down here to crumble into ash.
Title: Stocking Up

Description: Hello hello!  The Scourge to the south are digging up some ancient dragon thing.  I could care less why they're doing it, but they're pulling cartloads of composite ore in the process.

Go lift me a bunch of that ore.  That stuff should yield a pretty penny for all the weapons the Horde are crafting.


 Quest Hand-in: Hah!  That's quite a load!  Your back feeling alright?
Title: Garrison Campaign: Darktide Roost

Description: We is getting reports dat da Iron Horde warships be dockin' on a small island to da south of da Shadowmoon Valley.

We be sendin' some scouts, but we haven't heard back yet. We need ta be investigating.

Bron Skyhorn has a ryklak waitin' for ya when you be ready, commander.

 Quest Hand-in: These savages have no honor, it is time we deal with the Iron Horde presence on this island.
Title: Farshire

Description: My lads should be able to take it from here, {name}.  Valiance Keep is built to take a beating far worse than this.  I worry about our farmlands and mine in Farshire, however.

We sent a full detachment to protect our mining operations right before the invasion - they should be able to defend the civilians.

Gerald Green's in charge of the villagers there. There's a passage out of the northern wall out of Valiance Keep; it'll take you straight to him.  See what you can do to help them.

 Quest Hand-in: You're here to help?  You're just in time then!
Title: Don't. Stop. Moving.

Description: When Deathwing came, the Stone Dragons flocked to him. In his absence, they are again without purpose. They swarm and feed upon our kin.

I have bound dozens of Opalescent Guardians, but am unable to lead them from the safety of cover. I need someone more swift, as I suspect you might be.

Lead them by ground towards Therazane's Throne to the east. Surely, some will not make it, but as long as you keep moving, you should be able to bring several to join our forces there.

 Quest Hand-in: Well done. Of my main strengths, speed is not one.
Title: Beautiful, But Deadly

Description: The Redelav District is home to the most affluent venthyr in all of Revendreth. Its denizens spare no expense on the upkeep of their extravagant gardens.

Well worth the effort, I must say. For the Redelav District is the only place where Duskmire mushrooms can grow. They are as beautiful as they are deadly.

Would you mind collecting a few? Their uses are varied, and it's always a good idea to have some on hand.

 Quest Hand-in: <The Countess inspects the mushrooms with a wry smile.>A rich color means the spores will be potent.
Title: "Thunder King" Pest Repellers

Description: <An imposing image of a mogu face dominates this box, casting its gaze downward at neatly ordered rows of bold text.>

"DO NOT LET WEAK, DISGUSTING INSECTS INFEST YOUR GLORIOUS CROPS. CONQUER THEM WITH THE MIGHT OF THE THUNDER KING AND PROTECT YOUR LEGACY."

<The rest of the space is dedicated to cartoon depictions of various insects crying out in lament or fleeing in terror.>

 Quest Hand-in: Pest repellers! You're a genius, <name>! We can finally stop using that ancient bug sprayer.Aw yeah, Thunder King! That's what I'm talking about!I'll get this installed right away - those bugs won't know what hit 'em!
Title: Hataaru, the Artificer

Description: I will also need you to call upon Exarch Hataaru. I understand you were helping him with our defenses at the gate.

Hataaru is our Chief Artificer - he understands our technology better than any other and has been working tirelessly to recreate the glory of the civilization we left behind.

He has moved to his workstation outside of the Elodor Dig, our crystal mines located just to the Southeast. Look for him at the mine entrance.

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, <name>! I suspected I would see you again soon.I am willing to speak on your behalf at the Exarch Council, but an emergency situation has come up...
Title: Flamebender's Tome

Description: The Iron Horde, and the Burning Blade clan in particular, have forged a unique relationship with Draenor's ancient elementals. They can work with iron and flame in ways that even I don't fully understand.

Yet.

{name}, slay the Burning Blade's highest-ranking artisan: Flamebender Ka'graz. She is down in the very heart of the Black Forge of the Blackrock Foundry, an area known as the Burning Font. If we're lucky, her secrets are codified in a Flamebender's Tome.

 Quest Hand-in: Let me see what we have here... very interesting! This runic language here seems similar to the ignan kalimag dialect spoken by Azeroth's fire elementals. A full translation may take years.But these parts written in orcish - yes, these I can probably decipher. Not just to bend steel, but to bend elemental power itself to our will.Gul'dan may be powerful, but if we continue to unlock the mysteries of Draenor, we will be able to counter his every move...
Title: Orders from Azshara

Description: <Kojo studies the medallion and grimaces.>

Ugh... naga.

This medallion is inscribed with orders. Looks like naga have been commanded to invade our shores and seize artifacts of great power.

You know, I recently came upon one such object. See that dagger over there? Nasty thing. Gives me the willies. I swear I hear it whispering to me.

I found it on an island in Stormsong Valley, on a makeshift altar. Maybe if you take it there, you'll get an idea of how the naga intended to use it.

 Quest Hand-in: <You are filled with a sense of dread and foreboding.This is probably a very bad idea.>
Title: Factory Refurbished

Description: I need you to get us a Recycled Crawler Manifold.

You should be able to get one up at Junkwatt Depot if you recycle parts found there.

 Quest Hand-in: Nice work, this is just what I needed.
Title: How to Wear Seven Medallions

Description: One venthyr cannot wear seven medallions and command the power they bestow, nor command respect from anyone looking at them.

What I propose is the crafting of an artifact that can contain the power of the medallions. Focusing that power to one wielder.

Unfortunately, Revendreth lacks the craftsmanship needed to channel such powers. Not without turning the wearer into a puppet of Denathrius.

No, for this, we must employ the aid of a realm that specializes in service.

Draven has the details.

 Quest Hand-in: After much strategizing, the Prince and I have developed a plan that requires the aid and resources of someone I once led actions against on behalf of the Master.Prepare to shield your eyes. We need to go to Bastion.
Title: Carp Diem

Description: Despite the hozen's apparent disarray, there is an order to their chaos. Their leader, Chief Gukgut, is the shrewd mastermind behind their attacks.

He is organizing their movements at the great pit at the hozen camp to the northwest.

Strike now and show him no mercy, {name}, for he will do the same.

 Quest Hand-in: Without their leader, these hozen should once again settle into disarray.Today we rejoice in our victory! <name>, you came to us a stranger, but you depart as a friend.From henceforth, you are the highest of the high - a valued friend and defender of the Pearlfin tribe.
Title: The Days Are Just Packed

Description: Hello there! Would you mind checking on someone for me?

Sergeant Calvin was supposed to meet me here. We were going to go out looking for new alchemical reagents, but he hasn't shown up yet.

I know the militia has been really busy lately so I guess he's busy, but he should still be in Brennadam Square. Would you mind checking in on him?

 Quest Hand-in: This can't be happening...
Title: Primal Fury

Description: It looks like this is it, commander.

We must stop the Iron Horde at all costs. I have sent stormcrows to your garrison, and called for Bodrick Grey to deploy your troops to the Gates of Tanaan at once.

By the time you get to northern Talador, he should be waiting for you... with an entire army.

There is no time to delay.

 Quest Hand-in: Your feats seem to know no limits, <name>. Today, our garrison forces have struck a terrible blow to Warchief Hellscream and the Iron Horde.However, he is not defeated so easily. If anything, his hunger for vengeance will grow.We must destroy the root of his operations in Tanaan Jungle, but first, there is much preparation to be done.Until then, bask in the glow of our momentous victory.
Title: Deceive thy Enemy

Description: For every moment I hear silence, you draw closer to your death! SPEAK!

What? The camp has revolted? This cannot possibly be true! My minions would not dare undermine my authority.

Well then, every last one of them will pay for this treachery, they will pay dearly. Silence them all and be done with it! Report back to me once you have carried out my order or you shall be dealt with.

 Quest Hand-in: That will surely teach those that don't do as I say...By the way... where is Doomcryer? Why have you reported this revolt to me and not she?
Title: Build One More

Description: All these souls deserve a new construct, and when rebuilt any of them will make a valuable addition to our forces.

We must start somewhere. 

You should be able to find Malleable Flesh through out the Shadowlands. A few of the other parts may be harder to locate.

Collect parts and use the Abominable Stitching Table to build another construct.

 Quest Hand-in: So many powerful souls, this new additional shall bolster our forces greatly!
Title: The World Famous Ring of Blood!

Description: Dear Unadulterated Badass,

If you're reading this, you're exactly the sort of tough-as-nails champ in the making we need down at the Ring of Blood in Nagrand.

You and two friends are cordially invited to fight for your lives against the toughest creatures this side of Gorgrond. It's positively brutal - and the crowd loves it!

Come talk to me to start your first fight - beat four of the fiercest creatures I've got and you'll get a shot at the champ himself!

-Gurgthock

 Quest Hand-in: You did it. You really did it! Here's your winnings, champ.Man, the Highmaul ogres are not going to like this...
Title: Snap Judgment

Description: These pools are very special: they nurture life like nothing else in Pandaria.

Unfortunately this means they draw all kinds of attention from local fauna. Recently, dragon turtles have discovered that toadspawn pools are common on the tier just above us. They're running wild up there, trampling the lotuses and snapping at my workers.

They aren't much of a threat on their own, but in groups they can be pretty nasty. Please, if you can spare your strength, help clear them out.

 Quest Hand-in: You have my gratitude, <name>.Please take this as a token of my appreciation.
Title: Mission: Search and Rescue

Description: I will make these naga pay for their audacity. 

They and their skrog lackeys captured our warriors while we were fighting the Legion. They have no honor!

We must rescue our fallen soldiers before they are sold as slaves, or worse...

 Quest Hand-in: Our soliders will be back in action soon, and the Felrage naga will think twice before messing with us again!
Title: Dagger of Veiled Shadows

Description: The Qiraji and their servants wield items made with the rarest and finest materials: bones from gargantuan ancient creatures, gems from the depths of the earth, metals pure and strong.

Just the sight of Qiraji artifacts fills me with an urge to practice my craft with their shattered and smelted pieces.  Prove your allegiance to the Circle, {name}, and I will make you a powerful weapon from the finest Qiraji materials.

 Quest Hand-in: You've done well, <class>.  This is a masterwork hilt... the balance is perfect.Take your weapon, <name>.  Wield it with great confidence and vanquish our enemies!
Title: Noth's Special Brew

Description: The cauldron is ready to begin spewing its foul corruption across the land!

Now, death knight, a brief lesson in plague cauldrons. The gas that the cauldron emits is deadly to the living, but empowers Scourge. As with all Scourge creations, it feeds off of death and grows stronger the longer it feeds.

Take these Crusader skulls and drop them in the cauldron. You will be quite happy with the results.

 Quest Hand-in: The plague cauldron jumps to life when the skulls are placed inside.After a few seconds some vials of dark liquid float to the top.
Title: The Dawning of a New Day

Description: It looks like the meeting the shadowy figure spoke of is starting soon. The homeless are starting to mobilize. I need you to attend the rally and gather information, {name}.

Go to the center of Moonbrook and listen in on the rally. Return to me with whatever you find out.

 Quest Hand-in: I could hear the cheers from here. It seems as if we've got a huge problem on our hands, <name>.  We have to discover the identity of this shadowy menace before we enlist the aid of Stormwind. Perhaps there is another way...
Title: Pool of Tears

Description: The trolls that lurk within this temple have done grievous harm to my kind, {name}. We were sent here to guard this place, and were instead used to unleash the terrible powers within.

I must beg you for the help only a mortal can give. You can be my hand within the temple; should I enter by myself, I risk being turned against my brothers as well.

We shall make a pact. If you wish to help, first gather Atal'ai artifacts from the waters around the temple, and return them to me.

 Quest Hand-in: The essence of the green dragonflight wafts from these artifacts; the vestiges of my corrupted kin. In purifying them, I form a bond between us.Step forward, <name>, and receive the Oathstone of Ysera's Dragonflight.
Title: It's Time to Oil Up

Description: Three things come out of Irontree Clearing: lumber, oil, and exhausted workers. The first two are pretty much the cause of the third, but I like to be efficient about things where I can.

I've got our shredders working triple unpaid overtime, and there's really nowhere in the schedule for them to get maintenance.

Use this grappling hook to nab some of the extra oil cans floating around camp and use them to oil up the shredders, would you?

 Quest Hand-in: Efficiency in the workforce! Wonderful.Maybe I should check on the goblins inside those shredders later.
Title: Back to Darkbreak Cove

Description: YOU MUST RETURN... TO... THE DARKBREAK COVE. ERUNAK STONESPEAKER AWAITS... YOU WITHIN.

I DIE NOW....

 Quest Hand-in: Hello again, <class>.I felt L'ghorek die. A shame that such a magnificent being is gone.If we do not assist Neptulon, we will all meet the same fate.
Title: Counter-Plague Research

Description: I once worked for the so-called "Banshee-Queen", Sylvanas, as an apothecary.  I used to admire her, but something's changed within her.  She's not herself anymore.

I broke my vows with the Forsaken and joined the Crusade.  Now, I use my knowledge of alchemy to seek a counter-plague agent.  And the Plaguewood is the perfect place to do so.

I need to resupply a few reagents, any of which can be found within the Plaguewood.  I'll pay you if you can find any of these items.

 Quest Hand-in: I love the smell of fresh foot scrapings, don't you?If we're going to find a cure to the plague, we need to get creative with our ingredients.  Now, if you don't mind, I'm going to get back to work.
Title: Changing the Wind's Course

Description: At last, we have all that we need to right the wrongs of the North Wind and its followers. You have attuned the Lorehammer to Stormhoof's time and his persona.

Take the hammer again, head to the Temple of Life in the plains to the northwest. Use the hammer to assume the role of Stormhoof. Face the North Wind as Stormhoof, but realize that for the timeline to be restored, Stormhoof must die as the North Wind weakens.

Then, you must find and use the Horn of Elemental Fury to destroy the North Wind.

 Quest Hand-in: What you have done today will ensure that Stormhoof and his story will never be forgotten. As well, you have written yourself into the pages of Azeroth's history. I will remember and record your accomplishments for all eternity.
Title: The Fangs of Ashamane

Description: I have to admit, Verstok was right. The shrine was too easy of a target for the Burning Legion to attack. Still, he's gone and the Fangs are with him.

We're going to have to track him down for you to recover the Fangs. I should come with you but I have to stay with my people should we be attacked again.

Here, my companion Ebonfang has a sense of smell like no other. He will be able to guide you to wherever Verstok is hiding. Also take this shell, through it we can communicate.

May Elune guide you.

 Quest Hand-in: I've heard from Delandros about how you rescued the Ashen and protected the shrine.We all owe you a great deal for your heroism, <name>. And it seems that you were able to recover the Fangs as well!I suspect this war is far from over.
Title: An Ancient Legend

Description: My father has dedicated his life to studying the Vale of Eternal Blossoms.

The Vale is a mythical place, sealed after the Pandaren revolution twelve thousand years ago. We know so little about it!

My father followed a trail of clues to the cave down the hill, seeking a very old poem known as the Song of the Vale, but he is in no condition to retrieve it. It is guarded by some sort of ancestor spirit.

If you are heading that way anyway, would you mind bringing it back to him?

 Quest Hand-in: Oh... it is the poem! Did you... read it? What did you learn about the Vale?
Title: Lost Souls

Description: Never in my life have I beheld such destruction... such misery. The very ground we walk on us paved with the bones of our allies.

Even now I can see the lost spirits of Alliance soldiers wandering the ruins.

I cannot leave this place without putting the souls of our brave soldiers to rest. We owe them... I owe them that much.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you, <name>. A peaceful rest is all we have to offer those who have made the ultimate sacrifice for the Alliance... for Azeroth.
Title: Presence of Power

Description: The demons appear to be harnessing an ancient power within the Temple itself. They've managed to twist and corrupt these sacred grounds with fel magic.

We must remove the demonic presence before we press our final advance.

 Quest Hand-in: Our fight doesn't end here, <name>.
Title: Circle the Wagons

Description: Darion and the girls should have been back by now.  

Maybe they had trouble on the road, that old wagon is always breaking down.  I need to be sure they are safe!

Can you check on them for me?

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you.  I can rest easy knowing they are safe.
Title: Attack by Air!

Description: They have seen the might of the Horde by land, now they must feel it from the air! I want you to report to Valnok Windrager at once! You will find him here, in Agmar's Hammer.

Valnok has already been briefed on your mission and is expecting you.


 Quest Hand-in: <Valnok salutes.>So you're the hot shot, eh?
Title: The Defense of Warsong Hold

Description: Do not let Hellscream dissuade you from your duties as a soldier of the Horde, {race}. He bears a terrible burden in these frozen wastes, with the outcome of his charge resulting in victory over the Scourge or the extinction of all life on Azeroth. It is for this reason that we require your strength and wisdom.

The Scourge have begun their assault upon this fortress. Our soldiers steady the line, but are in desperate need of backup. Report to Razgor. He is stationed directly outside of Warsong Hold.

 Quest Hand-in: Just in time... The Nerubians have seemingly doubled in number in just a week's time. We could use all the help we can get out here.
Title: Lord Marrowgar Must Die!

Description: Lord Marrowgar is the guardian of the Frozen Throne within the Spire Chamber. Pieced together by the Lich King from the bones of a thousand vanquished adventurers, Marrowgar wields the power of the throne itself.

Without the destruction of this bone wraith, there is no hope of taking Icecrown Citadel.

The Council of Six has decreed that Lord Marrowgar must die!

 Quest Hand-in: The Frozen Throne is without its chief guardian thanks to you. Our attacks upon the Lich King's forces will be all the more successful now.
Title: Back to the Pit

Description: To truly stay in your best riding shape you'll want to test yourself against the other Hyldnir every day.

Head back into the Pit of the Fang and show them what you're capable of.  They'll appreciate suffering defeat to one as skilled as yourself.

 Quest Hand-in: You continue to demonstrate your prowess.  Your sisters have not lost their respect for you.
Title: Baleheim Must Burn!

Description: Killing the Winterskorns maybe not enough.  Maybe we burn their houses too!  Uh... and their bridges.  We should burn whole town to be safe!

You take this torch.  Go to Baleheim, to the west, and burn EVERYTHING!  That teach them good.

 Quest Hand-in: I guess you burned everything.  I see couple of spots not burning... but is close enough for Gorth.
Title: High Priest Venoxis

Description: Venoxis was the second of the two priests that Zanzil planned to bring back from the dead.  You have already succeeded in destroying the body of High Priestess Jeklik... Venoxis must be the next.

 Quest Hand-in: I ask you to slay Zanzil the Outcast, a lowly, hermetic exile of the Gurubashi, and what do you do?  You dash headfirst into the Gurubashi capital and eliminate one of their High Priests!  Very nearly two!  Only one word suffices to explain such a rash and foolhardy endeavor:Heroism.Jin'do the Hexxer still walks within Zul'Gurub's walls, but he lost one of his legs when you crushed Jeklik.  Today's battle is ours.
Title: Not Here, Not Now, Not Ever

Description: I cannot, will not, accept what is happening here. My body resists me, but I will stop this.

<He looks at you.> You will stop this.

Here is a root of the corrupted World Tree Shaladrassil. It has somehow found its way out of the ground to this untouched place and already the Darkfiend satyrs are hard at work corrupting Suramar.

Stop them. Kill the satyrs, take their horns, drive their points through the totems.

Only then can we have any hope of reversing this.

 Quest Hand-in: I am relieved, though there remains more we must do.
Title: Thal'darah's Vengeance

Description: We must attempt to establish communication with Farwatcher Glen, to the south. Our Darnassian glaive throwers are at your disposal, {name}. Use them to cut a swath through the encroaching Horde forces and clear a path to Farwatcher Glen.

I only hope we're not too late to save the Glen. Should Farwatcher Glen be intact, find Hierophant Malyk and inform him of our status.

 Quest Hand-in: We witnessed the detonation of the bomb. Terrible, terrible destruction... Farwatcher Glen, for better or for worse, is still intact. Unfortunately we've nowhere to run.
Title: Join the Battle!

Description: I received an urgent message from Sergeant Willem. Turns out that the Blackrock orcs have hired goblin assassins. They ambushed our battalion behind the abbey. Willem has asked me to send him a hero. You have to go help them, {name}!

Find Sergeant Willem north of the abbey at the command tent. Go!

 Quest Hand-in: It's true, we were ambushed. I don't dare send any more soldiers out there and risk losing them too. I need a volunteer. Someone willing to risk their life!
Title: Elementary, My Dear Drakonid

Description: Grimtusk wants to take another crack at Frostbite, eh? I hate to turn him down, but I left that life behind for the life of a scholar.

I'm trying to uncover the history--and make history. But I'm stumped by this esoteric riddle here in these ancient ruins. 

The riddle is this: if you touch a nearby crystal, it says "follow the pattern." But I haven't the faintest idea what that means!

Tell you what. If you can help me crack this riddle, I'll go help Grimtusk finish Frostbite off once and for all.

 Quest Hand-in: Oh dear... I'm not going to lie, <name>, this isn't my proudest moment.
Title: Highmountain Salmon

Description: This delicious fish can be found in the pools of Highmountain. Taking up fishing can be a productive and rewarding profession. Or, I hear there are plenty of fishers who are open to trading.

 Quest Hand-in: What a beautiful catch! I've never seen fish this size! Thank you, Grand Master.
Title: Competing Magic

Description: The scouts have spotted a dangerous Zandalari just this side of Za'Tual. We need someone capable to see him dispatched. Are you up to the task?

 Quest Hand-in: Your skills are impressive indeed. Thank you for doing this for me, <name>.
Title: More Rotting Hearts

Description: You've brought more ghoul hearts?  I can use as many as you can collect, {name}.

 Quest Hand-in: This will provide you with greater power against the Scourge.   Bring more hearts if you find them, <name>.
Title: Warming Up

Description: Prepare yourself, {name}. We're nearing the island where the previous expedition was lost.

Warm up on these combat dummies. We need everyone ready for whatever we find on that island.

 Quest Hand-in: Good, looks like you've kept up your <class> training during our voyage.I'm concerned about the sudden turn in weather. Spar with Private Cole while I speak with the ship's crew.Cole's report will determine where we'll place you on our initial expedition team.
Title: Into the Crypts

Description: The Reliquary is having a field day out here, literally!

Every day, the researchers find more relics to study and catalog.

Recently, one of our adventurers found this scroll at the Court of Bones.

I believe that this incantation can be used to call beyond the grave. And if my Mogu is up to date, I'd say you should use it in the last room in the Hall of the Exalted.

Would you be willing to test out my theory?

 Quest Hand-in: Ah yes, you've just confirmed my theory! Thank you, <class>.
Title: WANTED: Kliaa's Stinger

Description: Posted by: Dyuna

A vicious queen swamplighter has made the northern forests of Shadowmoon its home.

Unfortunately, this poisonous pest terrorizes the forest between Embaari Village and Shattrath. As local traders put their lives at risk, prices of goods will continue to rise.

Anyone who can put an end to the beast should detach its stinger as proof and bring it to Dyuna in Embaari Village. The merchant traders will reward generously.

 Quest Hand-in: By the elders of Karabor... that thing is huge!Our trade routes will be safe once again. Well... as safe as you can be running through the northern forests.Well done, <class>!
Title: Break's Over

Description: It's come to my attention a few of our peons have been caught sleeping instead of hauling iron from the mine. We can't let our supplies get low.

Take this club and get those lazy peons back on track.

 Quest Hand-in: With our peons back on track the iron stores should be full in no time.
Title: Report to Wyrmbane

Description: Our work here is done. Halford and Zoidfuse should be further down the coast, to the east.

If you don't mind, I'll meet you there.

 Quest Hand-in: Arlethal is already dead?That's good, I suppose... though it does take some of the fun out of my plan.
Title: Eyes on the Amathet

Description: On behalf of the Explorer's League, I'd like tae thank ye for helping establish the Uldum Accord and buying us some cooperation from Ramkahen.

In the interest of better understanding our foes, Ramkahen has allowed the exploring of the Amathet tombs. Unfortunately, though, their forces are spread too thin to provide protection.

I was hopin' ye could help out with that. 

Think ye could spare some time tae see what they're all about? We can start with an aerial look.

 Quest Hand-in: So much tae take in! I just wish it wasn't so hard tae write notes on gryphon-back.Still, I think we've only uncovered the tip of the iceberg.
Title: Windroc Mastery

Description: You must always push yourself if you are to one day stalk the mightiest of prey!  While you are not yet ready, I will point you in the right direction.

There is another breed of windroc even deadlier.  Seek out the ravenous windroc to test your mettle against.  You will find them in the heart of Nagrand to the west and southwest.

 Quest Hand-in: You have proven your skill once more, <class>.  Now you must go on to stalk the fiercest of the windrocs.
Title: An Eye for a Spy

Description: I'll get the prototype shredder working right now!

Take a look through my Observicopter. You'll see what you're about to head into...

 Quest Hand-in: That's a lot of orcs, eh? Glad I'm here tinkerin' away instead of in the thick of it.
Title: The Black Shield

Description: An iron shield, blackened by the fire that raged through the inn, is affixed to the crumbling chimney, one of the few remaining parts of the structure that once made up the Shady Rest Inn.

The shield can be removed from the brick of the chimney.

 Quest Hand-in: Hm, I'm no expert with the construction of arms and armor. Their use, yes, but not their making.This shield seems as ordinary as any, excepting the damage from the fire that engulfed the inn.
Title: Out For Delivery

Description: I tried to tell Vevesi that I could pull the wagon out of the mud.

But, no, he insisted on using magic to get it out... And now look what he's done.

<Hauler Bennet sighs.>

While I try to talk sense into Vevesi, can you run up the hill to the Basecamp and let Cataloger Wulferd know that he might need to ship another crate of camera supplies over from Boralus?

 Quest Hand-in: <Cataloger Wulferd laughs.>Not a problem. I packed plenty of spare film in my carry-on.
Title: A Royal Escort

Description: Arthas will soon face a desperate dilemma, and make a momentous decision.

I must call upon you to accompany the prince in his culling.

Arthas must make it through Stratholme alive and you must see to it that he defeats Mal'Ganis!

 Quest Hand-in: You have done well, <name>.The Infinites have been foiled and this thread of history remains intact.I thank you for your invaluable assistance, as does the entire Bronze Dragonflight.
Title: Angered Spirits

Description: Doctor Venkman vas vone of my greatest researchers, until he had to be put out of my misery.

He did leave me vizh vone of his greatest accomplishments, zhough. Against zhe properly attuned supernatural adversary, zhis veapon vill siphon zhe target's essence.

It is of key importance in zhe ritual I vill be attemptink.

Vhere do you come in, you ask? Simple. You have zhe priviledge of collecting zhe material.

Zhe veapon is calibrated to vork on zhe Furious Specters in zhe temple to zhe east.

 Quest Hand-in: Very goot!You have earned yourself a place at zhe ritual.You shall be among zhe first to velcome Gobbles back to his... original form.
Title: Highmountain Hunters

Description: I've just received word from our scouts that they've identified some potential recruits.

It seems as though the famed Hemet Nesingwary has set up camp not too far from our lodge.

While he isn't traditionally the type of hunter we'd invite into our ranks, his experience hunting large game could come in handy.

Head on over to his retreat and see if he's willing to aid our cause.

 Quest Hand-in: You're from the lodge up on the hill, aren't ya?
Title: Back to The Heart

Description: We should hurry back to Ardenweald!

You go on ahead and find Ysera. I'll escort the Stonewright there and make sure Huln gets back.

 Quest Hand-in: I am glad to see you again. We do not seem to have much time.
Title: Arms of the Grimtotems

Description: If the equipment you found at the ruins of the inn belonged to a Grimtotem attack party, there's likely to be more just like it within their camp to the northwest.

We haven't been able to gather much information about Blackhoof Village, but judging from the size of the raiding parties, there's a substantial force based there.

Do whatever you have to to capture some of their equipment so that we can compare it with your findings from the inn.

 Quest Hand-in: <Captain Darill inspects the armaments you've brought from Blackhoof Village.>There's no doubt about it. These match the description exactly, but there's just one problem -- these have never been used in battle. Blackhoof Village must not be the only Grimtotem post in the marsh.
Title: An Urgent Matter

Description: <The agent fixes his eyes on you and nods.>

I have an urgent letter for you, hero. Something has happened in the Keep. 

I recommend you see to its contents promptly. 

And keep this to yourself, hero.

 Quest Hand-in: It's good you are here.
Title: A Diplomatic Mission

Description: I see that you are very eager to help, {name}.  You didn't come all the way to Northrend to stay holed up in a city!  I've just the task for you... something that'll take you far away from here.

We've long sought to gain the favor of the tuskarr native to Northrend.  Recently a young tuskarr came to us seeking help, something we couldn't offer at the time.

Now that you're around, maybe you can lend him a hand.  Look for Karuk near the Riplash Strand, southwest of here, and see what you can do to help.  

 Quest Hand-in: You've come to my aid?  I thank you, <name>.
Title: Rock Troll in a Hard Place

Description: We should leave this place while we have a chance. The Bloodtotem are amassing at their village to the north, and I believe they intend to kill my people.

Let me know when you are ready to go, and I can take us to a safe place quickly.

 Quest Hand-in: You have little reason to trust me, but we have a common enemy in the Bloodtotem and I could use your help.
Title: Seeking Seahorn

Description: When the Brashtide pulled in, Seahorn grabbed the nearest weapon he could find and jumped off the ledge here.  You'll find him down below, probably pounding new holes into those worgen's skulls.

Help him out down there.  I can handle the motivation from up here.

 Quest Hand-in: I should have known these Brashtide were alive and up to no good.  I'd written them off years ago.
Title: To Zin-Azshari

Description: We need something to deal with the guardian of the Tidestone, {name}.

Our new allies here say that there is a naga enclave located in the ruins of Zin-Azshari. If there is anything potent enough to counter Azshara's sorcery, it will be in the ruins of her capital city.

The First Arcanist will accompany you, champion. She will be best equipped to assist you in matters both historical and magical while you search.

Good luck.

 Quest Hand-in: Is that what I think it is?
Title: Jin'Zil's Blessing

Description: Ah, it is done! Now to test it out.

Travel to the main point of conflict within Greatwood Vale and use my voodoo stick on the Krom'gar marauders battling the Grimtotem. My voodoo magic should renew their vigor and allow them to crush our enemies!

Go now, {name}!

 Quest Hand-in: Victory, at last! Though it stands to reason that without a stable supply line this victory will be short lived. Enjoy it while it lasts, <name>.
Title: Buyers Wanted!

Description: The X-52 Personnel Armor is finally complete and Gallywix has been sent packing with his tail between his legs!

I've got you to thank for this, {name}!

But we're still not done... the best part is yet to come. We're going to hold an auction and sell the X-52 Personnel Armor to the highest bidder!

Sassy Hardwrench should have a list of interested buyers ready to go. Head over to Hardwrench Hideaway and let her know we're ready for the auction!

 Quest Hand-in: So the invention is complete, huh? Good work, kiddo! We'll be rolling in moolah in no time!
Title: Learn to Ride in Durotar

Description: This pamphlet advertising riding training and mount purchases was sent from Xar'Ti.

Xar'Ti can be found at Sen'jin Village in southern Durotar.

 Quest Hand-in: So, shall we begin your Apprentice Riding training?
Title: Vileclaw's Claw

Description: Vileclaw is feared throughout Nagrand as a vicious predator. While it is true that Vileclaw is one of the most dangerous raptors you'll ever encounter, she is also a savagely beautiful creature.

Vileclaw must be preserved for future generations to behold! If you can bring me back one of her vicious claws, I'll make sure you get a cut of the profit!

 Quest Hand-in: Nice work, <name>!It's times like these that make me proud to be your mentor. You'll make a fine archaeologist someday!Here's your cut!
Title: Questionable Offerings

Description: So the traders sent you? As I told them, I only discuss the happenings of our family with those who understand our cause.

If you wish to know his whereabouts, you must prove that you do.

Behind us are several items gathered for offering to the Wicker Man. Bring us the items you feel will most appease it, so that it might give us its blessing.

Choose the correct offerings, and we will know your intent.

 Quest Hand-in: Your offerings pleased the Wicker Man. Very well, ask your questions, <class>.
Title: A TON of Artifact Fragments

Description: As much as you can carry.

 Quest Hand-in: Great work, <class>! I will let Vindicator Maraad know of your bravery.
Title: To Die By the Sword

Description: What's this? You fly no colors! Where is the pride in your house, gladiator?

Bah, this drought has left us with slim pickings indeed, if this is the best Maldraxxus can muster!

I remember the old days. The strongest souls arriving, then being divided among the five houses...

No matter. The tournament beckons. Enter the arena! Fight for glory!

By the look of you, it's likely you won't last long. Try to make a name for yourself in the time you have left.

 Quest Hand-in: You survived? Really...I admit, that was unexpected.
Title: Adventures in Archaeology

Description: Hey, you want to try my new diemetradon dogs?  No?  Raptor risotto?  Pterrordax ptacos?

Fine.  Oh, I just remembered!  I have a friend nearby that might be able to use your assistance.  His name is Spark Nilminer, and he's Marshal Expeditions' chief archaeology officer.

He's been sent out to Golakka Hot Springs, to the west.  You'll likely find him on the springs' western shore.

 Quest Hand-in: Good ol' Nolen.  How is he doing?  Hopefully better than I am...
Title: Smells Like Loamm

Description: I smelled you weren't a bad sort from the start. A little sweaty, but not a bad sort.

Consider this your personal invitation to Loamm, home of the niffen!

Let's all meet just outside the entrance. That way I can give you and your pals the proper niffen welcome!

 Quest Hand-in: Welcome to Loamm, Uplander! Our shining smell of a city!Aurantia is the name. I'm the High Redolence around here, which is just a fancy way of saying I'm the leader. It also means I'll be protecting my people from all the trouble that's broken on through from above.But, you know what? We've got time for all that later! Ebyssian and Emberthal have already filled me in, so why not take a second to rest up on a soft patch of dirt?
Title: A Unified Front

Description: From here, it will take our combined efforts to proceed.

Above us, Varos hides behind an impenetrable shield. To reach him, you must defeat the Centrifuge Constructs that power his shield.

We can each provide you with drakes from our respective flights to help you reveal him.

 Quest Hand-in: It is as I had hoped, <race>. We work well together.May our continued cooperation be enough to overcome the challenges that yet await!
Title: Teamwork Lesson: Ursoc

Description: <Your snowfeather hatchling continues to fight with other pets when threatened. It must learn to remain calm under pressure, even when facing great beasts. Showing it an epic example of teamwork against a great beast might help.>

 Quest Hand-in: <The hatchling positively beams at you in pride for defeating such a frightening foe. It will need some time to recover from this adventure.>
Title: Bumbles the Bee

Description: Hey {name}, thanks for delivering Mom's letter. I was really starting to worry about her!

Dad and I have been having a few problems running the farm after she left on her trip. If you didn't show up when you did, we'd still be in real trouble!

I was hoping you would be willing to help Bumbles out too. He was hurt when his hive was destoyed.

If we feed him some of Dad's special formula, hopefully he will heal up faster. First we need to find the secret ingredient, try looking around at his other lab.

 Quest Hand-in: Alright! This is exactly what we needed.
Title: Driving Them Out

Description: This is it, {name}. 

Lor'danel is all that stands in our way before we capture Darnassus and reclaim Kalimdor. 

Rout the defenders. We cannot risk allowing a single enemy to escape until we have secured control over the World Tree.

I want this place in order by the time the Warchief arrives.

 Quest Hand-in: This has almost been too easy.
Title: Hero's Call: Nagrand!

Description: The King has requested you represent him with the Kurenai settlement of Telaar in Nagrand.

Seek out Warden Moi'bff Jill upon arrival.

 Quest Hand-in: You are welcome here in Telaar.
Title: Multiple Dragon Isles Artifacts

Description: Do you have something for the archives?

 Quest Hand-in: Look at all these artifacts! This might take a minute. <Cataloger Jakes hastily makes several notes in her ledger.> Got it! Off with you, now! Come back if you have more!
Title: Stomp To My Beat

Description: Our warriors are out there fightin' hard to kill them nasty Wildhammer dwarves, so we can be safe back here at the village. It's only right we do what we can to support them.

A good beat's what every troll needs to do his best in a fight. The poundin' rhythm of the drums drivin' you to hit harder, callin' the spirits to watch over you. Take my drums to the battlefield wit' ya. Play 'em for our warriors, and let 'em show the Wildhammer who owns these lands!

 Quest Hand-in: Makes all the difference, doesn't it? That'll teach those dwarves a lesson.
Title: A Tale of Six Masters

Description: This book may be just the leverage we've been seeking... 

How familiar are you with the Council of the Black Harvest, {name}?

After Deathwing was defeated, six of the greatest Warlocks gathered together to teach all Warlocks advanced forms of magic stolen from our defeated foes.

Take a look at the tome beside me...

 Quest Hand-in: You are ready to learn more...
Title: Huddle at the Hollow

Description: I've never seen Akora this upset. Usually she's as sunny as her flowers, but that legend means a lot to her. She talks about it all the time. Hm...

<Keshki fidgets with their glasses.>

I don't know a lot about plants, and I don't think frogs would cheer up anyone but me...

But north of here there's a quiet spot where I do my thinking: Hornswog Hollow. Maybe we can find something to cheer her up there? Or, uh, try to formulate a plan to help?

 Quest Hand-in: As much as I want to cheer up Akora, <name>, taking care of these poor frogs is a bigger priority.For the red dragonflight, preserving life always comes first!
Title: The Damaged Journal

Description: This battered, mud-stained journal has seen better days. Leafing through the pages, you discover dozens of notes, diagrams, and maps.

The author's handwriting seems vaguely familiar, but you're unable to place it until you discover an entry signed with the name of Brann Bronzebeard.

The back half of the book, containing the most recent entries, has been torn away. Pages litter the battlefield, and it will be impossible to know what Brann discovered here until the book is whole again.

 Quest Hand-in: You found Brann's journal? Incredible! The league hasn't gotten a report from him in some time, and we began to fear he may have been captured or killed. What did he discover inside Thor Modan?
Title: The Grand Melee

Description: The grand melee is the most important of the tournament's competitions. Victory will not be easy, but I am confident that we will win. You must practice with your mount until the two of you work as one.

It will help prepare you for the rigors of tournament combat. 

Go to the stables outside the pavilion, equip your lance, mount the stabled Forsaken warhorse, and challenge the valiants. They wait in the Horde Valiants' Ring just outside our tent.


 Quest Hand-in: Training against the other valiants will sharpen your claws and hone your battle instincts. When the competition begins, you will be ready.
Title: The Core of Kroshius

Description: The most fearsome demon in Shatter Scar Vale is known as Kroshius. Though many have hunted him over the years, destruction has only made him stronger.

Time after time, warlocks have come to this forest and reanimated Kroshius. He now lurks in the southeast, surrounded by demonic fire, awaiting any who come to try and claim his power.

I will not have this corrupt cycle continue! Kill Kroshius, and bring his infernal core to me.

 Quest Hand-in: This foul chunk is what those warlocks sought year after year. I will protect it myself, or destroy it if possible, and ensure Kroshius never rises again.
Title: Message to Telaar

Description: <Lantresor points to an unmarked crate.>

Take it. It is my offering to your people. You have single-handedly saved my clan from extermination.

You may tell your leader that Lantresor of the Burning Blade and his Boulderfist ogres accept the offering of peace.

<Lantresor bows.>


 Quest Hand-in: Please, <name>, take from the peace offering whatever it is that you may desire. After all, without your efforts, this would not have been possible.
Title: The Abyssal Ride

Description: If you are going to be making it anywhere in this kelp forest, we need to get you a reliable mount. I think I've come up with a better plan than the sea turtle, and it's not far.

Tie off a lure at the rope just west of us, and then mount the seahorse that it will attract.

Be warned, you may need to work hard to break the beast.

 Quest Hand-in: Amazing! You look exhausted. She must have really made you work for it.Life should be a lot easier down here going forward with a mount that swift at your beckoning. Congratulations, <name>!
Title: One Option: Fire

Description: Here I thought things couldn't get worse, but now we have the Horde making camp around the home of some death god.

I've got a good idea of what they've brought, thanks to my time in the first three wars. Medicine, armor, food...

And probably offerings for this Bwonsamdi fella. Destroy all of these supplies to let the Horde know we won't let them stay here.

 Quest Hand-in: The Horde will be forced to retreat from the Necropolis without their supplies. A good win for us.
Title: The Great Moongraze Hunt

Description: Well done, {name}! Well done!

Now that you've cut your teeth with the moongraze stag, it's time you graduated to more formidable prey. Do not allow the casual disinterest of the moongraze bucks to fool you: when provoked, they are a fearsome foe.

You'll find the bucks north of here. Good hunting.

 Quest Hand-in: Wonderful! You're turning into quite the hunter, <name>.How would you like to look more like me? Well here is your chance! While you were out hunting, I fashioned these items out of some buck hides I had laying around. Take your pick!
Title: Orders from Azshara

Description: This medallion is inscribed with orders commanding the naga to invade our shores and seize artifacts of power.

<Kojo studies you thoughtfully.>

I've heard tales of a priest who used a horrifying dagger to fight the Burning Legion. It is said this blade... Xal'atath... whispers secrets of the deep. It might be our best chance of uncovering what the naga seek.

I recently came upon a makeshift naga altar in Atal'Gral. If you take Xal'atath there, the dagger may reveal crucial information.

 Quest Hand-in: <You feel a familiar sensation as Xal'atath reaches out to your mind.A beguiling blend of dread... and delight.>
Title: Not a Bug

Description: The cultists have discovered the last messenger you summoned, {race}.

While it was quite informative, it's important that we continue to monitor their every move.

Use this rod to siphon the dark matter from the corpses of enslaved minions at Aldur'thar. Then use their summoning crystal to bring another dark messenger into being.

Until it is discovered, the messenger will serve as our eyes and ears, discreetly observing the actions of our enemy.

 Quest Hand-in: Well done, friend.The messenger is up and reporting in as we speak.
Title: Learning the Ropes

Description: Now that you are a pet trainer, it's time to test your skills!

Head out into the forest and pick a fight with a battle pet.  Come back to me after you have won and I will continue your training. Good luck!

 Quest Hand-in: Nice work, <name>! You're better with those pets than I thought!
Title: The Missing Tracker

Description: I can't in good conscience send you to the worg cave without warning you that the previous person we sent there hasn't returned.

We're prepared for the worst, but perhaps there's a chance that he's alive.  We'd appreciate it if you helped him return -- Tracker Val'zij is one of the only hunters we have.

 Quest Hand-in: This hurts bad, mon.  Don't know if I'm gonna make it.
Title: A Wondrous Weapon

Description: An inspection of the weapon reveals expert craftsmanship and intricate inlay work, but this is no ceremonial blade. Faint marks and nicks along the blade attest to its use in combat.

The Darkmoon Adventurer's Guide lists several types of rare and valuable weapons, leaving no doubt that Professor Thaddeus Paleo at the Darkmoon Faire would be interested in taking a look at this piece.

 Quest Hand-in: Where did you find such a wonderful blade?This is a work of astounding craftsmanship and worthy weapon for any champion. I would love to have it for display.Would you accept a generous number of Darkmoon Faire tickets in trade?
Title: More Than a Prison?

Description: <The ancient artifact appears elemental in nature. Lillian Brightmoon in Valdrakken might be able to tell more.>

 Quest Hand-in: The Incarnates were locked away in the Vault, but aside from that we know very little either about it or its prisoners.Artifacts like this can shed light on their culture, their history, and... their power. Studying them could improve our odds in defeating the primalists. Bring me more of these I will reward you with supplies.Oh, and I will pen a note to Caretaker Jakes reminding her of your continued assistance of the Dragonscale Expedition.
Title: The Azerite Advantage

Description: We have received intelligence pointing us toward a reliable source of Azerite.

We must move quickly to acquire these resources for the Horde.

Report to the Banshee's Wail to aid in this urgent mission.

 Quest Hand-in: We cannot waste any time.
Title: Single Sunfury Signet

Description: Even the smallest contribution to our cause is noted, {name}.  Our enemies are many, but we shall prevail!

 Quest Hand-in: Kael's army will soon fall.
Title: The March to Nazmir

Description: Greetings, {name}. I am Blademaster Telaamon, and I have volunteered to lead this mission against the Horde.

Our forces will be gathering off the coast of Nazmir. Go now and we shall all meet there.

If all goes according to plan, we will lure the Horde away from Zandalar and bring an end to this war.

 Quest Hand-in: We're all here. Let's begin.
Title: Mail of the Ancients

Description: There is some wardenscale scattered here and there in the Broken Isles. Various enemies and local monsters seeking to ape the superior races like ourselves will have picked it up and worn it. 

The kind we need is amongst the oldest ever made. It is ancient gravenscale. Keep all that you find and and bring it to me. We will harvest what useful bits we can from it.

 Quest Hand-in: That should be enough Ancient Gravenscale. Well done, <name>!
Title: Blooming Villains

Description: Something stinks, traveler. The air to the west is rotten with malice.

Shimmerbough has long been a peaceful way station along the Path of Rebirth. The faeries there delight in revelry and celebration. But now their glade has fallen silent.

Scouts bring reports of the strange masked night fae. I know little other than that they are a threat.

For the sake of Ardenweald, they must be eliminated. Slay any you encounter.

 Quest Hand-in: Grim work, but necessary. May they be reborn into useful vassals of Ardenweald once more.
Title: Emerald Allies

Description: The druids of Hyjal are not the only ones sworn to defend this land.  The emerald dragons have once again become a powerful ally to our cause.

Speak to Alysra at the Ruins of Lar'donir, to the north, and see what you can do to help.

 Quest Hand-in: My duties are here, viewing the enemy's movement from above, commanding our armies where they're needed.Your aid would be most welcome.
Title: The Nightmare Scar

Description: This confirms it. The overgrowth here is not being caused by a mere overabundance of energy.

Do you understand? This is beyond what happened at the Wailing Caverns now. A rift into the Nightmare must have torn open in the middle of the very land we're standing on! And to think it's my fault...

I'm done picking at the edges of this wound. Go to the west, to the center of the overgrowth, and meet me again there. We will dive into the heart of this corruption and force it shut!

 Quest Hand-in: We've done it! The nightmare's connection to this place has been severed. The rest of the land is safe from this intrusion now, and in time, the abberations here will be subsumed by the balance of nature.I cannot thank you enough, <name>. By helping to restore order here, you've let me make amends for my foolish actions.
Title: Wisdom Has A Price

Description: <Ana listens to your story, and nods.>

Crocolisks attacking? I know a story about that. And I will share it with you, but first... I grow hungry.

Shark meat should do the trick. You should find enough sharks in the water beneath us.

 Quest Hand-in: You've brought me more meat than I could ever hope to eat.Now, I suppose I owe you a story...
Title: Dinosaur Crisis

Description: We've been getting more and more reports of raptor attacks in the area. I'm seeing to it that this place is safe enough for more settlement to start occuring, so I've put a bounty on the buggers.

A lot have been cleared out already, but the Highland raptors to the north have been growing in number. That won't be true for long, now will it?

Clear out a good deal of Highland raptors, and I'll have a nice reward for you.

 Quest Hand-in: A job well done. Consider this reward not from me, but from Ironforge; the preservation of Khaz Modan is a matter that concerns every dwarf.
Title: An Ancient Recipe

Description: Suramar is... was... an intellectual's dream.

We studied everything in there, from alchemy and the arts to the very nature of magic itself. How could we be so foolish as to accept them in?

Look at me, lost in the clouds again when there is much to be done. My work requires some fairly difficult ingredients, {race}. Perhaps you would help me procure them?

I am going to need some harpy talons. Crushed into a powder, they will be a potent reagent.

 Quest Hand-in: That should be plenty. Talondust loses its potency fairly quickly, so we must make haste.
Title: Follow That Cat

Description: Well, that explains why Mauti seemed smaller...  The real Mauti has run off with Grent Direhammer, but being the wise hunter that he is, he has fired flares off so you can track him.  Find Direhammer before it's too late!

 Quest Hand-in: We be here... Da hunter, he be in da cave.  Da beast... Sometin' ain't right about her...
Title: I Sense a Disturbance

Description: There's something wrong with Quetz'lun, the wind serpent goddess. What it is exactly I cannot sense, but I do know that her altar has been overrun with powerful creatures.

I'm going to send you there on the back of one of my children, which you saved. The two of you will move swiftly and with great stealth to uncover what has become of Quetz'lun.

My child will see you safely back to me. Just keep your eyes open.

When you are ready, ask and I will call one of my kittens for you.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you for bringing my kitten back safely.Deep down I knew it. I wanted to deny it, but your eyes have revealed the truth.Nevertheless, I sense something else. All is not as it seems.
Title: For the Horde!

Description: Without you, none of us would have made it to the shores of my homeland. You will be the one to lead our forces here on Draenor. This is your garrison to found.

I leave it to you to plant the banner and claim this territory. When you are ready, I will have Khadgar open a portal to bring through a few necessary reinforcements.

 Quest Hand-in: I'm under orders to obey your orders, commander.
Title: Vault of the Wardens: Bendy Glass Tubes

Description: You find tubing formed from a bendable sort of glass. It appears as though Grimoira was using it to suck out the insides of her victims.

Its magical properties, however, would seem ideal for use on an advanced alchemy table.

 Quest Hand-in: What's this you have for me, <name>? Say, these are some wondrous tubes! I bet I know a way to make them even better.I'll need you to temper these glass tubes in the fire of a dragon's breath under the light of a full moon on the equinox, then travel into the Emerald Dream and--Oh, hold on. These tubes are perfect just as they are. Nevermind!Sometimes I get a bit caught up in this whole adventuring business...
Title: Cleansing the Waters

Description: I must ask that you finish what we've set in motion.  Now that the demonic influence has weakened you must take this cleansing vial and pour it at the very source of the taint - Aggonar's own corpse.

You will find the demon's bones at the northern end of the pools.  Beware, I sense that Aggonar's essence has not quite left this world.

 Quest Hand-in: The essence of Aggonar lived on in the form of his foul offspring Aggonis.  With your success in defeating the demon, we can begin to work towards restoring the pools to their former purity.You have our thanks, <name>.  Your work will have a deep impact in this world.
Title: A Thirst For Blood

Description: Blood is the fountain of life and the fuel of my creations. Unfortunately, Deathlord, my supply is running low and the quality as of late has been disappointing at best.

If my undead offspring are to reach their full potential, I will need pure blood of the highest quality. Bring me the Blood of Sargeras and I will use it to fuel my finest creations!

 Quest Hand-in: At last, I have enough Blood of Sargeras to fuel my creations! You will see, Deathlord, what my genius is truly capable of creating...Now, I must ask that you leave me to my work... there is much to do, and we have little time to waste!
Title: The Spearcrafter's Hammer

Description: The Amani and the sin'dorei have a long history of mutual dislike and open hostility.  That doesn't prevent me from appreciating a fellow craftsman's work, {name}.

I've come across pieces of Amani weaponry and I must admit I'm impressed by the quality of their work.  It is rumored that Spearcrafter Otembe wields a magical hammer that is so light and well-balanced it allows him to work with great dexterity and efficiency.

If you bring me this tool I'll use it to craft you a weapon.

 Quest Hand-in: There's truth to the rumors, <name>.  This hammer is light and strong at once; I shall manage to complete several of my unfinished projects.  And of course, I'll let you have first pick.
Title: Disarmed and Docile

Description: There's a frankly unnerving amount of weaponry being waved about up there. Relieving them of some should help calm things down. Or at least calm my nerves.

What are they going to do without weapons, after all? Attack you with their bare hands? Ha!

 Quest Hand-in: Oh, those? Just dump them anywhere. I'm sure the elementals won't mind.
Title: The Sunken Vault

Description: 'Ello, High Priest. The Speaker has just been telling us of a calling of sorts, coming from deep in the core of Azeroth.

The voice is telling 'im there's a lost Titan vault out there, near the Maelstrom. We dun know what's inside, but he's got tha feelin' it's got somethin' ta do with the Light, and you!

Brann's got a vessel waitin' for ye, off the coast of Azsuna. Of course, I'll be accompanying ye as well, for cataloguing purposes. Can't go and let a chance like this go to waste!

 Quest Hand-in: Tis our greatest honor ta present ye with this steed, High <class>. An' thank ye for leading us, ye are truly blessed by the Light, an' so are all of us for havin' ye.
Title: By Any Other Name

Description: Excellent work, my apprentice! Our laboratory is back in working order!

Now, there is one final ingredient we require to complete our potion for Margrave Stradama.

You will need to run along to the greenhouse. I've cultivated a sprig of dreadshade that should be ready to harvest.

I will prepare the other reagents while you're away. Be safe, apprentice!

 Quest Hand-in: Come, my apprentice! Our efforts nearly bear fruit!
Title: Greatfather Winter is Here!

Description: Have a wondrous Winter Veil, friend!  Be sure to say hello to Greatfather Winter, who's currently in Ironforge!  If you've been nice this year, you'll receive wondrous treats on the day of the Feast of Winter Veil.  Be sure to tell him what you hope to get this year!

Also, be sure to stock up on treats to give those who've been nice this year.  We have a great selection to choose from.  Fresh from our farm to your plate - it's Smokywood Pastures wholesome goodness!

 Quest Hand-in: Ho ho hello.  I am Greatfather Winter, and I - courtesy of the fine folks of Smokywood Pastures... "Fresh from our farm to your plate, it's Smokywood Pastures wholesome goodness" - would like to wish you a fantastic Feast of Winter Veil.If you've been good this year, maybe you will receive treats from Smokywood Pastures as your treat for the Feast of Winter Veil.  Huzzah.
Title: Hold My Hand

Description: Take me to my daddy this instant!

Waaaait! You have to hold my hand...

 Quest Hand-in: You found my precious little sea star!
Title: The Artifacts of Steel Gate

Description: I came out here for a different reason; an old friend of mine has been calling to me in my dreams. But now that I see these small things with their machines making a big hole in the ground, it makes my blood boil.

From what I can see, these dwarves, as they are known, are digging up artifacts; artifacts that could be important to our past.

I want you to go down there and get these things for me. Don't let any of those dwarves stand in your way.

 Quest Hand-in: <The sage grunts his approval at your actions on his behalf.>Perhaps I will be able to find the time soon to study these artifacts and come to an understanding of their significance.But now there are more pressing matters to attend to.
Title: Finding Inner Peace

Description: This is a lovely spot don't you think?

I knew the myths of Ardenweald. 

Even glimpsed it in dream.

Yet it swells with tranquility unimagined. 

Calm is what my kind live for. Even in chaos.

You can always find calm. I can show you if you would like? 

I can sense a nearby convergence of calm. That will provide a suitable demonstration.

 Quest Hand-in: Do you see now? There is great power in being able to find calm. To be able to center ones self offer solace in even the most turbulent of times.
Title: Fire Training

Description: The grunts set up a fire training area outside the village.  These days, Razor Hill's buildings often catch fire -- you should lend a hand and train as a fire fighter!

Head west out of Razor Hill, then turn right as you pass the village's wall.  Find the training area, then grab buckets and toss them on the practice fires.

 Quest Hand-in: Well done, <name>!  Children, take a good look at this <class>. Grow strong and brave like him and one day you too will fight for the Horde.
Title: Ask the Locals

Description: Kalecgos is wise to seek the tuskarr's counsel. They have generations of experience with this land.

Many are resting here on their way to their various camps across the Span. 

Ask around! One of them must know about local ley lines.

 Quest Hand-in: Brena is your best bet.
Title: Tanaris is Calling

Description: Heya, {name}, Kelsey Steelspark down in Tanaris left a message for you. She says that the gnomes down there in Gadgetzan heard about what you've been doing up here.

Anyway, the Cataclysm hit them hard, too. Not as hard as us, but I'm certain they could use your help.

 Quest Hand-in: Greetings and salutations, friend. Welcome to Tanaris!
Title: The Trek Continues

Description: I believe the horses are ready.  Argus Highbeacon, the gentleman who works with the Argent Crusade, spoke with me earlier.  I understand he will be coming with us... that's great!  I'll make room for him.

I know that you are busy, so there's no hurry.  Whenever you're ready, hop into the caravan, and we will proceed to the next tower.

 Quest Hand-in: We've enjoyed having you ride with us, <name>.  Hopefully, once Gidwin and Tarenar join the Argent Crusade, we can continue to travel together.
Title: Warchief's Command: Howling Fjord!

Description: All able-bodied members of the Horde are hereby ordered to report to Apothecary Lysander in Howling Fjord.

The Forsaken have established a stronghold on the eastern shores of Northrend.

Now is the time to strike at the Scourge with our military might and a new plague that is being developed by the Royal Apothecary Society.

For the Horde!

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, <name>, you have arrived!Let's get to work.
Title: Bloody Expensive

Description: Welcome back, commander. The commander is obviously in a great hurry, and certainly the thought of removing their coat or boots or not dripping all over the floor are much too far beyond consideration.

The commander remembers the acidic solution, yes? Quite effective it was, though one barrel was not enough to remove ALL of the blood stains from the portraits, or the tapestries, or the ceiling.

Surely this must have been the most heroic and viscous battle in recent history.

 Quest Hand-in: Again, though more barrels were likely available, one will staunchly make do with the single barrel provided, comforted in the knowledge that the commander must deal with the great pressing issues of this land, and does not have time to clean up the mud that that so dutifully follows the commander's heroic allies.
Title: Squeaky Toy of Time and Space

Description: We have detected another time anomaly. A strange object that even we cannot understand the significance of.

This artifact must be returned before it does irreparable damage to the true timeline and the world as we know it.

Return here once you have recovered the artifact. I will open a portal so you may return it to its proper place.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you, champion. You have helped save Azeroth once again. I shudder to think what would have happened, were you not here to intervene...
Title: Da Big Score

Description: I know, I know. I be givin' ya these for ya treasures, but now I be wantin' dem back. It be complicated, mon. Do ya want da gold or not?

 Quest Hand-in: Oh, ya got dem for me? Excellent. Here's ya money.
Title: Securing A Future

Description: It is rumored that the Thunder King's power comes directly from a hidden source within his palace.

Even when he is defeated a new tyrant, Garrosh perhaps, could still use this magic to a terrible end.

That is unless we make the first move!

Take my staff into the Pinnacle of Storms. Once Lei Shen has been defeated place my staff in the center of his dais.

We will drain the rest of his power and make sure it stays in our hands.

 Quest Hand-in: You have just secured our advantage, <name>. Your work here will be remembered.Garrosh will be made to pay for his actions!
Title: Jorhuttam

Description: You upheld your end of your promise. I will do the same.

Take these drogbar drums. Then bang on them to call upon Jorhuttam to feast.
