Description: We'd been here for a month when those malformed giants appeared out of thin air. We were ill-prepared for any sort of attack and paid dearly for our complacency. An entire archaeology team was lost and several townsfolk were abducted and taken to the ruins. We've been on the defensive ever since.

To make matters worse, the scouts we sent to rescue our people have been harpooned by the vrykul and left for dead in the forest directly north of Valgarde. Dislodge those harpoons and free our scouts!


 Quest Hand-in: What the vrykul did to our scouts was a gruesome display of savagery. It was a scare tactic, meant to weaken our resolve... to send us running in fear for our lives.It failed.We are going to show those monsters what it means to wage war against the Alliance!
Title: Unforgivable Intrusion

Description: Darkness spreads dissonance throughout these halls. Mawsworn drain life from the air, and give only suffering in return. This must not be.

If the song is to be restored, silence is needed. The Mawsworn must be destroyed.

 Quest Hand-in: The golden hour of silence. A space for creation to begin.
Title: Blessing of Kimbul

Description: The entrance to the temple is sealed by a magical barrier.

According to my scrolls, the barrier can only be lowered by one who has gained the Ring of Tides.

There is a statue somewhere in the temple grounds with the power to bestow the ring, but the ruins are overrun with jungle spiders. Tulu and I are not strong enough to explore the lower ruins ourselves.

If you can gain the Ring of Tides and enter the temple, we may finally be able to face the naga head on!

 Quest Hand-in: Now that you have the Ring of Tides, you'll be able to enter the temple and make contact with the loa.
Title: Rohok's Request

Description: Fel orc blacksmiths may not be the most skilled in the world, but there is some craftsmanship to their trade.  Only fel iron can be used with this mold if we want to end up with a working key - anything else would probably end up breaking it.

Bring me some fel iron bars, a bit of arcane dust and motes of fire.  I'll try my hand at it, but I make no promises.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent.  Let's give it a shot.
Title: What the Guardian Beholds

Description: I appreciate your aid, {class}. I was the Kirin Tor mage who first discovered this artifact, Valthrux, and the Sundered Flame's plans.

The retrieval and study of this supposedly sentient and powerful artifact is of the utmost importance, and mark my word, I shall be the one to do it.

The Sundered Flame guess at its location, but I've used my magic to find a path for us.

There is a corrupted guardian nearby that holds a magic shard connected to Valthrux. I can use it to find the rest of the artifact.

 Quest Hand-in: Give it to me! Quickly now!Did you hear the whispers too?
Title: High Inquisitor Sinstone

Description: Even with my archives, it could be difficult to identify and recreate the sinstone of a high inquisitor.

 Quest Hand-in: High Inquisitors are powerful enemies. Bring a friend or two if you plan on challenging one directly.Happy hunting.
Title: Eye On the Prize

Description: This demon has proved less than useful. I have been using the Scythe of Souls on it, but so far, it has resisted my inquiries. We will see how long that lasts.

I have a different idea...

There is a fresh inquisitor demon ahead. They are horrific fel casters who see through their floating eyes and specialize in dark pacts. If you steal its power, Jace Darkweaver could use some of it in his ritual to spy on the Legion.

Better yet, you will gain its power by ripping it from its smoking corpse.

 Quest Hand-in: An inquisitor's essence... perfect. Allari was right.Now to complete my ritual and spy on the Legion's leadership.
Title: Needs a Little Body

Description: I am here primarily to deal with my wayward student. His followers, however, I will leave to you.

I have seen a possible future dat is... concerning. Rivers running red with poison, dead filling de streets. And dese... "Jambani" asserting themselves as de new rulers of Zuldazar. Dis cannot come to pass.

Fortunately for you, I know how to avoid dat fate. I think you will find their cauldrons are missing one key ingredient.

<He stares at you.>

Something to give it a little body, perhaps?

 Quest Hand-in: Fight fire with fire, dey say. Or in dis case, poison with idiots who chew de ankles of their betters.
Title: Reinforce Light's Purchase

Description: Now that we have established a foothold, we need to rendezvous with our soldiers in the field.

We have an Army of the Light encampment to the south, near where the Legion is keeping their strongest warriors in some sort of stasis.

Alleria went to scout the area. Find her, and see what information she has gathered.

 Quest Hand-in: We have a foothold here... for now.I am unsure how long it could hold out against a sustained assault.
Title: Grand Theft Mammoth

Description: The djaradin have loaded a mammoth with the spoils of their labor here for delivery to Fyrakk.

Redirect that shipment. We can make use of whatever supplies they've gathered.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent, this should put a mammoth dent in their operations.
Title: Break a Few Eggs

Description: This chamber is lovely and terrifying. 

What is born here will ruin the lives of so many. 

We cannot hurt the pods, but we can destroy the eggs of the serpents that guard them.

Take out the eggs, every little bit helps.

Poor eggs...

 Quest Hand-in: The fewer creepy flying snakes we have guarding the naga, the better.
Title: Tipping the Balance

Description: <Harrison grins.>

That's it, {name}. The pieces we need are hidden in these statues!

They look to be a bit off balance as is. Maybe just a little nudge...

I must say, your field work is coming along nicely. If you applied yourself, you could make a fine archaeologist one day.

 Quest Hand-in: Talk about bringing the house down...
Title: Onyx To Goodness

Description: What do you have there, {name}?

 Quest Hand-in: You did well to bring this egg to me. We will take good care of it, <name>.
Title: Flamewakers of the Molten Flow

Description: Of all Ragnaros' minions, the flamewakers appear to be the most devoted. Most of them dwell within this cave, preparing for another attack. Our foothold may be strong, but we will not tolerate any surprise attacks from these worms.

No, we will strike first.

Tear them apart, {name}.

 Quest Hand-in: I like the way you work, <name>.
Title: Rumor Has It

Description: Coryn Stelleris and Ruven Duskmere were close friends, but one always overshadowed the other. Now the Stelleris family stands to gain from lord Ruven's death. Handsomely.

House Duskmere will soon learn of their loss. I want you to be the one to redirect their anger and grief.

A handful of well placed rumors should do the trick.

I won't be lingering in this part of the city for long, and Ly'leth will want to know of your efforts.

Return to her when you are finished.

 Quest Hand-in: The city is buzzing with very interesting gossip, <name>. Victory is that much closer.
Title: Harbingers of Shadowmoon

Description: Let it be known that Zorus does have a sense of humor.

Enough small talk. Don the Spectrecles so that you are able to see the Shadowmoon orc spirits that wander this stronghold. Do not be frightened as we are truly the invaders here. Alas, they must be destroyed, for their time has long since passed.

Destroy the Shadowmoon harbingers infesting Wildhammer Stronghold and return to me.

 Quest Hand-in: You claim to have heard the ghosts whisper to you? And they mentioned Teron Gorefiend?<Zorus shudders.>Yes... I know Teron Gorefiend. Rather, I knew of him. He has long been thought dead. What could these ghosts be speaking of?
Title: Weapons for War

Description: The Scourge are adept at forging powerful armaments for their soldiers, making it difficult for our men to kill 'em! There are blacksmithing plans near the Baroness Anastari's ziggurat that their chief swordsmith plans to use for an extremely powerful weapon for Lord Aurius.

We're going to prevent that weapon from being made and stop their regular arms flow with one blow! Go take the plans and kill the Black Guard Swordsmith when he comes to defend 'em, and it'll make our mission much easier.

 Quest Hand-in: Great! Without a steady flow of their weapons, we'll win through attrition!
Title: Loola's Lost Love

Description: Oh it was horrible.

My husband and I were fishing in the marsh, I fell asleep and when I woke up he had been turned into a toad!

I'm sure it was one of those Shadowmoon orcs I hear so much about.

He jumped into the muddy waters before I could catch him.

Will you help me find my lost love, {class}?

 Quest Hand-in: Hmm... I'm sure one of these toads is my husband.
Title: Consulting the Experts

Description: We can restore the functions of the Lodestaff, but it will require the wisdom of the Archivists.

Not just me, but the Archivists who have come before. They were laid to rest near here. Given the scale of the destruction of Korthia and the likely possibility that this destruction will continue, this may be our last chance to visit their memorials before they are irrevocably ruined.

Visit the Archivists' memorials. Take Roh-Suir with you, so that he may take note of their messages before they are lost.

 Quest Hand-in: I trust you and Scholar Roh-Suir learned from the Archivists.
Title: The Etymidian

Description: It is time, {name}.  The Waygate has been activated for the first time in seven centuries.  Use it to travel to where our final hope lies.

Let us put an end to those who would seek to bring the taint of undeath to this pristine land.  Let us unleash the Etymidian.

 Quest Hand-in: <As you read the engravings on this stone colossus, you realize that this is the weapon that Freya spoke of.  This is the Etymidian.>
Title: Lindsay Ravensun, Revealed

Description: I was informed that that worthless woman, Lindsay Ravensun, would be here to support me in this battle, but so far, she's done nothing but brood within the basement of the greathall behind me.  All the better, I suppose.  She was a bit of a distraction.

Still, I cannot and will not stand for insubordination.  Find her, and bring her to me.

 Quest Hand-in: You won't be taking me anywhere, <name>.While Koltira prances about with his playmate, Thassarian, I plan to win this battle.  Then I'll make Koltira suffer for his weakness.Don't believe me?  Fine, I'll let you in on a little secret...
Title: Forged in Fire an' Flame

Description: Ye've done more than I had any right tae ask, {name}. Recovered Ironfoe from our enemy, retrieved a fragment o' the Molten Core, an' exposed the enemy within our ranks at the Firelands.

If ye'd do me the honor, would ye come with us tae Blackrock Depths one last time while we repair our most sacred anvil?

 Quest Hand-in: We're grateful to ye, <name>.
Title: Where in the World is Hemet Nesingwary?

Description: When I heard that the legendary Hemet Nesingwary was setting sail for the Sholazar Basin, I offered to help fund his expedition. We know little of Sholazar,  but it's said to be a lush paradise in the midst of this frozen continent.

Hemet has agreed to send back samples of exotic plants, reagents, and crystals. There hasn't been any word from him. Monte Muzzleshot was supposed to be bringing them supplies, but he hasn't returned, either. If you'll look into it, I'll send you in my flying machine.

 Quest Hand-in: Aye, Hemet's here. He's at the camp, just go northwest toward the river and you'll soon see it. And for the love of the Light, lad, have him send someone to cut me down!
Title: War of Shadows

Description: I have begun to assemble heroes for our cause. Perhaps you already know Arcanist Valtrois? We will need to recruit more in the future, but this is a promising beginning.

Our missions will be those of subterfuge, reconnaissance, assassination, and other focused strikes against our enemies.

Let us test the mettle of this nightborne, shall we?

 Quest Hand-in: Yes, this will do. The shadows will be stained blue with Alliance blood.
Title: Children of Nar'thalas

Description: Hi! {name}, right? The archmages in Dalaran said we might see you down here.

My brother and I are here on a reconnaissance mission. We're looking for our parents.

We've lived our entire lives thinking that our family was killed in Azsuna several thousand years ago, but look around! Most of the elves here are ghosts.

Olothil's been searching through books for clues as to why, but we could use some help.

 Quest Hand-in: This Prince Farondis opposed Queen Azshara, so she got mad and blew everything up? That's awesome!Hey Olothil, listen to this!
Title: The Cipher of Damnation - The Third Fragment Recovered

Description: Take this box to my father. He still resides at Oronok's Farm, far to the north, above Coilskar Cistern. When all three fragments are pieced together, the ancient words will be known once more.

Good luck, {name}. Tell my father that I will be home soon.

 Quest Hand-in: As soon as all three of the fragments of the cipher are together, the ancient words will be known.Recovery of this fragment was no doubt challenging. You must be rewarded for such heroism.
Title: Heavy Artillery

Description: Bad news, friend. They're bringing in serious firepower now.

We've spotted a tank on the northern hill by the windmill. They can reach the other side of the town from there. We can't let them set it up.

What do you say to giving them a taste of their own medicine? If you can take out their commander, you'd have a fancy new tank all to yourself. Imagine the mayhem you could unleash on their invasion!

 Quest Hand-in: Those were some explosions! I'm just glad they were directed at the Horde and not us.
Title: Who Needs Cauldrons?

Description: Have you seen the condition of Felstone Field?  The Alliance forces at Andorhal have taken the area, and they're using it to... to... to grow CROPS!

I almost liked it better when the Scourge held the area.  At least they had the sense to put a giant plague cauldron in the middle of the field.

We're going to take that farm back from these humans, {name}.  Take these drums and place them at key locations around the field.  I'll be waiting here at the Bulwark.

 Quest Hand-in: <Dithers practically glimmers with excitement.>The drums are placed?  In their positions?Very well then, I will give the word to the High Executor.  When the time is ready, he will be the one to press the ignition switch.
Title: That's a Big Bug!

Description: The mantid have something they call Raigonn. It's a giant bug they're using to bust down the wall's gates!

Let's keep that thing from getting into the vale!

 Quest Hand-in: If I didn't see it with my own eyes, I wouldn't have believed it.Great job, <name>!
Title: Void Ridge

Description: We have to improve my warp rift generator.  You must take it to Void Ridge.  Head east of here.  You must avoid the foul fort of Zeth'Gor.  To the east beyond Zeth'Gor is a small pass through the mountains.  Through this pass you will find Void Ridge, a terrible place on the edge of the abyss.

You must kill the walkers that you find there, and bring me shards of their souls.  With their power we will improve upon the warp rift generator and open a portal to the beyond that cannot be closed.  

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent, the warp rift generator is almost complete.  There is only one final ingredient we require.  Soon we shall be able to open up a warp rift to the deepest parts of the abyss.  Who knows what strange creature may come through?  Think of it <name>, the power such knowledge will bring is limitless.
Title: Death From Above

Description: We're doing a good job of holding the front lines against these bugs.  Some of these cheeky fiends, however, can fly over the aforementioned front lines and are really beating down on our inner defenses.

I've requisitioned reinforced fishing nets from our civilian ships.  If you've got a good enough throwing arm, they'll help you knock the enemy out of the sky.  Thin their numbers so that our defenses can hold the keep.

 Quest Hand-in: We'll beat them if they come by land and we'll beat them if they come by air.  If these motherless undead come by sea we're going to give them the beating of their lives.
Title: Try Again, Taivan!

Description: Return to the Teerai and tell them that not even I can train Taivan to be a hunter. He simply does not have it in him.

He is the most un-ferocious bakar I have ever seen, and I bet he would even try to make friends with the wild game if we let him! Hah!

 Quest Hand-in: Taivan just returned. They could not have trained him so quickly could they? No... I suppose not.<She sighs deeply and looks at Taivan.>He doesn't seem to be taking it well, either. I have one more idea, and if this doesn't work, we will have to make some difficult decisions.
Title: Regicide

Description: Galen Trollbane is a fool if he thinks that he can betray the Ebon Blade.

I have had enough of his games. The fallen prince wastes our time playing the king of a ruined throne, while heroes sacrifice their lives to save this world.

If Galen Trollbane will not open the tomb of his father, then we must take the sword and do it ourselves.

If he chooses to resist, so be it.

 Quest Hand-in: We have tarried here long enough, Deathlord. The time has come to open the tomb and raise our champion.
Title: Agapanthus

Description: <This whelpling is trying to get your attention. She locks eyes with you, then quickly flicks her head toward the northeast.>

 Quest Hand-in: Hail, <class>. We could use your aid.
Title: Where In the World is Mathias?

Description: Master Mathias Shaw is the leader of the Alliance intelligence organization known as SI:7. And apparently, he is now a dreadlord.

Or rather, a very clever dreadlord has taken his place while he is being held captive somewhere.

It is imperative that we reveal this imposter to the new king of Stormwind. If we fail to do so, then the Alliance will surely be eaten alive from within and the Burning Legion will win this war for a certainty.

 Quest Hand-in: Well, now we know that our SI:7 friend is being held at Felsoul Hold in Suramar. Not sure why we didn't check there first.I trust that you already have a general plan for how to retrieve him? I know that I do. Perhaps we can put our heads together.
Title: To the Depths

Description: The Earthen Ring has identified the watery realm of Vashj'ir as a source of the adversary's destructive energies.

It is still uncertain what dangers might be faced there, so any information you could gather would be of great value.

The Alliance is sending warships to the region as we speak. To gain passage, travel northwest of Stormwind and speak to Recruiter Burns at Stormwind Harbor.

May the spirits guide you, {name}.

 Quest Hand-in: All of our war ships are off fighting the Horde. You'll have to take the mercenary ship.
Title: The Conveniences of Home

Description: This chest could prove very useful to our efforts. Take the chest back to Shal'aran.

 Quest Hand-in: The heavy chest offers plenty of room to carry all of your belongings.
Title: A Path of Blood

Description: De main fleet of de Alliance and Kul Tirans are off de coast in Nazmir. But we cannot ignore de forces here.

Dere seems to be a strange fog coming in from Nazmir. De Kul Tirans must be using some of their voodoo to weaken us.

We must carve a path of blood through dese Alliance fools. Help our forces by weakening de Alliance.

 Quest Hand-in: Good, my forces can handle de remnants. You need to keep moving.
Title: What Lies Beneath

Description: If my suspicions are correct, this place still reels from some lingering darkness.

Whatever happened here... it could not have been the natural course of events.

Even the yaungol are not so brutal as to slaughter their own kind to the point of... this.

I will use the totems that you brought me to perform a cleansing ritual.

I need someone to assist me in the ceremony. Let me know when you are ready.

 Quest Hand-in: We look upon the true face of hatred!Now it all makes sense. This is the work of the sha.
Title: Take Out the Head

Description: While you and Ebyssian were away, I had an epiphany.

That corrupted caldera is at the center of the Zaqali elder's slumbering prison and their war camps. Whatever is located within is the key to what the Primalists are planning.

It is lightly guarded as well. Only a Primalist and a Zaqali priest. If we take them out, we can discover what I believe will be the truth behind all of this.

 Quest Hand-in: <Ebyssian looks between Sabellian and the caldera, his breath unsteady.>What... What has Fyrakk done?
Title: The Call for Allies

Description: The Alliance has been beset by dangers growing throughout all of Azeroth.

The only way we will keep our friends safe is if we seek out new allies.

I have been tasked as an ambassador to help seek these allies. Come to our embassy in Stormwind, I could use your help.

 Quest Hand-in: Welcome, <name>. I am pleased you answered the call.
Title: Direbeak Team Rumble

Description: <Your direbeak hatchling looks ready to team up with you for another round of battles and show off everything it has learned about teamwork. Commanding it with new allies would be an excellent test of its abilities.>

 Quest Hand-in: <The hatchling somehow still has energy, and runs off to play with your other pets. It will need some time to recover from this adventure.>
Title: Paragon of the Proudmoore Admiralty

Description: The grateful leaders of the Proudmoore Admiralty have requested your presence. They wish to reward you for your continued aid to their house.

 Quest Hand-in: Greetings, Highlord.For some time now you have been a paragon in your efforts for Boralus and the Proudmoore Admiralty. Our gratitude goes beyond anything mere words can define.Take these trophies as a token of our gratitude. The more you aid us, the more we can provide you.
Title: Good Fiery Boy

Description: I train hounds of all types, 'long as they're fiery. I've trained up Grimhowl here since he was a wee pup, but a life in Shadowforge City isn't what he's meant ta live!

Grimhowl needs that special someone to bond with, someone who'll take him 'round all of Azeroth. Perhaps that could be you?

Take some time to get to know him. I think Grimhowl will warm up to ye real quick!

 Quest Hand-in: They like ye, they really like ye! Treat this pup with love and they will be your adventuring partner for years to come.
Title: Allies in Death

Description: Our power alone may not be enough to fight the behemoth, Geir. Fortunately, Faljar was kind enough to send our allies into Helheim with us.

Earlier, I had discovered several of them being tortured by the elemental forces of Helheim. You may think the dead can't drown, but with Helya's power, this is not the case. 

I could not release them then, but now that you possess the waylight, you may be able to.

Seek them out and free them from an eternity of suffering!

 Quest Hand-in: It is good to have my shieldmaidens returned to my side. You have gained allies today, but know you have also gained my gratitude.
Title: They Who Held Fast

Description: The siege has been broken - they underestimated the resilience of Stonefang, and our reinforcement wave from Bladespire caught them completely off-guard.

Once we finish cleaning up here, we rally anyone who can still fight and prepare to march for Grom'gar.

The outpost captain, Karg Bloodfury, should have come out to meet us by now. Can you get him out here?

Tell him Lokra is waiting. He knows how much I hate to be kept waiting.

 Quest Hand-in: You're back! But where is Karg?
Title: Cavernous Capers

Description: While we wait for Veritistrasz and Narvra to nurse the rest of the camp back to health, I thought we might take a short jaunt.

I sensed a cavern on our way here, and... I feel like I may need a bit of spelunking to take my mind off what just happened...

Fancy joining me?

 Quest Hand-in: How very rude! Why, we turn up, we introduce ourselves politely, and we are attacked!Ruffians!
Title: Stolen Thunder

Description: Titanstrike is in the tomb of Warlord Volund somewhere on the isle of Shield's Rest. It's a dank, sloppy mess adrift in a sea of gloom.

Sounds lovely, eh?

I've been workin' with a vrykul guide named Prustaga. She'll help us break the wards keepin' the tomb sealed.

I know what you're thinkin'... vrykul are trouble. But she hasn't taken a swing at me just yet.

Huey'll take us down to the shore. Prustaga's probably found the tomb by now!

 Quest Hand-in: You might feel a bit dizzy after going through that teleporter. The Broken Isles isn't exactly next door, after all.
Title: The Sapphire Queen

Description: Bristlepine can be dangerous, but most stay far away from wolvar. Wasps on other hand not fear the Frenzyheart... they even kill some of our hunters.

I know Rakjak want wasp queen dead, but no wolvar want to go into her hive. You go kill wasp queen in Sapphire Hive to southeast and get stinger for Rakjak. Me bet Rakjak like that. 

 Quest Hand-in: You killed queen wasp! You stronger than Rakjak thought.Maybe wasps go away now and stop attacking Frenzyheart hunters.
Title: Fond Farewells

Description: Dis is where we part ways, {name}.

I'm going to take de name Akunda, and start a new life here. 

When you find Rakera, and I know you will, give her my thanks. 

She saved my life, and I'm going to make sure to live a life dat was worth saving. 

If you find yourself back in de city, could you deliver dis note for me? I trust you not to open it, though I doubt you could read my scrawls anyway.

 Quest Hand-in: <B'wizati reads the note and wipes a tear from her eye.>He may choose to forget, but I choose to remember, no matter what pain it brings me. At least he is safe. Loa watch over him.
Title: Survival Ring: Blades

Description: This is one of the challenges I put upon my warriors to keep them strong and fast. Let's see how you fare.

Survive the ring for 60 seconds without getting pushed out or killed. Stay on your toes.

 Quest Hand-in: Not bad, <class>. Not bad at all.
Title: Siegebreaker

Description: {name}, you've proven yourself on the Fields of Blood. But the Alliance still threatens our tauren friends.

The siege machinery outside the gates of Mulgore is like a spear aimed at our heart. I want you to go to the gates, south of here, and remove those siege vehicles from play.

Here, use these stickybombs. They're courtesy of our new goblin allies. It looks as though they stuffed explosive powder into ... what looks like ... grease-covered socks. But they'll do.

 Quest Hand-in: Very good. Now, should they storm the gates, they will have to do so with infantry.Do you think they have the stomach for that?
Title: Beasts of the Apocalypse!

Description: My brother and I were hunting in the woods to the east when we were ambushed by strange, insect-like beasts. Such aberrations have never before been seen in Azuremyst! Could they be a sign of the coming apocalypse? The apocalypse that YOU are destined to prevent?

If you truly are the Promised One, you will strike the creatures of the apocalypse down... and bring me their hides. From their hides, I can fashion armor of great power!

Find them to the east, beyond the road.

 Quest Hand-in: Not only is the prophecy true, this armor is also amazing! Surely it is armor fit for a champion! And I will sell it to you at discounted prices, furless one.I jest... The first piece is complimentary.
Title: Master and Servant

Description: The Ultrasonic Screwdriver is the ultimate tool. It can do anything to mechanical stuff!

Head back into the pools and dismantle a number of Mechazod's robots. Then all you have to do is use the screwdriver on their remains, and I'm betting that they'll turn to our side, for a short time anyway.

I'm pretty sure it won't work on the mechagnomes, so don't even bother with them.

Oh, and if you want to take anything from the robot's insides, you'll want to do so before using the screwdriver!

 Quest Hand-in: Woo hoo! And you brought back the screwdriver intact, too!Reprogramming those robots is going to turn out to be a huge advantage in our favor in the fight against Gearmaster Mechazod. I think you've earned a little something for that.
Title: The Art of War

Description: Lok'tar Ogar, old friend. It has been too long since last we spoke.

It is good to see that you emerged safely from the depths of Vashj'ir.

I am stationed here in Grommash Hold.

All in service to the Horde are to swear allegiance to their new Warchief.

You would do well not to keep him waiting, {name}.

 Quest Hand-in: Ahh, good. You're here. And not a moment too soon...
Title: Money, Money, Money!

Description: Grub Redcut and his crew are notorious for their love of money. They'll do anything for it.

I assume there is treasure to be had on his own ship, but just in case there isn't, there must be gold within their pockets. Will you do me the dirty business of collecting it?

I won't question your negotiation tactics--just don't kill them! I'm not trying to start a serious blood feud today.

 Quest Hand-in: Oh my gold, that looks like a hefty sum.
Title: Exceeding Expectations

Description: Run off to your trainer, Varzok, in Orgrimmar. Perhaps he can find you more... worthwhile... challenges.

 Quest Hand-in: There is only one place to test you next.
Title: Peace by Piece

Description: These Maldraxxi fiends have reoccupied my temple. They have entrenched this resurgence with shields powered by necromancy.

My disciples--the ones who were not captured and executed by your treacherous compatriots--report the core of a necrotic bulwark to the south. We cannot counter their forces until the shield is brought down.

See it done. I will not tolerate your presence otherwise.

 Quest Hand-in: We have only just begun.
Title: Heavy Lifting

Description: The stronger members of the House of the Chosen tend to take a fairly specific form. No doubt you've seen the larger warriors in the house?

They are the greatest threat in their collective force. Thin them out.

 Quest Hand-in: I must thank you. We are no match for the Chosen when it comes to brute strength.
Title: Critter Scatter Shot

Description: The howlers in these hills travel in packs. Three against one isn't a fight I want to pick.

Luckily those wolves are no match for my engineering skills! I just put the finishing touches on the prototype of a device that will help scatter the pack. All I need now is some ammo...

Snatch me some rabbits from the meadow south of here, and I'll let you be the first to try out the hand cannon.

 Quest Hand-in: Hrm, these rabbits are a bit bigger than I thought, but we should still be able to stuff a few of them into the hand cannon.
Title: Necro Overlord Mezhen

Description: The Scourge are at Gjalerbron and they have necromancers with them! They must be working to bring the vrykul into Arthas' fold.

I want the leader of these necrolords eliminated!

Do whatever it takes, {name}, but see to it that Necro Overlord Mezhen, and whatever he's attempting to accomplish, is neutralized.

I will not see the vrykul successfully allied with the Scourge!

Look for Mezhen on the platform in the rear right section of Gjalerbron.

 Quest Hand-in: <The captain breathes a sigh of relief.>Well, that should take some of the pressure off of us.<name>, time and again you have proven yourself invaluable to Westguard Keep and the Alliance at large. Pick something from the treasury, boy! It's the least we can do!
Title: The Endless Swarm

Description: Gao-ran's men need help down on the southern front. If you want to stand by the Shado-Pan, that's where you should do it.

 Quest Hand-in: The men of the battlefront are growing to respect you. You clearly know how to fight.
Title: Raiding the Vault

Description: The Swollen Vault is a repository for some of Lei Shen's nastiest weaponry and most prized trinkets - not surprisingly, these are often one and the same.

One artifact in particular, an amulet known as the Choker of Storms, could help us to understand his apparent mastery over lightning.

Break into the vault and slay the hoard-keeper. Take his key and use it to recover the amulet from a cache at the back of the vault.

 Quest Hand-in: What's this? A necklace? What are you trying to- ahh, I see... A relic from the Thunder King's vault! Fascinating... Powerful, too.The Kirin Tor will keep it safe. In return, please accept this.
Title: Restock: Free Press

Description: We got a problem, {name}.

Last Ember Court, that provocateur's gossip spread further than we thought. I've gotten all sorts of uncomfortable questions from socialites and nobles unsure of what to believe.

We've got to write some pamphlets to set the record straight and dispel that scoundrel's lies!

Then we can pick our entertainment for the next Ember Court.

 Quest Hand-in: Writing letters: one of the oldest forms of entertainment.We can book the next Entertainment whenever you're ready.
Title: A Special Surprise

Description: We got here, tore the place apart, and headed toward the prison house. We weren't expecting what we found in there, {name}. Seems the Crusade's been real busy. That whole thing is full of Argent Dawn prisoners. Most of them were already dead by the time we arrived, but a few were still breathing.

I was about to go in there and execute the rest of them, but I think you should have the honors. In particular, there's a real feisty human in there that I think you'll take great pleasure in executing.

 Quest Hand-in: Felt good, didn't it? You're not one of them anymore, <name>. You're Scourge. You're one of us. Forever...
Title: Path of Ascension: Echthra

Description: Your soulbinds request your strategic mind in another trial.

Their sights this week are set on Echthra, that they may learn from the lessons her memory teaches.

When you are able, report to Artemede to return to the Path of Ascension. Aid your soulbinds in defeating Echthra to prove their growth.

 Quest Hand-in: Congratulations on the victory. I look forward to hearing what your soulbinds have learned.
Title: One Shot.  One Kill.

Description: I was traveling to Lor'danel with an important message when I was attacked by the furbolg Marosh and his trackers. During the attack I was poisoned, leaving me barely able to stand. I can make an antidote, but it will take time before it is ready.

I would ask that you defend me until I can apply the antidote. I will aid you with my bow as best I can.

Should we survive, I will be able to deliver my message to Lor'danel, while you speak with Onaeya at Maestra's Post to inform her of this incident.

 Quest Hand-in: You bring most welcome news <class>. It is good to hear that Aynasha is alive and well thanks to you. I would hope that you might accept a reward for your valor. May Elune watch over you and light your path.
Title: Arcane Tomes

Description: Have you obtained any more arcane tomes, {name}?

 Quest Hand-in: The power contained in this tome is tremendous.  Yet it is easily condensed into a single rune by one with a clear mind.
Title: The Frost Wyrm and its Master

Description: You were right to bring this to me, {name}. You must venture to Gjalerbron and slay that wyrm and its master, Wyrmcaller Vile!

Even now, as we speak here, the frost wyrm may be on its way.

However, if I'm reading these plans correctly, blowing the wyrmcaller's horn on his platform, outside in the rear left area of Gjalerbron, will call Glacion back. When the creature lands, destroy it!

And {name}, please bring me the horn. We wouldn't want it falling back into the wrong hands.

 Quest Hand-in: Wow, that horn is cold!Once again you've saved Westguard Keep from certain doom. What a curious man you are, <name>. If only there were more of you.Well, this certainly calls for a reward. Which do you prefer?
Title: Suspiciously Spiced Steak

Description: My sister's idea is charming, but Theramus needs a real pick-me-up.

That would be a generous serving of sourbloom. We can make it into a paste to slather onto his favorite food: turtle meat!

Will you help me collect the ingredients?

 Quest Hand-in: The meat to sourbloom ratio is just right.
Title: Looting the Looters

Description: <The Mawsworn was carrying a Korthian artifact.

It's unclear what the enemy wants with such relics, but you suspect the attendants in Keeper's Respite would want to see them returned.>

 Quest Hand-in: Now this is special. This implement is used by the Fatescribe in his work.
Title: Catching His Eye

Description: For what must be done, I need someone I can trust. You're one of those few.

The woods and the orc village, Gul'var, are protected from my scrying magic. We need to pierce that veil. I think I know a way.

There's a fel presence within the woods. A demonic watcher is there, hidden in a cave from which it casts its all-seeing gaze.

I would like for you and the warden to capture it.

 Quest Hand-in: As soon as we have enough blessed water from the priestess's moonwell, we'll break the demon's will and use it as a proxy to see into Gul'var.That way, they won't know it's us scrying upon them.But first, we need to weaken their shrouding magic.
Title: Out with the Scouts

Description: We'd been briefed on mogu sightings in the Vale, but the situation is worse than we had anticipated.

Scouts are swarming all over the ruins to the northwest, gathering intel and stealing treasures.

Your objective is clear - dispatch of any scouts you see. An army cannot move if we take out its eyes.

 Quest Hand-in: Well done, <race>. That should send a clear message to the mogu - we are not to be trifled with.
Title: Mistress of Lies

Description: If you are done dealing with dese peasant loa, den perhaps you can help with my own loa: Shadra.

My "high" priestess, Yazma, is behind all of dis. If she is having her minions slay other loa, den I can only guess she is also trying to sacrifice my own loa as well.

Shadra's shrine is on de northwest side of de Garden of the Loa. You must stop her from slaying de Mistress of Spies.

 Quest Hand-in: Shadra was... consumed? I have heard of such heresies in Zul'Drak, but to hear of it in Zuldazar...
Title: Polished Up

Description: <Seshuli will surely want to hear about your progress on this shrine.

You feel as though you should report back to her as soon as you're able.>

 Quest Hand-in: <You recount your findings about the Vol'dun shrine to Seshuli>Dat desert is a fools home if ya ask me. Good thing de shrine still stands dere and you were able to fix it.I'm still reading de journal trying to gather more information for you.
Title: Sinstone Delivery

Description: Lord Chamberlain has held off the Accuser to buy us the time we needed to break the ward on her sinstone.

But, thanks to your delays, our reinforcement of his position is overdue.

I will collect the Accuser's sinstone and carry us to the battle.

 Quest Hand-in: This is, in fact, one of the larger sinstones I have seen.This will be easy to exploit.
Title: The Chef's Apprentice

Description: <Sezahjin rummages through his cooking ingredients in frustration.>

Where is Junji? I sent him to scavenge for vulture eggs, but he hasn't returned.

<Sezahjin pauses for a moment.>

He was just going on about de size of saurolisk eggs, but those oversized lizards are far too dangerous for a boy! He can't possibly be so foolish...

If he has gone to de saurolisk breeding grounds... he may already be dead. Please find him before it's too late!

 Quest Hand-in: You can't fool me, saurolisk! I know you're out dere waiting to eat me! Oh wait... you're a grown up! Please, get me out of here! Help!
Title: Replenishing the Healing Crystals

Description: Our immediate concern is the depleted state of our healing crystals.  We must replenish them quickly!

Unfortunately, the only way to do this at this point is to extract the blood from the local vale moths.  Their blood will make for a suitable substitute.

The moths can be found in many places around the vale, but they are mostly concentrated in the northwest.

 Quest Hand-in: Regrettable that those creatures had to die so that we might live - indiscriminate killing is not the <race> way.  However, the blood you gathered will replenish our healing crystals, so their deaths will not be in vain.
Title: The Lumbering Oaf Problem

Description: Ever seen a hobgoblin? They're another vile goblin creation. Take a goblin, make it even uglier, fatter, bigger and stupider and you have a hobgoblin. Add to all of that a nasty mean streak and we've got a problem.

These lumbering oafs wander the Sludgewerks and Mirkfallon Lake, acting as muscle to the goblins.

Get out there and thin 'em out. Permanently.

 Quest Hand-in: Slowly, but surely, we pick away at the Horde's numbers. They won't have a leg to stand on when this war really opens up.
Title: Unexpected Guests

Description: You helped me escape my fate by freeing me from the gallows, but allowing me to fight the Scarlet Onslaught by your side has truly freed my heart and mind from the guilt I have felt for so long.

I want to be a part of something greater than myself, a noble cause that won't distort the meaning of the Light. 

Let me travel to your temple and beg forgiveness of the Prophet. I may not be a welcome guest, but it's a journey I must make to complete my redemption.

 Quest Hand-in: Is this the enemy we should welcome as an ally?
Title: A New Source of Weapons

Description: These Sundered Flame pose a great threat to our borders. Their weapons are concerning. Gather what you can of their weapons--we can study them for any weaknesses, and even use them for our own defenses.

I have faith in you, outsider. If you perform this task for us, I will teach you some of our own blacksmithing arts.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you, outsider. This should help greatly.As promised, here is a scroll I had our blacksmiths prepare for you. May the knowledge grant you swift learning.
Title: Legion: The Legion Returns

Description: Warriors of da Horde! Break out ya axes and sharpen ya spears. Da Burning Legion has returned ta our world!

We be shipping outta Bladefist Bay right away. With da full fury of da Horde, we gonna smash der line so hard dat Sargeras is gonna feel it in da Nether!

Get to da ships. We got demons ta slay!

 Quest Hand-in: The ships are leaving from the dock in Bladefist Bay.Before you leave, prepare yourself. I have the feeling that this fight won't be an easy one.
Title: Honor and Privilege

Description: All done! I'm confident it will work. And not a scrounger in sight to pop a hole in it this time! Fortuitous.

Jorlan already swam up to catch it. Swam up and stopped to wait for it. He said you'd get the honors though. Jorlan's nice like that.

Go to the top with the balloon, take the flare gun from the crate, and scan the horizon for Alliance ships. If you see any, fire the flare towards them. That's it! All there is to it.

Swim. Float. Flare. Rescue! That last part's my favorite.

 Quest Hand-in: Perfect! There's no way they missed that, fighting or not.
Title: The Great Netherwing Egg Hunt

Description: Should you discover any Netherwing eggs while exploring, bring them to me.

Be warned, a Netherwing egg is a rare discovery. Do not become frustrated if you cannot locate one. These Dragonmaw have been very thorough in collecting most of them and shipping them off to parts unknown.

Eggs might be found on creatures of the island, near crystal formations, in the mines, or even inside a nethercite node or netherdust bush.

Keep a low profile. We don't need Mor'ghor catching wind of your actions.

 Quest Hand-in: Neltharaku will be most pleased, <name>. Well done.
Title: The Carpenter

Description: <Bzzzzzzzzzzzzt.>

Hello, can you hear me? Excellent!

It looks like Helix is in charge of building an enormous mast. You don't think they're trying to finish the Defias Juggernaut, do you?

You'd better go investigate {name}, and don't be afraid to get your hands dirty! You have clearance to use deadly force if necessary and, let's face it, it's probably going to be necessary.

 Quest Hand-in: <Bzzzzzzzzzzzzt.>Hey, it's Horatio. That was intense! I'm watching your progress on the Stormwind Communicator's Spyatron X3 application.They sure are using a lot of heavily fortified doors to hide their work. Keep pushing forward and see what you find next. I bet it'll be a huge clue!
Title: RSVP: Sika

Description: Hello, {name}! Sika like to help. So much to do.

Would go to Ember Court, but too many things only Sika can do. Very sorry.

 Quest Hand-in: What's in notes? Others need more help from Sika?<Sika takes in a deep breath.>Sika can do. Sika always helps.
Title: Crocolisk Tails

Description: De crocolisks of Uldum are known for bein' bigger than all the rest. When you need lots of meat in a hurry, they're always a good option.

 Quest Hand-in: Keep the meat deliveries comin', <name>. We need all we can get.
Title: Honor the Flame

Description: The Midsummer Fire Festival is a time to honor the elements.  The element of fire stirs passion within us all.  Many times, that passion pours out into aggressive actions.  But here, in this land, we focus our passion on reverence.

We will honor the flame as tradition dictates.  Will you honor the flame with us, {name}?

 Quest Hand-in: Honor the Kun-Lai Summit flame.
Title: A Burning Threat

Description: While we cast our eyes toward the cataclysm, who watches our backs? While our leaders take up arms against Deathwing, the Burning Blade plots our downfall.

Even as we speak, they are gathering recruits and supplies at the farm to the southwest. I care not to meet death at the hands of the Burning Legion. It's time we take matters into our own hands.

{name}, will you help me keep the vigil? Go and slaughter their ranks before it's too late.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you, <name>. This old orc will sleep more safely at night.
Title: Explosivity

Description: I don't want to waste your time. Let's make absolutely sure that these are what we're looking for.

Here, take this torch and toss it over onto those crates. If they explode, then we'll know what to do next.

 Quest Hand-in: I... ah... I guess we've found our gunpowder then.
Title: For Research Purposes

Description: I have taken pains not to disturb the automa during my time in Zereth Mortis, and so far they have paid little attention to me.

It seems recent events have changed that.

Again, let me be clear that I have no wish to harm the creations of the First Ones. But if, in the course of your efforts, conflict with the automa becomes inevitable, we must ensure that some good can come of it.

If I can examine fragments of fallen automa, it may provide knowledge to use against the Mawsworn.

Go carefully.

 Quest Hand-in: Though the loss of automa is unfortunate, these fragments could prove a boon to my research.
Title: Bolstering Your Arsenal

Description: Highlord, there are still weapons that you might obtain to help you defeat the Legion. We have kept a close eye on them during your time on the Broken Isles.

I would be happy to review them with you if you wish.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent. There's no time to waste.
Title: Big Gulp

Description: Arnold and I used to relax down at the moat in the Valley of Heroes.  One day, I lost my locket in the lake and I have never been able to find it.  Rumor has it that huge royal monkfish live in that moat and that they eat anything!  I know it's a long shot, but do you think you could catch a few monkfish and look for my locket?

Please let me know right away if you find it, it's very precious to me.

 Quest Hand-in: You found it!  I can't believe it was down there all those years!  You have no idea how much this means to me <name>.
Title: Straight to the Heart

Description: The success of Mor'Bitan's treachery has made him complacent.

Let him enjoy the feeling, for it ends here. We will lure him out with this ritual... and we will avenge my margrave.

Stand with me now, {name}. Together, we will make an example of this traitor.

 Quest Hand-in: Cursed lich--may his soul never be reborn.
Title: Broker Business

Description: <A web covered box of assorted scholar supplies lays haphazardly on the ground. The make seems Broker in origin. Perhaps the owner is nearby.>

 Quest Hand-in: Oh! My missing supplies! How fortuitous.
Title: Communication Breakdown

Description: It looks like the stealth generators aren't the only tech that SI:7 is bringing into the field. Our scouts have reported what look like listening devices set up at key points around Warfang. 

Obviously, these things have to go, but the goons haven't been able to get close to them on account of the hidden spies. 

While you're out there, make sure to trash 'em.

 Quest Hand-in: Looks like I owe you another one, pal.I'll have Kazit add it to the books.
Title: Destroy Naberius!

Description: Archmage Vargoth saw the danger in Naberius's pursuit of necromancy, but I don't think he ever anticipated that his own apprentice would wreak this much destruction upon the Kirin Tor.

You must defeat him, {name}, or else he will continue enslaving the spirits of our fallen brothers, robbing them of their rightful rest and destroying what little remains of Kirin'Var.

With his phylactery in hand, he can be confronted by two or three combatants, but who knows what his magic might do to more foes?

 Quest Hand-in: The defeat of Naberius is a great achievement, <name>. I can't help thinking that we might have had a chance against Kael'thas's forces if the apprentice's loyalties had been in the right place that day.
Title: Ring Repairs

Description: The damage wrought here is severe, but it can be reversed.

My master is weakened by all this destruction, but mushrooms are difficult to completely eradicate. By restoring power to the rings throughout the grove, we can strengthen them once again.

Take this beacon. Use it near a damaged mushroom in a ring, and watch how quickly nature can heal its wounds.

 Quest Hand-in: Together we are strong.
Title: Talgath's Forces

Description: I must continue to seek the Crest of Knowledge, my friend. Nothing short of the whole Crown of the Triumvirate can turn the tide in the battle we face.

Talgath's forces stand between us and that goal. I will need you to clear a path.

We can let nothing stand in our way. Not even Talgath.

 Quest Hand-in: <Velen does not seem to notice your presence.>
Title: Proving Your Worth

Description: Now that you have proven yourself as a warrior, let's see how your fishing skills hold up. I have fashioned a bait out of the moonshell claws you brought me. Use it to catch the shadow sturgeon in these coastal waters.

 Quest Hand-in: I see you are both a fisherman and a warrior.  I will do what I can to help you.
Title: Drustvar

Description: The stalwart protectors of House Waycrest hold fast along the western border, but recently all contact with them has been lost. We must secure their aid in order to bring Kul Tiras together under the Proudmoore banner.

 Quest Hand-in: I've only been to Drustvar once, on a hunting trip. It's a rugged land with a dark history and superstitious people. Steel yourself for this one.
Title: Preservation

Description: Oh no! We must stop them! {name}, is it? The Order needs your help!

Do you know what those horrible Slitherscale saurok are doing?

They have the audacity to steal cloud serpent eggs straight from the matriarch's nests!

While the cloud serpents become ever rarer, those brutes are... are...

<Suchi takes a deep breath.>

...they're eat their eggs for dinner! It's horrible!

Go to Windward Isle to the northeast and recover any unbroken eggs that you can. As students of the Order, it's our duty!

 Quest Hand-in: Well done, <name>. As soon as Suchi told me she sent you to recover the stolen eggs, I knew you would accomplish the task.Our instructors will make sure to return these eggs to a safer place.
Title: Jeweled Spade Handle

Description: An immaculately carved spade handle lies beside the rose. Apparently the spade was more beautiful than it was durable, as the blade has completely fallen off.

Your herbalism trainer may be interested in seeing this.

 Quest Hand-in: You say you found this near a starlight rose?You adventurers, always finding such interesting things out there in the wilds...
Title: Zonya the Sadist

Description: The prey be walkin' to the predator's territory, unaware of the danger that he is in. You be givin' Zonya no trouble dis time.

 Quest Hand-in: You think yourself victorious, but I be growin' stronger with each defeat.
Title: The Battle Must Go On

Description: We must continue to defeat and demoralize the armies of the Legion.

The emissaries of hate are Legion shocktroopers deployed to reinforce tactical Legion positions.  The enemy rallies around them for they fear them more than they fear us.

Today we will change that.  Take this banner and slay the demons of the Legion.  When you meet the emissary, slay and impale him.

 Quest Hand-in: Your dedication is exemplary, <name>.  We will show the forces of the Burning Legion what we're capable of.
Title: Loa-saur

Description: The Zandalari have found a way to bind loa to their beasts giving them impressive and lethal powers.

We need to put a stop to this.

Search the Beast Pens for a loa speaker and slay him. You should be able to find them by keeping a look out for their glowing beasts.

We must not allow these atrocities to continue.

 Quest Hand-in: Well done, champion. These beasts are strong enough. We don't need them infused with an angry spirit now do we?
Title: Mark of the Conquerors

Description: The invading minions of N'Zoth lay claim to lands they are not entitled to. 

The Vale will not be conquered while even one of the Rajani still draws breath.

Burn down their banners as a reminder of this.

 Quest Hand-in: Good.These invaders should know that we are not so easily conquered.
Title: Narrok

Description: I wish to do battle once more. These young ones need to grow stronger.

 Quest Hand-in: It would seem that these younglings still have a lot of work to do before they are at full strength. Thank you.
Title: It's a Trap!

Description: There's nothing more that I hate in this world than the sons of Gruul and their father!  They slaughtered my people, and my children, and now I will have a taste of revenge!

I have fashioned a trap from some dragon fire, and if you're clever enough, you might just be able to use it to kill a gronn.

I'm sure that you have a particular gronn in mind; it matters not to me which one you kill.  Just hurry, take the trap to your Commander Stonewall.

My thirst for revenge must be quenched!

 Quest Hand-in: Hmm, a trap fashioned from the essence of dragon flame?  I wonder how Sablemane comes by such rarified substances?It does not matter.  What does matter is that we are going to use it to slay a son of Gruul!
Title: Sacrificial Writes

Description: <As you peer inside the tome, you find a verse appear, glowing bright red.>

"For blood to bond, one strikes a deal,
A sacrifce which will appeal.
Seek out the lame, and never yield,
For in return, you shall be healed."

<As you finish reading the verse, you notice that a scroll has appeared in your hand.

Written across the top it's titled, "Writ of Sacrifice". Various runes, unknown to you, appear on the rest of the scroll. Yet, there's no explanation as to what to do with the scroll...>

 Quest Hand-in: I see you've completed the trial.<Kronah takes the writ from your hand and places it on the tome. It slowly begins to meld with the tome, and in a burst of light it vanishes.>You have done well and are now imprinted for all time with the Contract of Sacrifce.Now, onto more important matters. What do you think of murloc brain soup? I find it delightful and would love a guest to accompany me for a serving of it.
Title: Legendary Foil

Description: Last night, I was lying in my bedroll, tossing and turning, when an unnatural chill filled the inn. 

Then, out of nowhere I saw... the ghost of a draconid! It went through my luggage then vanished into thin air! 

But the true horror is that when I woke up... the ghost had taken my most beloved card!

Would you be so kind as to track down the ghost and get my card back? It is my most prized possession.

 Quest Hand-in: The apparition explained itself and asked for forgiveness.But then they asked to play a single match with me. Our game is apparently very different from what they used to play, and they wanted to try it.Thank you for helping both of us. Maybe the match will be fun?
Title: Terror of the Kraul

Description: By all the gods of the sea, what a monster!

I can barely believe what I am seeing, {name}. This ettin has undergone the same ritual that the brutes do, and it seems even angrier! If he gets out of here, we won't stand a chance.

I know I ask the impossible, but I must: kill this monstrosity and save the whole valley from its wrath! Here, take one of the potion samples you brought me. It's probably dangerous, but you might need it to defeat this beast.

 Quest Hand-in: It's done! I was afraid you were done for, but you've saved us all!
Title: Bushwhacker

Description: Kaz is using us, I am sure of it. She is a Laughing Skull and must NOT be trusted.

For now, I am willing to play along until we can learn more. 

Kaz is going to ask for you to travel to Evermorn Springs. When there, I recommend you slay any botani you encounter.

Culling the numbers of these horrific casters will hopefully save future orcs from such a infested fate.

I will stay with Kaz and keep a close eye on her.

 Quest Hand-in: I had thought the Laughing Skull were planning something. Now I think I am beginning to understand.They match savagery with savagery.
Title: The Lost Glacier

Description: <The Lich King's presence is overwhelming.>

Do you know why the red dragonflight seeks to prevent us from finding our prize?

The bones of a great red dragon teem with the essence of life, even decades after its passing.

You will consume this life essence, blight it, and turn it to undeath.

And then you will raise a dragon.

Fly now into the north. Find this glacier, and your destiny.

<The presence fades.>

 Quest Hand-in: <A crack in the ice beneath the snow, it's very deep. You feel the unholy power surge within you, this would be the ideal location to unleash the energy to raise the dragon.>
Title: Challenges in Maldraxxus

Description: In Maldraxxus, the House of the Chosen have taken control of large swaths of land, upsetting the balance of power amongst the houses. To them flock the most seasoned gladiators and warriors.

What better place to test yourself?

Head into the land of bones and blood, and stand against their most powerful minions. Prove true what you know to be inside of yourself.

 Quest Hand-in: The mightiest gladiators have fallen to your hand, and in doing so, you have shown that we, too, will defend the Shadowlands if necessary. Let this be a lesson to them.
Title: Guardians of Hyjal: Firelands Invasion!

Description: The Guardians of Hyjal, led by Arch Druid Malfurion Stormrage, seek brave heroes to assist with a full-scale assault on the Firelands.

Willing and able-bodied champions of the Horde should report to the Sanctuary of Malorne in Mount Hyjal immediately.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you for answering our call for aid, <name>.
Title: Safety in Numbers

Description: I've taught you all that is practical for now.

It is time we joined with the other survivors.  The others mentioned that King Greymane and his royal guard are just south of here.

We should go there and seek safety in numbers.

 Quest Hand-in: You've done well in coming here.  If we Gilneans stick together we might yet defeat this terrible enemy.
Title: Dagra the Fierce

Description: You climbed this mountain once more only to face your own demise.

 Quest Hand-in: Impossible!
Title: They Grow Like Weeds

Description: Ahh, it is you again, {name}.

Instructor Windblade is looking for you. You can find her on the ridge to the east.

She has some news about your cloud serpent.

 Quest Hand-in: Congratulations, <name>.There is great joy in seeing the fruits of your own labor.
Title: Round 'Em Up

Description: Lok'tar, {class}.

We've made progress, but we're going to need mobility if we want to maintain our foothold here in Kun-Lai.

I don't see many worgs, kodo, or the like around here. What I do see are yaks. Our pandaren allies have said they make good mounts, so they'll have to do.

Go round some up and return them here, so we can get our people riding them!

 Quest Hand-in: Well done! Well, they're plenty stubborn, I'll say that much. But they should do nicely.
Title: Warriors of Light

Description: We have gathered to celebrate our victory over the Burning Legion this day. Highlord, please join us.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you for leading us to victory. All hail, Highlord <name>!
Title: Survival of the Fittest

Description: The collar you took from the trapper is simple, but effective. Affixing the collar to a target will make them complacent and obedient to their Nightborne masters. Lilryia was able to reverse the spell using the traps you found.

The magics in the collar can now be used to cancel out the other collars.

How about giving the Nightborne a reminder that nature always finds a way?

 Quest Hand-in: I could hear their cries and see the carnage from here! That will teach the Nightborne to enslave creatures. Have they fallen so far during all those years under the shield?
Title: Smashing Herbs

Description: Now that the formalities are out of the way, let's have you do something actually useful.

On the islands below, there's a plethora of new and exotic herbs that we've yet to experiment with.

I'd like you to get some of those herbs and create some new pigments from them. Once you have enough, come back to me and I'll see what you've come up with.

 Quest Hand-in: Yes, these pigments look like they will do the trick. Well done, student.In fact... I've been researching a new glyph that these pigments would work splendidly with. Why don't you give it a shot?
Title: Reading the Bones

Description: One of the benefits of possessing this creature is that I have access to all of her powers. As a bone witch and rune reader, she has the power to throw the bones and determine one's fate.

<The Bone Witch smirks.>

Lucky for you and I that I have it within my power to influence those readings.

Bring me the bones of the vrykul that you kill here in Jotunheim and I will toss them to allow you to determine your own fate.

 Quest Hand-in: And now we shall see what the future holds for you.<The Bone Witch casts the bones upon the rug in front of her.>Choose your fate, <class>.
Title: On Swift Wings

Description: Our revered Archon has decided to grace you with an audience.

It is your duty to present your discoveries to her, then follow her wise judgment.

She holds audience in Elysian Hold, part of the sprawling Spires of Ascension, the home of the Ascended.

We shall carry you there, for it is a place for those who can fly.

 Quest Hand-in: The Archon's chambers are just above. I urge you to practice extreme deference while in her presence.
Title: The Wildhammer Specialty

Description: Well, if ye didn't find Blood Prince Dreven on yer ship, he must be hiding on the other one.

I can take ye down to it, but the Horde knows we're here now. What do ye say we create some distractions to hold their attention while we hunt down Dreven?

Me Wildhammers are itchin' tae let the hammers fly. Ye want to join us for the first round?

 Quest Hand-in: He's here.
Title: Lost in the Woods

Description: My student, Amalie, and I have taken it upon ourselves to act as the keepers of these woods. We were away from Drustvar briefly, and upon our return, found the grove infested and the surrounding land corrupted.

Amalie decided that she could deal with the grove infestation alone.

It's been some time since she ran off, could you look for her while you're in the Ashenwood?

 Quest Hand-in: She said she would head back on her own? At least she is safe.
Title: The Missing Blade

Description: <The echo of the blade Xal'atath lingers before you. Though the consciousness that resided within the dagger is gone, the place it once occupied still resonates with power.

You sense the weapon now speaks another voice. Another purpose....

You feel compelled to warn the king that the blade may now reside in the hands of the enemy.>

 Quest Hand-in: <You tell Anduin about Xal'atath and N'Zoth. His expression darkens.>This is grim news, champion.The Alliance stands on the threshold of victory. If the Banshee Queen has learned of a new weapon, she will use it to keep the war going indefinitely.
Title: Don't Go into the Light

Description: Okay, dis is de moment of truth! We will see if my voodoo can cure Zaluto.

I should have been honest with you... dere is a chance dis won't work. Voodoo isn't a science, you know.

I need you to hold Zaluto down, because dis here is going to hurt. A lot.

 Quest Hand-in: Zaluto is free from death's door, but he's still weak. We have more to do.
Title: Altar Altercation

Description: You see that altar down there? There's a magical eye settled at its peak, and I fear our group will not survive if it sees us.

Distract the eye, {name}. Cause a commotion, kill some ritualists, whatever you have to do - just occupy that thing long enough for me to guide the rest of our group past its gaze.

<Khadgar looks over his shoulder.>

Bring that strapping orc with you. The one that's not Thrall.

 Quest Hand-in: <Khadgar looks concerned.>No - we cannot wait for Ariok. He knew what he was getting into.His sacrifice cannot go to waste. We must keep moving.
Title: Stylish Cover

Description: Is that ta' same type of head topper Hips from the Sinstone Swingers wears?

 Quest Hand-in: Is that actually his spare hat? I can't believe it, I think I see some sweat on the band... thank you!
Title: Rare Resources

Description: Kh-kh-kh... the brokers, they go to many places. Many places we cannot. The eyes cannot follow them.

Find many secrets, they do. Bring us supplies, strange and rare.

Need things to trade. Need broker coins.

They trade with all. Find coins in all lands. Slay those that hold them, bring the coins to me. 

You may eat their corpses, I will not judge. Just need coins.

 Quest Hand-in: The clink of the coins is the sound of secrets being revealed. Many uses, many things I will purchase. More powerful will we become, due to this. A good find.
Title: King of the Foulweald

Description: My research has paid off.

I believe that with a show of force, we can diminish the furbolgs' aggressiveness.

Take this banner a short ways northeast and place it on their totem mound. They will try to destroy the banner, but hold your ground until their chief, Murgut, appears to save face for the tribe.  Bring me the totem he carries.

Gather your allies, {name}. This is no task for a single {class}.

 Quest Hand-in: Good work, <name>.  Issuing that challenge to the Foulwealds and defeating their leader sends them a strong message:The Horde is not to be trifled with.I don't believe that tribe will be giving us much trouble for a long time.
Title: Learning the Ropes

Description: Now that you are a pet trainer, it's time to test your skills!

Head out into the wild and pick a fight with a battle pet.  Come back to me after you have won and I will continue your training.  Good luck!

 Quest Hand-in: Nice work, <name>!  You're better with those pets than I thought!
Title: A Disturbance In The West

Description: Another force threatens to destroy all that we have worked for, {name}. You must head westward to Stars' Rest. Archmage Modera has sensed a great disturbance in the magical ley lines of our world that must be dealt with immediately!

Go now, {name}! Speak to Rodney Wells at the gryphon station here in Wintergarde and let him know the nature of your mission. He will place you on his fastest gryphon to deliver you to Stars' Rest. Speak with Archmage Modera when you arrive.

 Quest Hand-in: We definitely don't want another sundering, friend. I'll do all that I can to help you on your mission.
Title: Communication Orbs

Description: We have important work at hand, Highlord.

Spread out across the legion camp are orbs that are vital to the Legion's planning and strategy.

Destroying them will severely damage their efforts. I will go with you, Highlord, to see this through.

 Quest Hand-in: No... we underestimated the enemy.
Title: Worries and Validations

Description: The deaths of these Sundered Flame underscore how dangerous the Ruins of Karnthar are.

But Rannan believes that with some tinkering the R.A.D. can still quell the energies here.

Again, we're treating the symptoms and not the root cause.

Search the ruins for clues and see if you can discern their original function. And make haste, {name}. We may not have much time.

 Quest Hand-in: This is... not good news.If Sindragosa could not control Karnthar and ordered this station abandoned, I can only imagine the nefarious things that the Sundered Flame could do with it.We must not let it fall into their hands.
Title: Bwemba's Spirit

Description: Dese be troublin' times for us Darkspear.  Da Zandalar be reuniting all da troll clans an' plan to take back da lands dey lost.

We tryin' to warn all dat we can.  But it might be too late.

Another Darkspear gone down to Stranglethorn to warn da people.  But it ain't safe to travel alone in Stranglethorn.

Help me find him and make sure da people in Stranglethorn are warned of da rise of da troll tribes.

I gonna bind my spirit wit' ya.  When ya get to Stranglethorn, I be able to aid ya.

 Quest Hand-in: Dere ya have it, <name>.  It look like we gonna lead an assault on da Gurubashi in Zul'Gurub.Dese be dire times for us Darkspear.  But dey be even more dire for da Zandalar.  Dey goin' too far.Ya been good to Bwemba, hopefully ya gonna continue to help out all of Stranglethorn.Spirits be wit' ya, <name>.
Title: A New Adventure Awaits

Description: {name}! You're needed in the present. Things have... well, you should just come back to see.

I would finish what you're doing then head back. I can't keep you in the past for much longer!

 Quest Hand-in: Welcome back to the present! There's a lot you have to do.
Title: Fully Armed and Operational

Description: Commander! Great news! Now that the workshop is fully armed and operational, we can start cranking out siege weapons just as soon as we have the resources.

The Overcharged Siege Engine is the pinnacle of gnomish  engineering, if I do say so myself. It's more powerful than your average siege engine and you can use it almost anywhere! The only limit is the amount of fuel we're able to pack into the chasis.

As soon as you're ready to begin production, just bring us some resources and place a work order!

 Quest Hand-in: Can't wait to get this thing up and running for you, commander!Check back in tomorrow, and be sure to wear your blast goggles!
Title: Asghar's Totem

Description: What you read in the commander's journal is true. While the orcish Horde massed under Gul'dan, my people sought to defend ourselves from the threat by striking against him. Gul'dan learned of their intentions and cast a mighty spell that destroyed our camps and twisted the spirits of my brothers.

They must be stopped before they unleash a greater evil. In the Sketh'lon Wreckage to the north, seek out Asghar and bring me the totem he carries. With it, we can begin to thwart the dark conclave's plans.

 Quest Hand-in: <Parshah examines the totem.>Good. This old totem hasn't lost its power over the years, but it alone is not enough to stop the dark conclave.
Title: The Fall of Kel'vax

Description: We be ready ta kill Kel'vax and send his soul ta Bwonsamdi for judgment. Ya should know someting before ya go in.

Kel'vax was our son. Dat be why Bwonsamdi chose us ta stop dis madness.

I not be knowin' why Kel'vax chose ta forsake everyting we believed in centuries ago... but here we are.

Even without his undead, Kel'vax be very powerful. Be prepared... dis be our shot to end him and find our rest.

 Quest Hand-in: It be over. As ya can see, Kel'vax be trapped in his phylacteries.All dat's left for us ta do is ta destroy da containers ta send him ta Bwonsamdi for judgment.We couldn't have done this without ya. May Bwonsamdi be wit ya... and may ya be wise enough ta know when ta make a deal with him.
Title: All Hope is Lost

Description: I am not doing dis anymore! You and Da'jul are WRONG! Dere is no stopping Zardrax!

I am leaving, and you cannot stop me. Zardrax will save us all from destruction and give us new power!

 Quest Hand-in: We got no time ta be mournin' Kal'dran. He made his choice, so now we be makin' ours ta defeat Zardrax.
Title: Paint Bottle: Goblin Green

Description: <Kram Kelada could make use of this item.>

 Quest Hand-in: Good color choice!
Title: Making Contact

Description: Now that we have recruited champions for our order, we can use the Scouting Map to complete vital assignments across the Broken Isles.

Over the years our scouts have kept a close eye on hunters that might one day be added to our ranks. One such hunter, Lenara, was on her way to Trueshot Lodge when she was attacked.

I suggest that we send Loren Stormhoof on a mission to rescue her. He may be uniquely suited to this task.

 Quest Hand-in: Good, your champions were successful with their mission! We may be seeing some new faces around here soon.
Title: Heritage of the Mechagnome

Description: {name}, we could not be more pleased with your progress. You represent us well with the Alliance.

Return to Mechagon City at your earliest convenience. Waren has created a gift for you.

 Quest Hand-in: Continue in this manner, and our people will continue to advance at a rapid pace. There is so much left to discover! Continue to learn and grow, <name>!
Title: The Nighthold: The Eye of Aman'Thul

Description: The battle is won, but the war is far from over.

In order to stem the tide of demons flooding into Azeroth, we must use the Pillars of Creation to seal the Tomb of Sargeras.

<Khadgar peers down at the Eye of Aman'Thul.>

That... might be difficult to carry.

Perhaps I can use the power of the Eye itself to teleport it to Dalaran. I suppose there is only one way to find out!

 Quest Hand-in: With the Eye of Aman'Thul in our possession, we are one step closer to sealing the portal.
Title: Saving My Head

Description: Seeing as how you're a blacksmith, I figured it'd be best if ya made da spear. You can use dis forge here to do what ya need to to do.

I'll start writin' down what ya do and den we'll have us both da spear and da recipe!

 Quest Hand-in: Dat's it, mon! Ya did it!I tink before I head off back to da Isles, I'll be making a few extra copies of dees plans, just in case.I'll make ya a copy too, in case I be needing your help wit' making another one.
Title: Secret Strength of the Frenzyheart

Description: Battle still going at Kartak hold... I think it time for you to learn big secret of Frenzyheart.

We have berries we keep from other lands we came from... they not so special on their own, but mix them with drunk drinks and they make Frenzyheart super strong. You a Frenzyheart now... it time you get to be strong too.

I give some drink, then you be super strong and you go smash all the spark big-tongues.

 Quest Hand-in: You a fierce fighter... come back for more battle soon. Never enough good battle!
Title: Noko's Flute

Description: <Noko breathes in slowly.>

The stage manager says he cannot find my flute anywhere.

The last time this happened, one of the rowdy roadies had run off with it.

You can find those troublesome dredgers causing trouble around the party.

Retrieve my flute from them and I will play for your guests.

 Quest Hand-in: <Noko holds his flute tenderly.>I only truly feel like myself while holding the flute of my caravan.Thank you for providing the opportunity to play.
Title: Fel Ingredients

Description: Our scouts have located a Felskorn encampment within the Garrison of the Fel. We will need as many samples of fel poison as we can find if we are to concoct a cure for our stricken monks.

Take samples of anything that looks remotely useful!

 Quest Hand-in: Let's hope that's enough to brew a cure for our dying monks!
Title: Borrowed Technology

Description: I get it, I get it. Cappy's too busy to see this for himself. His loss!

See, I've managed to 'acquire' a certain shipment of solution from the enemy. And as much as I hate tinkerin' with inferior goblin technology, I'm inclined to make an exception here.

Take this sample. I'll need you to run a few field tests, just to prove its usefulness, while I try to do a little reverse engineering to duplicate the creation process.

Go to the front and gather the materials to make a decoy, then use the oil.

 Quest Hand-in: Good news!I've managed to reproduce the solution - hardly an accomplishment, of course.Doubt I'll live to see the day those neanderthal goblins cook up somethin' a gnome can't recreate in his sleep!
Title: The Hunting Hound

Description: Go and hunt the nearby beasts with your giant bakar. The bigger, the better. I will observe from here, and decide if he is worthy of Shikaar training. 

Be warned, I will only accept the best.

 Quest Hand-in: Your bakar, while massive and strong, does not seem to have the will to do what needs to be done in the hunt. He is too soft!I will give him one more chance, but this is it!
Title: Corki's Gone Missing Again!

Description: <Arechron sighs.>

This is so embarrassing. Do you remember my boy, Corki? You rescued him from the Burning Blade Ruins recently. Well, his curiosity has gotten the best of him once more. He told me that he was going to investigate the Boulderfist menace for 'uncle' Mo'mor and ran off to the ogre mounds in the Halaani Basin, north of here.

Do you think you could track him down? I would be eternally grateful.


 Quest Hand-in: Thank you so much, <name>. His mother will deal with him from now on.
Title: Shoak's on the Menu

Description: I don't know what stupid thing Shoak did to get captured by the Natha'vor trolls, we'll find out once you rescue him.

I bet they're getting ready to make a meal out of Shoak. You need to work fast and get him out! 

Shoak's one of the largest oafs that I know, those trolls won't be happy that you're taking their "meal" away.

 Quest Hand-in: Thanks again, I thought I was done for!
Title: The Emerald Nightmare: Piercing the Veil

Description: The darkness of the Nightmare is like a heavy shroud, warping reality and altering the perception of all living things. As areas of the Dream are cleansed, Xavius's hold weakens, and the way to the heart of the Nightmare will be revealed. But there might be a more direct way... my teacher once spoke of a pure power that could illuminate the darkness of the Nightmare, and allow all paths to become clear. But alas, Cenarius is lost....
