 Quest Hand-in: Incredible... where did you find these? With these Essences, I will be able to open the way directly to the heart of the Nightmare. Let us make haste!
Title: Frogs of Fire

Description: I found a perfect spot for a fishing net, one problem bothers me though... Those Hornspikes. I'm pretty sure they will ravage the nets as soon it's left alone. What do we do?

...I've got an idea. We treat our lava fishing nets with Icicle Brew to make them heat-resistant. We just need to teach those hornspikes to keep away from that smell.

Toss a flask of Icicle Brew at a hornspike, and then deal some damage to them. Just make sure not to kill them, they won't learn if they're dead, would they?

 Quest Hand-in: Well done! Feel free to use the fishing net spot now, there's enough room for us all.
Title: Work It

Description: The Trial of Style gives us the opportunity to look good. {class}.

The camera makes sure we keep looking good. 

So focus on me and my camera, follow my directions and I'll make sure you look fantastic!

 Quest Hand-in: The camera doesn't lie, <name>. You are one stylish <class>.
Title: Meet the High Tinker

Description: I don't know if you'll remember Mekkatorque or not. Nevin tells me that memory loss is pretty common for a Gnomeregan survivor.

Mekkatorque, or more properly, the High Tinker Mekkatorque is the leader of all the gnomes. He has made a habit of meeting with every rescued survivor personally. You should introduce yourself to him. He'll be with his war council beneath the tent in the center of town.

 Quest Hand-in: It's good to meet you, <name>. You've probably heard others speaking of Operation: Gnomeregan. Let me tell you a bit about what happened and why we left the dwarven city of Ironforge.
Title: I'm Not Lion!

Description: I've hunted many exotic beasts in my day, but I've never seen a lion like the one I encountered while scouting the basin.

The beast's amber eyes locked on mine, luring me closer. I was helpless to this predator's enchanting gaze. It was only when the lion pounced did the stupor break.

I've told Hemet of this magical beast, but he laughs. I'm not lying, {name}! The lion exists.

If you find the beast, bring me a trophy of your kill, and I'll reward you handsomely.

 Quest Hand-in: So I was right! The lion with the amber eyes did exist.Here's the gold as promised. This is worth every copper. You can't put a price on proving that you're right!I'll keep this eye, but I wouldn't want the rest of our prize to go to waste. Let's eat!
Title: Changing Course

Description: Champion, the time for action is upon us. 

Developments are underway that will change the course of this war. 

Report to me aboard Wind's Redemption as soon as possible.

 Quest Hand-in: I have news from our allies.
Title: Swift Vengeance

Description: I swear, when I find him...

<Tiffany catches your eye and regains her composure.>

{name}, I need you to track down my FORMER associate, Harold Winston. I doubt he's gotten far, given our location.

When you find him, I would like you to recover the stolen property and return it to me.

Use any means necessary. And don't worry about Ms. Moore's jewels, I'll redeliver a fresh supply to her personally.

 Quest Hand-in: <Tiffany takes the bag from you and pulls out the jewels. She carefully looks over each one.>Good, they're all here. And from the looks of it, they're all the original jewels.How did you deal with... actually, nevermind. I really don't care.
Title: Rattling Their Cages

Description: We have been having issues with the undead down at the Cape of Lost Hope for a while now.  Every time a new ship wrecks, they end up getting more undead to join their ranks.

Can you do us a favor and thin out the ranks up there?  I know you won't be able to kill them all, but anything you can do will help at this point.

Keep an eye out for alliance, we have been getting reports of them ambushing the beach lately.

 Quest Hand-in: Nice work on the undead up there <name>.  We really appreciate the help.
Title: Scrounging for Parts

Description: There's just too much to do around here, and too few gnomes on their feet to help! The high tinker has asked me to start converting some of our old bots and parts from Operation: Gnomeregan. I hope to have a new line of multi-bots ready for a field test soon!

I don't suppose you'd have some time to help, do you? There are all kinds of parts scattered around. Pick up anything you find and bring it back to me. You never know what could turn out to be useful!

 Quest Hand-in: These are fantastic! Let's see what we can put together. Would you be interested in testing out the prototype once I'm done?
Title: Iron Low Tide

Description: A few years ago I tried to join the Irontide. They said I wasn't "Irontide material", not cruel or heartless enough! 

So I teamed up with Nedly and Moxie here in Deadwash, and we started looking for treasure on our own.  

Let's show these Irontide they're not "Deadwash material".

 Quest Hand-in: No one's gonna cry about a few less pirates.  I may even dance about it!
Title: Feeding An Army

Description: We've had a chance to work with these beasts for a while now, and that's allowed us to develop a brand-new trap for you to try out. It should be much sturdier than the last one!

Mind giving 'er a run, commander? The Improved Iron Trap will let you capture some of the meatiest wildlife, like the big boars and riverbeasts out in Gorgrond. We'll be able to turn them into some tasty steaks.

 Quest Hand-in: Great work, commander! We'll get to grillin' up those steaks right away. I can already smell them!
Title: Grimaxe's Demise

Description: With you leading the way, we've finally broken the momentum of the Dark Iron attack. General Grimaxe, the Dark Iron leader, is attempting to rally his troops from the center of their lines on the frozen lake to the south.

He stands atop one of their new dark iron golems, shouting orders to his men. If he succeeds in rallying them, they may still be able to overpower us. You must prevent that, {name}. Destroy the golem guarding him, then kill General Grimaxe himself. He is the key to our victory.

 Quest Hand-in: We've done it! Without your help, Ironforge Airfield would surely be occupied by the enemy and the Dark Irons would have a clear road to Ironforge itself.The Council of Three Hammers must be informed of what happened here.
Title: Crabtender's Quandry

Description: The crabs are in danger!

This particular bunch has been through a rough season. Their previous habitat was ransacked by the Primalists, and then I led them to this area only for gorlocs to invade!

I thought they would be safe here, but the gorlocs only nurture aggression in their crabs, leading them to an early demise!

Please, defeat some of the gorlocs so the crabs can escape!

 Quest Hand-in: Aspect's grace shine down on you, <name>! You saved my precious crabs! I will watch them more closely this time. No gorloc will overtake my charges again!
Title: Into Occupied Territory

Description: Now, the more direct course of action that we are going to take, to figure out what these night elves are really up to, is to have you go to their island and steal any information that you can come by.

I want you to head west down the road out of town to Shalandis Isle, just off the coast. Go there and recover any plans they might have on the island or on their ship.

 Quest Hand-in: Troubling! These plans show the night elf forces at An'daroth, which we already knew, but also at An'owyn, a more remote ley-line nexus to the southeast.There is a third nexus to the east, which is not mentioned, named An'telas. I have a very bad feeling about all of this, <class>.
Title: Seeker of Truth

Description: You may be familiar with Orik Trueheart. He has devoted his time after the Northrend campaign to learning more about Tyr. 

Orik has evidence of a powerful shield crafted by Tyr long ago. With the help of the Sunwalkers, we may finally be able to seek it out.

Please speak to him immediately.

 Quest Hand-in: I'm glad yer coming. I've been wanting to pursue this for some time now. With help from the Seers, I think it can be done!
Title: Make Yourself Useful

Description: Gobbles vill be sorely missed, but zhe mission must not suffer.

Perhaps zhere is somezhink you can do to redeem yourself.

Take vone of zhe uniforms you recovered. Vhile vearink it, my vorkers vill not behave so... aggressively.

Lately, zheir morale has been a bit lackink. Some of zhe vorkers are refusing to perform zheir labors.

Auch, zhe audacity!

Find zhese lazy imbeciles and convince zhem zhat zhey must get to vork... or else!

 Quest Hand-in: Vell done, <class>.Zhere may be hope for you yet.
Title: The Dreadlord Balnazzar

Description: With the fall of the Scarlet Crusade, their disguised demon leader, Balnazzar, released the possessed body of Grand Crusader Dathrohan and went on a rampage, killing every remaining crusader here. He then used his necromantic power to raise them all as vile undead slaves.

Balnazzar refers to his new army as the Risen. We cannot let him grow this army - they are extremely powerful and, unlike Arthas' Scourge, Balnazzar will not hold his forces back. Kill him while we still have a chance, {class}.

 Quest Hand-in: It's good we stopped Balnazzar now. Before long, his army would have overtaken all of Stratholme, giving him a powerful center for his new unholy empire.
Title: Purity's Prerogative

Description: Do you feel it, {name}?

That cold hand that grips your throat? That chill settled in the pit of your stomach? That is the touch of the Maw, as certain as the Archon's will.

I do not know how Lysonia came to possess this power, but we must act quickly.

I will inform the Archon of what transpired here. You will act where my Hand could not. I will explain as we fly.

Speak to me when you are prepared to leave the temple.

 Quest Hand-in: We will see not a moment's rest today, will we?<Kleia eyes the fragment warily.>
Title: A Dryadic Remedy

Description: While you were gone, I heard from a dreamhare that one of the local ducklings is feeling rather down in the dumps. Luckily, I know exactly how to fix that!

Whenever I'm feeling moody, I snack on something sweet and tasty! As an expert in cute, lovable creatures, I know that the same principle will surely apply here.

This particular duckling is fond of a local dessert known as a Tasty Hatchling's Treat. Won't you find one and bring it to the poor dear? It's the dryadic thing to do, after all!

 Quest Hand-in: Oh, thank you, <name>! We dryads are stretched so thin that it can be hard to see to every little bird or beast that roams these streets.With your help, though, everything turned out splendidly! You make quite the useful dryad in a pinch! In fact, I may ask for your aid again some other time. There are always more adorable little creatures to attend to, after all!
Title: Sartharion Must Die!

Description: Sartharion, the Onyx Guardian, watches over the eggs of the Twilight Dragonflight. He rests within the Obsidian Sanctum in the Chamber of the Aspects underneath Wyrmrest Temple.

The Council of Six has decreed that Sartharion must die!

 Quest Hand-in: With Sartharion slain, surely Deathwing and Sinestra's plans are now stalled.
Title: A Seemingly Endless Nuisance

Description: I apologize for the state of things around here. The virmen - those rabbity creatures, down the hill - have been pushing further and further into my family's farm, and our crops - which are normally bigger, and more delicious, by the way - have been suffering because of it.

I'm no soldier... but you might be! Would you mind pushing some of these virmen off of our land?

 Quest Hand-in: <Pang surveys the area around his farm.>Well, they're not ALL gone yet, but there's less of them. And they aren't holding their ears quite as high anymore.I'd guess that they're scared of you, <name>.
Title: Withdraw to the Loading Room!

Description: Excellent job gathering the other survivors! They - and you - are the reason S.A.F.E. teams keep coming down here. Nevin won't rest until we've found and rescued every possible survivor.

I'm sending my men to the Loading Room to prepare for decontamination. Please follow them and meet up with Gaffer Coilspring when you arrive. She'll set you up for decontamination and have you on your way to the surface.

 Quest Hand-in: It's good to meet you, <class>. We rarely come across survivors as strong and capable as you are. I can help get you decontaminated and on your way out of here.
Title: Unsolid Ground

Description: The Twilight Cult are mining jade crystals near their camp.

Foolish...

Reckless...

Gather the mined crystals. Take them to the center of their camp. Shatter them against the ground.

The reverberations and the powered crystal will bring the tunnelers upon them.

They will learn respect for the earth...

Piece by piece...

Rock by rock...

...with time.

 Quest Hand-in: Time brings respect to all.The smallest pebble.The largest mountain.The most stubborn cultist.
Title: Actionable Intelligence

Description: <Tarecgosa listens intently as you describe your vision.>

Impossible!

Not even Arygos would dare to go to such lengths.

I do not question your integrity, {class}, but you must understand - your mortal mind can easily be deceived.

Regardless, Kalecgos must be informed of these events. You must travel to Nordrassil at once to seek him out.

I shall remain here to conceal the evidence of our activities. Speak of this to no one else!

 Quest Hand-in: <Kalecgos listens to your account of recent events.>It was wise of Tarecgosa to send you to me, <class>.Though your vision in the Nexus was almost certainly an elaborate illusion, it would be irresponsible of me not to investigate it.
Title: Return to the Broken Shore

Description: Fear not, {name}. I'm angry, but I don't chase my own death.

We will fly in and scout the ideal point of attack. The demons are still drunk on their victory, but we will put a swift end to their revelry!

Take my spare mount and we will fly to the Broken Shore. There we will bring honor to our dead.

 Quest Hand-in: Welcome to Skyhold, hero. Normally one must die to gain entrance, but times have changed.
Title: Vengeful Venture

Description: <You pick up the note and deduce that the Venture Co. are the killers of Dataguru Gryzix. You search his corpse, and find that his decoder and the Ub3r-Spanner schematic have been stolen.

You need to retrieve his decoder and the schematic and bring them back to Layla Evenkeel to have any hope of crafting the Ub3r-Spanner.

That mech you have following you should prove itself useful.>

 Quest Hand-in: He's dead? Poor sap, he was a damn fine engineer.Thank you, <name>.
Title: The Emperor's Way

Description: Recently, the August Celestials of Pandaria presented you with a challenge - and you triumphed.

But can you defeat them in combat? They are testing the mettle of all of Pandaria's heroes.

This challenge is not impossible, but you'll need to follow the advice of the last Pandaren Emperor and tackle it with unwavering inner strength. You'll also need a small army, so find a group of people you trust.

Defeat the four celestials here in the Celestial Court, and our journey is almost complete...

 Quest Hand-in: An impressive display of martial skill, <class>! You have truly walked the path of the emperor, and demonstrated the very traits pandaren value most.
Title: Lieutenant Paval Reethe

Description: I don't recognize the name of Lieutenant Paval Reethe. Your best bet would be to check with Adjutant Tesoran. He keeps track of all the records for the Theramore guard, from personnel to their equipment.

He should be able to tell you who this Reethe is with a quick check of his books.

 Quest Hand-in: Hello, <name>. You'd like information about a specific member of the Theramore guard? Reethe, was it?Just give me a moment to find the right book.
Title: Lost Scouts

Description: We sent some scouts towards the Five Sisters to the north to try and find whatever mogu leader has risen up to direct their movements in the valley. Few have returned.

I'd like to think they're just off downing too much ale or being irresponsible with some young pandaren, but they may actually be in some trouble.

Can you scout for the scouts? And see if they've turned up any information on that leader while you're at it?

 Quest Hand-in: The scout reports have pinpointed the mogu leader's position.
Title: Bridgeport Investigation

Description: While you're in Bridgeport, you might keep an ear out for any information that will be of aid to us.

You'd be surprised what you can learn by staying quiet and listening to people who think they're alone...

 Quest Hand-in: Explosives in the Ashvane Foundry? Clearly we can put that information to use. Well done.It sounds like that Captain Stone is somewhat of a big-shot as well. It would be a shame if something were to happen to her...
Title: Looming Threat

Description: The Quilboar in Razorfen Downs seem to have allied with the Scourge. This is dark news for us, {class}. We have dire enough problems dealing with these Grimtotem, we won't be able to handle an attack by the Scourge. Venture into Razorfen Downs, east of here, and see if you can find anyone that may be able to help you stop them before they decide to attack here.

 Quest Hand-in: You seem an able warrior. Perhaps you can help me put an end to the terrible evil here.
Title: At The Enemy's Gates

Description: Even as we ready for the tournament, Argent Crusade forces prepare the way for an assault on the enemy's stronghold of Icecrown Citadel.

In the Court of Bones in southwestern Icecrown, a few brave crusaders have set up a forward camp on the southern side of Corp'rethar. Equip your lance and mount the stabled campaign charger at the camp, then destroy the Lich King's minions.

Do not fear the masses of boneguard footmen, {name}, for they can easily be trampled under your horse's hooves.

 Quest Hand-in: Your bravery on the field has shown the crusaders that we are fearless in the face of the Lich King's minions.
Title: A Time to Break Down

Description: Well met, {class}. As we revel in the Wickerman ceremony, it comes as no surprise that the Alliance would attempt to ruin our celebration.

We have an opportunity to make them pay.  If you are interested, {class}, take this Dousing Agent and use it on the Alliance's Wickerman in front of Stormwind.

Extinguish their flame and revel in their misery, {class}.

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, so it is done.  A momentary setback, but if it is as annoying as their attacks have been, then it is worth it.The children learned about your adventure and were very excited.  They seemed to revel in the mayhem that you helped bring about... Oh those little rascals...They did want you to have some of these treats as a reward.  Enjoy, <name>.
Title: The Way Back Home

Description: Hello? This is Chief Telemancer Oculeth. I see you have emerged safely!

I am locking in your location as we speak. I will need you to activate the beacon on your end so we can establish a teleportation link.

Got it? Good.

 Quest Hand-in: When you suddenly vanished from our awareness we thought the worst.I do not know what to make of your adventures... I will need time to process this tragedy.Regardless, I am glad you are back safe and sound.
Title: Vaelen Has Returned

Description: I just saw that incompetent fool, Vaelen the Flayed, sneak into the vault building.

Go see to it that he rectifies his mistake and returns my death knights to me!

 Quest Hand-in: I think I can guess why you're here, <name>.
Title: A Rare Bean

Description: You are ill-equipped to face the restless elements of Nagrand. Before you can help the Earthen Ring, you must help yourself.

To the west you will find dung heaps left behind by the wildlife of Nagrand. You must search the dung for the digested remnants of the Nagrand caracoli. From this bean I am able to make a tablet that will aid you in your battle against the restless forces of nature.

Return to me when you have collected no less than two fists worth of caracoli... Ogre sized fists.

 Quest Hand-in: Please do not wash yourself in the sacred waters of the Throne.<Elementalist Lo'ap holds a prepared caracoli tablet up.>You place this under your tongue and allow it ample time to dissolve. Once it has dissolved, you will be able to breathe water as if it were air.
Title: To Catch a Shadow

Description: Gul'dan is on the Shadow Rise just up the hill to the west. But, you must hurry, {name}. We know that he's about to leave for Talador and Frostfire Ridge.

The use of the soul trap is straightforward. Simply point and shoot to ensnare Gul'dan. The crystal will take care of the rest.

I'll see you back at Starfall Outpost when you have him.

Good luck.

 Quest Hand-in: Unfortunate, but not surprising. At least we were able to defeat one of the inner council members.All is not lost, <name>. We know what the Shadow Council is up to and where they're heading.We'll regroup in Talador. Together, we'll put an end to Teron'gor and his plans for Auchindoun.Did you hear that?
Title: Blueprint: Emergency Rocket Chicken

Description: <This blueprint details how to build what appears to be an aeronautically inclined poultry unit.

You should be able to upload the blueprint to Pascal-K1N6's database in Rustbolt.>

 Quest Hand-in: Have you recovered a new blueprint, my fleshy friend?I will add it to my database posthaste.
Title: The Wisp and the Sea

Description: Queen Azshara and her handmaidens are the subjects of many a tragic tale. Her power and her hubris lead her badly astray but, even so, her handmaidens are loyal to her to this day. There is power in such a thing. 

The Wrath of Azshara is an abomination but, truthfully, it is actually one of her handmaidens who willing gave her life to protect her queen. Few know this. The Ancient Wisp knows this truth and if you take it to battle the Wrath of Azshara, you may find the handmaiden's gloves. Restore them.

 Quest Hand-in: These gloves have an air of sadness about them, do they not? Regardless, thank you for restoring them and bringing them here.
Title: Remember the Sunwell

Description: The Regent Lord intends to show First Arcanist Thalyssra our Sunwell.

I do not know if he will allow Alleria Windrunner to attend the meeting, but we are invited to join them.

 Quest Hand-in: That was not wholly expected.
Title: Archdruid of Lore

Description: Elothir resides in the ancient grove Thas'talah, where he communes with nature and instructs his acolytes in the ways of healing and the preservation of lore.

Seek him out and tell him that he is desperately needed here.

 Quest Hand-in: Welcome, <name>. News of your heroism spreads from the Dreamgrove.
Title: A Meandering Story

Description: <A quick glance at this heavy tome reveals flowery language and a plot that doesn't seem to go anyplace. At least not in the first few chapters.

There is some dirt on the cover, but the damage isn't too bad. This book doesn't seem to have found itself in too much trouble-- a bit like its plot.

Archivist Dreyden would probably be pleased to have his book back.>

 Quest Hand-in: Oh! You found one of my books! Thank you so much for returning it to me.
Title: A Growing Threat

Description: A moment there, {class}.

We've got more problems here than just the end of the world as we know it. Our vigil here's threatened by the quilboar. We've been content to leave them be when they stay in the Kraul, sure, but every day they press further and further out towards our camp.

Mahka, bless her green heart, wouldn't ever forgive me if I went out bashing heads in myself, but if you could help drive back those that're wandering near the camp, I'd appreciate it.

 Quest Hand-in: You've my thanks, if not that of the entire Earthen Ring.Maybe someday we'll find a way to talk it out with these pigs, but we can't heal the land if we're dead in our sleep.
Title: Big Bag of Creepers

Description: Right. You've been a polished bit of gray so far and it's appreciated from the bottom up for sure.

Well, now I got a task for 'ou that would help all of us dredgers put that anima you obtained to good use.

Creepers.

Not just any creepers, but 'em mire creepers. 'Ey got a look about 'em and a taste about 'em that just sings when you put it to good use.

As you go trippin' around Revendreth, grab any creepers ya find an' stick 'em in this here sack. I'll pay ya.

 Quest Hand-in: Well then, look at that!A big ol' bag of Creepers, with their squinty eyes and mold smellin' breath.Ain't 'ey cute? Havin' a few a these around the lads while they work will really help morale. Much appreciated from all of us.
Title: The Legend of Mechagon

Description: Heya, {name}. I was just tellin' Skaggit that I was hoping I'd run into you up here!

I caught wind of an Alliance operation into some old vault that opened in Tiragarde Sound.

In typical gnomish fashion, Tinkmaster Overspark is overreacting like crazy, claiming it's some lost connection to the gnome fairytale land of Mechagon.

<Gazlowe scoffs.>

I don't buy that for a second, but I am very interested in getting my hands on whatever tech's in that vault. You in?

 Quest Hand-in: Keep your head down! The Alliance beat us here!
Title: The Roads We Walk

Description: The armies of Maldraxxus are strong. They will recover from Vyraz's transgression. 

The first thing we must do is rebuild. Maw Walker, stand witness to a new era for Maldraxxus!

 Quest Hand-in: We must all move forward. The Shadowlands relies on our strength.
Title: Storm Chasing

Description: <Watu rips the shard out and gasps for air.>

I...completely lost control. Olekk was right. This terrible magic has to be the primalists' doing. Please, stop them!

I must get my brother back to camp.

 Quest Hand-in: You've returned! I felt the destruction of the source from here.
Title: Gromit Soul

Description: <The Gromit Soul is exuberant and inquisitive. The shape of the gromit will be yours to call upon.>

 Quest Hand-in: Ooh, a gromit! They pounce about with such joy!
Title: Agents of Destruction

Description: The Warsong Lumber Camp is a blight upon an embattled landscape. Every time we make progress in halting their operations, Overseer Gorthak orders his loggers to redouble their efforts!

Now, the orcs are cutting more wood than they can possibly use, leaving it to rot while their blades bite into fresh trees! This is an affront to all we stand for, {name}, and we will show them that we'll not suffer further destruction of our lands!

Go, and do not rest until Overseer Gorthak and his minions are dead!

 Quest Hand-in: At last we have sent a message that the orcs won't dare ignore. Any overseer or foreman who sets foot within the camp to replace Gorthak will feel my wrath!We must press our advantage, <name>, and never rest until the Warsong Lumber Camp is a distant memory and a glade of trees stands upon that ground.Now what was this about explosives...?
Title: Gathering Leather

Description: Greetings, young one.  You have a gleam in your eye; I can tell you are eager to venture back to the plains for the hunt.  May you bring honor to your clan!

I work with the skins of beasts, fashioning them into clothes and armor for the people of Thunder Bluff.

If you hunt beasts and bring me their skins, then I will fashion something for you.

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, these are very nice pieces.  They'll make fine leather goods.Here, <name>.  Take this in trade...
Title: The Last Wildkin

Description: The wildkin were once numerous in Darkshore.  Such are their ties to the land that the Cataclysm that shattered Darkshore also decimated their numbers.

The wildkin Aroom is the last of his tribe and is a powerful elder with a strong connection to Elune.  His help will be most necessary in healing the land -- you will find him north of here at the Moontouched Den.

 Quest Hand-in: A terrible sadness surrounds the creature.  Its eyes stare beyond you as you approach it.
Title: Raise a Glass!

Description: Pleased to meet you. Name's Venrik. I been scrapin' out a living here in Freehold for years.

Flynn used to be a regular back when he... well I shouldn't say too much. A man's past is his own.

I'll help the two of you out, but first I demand that you let me give you a proper Freehold welcome: A drink!

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, nothing like sharing a drink with an old friend... and a new one!
Title: The Eye of Odyn

Description: It is time to begin the war in Azeroth. We have prepared a tool for you to direct your warriors and your own operations from here. It is called the Eye of Odyn. 

If you will follow me, I will take you to it, and someone that will help you use it.

 Quest Hand-in: It has been a while since I've talked to the living. I hope you don't mind if I assist you. Being slain in combat has given me a calmer outlook in this emergency than other warriors.
Title: The Only Way to Travel

Description: Call me cautious but I kept a few flares just in case we needed to quickly escape.

I'm glad that wasn't needed but we could still use the ride back to the artillery tower.

Are you ready sir?

 Quest Hand-in: The outpost is now fully up and running and we have enough material to outfit an army - your army!
Title: Spiders, Huh?

Description: I feel like they're still crawling all over me. I squished one egg and all of a sudden I'm covered head to toe in baby spiders.

<Shivers>.

That treasure is just sitting there now. The next guy better not be arachnaphlipic... arachnaphonetic? Arachniphant? Afraid of spiders!

 Quest Hand-in: Oh, look here! You went and got that treasure! Hey... You still got a spider on your shoulder.Lets see what fantastic treasure you brought me... This is it? This is worthless! Here you keep it.Tough break, kid. Keep at it.
Title: Fact-Finding Mission

Description: The dragon Sethria must be stopped. We know that her roost is south of here, along the southern cliffs of Hyjal, but beyond that we know little else.

I have sent Thisalee on a fact-finding mission to Sethria's Roost. She specifically requested your help - evidently you made quite an impression with the young druid.

Meet Thisalee just beyond the tunnel leading to Sethria's Roost. And remember, this is a fact-finding mission - don't do anything crazy!

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, <name>! I was hoping to see you out here.What, Omnuron calls this a 'fact-finding mission?' Bah! Facts are best found on corpses.Let's do some damage.
Title: The Fate of Kurzen

Description: Hello, {class}.

We are soldiers of Stormwind, and rebels from Kurzen's Compound, a large outpost that you'll find just to the southeast of here.  We were under the command of Colonel Kurzen, until he and those close to him started to descend into madness...

We rebelled, set up camp here, and stood against Kurzen.  Now, my sources are telling me Kurzen has disappeared.  I trust my source, but it would help to hear from a third party.  Please, head into the compound and find some documentation of his fate.

 Quest Hand-in: They KILLED him?  And all this time, I thought he had them underneath an iron bootheel...
Title: More Fodder

Description: Leo Shealds at Deadwash is a crook, but he recognizes the threat the naga pose. He'll send men to help us if we ask, even if most are just fodder.

Travel to Deadwash and ask for help.

 Quest Hand-in: The way the Irontide's hitting us, there should be plenty of volunteers to go help.
Title: A Victory For The Silver Covenant

Description: In spite of Queen Lana'thel's boasting, you have restored Quel'Delar, {name}. Long have we dreamt of reclaiming Quel'Delar.

The Silver Covenant, and indeed all quel'dorei owe you a debt of gratitude.

As a {class}, the sword seems to know you lack the training to wield it and hasn't bonded to you. Where, then, will its next master come from? Perhaps the Argent Crusade can find one. Go north to the Argent Tournament Grounds and present the sword to Justicar Mariel Trueheart on behalf of the Silver Covenant.

 Quest Hand-in: That a weapon of such power has been redeemed from the clutches of evil is a great omen in these times, <name>. With Quel'Delar and staunch Silver Covenant allies at our side, the Lich King will have good reason to fear.The crusade maintains an arsenal of exceptional weapons for our strongest allies. Allow me to offer you your choice from among them in return for entrusting us with the care of Quel'Delar.
Title: Return to Zuldazar

Description: Warfang Hold is our most secured of the footholds we hold in Kul Tiras.

Kaga and her forces will be able to keep fortifications running, thanks to you. The Alliance will never see us coming!

Tell Nathanos that we have succeeded in our mission. I will help here until I am needed.

 Quest Hand-in: Warfang Hold is an important strategic base for the Horde.It is imperative that it stays safe. Rexxar will see to that.
Title: Stand Your Ground

Description: I hope this rain isn't a bad omen... this is supposed to be a simple rescue mission.

You'll be sparring with me today. We have to make sure you can handle yourself once we make landfall.

Let's see what you've got!

 Quest Hand-in: You're a skilled <class>, recruit. I think you'll prove a welcome addition to the main rescue team.
Title: Acquisition: Crystallized Stygia

Description: <This shard of crystal appears to have broken off of one of the massive crystalline structures throughout the area. It thrums with untapped energy.

Ve'nari would likely be interested in any of these shards you come across.>

 Quest Hand-in: Ah yes, the dormant stygia throughout the Maw will sometimes coalesce into forms such as this.You were wise to bring this to me, <class>.
Title: Ballistae Bits

Description: Those djaradin might smell like brutes, but their engineering corps must be top notch to keep churning out ballistae strong enough to threaten a dragon!

Northeast of Loamm there's an ongoing scrap between them and some black dragons. There ought to be lots of spare parts scattered around. Or slightly used, moderately on fire ones, anyway!

Haul them all back to Loamm! A little scorching won't stop our top minds from reverse niffeneering them.

 Quest Hand-in: Interesting, that's a lot more bone than I would have expected given the stress involved!
Title: Zalazane Returns

Description: {name}, I have never needed your help as much as I do this day. My home be under attack.

I only just heard myself. Master Gadrin be callin' for aid. Zalazane, an old enemy of da Darkspear, has returned to da Echo Isles and has brought with him an army of da dead.

Zalazane be a traitor who has slain many Darkspear and defiled their souls. Will you come with me to defeat him? We can take da ship dat departs da Port of Zandalar.

 Quest Hand-in: You... you brought da Zandalari with you?
Title: Very Disarming

Description: Look around you, {class}. What do you see? I see an opportunity.

The casters here work to imbue the Zandalari weapons with powerful magic. As if a sharp blade isn't enough to cut even the strongest foe down to size.

In my scouting I've noticed the weapons are not very well guarded. This is where you come in...

If we can steal a few of these weapons we may be able to use them. At the very least they are out of enemy hands.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent work, <class>!These weapons are terrifying on their own, nevermind the magic they are infused with.
Title: Go to Adana

Description: We've struck a great blow against the quilboar here. I will stay here, and hold the line, but you need to move on.

Seek Adana Thunderhorn; she has taken a few braves to the southwest to root out the rest of the Bristleback.

 Quest Hand-in: More trials lay ahead, <name>. I hope you're prepared.
Title: Kill Them, Of Course

Description: These mindless monstrosities hail from the farthest reaches of the Shadowlands. The anima drought has fueled their relentless hunger, driving them to seek new sources.

Their presence here is inconvenient, to put it mildly.

They tear at the land searching for any anima they can find. We must thin their numbers and buy time to safeguard the knowledge locked within the Sepulcher.

Exactly the sort of work you're accustomed to, yes?

 Quest Hand-in: Nicely done. You've bought us precious time.
Title: The Nexus Vault

Description: If the Ethereum managed to capture Azuregos, then they are more powerful than I imagined. 

We have not always seen eye to eye, Azuregos and I, but he is still my kin. Since you seek to put an end to the ethereals and claim Aluneth, I ask that you also free my brother from their grip.

With the Surge Needles destroyed, the shield has dissipated. The Nexus awaits, {name}.

 Quest Hand-in: You have my gratitude for saving Azuregos, <name>. I can rest easy knowing that the Nexus is under his care.As for you, I can see you're full of surprises. Never in my time have I seen a <class> who can control the chaotic energies of Aluneth. Thank you for what you have done for me and my kind today. You are truly the hero we need to face the Legion.
Title: Screechflight Potluck

Description: Are you ready to put those acting chops of yours to good use, {name}?

What? You don't have any chops? Then it's a good thing I've made you an im-PECK-able Screechflight disguise out of all the materials you just gathered!

Segallia and I still need time to finish building the final "egg" that will take out the matriarch, but I've made a smaller, prototype version for you to try out on the chef.

And don't worry! You'll be 12% safer from these explosions under all the feathers!

 Quest Hand-in: You did great and looked pretty good in that outfit to boot!Finally ready to cut this terrifying threat off at its beak?
Title: Grimtotem Chiefs: Isha Gloomaxe

Description: Sentinel training 101: take out their leaders and your enemy's forces will soon fall apart. We're going to do just that, {class}.

Isha Gloomaxe is the closest of the Grimtotem chiefs. Let's see if we can't take her measure.

 Quest Hand-in: She was tougher than I thought. We worked well together, but we're going to have to make sure not to underestimate the other Grimtotem chiefs.
Title: The Boon of A'dal

Description: I am pleased that you have come to me, {name}. I know of Crusader Bridenbrad, and of your travels in hope of saving him. Bridenbrad's valor has sparked remarkable selflessness in you, and this is a miracle unto itself.

The Light will take care of its own. I will extend my blessing to Bridenbrad and he shall not endure the corruption of undeath. I shall return you to Dalaran, and you shall return to him. Know that I remain with you.

 Quest Hand-in: <As you approach Crusader Bridenbrad, you cannot help but notice that his skin has taken on a pale hue and his breaths are shallow. It is clear that he has little time left.>You have returned to me, <class>. I must admit... it is good to see you again... your face renews my hope that this land will be free of Arthas's grasp one day soon. I'm proud to have met you...
Title: Setting Sun Garrison

Description: The mogu will not be able to maintain this attack much longer. We should be able to handle it here, thanks to your kind aid.

Might you be willing to find Anji at the Setting Sun Training Camp to the west? She's been tasked with preparing fresh-faced pandaren to aid the cause. You could show them a thing or two as well, I imagine.

 Quest Hand-in: You I can work with. Let's show these trainees a thing or two about how a real <class> fights.
Title: Time for Answers

Description: You have a lot of questions, {name}.  You're the only one who can see me because you touched something that once belonged to him... don't you remember?

You don't know what it is?  Well I can't just tell you... that would make him really mad.  He's not just a prince anymore... he's the king!

Meet me at the Court of Bones, north of Icecrown Citadel and you can see for yourself.

 Quest Hand-in: There you are.  I started to wonder whether you'd show up.
Title: The Forgotten

Description: Many soldiers died on this island {name}.  It is only fair that we pay our respects to them in any way that we can.

I need you to travel to Forgotten Hill, due west of here and release our brothers in arms' tortured souls away from this place.  Do be careful over there, reports of undead have been ongoing in the area.

 Quest Hand-in: May their souls rest in peace.
Title: Gloriously Incandescent

Description: I did not come here to fight, I have seen too many die already. I have killed so many with my own hands.

I have come to seek the light, and redemption.

The arakkoa of this land worship the sun as I do. But they are a violent, isolationist, and decadent race, who seem to derive a different message than my own people. This troubles me.

Bring me one of their Sun Crystals. I wish to see this light.

 Quest Hand-in: The sun, I can see it. It is so bright.I... wish to be alone. Take this, and my thanks.
Title: Monitoring the Rift: Sundered Chasm

Description: Did you feel that?! That was just an aftershock... you should've been here a few minutes ago!

I'm afraid I must call upon your services again. My instruments indicate that there is an immense disruption just west of here, far beneath the water's surface.

Just as before, I need you to take the arcanometer and capture the anomaly's data.

I'll cast a spell that will enable you to breathe underwater. If it wears off before you find it, come let me know and I'll renew its effects.

 Quest Hand-in: It was how big?That's impossible! I need to report to Dalaran at once!
Title: Eoin Dunwald

Description: Eoin's one of the twins. He's got a penchant for the drink. You'll likely be findin' him over by the old well - the ale stores were in a building there.

Mind making him to pay his worrying sister a visit? Shouldn't take much convincin' if you can get to the ale first.

 Quest Hand-in: Of all the buildings in all the towns to collapse, why'd it have to be this one?!
Title: Thunderhorn Cleansing

Description: The Grimtotem are a tribe that believe all of Kalimdor should belong to the tauren alone. Their hate and anger led to a corrupting thirst for power. Magatha, their leader, poisoned our High Chieftain, Cairne Bloodhoof, and attempted to take Thunder Bluff for herself; she was defeated, and the Grimtotem exiled.

Now they seek to ruin Mulgore itself as they are driven out. Quickly, {name}, you must go to the Thunderhorn Water Well in the north and perform the ritual!

 Quest Hand-in: You've done great honor for both me and my ancestors today.  Please, take this with my gratitude.
Title: Crumbling Behemoth

Description: The mogu have succeeded in empowering an enormous stone statue with the intent of unleashing it upon us.

In response, I would like to unleash you upon it.

It approaches from the Golden Stair. Bring it to its knees...

 Quest Hand-in: Glorious.  They will learn to fear us.
Title: Kortas Darkhammer

Description: I hear that you fought my fool of a brother. He lost, eh?

Looks like this is my time to shine!

 Quest Hand-in: You're no better than Durin. In it for the glory. Pah!
Title: Snailspiration: Prismatic Softshell

Description: I smell a snail on you, but it's strange. You holding out on me?

Not many people know this, but snails are incredibly susceptible to peer pressure. Show off that wonder-snail you got there, and let's get Slick inspired.

 Quest Hand-in: Prismatic, huh? That's a fancy term for pretty colors? Well this snail fits the bill. I hope Slick doesn't get too self-CONCH-scious about it. Ha! He's plenty pretty himself.
Title: Call to Arms

Description: Our next strike against the ogres will bring you further east to Stromgarde. The living consider these gutted ruins worth clinging to. Their sentimentality is disgusting!

All that Stromgarde holds for us is a foul den of more ogres, waiting to be struck down. Travel there and slay their shamans and lords, and ensure what passes for leadership among the ogres is snuffed out.

 Quest Hand-in: Cleared out properly? Good. I doubt we'll even bother to lurk in Stromgarde. That ramshackle hole needs to be razed into dust.The land would make a decent spot for a new Undercity in its place.
Title: Reconstructing "The Final Truth"

Description: I dare not repeat aloud the horrors that are recorded in these pages. The words themselves seem to shift and morph as I read them, as if the book itself is attempting to induce a descent into madness.

This is taxing work, but it is necessary if we are to fully prepare you for the dangers of Ny'alotha. For as disturbing as its descriptions might be, setting foot within it will prove more challenging by an order of magnitude.

Keep looking for pages from the book, {name}. But... leave the reading to me.

 Quest Hand-in: Our journey's end approaches. The darkness gathers.
Title: Rico's Rescue

Description: Some of our Roughriders are missing, I tried to find them, but got pinned down here by the bugs! 

I could really use your help, {name}. See if you can save my missing troopers.

 Quest Hand-in: Rico put in a good word for you. Could mean a promotion sometime.
Title: We'll Poke Their Eye Out

Description: The Javelins were some of Suramar's finest creations before the Sundering. Their magic is ancient and potent. Perhaps strong enough to defeat Azshara's wards.

Hurry back to Newhome. We must tell the others of our success here. You have done well.

 Quest Hand-in: With this, we can secure the Tidestone.
Title: Beauty in the Deeps

Description: We have slain many enemies, spilled much blood on the sand. My skills have improved tenfold fighting at your side.

Yet let us not forget that once, this was a place of peace. Once, my people walked amongst the caverns and reefs undisturbed.

There is beauty, here, in the depths, all around us. Take a moment, sit, and enjoy your serene surroundings. Look here, a crab with a shell of brilliant colors.

You see? There is beauty here, even now.

 Quest Hand-in: Take this crab, may it be a symbol of the beauty that once reigned in this place.With your help, it will again.
Title: Cutting Edge Poultry Science

Description: <Before you is a delicious chicken... And yet, despite everything, there is something a little bit... lively about this creature.

With a judicious application of science, there might be something that can still be done for this poor bird.

You resolve to bring the chicken to Dr. Oglethorpe in Booty Bay with all haste.>

 Quest Hand-in: Hmm, a difficult case but I believe I can help!These days so many people concerned if science should do something rather than if science can do it! Now let's see... Some wire, a few gears, a bit of feath-growth potion and some good old rocket fuel for some kick... And presto! One robotic chicken back from the brink!Er, if it goes insane and tries to kill everyone, you were never here and we never had this conversation.
Title: Cursed Talismans

Description: {name}, we cannot allow the Bleeding Hollow orcs to possess their cursed talismans!  You must acquire them for us so they may be disposed of, and so the soldiers who owned them may be honored for their sacrifices.

Go to Zeth'Gor, the cursed abode of the Bleeding Hollow, and perform your grim task... return to me when you have collected the talismans.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you, <name>.  My heart is saddened to see these talismans -- they underline the great losses we of Honor Hold have suffered against the fel orcs.  But I am heartened to see you successful against them.  If we can kill enough, perhaps we might emerge from this war victorious.
Title: Call to Arms: Drustvar

Description: We've discovered a spike of Horde activity within Drustvar. We cannot allow them to get the upper hand.

 Quest Hand-in: Great work, <class>.
Title: Pristine Carved Bronze Mirror

Description: This artifact has been restored to a remarkably excellent condition.  Perhaps you will put it on display at the Seat of Knowledge, so that lorewalkers and archaeologists can study it.

 Quest Hand-in: This will aid lorewalkers and archaeologists in understanding the history of Pandaria.
Title: The Squid Shrine

Description: Sometimes tidesages come to the orphanage and tell us about the sea and how they can talk to it.

I wanna talk to water!

We've gone on field trips to their monastery here in Boralus, but I heard their home in Stormsong is much more impressive. Can you take me to go see it? I heard there's a great view from the Brineworks!

 Quest Hand-in: That tidesage was so mysterious! Do you know him?I wanna be mysterious like him! He could make water tornadoes! He even said the water talked to him! How cool is that?!... I'm all wet now.
Title: Visions of the Past: The Invasion of Vashj'ir

Description: The shard you recovered looks to be of naga origin. I had hoped to find a strong focal object like this for a spell I've been working on that would allow us to glimpse into the recent past.

I've enchanted the blade, but you'll have to take it to a place where we know its owner was. I want you to travel back to the site where you found it and use the blade.

Perhaps we can uncover more behind what the naga are doing here. Or even better, maybe we'll uncover a weakness that will give us a better chance.

 Quest Hand-in: A Battlemaiden? I never heard of such a thing.The way you explain it, it sounds like the naga forces are far greater in scope than the Admiral could possibly have realized. We might be able to learn more through the blade if we can find other locations where this Battlemaiden was present, but the information you gave me makes me fear for the admiral and his soldiers. We must warn them.
Title: Some Good Fishing

Description: Another pair of hands! I could use some help catching enough fish to bring home for a meal.

These Kirin Tor seem concerned about something called magical anomalies in the area, whatever that means.

You're all welcome to stay here as long as you pitch in and help out.

Grab a fishing pole and start fishing. Many hands make light work!

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, that will do nicely! Thank you, adventurer.
Title: Blood Ritual

Description: Our goal is to find the demon hunter, Loramus Thalipedes.  Let me know when you are ready to begin the blood ritual, and then stand back.

 Quest Hand-in: The blood ritual was a success; I can clearly see where Loramus is right now.  That is, I can see where the pieces of his body lie...
Title: Troll Patrol: Something for the Pain

Description: Gritty as my men are, they're still mortal.

Wounds and pain diminish their ability to perform their missions. No amount of training changes that simple fact of life.

Thankfully, one of our alchemists has developed a recipe for a salve that binds to our bandages and greatly reduces the pain our soldiers experience.

The salve requires a special poppy these trolls cultivate just west of here. Go to Drak'Sotra Fields and harvest some of them to keep our stockpiles from running out.

 Quest Hand-in: Fine specimens, <name>.On behalf of my soldiers, I thank you for your efforts today.Captain Rupert is likely the next stop on your patrol. He's stationed at the wall just east of here.
Title: The Trial of Courage

Description: An Exarch must be a pillar of strength, and no greater strength is there than the courage to face danger.

Far to the northwest, among the snowy crags of Frostfire Ridge, lives a primal fury named Everburn.

Only when you face one of these creatures eye to eye, will you know the extent of your courage.

 Quest Hand-in: I see that you and Yrel have stared into the eyes of the most primal of the elementals, and not waivered from your path.It pleases me to say that your courage is not lacking.Well done.
Title: Band of Veiled Shadows

Description: The rings worn by the Qiraji lieutenants are rumored to grant them formidable abilities.  The corrupted gems that adorn them could, in theory, be swapped out with more pure materials to create uncorrupted versions of the rings.

The gems that adorn Qiraji idols would work quite well, as their quality is superior.

Bring me the ring and idols and I'll create a powerful ring for you, {class}.

 Quest Hand-in: I will swap the gem on the ring for you.  You'll find the effect is much more... agreeable.
Title: Not So Complex?

Description: Alright, I believe I've finished adding the missing entries into the codex. And we have the machete... err, knife.

All that's left is to make our own tablet and verify my other suspicion about these tablets:

I believe that they're not just simple texts, but a sort of magical device.

 Quest Hand-in: It was a good thing you were here to help me with that.I surely would have been killed by those spirits!
Title: I'm Saved!

Description: I don't mind sharing.  I'm just glad to be saved from that creep, Gankly!  And I collected tons of skins from Zangarmarsh, so it's no problem at all!

 Quest Hand-in: Well, I couldn't see if you helped out with saving Kristen, or not.  But if she handed you one of her bundles of skins then you're alright in my book.Here's your reward.
Title: All Things Fluffy

Description: The tailors are always anxious to get their hands on that fluffy argali fur. The wool is especially useful for surviving in the freezing cold mountains of the Dragon Isles.

 Quest Hand-in: So fluffy! Yes, this will do.
Title: Xy Are You Doing This?

Description: We cannot see them, but I am certain this is where Cartel Xy has established their base.

Something must have drawn Xy to this area of Zereth Mortis specifically, and we must discover what it is if we are to protect our friends here. 

Their cloaks do not cover their supplies very well. See what information you can gather from their belongings.

 Quest Hand-in: Oh, they thought they could hide their plans with a code? Hold on, my friend, this should take just a moment...
Title: The Healing Wings

Description: Evoker, you have my gratitude for aiding my weyrn in our most desperate hour.

After we regain our strength, the Healing Wings will rendezvous with the rest of our forces.

Cindre tells me that Emberthal lost everyone from her weyrn. I fear I have no magic that can heal such a wound.

She may seem stoic, but Emberthal feels this loss deeply, {name}. Tell her I am on my way.

 Quest Hand-in: I am relieved that Viridia lives.If what Dervishian says is true, we will have need of her talents in the battle to come.
Title: Sealing Fate: Apexis Crystals

Description: You seem like the type who is always seeking power, no? These seals provide an investment, if you will, in your future power.

I also seek power, but one that is a more immediate and tangible. If you manage to find some crystals, we can make a deal. 

Remember, you can only obtain three seals per week.  This counts as one of those three.  Next week, I may have others.

 Quest Hand-in: Of course you agree.
Title: A Very Special Guest

Description: Listen. It is obvious you are doing this deal on Dracho's behalf. 

I believe Ta'xera, the boss around here, would be very interested in striking a deal with someone of your talents.

She resides in the manor at the top of the hill. I recommend you don't keep her waiting.

 Quest Hand-in: I have hoped for your eventual arrival, Maw Walker. Dracho is no longer a partner of ours. Normally we would extend this punishment to you for attempting to subvert our rules. But you being who you are... changes things.Let's strike a deal. You bring things of interest to me directly. No middlemen. No tricks. We provide payment and our wares when necessary. Do we have a deal?
Title: Getting Ahead

Description: Morale's been down at the camp lately. Funny how getting chewed on by some bugs can spoil the mood of a place.

I've got an idea to perk the troops back up, though. We need a trophy!

See if you can get me the head of one of those big tanky-looking ones so we can put it on display to show these bugs that we mean business! Just try to make sure it's not too mangled, okay?

 Quest Hand-in: Wow, that thing is massive!If a giant severed bug head doesn't lift the troops' spirits, I don't know what will!
Title: Every Dog Has Its Day

Description: Maw Walker, when I heard you were building constructs and a home for souls still loyal to Maldraxxus, I began my search for you!

I am loyal and have always wanted a construct form, but the Margrave was unwilling to build one that suited my natural inclinations.  

I lived my whole life with the curse, it's all I know, and it's all I still want.

Would you build a construct for me?

 Quest Hand-in: I know this soul, she is strong and very loyal. We would be well aided by building this most unusual construct.
Title: Seymour and Agnes

Description: The other skinner - pair of skinners, to be honest - that comes to mind when you show me this scroll is a student of mine, named Seymour, and his mother Agnes.

Last I heard, they were in Stormheim, hunting the storm drakes.

 Quest Hand-in: Yes, yes, that's my manuscript, but there's no time for that.Look what they've done to my MOTHER!
Title: The Souls Plight

Description: Anima enables us to do many fings, but this sanctum can not function on anima alone. It'll require the combined effort of many souls workin' togeffer to unlock its full potential.

The Soul Warden is eager to be of service ever since you rescued 'im from the Maw. Your unique ability 'ta brin' souls from there will prove useful to him.

Why don't you go pay 'im a visit?

 Quest Hand-in: I'm pleased to speak with you once again, Maw Walker.
Title: Bark for T'chali's Voodoo Brewery!

Description: We need to spread the word about the trolls at Brewfest.  Ya need to shout at the flags outside the auction house in the Valley of Strength, in the Valley of Honor, in the Valley of Wisdom and in the Valley of Spirits.

But I'll make it easy for ya, I'll lend you a racing ram for 4 minutes.

Be careful though, the goblins didn't put any apple crates along the way.  They are cheap like that.

 Quest Hand-in: Ya did it!  We gotta get ready for the flood of customers that are sure to come our way!  Thanks!Oh, that's right, and we promised you a reward.  Can't forget about that...Feel free to stop by again another day to help us spread the word some more.
Title: Above the Winter Moonlight

Description: There, it looks like there's a good spot to launch to right across from here. This path should take you all the way to the top.

According to my  intel, your dragons should be up there. Let's just hope that they're still in a state to help you.

 Quest Hand-in: You are here for the trial? I'm afraid you might be too late.This battle with these Felskorn has taken its toll. I am too weak to grant you the power you seek...But perhaps you may be able to help...
Title: The Iron Fist

Description: It's time to send a rescue operation to the Gates of Valor, {name}.

I will prepare our troops and send them at once. We will need a sizable army to take on the massive Legion force in Stormheim.

Grandmaster, go ahead whenever you are ready. I will send our forces to meet you in the field.

 Quest Hand-in: They made you Grandmaster, eh? Well, I was busy anyway!Anyway, I managed to escape from those fel-drinking dirt-kickers across the road, but our own are still in trouble.Those Legion worms are goin' ta sacrifice the prisoners for their souls.We've got ta help them!
Title: Welcome to Stormwind

Description: Now that we are back in Stormwind, I need to deliver my mission report to King Wrynn.

In the meantime, I've asked Lindie to accompany you around the city. There's a lot to see and do in Stormwind, so feel free to explore at your leisure.

I'll send for you once I've delivered my report to the king.

 Quest Hand-in: Hey, <name>! It's good to see you!Captain Garrick asked me to show you around the city. I'm so excited!
Title: The Torches

Description: Until recently, the yaungol shaman would come here to work alongside us. Now, they bend my people to their will.

If we refuse, they kill us. Even if we oblige... they kill us.

The yaungol mist-shaman's magic flows through his torch. Take his torch away, and he has nothing.

 Quest Hand-in: This torch... the yaungol once used these to communicate with me, with my people.Now, they use them to undo us.
Title: Escape Velocity

Description: We really don't have time to rescue those that are incompetent enough to get themselves captured over and over. Still, since I have some extra rockets leftover, this problem should be a snap.

Take these single-stage booster rockets down into the Slave Pits to the north and put them on the cages.

The cage will lift off into orbit and those idiots will be freed.

 Quest Hand-in: Oops. Well, what goes up must eventually come down.
Title: An Urgent Meeting

Description: I've been looking for you all over Stormwind, {name}.

The captain has delivered her report to the king. It appears that Stormwind requires your service yet again.

The leaders of the Alliance have gathered together for a meeting at Stormwind Keep, and your presence has been requested by King Wrynn himself. I was instructed to find you and deliver the message without delay.

It has been an honor serving with you, {name}. May the Light bless you on your journey.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent, you're here. King Wrynn and the others have been awaiting your arrival.
Title: Power of the Genesaur

Description: Commander, you now have the Will of the Genesaur along with the genesis water and enough seeds to grow an army. Not to mention the Laughing Skulls you helped save.

I would call this mission a success.

I will investigate this fortress further and see if there are more materials we might glean from it.

In the meantime, you may want to bring these artifacts you have obtained to Durotan back at the outpost. I will catch up once we have finished here.

 Quest Hand-in: Well done, Commander. Many of the orcs have tried to master the power of the genesaur but I have never heard of any succeeding.You have won us a powerful weapon for the next time we face the Iron Horde.
Title: Black Rook Hold: Greater Power

Description: The raw power of the runestones will allow Hymdall to temporarily open a tear into demonic worlds, but it's not enough.

The Legion hides its presence in far away worlds with dark magic. Bring a greater runestone so that Hymdall can hone in on our enemies across the cosmos.

 Quest Hand-in: It is done. Let us prepare the Valarjar for glorious battle!
Title: We Meet at Light's Hope

Description: We must put Highlord Tirion to rest.

There is but one place suitable for a paladin of his caliber... Light's Hope Sanctum, a secret bastion of the Light hidden beneath our chapel.

Paladins the world over will join us for the ceremony. I know Tirion would want you there most of all.

 Quest Hand-in: It is fitting that you are here.Time and again, you have fought to save our world. Now, I fear I must ask you to undertake an even greater act of service.
Title: High Fash-Djinn

Description: With my newly empowered lamp, I sense further, more valuable trinkets in the pockets of these elves and demons. Fetch them for me!

 Quest Hand-in: You've done it! My lamp has never shone brighter. I shall continue to grant you coins, but I shall have to find new uses for the magic you provide.
Title: Embrace the Voodoo

Description: Dese heathens think we are weak. Dey think we are broken.

But Zandalari never truly die.

I've blessed dat skull Habutu gave you with a bit of voodoo dat will let it break through to de Other Side. You will need to use my spirit obelisks to channel its power. Dey will take it from dere.

 Quest Hand-in: Can you feel it? De spirits are flowing through you, and dey are pleased.
Title: Stag Soul

Description: <The Stag Soul is noble and mighty. The shape of the stag will be yours to call upon.>

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, the stag. This shape is now yours to call upon.
Title: Warlord Sriss'tiz

Description: A naga invasion would be disastrous, {name}. I've seen what naga can do and I would not want to see such a catastrophe befall any being. If I were to guess, this Warlord Sriss'tiz will be hidden in a cave - probably along the coast to the west.

Find Warlord Sriss'tiz and put an end to his reign.

 Quest Hand-in: With Warlord Sriss'tiz dead, the possibility of a naga invasion is now only a distant memory. We are safe, for the time being...I must admit, I was wrong to think badly of you, <name>. You have shown that you are nothing like the filth that was Archimonde. Accept this as a gift from the night elves.
Title: Reprisal

Description: I happen to know some Alliance scum that have somethin' coming to them. And they have something that belongs to us. I've authorized an all out assault on Highbank.

Board the Skyshredder and join the assault. Patch will fill you in on the details as you arrive.

 Quest Hand-in: Good to have you, <name>. Ready to sew some chaos?
Title: The Dreamway

Description: The preparations for the ritual are now complete.

Come with me, {name}, I will guide you to the ceremony.

 Quest Hand-in: Well done, <name>!Now that the path is open we can begin our journey to Val'sharah.
Title: The Archon's Answer

Description: Your cleansing is complete, and you are whole.

Our plan was a success. Undergoing such a rite, so soon after your arrival, has attracted Kalisthene's attention once more. 

Now is our opportunity to request an audience with the Archon.

Stand before her and be proud of what you have accomplished. No matter what happens now, you have done all that any aspirant could hope to.

 Quest Hand-in: You are worthy of Bastion's grace, <name>. May it serve you well.
Title: Return to Argus

Description: The gryphon master in Goldshire is Bartlett.  If you've spoken to him before, then you can take one of my gryphons to him.

That's a good lesson to know: gryphons are always trained to fly to their capital city, but they'll only take you to a remote gryphon master after you've already been there.

You've already been to Bartlett, so just speak with me again when you're ready to take a gryphon to Goldshire.  Once there, you can deliver Osric's Crate to Smith Argus.

 Quest Hand-in: Great, you brought the armor!  We'll get this divvied to those who need it immediately.Thank you, <name>.  Your efforts have been a great help to us.  And now that you're no stranger to gryphons, I hope you'll come and lend your aid to Goldshire often!
Title: Plans and Preparations

Description: Your weapon is stronger than ever, but it will need many more souls in order to reach its true potential.

Siouxsie has been collecting reports from the scouts, she will direct you to our enemies and their screaming souls will empower your weapon further.

 Quest Hand-in: Deathlord, I've prepared a brief report on all we've discovered about this new land.You should find it quite interesting.
Title: The Defense of Tian Monastery

Description: Chen's recent report indicates that Tian Monastery is under attack!

{name}, they need your help. Go speak to Tak-Tak west of the main temple. He can get you there quickly.

 Quest Hand-in: I did not expect the Grandmaster himself! Your strength will help us turn the tide. We cannot let these demons succeed!
Title: Informing the Queen

Description: <The dragon steward pulls your letter of introduction out of his sleeve.>

Yes... yes, I think that you are ready to see the queen now.

When you are ready, speak to me again and I will see to it that one of these drakes delivers you safely to the top of the temple. You will need to present your letter in person to Queen Alexstrasza.

 Quest Hand-in: You are very courageous to bring us this information. I was beginning to wonder why the blue dragonflight had so boldly initiated an attack upon the temple itself. Now we know that they are using enormous amounts of the very magic they view as such a threat to Azeroth.<The queen shakes her head in seeming resignation.>Hypocritical, but so be it. If Malygos will not come to his senses, we have no choice but to take action in response to their assault.
Title: An Important Mission

Description: Champion! I bear an urgent message from Danath Trollbane.

He requests that you join him at Krasus' Landing. He has an urgent mission that requires your expertise!

 Quest Hand-in: I am relieved you survived the Broken Shore when so many brave heroes were lost.<Danath hangs his head in a moment of silence.>I have been recalled from Honor Hold to aid the Alliance in its darkest hour. It is crucial that we learn from our mistakes.Do you have time to speak?
Title: Orgrim's Hammer

Description: The Argent Crusade pulled my ravaged body from the Broken Front. What a glorious battle, {race}. My axe sang as it cut down Alliance filth and Scourge alike.

My time is over. It will be a good death. Carry a message for me, soldier.

Our base flies out of reach of Scourge - overhead between Mord'rethar and Aldur'thar. It is called "Orgrim's Hammer."

<Hork futilely attempts to salute.>

Fly high and avoid the Alliance juggernaut, Skybreaker. Tell Korm... tell him I died... fighting... For the Horde.

 Quest Hand-in: <Korm salutes.>Damn the Scourge and damn the Alliance! Hork was one of our best. We will have our revenge. For Hellscream and for the Horde!
Title: Jewelcrafting Special Order:  A Yellow Brighter Than Gold

Description: We've been commissioned to make a gold bracelet, set with a taladite crystal "even brighter than gold". I can handle the metal work, but the crystal isn't something I can do.

 Quest Hand-in: This is beautiful.
Title: A Nose for Ptrouble

Description: Ah, yes, I was wondering when you would come to check on your little one.

As you have likely noticed, he is not here. Little ones are very curious and often seek to leave the nest before they are ready. It is often the brooding mother's job to keep them from wandering.

What, did you think I was going to stop him?

<Wingminder Goja laughs.>

I heard some screeching to de west. Best hurry, or you may not have a hatchling to look after!

 Quest Hand-in: <Kua'fon makes a soft sound deep in his throat. He seems very pleased with himself.>
Title: Naxxramas and the Fall of Wintergarde

Description: Lord Fordragon has led a crushing assault against Arthas at the Wrathgate. In response to this affront, Arthas has sent Naxxramas down upon us. While Kel'Thuzad hides in the floating citadel, his ground commander, Thel'zan, lays siege to Wintergarde Keep. The lower village is already lost and any chance of extracting survivors from the ruins diminishes by the minute.

We must act quickly! Report to Gryphon Commander Urik at the gryphon station at once! He'll get you up to speed.

Leave me!


 Quest Hand-in: <Urik points to a gryphon.>Have you ever ridden one of those? It's simple, friend. Just hop on and tell it where to go.
Title: Jewel Of The Sewers

Description: Hard to believe that most people fish in the Dalaran Sewers for giant rats and mutated fish.  Especially when those waters are filled with priceless jewelry - discarded by broken hearted fools, thieves, and careless drunks.

The trick is to let your hook drag the bottom and don't pull up too hard when you get something.  Try it out, {name}.  I'd be willing to trade whatever you find for a few trinkets of my own.

 Quest Hand-in: Well now, that looks like it could be valuable.  Difficult to know until it's cleaned up and appraised, but I'm still willing to make the trade if you are.
Title: Children of a Turtle God

Description: Volcanoth is the turtle god in the cave that these primitives worship.

It's not really a god.

<Hobart rolls his eyes.>

But it is tough enough that I'm going to have to devise a new weapon for you from the one functioning boot we have left.

I think that the age-old motto of "fight fire with fire" applies here. Plus, I like fire!

Let's get some fire glands from Volcanoth's children. That should give me time to modify the rocket boot into something more fitting.

 Quest Hand-in: Careful with those glands, <name>, careful!And now to load them into the refashioned shredder boot. I'm certain that you'll be surprised and amazed by my genius invention.
Title: Find OOX-09/HL!

Description: You have uncovered some sort of strange, egg-shaped device made from metal.  Fiddling with one of its knobs springs the egg to life, as it opens up into some sort of gnomish robotic contraption!  A voice from inside the robotic egg crackles to life.

"My name's Oglethorpe Obnoticus, and my homing robot has crashed!  I will reward you for its recovery; please take this beacon to the robot!"

"I now have computed the coordinates of the robot for you; it crashed at the head of the river near Skulk Rock!"

 Quest Hand-in: You place the egg... distress beacon... inside the chicken... homing robot.Hums and whirs are heard from inside the robot as it struggles to stand up.  After the robot comes to life, Oglethorpe's voice is heard once more, but now from inside the robot:"OOX-09/HL is working at least, but it needs major repairs!  It is much too heavy for you to carry it... but I think I have an idea.  Are you up for watching over it some more?"
Title: Go to the Front

Description: Well, {name}, I hope you're prepared for the next phase of our operation. The Legion never rests - and neither shall we! Take a gryphon and fly over to Honor Point - it's a small post near the Legion Front. 

Speak with Field Marshal Brock. He'll have instructions for you when you arrive. Oh, and tell that pasty-faced shield-kisser I said 'hello'.  


 Quest Hand-in: Well met, <class>. I'm glad that crusty old dwarf finally saw fit to send us some help!
Title: Descent

Description: What has transpired! That is to say, what has transpired?! Yes, that is the appropriate response, is it not?

I find our circumstances enthralling! Yet, tragic.

I prattle on... Yes, Lor'themar asked me to send you to him at once. He is in need of your expertise, {name}.

I'll lower you down the falls safely. Good luck!

 Quest Hand-in: We have already suffered great losses, <name>. Let us work together to prevent even more.
Title: WANTED: Rindlewoe

Description: A monstrous beast of wood and flesh has been terrorizing the nearby river territories. Knowing more about how the creature fights may yield interesting data!

Please report any and all findings to Suzie Boltwrench in Krazzlefrazz.

 Quest Hand-in: Hey! You got some great data off that monster.Here's a little somethin' for being such a great research assistant.
Title: Joining the Fight

Description: Lao-Chin's archers will need these arrows down at the bridge. Can you bring them?

 Quest Hand-in: Taran Zhu told me what became of my camp. I would have stopped it if I could, but the attacks from the bridge have not let up.Thank you for bringing these arrows - my archers will make good use of them.
Title: The Call of the Pack

Description: <Matoclaw continues:>

The easternmost portal of flame is the domain of Lylagar. Stand before the portal, deliver a challenging howl, and then force the fiery beast to submit.

 Quest Hand-in: I heard your triumphant cries echo across the mountain cliffs.I also heard Lylagar utter a... different type of cry.
Title: Gathering Idols

Description: Recently, just before the troggs surfaced within the site, we had uncovered a large number of strange, carved idols. But we didn't have the chance to study them, for soon after their discovery the troggs chased us away from the ruins! And those idols have a strange effect on the troggs. It makes them go berserk!

Bring me 8 idols - I want to study them, and I want them out of trogg hands!  You can find the idols on the troggs infesting the site.

 Quest Hand-in: You got them!  Nicely done, <name>!And you don't look too worse for wear, even with those berserk troggs about.  I'm going to keep my eye on you...you show some promise.
Title: Call to Arms: Zuldazar

Description: We're getting reports of increased Alliance activity within Zuldazar. Head over there and clear them out.

 Quest Hand-in: Good work, <class>.
Title: Welcome to the Darkmoon Races

Description: So this is your first race, eh? Don't worry - it's easier than it looks. Let me break it down for you...

Run through that big  banner there. That starts everything. Then, follow the smaller banners until you see a big, blue Post. Hit that, then return here.

You're scored on your time, so finish as fast as you can! And watch out for those electrified tripwires. They'll slow you down if you run through them. Good luck!

 Quest Hand-in: You made it! This is just a practice race so your time doesn't matter... other than bragging rights.Time to try the real race!
Title: Doing it the Hard Way

Description: Blast it all!

Someone's gone and corrupted the entire system! There be no way fer me ta access the main repository from this console.

We're gunna hafta do this the hard way, lad. I hope you an' yer friends here are up to a fight.

There be four guardians on the upper level of this place. I won't be able ta utilize these discs 'til they be... uhh, offline, shall we say.

 Quest Hand-in: Arrite, then.Let's deposit these discs and be done with this!
Title: Return More Lost Souls

Description: Maw Walker, we must do more to cut off the Jailer's power and deny him any more souls. 

Return to the Maw and rescue any more that you can.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent, Maw Walker. Our armies here will continue to grow stronger with each soul you return.
Title: Elekk Training: The Garn

Description: I've got one last challenge for ye, commander, but if it isn't a doozy.

They call them the garn. Wolves as black as night, and twice the size of a normal wolf, they can tear a man apart in seconds. Any beast in their right mind would be scared witless at the sight of such a predator.

There's a lone garn that's made it from their usual home in Frostfire, all the way over to Nagrand. Take your elekk, mount up, and bring it down. If the two of you survive, your elekk will truly be ready.

 Quest Hand-in: A fine beast, to be sure, commander. It'll stand up in even the toughest battles.I'll admit, I'm a bit jealous of ye'! Here's the reins! I'll be sure to take good care of it when ye bring it back.
Title: Hidden Amongst the Leaves

Description: When the Horde invaded, I did my best to thwart them but it is unknown how many forces have made passage already. This wall will slow them down, but it will not halt their attack entirely. 

<Malfurion's ears perk.>

Do you hear that, hero? The Ancients call to us!

We must protect them at all costs, {name}! They see what our eyes cannot see, and hear what our ears cannot perceive.

I have druids in the Twilight Vale. Find them. Send them to the Grove of the Ancients. I will reinforce the wall.

 Quest Hand-in: Elune be praised!
Title: Westward Bound

Description: Captain Garrick wants us tae search west o' camp fer any other members of the expedition.

Alaria and I will go on ahead. Meet us tae the west and we'll see what we can find.

 Quest Hand-in: A giant pit of spiders right on our doorstep! Aren't we the lucky ones?
Title: The Council's Call

Description: I'm sorry that I haven't kept your apprised of the situation. We needed more actionable information before bringing the matter before you.

The Council of the Six has been investigating Legion threats outside of the Broken Shore. I believe this scroll to be the final piece of information we need.
