Meet me in Dalaran at the Violet Citadel. We will need the other members of the Council.

 Quest Hand-in: <Khadgar gives you a knowing nod.>I'm glad you came, Huntmaster.
Title: Champions of the Mogu

Description: These lesser clans warring with each other in the Vale need to be taught their place.

Seek out their champions and eliminate them. Show them that only the Rajani have rightful claim here!

 Quest Hand-in: The wayward clans should learn that such fate awaits all that would oppose the Rajani.Take your reward, outsider. We are done here.
Title: Ogre Abduction

Description: This is neither a crude ogre trinket, nor an ancient relic made by my kind. Its specific construction is new to me...and this fact disturbs me greatly.

The wolf-girl will be sending you to Dire Maul soon, to fight the Gordok elite. They are the leaders of the Gordunni, and would know who is supplying these.

Take the orb back, I've cast a few enchantments on it. Hold it up in front of a weakened Gordok ogre, and once you've captured him, bring it back here.

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, you've brought him. Now I merely have to suffer the fate of speaking to him.
Title: The Snackrifice

Description: They took my grummles! Hozen don't eat grummles, but yeti do. And the Knucklethumps have a yeti.

Please rescue my grummles. Cut them down or let them out of cages. Rescue them any way you can.

Many fortunes and rewards if you do this.

 Quest Hand-in: Today is a day of many good and bad fortunes. Bad fortune that hozen stole my grummles. Good fortune that my <race> saves my grummles. Bad fortune that so many hozen must die to learn lesson. Good fortune that humans are luckydos and know how to fight.Grummles are not fighters. We carry, we explore, and we are content.
Title: An End And A Beginning

Description: Every good story has a beginning and an ending, {name}. While your story is far from over, I'll be damned if it's not already turning out to be the stuff of legend! No matter what happens to us when this is all over, what you've done at Wintergarde will be a tale told for years to come.

Now, ally, when you are ready I will use the phylactery to coax Thel'zan out of hiding.

Should we somehow succeed, report the victory to High Commander Halford Wyrmbane at Wintergarde Keep.

 Quest Hand-in: Wintergarde is saved because of you, <name>. To think that one man could so swiftly turn the tides of battle is hard for most to comprehend; yet here we are - victorious! You have managed to restore the faith of these people and earned the respect of your commanding officers. Lord Fordragon has returned to Angrathar to prepare our forces for the destruction of the Wrathgate and has requested that you join him! I couldn't recommend a better soldier for the job, <name>.
Title: Fake Gold for Black Gold

Description: Now that the "gold" is ready, I want you to take it up to Khan Blizh. He'll be so overwhelmed, I bet he'll offer to help us setup the drilling rigs. We could use the horsepower.

Haha, get it? Horsepower?

 Quest Hand-in: Just put it down on the ground, <race>.
Title: Bolas and Birds

Description: Up in the mountains we know the value of a good hunting companion. We use bolas to shoot down our flying prey, then our retrievers go and bring us our kill!

You want to take a shot? Nickel can accompany you. Shoot down some of the falcons in the woods. My dog will finish the job.

 Quest Hand-in: There's nothing like man and beast working together for a clean hunt!
Title: The Trial at the Temple

Description: My staff was strong and mighty without peer, but since I not its master, in time it would soon disappear.

The staff was a gift from the Jade Serpent, Yu'lon, but for only a single task. With my work finished, to her again it has passed.

Yu'lon be the staff's keeper, holding it for those who are blessed. To her we now go now, to announce your request.

 Quest Hand-in: I knew you'd succeed, <name>. I'm honored to be at your service.
Title: An Honest Heart

Description: If we are to defeat Vorath, we need to amplify the power of the ranseur. But we will not cut corners or impose our will to do it. That lesson has been learned.

However, the kyrian of Bastion are masters of ushering souls to their proper places. Perhaps they would lend a fragment of their power to our cause.

Go to Bastion, and find a way to empower the ranseur.

 Quest Hand-in: I suppose if one happened to die, this wouldn't be such a bad place to end up.This kyrian says he will help us.
Title: Our Last Option

Description: Zovaal has blocked our pursuit. If we are to defeat him, we must find a way to withstand Domination.

But to overcome it, we need to understand how it works. 

The Primus of Maldraxxus created Domination, he will be able to tell us more.

I asked Taelia to bring a piece of the Helm of Domination to Zereth Mortis. I dread to think of what might happen were I to try to carry it again... 

Let us discuss the way forward.

 Quest Hand-in: I don't like this as an option any more than Taelia does, but we need to wield Domination safely if we are to find a way to overcome it.Our first step is to ensure that the helm still works. On us.
Title: Naga of the Strand

Description: There is evil lurking on the coast to the west.

The Zoram Strand is the resting place of the doomed city of Zoram, destroyed during the Sundering and submerged beneath the seas. It has been lost to the night elves for ages. Lost, and nearly forgotten.

Now, the naga have returned, and for what reason we do not know. But reason matters little; we must slay these fiends and throw them back to the depths!

 Quest Hand-in: Very well done, <name>. Your actions in the Zoram Strand against the naga are commendable.I know your feat was not easily accomplished, for the strength and guile of the naga is well known to the night elves. We know this, for we share a history with them.The naga are cursed Highborne night elves. Ten thousand years ago, Queen Azshara made a pact of desperation with the Old Gods to save her surviving people from a watery grave.The naga are the result of that pact.
Title: Damsels and Dragons

Description: What ho, squire {name}! Forgive my lips, as they bear gravest news. Dragons have taken up stinking residence within the hallowed halls of Blackrock Spire!

These great wyrms hold a distressed damsel in their scaly graspers. Her name is Zaela, they say. Such a beautiful name!

As my squire, it is your Light-given duty to adventure yourself into this spire and procure evidence of these dragons, lest I waste my heroism on a dragonless quest.

 Quest Hand-in: This is dire evidence indeed! I shall head there presently, to slay no less than twenty of the great beasts.For Doloria!
Title: Gnome Improvement

Description: Listen {name}, that ring is yours, sure... but I can make you a better one!  That design, like I said, is really simple.  I am a lot more skilled now, and for the mere fee of thirty silver coins I'll spruce it up for you!  Well, a little more than thirty, actually...

I'm in a tight spot right now; all my material stock is all dried up.  If you bring me a bar of silver and a moss agate, I'll add a silver and agate lattice to the ring that will give it a little more pizzazz!

Trust me!

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, exactly what I needed!  Someday, when I find myself out of this hole that I am unjustly in, I will make for you, for EVERYONE the finest trinkets in all of Azeroth!  Until then, thanks for being a sport about the reagents.  I'd normally charge ten times what I have charged you for a ring of this quality...Speaking of rings, here's your new one!
Title: Cursed, But Convenient

Description: I need you to return to Azsuna at once, {name}. I've only just heard of an enchantress within the Crumbled Palace who knows of many rare enchantments.

Go to her and see what you can learn at once.

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, a fellow enchanter. Come to earn the marks of my subordinates, have you?If that's the case, then you may speak with my sentinel and druid. Earn their trust and they'll grant you their marks.I, however, have a different task for you...
Title: The Ember Court

Description: Prince Renathal is prepared to host this week's Ember Court whenever you're ready, Maw Walker.

Be sure to talk to the rest of the staff to finalize the guest list and amenities before we open the court.

Remember, we're trying to impress the guests and convince them that we know what we're doing, so make sure you choose amenities that'll make the guests happy!

Talk to Lady Ilinca if you have any questions about guests.

Once everything's ready, talk to me and I'll open the court!

 Quest Hand-in: Now THAT was a court to remember!How are you going to top that next week?
Title: Return to Mardum

Description: The gateway is fully functional, {name}. Ooh, I am positively tingling with excitement!

Do let Jace and the others know that we eagerly await your arrival. There's so much to do and ever so little time.

You will be joining us aboard, won't you?

 Quest Hand-in: This citadel was one of the Legion's most valuable assets - it will serve us well.
Title: This Is Retribution

Description: Anger seethes within me like smoldering coals.

One stoke, and that anger will flare into a roaring flame.

The Legion's attack on Exodar was just the motivation I needed, Highlord. I've watched my brethren die for the last time.

Now, I will be the one who does the killing. I WILL have justice! Help me, Highlord, and slay any demons you encounter in lower Faronaar.

 Quest Hand-in: Glorious.
Title: Follow the Recipe

Description: This seems to be part of a recipe for whatever concoction the Crown Chemical Company is cooking up. The other parts must be nearby.

 Quest Hand-in: Aha! With this we can start on an antidote for this awful mixture. Thank you for bringing this to me.
Title: Gaze of the Loa: Krag'wa

Description: Hello again, small one.

I see Talanji has chosen a worthy witness. I must test Talanji's willingness to sacrifice for her people. I will weigh her commitment to defending the weak. Many great rulers have failed this challenge and still gone on to make powerful monarchs.

But the most beloved, those that find themselves surrounded by loyal followers, always understand the value of devotion to their people.

You will help me with this trial. Speak to me when you are ready to begin.

 Quest Hand-in: I would allow no harm to come to you, <name>. Fortunately for you, an intervention was not needed.
Title: Treasures of the Thunder King

Description: My scouts have returned with word that more of the treasures from Lei Shen's tomb are being brought up into the citadel. We have access to a secret sewer entrance, but a door bars us from intercepting the shipment. If we're going to succeed in this raid, we will need a key that only the most trusted of Lei Shen's forces carry.

If you get your hands on such a key, bring it to me.

You can keep whatever spoils you steal from our raid. I simply want to see that this shipment never makes it to Lei Shen.

 Quest Hand-in: Not entirely unsuccessful. Still, we'll do better next time.Thanks for providing us with that key. The raid would not have gone off without you.
Title: Head Games

Description: <Kurzel rips a long strip of material from her blouse and hands it to you.>

Here, {race}, take this. Dip it in the remains of Novos the Summoner.

We're going to figure out what makes the Scourge leaders tick.

 Quest Hand-in: Hopefully we can find somebody willing to examine this sample.
Title: The Rotting Orchard

Description: The worgen infestation stretches further than Brightwood Grove. To the south, on the very edges of Darkshire itself, the Rotting Orchard is host to even more of the savage beasts.

The worgen there are more cunning, {name}, but just as savage and evil. They conjure foul shadows to tear their enemies apart from a distance. Go to the Rotting Orchard, and slay the Shadow Weavers to keep the town safe!

 Quest Hand-in: You performed well against the Shadow Weavers, <name>. But even now, years after their first arrival, there seem to be so many to replace the ones we kill.I will put my faith in Master Carevin. No doubt he will get to the bottom of the problem.
Title: Blackout

Description: The large hall at the top of Dun Argol houses the power source for the entire area. If you can destroy the power core, it will cripple Dun Argol for some time.

No power means no golems, no sentries, and no more lightning armaments.

When we were sent up here, they told us these explosives were for excavation, but thanks to Iron Thane Furyhammer, the research has been scrapped. We may as well get some use out of them, though. They're the only thing we have on hand capable of destroying the power core.

 Quest Hand-in: <Raegar nods approvingly.>I can't stand to see explosives go to waste and it'll set our enemies back for sure.
Title: Forget Her Not

Description: The staff was made with the bough of a world tree, so the receptacle that the soul is transferred to needs to be comparable. Within the adverse conditions of Vakthros there may be a flower that is tenacious enough to grow.

However, it will be fragile given the circumstances. Find it, and then bring it to one of the green dragonflight's groves to help strengthen it.

 Quest Hand-in: The flower only grows in specific conditions and due to that it contains quite a bit of magical energy. This should be a perfect conduit for Tarecgosa.
Title: Alpaca It Up

Description: <Sniffs curiously in the general direction of your backpack, eyeing it intently.>

 Quest Hand-in: <Munches enthusiastically on the Gersahl greens, while humming gleefully.>
Title: Relics of the Four Kings

Description: The mogu have reawakened and are a threat to all of Pandaria. They are on the cusp of becoming even more dangerous.

There are four great mogu kings of legend: Zian of the Endless Shadow, Meng the Demented, Qiang the Merciless, and Subetai the Swift. Four artifacts of these kings are secreted away in the Vault of Kings Past, below.

You must retrieve these relics before the mogu discover them and become unstoppable.

 Quest Hand-in: I will find a better hiding place for the four relics.Pandaria is indebted to you, <name>.
Title: Who's a Big Troll?

Description: <The skull speaks once more.>

My soul is ready, but my body is not.  The Bloodscalps desecrated my old body long ago.  The horrors that they inflicted upon me... my spirit watched on while they tore my body apart and, and... I can't go on.

Their chief, Gan'zulah, presided over the gruesome acts.  In fact, if memory serves, he was a strong, powerful troll... about the same size as I was.  What a fine coincidence.

You know what to do, {race}.  Make it quick.

 Quest Hand-in: You have done well, <race>.  Only one more step remains before I may return.
Title: The Mine Sweeper

Description: <One of the goblin flamethrowers. Unfortunately the tank has been cracked. It would be a good idea to bring it back to Felecia, she might have something to fix it up.>

 Quest Hand-in: A flamethrower!? This could be quite useful, but why couldn't you find one in better shape?
Title: Fallen Effects

Description: <You wrap Sheridon's effects into a bundle, and place them in your pack to return to the camp members.>

 Quest Hand-in: Oh... Sheridon... He bought our lives with his own. I... I will make sure his family gets these.I'll mark the location of his body, we'll have Rupert retrieve it so he can have a proper burial.Thank you. Please, have this.
Title: Silver Victory

Description: The harder we beat our enemies, the less quickly they'll return.

 Quest Hand-in: The was a good fight, Commander. It might give me time to clean my sword.And honor our fallen.
Title: A Man Named Godfrey

Description: Lord Vincent Godfrey spent his life defending the kingdom of Gilneas. When the worgen curse ravaged this land, Godfrey was one of the first Gilneans to take up arms against the beasts. It is said that upon discovering that his king was afflicted by the curse, Godfrey took his own life. He would rather be dead than serve the very creatures that he had defended his home against.

We are going to give him a second chance, {name}. Together we will battle southeast towards Tempest's Reach to collect his corpse.

 Quest Hand-in: Here we are, <name>. He is a little rotted, but no worse for the wear. We must hurry before the Alliance finds us!
Title: Cause for Concern

Description: Shadowmaster O'Flannerty's behavior was unusual.

His repeated mutterings about "shadow magic" and "void apocalypses" and "ancient creatures hungering for the souls of the living" certainly warrant further investigation.

You should report back to Saralara Fizzlesprang.

 Quest Hand-in: <She listens to your report.>Hmm. Yes. I think I know what's going on. It looks like we're going to have to solve this problem with science.
Title: Into Anguish

Description: Rulkan's gift to you, the Fragment of Anguish, will allow you to pass into the fortress unhindered. Go up these stairs to the doorway, then use the fragment to enter the compound.

Once you are inside, you will find three altars powering the magical barrier around their stronghold.

Destroy these runes, and Yrel and I will be able to join you in finding Ner'zhul.

 Quest Hand-in: <You hear Prophet Velen's voice in your mind.>Good work, <name>! The barriers are down. We are on our way.
Title: Seek and Destroy

Description: <The Banshee Queen's voice invades your thoughts once more.>

Search the nearby farmhouses for Alliance stragglers. Keep an eye out for any information that could lead us to Crowley and Bloodfang. Seek and destroy all that would stand in your way, {name}!

 Quest Hand-in: <The Banshee Queen's words float in your head.>This book documents a recent meeting with Ivus Bloodfang. The location mentioned is the Deep Elem Mine. I know of this place. It has only one entrance.We shall corner and crush them!
Title: Rezan, Loa of Kings

Description: Rezan be a powerful loa, one of great importance ta da Zandalari.

We need ta rescue him... but dis creature be projectin' a barrier of death. Notin' be gettin' in.

Unless... I be usin' me own anima ta shield ya from its magic.

Ya gotta act fast and kill da monster dat be drainin' Rezan. Me anima not gonna last forever.

Say da word when ya ready ta go.

 Quest Hand-in: Me be feelin' Rezan's essence inside of me... he be trustin' me wit' a great gift.No matter what be comin' next, me not gonna let him down.
Title: A Righteous Sermon

Description: Godfrey Goodard, once a righteous man and mayor of Wintergarde, is now an agent of the Scourge. His transformation from man to undying ghoul has taken place slowly, over time. He hears the call of the Lich King now and lives only to serve his master.

But as with all Scourge, Godfrey knows the language of death and with proper motivation, will tell us what we need to know about the tome.

Once you hear what you need to hear, return to the High Commander at the front lines. I'll clean up here as needed.

 Quest Hand-in: We should have known about the damned mausoleum. This is preposterous! Duke August Foehammer and Ambo Cash will be dispatched to the front lines in preparation for our next assault.Once you have cleared the mines I will send you to Foehammer so that we may begin our attack against the Scourge of Naxxramas!The information you have garnered thus far will be sent to Lord Fordragon at the Wrathgate upon the wings of our most able gryphon!
Title: Ulfar's Guidance

Description: There is one who may know how to dispel the curse from Gweyir.

In the mountains of Drustvar lives Ulfar, an ancient Thornspeaker who sided with the humans of Kul Tiras against his fellow Drust.

Journey to his den and ask for his wisdom. He may hold the answers you seek.

Lord Herne and I will tend to Gweyir once she arrives with Ara'lon.

 Quest Hand-in: You have come from beyond the veil to seek my wisdom? A long journey indeed...
Title: Scales of the Earth

Description: While leather armor is strong on its own, integrating scales into the design is what truly sets it apart.

The type of scales you use will determine how many you'll need to fully protect the wearer. And one of the strongest type of scales are basilisk scales.

A fully matured basilisk has the strongest of course. Near the village of Llothien is a basilisk den. Kill the matriarch and return her scales to me.

 Quest Hand-in: The basilisk scale is thick. Even a thinned version of this is enough to repel any sword or spear attack.That strength is what makes these scales so valuable to our craft.
Title: Power Problems

Description: Rozzy, part of the extraction crew, headed out with some gear to work on a plan to keep these reconfigulators all charged up.

Go see see if she could use some help!

 Quest Hand-in: If Merd wants you to help, I've got just the thing!
Title: Big Hunter Mon

Description: In these valleys, the Mon be kepin' beasts alive only to serve as sport. For his entertainment.

The lives of others not be so cheap. Even the smallest creature can cause a whole lotta trouble. The Mon gonna be learnin' to respect that.

I think this be a good time to teach this Big Hunter Mon a lesson, don't you? Be you my faithful messenger?

 Quest Hand-in: Haha! Well done, richmon. It gonna take that Big Hunter Mon weeks to get de smell outta his ammo stores. Not to mention his feet. You have earned my favor.
Title: Runeforging: Preparation For Battle

Description: The mark of war is etched indelibly upon your soul, death knight. You have learned the dark art of runeforging and with it you will engrave runes of power upon your weaponry.

Preparations for battle must be made. Return to one of the runeforges, here in the Heart of Acherus, and use the power of runeforging to emblazon your weapon with a rune of power!

Return to me when your blade glows with dark energy!

 Quest Hand-in: Remember these words, <class>: The Runeforge is a Scourge instrument. It exists only in Acherus, Naxxramas and the heart of Icecrown! You may only emblazon your weaponry at a Runeforge.Return often and emblazon all of your weapons. A <class> must be prepared for all that would dare oppose him!
Title: Imbeciles Abound!

Description: The shipment from New Agamand was to arrive at Venomspite last week and then be delivered to me after some simple field tests. It is a Horde imperative - the last piece of the "victory puzzle."

<Sintar sighs.>

It is quite disheartening to know that you are surrounded by imbeciles and incompetent boobs!

You must travel to Venomspite, near the eastern border of Dragonblight. Find that buffoon, Middleton, and let him know that I am waiting on the package.

 Quest Hand-in: We ran into a little - MINOR - problem. Everyone that tried handling the blight vaporized. We're working on adjusting the formula a tad so it doesn't instantly kill you for looking at it sideways. The good news is that I think I've almost got it!
Title: Putting Olakin Back Together Again

Description: We can't afford to waste any time putting Olakin back together. Fortunately, the Scourge has provided a perfect place for you to stitch him back together.

Near the Fleshwerks' flesh giant lab is the Sanctum of Reanimation. Search the area for a spool of thread and the doctor's cleaver. Then, take Olakin's remains to the large slab in the middle of the sanctum and get to work.

 Quest Hand-in: Olakin should consider himself fortunate. No one is rescued from the Scourge, no one. No amount of thread and heroism will save him a second time. I'll make certain he remembers it.
Title: Bounty: A Few Snapdragons

Description: Snapdragons are one of the most dangerous species on Nazjatar. The naga breed them for the viciousness and their ability as trackers.

If we hope to keep our positions hidden from the naga, we must take out these groups of snapdragons immediately.

After you are done, report to the quartermaster to claim your reward.

 Quest Hand-in: This will ease our efforts in Nazjatar.
Title: A Bitter Pill to Swallow

Description: <The corpse of a single cave swallow rests on the cavern floor. You should tell Cinnam.>

 Quest Hand-in: Who cares about dead swallows now? Effie is missing!
Title: The Deed is Done

Description: Prince Wrathion will be pleased to hear that you've succeeded. You should report back to him at Ravenholdt Manor.

The Prince has been known to be extremely generous to those who help him. 

 Quest Hand-in: That's wonderful news, <name>. Creed was not the most powerful of the remaining black dragons, but his manipulation of the Gilneans was truly diabolical.I've prepared a reward for you. These blades may not look like much at present, but in the right hands they may yet awaken.Perhaps in YOUR hands...
Title: Sky Ablaze With Cannonfire

Description: Oh! It's me! And {name}, was it? I remember this!

I seem to have found myself in the middle of a battle between the Horde and the Alliance, which wouldn't USUALLY be a big deal, except for that enormous cannon that seems to be trained on me anytime I try to fly away.

Think you could take it out for me?

 Quest Hand-in: You did it! Now hurry along... if I remember this correctly, you don't have much time left!
Title: Fury Given Voice

Description: I will answer this attack upon my val'kyr with relentless fury!

You have a vital role to play in this, {class}. You will muster the courage that you have demonstrated this day to lure my Eye to battle.

But first, a simpler task ... the creation of the horn that will summon my wrath. Master Smith Helgar will guide you.

 Quest Hand-in: This is well made, <name>.Of course, every great horn has a name. It is our tradition!
Title: The Valiant's Charge

Description: In your training as a valiant, you'll have the chance to test your skills against valiants representing other cities. Although a valiant's battles are not a formal part of the competition, you will learn valuable lessons about the fighting styles and weaknesses of your opponents.

The valiants are a spirited lot, competing amongst themselves for honor and notoriety.

Train as a valiant until you are confident of your ability to best all who face you, then bring me the seals you have earned.

 Quest Hand-in: Impressive, valiant. I will make the arrangements for your test immediately.
Title: Ages-Echoing Wisdom

Description: Hmph. Even if I wanted to give her weapons, I cannot. My glade is under attack!

Most of my people were driven out during the attack on the growthworks but a few of the elders stayed behind. Whether to delay the enemy or see the friends to safety, they are not here where it is safe.

Each elder can perform extraordinary works and could make the weapons in no time at all. Rescue the elders and then we'll talk about using their talents for the good of Ardenweald.

 Quest Hand-in: Good! I am glad you found them alive. Of course, we will be unable to put them to work until the threat is dealt with and they are able to continue their crafts in peace. I'm sure Sorcha will understand.
Title: The Soul Contact

Description: Your reputation precedes you, Maw Walker... braving the Maw and bringing Baron Mograine back in one piece...

That was most impressive!

With our dire shortage of souls, we'll need you to do that again. Bring us more willing souls so we can restore this sanctum's power!

Seek out the broker who aided you before and ask if she will do so again. You may need her.

 Quest Hand-in: Back again so soon, Maw Walker?
Title: Lovesick and Lost

Description: Ugh. My head. My HEART.

Feels like a good hangover and a bad breakup put together.

On the bright side, I think I know where we are. And where that ship was headed.

Freehold.

It's a... free town. For, uh... free folk. The only rule is that there are no rules. Lotta guys with peg legs and eye patches and exotic pets. Catch my drift?

There's a trail through the hills that'll take us there. Pretty sure I remember the way...

Let's get moving. Gotta walk off that damn siren's witchery.

 Quest Hand-in: Told you I knew how to find it!
Title: Heat That Just Don't Quit

Description: We smith, we smelt, we roast up whatever spider meat we can get.  Bush chicken if we're lucky.  Point is, all o' this work means we need lots and lots of fire.

Good thing we're smack dab in the middle of firetown.

O' course, the best fire comes from the elementals.  You'll find 'em all over Searing Gorge, but always near lava.  Here, take these flasks and use 'em on the elementals.

Oh, did I mention the elementals gotta be alive when you gather your sample?

 Quest Hand-in: Yeeeeeeowch!  Don't just go puttin' this stuff into a dwarf's open hand.  This stuff is burnin' up!Now me hands are gonna get even more swollen...
Title: Elemental Bonds: The Vow

Description: Before he passed through the portal to Mount Hyjal, Thrall asked you to follow him. There is something he would like you to witness.

 Quest Hand-in: Thanks to you, my friend - I live again! And due to the combined efforts of the Cenarion Circle and the Earthen Ring - the World Tree will bring new life to Azeroth as well.While Deathwing and the rest of our foes remain to be dealt with, I wish to share something with you.
Title: The Trial of Faith

Description: No Exarch trial is complete without a holy pilgrimage to the sacred resting place of our fallen champions.

On the way, I ask that you take Vindicator Maraad's ashes and lay them to rest within the hallowed halls of Auchindoun.

There, the spirits of our fallen ancestors will test Yrel's greatest weakness.

Good luck.

 Quest Hand-in: It seems you have been successful in your journey.How do I know this? If you had not passed the challenge of the ancestors, you would not have returned at all.
Title: Avenge Me!

Description: I hear them, brother....

The moans of the wounded Alliance... they taunt me...

Finish what we have begun here, {class}. Show no mercy... let none of them survive.

For... the Horde...

 Quest Hand-in: The time of tolerance for the Alliance has passed, <name>.They have earned our hatred! They shall live in fear of the Horde until they no longer pollute our world!
Title: Cave Medicine

Description: It's good to see a friendly face.  Might be the last one I see.

One of those jormungar stung me with some sort of toxin before I managed to get away.  I can feel my whole body getting numb, mon.

I'm going to need a toxin gland to make an antidote.  I will also need some of the cave mushrooms that grow here... they'll slow the toxin down.

Hurry, please.  I don't have much time.  

 Quest Hand-in: I thank you, mon.  I might live another day now.
Title: Leystone Deposit Sample

Description: This ore looks like nothing you've seen before.

A mystical sheen moves through the metal in complex, unpredictable patterns. Your trainer in Dalaran would certainly like to see this.

 Quest Hand-in: It's so light. So pretty, too! Reminds me of elementium, a bit.If you see any more ore like this, try and strike it with the grain. You'll waste much less of it.
Title: Warning the Cenarion Circle

Description: The Cenarion Expedition has become a large organization with a good degree of autonomy.  These events are important enough that we need to warn the Cenarion Circle.

Do not worry, I will not ask you to travel back to Moonglade; we have emissaries as nearby as Hellfire Peninsula.

 Quest Hand-in: The news you bring about the naga activity in Zangarmarsh is dire.  Ysiel was wise in sending word to us.  She hasn't forgotten that the Expedition cannot exist without the Circle's support.
Title: Surrender or Else!

Description: {name}, you and Ace need to march those naga hatchlings down there and use them as leverage to convince the leader of the naga to surrender to us.

Ace knows where to go on the south side of the ruins... just follow him.

 Quest Hand-in: A faceless of the deep? What's that? That does NOT sound like a naga!Well, you killed it, whatever it was. It doesn't matter now. We have other fish to fry....
Title: Prismbreak

Description: If that prism of yours is tuned to refract a basilisk's gaze, we can use its crystal properties to reverse the process. All we need is a source of power.

In the weapons cabinet to your right, you'll find our prototype laser mining drill. I loved that thing but the near daily dismemberments got to be a real bother. Grab the laser drill and swap out the lens with that crystal of yours...

 Quest Hand-in: <You pop out the lens assembly and slide the crystal into place. The weapon hums ominously.>
Title: Champion's Vow

Description: You've made your pledge, {class}.  Now it is up to you to see it through.

Serve the Scale of the Sands well and you will be rewarded.  Fail and the timeline as we know it will be unravelled!

 Quest Hand-in: You've proved your worth, <race>.  Up to a certain point, at least.The favor of Nozdormu's prime mate is not obtained easily.
Title: You're Fired!

Description: Doomcryer did nothing to stop the revolt? How dare she! She has been trying to undermine my authority for some time. However, this time will be her last. You must summon her and deal with her personally.

Her anger guards hold the keys that summon her to Forge Camp: Anger. Retrieve the five keys and activate the five Legion obelisks. The obelisks have a short duration, so make sure they are all activated at the same time. Remember, the anger guards carry more keys.

 Quest Hand-in: That is great news, great news indeed, <name>. I could not have asked for a better outcome. Your service to our people is most greatly appreciated; choose one of the following heroic items.Your name will forever be remembered in our peoples' hearts.
Title: A Weapon of Old

Description: I've been studying the parchment Lady Lucille sent with you and have translated some of the older language. 

They called it "Liquid Fire" and it was used to "burn away the Drust". Using this as a basis I believe we can adapt it to our needs. This is a complex recipe, but it just so happens I have everything we need to make this potent alchemical weapon!

I will need your assistance in creating this. Would you be so kind as to help?

 Quest Hand-in: Wonderful! Smells a bit strong but I think it will burn those wooden constructs well! Now it's time to test it out.
Title: All that Rises

Description: <The voice of the ancient presses against your mind.>

NOW THAT... YOU HAVE STOLEN... THE ENERGIES OF... THE FAITHFUL, ENTER... THE TEMPLE AND... DESTROY... HALLAZEAL THE ASCENDED!

 Quest Hand-in: YOU HAVE DONE... MYSELF AND... THE TIDEHUNTER GREAT... SERVICE.
Title: Jandvik's Last Hope

Description: Commander Malt'his was conferring with a sea giant?

Without your help, this village will surely fall to the combined forces of the Sashj'tar and the sea giants.

<Toryl stands there quietly for a moment.>

Meet me in an underground cave out in Azuregale Bay.

I want to show you something that may turn the tide in this battle.

 Quest Hand-in: I do not know who you are, but I must thank you.
Title: The Deadliest of Poisons

Description: You've got the poison. Now it's time to take out that ogre. Gutgruk the Tough.

He usually patrols around their citadel. Probably looking for your expedition as we speak!

Poison your blades, then take that monster down.

 Quest Hand-in: We'll make sure Coulston Nereus is properly remembered for his sacrifice. It's a good thing that poison stopped the ogre... otherwise we would've been in trouble!
Title: Jango Spothide

Description: South of here is an area of Westfall known as the Dust Plains. From what we know the gnolls of the region have made the Dust Plains their unofficial capital. As with any capital, there exists a leader at the heart. If we are to put an end to these attacks, we must track down the gnoll in charge and end him.

Venture forth into the Dust Plains, find the gnoll leader, Jango Spothide, and kill him. Take out any other gnolls that get in your way.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent work, <name>. It will take the Riverpaw weeks to recover from the blow you just dealt. Please take an item of your choosing as a reward for what you have done.
Title: Gorgrom the Dragon-Eater

Description: We must show the ogres that we are not to be trifled with. We must send a message.

Travel to Boulder'mok and kill the ogres there. Make sure you keep their heads.

Then go to Gorgrom's altar and place the trap there for him. Gorgrom will appear, and you must lure him into the trap. When he is dead, mount your grisly totems near his corpse, so that the ogres may look at their fallen master and their fallen brothers, and know the price for seeking to destroy us.

 Quest Hand-in: Well done, <name>. Well done!I suspect we will hear little more from the ogres and their master.
Title: Undying Twilight

Description: The Twilight Cultists are here! They're trying to stop the ritual! Get to the back chambers and help fight them off!

 Quest Hand-in: The Twilight forces continue to stream in, but it looks like the Earthen Ring defenders can handle them.
Title: The Urn of Voices

Description: Vol'jamba does possess de Sight, and so even now he is taking precautions against us.

Regrettably his vision is incomplete. You will help me prepare for his demise and deal with his followers simultaneously. De tool you will use is called de Urn of Voices.

Take it and venture into Tal'gurub. Slay his followers, destroy their golems and masks. Their spirits, once released, will fill de urn.

Oh, and try not to die while holding it. De Urn of Voices is not discerning.

 Quest Hand-in: All according to plan. Do not worry for dem... dis was always their fate.
Title: A Giant's Feast

Description: The next giant on my list is called Negolash.  I remember vividly how he leapt from the seafoam and plucked poor Poop-Deck Paul from the crow's nest.

Swallowed him in one gulp, he did.  And snapped my mizzenmast in two on the way down.

No man on my crew deserves such a heinous death.  So we're going to use Negolash's appetite against him.  Kelsey Yance should be able to sell you some meat, and Whiskey Slim has enough booze to knock out... well, a sea giant.  You'll find both of them in town.

 Quest Hand-in: This wasn't expensive, was it?  Well, here's some pieces of eight to reimburse you.Now let's get onto this revenge, shall we?
Title: The Rear is Clear

Description: Excellent work, {name}! The rear is now officially clear. We'll take care of the stragglers. I want you to go back to Marshal McBride, standing in front of Northshire Abbey, south of here, and let him know that the goblin situation is under control.

Farewell, {class}.

 Quest Hand-in: With your help we have managed to secure the northern and western sectors of Northshire. We still have a rather large contingency of Blackrock orcs to the east and they've begun burning down the forest!
Title: Warchief's Command: Thousand Needles!

Description: All able bodied members of the Horde are hereby ordered to report to Nyse at Mudsprocket. Join the Horde forces fighting against the renegade Grimtotems who dominate the area.

Nyse will provide you with transportation to the front lines. She will be waiting for you at Mudsprocket's inn, tucked away in southern Dustwallow Marsh.

Destiny calls!

 Quest Hand-in: The Horde forces in Thousand Needles desperately need your help.
Title: Ny'alotha: MOTHER's Guidance

Description: Ny'alotha does not obey the rules of space and time, and we may be able to use this to our advantage.

MOTHER theorizes that if we obtain specific objects from N'Zoth's chosen, we can utilize them to bend space and expedite our passage here in the future. Though, it is doubtful they will relinquish these items willingly.

 Quest Hand-in: With these items, MOTHER can guarantee safe access to this area.
Title: Rocks of Ragnaros

Description: With me shaman still in their conveyances, a vital component o' our upcomin' ritual remains scattered among the supplies.

I can only hope the Horde haven't taken 'em. They're rare an' precious...

If you see any glowin' objects out there, recover 'em. They're o' tremendous value.

 Quest Hand-in: Couple o' scorch marks here an' there, but nothin' out o' the ordinary. These'll do nicely.
Title: A Burning Distraction

Description: We're going to need a distraction if we are to rescue Mathias Shaw from where he's being held captive in Felsoul Hold.

A big one.

Explosives placed in a few key locations should do nicely. Noggenfogger is playing nice and has donated some bombs to the cause. He might be trying to smooth over relations due to his earlier extortion.

I can have someone go ahead and mark the best locations. You want to do the honors?

 Quest Hand-in: That was a big distraction!
Title: A New Era for the Plaguelands

Description: No longer does the Scourge hold this area.  We, the living, are retaking Lordaeron.

We have taken great strides already, as you have already seen.  The earth flowers, the trees grow tall and green, and the wildlife is beginning to return.  Yet a few remnants of undeath remain.

While the trees and grass prosper, the animals are struggling.  Something is preventing them from healing, and I intend to find out what.  Bring me samples from the plagued wildlife so that I may study them more closely.

 Quest Hand-in: This will be more than enough, <name>.  Now, I will need some time to perform my studies.
Title: No Wisp Left Behind

Description: More of the Kaldorei souls still languish in the Maw.

I ask you once again, Maw Walker, to find them.

Help correct this wrong.

 Quest Hand-in: It brings me joy to see more souls freed from that dark place.Thank you Maw Walker, for continuing to help us.
Title: She Says Potato

Description: Roberta Carter has recruited me to help prepare one of the feast dishes, candied sweet potatoes.  Normally, I'd love to help, but I've promised the hostess that I'd help her watch the tables.

I'd really appreciate it if you would help me come up with those candied sweet potatoes. Roberta would never forgive me if I let her down.

If you're going to cook the sweet potatoes yourself, you'll have to buy them from the Pilgrim's Bounty merchant in Thunder Bluff. Thanks, {name}.

 Quest Hand-in: Thanks, <name>. Now, I can help the hostess out and still keep my word to Roberta.
Title: Break the Spine

Description: To lead his tainted forces,  the God-King has enlisted demons of great power to act as his lieutenants. If we wish to end his assault, we will need to take their leaders.

These demons are too powerful for most mortals to face, but with the power of Stormheim at your disposal, they will prove no match for you. 

Take them down, and shatter the spine of Skovald's offensive!

 Quest Hand-in: With their fel leaders slain, the God-King's forces will scatter. Still, we are not finished here. So long as the demons continue to assault the gates, Stormheim will not be safe.
Title: Invader Djaradin

Description: We may not have the power to take back our outpost, but we do not have to surrender without a fight.

Show them we still have teeth.

 Quest Hand-in: Wonderful.
Title: Where'd They Go?

Description: My boys are missing. You're going to help me find 'em.

Got it?

 Quest Hand-in: Pity. At least I can tell the rest of the boys they went down fighting.
Title: Our Mountain Now

Description: {name}, go take care of those "roughnecks." They might fashion themselves as tough, but a bit of your unique brand of Horde savagery should have them running in no time.

Lilian, scout the area. We need to know about any nearby threats.

Rangers, secure the perimeter. We'll reconvene in the roughneck camp once {name}'s work is done.

 Quest Hand-in: <Nathanos looks around the camp and nods to himself.>This will do.
Title: Return to Thalodien

Description: It would be best if this information got back to Thalodien as soon as possible.  I'll stay here and cover our tracks.

It wouldn't do us much good to have Kael'thas find out what we were snooping around here.  Secret information is always better if your enemy doesn't know you have it.

 Quest Hand-in: You do not cease to amaze me, <name>.  That was quite the feat of stealth you pulled off at Manaforge Coruu.
Title: Gifts of the Great Crane

Description: The cranes of Krasarang are a gift from Chi-Ji. Even the very feathers they leave behind are a gift for us to appreciate.

We use these feathers to adorn our garments and to fletch arrows. But first... they must be gathered.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you, <name>.Return to us again soon.
Title: Return to Stormglen

Description: It'll be a long time before our nation comes together again.  The old political divisions pale in comparison to what divides us now.

Yet if there was ever a time for us to come together and unite against a common enemy, it is now.  And it is you, {name}, who have proven able to bridge the gap between our people.

Return to Stormglen and tell them it is safe to go through the Blackwald on their way to Tempest's Reach.  We will take care of any Forsaken who follow them.

 Quest Hand-in: King Greymane gave me a brief rundown of the plan before he set off for the Blackwald.  Doesn't make it sound any less crazy.
Title: Defungination

Description: Have you seen the fungus out there in the water? It's growing faster than a baby ravasaur from Un'goro, and if we don't get it under control, the Gearworks is gonna be ruined like our last village.

Uncle Krixel used to tell me to burn away the red fungus because that's what makes it grow so fast.

You could help us out by taking a flame blaster and clearing out some of those spores down in the shallows.

 Quest Hand-in: Hey good job out there! I couldn't have done it any better myself.
Title: Maldraxxian Weapons

Description: <The weapon you find seems unlike those wielded by most venthyr, yet the marks it bears are unmistakably familiar...

It would be wise to seek out more such weapons and bring them to the Accuser.>

 Quest Hand-in: The Blackbale venthyr are wielding the weapons of the Maldraxxi army?That would mean...
Title: The Tillers

Description: The Tillers do their business at Halfhill in the Valley of the Four Winds.

If you're interested in getting started, I hear there's a new farmer in town by the name of Farmer Yoon.

I betcha he'll be looking for help.

 Quest Hand-in: You arrived just in time!
Title: A Bundle of Hides

Description: I have a bundle of hides from the animals of Mulgore, and must get them to Thunder Bluff.  A colleague there, Ahanu, will use the hides to create leather goods.

Will you take the hides to him for me?

The quickest way to Thunder Bluff is on the back of a wind rider.  Bring the bundle of hides to Tak, our wind rider master in Bloodhoof Village, and speak to him about transport to Thunder Bluff.

 Quest Hand-in: If you must take these hides to Thunder Bluff, then you have come to the right place.
Title: Dragonsprings Drop

Description: The fish could be biting better, don't you think?

You know, that gives me an idea. Legend says these lakes and rivers did not always have fish. They say, these watering holes were stocked with fish when the dragons soaring overhead dropped them! Can you believe it?

Maybe you and your drake could give it a try?

 Quest Hand-in: Ha! The legends are true, how fantastic!
Title: More Fetid Filets

Description: Our little guy is getting hungry again. 

Could you pick him up a quick bite to eat?

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent! This will make sure he grows up big and strong!Let's hope he doesn't try to eat us then!
Title: The Weak Link

Description: This ought to be enough to break the bonds that hold your newfound ally.

<Ve'nari pauses for a moment.>

Before you do so, I offer a word of warning.

No creature imprisoned in that place should be trusted. Tread carefully, mortal. 

After all, it would be a shame to lose so valuable a business partner.

 Quest Hand-in: Freedom. Of a sort. Yes... this is good. You have my thanks.What was it you wanted? Ah, power. Yes. Very well, then.
Title: A Message of Blood and Fire

Description: Look at what I be findin' here. Dis one had a magic wand in his hand.

<Rokhan shuts his eyes for a moment.>

Mmmmm... it be warm. Mojo of fire be within. Perfect!

Take dis ting an' give 'em a taste of their own firepower.

Burn da whole village down!

 Quest Hand-in: Good job, mon. Justice be served.
Title: Hunting an Inquisitor

Description: You may have noticed that inquisitors are protected by the Lord Chamberlain's magic. A potent consequence of wielding the Master's medallion.

But now that we have access to Inquisitor Traian's sinstone from the archives, we have the power needed to break through those defenses.

Locate the inquisitor, and order Temel to read out from his sinstone. Declaring the true name and sins of the inquisitor will shatter his defenses and make him vulnerable for a short window of time.

Be ready to strike.

 Quest Hand-in: Decorous and deserved.I hope this will be the first of many corrupt inquisitors we fell together.
Title: Nowhere To Run And Nowhere To Hide

Description: Nothing less than total annihilation will suffice, {name}. To that end, a few hundred mindless ghouls assaulting the front gate of New Avalon will not do. We must infiltrate the inner sanctum and dispose of their officials. They must be shown that no one can escape the Scourge's grasp!

Make your way to the New Avalon Town Hall, southwest of here, and assassinate the mayor. Search the building for the New Avalon registry and bring it to me.

 Quest Hand-in: The registry will tell us many things about the Scarlet insects.<Keleseth flips through the pages of the registry.>Death rates, births, but most importantly, movement.Look here, <name>, they have already sent three vessels abroad. Let me see here... Where are they headed?WHAT? This is impossible. They sail to Northrend!Beside the coordinates are the words: "Crimson Dawn."
Title: Into the Wilds

Description: Deep in the wilds, on the southern coast where the Krasarang River meets the sea, rests the Temple of the Red Crane, home of the great Chi-Ji and his most devout followers.

They should be told of what happened here.

If you're headed that way, I have a favor to ask; We often send supplies to the temple, but our last courier has not returned. Please look for signs of him as you travel - where the road forks at the Dojani River, he'd have gone south. When you reach the temple, find Koro Mistwalker.

 Quest Hand-in: I see... And the sha have seeped out as far as the province already, have they?Well, I hate to break it to you, but the temple is also overrun with sha. Those of us who haven't been killed or... possessed, or whatever, are fleeing for our very lives.If you defeated the sha at Zhu's Watch, I have to implore you to help us deal with them here.
Title: Mission Report: Stonefist Watch

Description: Your followers have sent a report regarding the assault on Stonefist Watch.

It details that victory was hard-fought, but all of the bandits previously living in the outpost have been slain.

Deliver the report to Nathanos Blightcaller aboard The Banshee's Wail.

 Quest Hand-in: It seems the mission to create an additional foothold in Tiragarde Sound was a success. Well done, <name>.I will send you to oversee the fortifications at once.
Title: The Ascent

Description: I can feel the voice of the Fury at the top of the ascent. Come, let us climb these stairs together.

Be on your guard. The goren of this area are likely to be drawn by the smell of a shaman.

If we get separated, fall back to the base of the stairs and regroup.

 Quest Hand-in: This is ancient magic, from a time before the orcs. It will not be easy to undo.
Title: Scrying Stones

Description: I have a gift for you, {name}. 

It's a stone unlike anything you've seen before. To the uninformed, it may seem to be a simple rock, but it's far more precious than that. 

This is a scrying stone. It reveals objects that have been hidden by magic. When near an anomaly, the runes etched within will begin to glow. 

Use the stone to reveal treasure hidden away by ancient magic.

 Quest Hand-in: See, I wasn't lying. The scrying stones are extraordinary!
Title: Dangerous Prey

Description: <Your bloodgazer falcosaur continues to tremble timidly whenever a powerful creature is nearby. It would help to build its confidence to see you defeat such a creature.>

 Quest Hand-in: <The hatchling caws at you. A compliment, perhaps? It will need some time to recover from this adventure.>
Title: Catch A Star

Description: I require your aid on a... delicate matter, {name}.

Starfly Wings form a vital ingredient for some of our creations and our supply is exhausted.
They are tiny things, very fragile, and I am ill able to handle them delicately.

Could you obtain the Starflies for me? They must be caught alive in order for their wings to not spoil and we desperately need them. 

I'll ensure that you are compensated for your time, of course.

 Quest Hand-in: Outstanding! I could see the shine coming from your pack before you even arrived.Thank you!
Title: A Familiar Ring to It

Description: {name}! Let's talk bling. I'm looking for a ring.

See, the elves down in Azsuna were some fine master jewelcrafters back in the day... or so they say. The books all talk about a ring called the "Band of Farondis". Can't hurt to ask around for it.

Let's head to Azsuna. Bet I'll get there sooner!

 Quest Hand-in: So the ring was stolen by murlocs? Sounds like another opportunity for you and I to work together!Partners in crime, for the rest of time!
Title: Welcome to the City of Smells

Description: Ain't it incredible, uplander!

Now for the backbreaking labor. We've got to deliver this deepflayer meat to all my customers and collect their pay. I'd carry it all myself, but I'm just a poor, old, frail, gorgeous woman in need now, aren't I?

<Honeypelt gives you an expertly practiced wink.>

Why don't you handle it for me? Brynnsahce will do the heavy lifting while you take a little tour of the place. Put your best smell forward--we're a friendly sort!

 Quest Hand-in: Not too shabby, kid. Maybe there's room for you on the monster hunting roster, yet!Just kidding! Another joke! There is no roster! Just combat-hungry suckers who got rocks rolling 'round their gut like I do.You'll get there one day. Keep trying.
Title: The Pirate's Bay

Description: While we've made some progress on the Broken Shore, I think it is time for the more subtle tactics of the Uncrowned.

We've received word of a large cave off the main island, where powerful demons meet to plot our downfall. Tess and Tethys have formulated a plan, but they need your help to see it through.They are waiting for you at Dead Man's Bay in Azsuna.

 Quest Hand-in: Straighten up, Shadowblade. We've got work to do.
Title: Bolted Steelhead

Description: <Danielle Anglers may be interested in this fish.>

 Quest Hand-in: This fish appears to have been manufactured! The workmanship is quite sophisticated. I want to catalogue this and release it for further observation.
Title: Ghoulish Effigy

Description: Out here on the outskirts of town, it's a wonder the walking dead haven't eaten me!  In fact, just yesterday a pack of ghouls was pounding on the walls of my tower!

I want to make an effigy - a kind of "scarecrow" for ghouls.  To do that I need some ghoul ribs.  You can find plenty of them on the fetid corpses wandering Manor Mistmantle's grounds, north of Darkshire...

Get the ribs for me, and I will repay you with some coin.

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, thanks.  These will do just the trick!
Title: Proving Pit

Description: Ya done quite well for ya'self, {class}. I'm sure I could teach ya a trick or two here and dere, but I not be wastin' ya time on tiki targets no longer.

l put one last trial before ya den, mon. Head over to da provin' pit in the middle of dis area and fight a real baddy - one dat wants ta kill ya back. Just let the jailor by the pit know when ya ready.

 Quest Hand-in: Ya handle yerself quite well. Ya gonna be quite powerful some day.
Title: The Edge Of Winter

Description: The Ironforge grand champion's squire told me an intriguing story.

In southern Crystalsong Forest, overlooking the Crystal Vice's exit, you will find Lord Everblaze. Kill him and take the everburning ember from his corpse.

Bring it to the center of Winter's Breath Lake in northern Howling Fjord, and use it to free the maiden encased in ice. She is the guardian of an ancient sword and will award it to whoever frees her.

Prove your worth and earn the weapon that she has guarded for so long, {name}.

 Quest Hand-in: The blade is as fine as the squire said it would be, but where did he find out about it? No matter; it will serve its new owner well. Perhaps it's only fair that Ironforge's grand champion be the one to wield it.
Title: Anima Tastings

Description: You started a trend, {name}!

Your constant gallivanting around the different realms of the Shadowlands has inspired a new flair for the exotic among Revendreth's elite. If it's from outside Revendreth, the venthyr want to try it.

And I know just what the next big thing will be: anima tastings!

Think about it: we--and by 'we' I mean 'you'--bring back fresh anima from all the different realms you travel too.

Then socialites get to sip it and pretend it tastes like wherever you got it from!

 Quest Hand-in: Hips already sent over a name for the Master of Anima he wants to lead the tastings.I'll get her on the staff and have this stuff delivered to her.
Title: Running Late

Description: I beg your pardon, but I am a little concerned at Lord Waycrest's tardiness.

I'd hate to be a bother, but would you mind checking on him? The ceremony awaits his presence.

You can find him in the bride's room, at the top of the tower.

 Quest Hand-in: Splendid! I'll just need to take a few moments to go over this and I'll be right down.Please let Lucy and Alexander know I will be ready shortly.
Title: The Baron's Plan

Description: You have done well in my service, Nelesis. When the time has come to take my rightful place, you will be well rewarded.

Until then, I will require your utmost devotion and secrecy.

Our preparations are almost complete. Come, walk with me, and I will show you the splendor of our works.

 Quest Hand-in: There are but a few tasks remaining before we can complete our ritual.You must begin immediately.
Title: Cultural Significance

Description: I have noticed dat your skill with harvesting plants has improved, but I have also noticed dat you just treat each flower and leaf as a commodity. De flora of dese islands have a rich history, with a deep cultural significance to us.

Go down to the Port of Zandalar, and ask some of the men and women what a sea stalk means to them.  Learn from us, and l will make it worth your while.

 Quest Hand-in: De sea stalk has a unique magical property dat allows de stalk to provide de flower water, even if de flower is cut off.Sailors will give their loved ones a flower and keep de stalk on themselves, so if dey fall over board, de salt water kills de flower. What you hold is more dan a stick, it is a family member's life.As for your lesson, unlike most other magic plants, de best material to harvest for magical essence is de stem, not de leaves or flower.
Title: A Primal Threat

Description: Raszageth has wasted no time building up her Primalist forces.

The Kirin Tor have detected massive storms being unleashed at key points across Kalimdor and the Eastern Kingdoms.

The Primalists are unleashing the elements to add to their strength. It seems they plan to cause chaos not only in the Dragon Isles, but in the lands of the Alliance and Horde as well.

Seek out the enemy and study their methods. We have to stop them before it's too late.

 Quest Hand-in: It is good you thwarted their attack, at least for now.<Khadgar examines the motes you brought him.>Hmm, primal elemental energy. I will take this for further study.
Title: Imposing Threat

Description: One of Vereesa's scouts has returned with word of a mogu leader under the central tower. He needs to be removed.

Would you be willing to handle this?

 Quest Hand-in: I appreciate what you've done for us this day, <name>.
Title: Transdimensional Warfare: Chapter II

Description: <The Banshee Queen's words float in your head.>

You are now ready to use the portal. Be warned, {name}, once you step through you will appear in another dimension at Ambermill. There will be a hundred, perhaps a thousand, magi waiting to kill you.

You must persevere and kill all in your path.

 Quest Hand-in: <The Banshee Queen's voice invades your thoughts.>Excellent work, <name>. Now to eject them into our waiting hands!
Title: Vilebranch Scum

Description: The Vilebranch are a different tribe from the Revantusk, but the difference is academic. Far as we're concerned the only good troll is a dead troll!

But make no mistake, the Vilebranch are just as nasty even without the Horde's chain around their neck. They'll poison this whole land unless we take this stand and get rid of them

You can start with their witchdoctors and headhunters on the lower tier. Let me know when you've killed a fair share of 'em.

 Quest Hand-in: Aye, we'll have these trolls cleared out yet.
Title: Give 'em What-For

Description: Alright, {name}, listen up.  I know a thing or two about troggs, and one of those things is that the biggest, strongest troggs get the most respect.  The brutes value strength over anything else.

Ye see those great big troggs sitting back behind the front lines?  They're the closest they have to what ye'd call a leader.  Go take out a few, and show 'em what it means to mess with the Sons of Ironforge!

 Quest Hand-in: Hmm... they blame us for destroying their home, ye say?  Well, that wasn't us, that was the horrible earthquake we had earlier today.  Are they that dense that they can't see we nearly lost our camp too?Can't blame a trogg for fightin' for his home, though.
Title: Trouble at the Lake

Description: You've been a great help in securing the mines and rescuing the trapped miners.

The Senate will be heartened to hear that you and Captain Tharran's mountaineers have made progress in securing Dun Morogh.

What worries me is that I haven't seen any reports from Sergeant Bahrum and his detachment. They were sent east, along the road toward Helm's Bed Lake, and ordered to set up a small outpost. Would you go to Bahrum's Post and check in on the sergeant?

 Quest Hand-in: It's a good thing the Senator didn't come out here on his own. It's dangerous, and we're going to need all the help we can get to get the situation under control.
Title: A Poisonous Palette

Description: I may not be great at my job, but at least I paid attention when I was learning how to do it. Every Waywatcher worth her scales knows how to make a proper antidote. I just need enough poison to mix it properly.

Nori said the tarasek who attacked her had spears coated with the stuff. Find them and bring their spears to me. If my hunch is correct, I'll be able to make an antidote with the residue from the spearheads.

I just hope we have enough time.

 Quest Hand-in: <Alvi takes the spears that you gathered. She carefully scrapes her dagger across one of the blades, removing a film of sticky, sickly sap.>It's just as I thought. Thank you, <name>. This should be enough for an antidote, and I even think I know where the poison is coming from.
Title: To the Fathom-Lord's Call

Description: Fathom-Lord Zin'jatar has sent word that the Kvaldir leader has shown himself. I would like you to make your way to him at the far end of the terrace above us, on the middle level of the ruins: Nar'shola Terrace.

Kill any Kvaldir that stand in your path on that terrace. We want the echoes of this defeat to ring in their minds so that they will dare not return to threaten our purpose here.

Your devotion does not go unnoticed, my battlemaiden. Go knowing that you have my blessing.

 Quest Hand-in: It is good of you to join me, Battlemaiden. The echoes of your combat graced your approach. It was a beautiful sound to behold.
Title: Meet Number Two

Description: All the good work you've done for us hasn't gone unnoticed, {name}.  Our second in command, the delightful Annie Bonn, is incredibly impressed with what you've done so far and wants to meet you.  

 Quest Hand-in: Well, well, well.  If it isn't <name>.  You show up at Scalawag point, no one's heard of you except some goblin friend of that half-wit Terry.Let's just say I'm a bit... skeptical... of your intentions here.
Title: Unseen Influence

Description: The corruption in the Apexis has begun to affect many of my people. We are so accustomed to the power it grants us that more succumb to the whispers every day. You must bring me more samples so I can free my people from yet another curse.

 Quest Hand-in: I will continue to need your help until this world is free of whatever terrible presence Gul'dan has invited to destroy us.
Title: Legend of the Animaswell

Description: <This appears to be an incomplete set of notes detailing one archivist's search for a mythical font of anima hidden somewhere deep in Korthia.

Koros in Elysian Hold would be able to help you put together a team to search for it.>

 Quest Hand-in: <Koros carefully studies the documents you brought him.>The documentation is incomplete. It is unclear if the archivist even survived...But the tales of the anima are coherent, and there are enough details here to launch an expedition.It will not be easy. The archivist warns of many dangers protecting the anima source...
Title: Starting Young

Description: Our scouts are bringing back reports of fire hawk hatchlings all over the peak... their eggs must have hatched very recently. Better yet, it seems that they're extremely docile.

I know it may sound a strange and perhaps unsavory request, but if you were able to bring some of those hatchlings back to me, I might be able to train them to aid us in our war efforts.

Are you willing?

 Quest Hand-in: They look to have singed your gloves a bit, but I don't see any damage otherwise. Well done, <class>.Come by again within the next few days to see how the training has gone.
Title: Avast Ye, Admiral!

Description: Listen close, sea dawg... the powers of Booty Bay is what keeps us Bloodsail from sailing wheres we like and taking whats we want as rights o' plunder.  Were ye to put a knife to Fleet Master Seahorn, we'd ne'er run afoul of a Booty Bay's vessel.  Were ye to put a knife to Baron Revilgaz, we'd ne'er face the law on their terms.

If ye are to be an honorary admiral amongst us - yes, ADMIRAL, you'll puts a knife to both of 'em as I've says.  Go now lad, and return to me once ye does the deeds.

 Quest Hand-in: Avast ye... Admiral <name>!  Yer a pirate of pirates, lad!It warms the cackles of me heart to give ye this hat.  Ye will ne'er find one like it anywheres, and all that gazes upon ye will see that yer an Admiral of the Bloodsail Navy!
Title: Stormheim

Description: Nathanos Blightcaller, Champion of the Banshee Queen herself, sent for you in Dalaran.

He should be waiting for you in the Violet Citadel. It sounded urgent.

 Quest Hand-in: <Nathanos glances over at you, pausing for a moment before acknowledging your presence.>Yes?
Title: A Rediscovered Legend

Description: This Sparring Arena is a good start, but we will need trainers to help mold your forces into worthy fighters.

There has been a reported spotting of a draenei to the west who matches the description of Akaani.

This is interesting, as we all believed her dead. She was one of the finest warriors the draenei have ever fielded and a master of nearly any weapon forged or found.

Commander, you could not ask for a more skilled trainer. I advise seeking her out, if it is really her...

 Quest Hand-in: You do not have the look of a Stonemaul bounty hunter.We escaped the clutches of their vile arena but at a heavy cost. We were forced to leave too many allies behind and too many ogres breathing.We could use a fresh face, one that is unknown to the ogres.
Title: Soul Prism of the Illidari

Description: Alas, I will not burden you with the location of the master's soul just yet, {name}. First we must craft a soul prism powerful enough to hold the master's boundless chaotic energies.

To do this I require lingering soul fragments from powerful beings found across this world. Bring me enough and I will craft a soul prism capable of holding the soul of the master - at least long enough to transfer into the naaru.

 Quest Hand-in: The Soul Prism of the Illidari is ready for use.Illidan's soul was plucked from the Nether - stolen - and taken to the underworld. A place known as Helheim.
Title: Shadow Council Invasion!

Description: The demons are at our heels, Commander. Cow's milk is sour. A crone gave me an evil look this morning. The sky just doesn't seem... right.

 Quest Hand-in: They're defeated! I'm glad we came here, Commander. To Draenor. Fighting against demons reminds me why we fight for the Alliance.
Title: Blind Lake Lunker

Description: That's a fine Blind Lake Lunker you got there {name}.  How long did you fight it?  Fish like these don't come around very often, but when they do, it's a fight!

 Quest Hand-in: I will take any lunkers you like find like this off your hands.  Come back and see me anytime you catch one and I will pay you top dollar!
Title: Loss Reduction

Description: You've got to help us.  The elementals... they're stronger than they look, and they come in waves.  They took us completely by surprise, and we were overcome.

Many of my fellow grunts lay dying on the beach.  If you could save them... I would be grateful, as would Gar'Thok back in Razor Hill.

 Quest Hand-in: I've already spoken with several orcs that have returned from the beach.  All of them told me that you were the one who saved them.You've done a noble task today, <name>.  Lok'tar ogar!  For the Horde!
Title: Or Against Us

Description: If Ly'leth is to achieve the role of advisor to the Grand Magistrix we will need to open a path for her.

It is true she will have some supporters but they alone cannot grant her the title.

There are other houses that Ly'leth must contend with. Fear and coercion are their tools. None dare stand against them openly, and we cannot win them over with favors and oaths. 

Seek out Arluin. I trust he will have some ideas of how to proceed.

 Quest Hand-in: Very well. Let us talk strategy.
Title: No Spies Allowed

Description: Hey {name}, I'm glad you're here.

I'm in way over my head! Killer bugs, a strange substance... that GIANT sword sticking outta the ground... I don't have a good feelin' about this place!

To make matters worse, I've been gettin' reports of Alliance spies snoopin' around the camp!

Look kid, the Dark Lady has plans for this mysterious ore and I ain't going to be the one to dissapoint her, know what I mean?

Get over to the mining camp and take out those SI:7 spies before they ruin the whole operation!

 Quest Hand-in: You did well, <name>... Crisis averted! But we better keep an eye out for reinforcements.If this stuff is as valuable as Gallywix says it is, the Alliance is going to be all over this place in no time!
Title: Your First Day as a Pirate

Description: Ye may be a slayer of Fleet Masters, but rules is rules and orders is orders.  And MY orders say that all new pirates start out as swabbies.  It's the rule.

You're to be working for Captain Keelhaul, the commander of the Riptide.  It's the westernmost ship in the fleet, which is parked south of the tip o' the cape.

Find him in his captain's chambers, and bring yer papers.

 Quest Hand-in: Yes... yes... I see... well, everything appears to be in order.Slayer of the great Seahorn, eh?  That doesn't matter on MY ship.  Only thing you're gonna be slaying is deck stains.  Grab a mop.
Title: Failed Apprentice

Description: Oru'kai was the first ogre mage to master the art of enchanting on Draenor. Upon his death, his items were scattered across Draenor. I have tracked his staff to the shore you see before us. 

As you can see, the staff's enchantment is making it difficult to retrieve. A would-be apprentice, Deema, took one of Oru'kai's rings in to break the enchantment, but she failed and became trapped as well. 

Find and free Deema, take the ring, complete her task, and I will consider a reward.

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you. I thought I was going to be stuck here forever.
Title: The Grand Melee

Description: The grand melee is the most important of the tournament's competitions. Victory will not be easy, but I am confident that we will win. You must practice with your mount until the two of you work as one.

It will help prepare you for the rigors of tournament combat.

Go to the stables outside the pavilion, equip your lance, mount the stabled Orgrimmar wolf, and challenge the valiants. They wait in the Horde Valiants' Ring just outside our tent.



 Quest Hand-in: Training against the other valiants will sharpen your claws and hone your battle instincts. When the competition begins, you will be ready.
Title: Tomb of Sargeras: The Deceiver

Description: Carried by only the most powerful of his servants, the Seal indicates the presence of the Deceiver, Kil'Jaeden. He must be defeated.

 Quest Hand-in: Were you able to overcome the Tomb of Sargeras?
Title: Eyes to the Sky

Description: The House of Eyes still reels from Akarek's demise. They search for direction. For purpose.

Perhaps you can help them find it. Continue to gain the trust of the Eyes. Their skills will be invaluable to our cause.

 Quest Hand-in: You've done well, Maw Walker. The Eyes place their trust in you.
Title: If There Are Survivors...

Description: Across the Valley of Echoes, west of here, and through the Breach, is the first Scourge encampment in Icecrown known as Scourgeholme. We fought a good fight at Scourgeholme and killed many Scourge, but in the end we were forced to retreat. Many soldiers were left behind - their fate unknown.

If there are survivors, we must attempt a rescue. Directly down this southeastern path is Penumbrius, ally of the bronze dragonflight and caretaker of the proto-brood. Seek him out and ask for his assistance.

 Quest Hand-in: <Penumbrius nods.>My kin will help. Together we will battle the Lich King and his undead legions.
Title: Snack Time

Description: Cloud serpents love to eat, and one of their favorite treats is the sugar minnow.

These fish can be found in salt or fresh water anywhere in Pandaria. I trust you have some skill in fishing, and your own fishing pole to catch them?

Bring me a fresh catch and I'm sure the hungry beasts around here will be very grateful.

 Quest Hand-in: Oh wonderful! These fish will do nicely.
Title: With Our Powers Combined

Description: Emberthal is waiting for us in front of the Brimstone Garrison.

Come, {name}. She will be pleased to see we have rallied the full might of the black dragonflight to aid her cause.

 Quest Hand-in: Nothing can stop the black dragonflight when we stand together.
Title: Livin' the Life

Description: Listen, I really shouldn't be talkin' to you, but I owe Horatio a favor or two. I don't really know nothin' about what happened to the Furlbrows, but I might be able to point you in the right direction.

<Lou hands you a large crate.>

That crate used to be my home before I struck it rich. Now I'm livin' the life every hobo dreams of!

Right, so you take that there livin' crate and head to the Jangolode Mine, southwest of here. Head to the back of the mine and once there, hide in the crate. 

 Quest Hand-in: <Lou puts his hands to his ears and starts talking loudly.>STOP! STOP! STOP! I don't wanna hear it! I don't wanna know and I don't care! That kind of information is liable to get you killed 'round these parts.I got one more bit of information for you and then we're done!
Title: Menace to Society

Description: These troggs are a menace to the whole area! They raid camps and caravans and eat the livestock when they come down from their caves. The kids being up there might set them off!

Slay some of those troggs before they decide to cause trouble.

 Quest Hand-in: You look like you've been in a fight. Did you introduce those troggs to the business end of your weapon?That's what I would have done! Give 'em a good right hook! And then a left! Pow! Bam!I bet they're sorry for messing with you!
Title: Blinding the Brokers

Description: We cannot allow Kel'Thuzad to discover who stopped his shipment. 

None must be left to tell the tale of what transpired here.

 Quest Hand-in: The guards have been dealt with? Good.We have more pressing matters, now.
Title: Isolating Zalamar

Description: Hir'eek, de loa of bats, has been corrupted by G'huun! We will get no help from him.

We only have one option if dey have a loa on their side... we must kill Hir'eek.

It's crazy, and we will both probably die, but I have a plan. We need to isolate dis place first.

De blood trolls have wardrummers who sound an alarm if anything happens here. We need dem gone... but you have to be sneaky about it.

You have a good disguise, so you can order de drummers to go leave their posts.

 Quest Hand-in: Hah! Now we have plenty of room to mess with dis camp. Dere will be no reinforcements from de other blood trolls.
Title: Secretest Fish

Description: <Danielle Anglers in Mechagon may be interested in this fish.>

 Quest Hand-in: Where did you find this fish? It opens up many new possibilities for fish research!With just a little adjustment, I can modify a rudimentary lure, adapting it to attract more fish than ever!Of course it might just attract more fishermen instead!
Title: The Fists of Vaandaam

Description: You have done me a great service. This blade is as much yours as it is mine.

I offer you this blood oath: I shall serve your cause and lend my knowledge of blades and mining to your forces.

Will you accept it?

 Quest Hand-in: For years the ogres would make me fight, kill, and salute. My soul bled with each salute.But because of you, I will never again have to salute an ogre.You have helped me win my freedom, so I choose to use that freedom to serve your banner.Today, I salute you, commander.
Title: The Honored Dead

Description: Our fallen deserve a hero's funeral, but we cannot bury them here on sacred taunka ground.

I'll not ask you to drag their bodies back here, but take this and head further into the cemetary.  When you come across our dead caravan guards and workers, put them to the torch.

Honor our dead, {class}!

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you, <class>. We are the Horde, we do not leave our dead behind!It should never have been necessary in the first place. Steeljaw was a fool!
Title: Doublerum

Description: <Baron Revilgaz sighs.>  Even with all my suspicions about Firallon's plot, we aren't prepared for a full two-front attack between the Bloodsail and the Brashtide.  It's going to take a small miracle to hold Booty Bay today.

I've got a barrel of Doublerum in my chambers.  Take the stairs down three flights, and check the first door on your right.  You can ignore the warnings on the barrel... those should be the least of your worries.

 Quest Hand-in: This must be the doublerum.  You pour a glass for Revilgaz, then consider pouring one for yourself...
Title: Sallow Essence
