Description: <The felwort is reduced to a thick, clotted pigment. While all felwort-begotten pigment is somewhat offensive, this batch practically glows with a malevolent energy.>

<Professor Pallin would be interested in seeing this.>

 Quest Hand-in: We've ventured into undiscovered territory, <name>. There isn't anyone out there in ANY academic circles I'm aware of that is milling felwort this effectively.Well done, student. Or, should I say... well done, junior deputy assistant scribe?Nah... I still prefer "student".
Title: Leathery Venom Gland

Description: <You pry a leathery gland from the snapdragon corpse. Drops of venom spill from an opening on one end and sizzle as they touch the ground, leaving small holes behind.

This toxin appears to be very potent. It would be best to bring it back to Mezzamere.>

 Quest Hand-in: Friend, let me take that from you, it is best not to handle the venom for too long.The naga tame the snapdragon with ease, but we have more difficulty. They seem to have a natural affinity for them. I envy them somewhat, the creatures are both vicious and loyal.The venom they spit is deadly. I have only known one to truly master it, a naga commander. We believe she feeds on the substance to give herself immunity. I do not know how this is possible, she must be a terror in combat.
Title: Tear Them From the Sky!

Description: Egah! They're here, {name}. They're here!

I had hoped to equip a whole army with my shoulder-mounted drake-droppers, but all I have is a single, extremely expensive and wholly untested prototype. Here, take it!

Shoot the Dragonmaw black drakes that are circling Thundermar, and drop them from the sky!

 Quest Hand-in: You did it, <name>! Alliance ingenuity to the rescue.Of course, I don't have anything to help you fight the dismounted riders now that they're on the ground. You're a <class>; improvise!
Title: Clandestine Operation

Description: As you well know, I have opposed the Horde at many turns. The orcs have taken... so much from me. From my family.

Yet I have witnessed your deeds firsthand, {name}. I have seen you fight for Azeroth time and again. And like the rest of us, you have endured many trials and hardships to reach this point.

Now, I must ask your help. Will you hear me out?

 Quest Hand-in: The time to make our move is now.
Title: Hexoskeleton

Description: I have a bet going with Xanjo over what leather is de best for armor in regards to resisting piercing and slashing attacks.

He says scales are the best, but I have something better in mind.

I feel de makrura's exoskeleton could be treated to act as a natural plate armor.

Bring me de carapace of a bittertide makrura, and I will teach you how to harvest bones more effectively from creatures you're skinning.

 Quest Hand-in: Nice.These plates are very thick, and TECHNICALLY leather. My victory is almost guaranteed.As for your lesson... makrura don't have bones.<Rana smiles.>Fine, fine! I will teach you something useful, too.<Putting the carapace on the ground, Rana shows you how to feel if a bone is broken before removing it.>
Title: Forgy

Description: <Rendle left you a crumpled envelope addressed to Forgy in Darkhaven. On the outside of the envelope are very specific orders to tell Forgy that Rendle sent you.

What aid might Forgy be able to offer the Ember Court?>

 Quest Hand-in: What can I do for ya, Maw Walker?
Title: Return to Revilgaz

Description: Something is happening outside.  Could the Bloodsail already be here?

You'd better get Revilgaz his doublerum.  Quickly.

 Quest Hand-in: <The Baron quickly empties his cup.>AH!  Much better, <name>.  Now, let's get down to business.  I believe that you and I have a town to save.
Title: Gaining the Upper Hand

Description: We need to retrieve the Abyssal Scepter and get out of here before the Kul Tirans break our line in Plunder Harbor.

I did some research while you were gone. I believe I uncovered the location where the ritual must take place.

When you are ready to go, we can make our way over.

 Quest Hand-in: We've got the scepter... for better or for worse.
Title: What Lubbins Needs

Description: I think that I know what we gotta do, {name}. 

But first, let's talk about it!

I even have a gift to give you after we're done! Fun, right?

 Quest Hand-in: Make sure to summon Lubbins, then use this battle-stone on him. It'll permanently make him stronger.
Title: Sunder the Crater

Description: The Primalists have moved into Stormsunder Crater. They're raising elementals and exploiting the land.

They should be dealt with in a swift and decisive manner. Thin their ranks. Destroy their totems. Help us make the Forbidden Reach safe for the dracthyr, the tuskarr, and all the dispossessed who want to call it home again.

 Quest Hand-in: Well done. You just did some serious damage to their plans here in the Forbidden Reach.
Title: A Call to Revendreth

Description: Oh, I'm glad you're here, we've got a problem!

Our friends in Revendreth are struggling under the rule of Sire Denathrius. He was always a cruel leader, and now he's thrown in his lot with the Jailer! 

If Denathrius's control of Revendreth isn't broken, he'll come for us next...

Let's do whatever we can to help them out!

 Quest Hand-in: Ha, take that Denathrius. He won't be allowed to rule the Shadowlands if you have anything to say about it!
Title: Inscribed Serpent Staff

Description: As powerful it is, at some point you know you will outgrow this staff.  When that time comes, one of the Inkmasters in the Arboretum would most likely be interested in taking it from you.

 Quest Hand-in: This is a weapon of great beauty and power.  If you are certain you wish to part with it, I would be happy to take it from you.
Title: The Last Refugee

Description: There was this massive earthquake and then everything went black. The next thing I know, I woke up here a prisoner. The whole place is overrun with air elementals!

I hope that everyone's okay. These Twillight's Hammer scum better not have hurt any of my friends!

Quick, {class}, use something sharp to jimmy the lock on this ball and chain. Together we should be able to make it to the refugee camp.

 Quest Hand-in: Aye, you're the fine lad who saved my Hollee!Well, I've got a fitting reward for you here, I'm sure. We really can't thank you enough for bringing her to safety, <name>.
Title: Claimant to the Throne

Description: I have dedicated myself to saving Azeroth from destruction time and time again, and this fool thinks he can just swoop in and claim the title of aspect? I think not.

Talk to my people, {name}. See what they have to say about me and what I have done for this world.

 Quest Hand-in: Surely you back my claim, do you not, <name>?
Title: Bled Dry

Description: <The draenei spits out his last words.>

They kept us in cages. They... drain our blood, for... rituals...

<He coughs violently.>

...many left --

    -- my... people...

<The draenei dies.>

 Quest Hand-in: Well done, <name>.Given, they are injured, half-starved, and poorly-equipped... but there is no blade so sharp as a vengeful spirit, no armor so thick as a righteous cause.
Title: Slow-roasted Turkey

Description: Every Pilgrim's Bounty feast requires a magnificent centerpiece, and I'm not talking about a decorative horn of plenty, either. No, the focus of the meal is a magnificent roast turkey.

There's a good recipe for it in your bountiful cookbook. Why not hunt some wild turkeys and prepare a few? The turkeys wander all over Elwynn Forest, so you shouldn't have a problem finding one.

Once you're done roasting them, will you bring them to Isaac Allerton near the gates of Darnassus?

 Quest Hand-in: These are beautiful and just in time to feed hungry feasters. Thank you, <name>. You've truly mastered all the courses of a traditional Pilgrim's Bounty meal.
Title: To Wyrmrest!

Description: The Dragon Soul... a weapon with enough power to defeat Deathwing. Thanks to you, it is now safely in our hands.

Come! The aspects await us. We must bring the Dragon Soul to Wyrmrest Temple, in the center of Dragonblight.

 Quest Hand-in: I owe my life to you, heroes.Now that we hold the Dragon Soul safely within Wyrmrest, it may be that all of Azeroth owes their lives to you.
Title: Zeth'Gor Must Burn!

Description: The Bleeding Hollow clan have betrayed their noble heritage!  We, the orcs who fought and died to save ourselves from the fel taint of Mannoroth, look upon our vile cousins and see only weakness and ignobility... and for that, they must burn!

Enter Zeth'Gor, their bastion to the east, and burn their buildings.  Kill peons for their torches, ignite them at their forge, and hurl the burning torches at their hovels, their stable and their barracks.  Burn them all, and then return to me!

For the Horde!

 Quest Hand-in: Hah!  I could see the smoke and flames of Zeth'Gor from here!  May the Bleeding Hollow fiends burn to ash and drift far from the sight of any true orc!Thank you, <name>.  You helped burn away an afront to every orc's spirit.
Title: The Eagle Spirit's Blessing

Description: The spear is linked to a spirit called Ohn'ahra. It has been tradition for us to speak with her and receive her blessing before going after the spear. She may also impart some knowledge.

If you would accompany me to Spiritwatch Point, I will summon the Eagle Spirit and ask for its blessing in the coming fight.

 Quest Hand-in: We saved the Eagle Spirit and received her blessing. I feel even more confident we will get Talonclaw now!
Title: Skitterweb Menace

Description: Vengeance is all consuming, {name}! Our third ship sank off the coast of the Skittering Dark, northwest of here. The men that made it off that boat were either captured or killed by the Skitterweb spiders of the region. For that, the spiders must die! ALL OF THEM!

Travel to the Skittering Dark and crush those insects!

Be on the lookout for their matriarch. Perhaps if we find her we can end this menace forever!

 Quest Hand-in: The root of this evil must be found and destroyed! The Skitterweb matriarch must be nearby. No doubt hiding in the nearby cave!
Title: Allies in Val'sharah

Description: <Your sharptalon hatchling stubbornly refuses to enter Val'sharah when you approach.> 

<Though they revere nature, the Dreamweavers also must maintain the balance of nature, and began an aggressive campaign against the falcosaurs once their invasiveness was noted. It has likely seen the druids of Val'sharah slaughter some members of its flock.>

<Show your falcosaur that you and it can work alongside the Dreamweavers.>

 Quest Hand-in: <The hatchling no longer shivers when entering the dense foliage of Val'sharah. It will need some time to recover from this adventure.>
Title: The Stoneplow Convoy

Description: I tried to save as many of the Stoneplow envoys as I could but these "mantid" dragged many of them off into the jungle.

These are civilians in need of our help.

Please take the herbs you gathered earlier. I've infused them with what gifts of the Light are still granted me. Use them on as many of the Stoneplow envoys as you can.

 Quest Hand-in: The civilians are trickling in thanks to you. These "mantid" creatures are a serious threat. We will need to rally our forces soon to help.One of the envoys asked me to give this to you as a token of thanks.
Title: Felwort Analysis

Description: I sent felwort samples to some of my fellow herbalists, but haven't heard back from them yet. Could you please follow up with them and collect their analyses.

Ryno Bloomfield is currently working in Un'goro Crater.

Dani Earthtouch is researching Freya's influence in Sholazar Basin.

Finally, Lohor has been working in the overgrown portion of Gorgrond.

 Quest Hand-in: Much of this is very technical and mundane, but Ryno's analysis can be applied right away.Look at this, here...
Title: To Darkhaven

Description: Across this bridge is the hamlet of Darkhaven. It is fortified by those loyal to Sire Denathrius. These pitiful rebels would not dare approach it.

However, getting to it may prove challenging. Here, I shall carry the anima, you make sure no one throws us back into the Endmire.

 Quest Hand-in: It may not look like it, but this rebellion is on its last leg. Those who stand against the Master are fools who will know a new form of pain and suffering.
Title: Slaughter at Boulder'mok

Description: I know that we have plans for you to head to Boulder'mok. I have something that I want you to do while you are there.

We must take any chance we can get to strike down the ogres of these mountains, or they will overrun us, and all that we have bled and died for will be for nothing!

Boulder'mok lies to the west. Travel southwest, cross the bridge and head through the tunnel. On the west side of the Raven's Wood you will find them.

{name}, I want you to wipe out the Bladespire ogres of Boulder'mok.

 Quest Hand-in: <Lieutenant Fairweather grins at the story that you tell her about your adventures at Boulder'mok.>Ah, I wish that I could have been there with you.  Let me tell you something, <name>: never accept any duty that keeps you from the glory of the battlefield!Hah!  After all of the ogre killing that you've done, are there any still left in these mountains for me?!
Title: Pristine Petrified Bone Whip

Description: This artifact has been restored to a remarkably excellent condition.  Perhaps you will put it on display at the Seat of Knowledge, so that lorewalkers and archaeologists can study it.

 Quest Hand-in: This will aid lorewalkers and archaeologists in understanding the history of Pandaria.
Title: Filling the Tanks

Description: <The containment pack appears to be intact, albeit empty. Perhaps refilling it with the appropriate mixture of liquids will render it functional once more.

Slaying the correct combination of slimes should provide all the fluid necessary.>

 Quest Hand-in: An amazing find! You seem to have salvaged a fully charged unit... just throw this switch to activate it!
Title: Overwhelmed!

Description: You there, {class}! Help me!

We're losing valuable lives! There are simply too many wounded for me to tend to alone. If we can't get our soldiers healed we could be run out of Grizzly Hills altogether!

Take this tourniquet and use it on the wounded down on the battlefield.

Hurry, {name}! They're dyyying!!

 Quest Hand-in: Oh, thank you, thank you.You've helped us to live another day. Perhaps there's hope yet.
Title: It Is A Mystery

Description: We have detected several... anomalies in these mines, of an arcane or spiritual nature. They are disrupting our attempts to discern the nature of the magic used in the spirit binding rituals here.

They are quite elusive, but we've managed to isolate the arcane signature of one of these anomalies, and one of our mages has enchanted this bauble with its signature.

Take the bauble. It will begin to glow more brightly as you approach the anomaly. Once you reach it, you can use the bauble to draw it out.

 Quest Hand-in: Ahh, yes. I received word from one of our researchers that they are no longer troubled by that anomaly. Well done.
Title: Learning The Reins

Description: Most of the tournament's competitions require competitors to master the command of a mount in battle. In order to familiarize you with mounted combat, we've put up training dummies all over the northern part of the tournament grounds.

Visit the stables outside the pavilion, equip your lance, and mount up on the Sunreaver hawkstrider. Familiarize yourself with the mount and use its abilities to defeat the three different kinds of training dummies. 


 Quest Hand-in: Well done, <name>. Mounted combat is often hard to pick up for those accustomed to fighting on foot. I have no doubt that you'll continue to improve with practice, which is more than I can say for some warriors.
Title: Sizing Up The Opposition

Description: Turalyon was no doubt hoping for better news, but I fear I cannot provide it. Attempting to drive into the heart of the Legion now would cost us everything.

There must be another way. I do not know what it is, but I trust that we will find it.

Best not keep Turalyon waiting. We must move forward.

 Quest Hand-in: <Turalyon listens in grim silence.>
Title: Some Like It Hot

Description: I've been making progress in my research, {name}. Based on what we've witnessed in the local flora, it's quite possible that your Lasher also accepts superheated liquids as a principal source of nutrition.

I'd like you to help me with a little experiment. The Emberspit Scorpions that inhabit the Magma Springs to the north spew out burning pools of fire during combat.

Take the Lasher and observe his reaction to the scorpions' Ember Pools.

 Quest Hand-in: Did it work? So my theory was correct?
Title: Cooking Meat

Description: This is Alaria, a draenei shaman who was with the lost expedition.

She's nearly starved to death. We need to get her something to eat!

Slay some of the nearby wildlife for their meat. Bring whatever you find here to cook.

If we can help Alaria regain her strength, she might be able to tell us what happened to the others.

 Quest Hand-in: <Alaria quickly eats the meat that you cooked.>By the Light... I feel so much better.You need to keep moving... quilboar have kidnapped the expedition, including Captain Garrick's son!
Title: Fair Exchange for a Soul

Description: While we work away here in the Conservatory, we must not forget to support the rest of the covenant.

I am needed here, but you can range far, even though your legs are short. 

Please, help our covenant recover the anima we need. I can then dedicate my time to preparing another spirit for you to restore.

 Quest Hand-in: You continue to serve the conservatory well. For this you have my thanks.Now you may choose from the spirits I have collected myself for restoration.
Title: Reinforcements

Description: The resources you gather can be used to recruit new troops for the war effort.

Return to me periodically to issue new recruitment orders for your missions.

If you have available resources, you should use them now to issue your first recruitment order.

The war effort rages on even as we speak. We have need of fresh recruits.

 Quest Hand-in: Good. Your new recruits will be available for missions once they have finished their training.
Title: Buy Us Some Time

Description: Many good warriors have been lost today.

If what the shaman says is true, then we must act swiftly or we will add to their numbers.

The naga are out there, scouring these waters looking for survivors.

We are not yet ready to fight, {race}. You must buy us time to make preparations.

Find the naga that hunt us and delay their efforts.

 Quest Hand-in: Let us hope that your work has bought us the time we need...
Title: Honored Attendance

Description: It is my humble honor to be the Ember Court's first guest.

Please inform Prince Renathal and all of your other compatriots that I will certainly attend whenever you wish to open the gates.

 Quest Hand-in: If Kassir is coming, we had better ensure this is a formal affair.
Title: Bwonsamdi's Deliverance

Description: We be havin' a task from Bwonsamdi, da loa a death, ta purge dis place of its undead.

Dey be controlled by a monster called Kel'vax.

Can ya help? Dere be zombies destroyin' Bwonsamdi's temple over dere, and we no have da strength ta fight 'em all.

Take dis torch. Kill dem zombies, den burn them corpses with da torch. It should be deliverin' their souls ta Bwonsamdi.

Ya do dat, and we be one step closer ta stoppin Kel'vax.

 Quest Hand-in: Ya did good, I can tell Bwonsamdi be pleased by ya releasin' his followers.
Title: By Hook Or By Crook

Description: I suppose he'll come around with some cold water to the face. What do you think he'll tell us?

I'll secure him inside our livestock pen behind me here. I don't think he'll stay conscious long. Find out what you can about why the quilboar are attacking our farms! I'll leave the interrogation methods up to your better judgment.

 Quest Hand-in: Very interesting - our brute here seems both enthralled and terrified of the one they call "Tortusk." A powerful leader can inspire his people to acts of greatness or atrocity... but we orcs would know that more than others.We should turn our attention to this Tortusk problem.
Title: Mystery of the Infinite

Description: A time storm at the Bronze Dragonshrine to the northeast is keeping immortals from entering.

The Infinite Dragonflight are in a fight inside with the defenders to wrest control of the dragonshrine. We must take this opportunity to gain information.

You are not immortal. You can cross into the dragonshrine and use the Hourglass of Eternity. Protect the hourglass for long enough and the leader of the Infinite Dragonflight should be revealed.

Be warned, the Infinite Dragonflight will try to stop you!

 Quest Hand-in: You saw Nozdormu? That doesn't make any sense.<Chromie thinks a moment about what you've said.>Actually, that's great news! We had no idea of where or when the Lord of Time had gone to. We just knew that he had disappeared to deal with very important matters.So, even though the leader of the Infinite Dragonflight wasn't revealed, you've discovered that Nozdormu is alive and well, and fighting back against them!Thank you, <name>. I'll be seeing you soon!
Title: The Price is Death

Description: We've long believed that the ocean is big enough for all that wish to call it home. 

Unfortunately, the naga don't see it that way. 

They kill and capture our kind without remorse, and it's about time they paid the price.

 Quest Hand-in: If they're dead, they can't hurt me anymore. If I keep telling myself that, soon enough I'll believe it, right?
Title: Ready for Battle

Description: Welcome to the warfront, {name}.

Our recruits are eager to join you on the battlefield.

A good place to start would be Ralston. I'm sure he's got a few who could learn much fighting by your side.

 Quest Hand-in: With our allies rallying by your side on the battlefield I have no doubt we will remove the Horde threat from Arathi.
Title: Turnabout Betrayal

Description: Enchantress Ilanya remembers me?

<The satyr pauses to wipe a tear away.>

I made a fool's bargain ten millennia ago. I learned of the queen's alliance with the Legion and betrayed my heart to join their side. I was transformed into a monstrosity, only to die in battle against the mortals.

Now the Legion returns, but I linger as an impotent spirit. Be my vessel and slay the demons ahead of us. Take their demonic runes and render them to dust.

 Quest Hand-in: After watching these demons helplessly for so long, you have given me a chance to strike back at them!Now the real work begins.
Title: Rituals of Blood

Description: Anji and I have fought in many battles, so we know how to handle a few mogu, but the blood magic used by these Dokani is just unsettling!

As if it weren't bad enough for them to kill everyone in their path, but to use their corpses to fuel their unholy rituals? I just can't stomach it!

Do me a favor. If you ever come across any of these rituals, put a stop to them! Even our enemies don't deserve to be defiled with their dark magic.

 Quest Hand-in: It is a relief to know that you've put an end to those rituals.Just thinking about them turns my stomach.
Title: The Mogu Agenda

Description: Mogu don't often gather in numbers like this. We should find out what they are up to.

I thought I heard someone shouting orders near the center of the ruins.

We should probably see if he has information.

 Quest Hand-in: Wait. This document talks about the Pools of Youth!The pools exist?!
Title: Filthy Mongrels

Description: Those flea-bitten Hyena Mongrels the gnolls breed have got to go! Not only do they have no manners at all--you would not believe the places I've seen them relieve themselves--but they may very well be able to sniff me out despite my exemplary illusions.

Do the well-mannered world a favor and remove them from it.

 Quest Hand-in: Play dead, indeed!
Title: Face Your Fears

Description: The temple is now accessible. We must go now to aid Mikanikos in breaking the Sire's influence on the crown.

Prepare yourself. Denathrius's magic has always been potent and destructive. 

This won't be easy.

 Quest Hand-in: With the echo of Denathrius defeated, Mikanikos assures me the crown is pure.This is a key victory for Revendreth and all the Shadowlands.
Title: A Promise of Earth

Description: Deepholm thanks you, shaman.

The Twilight's Hammer has always sought dominion over my kingdom, but this latest threat was far greater than their previous efforts.

For your service to the elements of earth, I will pledge my armies to the Earthen Ring in the defense of Azeroth.

I have no love for the mortal races, but this world is not the Burning Legion's to destroy.

Tell your Earthen Ring that Therazane the Stonemother stands with them!

 Quest Hand-in: It is good to see you safely back, Farseer. With Therazane's allegiance, we now have three of the Elemental Lords united to our cause.However, one still remains...
Title: The Dread Citadel - Naxxramas

Description: Long ago, magical wards placed upon Naxxramas stymied our attempts to assault Kel'Thuzad's forces. Though I was able to conceal our army past them, I have since learned to dispel them should the need ever arise.

I will confess my disbelief of your story. However, if you are so devoted to this investigation, I will enchant your insignia so you may breach these barriers yourself. For a price.

 Quest Hand-in: You will feel a slight tingle, <name>. That sensation means it's working. Once complete, you should be able to see whatever it is you believe you will find.
Title: A Spear Through My Side, A Chain Through My Soul

Description: My fate is sealed. The yaungol put this spear in my side. The wound will kill me.

The yaungol hold me in place with their twisted, corrupted magic. The indignity of it hurts worse than my spear-wound.

My death, I cannot stop. My imprisonment... you may be able to help me with this.

 Quest Hand-in: I am freed.The yaungol must be stopped.
Title: Stuff We All Get

Description: A lot of competitors meet their end in the Theater of Pain. But their weapons are still good as new!

It can get expensive to equip a fresh recruit, especially if you're not sure they'll survive their first bout. That's why we outfit them with "slightly used" armaments.

Gather them up for me, would you? Can't let a good weapon go to waste!

 Quest Hand-in: These weapons will be put to good use. Hopefully, we won't have to collect some of them again.
Title: A Present for Teacher

Description: I'm all caught up with the other kids now, even though I started very late. Now I can join the regular classes!

I made you an apron to show you how much I appreciate all you've done for me. I hope you like it?

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you so much.
Title: Orfus of Kamagua

Description: Hail, traveler. I am Lunk-tusk of the Kalu'ak. We are known as tuskarr to your people. My partner and I were recently sent up to investigate strange happenings along one of our hunting trails. It was when we approached the graveyard known as Shield Hill that we were attacked by the undead. I was lucky to make it to this camp, but I am uncertain as to what became of Orfus.

We parted ways at the Ancient Lift, southeast of here along the cliff edge. Will you go see if he is ok?

 Quest Hand-in: Lunk-tusk lives? At least there is some good news to be had on this day...
Title: Joint Rescue Operation

Description: Tomul says the attacks on the Windtotem were carried out by an enemy clan known as the Nokhud. 

Just down this road is their closest outpost, and the most likely location where tauren prisoners would be taken.

The task is simple--rescue the captives. We do not know how many there are, or how long they have been here, so we must hurry.

I speak from experience when I say centaur do not keep their captives for long.

 Quest Hand-in: We have scoured the camp and saved who we could, but Bovan is not among the captives.
Title: The Underground Menace

Description: Lion killer, chicken chaser, new Frenzyheart slave...

I know you no want to stay slave, so I tell you what to do. Show you better than the other Frenzyheart hunters and then Rakjak respect you.

Under sands of south river there a beast that kills wasp, apes, and even wolvar. He called Serfex. You bring claw of Serfex to Rakjak and maybe he release you from slaveness.

Hope Dajik teaching you good so Serfex be easy stuff.

 Quest Hand-in: You kill Serfex? I bet you follow mighty wolvar that kill Serfex and take claw.My claw now.
Title: The Irontide Crew

Description: You see those salty looking guys in red? That's the Irontide crew.

They're the worst of the worst. Cutthroats and brigands, to a man.

Irontide wouldn't be guarding the docks if they didn't stand to gain something...

Lighten their pockets. See what kinda hardware they've got.

 Quest Hand-in: Just as I thought - Irontide cut some kind of deal with Ashvane.Figures... birds of a feather and all that.
Title: The Adept's Path

Description: Your time as an apprentice has come to an end, {name}. You are ready to advance to the rank of adept, to become a full blood knight in service to Silvermoon.

To honor your accomplishments, the warchief has commissioned his personal smith to forge a weapon for you.

The cursed Shadowfang Keep in Silverpine Forest is the only place to get the materials you'll need. Travel there and recover the holy symbol of Commander Springvale, a supply of moonsteel ingots, and sinew from the ghouls and geists there.

 Quest Hand-in: I don't know how you came by such a large supply of moonsteel, <name>, but I haven't worked with it in years. It will be both a challenge and a pleasure to create this weapon for you.
Title: Celebrating Good Times

Description: Seek out Major Mattingly in the Valley of Heroes, {name}. He will be expecting you...

 Quest Hand-in: Few are graced with such ceremony, <name>. Please, choose your reward so that we may begin the celebration.
Title: The Perfect Horse, of Course

Description: With all that you've collected for me... I guess it is time to mount, isn't it?

Hoo! I haven't felt such nerves for three hundred years! Would you mind assisting me in finding a suitable equine partner? I could not trust myself to make the decision alone!

 Quest Hand-in: He's on! He's on!Don't worry, <name>. I'm sure he'll be fine! Thanks for all of your help!
Title: A Champion Rises

Description: You have earned my respect and the respect of your peers. You defeated all who challenged you and mastered the ways of tournament combat. I have no doubt that you are ready to face down the champions of other cities for the glory of the Forsaken!

Justicar Mariel Trueheart has asked to speak with you, {name}, and to formally enter you in the champions' grand melee.

 Quest Hand-in: I welcome you as a champion of the tournament, <name>. As a champion, you will be able to compete for the grand championship of the tournament. You may also choose to become a valiant with another Horde city's delegation and in time, a champion for that city as well.All champions must have the assistance of a squire, <name>, and you are no exception. Allow me to appoint one of ours to accompany you in battle. He will proudly carry the banner of any city that has named you a champion.
Title: Remembering the Ancestors

Description: The living are not the only ones who require sustenance. One of my duties is to prepare the rice cakes that are left for the ancestors. Normally, my senior apprentice has the honor of taking the cakes to the Temple of the Moon for blessing and then presenting them to the ancestors. Since she is out of the city today, would you mind performing the duty in her place?

 Quest Hand-in: <You lay out the rice cakes around the shrine, which begins to glow softly. A faint sense of approval washes over you.>
Title: Iron Horde Orders

Description: Spirit spotted some orders at the Iron Horde camp on the nearby bluff. You must have missed them when you were there. Could you look into it?

 Quest Hand-in: These orders are written with terrible handwriting.
Title: Rise, Champions

Description: The Legion's defeat cannot be accomplished alone.

To win this war, we must work together, just as we did in ancient times.

To begin, we must recruit more druids to our aid. Speak to the troll Zen'tabra and the night elf Naralex.

Both of them are accomplished druids. They will gladly defend the Dreamgrove.

 Quest Hand-in: Good. I know Zen'tabra and Naralex, and they will serve the Dreamgrove bravely.
Title: Walk Among Ghosts

Description: Every year, we ask a champion of our people to perform an act of remembrance in honor of those who fell to the Scourge. Lady Liadrin has performed this ritual, as have I, among others. This year, I am honored to give the task to you.

<The Regent Lord hands you an ornate lantern.>

This lantern carries a flame born of the Sunwell. I would ask that you bring it to locations that were significant to the fall of the Sunwell and of Quel'Thalas, and to light the memories we cannot forget.

 Quest Hand-in: This land will never recover from the damage that was done here. But we lost so much more than land that day.
Title: Moozy's Sojourn

Description: My son! They took him! My wife and I split up to look for him. She went upriver and I went downriver.

Leave me, please, and find Moozy... I might be okay... If you find Moozy, please bring him to my wife upriver.

 Quest Hand-in: <Moozy squeals in delight at your presence.>
Title: Nine's Plan

Description: My benefactors used their diminutive intellect to construct an interplanetary transport. As designed, this so-called "Rocket" is a death trap. But I suspect a simple re-engineering of the fuel catalyst semifold would render a stable mixture, providing a breathable oxygen byproduct. To implement such changes, I require the original engineering plans.

Locate the Laboratory Archives and ring the doorbell to gain entry. The plans will be held by the lab director himself, presuming he still lives.


 Quest Hand-in: <The raptor snatches the paperwork in her prehensile claws and holds the schematics up to her face, clucking her pointed teeth dismissively.>These are like the scrawling of children. Common sense precludes the routing of control hydraulics so near to the secondary stage burners! Still, this is salvageable.Do you know how to refactor fuel matrixes for pressure variations at a fixed acceleration? No? Very well, perhaps you can do something else for me while I reconfigure the rocket...
Title: Drain Schematics

Description: The schematics you've obtained show an underground system of drains and pumps that connect the lakes in the region to Serpent Lake.

If the schematics are correct, there is a giant drain in the center of Serpent Lake.  Confirm this and bring the news to Cenarion Refuge.

 Quest Hand-in: The naga have turned Serpent Lake into a giant water sink for the rest of Zangarmarsh.  What could they possibly be doing?You've done well in bringing this news to us, <name>.  We will send a team to investigate this drain you've discovered.  I have a different task for you in the meanwhile.
Title: Beastmaster's Hunt: The Crane

Description: Along with the snare, you get some advice on crane hunting:

The greatest cranes of the Krasarang Wilds don't care about simple things like food. You need to play on the creatures' emotions if you want to draw them out of the jungle.

There's plenty of cranes on the Cradle of Chi-ji and on the Narsong Spires, both to the west of here. Pluck some of those cranes' quills, then put them in a visible spot near the Crane Temple. Your quarry will come running to you.

 Quest Hand-in: You place the feathers in the dirt, then look off in the direction of the temple...
Title: Blueprint: Personal Time Displacer

Description: <This blueprint details how to build what appears to be a complex time-manipulation device.

You should be able to upload the blueprint to Pascal-K1N6's database in Rustbolt.>

 Quest Hand-in: Have you recovered a new blueprint, my fleshy friend?I will add it to my database posthaste.
Title: Nobundo Awaits

Description: Nobundo and the other champions of the Earthen Ring have gathered down below. They are awaiting your arrival, Farseer.

A great ritual is about to take place and they have requested your presence. Do not worry about your administrative duties for now, I'll take care of things here.

Nobundo is waiting for you now. May the elements be with you, Farseer.

 Quest Hand-in: I hear you have been making good progress down among the Broken Isles. Good. We, too, have been busy here at the Maelstrom.There are important matters that await us...
Title: Between Us and Freedom

Description: The last of our survivors have fought their way into the final chamber ahead.

Only one obstacle stands between us and the vault's exit - the leader of this demon invasion, Bastillax.

Kill him, take his power, and claim our freedom.

 Quest Hand-in: We escaped the Vault, but our work is far from over.The Legion's assault on this world is just beginning.If Azeroth is to survive, we may have to work with this... Archmage Khadgar.
Title: I'm Too Old for This Ship

Description: If I understood this correctly, the Lord Admiral of the Kul Tiran navy wants me to come out of retirement specifically to build a ship for the king of Stormwind.

Can't say I've had THAT request before.

<Dorian leans back in her chair for a moment and rubs at her eyes.>

I'm getting too old for this nonsense.

<Dorian heaves a long sigh.>

Go on out back and saddle Hurricane for me while I pack my things. We will meet you at Port Fogtide.

We're going to need a slip.

 Quest Hand-in: Well. This complicates things a touch.
Title: Heavy Grinding Stone

Description: To help with my workout, I like to fit a staff between heavy grinding stones, then lift the staff over my head.  It isn't easy, but being the strongest woman in the world, like I am, can't be earned sitting down!

Can you help me?  I need more grinding stones - bring me some and I'll trade Darkmoon Faire tickets for them.

 Quest Hand-in: You brought the stones!  And they're heavy!  I can already feel my muscles getting bigger.  Thanks <name>!Here, take these tickets, and be sure not to eat too many sweets while you're at the faire.  A big strong <class> like you needs to keep himself in fighting shape!
Title: Ezul'aan Calls

Description: Ezul'aan, one of the foremost paladins in the realm, has asked to speak with you personally. I do not know what he has planned, but it sounds like he has been impressed with your rapid progress.

You should make your way to Stormwind immediately and meet him at the Training Hall in the Old Town district.

 Quest Hand-in: It heartens me to see that my message found you, <name>. We have much to discuss.
Title: 7th Legion Battle Plans

Description: While destroying Pyrewood will certainly garner us an advantage over the Alliance upon the field of battle, our true purpose here is to leave them crippled.

Southwest of here, near the Greymane Wall, lies the 7th Legion Base Camp. We must search the base camp for battle plans. With the 7th Legion battle plans we will be able to pinpoint all Alliance troop advancement in Silverpine Forest.

 Quest Hand-in: <Walden flips through the battle plan.>It looks like the reinforcements from the ships in Gilneas are marching soon. Crowley and Bloodfang have set up an encampment to the southeast for the Gilneas Liberation front.
Title: Powder Play

Description: Our shipments of saltpeter from Dustwallow have been held up, which means we can't manufacture our own gunpowder here.

But I can retrofit our armaments to use goblin Blast-O powder. It's unstable, dangerous, toxic to the skin, and harmful if swallowed... but I think I can make it work!

Get me a keg of the stuff by attacking one of those goblin sapper specialists who've been storming our walls.

 Quest Hand-in: Great! Set the keg down right here. I'll measure out some charges once I've donned my full-body protective gear.
Title: Nuts for Berries

Description: Oh! What a relief it is to see a fresh face. I was beginning to feel we had been forsaken.

Our supply lines were cut off days ago, and things have been looking - well, bleak. To be honest, this was a suicide mission to begin with if you ask me.

Maybe I'm simply not cut out for all of this violence - to say nothing of the bitter cold! I'd much rather be back in Dalaran studying ancient texts.

To the point, our food supply is nearly spent. Please, gather what you can and bring it to me.

 Quest Hand-in: Well, it's not much, but it should keep us alive for another day.I believe you'll find this to be a fair price for your efforts.
Title: Princely Visit

Description: This is it! The fabled Mechagon!

The greatest discovery of our age, and you're here to witness me accomplish it!

<Tinkmaster Overspark puffs out his chest, brushes off his robes, and smiles confidently.>

I am ready to address the Mechagon people. You may accompany me.

 Quest Hand-in: Welcome to the Rustbolt Resistance.
Title: Proclamation Reclamation

Description: You know who likes to hear themselves talk, loves bureaucracy, and enchants their own records? Dragons!

Go poke around in the old black dragon fort north of Loamm. I'm sure they'll be all sort of magic-ish decrees, proclamations, and shopping lists just lying around!

Bring whatever you uncover to Scridorsa the Chiseler back in Loamm. I'm sure she'd love something new and heavily enchanted to read!

 Quest Hand-in: <Scridorsa flips through the documents.>"By my hand...", "The will of the Earth-Warder...", "At my command..." Sounds like a dragon, sure enough!Still, these should make for an interesting study, if not read.
Title: Going to Waste

Description: Me wee rogue friend Lowping were
gnome-napped by them dirty naga when we got 'ere. He's gone! They drug him right oft toward tha cove!

But 'ere's tha real issue. He 'ad a schematic on 'im fer one of me greatest inventions.

And by "on 'im," I mean I tattooed it to tha top o' his head. FOR SAFETY!

When ye find 'im, jes shave 'is head and make a quick copy o' tha design.

 Quest Hand-in: Oh aye, yeh get me schematic! Here, keep a copy fer yerself, in case yer lookin' for somethin' to tattoo somewheres.It's a damn shame about Lowping. Yeh know, come ta think of it, maybe we shoulda rescued him. Ah! Multi-tasking were never my thing.
Title: I'm A Huge Liar and a Fraud

Description: I have no idea what this artifact is.  I have no idea where I would even START finding out what it is.

In fact, I have no idea why anybody expected ME to be able to identify it in the first place.

I asked for water because I was thirsty.  I asked for the jewelry and furs for... well, they're for my girlfriend.

Hopefully I can at least point you in the right direction.  Garley Lightrider in Booty Bay is a member of the Reliquary, and might be of more use than me.

Sorry.

 Quest Hand-in: Fascinating!I'll need some time to study this.  Why don't you have a look around Booty Bay and come back later?
Title: The Ranger Lord

Description: Good to see you survived the wreck. Nathanos made it as well, though his face is now even uglier than before.

He took a group of rangers north to look for Sylvanas - nobody has seen her since the battle.

He asked me to send you his way if you ever woke up.

 Quest Hand-in: <Nathanos narrows his eyes at the wreckage of Sylvanas' ship.>She's out there... she has to be.
Title: Know Where to Strike

Description: It is the Wild Hunt's duty to hunt down those who would harm our charges and to ensure the security of our borders. But as the crisis has grown, so have our duties to Queen and Grove.

This is where I come in. It is my duty to be aware of all that goes on within the endless forest. It is my charge to help deploy our resources, so that we may aid our queen.

Allow me to demonstrate...

 Quest Hand-in: They will succeed in their mission, I have no doubt.
Title: Complete Your Training: The Final Test

Description: Welcome back, {name}.  The time has come for you to complete the last step of your training.  Head to the Training Grounds for your final test.

 Quest Hand-in: Well done, <name>.  Your training is now complete.  Feel free to return in the future to spar with the masters here to practice what you have learned.
Title: Playing Dirty

Description: Have you seen the huge lumbering ettins roaming the forests? Cursed things came from Gilneas. Now they wander the land searching for their next juicy meal. We've managed to subjugate and utilize some of them to haul our wagons, but the others... well, they must be killed!

Unfortunately, we can't spare any soldiers to do the job. That's where you come in, {class}!

I have a plan, but it's going to require some materials. Head out into the forests around this base and collect diseased beast organs.

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent! Now to prepare the "meal."
Title: WANTED: Hilaani

Description: We need more meat, commander.

I know what you're thinking. What about all of that meat right behind me?

That's the problem. It'll be gone in a day if we're lucky.

There's a riverbeast that lives in the lake to the south. Locals call her Hilaani. Massive, lots of meat.

If you would take down the beast and bring me her meat, your wolves will be better off for it.

 Quest Hand-in: Is that what I think it is? You are too kind, commander!
Title: Might of the Earthen

Description: At first glance, this pillar seems very plain, but your knowledge of archaeology tells you differently.  If you had a Dwarf Rune Stone, its originations could be brought to light.

 Quest Hand-in: Ah ha!  You knew you'd seen this level of craftsmanship before.  Now, with the final piece...
Title: Fencing the Rose

Description: Looking to sell something?

 Quest Hand-in: Ah yes, an eternium rose.  I heard vendors suddenly stopped buying them... something about the resell value being too low.You're in luck though, because I know a collector who still wants them.  In fact, I can take this one off your hands, but you'll have to come back tomorrow if you have another one to sell.
Title: Go with Honor, Friend

Description: This mission ended up being far more than any of us expected, {name}, and you did very well. I shudder to think of what would have happened without you here. 

Some time back, the King commissioned a set of armor be made. Armor to adorn our greatest heroes. 

You have proven yourself more than deserving of such honor.

Meet me in the Valley of Heroes, {name}.

 Quest Hand-in: You have done so much for this city. Thank you, hero. Wear this armor with pride.
Title: Peculiar Delicacies

Description: Hey bub, interested in making an extra dime?

I've got it on good authority that some interested parties are paying BIG money for silithid legs.  Yes, you heard me right, silithid legs!  Apparently these things are delicious if you cook them right.  They're like underground lobsters, and they live just south of here.

Thing is, I'll need a good amount of them to pay for my overhead.  Think you could get me 8 dozen or so?

 Quest Hand-in: Brilliant!  We're on the cusp of something big here, <name>.  Here's your share of the inevitably huge profits.Now, on to other matters...
Title: Ari's Package

Description: Look! It was right here under our noses. "Arcanists Guide to Rare Diseases." Sheepish thing. Most books just want to be dusted off and read from time to time. We will leave the phials of nightwell energy and it will go with you meekly enough.

Here. I have packaged the book up for you to bring to Khadgar. I wrapped it in moth's wings to keep it soothed and light-hearted. And there is a gift for you. Just a small thing, really.

 Quest Hand-in: Ari found just the book I needed! And she included a ring for you as well.
Title: The Key to the Focusing Iris

Description: A potent thrumming of magical nature can be heard and felt emanating from the eye-shaped jewel dropped from Sapphiron's clutches. To mortal ears it is nearly painful to be in the presence of the stone.

Surely such a powerful item of import can only be taken to the queen of the dragons, Alexstrasza the Life-Binder. Seek her counsel atop Wyrmrest Temple in the Dragonblight.

 Quest Hand-in: These keys are held by the most ancient members of the blue dragonflight. Only they are entrusted with them by their master, Malygos.This is the break that we've been waiting for to strike at the Aspect of Magic!<The queen of dragons studies you for a brief moment.>You are not able to use the key as-is to access the Focusing Iris, but I can imbue you with a portion of my power; enough to enable you to use it to open the iris a fraction.It will be enough to draw Malygos's ire!
Title: Setting the Defense

Description: Custodian Cynegos and I were just discussing the impact the Primalist attack has had on the plans to assault the Cobalt Assembly, and I had an idea. 

<Celeste withdraws a wand from the folds of her robes.>

Take my wand and empower their weapons!

A little bit of fire should do the trick...

 Quest Hand-in: Fantastic job! After repelling their attack on the camp, it's imperative that we keep the Primalists on the back foot. Now please give me my wand back.
Title: Spirits of the Feralfen

Description: The most powerful tribe of Lost Ones in the marsh, the Feralfen, are said to possess powerful medicine. There may be no truth to such rumors, but anything that might help me channel the spirits of this world cannot be ignored.

Find the Feralfen mystics, hunters and druids, {name}, and capture their totems. Everything I need to know should be apparent from the carvings.

 Quest Hand-in: Hmm... They seem to be divided between images of a serpent spirit and a bird spirit. No self-respecting Darkspear troll engages in bird worship. Their spirits are weak, capricious, and best left to the Amani.But the serpent, <name>, the serpent wields considerable power and this is the spirit I shall study.
Title: Lost in Zem'lan

Description: Legends say that a mountain of treasure sits deep inside the Port of Zem'lan, pillaged from every corner of Azeroth. But it's guarded by unkillable, eternal monsters.

No vulpera or exile has ever stolen treasure from the Port of Zem'lan and made it out alive.

My caravan was going to be the first. Our scout, Meeki snuck in to figure out a route, but he never came back.

It would be wisest for you to leave here and never return. But, if you go into the port, please find Meeki.

 Quest Hand-in: <Meeki has been stabbed multiple times. He is clearly dead.>
Title: The Mead Master

Description: The Storm Brew is created by a legendary vrykul brewmaster named Melba. Here is the location of her meadery along the northern Stormheim coast.

If we can convince her to share her secret recipe with us, we will gain a significant advantage over the enemy.

Grandmaster, how are your skills of persuasion?

 Quest Hand-in: My master was loved by many, and she passed her knowledge to me.However, the recipe for Storm Brew, her most fiercely guarded secret, was stolen before she could teach it to me.
Title: The Primalist Front

Description: The Khanam Matra sent word that she and her forces have arrived in the Emerald Gardens. They've located Koroleth and her Primalists. It appears a massive enemy invasion is gathering on a beach to the north.

Wisely, she has several scouts watching strategic locations around the battlefield. Go and collect their reports, then meet me and my forces at the battlefront. Glory awaits us in battle, and, if we succeed, there will be vengeance.

 Quest Hand-in: Our enemies are one step ahead of us. Do not despair. Our resolve is as strong as our alliance. Prepare yourself, <name>.
Title: The Lost Empire

Description: You have proven that you are willing to assist the Azjol Empire in its time of need and as such the Azjol Empire will assist the Horde.

Take this scroll back to your leader. It documents the strengths and weaknesses of the Nerubians attacking Icemist Village. Consider it a gesture of good faith - a willingness to help your people. Use the knowledge on those pages to crush the Anub'ar and you will have done a service for us all.

Farewell, {race}.


 Quest Hand-in: <Overlord Agmar looks over the document.>Is this what I think it is? With the information contained within these pages we will CRUSH the Anub'ar assault!You have done well to bring this document to me, <name>. Perhaps you will be allowed to watch or even participate in the final battle at Angrathar! LOK'TAR!
Title: Secret Communication

Description: Some of the Twilight's Hammer cultists carry around little papers with gibberish written on them.  I want you to bring me a stack of them, {class}.

I can't figure out what the gibberish means, but that's not the point!  These papers are how their different groups communicate secretly.  The more texts we take out of circulation, the less they can communicate!

 Quest Hand-in: Excellent!  I'll stash these away, maybe they'll be useful later.
Title: Tailgunner!

Description: Okay, I've softened this guy up, how about you help me finish him off?

I've got a plan for our escape, but it'll require a lot of guts and a little luck.

You up for it, {name}?

Just follow my lead...

 Quest Hand-in: Good work back there, <name>.Looks like we've lost them, for now at least.
Title: Honor the Flame

Description: The Midsummer Fire Festival is a time to honor the elements.  The element of fire stirs passion within us all.  Many times, that passion pours out into aggressive actions.  But here, in this land, we focus our passion on reverence.

We will honor the flame as tradition dictates.  Will you honor the flame with us, {name}?

 Quest Hand-in: Honor the Townlong Steppes flame.
Title: The Funky Monkey Brew

Description: Pirates! Our shores have been scoured by the most ill-tempered, ill-mannered, ill-hygienic, and ill-good hozen that ever was found in Pandaria. And to make matters worse, they claim to serve the legendary Captain Ook!

We see them every night partying and brewing punch on their island Unga Ingoo.

 I say we take their brew for a change! I think I can even improve their mix.

Gather up some friends and meet me on the southern side of Unga Ingoo. It is time for a Brew Run!

 Quest Hand-in: A fine punch! A fine punch indeed! The sort of punch that punches back. Well done, <class>!
Title: Welcome To Our House

Description: Your ties to the other covenants had me doubting you would return. I see now that was foolish of me.

Outsider or not, you have stood bravely beside the armies of Maldraxxus. I am confident the Primus would have welcomed you into our ranks with pride.

One day, he might return as well. But we cannot afford to wait. 

In the Primus's absence, I will name you a Necrolord of Maldraxxus.

 Quest Hand-in: This is our war to win, Maw Walker. It is now yours, as well.
Title: Desert Research

Description: The dark blade of Sargeras has cast a shadow of destruction over this land.

It seemed that the silithid hives were destroyed in the attack, but I have received reports that the silithid are returning.

We need to find out how the silithid avoided destruction and what effect the blade is having on their hives.

The crown wants the surviving silithid dissected and studied. 

Tammy Tinkspinner is conducting the research and is in need of a "collector."

 Quest Hand-in: You're here to collect the samples? Let's get started!
Title: Lulubelle on Loan

Description: What you plan to do is pretty risky, you know? Summoning one sister would be difficult enough, but both of them at once? That's just asking for trouble.

Luckily, I'm up for the challenge. I'll help you and the rest of the council summon those demons, and hopefully restore pride to the Fizzlebang name.

 Quest Hand-in: With Lulubelle's assistance, we should be able to complete the summoning.
Title: The Cold Does Bother Them, Actually

Description: If there is one thing I have learned in my years as a seamstress, {name}, it is that adventurers will always underestimate the cold.

I have explorers in the Azure Span begging me for warmer robes.

Would you take pity on them and craft a few?

 Quest Hand-in: Thank you, <name>.Please, learn from these examples. Study them to improve your tailoring.And stay warm.
Title: Fragments of Disaster

Description: In the hall beyond rests the bones of the failed arcan'dor.

I will take fragments of the crystallized tree and attempt to read them. We must discover the root cause of this destruction.

Only then do we have any hope of preventing this disaster from repeating itself.

 Quest Hand-in: I will study these carefully. If we are fortunate, there will be answers.
Title: More Bat Eyes

Description: {name}, the attraction I'm designing will be the scariest event since Gnomeregan was overrun!  And it's largely thanks to you and all the baubles you've brought me.  Many, many thanks!

I don't need much else, but... if you bring me more evil bat eyes from the bats of the Eastern Plaguelands... I might have more Darkmoon Faire tickets for you.

 Quest Hand-in: Thanks again, <name>.  Here are your tickets!
Title: Engorged Goren

Description: You must be the {class} that so impressed Exarch Hataaru. Can you help?

The Elodor Dig just behind me is overrun by strange stone creatures. These so-called goren actually devour minerals, metabolize them, and grow crystalline structures from their arms and back. Like most of the wildlife on this world, they completely baffle us.

Please slay as many as you can and gather their crystal scales for me. You'll be protecting our earthworkers and aiding our research at the same time.

 Quest Hand-in: <The artificer withdraws a loop and peers intently at the scales you've brought him.>Unreal. The crystalline matrix is flawless, as if produced from one of our forges on Argus.I wish we could hook up these creatures to our machinery... but I suspect the Exarch would take issue with that.Thank you for your help!
Title: Artisan Tool Belt

Description: <The tool belt has many pouches and loops, and is outfitted with many tools and materials. 

It will allow your steward to not only assist you with crafting, but also carry common trade goods.>

 Quest Hand-in: Tools for me? Wow! Love making things.Look forward to working together more!
Title: Research Ruination

Description: The Cult of the Damned continue their work within the halls of Aldur'thar. 

Infiltrate their chambers and destroy their research. It may not stop them, but it will buy us valuable time.

 Quest Hand-in: We will see how long this postpones their efforts.
Title: Thorium Widget

Description: Yebb Nebblegear, like me, is working on a future attraction.  So amazing is this attraction, says Nebb, that it will draw folks from across the world... and it will make us all very, very rich!

He says he needs thorium widgets for its construction, and wants me to collect them for him.  So what do you say, {name}?  Do you know where to get Thorium widgets?  If you're an engineer, can you make them?  Do you want to trade them for Darkmoon Faire tickets?

 Quest Hand-in: Ah, thank you, <name>!  Yebb will enjoy these widgets.  I don't know what he has planned for them, but Yebb's a clever little gnome.  He's clever, and maybe a little devious....If only he liked the taste of humanoid flesh... he'd make a great troll!Here, <name>.  A deal's a deal, and these tickets are yours.
Title: Mantid Methodology

Description: <This amber sword was left behind as you knocked one of the Mantid back through a time rift.

You take a moment to ensure it's safe, then place it in your pack.

Perhaps Soridormi would be interested in it.>

 Quest Hand-in: <Soridormi turns the blade over in her hands and holds it up to the light.>This is the first time I've seen a blade made of pure amber.It's a lot sturdier than I expected, and quite dense.Good find, <name>. I will put it on the table, in case you want to look at it later.
Title: An Offering for Aviana

Description: Although the guardian of all winged creatures is no longer with us in body, I sometimes hear her voice in the whisper of swaying leaves.

{name}, we ask much of you as you set out to preserve this mountain. Before going on, take a moment to reflect.

Take this offering of nectar to Aviana's burial circle, a circle of stones just outside the main door of the shrine. Perhaps some time alone with Aviana's memory will help sharpen your focus.

 Quest Hand-in: <A whispered plea rings within your head.>To be born again, but in darkness...I have been stolen away.<The spirit appears frantic, but falls silent as her image fades.>
Title: Shadow of the Defiler

Description: Crimson energy swirls within this disturbing object, which seems to have slightly different contours each time your gaze returns to it.

Its power is utterly foreign, unlike anything you have seen in Draenor or during your battles with the Legion. Perhaps the keepers of Moonglade, back on Azeroth, might have some insight into its nature.

 Quest Hand-in: Where... where did you find this?
Title: The Proper Souls

Description: We must save as many souls as we can from the fate we have just witnessed.

Search the halls for souls who have escaped the Lord Chamberlain's perverse rituals. Subjugate them and bring them to me inside the Halls of Atonement.

Together, we will make certain that each soul is appropriately processed and cared for.

 Quest Hand-in: Every lost soul must be tended to.
Title: Gone Soft

Description: The fungal behemoths that surround us have succumbed to a weakness very similar to that that affects your kind. Their skin has grown soft. They no longer belong with the stone.

Kill them. We do not wish to see this infection spread.

 Quest Hand-in: You carry with you a certain degree of potency. I can find some respect for such strength, especially in your kind.My concerns are not yet abated. Not for the source of the overgrowth, and not for you.
Title: Blood and Gold

Description: The challengers gathered in the Valley of the Sword have brought with them offerings to the watchers of the vault. 

It might be a good idea to take some of these offerings with you to help in appeasing Yotnar.

 Quest Hand-in: I appreciate your gifts, outsider. You show great respect to the trials. You do well to honor our ways.
Title: None Left Behind

Description: Your friend has been doing everything she can to save my crew. I'm deeply appreciative.

We're still dealing with more than we can handle here: quenching the fires on the wreckage, getting my people out, fighting off these evil sea creatures, and trying to prevent the prisoners from escaping. We're simply in over our heads.

I still have men on the ship that we need to get clear before the wreckage collapses on them. I know this is asking a lot, but can you help?

 Quest Hand-in: I have no idea who you people are, but fate surely smiled on us this day. Many more would be dead if not for the help of you and your friends. I am in your debt.
Title: Return to Sathiel

Description: It all checks out as far as I can tell.

So, the question is, have you already spoken to Skymaster Brightdawn in Fairbreeze Village?  If so, then this can be as simple as you paying the small fare and quickly flying back.

Let me know when you're ready.

 Quest Hand-in: Well, I guess if he said that the rest of it will be coming quickly overland, then I'll take him at his word.  He's certainly never failed to provide the goods in the past.Thank you, <name>. Here take this coin... it's done nothing but jingle around in my pocket all day.
Title: Krom'gar Fortress

Description: Our main base of operations in Stonetalon Mountains is Krom'gar Fortress. It is from there that Overlord Krom'gar oversees all Horde military activity in the region. Krom'gar reports everything that happens directly to the Warchief.

The attack plans you brought back detail an assault that's supposed to take place against Krom'gar Fortress soon. Take the plans and head to the fortress, southwest of here. Give them to the Overlord.

So long, {name}. Truly, Hellscream's eyes are upon you.

 Quest Hand-in: <Overlord Krom'gar takes the plans from you.>Hmm. Perhaps this grunt is more than he would appear. Perhaps this grunt is in actuality a sergeant.Look now upon Krom'gar Sergeant <name>, soldiers. He has come to serve warning of a cowardly Alliance attack. An attack that we will CRUSH!
Title: Field Reports

Description: The Scourge can strike anytime, anywhere.

To counter their unpredictability, the Argent Crusade has secured key locations along the southern road heading east. However, I have yet to receive any reports from our scouts in the field.

With the erratic nature of these attacks, I fear the worst.

Travel the road and take stock of our outposts. I'll be expecting a full report when you return.

Light be with you, {name}.

 Quest Hand-in: This is far worse than we thought.Commander Gregor must be told of the true extent of the Scourge's resurgence.
Title: Corrupted Songflower

Description: You have found a sickly, corrupted version of what appears to be a songflower plant.  A pungent, unhealthy odor emanates from the plant.  It desperately needs some sort of attention if it is to be turned back to normal.

 Quest Hand-in: You apply some Cenarion plant salve to the songflower. It immediately begins to shed its corrupted form, blossoming into a vibrant and healthy plant.
Title: Ursangous' Paw

Description: The mighty bear Ursangous is no more!

The small quarter-crescent emblem on its paw indicates that this beast was trained by the night elves to prowl the forest in search of their enemies. There is no telling how many of your Horde allies fell to this creature.

The paw should be brought to Tarkan at Silverwind Refuge. He will be pleased that such a weapon has been removed from the enemy's arsenal.

 Quest Hand-in: The paw of Ursangous!Have you any idea what trouble this beast has caused us over the years? Those days are over now, thanks to you.I shall forward this trophy on to Orgrimmar to be put on display, along with your account of its death.Congratulations!
Title: Shields Down!

Description: De time has come, commanda. Packleader Kargora an' de Arkonite Shield no longa protected.

We need ta kill her an' destroy de shield crystal.

 Quest Hand-in: I'm sorry to hear about Kajassa's shadow hunters, but we couldn't afford to let the Warsong have Telaar.With the death of Kargora and her pack, we're one step closer to the invasion of the Warsong's home, Grommashar.One step close to justice.
Title: A Colossal Victory

Description: The crab has fallen.

 Quest Hand-in: Well fought, <name>.
Title: The Endless Forest

Description: Well, that's all I have for you! Whew! You've been on a whirlwind tour of things around here, haven't you? Up and down and slantways and even into the Maw! Your head must be practically spinning.

<Flutterby giggles.>

You should check in with Lady Moonberry and let her know your training is complete!

She probably won't quiz you on what you've learned.

Probably.

 Quest Hand-in: Welcome to the Court of Night, <name>. I just know we're going to save Ardenweald! Oh, and the rest of the Shadowlands, too!And if we can't, and the forest withers away, and the Jailer breaks free from the Maw and plunges all of the realms eternal into crushing despair from which there is no return... Then at least we can say we had fun trying!
Title: Turning the Brashtide

Description: The Brashtide are everywhere!  The Baron's Booty Bay Bruisers are no match for their sheer numbers, I'm afraid.

While you're down here in the fray, why don't you help me get rid of a few of them?

When you're done, don't bother coming back here.  I'll probably be pretty busy.

 Quest Hand-in: We need to keep moving, <name>.  Booty Bay won't hold out for much longer.
Title: The Wrathsteed of Xoroth

Description: The time has come and the preparations have been made. When you are ready, we will tear a hole into Xoroth, and force the Arax'ath and the Wrathsteed out of hiding.

Follow me to the summoning platform. From there we will initiate the ritual.

Prepare yourself, {name}. This will not be an easy undertaking.

 Quest Hand-in: The Wrathsteed is prepared for your binding, Netherlord. It will not be easy to enslave, its will is strong.I have to say, I'm a bit jealous. Never before have I seen such a ferocious beast, our disciples have it barely held in check.
Title: Merciful Freedom

Description: The soldiers that they didn't kill are being held in cages scattered across this farmland. Through some thievery we've managed to find a few keys, but we're unable to get close enough to any prisoners without being attacked.

We need your "talents" in securing those keys and freeing the prisoners. Bash in the brains of the necrolords and aberrations and take their keys. Use those keys to free Scourge prisoners.

 Quest Hand-in: Each prisoner saved is one less undead aberration that we have to deal with, <name>. You've done a great service for the Horde.
Title: One Step Closer

Description: {name}! I just heard that Brann Bronzebeard - that crazy, titan-obsessed dwarf - has decided to go hunting for his precious disc in Suramar.

Talk about the last place you'd want to go digging around, given the current events.

I'm sure he could use your help.

 Quest Hand-in: There's demon stink all over this place. But there's also a lot of clues as to where a piece of the titan disc is!
Title: Ogre Invasion!

Description: Commander, our scouts say that ogre bands march through the snow. If they want more battle after the beating we already delivered, then I'm eager to oblige them.

 Quest Hand-in: It's good sport, fighting foes larger than yourself. You're happy with your grunts' conduct, Commander?
Title: Ignoring the Warnings

Description: Ignore the shaman, soldier.  Certain powers-that-be within the Horde demand that I keep him with me, but I assure you, that Thrall-loving farseer truly sees no farther than the borders of this hut.

Elementals war against one another to the west of here.  I normally wouldn't mind, but I need that land clear to secure a broader shipping route to and from the Barrens.  The elementals are normally quite strong, but they are weakened by their attacks against one another.  Use this knowledge to destroy them.

 Quest Hand-in: See?  The shaman's tales are nothing but that... a youngling's bedtime stories.  The new Horde takes what it wants, and doesn't waste time with such frivolity.If you get a chance, I recommend you tell Shin... and those like him... not to waste any more of your time.
Title: Trophy of Glory: Roardan the Sky Terror

Description: Defeating Roardan has yielded you a trophy worthy of acclaim.

Take this to Maraad at Highpass.

 Quest Hand-in: The screams of that giant rylak could never be ignored.You could never be sure if it was far away or if there would be a sudden shadow followed by your immediate death.  Well done!
Title: Re-sizing the Situation

Description: I call this gadget "the Re-Sizer." It's what I used to unshrink the Choppy Booster Mk. 5.

Look, I'm gonna be honest. I got, at best, a passing understandin' of how this thing works.

That means I'm gonna be pushing a lot of buttons to see what happens.

I'm sure we'll figure out how to upsize one of these boars. Then we'll use it to trample those undead goons!

You hold the Re-Sizer while I fiddle with it. Then just press the button and, uh... hope for the best?

 Quest Hand-in: So the giant boar was a fool's errand, and you turned the device into a weapon instead?Good work. Let's see if you can pull this off.
Title: A Grapple a Day

Description: So some old magic vrykul is helping us out? I guess that's good, but this trial of yours might be tricky. You see, the only way up that mountain, is through those big walls.

You know, the ones with the mean-looking drakes on them.

I scouted a bit, but couldn't get too far without those drakes trying to make lunch out of poor Duchess. The vrykul have them trained, which can't be good.

I say we sneak in. I managed to snag a few grapple launchers earlier. Grab one and meet me outside the city walls.

 Quest Hand-in: Yes, that should do quite nicely.
Title: Renn McGill

Description: From the wording of the orders you recovered, it looks like the first priority of the Defias will be to locate and secure whatever cargo they possessed.

SI:7 has had a salvage diver named Renn McGill working out of Theramore for some time. When he heard about the shipwreck, Renn went north to dive near the islands the Defias now occupy.

If we're to beat the Defias to this cargo, we'll need his help. Look for him in the waters northeast of a small island just north of the island you visited earlier.

 Quest Hand-in: <Renn looks over the orders.>So there was valuable cargo on board! We have to locate it before the Defias recover it. These guys are no divers, but we're going to need some of their gear if you're to help me find the cargo.
Title: Back into the Darkness

Description: Souls continue to pour into the Maw, and with them the anima that could help us.

You were able to rescue me from that place. Can I count on your strength to repeat the same trick?
Please, get us more willing souls so we can bolster this sanctum's power.

Seek out what aid you can and do what we can't, Maw Walker. You are our last, best, hope.

 Quest Hand-in: Back again so soon, Maw Walker?
Title: Know Prisoners!

Description: If Alexstrasza truly wants to find the causes of this rebellion, we need to hear out the rebels.
   
To do that, we have to safely detain rebels who want to kill us. Well, you. That's much harder than resorting to violence, and more dangerous as well.

But I've experienced this when I left the rebels. Orian Darkwater cast a spell to bind me totally. It worked, and I paid close attention.

I've imbued that spell into a ring. You can use it to bind them safely. It should work, anyway!

 Quest Hand-in: This is the more difficult way, but every rebel we capture instead of kill is a chance to end this violence - and a life saved.
Title: Greater Obsidian Key

Description: Bring me an assembled Key

 Quest Hand-in: This key will allow us to access more of the Citadel's lost secrets.
Title: Retaking Mystral Lake

Description: We could easily have held Silverwind Refuge from the Horde had they not taken control of our water elemental defenders on Mystral Lake.

One of their shaman summoned in Tideress, an old and angry water spirit of the forest who befouled our elementals and turned them against us. With the lake and the Horde pressing in on us, we had no choice but to retreat to the spire here.

Go east. Take the lake back so that we will have a chance to retake the refuge some day.

 Quest Hand-in: Well done, <name>! With the befouled elemental numbers thinned and Tideress put back into the lake, we should be able to launch a counter-offensive on Silverwind Refuge.Just as soon as we're done with defending the spire....
Title: Return to the Hold

Description: Let us ferry the heart to Elysian Hold swiftly.

There are many in the Shadowlands who would strike at us to take its power for their own. Keep your eyes open, Maw Walker.

We return to our kin victorious this day.

 Quest Hand-in: I am glad to be among our own once more. Maldraxxus is not to my tastes.
Title: Panther Stalking

Description: The youngest panthers fell easily before you.  Panthers that have come of age will naturally be stronger, and quicker, and more difficult to defeat.

Larger panther tracks lead to the west.

 Quest Hand-in: You take a moment to silently congratulate yourself on your panther hunting so far.
Title: Professionally Good Looking

Description: The archmage has recently locked himself away in his tower. If you wish to enter, you'll need help from some of his apprentices. I'm afraid you won't get it dressed like that.

Xylem has a thing for... outfits, and his apprentices use them to show rank. If you wish his apprentices to help you, you'll need to appear their superior. Such is their desire to impress the archmage, many of his apprentices will battle each other for the best pieces.

I think you know where this is going.

 Quest Hand-in: Yes, I think that will do.The apprentices outside the tower should think you outrank them now, so you should be able to get some information out of them. You'll need it to bypass the barrier.
Title: Battle at Valhalas: Thane Deathblow

Description: Your skills have not gone unnoticed by the vrykul of Jotunheim, {name}. Thane Banahogg has taken a personal interest in you and has insisted that he be your next match.

If you thought Carnage was bad, then you might want to go home now. Thane Banahogg's nickname is The Deathblow. I think you can guess how he earned it.

Do you accept the thane's challenge?

 Quest Hand-in: I don't know what trickery it was that you used to bring down the thane -- I couldn't see it from this angle -- but I can assure you that you will not survive your next match.Yes, I know who it is. Run, little <race>. Flee to the far corners of the world.Or stay and die. It matters little to me.
Title: Terms of Surrender

Description: Believe it or not, I have good news: we've already taken Lok-rath.

<The vindicator beams with pride.>

Our soldiers have captured most of the Warsong, including their leader, Uruk Foecleaver.

I saved the honor of accepting his surrender for you. They're waiting for you inside, commander.

 Quest Hand-in: Commander <name>.Terms of surrender? Hmm... let me think.
Title: Langridge Shot

Description: {class}! Thank the Light - they've practically driven us back to the docks. The courtyard is overrun!

We're out of canister shot and the orcs are getting ready for an assault up the hill. We need to improvise some scatter-shot, and fast.

Hurry, run into the broken tower here and grab whatever sharp, pointy bits of scrap metal you can lay your hands on. Knives, forks, nails - anything! Load the cannon when you've got an armful!

 Quest Hand-in: The Horde is massing at the base of the hill. Breathlessly, you stuff the debris you collected into the muzzle of the cannon, step back, cover one ear, and tug on the igniter cord...
Title: Bad News Bear-er

Description: No reports have made it out of here since the beginning of the siege on Splintertree. By now, Commander Grimfang must be getting anxious.

I am sending you to Zoram Strand to deliver our report. It's not pretty, but at least he'll have the facts.

Speak to Vhulgra when you're ready to make the trip.

 Quest Hand-in: <Commander Grimfang's brow wrinkles as he reads the report.>This is grim news, indeed.May the spirits preserve them until we can fight our way to Splintertree....
Title: Of Dark Deeds and Dark Days

Description: I should have known better, and now Rezan is dead, and my own power is barely holding on. Soon Bwonsamdi himself will be coming to collect me.

Talanji... she must know what has happened here. Go to her, tell her. Aid her where you can.

I followed a god of strength and yet I have not de strength to face her with dis shame.

For now, I must gather our forces and pursue Zul.

 Quest Hand-in: Rezan is... dead?
Title: Administering the Salve

Description: I've prepared a simple salve that should restore our grunts' strength with the herbs you brought me.  Take it and administer it to any debilitated grunts you see in the vicinity.  Return to me when you're done.

 Quest Hand-in: May the spirits bless you, <name>.  The Mag'har are in your debt.
Title: Crocolisk Boy and the Bearded Murloc

Description: Yebb is working on other attractions for his zoo, including wet, swampy abodes for a boy raised by crocolisks, and perhaps for a murloc.  We will need nice, water-tight leggings so we won't get waterlogged during prop-ups and tear-downs.  For that job, I think turtlescale leggings will do the trick.

{name}, can you make those leggings?  If you do, then a fat stack of Darkmoon Faire tickets will be your reward...

 Quest Hand-in: Great, you made them!  These will do nicely... I just hope I won't be the one to clean the crocolisk cage when the time comes.  Those beasts can be rather beastly, don't you think?Here are your tickets, <name>.  Enjoy them, and enjoy your stay at the Darkmoon Faire!
Title: Rin'thissa's Eye

Description: Oddly enveloped within the felslate deposit is a humanoid eye.

It quivers with life. You get the sense that it would blink at you if it had an eyelid.

A mining expert should take a look at this.

 Quest Hand-in: It is. This eye once belonged to my sister, Rin'thissa.Poor fool, she cut out her own eye and replaced it with a hunk of ore. That was the tipping point... she's completely fel-maddened now.Learn from her mistake, <name>.
Title: Defense of Quel'Danas

Description: With our best defenders defeated and the line broken, Arthas made quick work of Silvermoon's remaining forces and tore through the city.

This is where we part ways. I must return to Silvermoon before Halduron starts sending rangers to search for me.

The dragonhawk master in Fairbreeze Village has orders to fly you to Quel'Danas. Someone much more familiar with the events on the island will meet you there.

 Quest Hand-in: Are you ready, <name>?
